mooſt approche latinite italian spaynyſhe tonges whome one corruption gothes longobardes hadde begynnynge latyn ſpoken ſtraungers barbare vnderſtondyng beinge alſo latyn vandales gothes moore paſſed ſo amended well pronunciation wrytynge englyſhe man ſmale tyme exercyſed tonge hath lacked grounde make grammer rule ordynarye therof though trouth whyche ſome ſhall ſcarſelye beleue germayns haue ſo fourmed order theyr langage ſame moch plentie nere concordaūce phraſe latyn frenche tonge hath verely lyke theſe reſt haue ben thus vigilant ſtudious meliorate amende theyr langages ſo hath man fro tyme fyrſt began ryden loued cheualrye trouth honoure fredom curteſye full worthy hys lordes warre therto rydden man farre well chriſtendome hethyneſſe euer honoure hys worthyneſſe alyſaundre full ofte tyme dourde begon abouen nation pruce lettowe rydden luce chriſten man ſo ofte hys degre garnade ſyege algezer rydden belmarye leyes alſo satalye wonne great ſee many noble armye mortall battaylles bene fyftene foughten fayth tramyſſene lyſtes thries aye ſlayne hys fo thys ylke worthy knyght ben alſo somtyme wyth lorde palathye ayenſt another hethen turkye euermore ſouerayne pryſe riche countrey wyſedom cheualry conquered reigne feminy whylom icleped cythea wedded quene ipolyta brought home wt contre wyth mykell glory ſolempnyte eke yonge ſuſter emely thus victory melody let thys worthy duke athene ryde hys hoſt armes hym ſyde certes yf nere longe wolde haue tolde fully manere howe wonnen reygne feminy theſeus cheualry great batayle none betwene athene amaſones howe beſeged ipolyta yonge hardy quene cythea feeſt yt weddynge tempeſt home comyng al yt thyng mote nowe forbere haue god wotte large felde ere weked ben ox plowe remenaunt tale long ynowe wyll nat letten eke non thys rout let euery felowe tell hys tale let ſe nowe ſhall ſupper wyn lefte wyll agayne begyn thys duke make mencyoune whan come almoſt towne hys wele hys moſt pride ware caſt hys eye aſyde kneled hyghe wey company lady twey twey eche cladde clothes blake ſuch crye ſuch wo make thys worlde ny creature lyuinge euer herde ſuche waymentynge thys crye nolde neuer ſtynten tyll reynes hys bridell henten folke ye yt myn home cōmyng perturben ſo feeſt cryeng quod theſeus haue ye ſo great enuy myne honour thus cōplayne cry hath myſbode offended nowe telleth yf may amended ye clothed thus blake oldeſt lady ſpake whan ſhe ſwowned adeedly chere ruthe ſe ſayd lorde fortune hath yeue vyctory conquerour lyue nought greueth v glory honour beſeke mercy ſocour haue mercy wo diſtreſſe drope pyte thy gētylneſſe vpon v wretched wymen let thou fall certes lorde ny none v ſhe ne hath ducheſſe quene nowe caytyſes well iſene thanked fortune falſe whele non eſtate aſſureth wele certes lorde abyde preſence temple goddeſſe clemēce haue waytyng fourtenyght helpe v lorde ſythe lyeth thy myght wretche wepe wayle thus whylom wyfe kyng campaneus ſtarfe thebe curſed ye day ben thys aray maken thys lamentacyon loſten huſbondes town whyle ſyege aboute laye yet olde creon wel awaye lorde nowe thebe cyte fulfilled yre iniquite diſpyte hys tyranny done deed bodyes vyllanye lordes whiche ben ſlawe hath bodyes heape ydrawe wyll nat ſuffre hem none aſſent neyther buryed ne brent maketh houndes eate hem dyſpyte wt worde wythout reſpyte fallen groſly cryen pytouſly haue v wretched wymen ſome mercy let ſorowe ſynke thyn hert gentle duke frō hors ſtert wyth hert pytous whā herde hem ſpeke hym thought hys herte wolde breke whan ſawe hem ſo pytous ſo mate whylom ſo great aſtate hys armes hem vp hent hem comforted full good entent ſwore hys othe true knyght wolde ſo ferforthly hys myght vpon tyrante creon hem wreake al people grece ſhulde ſpeake howe creon theſeus yſerued dethe full well deſerued ryght anon wythouten abode baner diſplayed forthe rode thebe warde hys hooſt beſyde nere athene nolde go ne ryde ne take hys eaſe fully halfe day onward hys way nyght lay ſent anone ipolita quene emely yonge ſyſter ſhene vnto towne athene dwell forth rydeth ther ny tell red ſtatu mar wt ſpere targe ſhyneth hys whyte baner large feldes glyttren vp doun hys baner borne hys penon great clamour weymentyng ladyes made brennyng bodyes great honour theſeus noble conquerour doth ye lady whan went ſhortly tellen myne entent whan yt worthy duke theſeus hath creon ſlayne wan thebe thus styl felde toke al nyght hys reſt dyd al countre hym leſt ranſake taas bodyes dede hem ſtrype harneys wede pyllours dyd buſyneſſe cure batayle diſcomfyture ſo befell taas founde gyrt wt many greuous wounde two yonge knyghtes lyeng bothe armes ſame wrought full richely whiche two arcyte hyght one hyght palamon fully quycke ne fully deed cote armour gere haraudes knewe hem beſt ſpecyall bloode ryall thebe ſyſtren two yborne taas yt pyllours hath hem torne han hem caryed ſofte tent theſeus ful ſone hem ſent athene dwellen priſon perpetuall nolde hem raunſon whan thys worthy duke thus paſſeth yere yere day day til fel one morowe may emely yt fayrer ſene lylly vpon ſtalke grene freſher may floures newe roſe colour ſtrofe hewe whiche fayrer hem two er day aryſen redy dyght may wol gayler ryſen romed chambre hyghe whiche noble cyte ſyghe eke gardyn full braunches grene thys freſſhe emely ſhene walke romed vp doun ſorowfull priſoner palamon gothe hys chambre romyng fro hym ſelfe browes twey ꝙ great honour falſe ne traytour thy coſen thy brother ſworne full depe eche v neuer dyen payne tyll dethe departe v twayne neyther v loue hyndre ne none caſe leue brother thou ſhuldeſt truly euery caſe ſhulde thyn othe myn alſo certayn wote well thou darſt withſayn thus arte thou counſell doute nowe thou woldeſt falſly ben aboute loue lady loue ſerue euer ſhall tyll myn herte ſterue nowe certes falſe arcite thou ſhalt ſo loued fyrſt tolde wo counſell brother ſworne haue tolde beforne whiche thou art thounden knyght helpen yf lye thy might el arte thou falſe dare well ſayne arcite full proudly ſpake agayne thou ſhalt ꝙ rather fals thou arte falſe tell vtterly paramour loued fyrſt thou wilt thou ſayn thou wiſt nat whether ſhe woman goddeſſe thyne affection holyneſſe myne loue thys duke theſeus caught accorded thus wyth ſwerde ſhulde leſe hys heed na none remedy ne reed taketh hys leaue homward hym ſped let hym beware hys necke lyeth wedde howe great ſorowe ſuffreth nowe arcite death feleth hys herte ſmyte wepeth wayleth cryeth pyteouſly ſleen hym ſelfe wayteth priuely ſayd ala daye borne nowe preſon worſe beforne nowe ſhappen eternally dwell purgatory hell ala euer auenture full blyſfull priſon mayſt thou endure priſon nay certes paradyſe well hath fortune tourned dyſe haſt ſyght thabſence poſſible ſythnes thou haſt preſence arte knyght worthy man able ſome caſe murdre ſyckneſſe ſome man wolde hys priſon fayne hys houſe hys meyne ſlayne infinite harmes bene thys matere wote thynge prayen faren dronke mouſe dronken man wote well hath houſe wote nat whych ryght parfyte hele nowe exiled fro wele syth maye ſene emely nam deed ny remedy ¶vpon ſyde palamon wyſt arcite gone ſorowe maketh great tour reſowned hys yellynge clamour pure fetter hys ſhynnes grete hys bytter ſalte teares wete ala ꝙ arcite coſyn myne ſtryfe god wote frute thyne thou walkeſt nowe thebe large wo thou yeueſt lytle charge thou mayſt ſyth thou haſt wiſedome māhed aſſemble al folke kynred make warre ſo ſharpe thys countre ſome auenture ſome treate thou mayſt haue lady wyfe muſt nedes leſe lyfe waye poſſibilite syth thou arte thy large priſon fre arte lorde great thyne auauntage myne ſterue cage maye wepe wayle whyles yt lyue wyth wo priſon maye yeue eke wyth payne loue yeueth alſo doubleth al tourment wo therwyth fyre ielouſy vp ſtert wythin hys breſt hent hym hert woodly lykely beholde boxe tree aſhen deed colde ſayd cruell goddes gouerne thys worlde wyth worde eterne wrytten table athamant parliament eterne graunt mankynde vnto yholde ſhepe rouketh folde ſlayne man ryght another beeſt dwelleth eke priſon arreſt hath ſyckneſſe great aduerſite ofte tyme gyltleſſe parde gouernaunce thys preſcience gyltleſſe turmenteth innocence encreaſeth thus penaunce man bounden hys obſeruaunce goddes ſake letten hys wyll beeſt maye hys luſtes fulfyll beeſt deed hath payne hys death mā mote wepe playne though thys worlde haue care wo wythout doute maye ſtanden ſo anſwere thys lete diuines well wote thys worlde great pyne ala ſe ſerpent thefe many true man hath myſchefe gone hys large hym lyſt may turne mote bene priſon saturne eke iuno ielous eke wood hath ſtroyed well nye blood thebe wyth hys waſt walles wyde venus ſleeth ſyde ielouſye feare hym arcite nowe wyll ſlynte palamon lyte let hym hys pryſon ſtyll dwell arcite forth woll tell ſommer paſſeth nyghtes longe encreaſeth double wyſe paynes ſtronge louer priſoner whych hath wofuller myſter ſhortly ſaye thys palamon perpetuall dampned priſon • haynes feters deed arcite exiled hys heed euermore countre lyſt ye woll tell forth tale began ¶when arcite thebe comen full ofte daye ſwelte ſayd ala ſene hys lady ſhall neuer mo ſhortly conclude hys wo mykell ſorowe made neuer creature ſhalbe whyle worlde maye dure hys ſlepe hys meate hys drynke hym byraft leane wareth drye ſhaft hys eyen holowe gryſly beholde hys hewe pale falowe aſſhen colde ſolitary euer alone waylynge nyght makynge mone yf herde ſonge inſtrument wolde wepe myght ſtent feble hys ſpirites ſo lowe chaūged ſo yt man coude hym knowe hys ſpeche ne hys voyce though men herde hys gyre worlde ferde nought comly lyke louers maladye hereos rather lyke manye engendred humour melancolyke beforne hys fell fantaſtyke ſhortly turned vp ſo doun habyte dyſpoſicion hym thys wofull louer arcyte ſhulde daye hys wo endyte endured yere two thys cruell torment thys payne wo thebe hys countre ſayd vpon nyght ſlepe hym layde hym thought howe wynged mercury beforne hym ſtode bad hym mery hys ſlepy yerde hande bare vpryght harte wered vpon hys heares bryght arayed thys god toke kepe argus toke hys ſlepe ſaid thus athene ſhalt thou wend ſhapen thy wo end wyth worde arcite awoke ſtert nowe truly howe ſore ſmert quoth athene ryght nowe wyll fare ne drede death ſhall ſpare ſe lady loue ſerue preſence recke ſterue word caught great myrrour ſawe changed al hys colour ſawe hys vyſage another kynde ryght anone ran hym hys mynde ſyth hys ybrought confuſyon blode ryall cadmus amphyon cadmus whiche fyrſt man thebe buylt fyrſt town began cyte fyrſt crowned kyng hys lynage hys ofſpring lyne ſtocke ryall nowe ſo caytiſe ſo thrall mortal enemy ſerue hym hys ſquire poorly yet dothe iuno well ſhame dare knowe myne owne name wont hyght arcyte hyght philoſtrat nat worth myte ala thou fell mar ala thou iuno thus hath yre lynage saue wretched palamon theſeus martreth pryſon ouer thys ſleen vtterly loue hath hys firy darte ſo bremyngly ſtycked true carefull herte ſhapen deth erſt ſherte ye ſleen wyth youre eyen emelye ye ben cauſe wherfore dye remenaunt myne care ne ſet nat mountaunce tare yt coude ought pleſaunce yt worde fell traunce longe tyme afterwarde vp ſtort palamon thought ye thrugh hert felte colde ſworde ſodenly bloode counſell ſworn haue full ofte tolde beforn haſt taped duke theſeus falſly haſt chaunged thy name thus wyll deed el thou ſhalt dye thou ſhalt nat loue lady emelye woll loue onely mo palamon thy mortall though yt haue weapen thys place pryſon aſſert grace drede eyther thou ſhalt dye thou ne ſhalt louen emelye theſe thou wilt ye ſhalt aſſert arcite full diſpytous hert whan hym knewe hys tale herde ſters lyon pulled ſwerde ſayd god ſytteth aboue ne yt thou art ſyck wood loue eke yt thou wepen haſt thys place thou ſhuldeſt neuer groue pace thou ne ſhuldeſt dyen myne honde defye ſ •• etie bonde whiche yt thou ſayſt yt haue made fole thynke wel loue fre wyl loue maugre thy myght moche thou arte knyght wylneſt darrayne batayle haue trouth morow wyll nat fayle without wetyng • wyght well founden knyght bryngen harneys ryght ynough cheſe beſt leaue worſt meate drynke night wyl bring inough clothes thy beddyng yf ſo thou lady wyn ſlee thys wodde ther thou mayſt wel haue thy lady palamon anſwerde graunt thus ben departed tyll morowe whā ech hem laid faith borowe ¶o cupyde charyte regne yt woldeſt haue felowe ful ſoth ſayd loue ne lordſhyp woll hys thankes haue felyſhyp fynde arcite palamon arcite ryden anone toun morowe daye lyght ful priuely two harneys hath dyght ſufficient mete darreygne batayle ye felde betwyre hem tweine hys horſe alone borne caryeth hys harneys hym beforne groue tyme place yſet thys arcite thys palamon bene mette chaungen gan colour face ryght hunter ye regne trace •• andeth gappe wyth ſpeare • unted lyon beare hereth hym ruſhynge leaues breaketh bowes greaues thiketh cometh mortal enemy wythout fayle muſt deed eyther ſlee hym gappe ſlee yf myſhappe ferden chaungynge hewe farre euerych knewe na good daye ne ſaluyng ſtreyght wythout worde reherſyng eueryche hem helpeth arme frendly hys owne brother wyth ſharpe ſpeares ſtronge foynen eche wonder longe thou myghteſt wene thys palamon hys fyghtynge wood lyon cruel tygre arcyte wylde bore gan fyght ſmyte frothen whyte ſome yre woode •• p ancle foughten bloode •• thys wyſe let hem fyghtyng dwell forth wol theſeus tel deſtenye miniſter general executeth worlde ouer al purueyaūce god hath ſayd beforne ſtrōge yt though ye world ſworn contrary thynge yea naye yet ſomtyme ſhall fall daye fell neuer yet thouſande yere certaynly appetytes warre peace hate loue al ruled ſyght aboue thys meane nowe myghty theſeus hunt ſo deſyrous namely great harte may hys bed daweth hym day ny clad redy ryde wyth hunt horne hoūdes hym beſyde hys huntyng hath ſuch delyte hys ioye appetyte bene hym ſelfe great hertes bane mar ſerueth nowe dyane clere day haue told theſeus wyth al ioye blys wyth hys ipolita fayre quene emely yclothen grene huntynge ben rydden ryally groue ſtode faſt ther herte mē told duke theſeus ſtreyght waye hath hold lande rydeth hym ful ryght thider ye hert wōt haue flight ouer broke ſo forth hys way duke wol houe cours twey hoūdes ſuch hym lyſt cōmaunde ye duke comen ye launde vnder ſonne loked anon ware arcyte palamon foughtē breme bulles two bryght ſwordes wenten fro hydouſly wyth leſte ſtroke ſemed wolde haue fellen oke nothynge ne wote duke wt ſporres courſer ſmote ſterte bytwyxt hem two pulled hys ſworde cryed ho nomore payne leſyng heed myghty mar ſhall anone deed ſmyteth ſtroke maye ſene telleth myſter men ye bene ben ſo hardy fyghten wythout iudge offycere though lyſtes rially thys palamon anſwered haſtely ſayd ſyr nedeth wordes mo▪ haue death deſerued two two wofull wretch ben caytyues ben encombred owne lyues thou arte ryghfull lorde iuge ne yeue v neyther mercy ne refuge ſlee fyrſt ſaynt charite ſlee felowe wel ſlee hī fyrſt though thou know lite thy mortal foe thys arcite fro thy lande banyſhed hys heed whych hath deſerued deed thys came vnto thy yate ſayd hyght philoſtrate thus hath iaped full many yere thou haſt made hym thy chefe ſquire thys loueth emely ſythe day come ſhall dye make playnly confeſſyon thylke woful palamon hath thy priſon broke wyckedly thy mortall foe loueth ſo hotte emelye bright wol dye preſent ſyght wherfore aſke dethe iewyſe ſlee felowe ſame wyſe bothe haue deſerued ſlayn worthy duke anſwerde anon agayn ſayd ſhorte concluſyon owne mouthe confeſſyon hath dampned woll recorde nedeth pyne wyth corde ye ſhall deed myghty mar reed quene anone woman heed gan wepe ſo dyd emelye ladyes companye great pyte thought hem euer ſuche chaunce ſhulde befall gentylmen great eſtate nothyng loue thys debate ſawe blody woundes wyde ſore cryden bothe leſſe haue mercy lorde vpon v wymen bare knee downe fall wolde haue kyſt fete ſtode tyl laſt ſlaked hys mode pyte renueth ſone gentle herte though fyrſt yre quoke ſterte hath conſydred ſhorthly clauſe treſpas hem bothe eke cauſe al though hys yre gylt accuſed yet hys reaſon hem bothe excuſed thus thought well euery man woll helpe hym ſelfe loue al eke delyuer hym ſelfe pryſon eke hys herte compaſſyon wymen wepen euery one hys gentle heyte thought anone ſofte vnto hym ſelfe ſayd fy vpon lorde woll haue mercy lyon bothe worde dede hem ben repentaunce drede well proude diſpytous man wyll mayntayne fyrſt began lorde hath lytell diſcretyon ſuche caſe diffynition wayeth pride humbleſſe one ſhortly whan hys yre thus agone gan loken vp eyen lyght ſpake theſe wordes al hyght god loue ah benedicite howe myghty howe great lorde agayn hys myght ther gayneth obſtacles may cleaped god hys miracle maken hys owne gyſe euerych hert hym lyſt deuyſe lo thys arcyte thys palamon quitely priſon gon myght haue lyued thebe ryally knowen mortall enemy dethe power alſo yet hath loue maugre eyen two brought hem hyther bothe dye nowe loketh great folye▪ may fole yf loue▪ beholde goddes ſake ſytteth aboue se howe blede nat wel arayde thus hath lord ye god loue hem payd wage fee ſeruyſe yet wenen full wyſe ſerue loue aught may fall yet beſt g • ſhe haue thys iolyte hem therfore moche thanke wotte nomore hote face god wotte cokowe hare mote ben aſſayed hote colde man mote ben foole yong olde wote ſelfe full yore agone tyme ſeruaunte one therfore ſyth knowe loues payne wote howe ſore man diſtrayne ofte hath caught laas▪ foryeue hooly treſpaas requeſt quene ye kneleth eke emely ſyſter dere ye ſhall bothe anon anto ſwere ye ſhal neuer countre dere ne make warre vpon nyght ne day ben frendes ye may yene thys treſpas euery dele hym ſwace aſking fair wele lordſhyp mercy prayde hem graunted grace thus ſayde ſpeake worthy lynage rycheſſe though ye ſhe quene princeſſe ilke bothe worthy doutles wedde whan tyme netheles ſpeake ſyſter emely ye haue thys ſtryfe ielowſy ye wote ſelfe ſhe maye wedde two one though ye fyghten euer mo one hym loth lefe mote go pype yue lefe thys ſaye ſhe maye haue ne ben ye neuer ſo ielous ne ſo wroth therfore put thys degre eche ſhall haue hys deſtyne hym ſhape herken wyſe lo ende ſhall deuyſe wyll thys plat concluſion wythout replicacion yf lyketh taketh beſt euerych ſhall go lyſt frely wythout raunſome daungere thys daye fyftye wekes ferre ne nere euerych ſhall brynge c knyghtes armed lyſtes vp ryghtes al redy darreyne batayle thys behote wythouten fayle vpon trouth true knyght whether hath myght ſaye whether thou may wyth hūdred ſpake slee hys contrary lyſtes dryue hym ſhall yene emely wyue yt fortune yeueth ſo fayre grace lyſtes ſhall maken thys place god ſo wyſely ſoule rewe ſhal euyn iudge trewe ye ſhall none ende wyth make one ſhalbe deed take yf ye thynken thys wel yſayd sayeth aduyſe holde wel apayd thys ende concluſion loketh lyghtly palamon ſpryngeth vp ioye arcite coude tel coude endyte ioye made thys place theſeus done ſo fayre grace doun knee wēt euery maner wight thanked wyth al hert myght namely theſe theban many ſythe thus wyth good hope herte blythe takē leue hōward gan ryde thebe warde wyth olde walles wyde trowe men wolde deme negligence yf foryetten tell dyſpence theſeus goeth ſo buſely maken vp lyſtes royally ſuche noble theatre dare well ſaye thys worlde ther na circute myle walled wyth ſtone dyched al roūde ſhape maner compas full degree heygth fyrty paas man ſet one degre letted hys felowe ſ • eſtward ſtode gate marble whyte weſtward ryght ſuche another thoppoſite ſhortly conclude ſuche place none erth ſo lytle ſpace lande na craftes man gemetry arſmetyke ne portriture ne caruer ymages theſeus ne gaue hym mete wage theatre make deuyſe hys ryte ſacrifyce eſtwarde hath vpon yate aboue worſhyp venus goddes loue make auter oratory weſtſyde memory mar hath maked ſuch another coſt golde largely fother northwarde turret wal alabaſtre whyte redde coral oratorye ryche ſe worſhyp diane goddes chaſtite hath theſeus wrought noble wyſe yet foryetten deuyſe noble caruynges portratures ſhap countenaunce fygures oratory thre fyrſt tēple venus ſhal ¶fayreſt fayre lady myne venus doughter ioue ſpouſe vulcanus thou glader mount cytheron thylke loue thou haddeſt adon haue pyte bytter teares ſmerte take humble prayer thyne herte ala ne haue langage tel effecte ne turment myne hel myne hert may myne harmes bewraye ſo confuſed ſaye mercy lady bryght woſt wele thought ſeeſt harmes yt fele conſyder al thys rue vpon ſore wyſly ſhal euermore clothes fayre emely herte debonayre body wyſhe water wel ſhe dyd ryght dare nat tel thyng generall yet game meaneth wel charge good man large bright heare vnkēpt vntreſſed crowne grene oke vnſeryall wel woſte thou deſyre ben mayde al lyfe ne neuer wol loue ne wyfe thou woſte wel thy company mayde loue huntyng venery walken woddes wylde ben wyfe ben chylde nought wyl knowe companye man nowe helpe lady ſythe ye may tho thre formes thou haſte palamon hath ſuche loue eke arcyte loueth ſo ſore grace pray withouten ſende loue peace bytwyxt hem two fro turne away hertes ſo al hotte loue deſyre al buſy turment al fyre queynt turned place ſo thou wolte grace yf ſo deſteny ſhapen ſo ſhal nedes haue one hem two ſende hym moſte deſyreth beholde goddeſſe clene chaſtyte bytter teares chekes fal syn thou arte mayde keper v maydenhede thou kepe wel cōſerue whyle lyue mayden wol yt ſerue ¶the fyres brenne vpon auter clere whyle emely thus prayere ſodenly ſhe ſawe thyng queynte ryght anon one fyres queynte quycked agayn anon fyre queynte al agon queynte made whyſtlyng theſe wete brondes brennyng brondes ende ran anone bloddy droppes many one whiche ſo ſore agaſte emelye ſhe wel nye madde gan crye ſhe ne wyſte ſygnyfyed onely feare thus ſhe cryed wepte pyte therwithal dyane gan apere bowe honde right huntereſſe ſayd doughter ſtynte thyn heuyneſſe amonge goddes hye affyrmed eterne worde wrytten confyrmed thou ſhalt wedded one tho haue ſo much care wo vnto whych hem may tel farewel may lenger dwel fyres whych myne auter brenne shal declaren er thou gon henne thys auenture loue thys caſe ye worde arowes caſe goddes clatteren faſt rynge forth ſhe went made vaneſhynge whych thys emely aſtonyed ſayd mounteth thys ala put vnder thy protection dyane vnder thy dyſpoſycion home ſhe goth next waye effect nomore ſaye nexte houre mar folowyng arcite vnto temple walked fyers mar done hys ſacrifyſe wyth al myght hys paynem wyſe wyth pytous herte hye deuocion ryght thus mar ſayd hys oriſon ¶o ſtronge god reygnes colde trace honoured arte lorde yholde haſt euery reygne euery lande armes al brydle thyne hande hem fortuneſt thy lyſt deuyſe accepte pytous ſacrifyce yf ſo thought may deſerue might worthy ſerue thy godhede maye ben one thyne praye thou rue pyne thylke payne thylke hotte fyre whech thou brenteſt whylom deſyre thou vſedeſt fayre beaute fayre yonge freſhe venus fre haddeſt thyne armes thy wyll al though thou one tyme myſſyll vulcanus caught hys laas founde thy lyggynge hys wyfe ala thylke ſorowe thyne herte haue ruth wel paynes ſmerte yonge vnconning thou woſt trowe wyth loue offended moſt euer lyues creature ſhe doth al thys wo endure ne retcheth neuer ſynke flete wel wote ſhe mercy hete mote wyth ſtrength wyn place wel wote wythout helpe grace ne may ſtrength auayle thē helpe lorde morow batayle thylke fyre whylom brent well fyre nowe brenneth morowe haue vyctorye myn trauayle thyn glorye thy ſouerayne tēple wol moſte honouren place alwaye moſt labouren thy pleaſaunce thy • raftes ſtrōge thy temple wol baner honge al armes companye euermore vntyl daye dye eterne fyre wol beforne fynde eke thys auowe wyl bynde berd heare yt hongeth lowe adoun neuer yet felte offenſioun raſour ne ſhere wol yeue bene thy true ſeruaunt whyle lyue lorde haue ruth vpon ſorowes ſore yeue victory aſke nomore ¶the prayer ſtynte arcite ſtronge rynges temple dore ronge eke dores clatren ful faſte whych arcite ſomwhat agaſt fyres brennen vpon auter bryght gan al temple lyght ſwete ſmel anone grounde vp yaſe arcite anone hys honde vp haſe enſence fyre caſte wyth rytes mo laſte ſtatue mar begā hauberk ryng ſoūde herde murmuryng ful lowe dym ſayd thus victory yaue mar honour glory thus wyth ioye hope wel fare arcite anone hys ynne fare fayne foule bryght ſonne ryght anone ſuch ſtryfe begonne thylke grauntynge heuen aboue bytwyrt venus goddes loue mar ſterne god armypotent iupiter buſy ſtynte tyl pale saturnus colde knewe ſo many auentures olde founde hys experience arte ful ſone hath pleaſed euery parte ſoth ſayd elde hath great auauntage elde wyſedome vſage men maye olde ren rede saturne anone ſtyntē ſtryfe drede al agayne hys kynde al thys ſtryffe remedy fynde dere doughter venus ꝙ saturne courſe hath ſo wyde turne hath power wote man myn drenchynge ſee ſo wan myne priſon derke cote myn ye ſtrāglyng ye hāgyng ye throte murmure churles rebellyng groynyng priuy enpoyſonyng vengeaūce playne correction whyle dwell ſygne lyon myne ruyne hye halle fallyng toures walles vpon mynor vpon carpenter ſlewe sampſon ſhakyng pyllers myne ben maladyes colde derke treaſons caſtels olde lokynge father peſtilence nowe wepe nomore ſhal diligence palamon thyne owne knyght shal haue hys lady thou hym behyght thogh mar ſhal helpe kniȝt natheles betwixt mote ſomtyme pee albe ye one complection cauſeth al daye ſuch deuiſion thyne ayle redy thy wyl wepe nomore wol thy luſt fulfyl ¶now wol ſtyntē theſe goddes aboue mar venus goddes loue playnly wol tellen great effecte whych began great ye feeſt athene day eke luſty ſeaſon may made euery wyght ben ſuch pleaſaūce al day iuſten daunce ſpenten venus hye ſeruyce bycauſe ſhulden aryſe erly ſe great ſyght vnto reſt went nyght morowe day gan ſprynge horſe harneys noyſe claterynge hoſtelryes al aboute palays rode many route lordes vpon ſtedes palfrey mayſt thou ſe deuyſyng harneys vncouth ſo rych wrought ſo wele goldſmethry braudry ſtele ſheldes bryght teſters trapper gold hewē helmes hauberkes cot armers lordes paramentes courſers knyghtes retenue eke ſquyers naylynge ſpeares helmes bokeling gyggyng ſheldes layners lacynge nede nothynge ydel fominge ſtedes golden brydel gnawyng faſt armurers alſo wyth fyle hammer rydyng fro yemen fote comunes many one wyth ſhorte ſtaues thycke may gone pypes trompes nakoners clarion batayle blowen blody ſowns palays ful people vp doun thre ten holdynge queſtion deuinyng theſe theban knyghtes two ſayd thus ſome ſayd ſhulde ſo helde wyth hym ye blacke berde wt balled ſome wt thick herde ſayd loked grym wold fyght hath ſparth twenty poūde weight thus hal ful deuinynge longe ſonne gan ſprynge great theſeus hys ſlepe gan wake wyth mynſtralſye noyſe make helde yet chambre hys palays ryche tyl theban knyghtes yliche honoured place yfette ¶duke theſeus wyndowe ſette arayed ryght god trone people preaſed thyderwarde ful ſone hym ſene done hym hye reuerēce eke hys heſt hys ſentence heraude ſcaffolde made oo tyl al noyſe people ydo ſawe people noyſe ſtyl thus ſhewed myghty duke wyl ¶the lorde hath hys hye dyſcrecion conſydred dyſtruccion gentle bloode fyghten thys gyſe mortal batayle thys empryſe wherfore ſhapen ſhal dye wol hys fyrſt purpoſe modefye man therfore vp payne loſſe lyfe maner ſhorte polaxe ne ſhorte knyfe lyſtes ſende thytherbrynge ne ſhort ſword ſtycke point bytynge man ne drawe ne beare hys ſyde ne man ſhal hys felow ryde one courſe wyth ſharp groūden ſpere foyne yf hym lyſt fote hym ſelfe myſchefe ſhalbe take ſlayne brought ſtake ſhall bene ordeyned eyther ſyde thyther ſhal force abyde yf ſo fal chieftayne take eyther ſyde el ſleene hys make lenger ſhal turnament laſte god ſpede goeth layeth faſte ſwordes lōge maſes fyghtē fyl goth waye lordes wyl ¶the voyce people touched heuen loude cryed wyth mery ſteuen god ſaue ſuche lorde ſo good wylleth deſtruction blood vp goeth trompes melodye lyſtes rydeth ſo companye ordynaunce throughout cytie large hōged wyth cloth golde wyth ſarge ful lyke lorde thys noble duke gan ryde theſe two theban euery ſyde rode quene emelye companye one degre thus paſſen throughout cytie lyſtes comen tyme na daye yet fully pryme ſet theſeus full ryche hye ipolita quene emelye ladyes degree aboute vnto ſeates preaſeth al route weſtward thrugh ye yates vnder marte arcite eke hundred hys parte wyth baner reed entred ryght anon ſelue momet entred palamon vnder venus eſtwarde place wyth baner whyte hardy chere face al worlde ſeken vp doun euen wythout variacion na ſuch companyes twey na none ſo wyſe coude ſey auauntage worthyneſſe ne eſtate ne age euen choſe geſſe renges fayre hem dreſſe name red euerychone nombre gyle none tho gate ſhyt cryed loude deuer yonge knightes proude ¶the heraudes left prycking vp doun ryngen trompes loude clarioun nomore ſaye eſte weſte goth ſharpe ſperes ſadly arreſt goth ſharpe ſpurres ſyde ſe men iuſt ryde ſhyueren ſhaftes vpon ſheldes thycke feleth herte ſpoune pryck vp ſpringeth ye ſper • twenty fote hyght goth ſwordes ſyluer bryght helmes heawe ſhrede burſt ye blood wyth ſterne ſtremes rede wyth myghty mace bone breke ye thyckeſt ye thrōge gan threke ther ſtomblen ſtedes ſtrōge gon al rolled vnder foote dothe bal foyneth hys fete wyth tronchoun hurleth wyth hys horſe adoun body hurte ſyth ytake maugre hys heed brought vnto ſtake forward ryght muſt abyde ladde ſyde ſomtyme doth hem theſeus reſte hem refeſhe drynke yf hem leſte full ofte day haue theſe theban two togyther met done eche wo vnhorſed hath eche hem twey ther tygre vale galaphey whelpe ſtole lyte cruel hunte arcite ielous herte vpon thys palamon ne belmary fel lyon hunted hys honger woode ne hys prey deſyreth ſo bloode palamon ſlee hys foe arcite ielouſe ſtrokes helmes byte renneth ye bloode ſydes rede somtyme ende euery dede er sunne vnto reſt wente ſtronge kynge emetrius gon hente thys palamon fought wt arcite made hys ſworde depe hys fleſh byte force twenty take vn yolden drawen ſtake reſcous thys palamon ſtronge kynge lygurge borne adoun kynge emetrius al hys ſtrength borne hys ſadle ſwordes length hurte hym palamon take al nought brought ye ſtake hys hardy herte myght hym helpe naught muſt abyde caught force eke compoſycion ſoroweth woful palamon gon agayne fyght ¶and theſeus ſene ye ſyght cryed hoe ne none ſhal lenger hys felowe gon wol true iuge partye arcite thebe ſhal haue emelye hys fortune hath fayre ywonne anon noyſe people bygonne ioye thys ſo loude hye withall ſemed lyſtes ſhulde fall nowe fayre venus done aboue ſayth ſhe doth ye quene loue wepeth ſo wātyng wil tyl teares lyſtes fyll ſayd ſhamed doutles saturne ſayd doughter holde thy pee mar hath al wil kniȝt hath bone myn heed thou ſhalt eaſed ſone ¶the trompes loude mynſtralcye heraudes ſo loude yel crye ben wele loue dan arcyte harkeneth ſtynteth noyſe lyte whyche myracle byfell anon fyers arcyte hys helme ydon courſer ſhewe hys face pricketh endlonge large place lokyng vpwarde vpon emelye ſhe ayen hym caſte frendly eye woman ſpeke comune folowen al fauour fortune hys chere hys herte grounde fyre infernal ſterte pluto ſent requeſt saturne whiche horſe feare gan turne lepe ſyde foundred lepe er arcyte may taken kepe pyght hym pomell hys heed place lay deed hys breſt broſten wyth ſadel bowe blacke lay cole crowe bloode yronne face anon brought place wyth herte ſore theſeus paleys tho coruen hys harneys bedde ybrought ful fayre blyue yet memorye lyue alway cryeng emelye ¶duke theſeus al hys companye comen home athene hys cyte al blyſſe great ſolempnyte al auenture fall wolde diſcomforte hem men ſayd eke arcyte ſhulde dye ſhulde ben yhealed hys maladye thyng fayne hem al none ſlayne al ſore hurte namely one wt aſpere thronled hys breſt bone two woundes two broken armes ſalues ſome charmes fermaces herbes eke ſaue dronken▪ wold lyeues haue whiche noble duke wel comforteth honoureth euery man made reuel al longe nyght vnto ſtraunge lordes ryght ne na holde diſcomfortyng iuſtes tourneyng ſothly na diſcomfyture fallyng holde auenture ne ladde force vnto ſtake vnyolden twenty knyghtes take one perſon lone withouten mo haryed forth arme foote eke hys ſtede driuen forthe ſtaues footemen bothe yemen knaues ar • tted hym vilanye may man cleape cowardye whiche anon duke theſeus dyd crye ſtynten al rancour enuye grete wel one ſyde eyther ſyde ylyke others brother yaue hym ryghtes degre fully helde feeſt dayes thre coueyed knyghtes worthyly hys towne dayes iourney largely home went euery man ryght way ther farwel haue good day batayle wol endyte ſpeke palamon arcyte swelleth breſt arcyte ſore encreaſeth herte clotered bloode leche crafte corrumped hys body lafte neyther veynbloode ne ventouſyng ne drynke herbes may helpyng vertue expulſed anymall thylke vertue cleaped naturall ne may venym voyde ne expell pypes hys longes began ſwell euery lacerte hys breſt adown ſhent wyth venym corruption hym gayneth neyther get hys lyfe vomyte vpwarde ne downwarde laxatyfe bruſte thylke regyon nature hath domynacyon certainly ther nature w • l nat wirche farwel phiſyke go beare corſe chirche thys al ſome arcyte muſte dye whiche ſendeth emelye palamon hys coſyn dere ſayd thus ye ſhall ¶nought may woful ſpyrit herte declare poynte al ſorowes ſmerte lady loue moſte bequethe ſeruyce goſte abouen creature syn lyfe may lenger dure ala wo ala paynes ſtronge haue ſuffred ſo longe ala dethe ala myn emely ala partyng company ala myn hertes quene ala lyues wyfe myn hertes lady ender lyfe worlde aſken mē haue nowe loue colde graue alone withouten company farwel ſwete foe myn emely ſofte take armes twey loue god herkeneth ſey ¶i haue coſyn palamon ſtryfe rancour many day agon loue ielouſye iupiter ſo wyſſely ſoule gye ſpeken ſeruaunt properly cyrcumſtaunces al trewly ſay trouth honour knyghthede wyſedom humbleſſe eſtate hye kynrede fredom longeth arte iupiter haue ſoule parte worlde ryght knowe non worthy loued palamon ſerueth woll hys lyfe yf ye ſhall euer ben wyfe yet palamon gentyll man worde ſpeche fayle begā hys fete vnto hys breſt come colde dethe hym nome yet ouer hys armes two vytal ſtrength loſte al ago saue onely intellecte without dwelled herte ſycke ſore gan faylen whan herte felte dethe duſked hys eyen two fayled brethe hys lady yet caſte hys eye hys laſte worde mercy emelye hys ſpyrit chaunged went whytherwarde tel ne therfore ſtynte diuynyſtre ſoules fynde regyſtre ne lyſt thylke opinyon tell hem though writen wher dwel arcyte colde mar hys ſoule gye nowe woll ſpeke forthe emelye ¶shright emely howlen palamon theſeus ſuſter vp toke anon swounyng bare fro hys corſe away helpeth tarry forthe day tellen ſhe wept bothe euē morowe ſuche caſe woman haue ſuche ſorowe whan huſbandes ben fro hem go parte ſorowen ſo el fallen ſuche maladye laſte certaynly dye infinyte ben ſorowes teres olde folke folke tender yeres al towne dethe theban hym wepeth bothe chylde mā great wepyng certayne whan hector brought al freſhe iſlayn troy ala pyte cratchyng chekes rentyng eke woldeſt thou deed thus woman crye haddeſt golde ynoughe emelye man myght glade theſeus sauyng hys olde father egeus knewe thys worldes tranſmutacion ſene bothe vp doun ioye wo wo gladneſſe ſhewed hym enſamples lykneſſe ryght dyed neuer man ꝙ ne lyued erthe ſome degre ryght ſo lyued neuer man ſayde al thys world ſomtyme ne deyde thys world thorowfare full wo ben pylgrymes paſſyng fro deth ende euery worldes ſore ouer al thys yet ſayd moch thys effecte ful wyſely exhorte people ſhulde hem recomfort duke theſeus al hys buſy cure caſteth nowe ſepulture good arcyte ſhall beſt ymaked eke moſte honorable degre laſte toke concluſyon arcyte palamon loue batayle hem bytwene ſame ſelue groue ſwete grene amerous deſyres hys complaynte loue hys hotte fyres wolde make fyre whiche offys funeral myght hem al accomplys hath anon cōmaunded hacke hewe okes olde lay hem al arewe culpons wel arayed brenne offycers ſwyfte foote renne ryght anon hys commaundement theſeus hath yſente beere ouer ſpradde wyth clothe golde rycheſt ſame ſute clothed arcyte vpon hys handes hys gloues whyte eke hys heed crowne laurer grene hande ſworde ful bright kene loyde hym bare viſage bere therwith wepte pyte people ſhulde ſene hym whan day brought hym ye hall roreth cry ſorowes ſoun tho gan woful theban palamon glytering berde ruddy ſhynyng here clothes blacke dropped al wyth teres paſſyng wepyng emely rufulleſt company moche ſeruyce ſhulde noble ryche hys degre duke theſeus let forthe ſtedes bryng trapped ſtele gleteryng couered armes dan arcyte vpon theſe ſtedes great whyte ther ſaten folke one bare ſheld another hys ſpeare hys hande helde thyrde bare bowe turkes brent golde caſe eke harnes ryden forthe pace ſory chere towarde groue ye ſhal ¶the nobleſt grekes vpon ſhuldres caryed bere ſlacke pace eyen reed wete throughout cyte mayſter ſtrete ſprad al wt blak wōder hye ryght ſame ſtrete ywrye vpon ryght hande wente egeus ſyde duke theſeus veſſels hande golde full fyne al ful hony mylke bloode wyne eke palamon full great company came wofull emely fyre hande yt tyme gyſe offyce funeral ſeruyſe hye labour ful great apparaylyng ſeruyce fyre makyng grene toppe heuē raught twenty fadome brede armes ſtraught ſayn bowes ſo brode ſtrawe firſt ther layde many lode fyre maked vp height eke name howe tree heyght oke firre beche aſpe elder elme popelere wyllo holm plane boxe cheſteyn laulere maple thorne beche ewe haſel whipultre felde ſhal nat tolde ne howe goddes ronne vp doun diſheryted abytacioun whiche wonned reſt pee nymphes fauny amadriades ne howe beeſte ne byrdes fledden feare whan tree fall ne grounde agaſt lyght nat wonte ſe ſonne bryght ne fyre couched firſt ſtre drye ſtyckes clouen thre grene wodde ſpicery clothe golde perry garlondes hāgyng many floure myrre enſence ſwete odoure ne howe arcyte lay amonge al ne rycheſſe aboute hys body ne howe emely gyſe put fyre funeral ſeruyſe ne ſhe ſwouned whā maked ye fyre ne ſhe ſpake ne deſyre ne iewelles men fyre caſte whan fyre great brent faſte ne ſome caſt ſheld ſome ſpere veſtementes whiche yt cuppes full wyne mylke bloode fyre brent woode ne howe grekes huge route thryſe rydden fyre aboute vpō lefte hande loude ſhowtyng thryſe ſpeares clateryng thryſe howe ladyes gan crye ne ladde homwarde emelye ne howe arcite brent aſſhen colde ne howe lyche wake holde nyght ne howe grekes play wake playes kepe nat ſay wreſtled beſt naked wyth oyle anoynt ne bare hym beſt euery poynt woll tellen howe gone athene whan play done ſhortly poynt woll wende make longe tale ende proceſſe length yeres ſtynten mornyng teres grekes one generall aſſent ſemed parlement athene vpon certayne poynt caas amonge whiche poyntes yſpoken haue certayne countres alyaunce haue theban fully obeyſaunce whiche thys noble theſeus anon let ſende thys gentyl palamon vnwyſte ye cauſe blacke clothes ſorowfully came hys commaundement hye tho ſent theſeus emelye whan ſet huſhte yt place theſeus abydden hath ſpace worde came wyſe breſt hys eyen ſette hym leſt ſuche ſadde vyſage ſyked ſtyll right thus ſayd hys wyll ¶the fyrſt mouer cauſe aboue whan firſt made fayre chayne loue great theffecte hye hys entente wel wyſte therof mente fayre chayne loue bonde fyre eyre water londe certayne bondes may nat fle ſame prince mouer ꝙ hath ſtabliſſhed ī wretched world adoſ • certen dayes duracion al engendred thys place ouer whiche day may pace al mowe yet dayes abredge nedeth none auctorite ledge proued experyence lyſt declaren ſentence may men thys ordre diſcerne thylke mouer ſtable eterne wel may men knowe fole euery party deryued hys hole nature hath taken hys begynnyng one parte cantell thyng thyng perfyte ſtable diſcendyng ſo tyl corrumpable therfore hys wyſe purueyaunce hath ſo wel byſet hys ordynaunce ſpaces thynges progreſſyons shullen endure ſucceſſyons eterne wythout lye thus mayſt thou vnderſtande ſe eye lo oke hath ſo longe noriſhyng fro tyme beginneth firſt ſpring hath ſo longe lyfe ye may ſe yet laſt waſted tre conſydreth eke howe harde ſtone vnder fete whiche reeade gone yet waſteth lyeth wey brode ryuer ſomtyme wexeth drey great townes ſe waue wende ye ſe al thys thyng hath ende man waman ſe ſhal alſo nedeth one termes two ſayne youthe orels age mote deed kyng wel page bedde ſome depe ſee large felde ye may ſe helpeth al gothe ylke wey may ye ſe al thyng mote dey maketh iupiter kyng prince cauſe al thyng conuertyng al hys propre wyl whiche deryued ſothe tel agayne creature lyue degre auayleth ſtryue wyſedome thynketh make vertue neceſſyte take wel may eſchewe namely v al dewe ſo grutcheth aught dothe folye rebel hym al may gye certaynly man hath moſte honour dyen hys excellence flour whan ſyker hys good name thā hath frendes ne ſham gladder ought frendes deth whan honour yolde vp breth whan name apalled age al foryeten hys vaſſellage beſt worthy ſame dyen whan beſt name contrarye al thys wylfulneſſe grutchen we▪ haue heuyneſſe good arcite cheualry floure departed dutye honoure foule priſon thys lyfe grutchen coſyn hys wyfe welfare loueth hym ſo wele hem thāke nay god wot neuer dele bothe ſoule eke hem offende yet mowe luſtes amende ¶what may conclude thys longe ſtory ſorowe rede v mery thanke iupiter al grace er departen thys place rede maken ſorowes two one perfyte ioye laſtyng euer mo loke nowe moſt ſorowe heryn wol fyrſt amende begyn suſter quod thys ful aſſent wyth al people parlement gentle palamon owne knyght ſerueth wyl herte myght euer hath done ſythe ye fyrſt hym knew ye ſhal grace vpon hym rewe take hym huſbonde lorde lene honde thys accorde let ſe nowe womanly pyte kynges brother ſonne parde though poore bachelere syn hath ſerued ſo many yere ſo great aduerſyte muſte ben conſydred leueth gentle mercy ought paſſen ryght ſayd thus palamon ye knight trowe chere nede lytel ſarmonyng make aſſenten thys thyng cometh nere taketh lady ye honde bytwyxt hem maked anon bonde hyght matrimony maryage counſayle baronage thus al blyſſe melodye hath palamon ywedded emelye ¶and god al world hath wrought sende loue yt hath ſo dere bought nowe palamon al wele lyuyng blyſſe richeſſe hele emelye hym loueth ſo tenderly ſerueth ſo gentelly neuer ther worde hē bytwene ielouſye tene thus endeth palamon emelye god ſaue al thys fayre companye ¶here endeth knyghtes tale foloweth myllers prologue whan knight thus hys tale ytolde al companye na ther yong ne olde ne ſayd noble ſtory worthy drawen memory namely gentyls euerychone hoſte lough ſware ſo mote gone gothe right vnbokled male let ſe nowe ſhal tel another tale truely game wel begonne nowe telleth ſyr monke yf ye donne somwhat quyte knyghtes tale ¶the myller dronken al pale vnnethes vpon hys horſe ſatte ne nolde auale neyther hoode ne hatte ne abyde man hys curteſye pylates voyce began crye ſwore armes bloode bone noble tale none wol nowe quyte ye knight tale ¶our hoſte ſawe dronkē ale ſayd abyde robyn leue brother better man ſhal tel v fyrſt abyde let v wirche thriftely ¶by goddes ſoule ꝙ wol wol ſpeke el go way hoſte anſwerde tel dyuelway thou arte foole thy wytte ouercome nowe herkeneth quod yu myller al ſome fyrſt make proteſtacion dronke knowe ſoun therfore yf miſpeke ſay wyte ale sothwarke pray wol tel legende lyfe bothe carpenter hys wyfe howe clerke ſet wrightes cappe ¶the reue anſwerde ſaid ſtynte thy clap let thy lende dronken harlottry ſynne eke great folye apayren man hym defame eke bryng wyues ſuche blame thou mayſt ynouge thynges ſayn thys dronkē myller ſpake ful ſone agayn ſayd leue brother oſwolde hath wyfe cokolde ſay therfore thou arte one ben ful good wyues many one arte thou angry tale haue wyfe parde wel thou yet nolde al ox plough take vpon ynough demen ſelfe one wol beleue none huſbonde ſhulde ben inquiſytyſe goddes priuete ne hys wyfe ſo fynde goddes foyſon remenaunt nedeth nat enquere ſhulde ſay myllere nolde wordes man forbere tolde chorles tale manere forthynketh ſhal reherce therfore euery gentle wight pray demeth goddes loue ſay yuel entent mote reherce tale al ben better werſe el fa •• en ſome matere therfore ſo lyſt turne ouer lefe choſe another tale ye ſhal fynde ynowe great ſmale hyſtorial thyng toucheth gentilneſſe eke moralite holyneſſe blame yf ye choſe amys myller chorle ye knowe wel reue eke mo harlotry tolde eke bothe two auyſe put blame eke men ſhuld make erneſt game ¶here endeth myllers prologue foloweth hys tale whylom ther dwellyng oxenforde ryche gnoffe yt geſtes helde borde craft carpenter wyth hym dwelling poore ſcoler ylerned arte al fantaſye turned lerne aſtrologye coude certayne concluſyons demen interogacions men aſked hym certayne houres whan yt men ſhulde haue drought ſhoures yf men aſked hym ſhulde befall euery thyng may reken al thys clerke cleped hende nycholas derne loue coude ſolas therto ſlye ryght priue ylyke mayden meke ſe chambre hoſtelry alone withouten company ful fetouſly dight herbes ſote hym ſelfe ſwete rote lycores ſytuwale almagiſte bokes great ſmale lagour longyng hys arte augrym ſtones lyeng fayre parte ſhelues couched beddes heed hys preſſe ycouered foldyng reed al aboue lay gay ſautrye whiche made nyghtes melodye ſwetely al chambre ronge angelus ad virginem ſonge ſonge kynges note ful ofte bleſſed hys mery throte thus ſwete clerke hys tyme ſpente hys frendes fyndynge hys rente ¶thys carpenter wedded new wyfe whych loued hys lyfe eyghtene yere ſhe age ielous kepte ſtrayte cage ſhe wyld yonge olde demed hym ſelfe ben cokewolde knewe cato hys wytte rude bad men wedde ſimilitude men ſhulde wedde aſtate youth elde often debate ſyth fallen ſnare muſt enduren folke hys care fayre yōge wyfe therwithal wyſele body gentle ſmale ſeynte ſhe weared barred al wyth ſylke barme clothe whyte morowe mylke vpon lendes ful many gore whyt ſmock embrouded al byfore eke behynde colere aboute cole blacke ſylke within eke without tape whyte volypere ſame ſute colere fylet brode ſylke ſet ful hye ſykerly ſhe lykerous eye ful ſmale ypulled browes two tho bent black ſlo moche blyſful ſe newe perienet tre ſofter wol wether gyrdel honge purſe lether taſſed wyth ſylke perled wyth latoun al thys worlde ſeken vp doun ny man ſo wyſe yt couth thenche gay popelote ſo gay wenche ful bryghter ſhynyng hewe towre noble forged newe ſonge ſo loude erne ſwalowe ſyttynge berne therto ſhe couth ſkyppe make game kydde calfe folowyng hys dame mouth ſwete braket ye methe horde apple lyeng hey hethe wynſynge ſhe ioly colte longe maſte vpryght bolte broche ſhe bare lowe collere brode boſſe bokelere ſhoes laſed legges hye primrole pyggeſkye lorde lyggen hys bedde yet good yoman wedde ¶nowe ſir efte ſire ſo byfel caas day thys hende nycholas fel thys yonge wyfe rage pley whyle huſbonde oſeney clerkes ben ful ſotel queynte priuely caught queynte ſayd wy haue wyll derne loue lemman ſpyll helde faſte haunche bone ſayd lemman loue wel one wol dyen alſo god ſaue ſhe ſpronge colte traue heed ſhe wrieth faſt away ſayd wol keſſe ſay let quod ſhe let nycholas wol crye harrowe ala way handes curteſye thys nycholas gan mercy crye ſpake ſo fayre profered hym ſo faſte ſhe loue graunted hym laſte ſwore oth ſ thomas kent ſhe wolde bene hys cōmaundement ſhe may leyſer wel aſpye huſbonde ſo ful ielouſye ye wayte wel priue wotte ryght wel nam deed ꝙ ſhe ye mote ben ful derne thys caas nay therof care ye quod nycholas clerke lytherly byſet hys whyle yf couth carpenter begyle thus accorded yſworne awayten tyme haue ſayd byforne whē nicholas thus euery dele thacked aboute lendes wele kyſſed ſwete taketh hys ſautry playeth faſte maketh melody fel thus ye paryſh cherche chriſtes owne workes werche thys good wyfe wente vpon holydaye forheed ſhone bryght daye waſhe ſhe let werke ¶now ther ye chirch paryſh clerke whych cleaped abſolon croulle hys heare golde ſhon ſtrouted fanne large brode ful ſtreyght euen lay hys ioly ſhode hys rode redde hys eyen gray goo poules wyndowes coruē ſhoos hoſen redde wente fetouſly gyrde ful ſmale properly al kyrtel lyght waget ful fayre thycke ben poyntes ſet therupon gay ſurplyſe whyte bloſome ryſe mery chylde ſo god ſaue wel coude let bloode clyppe ſhaue make chartre lande quytaunce twenty maner coude tryp daunce ſkole oxenforde tho wyth hys legges caſten fro play ſonges ſmale rybyble therto ſonge ſomtyme loude quinyble wel couth playe geterne al towne na brewhouſe ne tauerne ne vyſyted wyth hys ſolas gay tapſtere ſoth ſay ſomwhat ſquaimous fartynge ſpeche daungerous ¶thys abſolon ioly gaye goth wyth cenſer ſondaye cencyng wyues paryſhe faſte many louely loke hem caſte namely thys carpenter wyfe loke hym thought mery lyfe ſo propre ſwete lycorous dare wel • ayne yf ſhe ben mous catte wold haue hente anon thys paryſhe clerke thys ioly abſolon hath hys herte ſuch loue longynge wyſe toke none offerynge curteſye ſayd wolde none moone whē night bryght ſhone abſolon hys geterne hath ytake paramour thought wake forth goeth ielous amerous tyl came carpenter hous lytle cockes ycrowe dreſſed hym ſhot wyndowe vpon carpenter wall ſyngeth hys voyce gentle ſmall nowe dere lady yf thy wyl pray ye wol rewe ful wel accordyng hys geternynge ¶thys carpenter awoke herde ſynge ſpake vnto hys wyfe anon alyſon here thou abſolon chaūteth thus vnder boures wal ſhe aunſwerd huſbande ther withal yes god wot hym euery dele paſſeth forth wil ye bet thē wele fro day day thys ioly abſolon woeth hym wo bygon waketh al nyght al day kēbeth hys locke brode made gay woeth meanes brocage ſwore wolde ben owne page ſyngeth brokkyng nyghtyngale ſent pyment meth ſpyced ale wafres pypynge hotte glede ſhe toun profred mede ſome folke wol wonne rycheſſe ſome ſtrokes ſome gētleneſſe somtyme ſhew lyghtnes maſtrye playeth heraudes ſkaffolde hye auayleth hym thys caas loueth ſhe thys hende nicholas abſolon may blowe buckes horne ne hys laboure aſkorne thus ſhe maketh abſolon ape al hys requeſt turneth iape forſoth thys prouerbe lye men ſay thus alway nye ſlye maketh ferre loue loth though ye abſolon woode wroth bycauſe ferre ſyght thus nye nycholas ſtode hys lyght beare well hende nycholas abſolon may wayle ſynge ala ſo byfel ſaterbay thys carpenter gone oſnay hende nicholas alyſon accorded thys concluſion nycholas ſhulde ſhapen hem wyle thys ſely ielous carpenter begyle yf ſo game went aryght ſhulde ſlepe hys armes al nyght thys hys deſyre alſo ryght anone wythout wordes mo thys nycholas lenger wolde tarye doth ful ſofte vnto hys chambre carye meate drynke day twey huſbande bade ſey yf aſked nycholas ſhulde ſaye ſhe nyſt al daye ſhe ſawe hym cyte trowed ſome maladye crye mayde coude cal nolde anſwere naught yt might befal ¶thus paſſeth forth al ylke ſaterday nycholas ſtyl hys chambre lay ete dranke ſlept dyd lyſte tyl ſonday sunne goeth reſte ¶thys ſely carpenter hath great maruayle nicolas thinge might eyle ſayd drad ſaynte thomas ſtondeth aryght nycholas god ſhylde dyed ſodaynly worlde nowe ful tykel ſekerly ſawe day corſe borne cherche mōday laſt ſaw werche go vp quod vnto hys knaue anone cleape dore knocke faſt ſtone loke howe tel boldely ¶this knaue wente vp ful ſturdely chambre dore whyle ſtode cryed knocked woode howe ye mayſter nicholay howe may ye ſlepe al longe day al naught herde aworde hole founde ful lowe vpon borde catte wonte crepe hole loked ful depe laſte hym ſyght ¶thys nicholas ſate euer gapyng vpright keyked newe mone gothe tolde mayſter ſone aray ſawe thys ylke man ¶this carpenter blyſſen hym began ſayd nowe helpe v ſeynt frideſwyde man wot lytel ſhal hym betyde man fallen hys aſtronomye ſome woodneſſe ſome agonye thought aye wel howe ſhulde men ſhulden knowe goddes priuete ye bleſſed alway leude man naught onely byleue right ſo ferde another clerke wt aſtronomy walked feldes pry vpon ſterres wete ſhulde befal tyl marlpyt yfal ſawe yet ſaynte thomas reweth ſore hende nicholas ſhal arated hys ſtudyeng may ieſus heuen kyng get ſtaffe may vnderſpore whyle thou robyn heueſt vp dore ſhal hys ſtudyeng geſſe chambre dore gan hym dreſſe hys knaue ſtronge carle none haſpe bare vp dore one ſtore dore fel anone ¶this nicholas ſate ſtyl ſtone euer gaped vpwarde eyre carpenter wende diſpeyre hente hym ſhulders myghtyly ſhoke hym harde cryed ſpytouſly nicholas loke adowne awake thynke chriſtes paſſyon crouche yt elues frō wicked wightes therwith nightſpel ſaid anonrightes foure halues houſe aboute threſholde dore without ieſu chryſt ſaynt benedyght blyſſe houſe euery wycked wight fro nyghtes mare wyte pater noſter wonneſt thou ſaynt peter ſuſter ¶and laſte thys hende nicholas gan ſyke ſore ſayd ala shal al worlde loſte eſtſones nowe carpēter anſwerde ſayſt thou thinke god men yt ſwynke nicholas anſwerde fetch drinke wol ſpeke priuete certayne thynges toucheth wol tellen none man certayne carpēter goth cometh agayn brought myghty ale large quarte whan eche hem dronkē hys parte nicholas dore faſte ſhette downe carpenter hem ſette ſayd iohn hoſte myne lefe dere thou ſhalte vpon thy trouthe ſwere wight thou ſhalt coūſel wrey chriſtes counſayle ſay yf thou tel man thou arte forlore vengeaūce thou ſhalte haue therfore yf thou wray thou ſhalt woode ¶nay chriſt forbyd hys holy bloode quod tho ſely man blabbe ne though ſay lefe gabbe say thou wolte ſhal neuer tel childe ne wyfe harowed hel nowe iohn ꝙ nicholas wol nat lye haue yfounden myn aſtrologye haue loked moone bright monday next quarter night shal fal rayne ſo wylde woode halfe ſo great neuer no floode world ſaid leſſe houre shal al dreynte ſo hydous ſhoure thus ſhal mankynde drenche leſe lyfe carpēter anſwerd ſaid ala wife ſhal ſhe drenche ala myn alyſon ſorowe fel almoſte adoun ſaid remedye thys caas yes yes ful good quod hende nicholas thou wolt werche lore rede thou maiſt werchē thyn hede thus ſayeth salomon yt ful trewe worke al coūſayle thou ſhalt rewe yf thou wylt werken good counſayle vndertake wythout maſt ſayle yet ſhal ſaue haſt thou herde howe ſaued noe yt lorde warned hym byforne al ye worlde water ſhuld lorne yes quod carpenter ful yore ago ¶haſt thou herde quod nicholas alſo ſorowe noe wyth hys feloſhyp myght gete hys wyfe ſhyppe hym leuer dare wel vndertake thylke tyme al hys wether blake ſhe ſhyp herſelfe alone therfor woſt thou beſt done thys aſketh haſte haſty thynge men may preche ne make taryenge anone go get v faſt thys inne knedyng trowe el kemelyn eche v loke ben large mowe ſwymmē barge haue therin vytayles ſufficiante day fye remenante water ſhal aſlake gon awaye aboute prime vpon nexte daye robyn may wetē thys thy knaue ne eke thy mayde gylle may ſaue aſke though thou aſke wol tel goddes priuete suffyſeth yf thy wyttes madde haue great grace noe hadde thy wyfe ſhal wel ſaue doute go nowe thy way ſpede aboute thou haſt ygetten v theſe knedynge tubbes thre ſhalt thou hange hem ye rofe ful hye man purueyaunce eſpye yu haſt done thus haue ſayde haſt vytayle fayre hem ylayde eke axe ſmyte corde two yt water cometh may go breake hole hye vpon gable vnto garden warde ouer ſtable may frely paſſen forth waye great ſhoure gone awaye ſhalt yu ſwym mery vndertake doth ye whyt ducke drake wol clepe howe alyſon iohn mery floode wol paſſe anon thou wolt ſayn hayle maſter nicholay good morowe ſe wel day ſhul lordes al lyfe al worlde noe wyfe one thynge warne ful ryght wel auyſed ylke nyght entred ſhyppes borde none v ne ſpeake worde ne clepe ne crye ben hys prayer goddes owne heſte dere ¶thy wife thou mot hāge farre twinne betwyxte ſhalbe ſynne lokynge ſhal dede thys ordinaunce ſayd go god ſpede morowe nyght whē men al aſlepe knedynge tubbes wol crepe ſytten abydynge goddes grace go thy waye haue lenger ſpace make thys lenger ſermonyng men ſayne thus ſend ye wyſe ſay nothyng thou art ſo wyſe nedeth teche go ſaue lyues beſeche ¶thys ſely capenter goeth forth waye ful ofte ſayd ala welawaye hys wyfe tolde hys priuete ſhe ware knewe bet al thys queynt caſt ſey natheles ſhe ferde ſhe wolde dry ſayd ala go forth thy way anone helpe v ſkape deed echone thy trewe wedded wyfe go dere ſpouſe helpe ſaue lyfe lo whych great thynge affection men may dye ymagynacion depe may impreſſion take thys ſely carpenter begynneth quake hym thynketh verely may ſe no ſtoode come waltrynge ſee drenchen alyſon hys hony dere wepeth waileth maketh ſory cher • ſyketh wyth many ſory thought gothe getteth hym knedyng trough tubbe kemelyn priuely ſent hem hys hynge hem rofe ful priuely hys owne honde made hym ladder thre clymben ronges ſtalkes tubbes hongyng balkes hem vitayled trough tubbe wyth breed cheſe good ale tubbe suffyſyng ryght ynowe daye er made al thys arraye ſent hys knaue eke hys wenche alſo vpon hys nede london go ye monday drowe nyght ſhette dore without candel lyght dreſſed al thyng ſhulde ſhortly clomben vp al thre ſytten ſtyl fully furlonge way pater noſter clum ſayd nicolay clum ꝙ iohan cluom ſayd aliſon thys carpenter ſayd hys deuocion ſtyl ſyt byddeth hys prayere awaytynge rayne yf ¶the deed ſlepe wery beſyneſſe fel thys carpenter ryght geſſe aboute curfewe tyme lytel trauayle hys goſt groneth ſore efte routeth hys heed myſlay ye ladder thē ſtalketh nicolay alyſon ful ſofte ſhe ſpedde wythout wordes mo went bedde carpenter woned lye reuel melodye thus lyeth alyſon nycholas buſyneſſe myrth ſolas tyl bel laudes gan rynge freres chaunſel gon ſynge ¶thys paryſh clerke thys amerous abſolō loue alway ſo wo bygon vpon monday oſenay wyth company hym dyſporte play aſked vpon caſe cloyſterere ful priuely iohn carpentere drewe parte chyrche ſaid ſaw wyrche syth ſaturday trowe went tymbre abbot hath hym ſent wont tymbre go dwellen grange day two el hys houſe certayne ſothly ſayne thys abſolon ful ioly lyght thouȝt time walk alnight ſekerly ſawe hym ſterynge hys dore ſyth day began ſprynge mote thriue ſhal cockes crowe ful priuely knocke hys wyndowe ſtant ful lowe vpon hys boures wal alyſon wol nowe tellen al loue longynge yet ſhal myſſe leeſt way ſhal kyſſe maner comforte ſhal haue parfaye mouth hath ytched al thys longe daye ſygne kyſſynge leeſt alnyght mette eke feeſt therfore wol go ſlepe houre twey al nyght wol walke pley ¶when yt fyrſt cocke hath crowe anon vp ryſt thys ioly louer abſolon hym arayeth gay queynt deuyce fyrſt cheweth greyns lycoryce ſmellen ſote kempt hys vnder hys tonge trueloue bere therby wende ben graciouſe rometh carpenter houſe ſtyll ſtante vnder ſhotwyndowe vnto hys breſt raught ſo lowe ſofte knocked wyth ſemely ſoun ye honycombe ſwete alyſoun fayre byrde ſwete ſynamome awaketh lemman myne ſpeaketh ful lytel thynken ye vpon wo loue ſwelt go wonder though ſwelte ſwete morne dothe lambe tete wy lemman haue ſuche loue longyng lyke turtle trewe mornyng may eaten may mayde go fro wyndowe iacke foole ſhe ſayde helpe god ſwete ſaynt iame loue another el blame wel bet ieſu abſolon go forth thy waye wol caſte ſton let ſlepe twenty dyuelway ¶alas quoth abſolon welaway trewe loue euer ſo yuel byſette kyſſe ſyn may bette ieſus loue loue wylt yu go thy waye therwith ꝙ ſhe ¶ye certes lemman quoth thys abſolon make redy ꝙ ſhe come anon vnto nycholas ſhe ſayd ſtyl nowe peace thou ſhalt laugh thy fyl abſolon ſet vpō knee ſayd lorde al degree thys hope cometh lemman thy grace ſwete byrde thy nore wyndowe ſhe vndoth haſte haue ꝙ ſhe ſpede faſte let neyghbours aſpye abſolō gan wype mouth ful drye derke nyght pytche cole ye wyndow ſhe put er hole abſolon felte neyther bet ne wers mouth kyſt bare er ful ſauerly ware thys backe ſterte thought amys wel wyſte woman hath berde felte thyng al rowe longe herde ſayd fye ala haue ¶te quod ſhe clapte wyndowe abſolon gothe forthe ſory paas berde berde ſayd hende nycholas goddes corpus gothe fayre wele ſely abſolon herde euery dele hys lyppe gan angre byte ſelue ſayd ſhal quyte rubbeth froteth lip duſt wt ſonde ſtrawe chyps abſolon ſaythe ful often ala ſoule betake sathanas leuer thā al town quod diſpyte auenged ¶alas quod ala yt ne ybleynt hotte loue colde al yqueynt fro tyme kyſte er paramour ſet kers healed hys maladye ful ofte paramoures gan defye wepe dothe chylde ybete ſofte pace wente ouer ſtrete vnto ſmythe men callen dan gerueys hys forge ſmyteth plowe harneys ſharpeth ſhares culters beſyly abſolon knocketh al eaſily ſaid vndo gerneys anon ¶what arte thou abſolon abſolon chriſtes ſwete tre ryſe ye ſo rathe • ey benedicite eyleth ſome gay gyrle god wote hath brought thus berytote ſaynte note ye wote wel mene ¶this abſolon ne raught bene al play worde agayne gaſſe hath towe hys diſtaffe geruays knewe ſayd frende ſo dere hote cultre chymeney lene haue therwith done wyl bryng agayne ful ſone ¶gerueys anſwerde certes golde poke noble al vntolde thou ſhuldeſt haue trewe ſmyth eye criſtes fote wol ye therwith therof quod abſolon may ſhal wel tellen morowe day caught culter colde ſtele ful ſofte dore gan ſtele went vnto carpenter wal coughed fyrſt knocked ther withal vpon wyndowe right dyd ere ¶this alyſon anſwerde knocketh ſo warāte thefe nay ꝙ god wot ſwete lefe thyn abſolon thyn owne derlyng golde ꝙ haue ye brought ryng mother yaue ſo god ſaue ful fyne therto wel ygraue wol yeue yf thou kyſſe nycholas ryſſen pyſſe thought wolde amenden iape ſhulde kyſſe er er ſkape vp wyndowe dyd haſtely er put ful priuely ouer buttockt haunche boon therwith ſpake clerke abſolon speke ſwete byrde thou arte ¶this nycholas anon let fleen farte great ben thunder dent ſtroke welny yblent redy hys yron hote nycholas arſe ſmote gothe ſkyn hondbrede hotte cultor brende ſo hys toute ſmerte wende dye woode gan crye helpe water water goddes herte carpenter hys ſlomber ſterte herde one crye water wood thought ala cometh no flood ſette hym vp without wordes mo axe ſmote corde two downe gothe al foūde neyther ſel breed ne ale downe ſhortly fel vpon flore ſwowne lay ¶vp ſterte alyſon hende nycholay cryed harrowe ſtrete neyghbours ſmal grete ronne gauren thys man ſwoune lay palyſhe wan fal broſten hath arme ſtonden muſte vnto hys owne harme whan ſpake yborne adoun wyth hende nycholas alyſoun told euery man woode agaſte ſo no floode throughe fantaſye hys vanyte hath getten hym knedyng tubbes thre hath hem honged rofe aboue prayed hem goddes loue ſytten roofe par companye folke gan laughen fantaſye roofe kyken gape turned al hys erneſt iape ſo carpenter anſwerde naught man reaſon herde othes great yſworne adowne eueryche clerke anon helde ſaid ye mā wood leue brother euery wyght gan laughen ſtrife ¶thus ſwyued carpenter wyfe al hys kepyng hys ielouſye abſolon hath kyſt neyther eye nycholas ſkalded toute thys tale done god ſaue al route ¶here endeth myllers tale foloweth reues prologue whan folke laughed thys nyce caas abſolon hende nycolas dyuers folke dyuerſly ſayde parte loughe playde ne thys tale ſawe man hym greue onely oſwolde reue bycauſe carpenter crafte lytel yre hys herte ylafte gan grutchen blamen lyte sothly quod ful wel couthe ye quyte wyth bleryng proude myllers eye lyſt ſpeke rybaudrye eke olde luſt play age graſſe tyme done fodder forage whyte toppe writeth myne olde yeres ſōtyme yolow white bē myn here yet fare doth open er ylke frute euer lenger wers tyl • otten molloke ſtre olde men dreden ſo fare tyl rotten rype hoppē alway world wol pype wyl ſtyketh euer nayle haue hore heed grene tayle hath leke though ourmight gone wyl deſyreth folye euer one whā may thā wol ſpekē yet aſſhen olde fyre yreken ¶four gledes han whiche ſhal deuyſe auauntyng lyeng angre couetyſe theſe four ſparkles longen elde olde lymmes mowe wel ben vnwelde wyl ne ſhal fayle ſothe yet haue alway coltes tothe many yere paſſed henne syn tappe lyfe began renne ſikerly whan borne anone dethe drowe tappe lyfe let gone euer ſyns hath tappe yronne tyl almoſt al empty tonne ſtreme life droppeth ye chimb ſely tonge may wel ringe clymb wretchedneſſe paſſed ful yore olde folke ſaue dotage ¶whan yt hoſt herde ſermoning gan ſpeke lordly kyng ſayd amounteth al thys wytte ſhal ſpeke al day holy wrytte dyuel made reue preche ſouter ſhypman leche say forthe thy tale tary nat tyme lo depforde halfe way pryme lo grenewyche many ſhrewe tyme thy tale begyn ¶nowe ſirs quod oſwolde reue pray al ye greue anſwere ſomdele ſet hys houſe leful force force ſhoufe dronken myller hath ytolde v howe begyled carpentere parauenture ſkorne one leaue ſhal hym quyte anone ryght churles termes wol ſpeke pray god hys necke mote breke wel myne eye ſene ſtalke owne ſene balke ¶here endeth reues prologue ¶here begynneth reues tale trompynton far fro cambridge ther gothe broke ouer bridge vpon whyche broke ther ſtant mell ſothe tel myller dwellyng many day pecocke proude gay pypen couthe fyſſhen nettes bete turne cuppes wel wraſtle ſhere aye hys belte bare longe pauade ſworde ful trenchaunt ye blade ioly popere bare hys pouche ther mā peryl durſt hym touche shefelde thwytel bare hys hoſe roūde face camyſed noſe pylled ape hys ſkull market beater full durſt wyght honde ledge ne ſwore ſhulde abedge theſe ſothe corne mele ſlye vſaunt ſtele name hoten deynous symkyn wyfe comen noble kyn parſon towne father yafe ful many panne bra symkym ſhulde bloode alye yfoſtred nonnerye symken wolde wyfe ſayde ſhe wel ynouriſſhed mayde ſauen hys aſtate yomanrye ſhe proude perte pye ful fayre ſyght vpon hem two holy dayes byforne wolde go hys typet wounden aboute heed ſhe came gyte reed symken hoſen ſame durſt wyght clepen dame none ſo hardy wente way one durſt rage play yf wolde ſlayne symkyn pauade knyfe bodkyn ielous folkes ben perillous euermo algates wolde wyues wende ſo eke ſhe ſomdele ſmoterlyche dygne water dyche ful hoker beſmare thoughe lady ſhulde ſpare kyndred nortelrye ſhe lerned nonnerye ¶a doughter bytwyxt hem two twenty yere withouten mo sauyng chylde yt halfe yere age cradell lay propre page wenche thicke wel ygrowen wyth camyſed noſe eyen gray glas buttockes brode breſtes rounde hye right fayre heare wol lie parſon ye town ſhe ſo fayre purpoſe maken hys heyre bothe hys catell hys meſuage ſtraunge made maryage hys purpoſe ſtowen hye ſome worthy blode auncetry holy church good mote ben diſpended oh holy church blode diſcended therfore wolde hys holy blode honour though holy churche ſhulde deuour ¶great ſoken hath myller dout whete malte londe namely ther great college men clepen solere hall cambrege ther whete eke malt igroūde day happed ſtounde sicke lay manciple malady men wenden wiſely ſhulde dye myller ſtale whete corn hundred tyme beſorn ſtale curteyſly nowe thefe outrageouſly wiche warden chydde made fare therof ſette myller nat tare craked boſted ſwore na nat ſo thā yonge poore ſcholers two dwelten hall whiche ſay teſtife luſty play onely myrthe reuelrye vpon warden beſtly crye yeue hem leaue lytel ſtounde gon • ſene corne ygrounde hardely durſt lay necke myller ſhuld ſteale hem half pecke corne ſleyght ne force hem reue laſt warden yaue hem leue iohan hight one aleyn hight ye town yt hight strother farre northe tel aleyn maketh al redy gere horſe ſacke caſte anon forthe goth aleyn clerke alſo iohn good ſworde bockeler ſyde iohn knewe way hym nedeth gyde myl dore ſacke layth ¶aleyn ſpake firſt al hayle symkē fayth howe fare thy fayre doughter thy wyfe aleyn welcom quod symken lyfe iohn alſo ye god simōd ꝙ iohn nede pere behoueth ſerue ſelfe yt ſwain el fole clerkes ſayne manciple hope wyl deed swa werkes aye wanges heed therfore come eke alayne grynde corne cary home agayne pray ſpede v heme ye may ſhalbe quod symkyn fay wol ye hande god ryght hopper wol ſtande quoth iohn ſen gate ye corne goth yet ſawe neuer father kyn howe hopper wagges fra alayne anſwerd iohan wylte thou ſa wol byneth crowne ſe howe mele falles adowne troughe ſhalbe diſporte quoth iohan fay may ben one ſorte ill myllere ye myller ſmyleth nycite thought al ny done wyle w • ne man may hem begyle thryfte yet ſhal blere eye al ſleyght philoſofye queynte clerkes make wol ſteale whan take ſtede floure yet wol gyue hem brēne greateſt clerkes ben wyſeſt men whilom wolfe ſpake mare al arte counte tare ¶out dore gothe ful priuely whan ſawe tyme ſubtelly loked vp downe tyl yfounde clerkes horſe ſtode ybounde behynde mylle vnder leſſel horſe gothe fayre wel ſtrypeth bridel ryght anon whā ye horſe loce gan gon towarde fen wylde mare rynne forth wt wehe thicke thynne myller gothe agayne worde ſaide doth note wt theſe clerkes playde tyl yt corne fayre wel ygrounde whan meale ſacked ybounde iohn goth fonde hors away gan crye harowe welaway horſe loſte aleyne goddes bane steppe thy fete mā come forth al atanes ala wardeyn hys palfray lorne ¶this aleyn al forgate bothe mele corne al mynde hys huſbondrye whylke way gon gan crye wyfe came leapyng inwarde rene ſayd ala gothe fenne wylde mare faſte may go vnthāke come hys honde yt bonde ſo yt better ſhulde haue knyt reyne ala ꝙ iohn aleyn chriſtes peyne lay downe thy ſwerde ſhal myn alſwa ful ſwyfte god wafe raa goddes ſale ſhal ſkape v bathe ne haddeſt thou put capel ye lathe il heyle aleyn god thou fonne ¶theſe ſely clerkes han ful faſte yronne towarde fenne aleyn eke iohn whan myller ſawe yt agō halfe buſſhel floure hath take bade hys wyfe knede kake ſayd trowe clerkes ferde yet myller make clerkes berde al arte yet let hem gon way lo gon let chyldren play get ſo lightly crowne theſe ſely clerkes rennen vp downe kepe kepe ioſſa wartherere ga whyſtle thou ſal kepe hym ſhortly tyl nyght couth though al might caple catche ran away ſo faſte tyl dyche caught hym laſte ¶ • ery wete beeſtes rayne cometh ſely iohn wt hym cometh alayn ala quod iohn day borne nowe dryuen hethē ſkorne corne ſtole men wol v fooles cal bothe warden felowes al namely myller waylaway thus playneth iohn gothe yt way towarde myll bayarde honde myller ſyttyng fyre fonde night ferther might nought loue god hym beſought herbrough eaſe peny ¶the myller ſaid ayen ben suche yet ſhal ye haue part houſe ſtrayte ye haue lerned art ye argument make place myle brode twenty foote ſpace let ſe nowe yf thys place may ſuffyſe make rōmer wt ſpeche gyſe symōd ſaid iohn ſaint cutberde aye thou mery fayre anſwerde haue herd ſai mē ſhuld takē twa thīges swylk fyndes ſwilke bringes ſpecially pray hoſte dere get v ſome meate drinke make v chere wyl pay trewly ful empty honde men may haukes tul lo ſyluer redy ſpende myller ye towne doughter ſende ale breed roſted hem goo bounde hors ſhulde go loo chambre made bedde ſhetes chalons fayre yſpredde owne bedde ten fote twelue hys doughter bedde al ſelue right ſame chambre myght bette cauſe ther rowmer herbrowe yt place ſoupen ſpeken myrth ſolace dronken euer ſtronge ale beſte aboute mydnight went reſte ¶wel hath myller vernyſhed heed ful pale dronken nothyng reed galpeth ſpeketh noſe quacke poſe bedde gothe wyfe iay ſhe lyght iolyfe ioly whyſtel wel ywette cradell beddes fete ſette rocken yeue chylde ſouke whan yt dronken al crouke bedde went daughter ryght anon bedde gothe aleyn eke iohn na hem neded dwale myller hath ſo wiſely bybbed ale horſe ſnorteth hys ſlepe ne hys tayle behynde toke kepe wyfe bare hym bordon wel ſtrong men might hem route forlonge wenche routeth eke par company ¶aleyn clerke herde melody poked iohn ſaide ſlepeſt thou herdeſt thou euer ſwylke ſange er nowe lo nuylke couplyng ytwyxt hem wylde fyre bodyes fal herde euer ſwylke ferly thyng ye ſhal haue floure yuel endyng al lange nyght tydes reſte yet naforce al ſhal beſte iohan ſayd euer mote thriue may yon wenche wol ſwyue eſement hath lawe ſhapen v iohn lawe ſaythe thus yf man one poynte ben greued ſhal releued corne ſtolne ſothly nay haue yuel fyt day ſyn ſhal haue none amendement agayne loſſe wyl haue myn eſement goddes ſale ſhal none ¶thys iohan anſwerde aleyn auyſe myller peryllous man ſayde yf ſlepe abrayde myght v bathe vilonye aleyn anſwerd coūt worth fly vp ryſte wenche crept wenche lay vpright faſte ſlept tyl ſo nye er ſhe myght aſpye ben late crye ſhortly ſayne play aleyn wol ſpeke iohn iohn lay ſtyl forlonge way two hym ſelfe maketh routh wo ala ꝙ wycked iape nowe may ſay ape yet hath felowe ſomwhat harme hath myllers doughter hys arme auntreth hym hath hys nede yſpedde lye draffe ſacke bedde whan iape tolde nother dey ſhal holde daffe cokeney wol aryſe auntre fay vnhardy vnſely thus men ſay vp coſe ſoftely wente vnto cradel arme hent bare ſoftely beddes fete sone wyfe routyng lete gan awake went pyſſe came agayn gan cradell myſſe groped ſhe foūde none ala ꝙ ſhe almoſte myſgone almoſt gone clerkes bedde eye benedycite foule yſpedde forthe ſhe gothe tyl ſhe cradel fonde gropeth alway honde founde ye bedde thought nat good bycauſe cradel ſtode nyſte ſhe derke fayre wel ſhe crepte clerke lyeth ful ſtil wold haue caught ſlepe within iohn clerke vp lepe good wyfe layde ful ſore mery fyt ſhe nought ful yore pricked harde depe madde ioly lyfe haue theſe two clerkes ladde tyl thyrde cocke began ſyng ¶aleyn waxe wery dawnyng ſwonken al longe nyght ſayd farwel malyn ſwete wyght day comen may lenger byde euermo ſo go ryde thyn owne clerke ſo haue hele nowe dere lemman ꝙ ſhe go farwele thou go one thyng wol tell whā thou wendeſt homwarde mell ryght entre dore behynde thou ſhalt cake halfe buſſhel fynde ymaked thyn owne mele whiche helpe ſyre ſtele good lemman god ſaue kepe yt worde ſhe gan almoſte wepe ¶aleyn vpriſt thought er dawe wolde go crepen felawe founde cradel honde anon god thought al wronge haue gon heed totty ſwynke nyght maketh go aryght wot wel ye cradel haue myſſe go lyeth myller hys wyfe alſo forthe gothe twenty dyuel way vnto bedde myller lay wende haue cropen felowe iohn myller crepte anon caught hym necke ſoft ſpake ſayd iohan thou ſwyneſheed awake chriſtes ſoule noble game lorde called ſaynt iame haue thriſe ſhorte nyght swyued myllers doughter bolt vpright whyles thou haſte cowarde ben agaſte ye falſe harlot quod myller haſte falſe traytour falſe clerke quod thou ſhalte deed goddes dignyte durſte ſo bolde diſparage doughter come ſuche lynage throte bolle caught alayn hent diſpytouſly agayne noſe ſmote feſt downe ran blode ſtreme vpon breſt flore wyth mouthe noſe ybroke walowen dothe pygges poke vp gon downe ayen anone tyl myller ſpurnde ſtone downe fyl backwarde vpon wyfe wyſte nothyng nyce ſtryfe ſhe fal ſlepe lytel wyght iohn clerke yt waked alnyght fal ſlepe ſhe brayde helpe holy croſſe fynde ſtaffe ſhe ſtert vp alſo knewe e • tres bet thā dyd iohn wal ſhe founde ſtaffe anon ſawe lytel ſhemeryng light hole ſhone moone bright lyght ſhe ſawe hem bothe two ſykerly ſhe nyſte ſhe ſey whyte thyng eye whan ſhe gan whyte thyng aſpye wende clerke weared voluper wt ſtaffe ſhe drowe alway ner ner wende haue hyt aleyn ful ſmote myller pylled ſkul gothe cryed harowe dye theſe clerkes bete hym wel let hym lye arayeth hem toke horſe anon eke meale way gon mylle dore toke cake halfe buſhel floure wel ybake thus proude myller wel ybete hath yloſt gryndyng whete payde ſupper euery dele great ſmale thus haue quyt myller tale ¶here endeth reues tale foloweth coke prologue coke london whyle reue ſpake ioye hym thought claude hym bake ha ꝙ chriſtes paſſyon myller hath ſharpe concluſyon vpon argument herby gage wel ſayd salomon hys langage ne bryng euery man thyn hous herbrowyng nyght perelous wel ought man auyſed brought hys pryuete pray god ſo yeue ſorowe care euer ſythen hyght hodge ware herde myller bette yſette awerke iape malyce derke god forbyd ſtynten therfore yf ye vouche ſafe tale poore man wol tel wel lytel iape fel cyte ¶our hoſt ſayd ſyr graunte nowe tel rodger loke good many paſty haſte thou letten blood many iacke douer haſt thou ſolde hath twyſe hotte twyſe colde many pilgrym haſt thou chriſtes curſe thy parſſe yet fare worſe haue eaten wyth thy ſtobel goo thy ſhoppe manye ſlye loo nowe tel gentle rogere thy name yet pray wrothe game man may ſay ful ſothe game play ¶thou ſayſt ful ſothe ꝙ roger ſay ſoth play quade play ye ſleming ſaith therfore henry baylly thy fayth thou wrothe departen though tale ben hoſtelere natheleſſe wol tellen yet er parte ywys thou ſhalte quyt therwithal lough made chere ſayd tale ye ſhullen ¶here endeth coke prologue foloweth hys tale aprentiſe whilom dwelte cyte crafte vitaylers galiard goldfynch ſhawe browne bery proper ſhorte felawe locke blake kempt ful fetouſly daunce couthe ful wel ioltly called perkyn reuelour ful loue paramout hyue ful hony ſwete wel wenche wyth hym might mete euery bridal wolde ſyng hoppe loued bette tauernes ſhoppe whan ridyng chepe ſhoppe thider wolde lepe tyl al ſyght iſeyn daunced wel wolde come ageyn gather hym meyny hys ſorte hop ſyng make ſuche diſporte ſetten ſteuyn mete playen diſe ſuche ſtrete cyte na prentiſe fayrer couthe caſten payre diſe perken couthe therto fre diſpence place priuyte founde maiſter wele chafare oftymes founde bore ful bare ſikerly prentiſe reuelour haunteth diſe riotte paramour maiſter ſhal hys ſhoppe abye al haue parte mynſtralcy thefte riotte ben conuertible al play gettron ribible reuel trouthe lowe degre ben ful wrothe al day men may ſe ioly prentiſe mayſter abode tyl nye prentiſhode al ſnybbed bothe early late ſomtyme ledde reuel newgate laſt maiſter thought vpon day whan hys paper ſought prouerbe ſaith ſame worde welbette rotten apple horde rote al remenaunt fareth riottous ſeruaunt moche leſſe harme let paſſe ſhende al ſeruaūtes place therfore maiſter gaue hym quitaunce badde go wt ſorowe myſchaunce thus ioly prentiſe leue nowe lette hym riot al nyght leue thefe without louke helpeth hym waſte ſouke bribe borowe may anon ſent hys bedde hys array vnto compere hys owne ſorte loued dice reuel diſporte wyfe helde countenaunce ſhoppe ſwyued ſuſtenaunce ¶here endeth coke tale foloweth man lawes prologue ovr
