al ye route fourthe parte thys day gon loue god ſaynt iohn leſeth tyme ferforth ye may lordinges tyme waſteth night day ſtealeth v priuely ſlepyng negligēce wakyng doth ye ſtreme turneth neuer agayn diſcendynge fro moūtayne ye playn wel seneke many phylyſofre waylen tyme golde cofre loſſe catel may recouered loſſe tyme ſhendeth v ꝙ wol come ayen withouten drede wol malkyns maydenhede whan ſhe hath loſte wantonneſſe let v mowlen thus ydelneſſe syr man lawe ꝙ ſo haue blys tel v tale anon forwarde ye ben ſubmytted fre aſſent ſtonden caſe iugement aquyteth beheſte haue ye done deuer leſte ¶hoſte ꝙ de pardeuxied aſſent breke forwarde myn entent byheſte dette wol holde fayne al beheſt better ſayne ſuch law mā yeueth wight ſhulde hym ſelue vſen ryght thus wol text natheles certayne right thrifty tale ſayne chaucer though leudly metre rymyng craftely hath ſayd hem ſuche englyſſhe olde tyme knoweth many man yf haue ſayd hem leue brother one boke hath ſayd hem another hath tolde louers vp doun mo ouyde made mencioun epyſtels ben ful olde ſhuld tellē hem ſythen ben tolde youthe made ſyxe al lone ſythen hath ſpoken euerychone theſe noble wyues theſe louers eke ſo wol hys large volume ſeke cleped ſayntes lyues cupyde may ſe large woundes wyde lucreſſe babylon thiſbe ſwerde dydo falſe enee tre phillis demophoon playnte deianire hermyon artadna hyſiphilee ba • ayne yle ſtondyng ſee dreynte lyandre hero teares heleyn eke wo briſets laodomia crueltie quene medium lytel chyldren hongyng hals iaſon loue ſo fals hypermiſtra penelope alceſte wyfehode cōmendeth beſte certaynly worde ne writeth thylke wycked enſample canace loued owne brother ſynfully ſuche curſed ſtories ſay fy el tyro appolloneus howe curſed kyng antyocus byrafte doughter maydenhede ſo horrible tale rede whan drewe vpon pament therfore ful auiſement nolde neuer write uon hys ſermons ſuche vnkynde abhominations ne ne wol non reherce yef may tale howe ſhal thys day lothe lykened doutles muſes men clepeth piryades methamorphoſeos wotte mene natheles reche bene though come hym haubake ſpeke proſe let hym rymes make worde ſobre chere began hys tale ye ſhullen ¶here endeth man lawes prologue foloweth hys tale hateful harme condyciō pouert thurſt colde hūgre ſo cōfoūded aſken helpe ſhameth thyn hert thou non aſke wt nede thou art ſo wounded nede vnwrapeth al thy woūdes hid maugry thyn heed thou muſt indygence ſtele begge borowe thy diſpence thou blameſt chriſt ſayeſt ful bytterly miſdeparteth rycheſſe temporall thy neyghbour thou wyteſt ſynfully ſayeſt tyou haſte lytel hath parfay ſayſt thou ſomtyme reken ſhall whan tayle ſhal brenne glede nought helpeth nedeful nede herken ſentence wyſe better dyen haue indygence thyne ſelfe neygbour wol diſpyſe thou poore farwel thy reuerence yet wyſe man take thys ſentence al dayes poore men ben wycke beware therfore thou come pricke thou poore thy brother hateth al thy frendes fleeth fro ala ryche marchauntes ful wele ye noble prudent folke caas bagges ben fylde ambes aa wt cyſe ſynke yt renneth chaūce chriſtenmaſſe mery may ye daunce ye ſeken loude ſee wynnynges wyſe folke ye knowen al ſtate reignes ye ben father tidynges tale bothe peace began rekē wel goodneſſe beaute na neuer ſuche nother ſhe pray god honour ſuſtene wolde ſhe al europe quene hye beautie without pride youthe without grenhede folye al werkes vertu gyde humbleſſe hath mayden ſeyn home surrey ben went ageyn done nedes han done yore lyuen welth ſay fel yt theſe marchātes ſtodē grace hym soudon surrye whā yt came frō ſtraunge place wolde hys benygne curteſye maken hem good chere beſyly aſpye tydynges ſondry realmes lere wonder might ſeen amonge thynges ſpecially theſe marchantes haue hym tolde dame cuſtaunce gret nobleſſe erneſt ceryouſly soudō hath cauȝt ſo great pleſāce han fygure hys remembraunce al luſte al hys beſy cure loue whyle lyfe may dure parauenture ylke large boke cleped heuē twritten ſterres whan byrthe toke loue ſhulde han dethe ala ſterres clerer glas written god wot ſo coude rede dethe euery man withouten drede ſterres many wynter byfore written deth hector achilles pompey iulius bore ſtryfe thebe hercules sampſon turnus socrates dethe men wyttes ben ſo dull wyght wel rede full soudō priue counſayle ſene ſhortly thys mater pace hath hem declared al hys entent ſaid hē certain yf might haue grace haue cuſtaūce withyn lytel ſpace na deed charged hem hye ſhapen lyfe ſome remedye diuers men diuerſly ſayden argument caſten vp doun many ſubtell reaſon forthe layden ſpeken magike abuſyoun finally concluſyoun ſeen non auauntage ne non way ſaue maryage ſawe therin ſuche difficulte way reaſon ſpeke al playne bycauſe ſuche diuerſyte bitwene bothe lawes ſayne trow yt chriſten prince wolde fayne wedden hys chylde vnder lawes ſwete v taught mahounde prophete anſwerde rather leſe cuſtaunce wol chriſten doutels mote ben may non cheſe pray holde argumentes pee saueth lyfe recheles getten hath lyfe cure thys wo may long lengre tarieng forwarde hem dreſſe al ſome cuſtaunce ſorowe al ouercome ful pale ariſt dreſſheth wende wel ſhe ſey non ende ala wondre though ſhe wept ſhal ſent ſtraunge nation fro frendes ſo tenderly kept bounden vnder ſubiectyon one ſhe knoweth condityon huſbondes ben al good han ben yore knowen wyues dare ſay father ſhe ſaid thy wretched child cuſtāce thy yonge daughter foſtred vp ſo ſofte ye mother ſoueraigne pleaſance ouer al thyng take chriſt lofte cuſtaunce child cōmaundeth ofte vnto grace ſhal surrye ne ſhal neuer ſe eye ala vnto barbary nation muſt anon ſithen wyl chriſt ſtarfe rome harme hanybal romayns hath inēqueſhed tymes thre na herde ſuche tendre wepyng pyte chambre departyng forth ſhe mote wheder ſhe wepe ſyng fyrſt mouyng cruel firmament wyth thy diurnal ſwegh croudeſt aye hurtleſte al fro eft occident naturally wolde holde another way thy croudyng ſet heuen ſuche array begynnyng feirs voyage cruel mar hath ſlayne maryage infortunate aſſendent tortuous whiche lorde helpeleſſe fal ala hys angle derkeſt houſe mar occiſer thys caas feble moue vnhappy ben thy paas thou knitteſt yt thou nart receyued ther thou wel fro thēce art yu wayued imprudent longe beſechyng hym done honour ſhe might haue ye chriſtē folke feſte pleſen hem wol labour soudō ſaythe wol heſte knelyng thanketh requeſte glad nyſt ſay kiſt ſonne home ſhe goth way aryued ben great preſe ryche raye surreyens romayns ymette yfere mother soudon ryche gay receyueth al glad chere mother myght doughter dere vnto next cyte beſyde ſofte paas ſolempnely ryde nought trowe triumphe iulyus whiche lucan maketh ſuche boſt royaller curious thaſſemblyng bliſful hoſt scorpyon wycked goſt ſodonneſſe al flatteryng caſt vnder al thys ful mortally ſtyng soudon cometh himſelfe ſone ryally wonder tel welcometh wyth moche ioye blys thus myrthe ioye let hem dwel fruyte euery tale tel tyme come mē thought beſt reuel ſtynte men gone reſt tyme come olde soudōneſſe ordened hath ye ferſt whych tolde feeſt chriſten folke hem dreſſe general yonge olde may men feeſt ryalte beholde deyntes mo deuyſe al dere boughten ryſe soudon wo yt euer thou art ſucceſſour worldly bliſſe ſpringed bytterneſſe ende ioye worldly laboure wo occupyeth ende gladneſſe herken thys counſayle thy ſekerneſſe vpon thy glad day haue thou mynde vnware wo harm yt cometh behynde ſhortly tellen worde soudon chriſten euerychone ben al hewe ſtycked borde onely dame cuſtaunce alone thys olde soudonneſſe curled crone hath wyth frēdes done thys curſed dede ſhe ſelfe wolde al countre lede ne ſurreyn none yt cōuerted coūſayle soudon wot na al heawe er aſterted cuſtaūce han taken anone fotehot ſhyppe al ſterneleſſe god wot han ſet bydden lerne ſayle surrey ayenwarde itayle certayne treſour ſhe thyder ladde ſoth ſayne vytayle great plente han yeuen clothes eke ſhe ſorth ſhe ſayled ſalte ſe cuſtaunce ful benignite emperours yonge doughter dere lorde fortune thy ſtere bleſſeth wt ful pytous voyce vnto croſſe chriſt tho ſayd ſhe clere welful aulter holy croice reed lambes blode ful pyte waſhe ye worlde fro ye olde iniquite fro fende fro hys clawe kepe daye ſhal drenchen depe victorious tree protection trewe onely worthy bere kynge heuē hys woūdes newe whyte lambe hurt wt ſpere flemere fendes hym whych thy lymmes faythfully extenden kepe yeue myght lyfe amēdē yeares dayes fleteth thys creature thrughout ye ſee grece vnto ſtrayte marocke auenture many ſory mele may ſhe bayte death ful ofte may ſhe wayte wylde waues wolde dryue vnto place ſhe ſhulde aryue men mightē aſkē ſhe ſlayne ſene mighty werkes chriſt euery harme tryacle certayne meanes often knowē clerkes doth thinge certayne ende yt ful derke man wytte ignoraunce ne knowe hys prudent purueyaūce ſyth yt ſhe ye feeſt yſlawe kepeth fro drenchyng ſee kept ionas fyſhes mawe tyl ſpouted neniue wel may mē knowe wight kept ye people ebrake drenchyng wyth drye fete ſee paſſyng hath foure ſpirites ye tempeſte power anoye lande ſee north ſouth alſo weſt eſte anoyeth nether ſee ne lande ne tre sothly cōmaunder therof fro ye tempeſt aye thys woman kepte wel ſhe woke ſhe ſlepte wher might womā mete drynke haue thre yere laſteth vitayle fedde egipcyan marye caue deſerte none chriſt ſans fayle fyue thouſand folk gret maruaile loues fyue fyſſhes two fede god ſent toyſon great nede driueth forthe occian throughout wylde ſee tyl laſte vnder holde nempne ne fer northumberlōde waue caſte ſande ſhyppe ſtycked ſo faſte thence nolde al tyde wyl chriſt yt ſhe ſhuld ther byde conſtable caſtel downe fare ſeen wrecke al ſhyp ſought fonde wery woman ful care founde alſo treſoure ſhe brought langage mercy ſhe beſought lyfe body twyn delyuer wo ſhe mauer latyn corrupte ſpeche algates therby ſhe vnderſtonde conſtable whā hym lyſt lenger ſeche thys woful woman brought londe kneleth downe thāketh goddes ſonde ſhe ſhe wolde man ſey ſoule ne fayre though ſhe ſhulde dey ſayd ſhe ſo maſed ſee ſhe foryate mynde trouthe conſtable hath ſo great pyte eke wyfe wepen routh ſo dyligent withouten ſlouthe ſerue pleſe eueryche place al louen loken face cōſtable dame hermegilde wyfe paynems cōtre euery hermegylde loued ryght lyfe cuſtaunce hath ſo long ſoiourned oriſons many bytter tere tyl ieſu hath conuerted grace dame hermegylde cōſtableſſe place al londe durſt chriſten route al chriſten folke ben fledde coūtre paynems conquered al plage north londe ſee wale fledde chriſtianyte olde breton dwellyng ile refuge meane whyle yet na ther neuer chriſtē bretō ſo exiled na ſome priuete honoured chriſte heathen folke begyled nye caſtel ſuche dwellen thre one hym blynde might ſe thylke eyen mynde whiche men ſeen ben blynde bright ſonne ſomers day whiche conſtable wyfe alſo cuſtaunce han taken ryght way towarde ſee furlong waye two playen roman fro walke thre blynde men met croked olde eyen faſte yſhette ye name chriſt cryed blind bretō dame hermegylde yeue ſyght agayne lady ware frayde ſoun leſte huſbonde ſhortly ſayne wold ieſus chriſtes lore haue ſlayne til cuſtāce made bolde bad werch wyl chriſt doughter cherch cōſtable wore abaſhed ſyght ſayd amounteth al thys fare cuſtance anſwerde ſyr chriſtes might helpeth folke fendes ſnare ſoferforth ſhe gan lawe declare ſhe conſtable er eue cōuerted hath chriſt made hym bileue cōſtable nothing lord place ſpeke ther cuſtaunce fonde kept ſtrongly many wynter ſpace vnder alla kyng northumberlonde ful wyſe worthy hys honde agayne scottes men may wel tourne wol agayne matere sathan euer v wayteth begyle sawe cuſtaunce al perfectioun caſt anon might quyte wyle made yong knight yt dwelt toun loue ſo hotte foule affectioun verily hym thought yt ſhulde ſpyll one might haue wyll woeth aueyled nought wolde ſynne wey diſpyte compaſſed thought maken ſhamfull dethe dey wayteth whan conſtable awey priuely nyght crepte hermegildes chambre whyle ſhe ſlept wery forwaked oriſons slepeth cuſtaunce hermegylde alſo knight sathans tēptacions al ſoftely bedde ygo cut throte hermegylde two layde ye blody knyfe dame cuſtaūce went waye ther god yeue myſchaunce sone cometh ye cōſtable home agayne eke alla kynge lande ſawe hys wyfe dyſpytouſly yſlayne whych wepte wronge hande bedde blody knyfe fonde dame cuſtāce ala myght ſhe ſay wo wytte al away kynge alla tolde al myſchaūce eke tyme wyſe ſhyppe foūden cuſtaūce ye han herde deuyſe kynges herte pyte gan aryſe ſawe ſo benygne creature fal dyſeaſe myſaduenture ye lābe towarde hys death brought ſtante innocent beforne kyng fals knight yt hath treſō wrought bereth hād yt ſhe hath thing natheleſſe great mornyng amonge people ſayd geſſe ſhe done ſo great wyckedneſſe han ſene euer ſo vertuouſe louyng hermegylde right lyfe bare witneſſe eueryche houſe saue hermegyld ſlow wt hys knyfe gētle kyng hath caught great motyfe wytnes thought wold enquere deper thys caſe trouth lere ala cuſtaunce thou haſt champion ne fyght canſt thou ſo welaway ſtarft redempcion bonde sathan yet lyth laye thy ſtronge champion thys daye yf chriſt myracle kyth without gylt thou ſhalt ſlayne aſwyth ſet doune knee thus ſhe ſayde immortal god ſauedeſt suſanne fro falſe blame thou mercyful mayde marye meane doughter ſaynt anne byforne whoſe chylde angel ſynge oſanne yf gyltleſſe thys felonye ſocoure el ſhal dye haue ye ſene ſomtyme pale face amonge prees hym hath ben lad toward deth wher get grace ſuch colour face hath mē might know face yt byſtad amonges al face route ſtandeth cuſtaunce loketh aboute quenes lyuynge proſperite ducheſſes ye ladyes euerychone haue ſome routh aduerſite emperours doughter ſtante alone hath wiȝt whō make hermone bloode royal ſtondeth drede farre ben thy frendes thy great nede thys alla kyng hath ſuch compaſſioun gentle herte ful pyte hys eyen ran water doun nowe haſtely fette boke quod yf thys knyght wol ſwere ſhe thys woman llowe yet wol v auyſe wol ſhal ben iuſtyſe breton boke wrytten wyth euangeles fette theron ſwore anone gylty meane whyles hande hym ſmote necke bone downe fyl atones ſtone hys eyen braſt hys face ſyght euery body place voyce herde generall audience ſayd thou haſt dyſclandred gyltles doughter holy chyrch hye preſence thus haſt thou done yet holde pee maruayle agaſt al prees dyſmayde folke ſtoden euerychone drede wreche ſaue cuſtaunce alone great ye drede eke repentaūce hem hadden wrought ſuſpection vpon thys ſely innocent cuſtaunce thys myracle concluſion cuſtaunces mediation kynge many another place conuerted thanked goddes grace falſe knight ſlayn vntroth iudgement alla haſtely yet cuſtaūce death gret roth ieſus hys mercy made alla wedden ful ſolempnely thys holy mayde ſo bryght ſhene thus hath chriſt made cuſtaūce quene woful yf ſhulde lye thys weddyng donogelde mo kynges mother full tyranny thought curſed hert braſt two wolde ſonne ſo thought deſpyte ſhulde take ſtraunge creature vnto hys make lyſt chaffe ne ſtree make ſo longe tale corne ſhulde tel royalte ye mariage whych courſe goth beſorne bloweth trompe horne frute euery tale ſaye eaten drynken daunce playe gon bedde ſkyl ryght though ye wyues ben ful holy thynges muſt take pacience anyght maner neceſſaries ben pleaſynges folke han wedded hem rynges lay lytel holyneſſe aſyde tyme may none betyde gatte man chylde anone byſhoppe hys conſtable eke toke hys wyfe kepe gone scotlandwarde hys fo men ſeke fayre cuſtāce yt ſo humble meke longe gone wyth chylde tyl ſtyl halte chābre abyding chriſtes wyl tyme come man chylde ſhe bare mauricius fontſtone hym calle conſtable doth forth come meſſanger wrote hys kynge yt cleped alle howe thys blyſful tydynge byfal tydynges nedeful ſay taketh letter forth goth way thys meſſanger done hys anauntage vnto kynges mother rydeth ſwythe ſalueth ful fayre hys langage madame quod ye maye glad blythe thanketh god hūdred thouſand ſythe lady quene hath chylde wythoutē doute ioye blyſſe thys reygne aboute lo letter ſealed thys thynge mote beare al haſt may yf ye wol ought vnto ſonne kynge ſeruaunt nyght day donegylde anſwerde thys tyme nay wol al nyght thou take thy reſte morowe wol ſay leſte meſſāger drōke ſadly ale wyne ſtolen hys letter priuely hys bore whyle ſlepte ſwyne counterfeted ful ſubtelly another letter wrought ful ſynfully vnto kynge dyrecte thys matere fro hys conſtable ye ſhal letter ſp • ke quene delyuered ſo horrible fendlyche creature caſtel none ſo hardy whyle durſt therin endure mother elſe auenture come charmes ſorcery euery wyght hateth company wo kyng whē yt letter ſeyn wyght tolde hys ſorowes ſore wyth hys owne honde wrote ageyn welcome ſonde chriſt euermore newe lerned hys lore lorde welcome thy luſt thy pleaſaunce iuſt put al thyne ordynaunce kepeth childe al foule fayre eke wyfe vnto myne home cōmyng chriſt lyſt may ſende heyre agreable thys lykynge thys letter ſealeth priuely wepynge whych meſſangere taken ſone forth goth ther ny done meſſanger fulfylled dronkenneſſe strōge thy breth thy lymmes faltrē aye thou bewrayeſt al ſecretneſſe thy mynde lorne thou ianglyſt iaye thy face turned newe araye dronkenneſſe reyneth route ny coūſayle hyd wythoutē doute donegild ne haue englyſh digne vnto thy malyce thy tyrannye therfore fende reſygne let hym endyte thy traytrye fye mannyſhe fye nay god lye fye fendyſhe ſpirit • dare wel tel though thou walke thy ſpirit hel meſſāger cometh fro ye kynge agayne kynges mother houſe lyght ſhe thys meſſanger ful fayne pleaſed hym al euer ſhe myght dronke wel hys gyrdel vnder pyght ſlepeth ſnorteth hys gyſe al nyght tyl ſonne gan aryſe efte hys letter ſtolen euerychon counterfeted letter thys wyſe kynge cōmaundeth hys conſtable anon vp payne hongyng hye iewyſe ne ſhulde ſuſtren wyſe cuſtaunce wythin hys realme abyde thre dayes quarter tyde ſame ſhyppe fonde yonge ſonne al gere ſhulde croude put fro londe charge ſhe neue • eft come cuſtaunce wel may thy goſte haue fere ſlepynge thy dreame ben penaūce donegylde caſt al thys ordynaunce meſſāger ye morow woke vnto caſtel halte nexte way conſtable letter toke thys pytous letter ſey ful ofte ſayd ala welaway lord chriſt ꝙ may world endure ful ſynne many creature myghty god yf thy wyl syn thou art ryghtful iuge may thou wylt ſuffer innocence ſpyl wycked folke raygne proſperite good cuſtaunce ala ſo wo mote thy tourmētour el dey ſhames death ther ny none wey wepen yonge olde place kynge thys curſed letter ſent cuſtaunce wyth deadly pale face fourth day towarde ſhyp ſhe went natheleſſe ſhe taketh good entent wyl chriſt knelyng ſtronde ſayd lorde aye welcome thy ſonde kepte fro falſe blame whyles lande amonge kepe fro harme eke fro ſhame ſalte ſee al though ſe howe ſtronge euer nowe hym truſte hys mother dere ſayle eke ſtere lytel chylde lay wepynge arme knelynge pytouſly hym ſhe ſayde peace lytel ſonne wol none harme wyth kercher heed ſhe brayde ouer hys lytel eyen ſhe layde arme ſhe lulleth ful faſte heuen eyen vp ſhe caſte mother quod ſhe mayde bright mary soth woman eggement mankinde lorne dampned aye dye whych thy chylde croſſe yrent thy blyſful eyen ſawe al hys turment compariſon bytwene thy wo wo man may ſuſtene thou ſe thy chylde yſlayne byfore thyn eyen yet lyueth lytel chylde parſaye nowe lady bryght al woful cryen thou glory womanheed thou fayre may thou hauen refute bryght ſterre day rewe chylde thy gentylneſſe reweſt euery ruful dyſtreſſe lytel chelde ala thy gylte neuer wroughteſt ſynne yet parde wol thyne hard father haue ſpylte mercy dere conſtable quod ſhe let lytel chylde dwel wyth yf thou darſt ſauen hym fro blame kyſſe hym one hys father name therwyth ſhe loketh backward ye lōde ſayd farewel huſbande routhleſſe vp ſhe ryſt walked downe ſtronde toward ſhyp foloweth al prees euer ſhe prayeth child holdē pee taketh leue holy entent bleſſeth ye ſhyppe ſhe went vitayled ſhippe drede habundantly ſor full long ſpace neceſſaries ſhulde nede inowe heried goddes grace wynde weder almighty god purchace bringe home better ſay ſee ſhe driueth forthe way alla kyng cometh home ſone vnto hys caſtel whyche tolde aſketh wyfe hys chylde conſtable gan aboute hys herte colde playnly al maner hym tolde ye han herde tel better ſheweth king ſeale letter ſayd lorde ye commaunded vp payne dethe ſo haue done certayne meſſanger turmented tyl muſt beknowen tel plat playne fro night night place lain thus wytte ſubtel enqueryng ymagened whō harm gā ſpring honde knowē yt letter wrote al venym curſed dede wyſe certaynly note effecte alla drede mother ſlow may men playnly rede ſhe traytoure alegaunce thus endeth old douegild miſchaūce ſorowe alla nyght day maketh hys childe hys wyfe alſo tonge tel may nowe wol cuſtaunce go fleteth ſee payne wo fyue yere lyked chriſtes ſonde ſhyppe aproched vnto londe vnder hethen caſtel laſte whiche name text fynde cuſtaunce eke chylde ſet vp caſte almighty god ſaueth al mankynde haue cuſtāce chyld ſome mynde fallen hethen honde efte ſone poynte ſpyl ſhal tel ſone downe fro caſtel cometh ther many wight gauren ſhyppe cuſtaunce ſhortly fro caſtel nyght lordes ſtewarde god yeue miſchaū ce thefe renyed • ceaunce came ſhyp alone ſayd ſholde lemman whether ſhe wolde nolde wo wretched woman tho bygō chylde cryed ſhe cryed pitouſly blyſful marye holpe anon ſtroglyng wel mightyly thefe ouer borde al ſodaynly ſee drenched vengaunce thus hath chriſt vnwēmed kept cuſtāce ſoule luſte luxure lo thyn ende nat onely thou faynteſt man mynde verily thou wolt body ſhende ende thy werke thy luſtes blynd cōplayning many one may mē fynd werke ſomtyme thētent ſynne ben eyther ſlayne ſhent may weke womā haue yt ſtrēgth defende agaynſt renegate golyas vnmeſurable length howe might dauid make ſo mate yonge armure ſo deſolate howe durſt loke thy dredful face wel may men 〈◊〉 goddes grace yaue iudith courage hardyneſſe ſleen hym holofernes hys tente delyuer wretchydneſſe people god ſay entent ryght god ſpyrite vygore ſente hem ſaued hem miſchaunce ſent might vigore cuſtaunce forth goth ſhip thorow ye narow mouth subalter ſepte fletyng aye somtyme weſte ſomtyme northe ſouth ſomtyme eſte ful many wery daye tyl chriſtes mother ybleſſed ſhe aye hath ſhapen endleſſe goodneſſe make ende al heuyneſſe ¶explicit ſecunda par et ſequitur par tertia let v ſtynte cuſtance throwe ſpeke romayne emperoure surrey hath letter knowe ſlaughter chriſten folke diſhonour done hys doughter falſe traytour meane curſed wycked soudonneſſe feeſt let ſleen bothe leſſe whiche emperour hath ſent anon hys ſenatour royal ordinaunce lordes god wote many one surreyns done hye vengeaunce brennē ſleen bringē hem miſchāce ful many day ſhortly ende homward rome ſhapē hem wēde ſenatour repayreth victorye rome warde ſaylyng ful royally met ſhyp dryuyng ſayth ſtory whiche cuſtaunce ſate ful pitouſly nothyng knewe ſhe ne ſuche array ne ſhe nolde ſey eſtate thoug ſhe ſhulde dey bryngeth rome wyfe yaue yonge ſonne alſo ſenatour ſhe ladde lyfe thus lady bryng wo woful cuſtaunce many another mo longe tyme dwelled ſhe place holy werkes euer grace ſenatours wyfe aunte al ſhe knewe neuer wol lenger tarye thys caas kyng alla ye whiche ſpake yore hys wyfe wepeth ſyketh ſore wol retourne let wyl cuſtaunce vnder ſenatours gouernaunce ¶kyng alla yt mother ſlayne vpon day fel ſuche repentaunce yf ſhortly tellen al ſhal playne rome cometh receyue hys penaūce putten church ordinaunce hye lowe ieſu chriſt beſought foryeue hys wycked werkes yt wrought fame anon rome town born howe alla kyng ſhal come pilgrymage herbegers wenten hym byforne whiche ſenatour vſage rode hym agayne many hys lynage wel ſhewen hys hye magnifycence done kyng reuerence ¶great chere dothe thys noble ſenatour kyng alla hym alſo eueryche hem dothe great honour ſo byfel day two ſenatour kyng alla go feeſt ſhortly yf ſhal lye cuſtaunces ſonne went hys companye som mē wold ſayne ye requeſt cuſtance ſenatour ladde thys childe feeſt may tellen euery circumſtaunce may leſte ſothe right hys mother heſte byforn alla duryng meate ſpace chylde ſtode lokyng kynges face alla kyng hath thys chyld great wonder ſenatour ſayd anon whoſe ye fayre chyld ſtondeth yonder quod god ſaynt iohn mother hath father hath non wote ſhortly ſtounde tolde alla howe childe founde god wote quod ſenatour alſo vertuous lyuer lyfe ne ſawe neuer ſhe ne herde mo wordly woman mayden ne wyfe dare wel ſay ſhe leuer knyfe breſt ben womā wycke mā couthe bryng yu pricke nowe chylde lyke cuſtaunce poſſyble creature alla hath face remembraunce dame cuſtaunce theron muſed yeue childes mother aught ſhe wyfe priuely ſyght ſpedde hym fro table myght parfay thought ye fantome myn heed ought deme ſkylful iugement ſalte ſee wyfe deed afterwarde made hys argument wot yf chriſt hath hyther ſent wyfe ſee wel ſente countrey fro then yt ſhe wente anone home wyth ſenatour goeth alla ſe thys wonder chaunce thys ſenatour doth alla great honour haſtely ſente cuſtaunce truſteth wel luſt daunce ſhe wyſt wherfore ſonde vnneth vpon fete myght ſhe ſtonde whē alla ſaw wife fayre gret wept rough ſe fyrſt loke ſet knewe wel verely ſhe ſorowe dombe ſtante tre herte ſhet dyſtreſſe ſhe remembreth hys vnkyndneſſe twyſe ſhe ſowned owne ſyght wepeth hym excuſeth pytouſly nowe god ꝙ hys hallowes bryght wylly ſoule haue mercy harme gyltleſſe maurice ſonne ſo lyke face el fende fetch thys place longe ye ſobbyng bytter payne woful herte myght ceſe great pyte hem complayne thrugh plaintes gan wo encreſe pray al laboure releſe may tel wo tyl morowe ſo wery ſpeake ſorowe fynally ye ſoth wyſte alla gyltleſſe wo trowe hundred tymes ben kyſte ſuch blyſſe bytwyxt hem two ſaue ioye laſteth euermo lyke creature hath ſeyen ſhal whyle ye world may dure tho prayed ſhe huſbande mekely releſynge pytous payne wolde praye father ſpecially hys maieſty wolde enclyne vouchſafe ſomdaye wyth hym dyne prayed hym eke ſhulde waye vnto father worde ſaye mē wold ſay yt chyld maurice doth thys meſſage vntyl thys emperour geſſe alla ſo nyſe hym ſo ſoueraygne honour chriſten folke flour sent chylde bette deme went hym ſelfe ſo may wel ſeme thys emperour graunted gentelly come dyner hym byſought al redy loked beſely vpon chyld doughter thought alla goeth hys ynne hym ought arrayde thys feeſt euery wyſe farforth hys connynge may ſuffyce morow came alla gan hym dreſſe eke wyfe emperour mete forth ryde ioye gladneſſe ſhe ſawe father ſtrete lyght downe falleth hym fete father ꝙ ſhe yonge chylde cuſtaunce nowe ful clene remembraūce doughter cuſtaunce ꝙ ſhe whylom ye han ſent surrye father ſalte ſee put alone dampned dye nowe good father mercy crye sende hethenneſſe thanken lorde hys kyndneſſe pytous ioye tellen al bytwyxt hem three ſyn bē thus ymette tale make ende ſhal day goth faſt wol longer lette thys glad folke dyner ben ſette ioye blyſſe meate let hem dwell thouſande folde welmore tel chyld mauris ſythin emperour made pope lyued chriſtenly chriſtes churche dyd great honour let al thys ſtory paſſen cuſtaunce tale ſpecially olde romayne ieſtes men may fynde maurys lyfe beare mynde kynge alla hys tyme ſey wyth thys cuſtaūce holy wyfe ſo ſwete englande ben come ryght wey lyue ioye quyete lytel whyle laſteth hete ioye worlde tyme wol abyde fro daye nyght chaungeth tyde lyued euer ſuch delyte daye ne meued eyther conſcience yre tallent ſome kyn affraye enuye pryde paſſion offence ne ſaye thys ende thys ſentence lytel whyle ioye pleaſaunce laſteth blyſſe alla wyth cuſtaunce deth yt taketh hye lowe rente paſſed yere euen geſſe thys worlde kynge alla hente cuſtaūce hath ful gret heuyneſſe nowe let v prayen god hys ſoule bleſſe dame cuſtaunce fynally ſay towarde ye towne rome goeth way rome come thys holy creature fyndeth father hole ſounde nowe ſhe ſkaped al auenture ſhe father hath yfounde downe knee goeth ſhe grounde wepynge tenderneſſe herte blythe heryeth god hūdred thouſand ſythe vertue holy almeſdede lyuen al neuer ſonder wende tyl death departen hem thys lyfe lede fareth nowe wel tale ende ieſu chriſt yt myght may ſende ioye wo gouerne v hys grace kepe v al ben thys place ¶thus endeth man lawes tale foloweth squyers prologue ovr hooſt hys ſtyroppes ſtode anone ſayd good men herkeneth euerychone thys thryfty tale none syr paryſh preeſt ꝙ goddes bone tel v tale thy forwarde yore ſe wel ye lerned men lore moche good goddes dignite parſon hym anſwerde benedicite cyleth man ſo ſynfully ſwere ¶our hoſt anſwerd ienkyn ye good mē ꝙ hoſt herkeneth ſmel loller wynde ꝙ abydeth goddes dygne paſſion ſhall haue predication thys loller wol prechen v ſomwhat ¶nay father ſoule ſhal nat sayd squyer ſhal preche ſhal goſpel gloſe ne teche leueth al great god quod wolde ſowen ſome dyffyculte ſprynge cockel clene corne therfore hooſt warne byforne lolly body ſhal tale tel ſhal ryngen ſo mery bel ſhal waken al thys companye ſhal ben philoſofye ne phiſyke ne termes queynte lawe lytel laten mawe ¶here endeth squyers prologue hereafter foloweth hys tale sarra lāde tartary dwelt kynge warred surry thrugh ther died many douȝty mā thys noble kynge called cambuſcā whych hys tyme ſo great renoun na regioun excellent lorde al thynge hym lacked naught longed kynge ſecte whych borne kept hys laye whych ſworne therto hardy wyſe ryche pytous iuſte alwaye ylyche trewe worde benygne honorable hys corage centre ſtable yonge freſhe ſtronge armes deſyrous bacheler al hys hous fayre perſon fortunate kept alwaye ſo royal aſtate na ſuch another man noble kyng tartre cābuſcā two ſonnes eltheta hys wyfe whych eldeſt hyght algarſyfe cleped camballo ¶a doughter thys worthy kynge alſo yongeſt hyght canace tel al beaute lyeth tonge ne connynge dare vndertake ſo hye thynge myne englyſhe eke vnſufficient muſte rethor excellent couth colour longyng ye arte yf ſhulde dyſtryue euery parte none ſuch muſte ſpeake ſo byfel thys cambuſcan hath twenty wynter borne hys dyademe wonte fro yere yere deme let feeſt hys natiuite done cryen throughout sarra hys cyte laſte ydus marche yere phebus ſonne full • oly clere nye hys exaltation martes face hys mantion aries collorike hote ſygne ful luſty wether benygne whych foules agaynſt ye ſonne ſhene ſeaſon yonge grene ful loude ſonge affection hem ſemed han getten hem protection ayen ſwerde wynter kene colde ¶thys cābuſcā haue tolde royal veſtementes ſyt hys deys wyth dyademe ful hye hys paleys helde hys feeſt ſo royal ſo ryche thys worlde na none lyche whych yf ſhall tel al array wolde occupye ſommers day eke nedeth deuyſe euery courſe ordre ſeruyce wol tel ſtraunge ſewes ne ſwannes ne heronſewes eke lande tellen knyghtes olde ther ſome meate ful dainty holde thys lande men retche ſmal man maye reporten wyl tarye pryme frute loſſe tyme vnto fyrſt purpoſe wol haue recourſe ¶and ſo byfel thyrde courſe whyſe thys kyng ſyt thus noblay herkenyng minſtralles thinges play beforne hym hys borde delicyouſly halfe dore al ſodeynly come knyght ſtede braſſe hys honde abrode myrrour glaſſe vpon hys thombe golde rynge hys ſyde naked ſwerde hongynge vp rydeth hye borde al hall ne ſpoke worde maruayle ye knyght hym beholde ful beſely wayten yonge olde ¶this ſtraūge knyght yt come thus ſodenly al armed ſaue hys heed ful royally salued kynge quene lordes al ordre ſytten hall wyth ſo hye reuerence obeyſaunce wel ſpeche countenaunce gawyn wyth hys olde curteſye thoughe come ayen fayre ne coude amende worde hye borde manly voyce ſayd meſſage forme vſed langage without vyce ſyllable letter tale ſhulde ſeme better accordant wordes chere teacheth arte ſpeche hem lere al ſowne ſtyle ne ne clymben ſo hye ſtyle yet ſaye thus comen entente thus much amoūteth al euer mente yf ſo haue mynde ¶he ſayd kynge araby ynde liege lorde thys ſolempne day salueth beſt may ſendeth honoure feeſt redy heeſt thys ſtode braſſe eaſely wel ſpace daye naturel ſay foure twenty houres ſo ye lyſt drought ſhoures beren body euery place whych herte wylleth pace without weme foule faire yf ye lyſt fleen eyre doth egle hym lyſt ſore ſame ſtede ſhal beare euermore withouten harme tyl ye ben leſte though ye ſlepen backe reſt turne agayn ye writhyng pyn wrought coude ful many gyn wayted ful many conſtellation done operatyon knew ful many ſeale many bonde myrrour eke yt haue myne honde hath ſuch myght men may ſe ſhal fallen aduerſite vnto reygne ſelfe alſo openly ſe frende foe ouer al thys yf lady bryght hath ſet herte myner wyght yf falſe ſhe ſhal treaſon ſe hys newe loue al hys ſubtylte openly ſhal nothynge hyde wherfore agayne luſty ſommer tyde thys myrrour thys rynge ye maye ſe hath ſente lady canace excellent doughter ¶the vertue thys rynge yf ye woll thys yf ſhe lyſt vpon thombe purſe bere foule fleeth vnder heuen ſhe ne ſhal vnderſtande hys ſteuen knowe hys meanynge openly playne anſwere hym hys langage agayne euery graſſe groweth vpon rote ſhal wel know wol bote al hys woūdes neuer ſo depe wyde ¶this naked ſwerde yt hangeth ſyde vertue hath yt man ſo ye ſmyte throughout armure wol karue byte thycke braunched oke mā woūded wyth yu ſtroke shal neuer hole tyl lyſt grace ſtroken ye platte thylke place hurte thys moche ſayne ye mote wyth platte ſwerde agayne stroken hym wounde wol cloſe thys ſoth wythouten gloſe fayleth whyles holde whē kniȝt hath thus tale tolde rydeth halle downe lyght hys ſtede whych ſhone ſonne bryght stante courte ſtyl ſtone knyght chambre ladde anone vnarmed meate yſette al harneys byforne hym ſette ſayne ſwerd eke ye myrrour al borne hye tour wyth certayne offycers ordeyned therfore ca • ace rynge bore solemnely ſhe ſat table ſekerly wythout fable horſe braſſe yt may remeued ſlante grounde yglewed maye man place dryue none engyne wyndlas polyue cauſe crafte therfore place hau lafte tyl yt kniȝt hath taught hem ye manere voyden hym ye ſhal ¶great ye prees ſwarmed fro gauren horſe ſtandeth ſo ſo hye ſo brode longe wel proporcioned ben ſtronge ryght ſtede lumbardye therwyth ſo horſly ſo quycke eye gentle courſer poyle certes fro hys tayle hys ere nature ne arte coude hym amende degre al people wende euermore moſte wonder howe couth gon bra fayrie people ſemed dyuers folke dyuerſly demed many heedes many wyttes ben murmure doth ſwarme made ſkylles fanteſyes reherſynge olde poetryes ſayden ylyke pegaſe horſe wynges flee el grekes horſe synon brought troye dyſtruccion men thys olde bokes rede myne herte ꝙ one euermore drede trowe ſome men armes ben therin ſhapen hem thys cytie wyn right good yt ſuch thynges know rowned felow low ſayd lyed rather ylyke apparence made ſome magyke iogglours playen theſe feaſtes grete ſondry thoughtes thus iāgle trete leude people demeth comenly thynges ben made ſubtelly leudneſſe comprehende demen gladly badder ende ſome wondren ye myrrour borne vp mayſter toure howe men myght ſuch thynges ſe anſwerd certes myght wel naturally compoſicyons angel ſlye reflection ſayden rome ſuche ſpeken alocen vitilion ariſtote wryteth lyues queynte myrrours proſpectiues knowen han bokes herde folke han wōdred ye ſworde wolde perce euery thynge fel ſpeche telophus kynge achylles hys queynte ſpere couth wyth heale dere right ſuch wyſe mē may wt ſwerde right ye haue ſeluē herd ſpeken ſondry hardyng metal ſpeken medycyns eke wythal ſhulde hardened whych vnknowe algate ¶tho ſpeake canaces rynge ſayden al ſuche wonder thynge crafte rynges herde neuer non saue moſes kynge salomon name connynge ſuch arte thus ſayen people drawē hem aparte natheleſſe ſome ſayden wonder maken • ſerue aſhen glas yet glas • yke aſhen ferne ſo han knowen ſo ferne therfore ſeſen iāglyng wōder ſore wondren ſome cauſe thōder ebbe fludde goſſomer myſte al thynge tyl cauſe wyſte thus ianglen demē deuyſe tyl kyng gan fro hys borde aryſe ¶phebus hath lefte angle merydional yet aſcendyng beeſt royal gentle lyon aldrian whan tartre kyng cambuſcan roſe borde ſate ful hye byforne hym gothe loude mynſtralcye tyl came hys chambre paramentes ſownen dyuers inſtrumētes lyke heuen nowe dauncen luſty venus chyldrē dere fyſhe lady ſate ful hye loketh hem frendly eye ¶this noble kyng ſette vpon hys trone ſtraunge knyght fet hym ful ſone daunce gothe canace reuel iolyce able dul man deuyſe muſt hau knowe loue ſeruyſe ben feeſtlyche man freſſhe may ſhulde deuyſe ſuche araye ¶who coulde tellen forme daūces vncouth ſo freſh countenaunces suche ſubtyll lokynges diſſimulinges drede ialouſe men apperceyuynges man lancelot deed therfore paſſe ouer al luſty heed ſay iolyneſſe lete hem tyl men ſupper dreſſe ¶the ſteward byddeth ſpyces hye eke wyne al melodye vſhers ſquyers ben ygone ſpyces wyne comen anone eten dronkē whā ende vnto temple reaſon wende ſeruyce done ſoupen al day nedeth reherſen array eche man wot wel kynges feeſt plenty moſte leeſt deyntes mo ben knowynge ſupper gothe noble kynge ſeen horſe braſſe al route lordes ladyes hym aboute wōdrig ther hors bra ſythen great ſiege troye men wondred horſe alſo ſuch wondring tho fynally kyng aſketh knyght vertue thys horſe myght prayde tellen gouernaūce horſe anon gan tryppe daunce whā yt knightlayde honde hys rayne ſayd ſyr ſayne whan lyſte ryden ye mote tryll pyn ſtante hys ere whiche ſhal tel bytwene v two ye mote nempne hym place alſo countre lyſt ryde whan ye come lyſte abyde bydde hym diſcende trylle nother pyn therin lyeth effecte al gyn wol downe diſcende wyl place wol abyde ſtyl though al ye world cōtrary ſworne ſhal then ythrowe ne yborne yf lyſt bydde hym then gon tryl thys pyn wol vanyſhe anon ſyght euery maner wyght come ayen day nyght whan lyſt clepen hem agayne ſuche gyſe ſhal ſayne bytwyxt ful ſone ryde whā lyſt ther ni done ¶enfourmed whā ye kyng ye knyght hath conceyued hys wytte aright maner forme al thys thyng ful glad ful blythe noble kyng repayreth hys reuel byforne brydel toure yborne kept amonge iewels leſe dere horſe vanyſſhed manere ſyght ye get thus lete luſte iolyte cambyſcan hys lordes feſtyng tyl wel nye day began ſpryng ¶explicit prima par • et ſe quitur par ſecunda nortee digeſtyon ſlepe gan hem wynke bad hem take kepe myrth drinke labour wol haue reſte galping mouthe hem al keſte ſayd tyme lye adoun blode hys domynacyoun cheryſſeth blode nature frende ꝙ thankē galpyng two thre euery wight gan drawe reſte ſlepe hem bade toke beſte dremes ſhul ben olde ful heedes fumoſyte cauſeth dremes whyche ther charge ſlepen tyl pryme large moſte parte canace ful meſurable woman father ſhe take leue gon reſt ſone alter eue lyſt appalled morowe vnfeſtlyche ſe ſlept fyrſt ſlepe awoke ſuche ioy ſhe herte toke queynt rynge myrrour twenty tymes ſhe chaunged colour ſlepe ryght impreſſyon myrrour ſhe viſyon wherfore ſonne vp gan glyde cleped maiſtreſſes beſyde ſayd luſte aryſe ¶theſe olde woman ben gladly wyſe mayſtreſſe anſwerde anon ſayd madame whither wol ye gon thus erly • folke ben al reſte ¶i wol quod ſhe aryſe leſte lenger ſlepe walken aboute mayſtreſſe cleped wome great route vp ryſe wel ten twelue vp ryſeth freſſhe canace ſelue ioly bright yonge ſonne ram four degree vp ronne hygher whan ſhe redy ſorthe ſhe walketh eaſye paas arrayed luſty ſeaſon ſote lightly playen walken fete nought fyue ſixe meyne trenche fer parke gethe ſhe ¶the vapour whiche yt fro erth glode maketh ſonne ſeme ruddy brode natheleſſe ſo fayre ſyght made al hertes lyght ceaſon morownyng ſoules ſhe herde ſynge right anon ſhe wyſte ment right ſonge knewe al entent ¶the knotte euery tale tolde taryed tyl luſte colde hem han herkened yore ſauour paſſeth euer lenger fulſomneſſe prolixite ſame reaſon thynketh ſhulde vnto ſame knot condiſcende make walkyng ſone ende ¶amydde ti • drye whyt chalke canace playeng walke ſate fauron ouer heed ful hye pytous voyce gan crye al wodde reſowned cry beaten ſelfe ſo pytouſly bothe wynges tyl reed blode ran endelonge tre ſhe ſtode euer one ſhe cryed ſhright becke ſeluen ſo ſhe pyght na tygre ne cruel beſte dwelleth wodde eyther foreſte nolde hā wept yf wepe coude ſorowe ſhe ſhright alway ſo loude na neuer yet man lyue couthe faucon wel diſcryue herde ſuche another fayreneſſe wel plumage gentylneſſe ſhappe al might trekened faucon peregryn ſemed ſhe ſcrude londe euermore ſhe ſtoode ſwouned lacke blood tyl welny ſhe fal fro tree ¶this fayre kynges doughter canace fynger bare queynte rynge thrugh ſhe vnderſtod wel euery thīg foule may hys leden ſayne coude anſwere hym leden agayne hath vnderſtande faucon ſeyde welny routhe almoſt ſhe deyde tre ſhe gothe ful haſtely faucon loketh ful pytouſly helde lappe abrod wel ſhe wyſte faucon muſte fallen twyſte whā yt ſhe ſwouned next lacke bloode longe whyle wayten ſhe ſtoode tyl laſte ſhe ſpake manere vnto hauke ye ſhalen ¶what cauſe yf tell ye ben furyal payne hell quod canace vnto hauke aboue thys ſorowe dethe loſſe loue trowe theſe ben cauſes two cauſen moſt gentyll hert wo harme nedeth ſpeke ye vpon ſelfe wreke whiche proueth wel eyther ire drede mote ben encheſon cruell dede syu ſe none wyght chace loue god ſo doth ſelfe grace may helpe weſt eſt ne ſawe neuer er byrde ne beeſt farde hym ſelue ſo pytouſly ye ſlee ſorowe veryly haue ſo great compaſſioun goddes loue come fro tre adowne kynges doughter trewe veryly cauſes knewe diſeaſe yf lay myght wolde amende certes nyght wyſely helpe great god kynde herbes ſhal right ynowe fynde hele hurtes haſtely tho ſhright faucon yet ſpitouſly euer ſhe dyd fell grounde anone lyeth ſwoune deed ſtone tyl canace hath lappe itake vnto tyme ſhe gan ſwoune awake ſhe ſwoune gan abreyde ryght haukes leden thus ſhe ſayde pite renneth ſoone gentyl herte felyng ſemilitude paynes ſmerte proued al day men may ſe wel werke authorite gentle hert kepeth gentilneſſe ſe wel ye haue diſtreſſe campaſſyon fayre canace womanly benignyte nature principle hath ſette none hope fare bette obey vnto hert free make beware whelpe chaſtiſed lyon right cauſe concluſyon whyle haue leyſer ſpace myne harm wol confeſſen pace euer one ſorowe tolde wepte ſhe water wolde tyl faucon badde ſtyl ſike thus ſhe ſayd tyl ¶there bredde ala ilke day foſtred roche marble gray tenderly nothyng eyleth ne wiſt aduerſyte tyl coude flye ful hye vnder ſkye dwelte terſelet faſt ſemed wel al gentylneſſe al ful trayſon falſneſſe ſo wrapped vnder humble chere vnder hewe trouth ſuche manere vnder pleaſaunce vnder buſy payne wight coud haue wede coud fain depe greyne dyed colour right ſerpent hideth vnder flour tyl may ſe hys tyme byte right ſo god loues ipocrite dothe ſo hys ſerymones obeyſaunce diſſimulynge fayre aſſemblaunce ſowneth vnto gentilneſſe loue tombe al fayre aboue vnder cors ſuche ye wote suche ipocrite colde hote wyſe ſerued entent ſaue fende non wiſt ment tyl ſo long weped complayned many yere hys ſeruyce yfayned tyl myn hert pitous nyce al innocent hys cruel malyce ferde hys dethe thought vpon hys othes hys ſuretee graunted hym loue vpon condition euermore myn honour renoun ſaued bothe preuy apert ſay hys deſert yaue hym al myn hert thought god wote wyſe nought toke hert chaunge myn aye ſothe ſayd gone ſythen many day trewe wight thefe thynketh one whan ſawe thyng ſo fer ygone graunted hym fully loue ſuche gyſe haue ſayd aboue yeuen hym trewe hert fre ſwore yafe hert anon tygre ful doubleneſſe fyll hys knee ſo deuout humbleſſe hye reuerence eke chere lyke gentyl louer manere rauyſhed ſemed ioye neuer troylus ne paris troy iaſon certes ne non man syn lamet alderfyrſt began louen two writen folke beforne ne neuer ſythen adam borne ne couthe man twenty thouſande parte counterfete ſophymes hys arte ne worthy vnbocle hys galoche ther doubleneſſe faynyng ſhulde aproche ne ſo couth thanke wight dyd maner heuen ſe tyl woman ſhe neuer ſo wyſe paynteth hys chere poynt deuyſe wel hys wordes hys countenaunce ſo loued hym hys obeyſaunce trouthe demed hert yf ſo thyng hym ſmert al neuer ſo lyte wyſt thought fetel dethe herte twyſt ſhortly ſo ferforth thyng went wyl wylles inſtrument ſay wil obeyed wyl al thyng ferre reaſon fyl kepyng boundes worſhyp euer ne neuer thyng ſo lefe ne ſo leuer hym god wote ne neuer ſhal mo laſt lenger yere two ſuppoſed hym nothyng good fynally thus laſt ſtode fortune wolde moſt twyn place whiche wo queſtyon make diſcriptyon thyng dare tel boldely knowe payne dethe therby suche harm felte ne might beleue ¶so day toke hys leue ſorowfully eke wende verely felte moche harm whā herde ſpeke ſaw hewe natheles thought ſo trewe eke repaire ſhulde agayne withyn lytel whyle ſothe ſayne reaſon wolde eke muſt go hys honour ofte happeth ſo made vertue neceſſite toke wel ſythe muſt nedes beſt might hidde fro hym ſorow toke ye hond ſeit iohn borow ſayd thus lo al beth ſuche haue ben ſhal anſwerde nedeth reherce ſayn bet wers whan al wel yſaid hath done therfore behoueth hym longe ſpone ſhal eten fende thus herd ſay laſt mote forth hys way forthe ſle • th til come leſt whan come hym purpoſe reſt trowe thylke text mynde al thyng repayring hys kynde gladeth ſelue thus ſayn men geſſe men louen kynde newfangleneſſe briddes men cage fede though yu nyght day take hem hede ſtrawe cage fayre ſofte ſylke gyue hem ſugre hony breed mylke yet right anon hys dore vppe fete wold ſporne adown cup wood wolde wormes eate newfangled ben meate louen nouelries proper kynde gentylneſſe blode may hem bynde ferde thys tercelet ala day tho gentel borne freſhe gaye goodly ſe humble free ſawe vpon tyme kyte flee ſodaynly loued kyte ſo al hys loue clene fro goo hath hys trouthe falſed wyſe thus hathe kyte loue ſeruyce lorne without remedy ye worde faucon gan crye ſwouned ofte canaces barme great ye ſorowe haukes harme canace woman made nyſt might faucon glade canace home bereth lappe ſoftely playſters gan wrappe ſhe wt becke hurt ſelue nowe canace herbes delue grounde make ſalues newe herbes precious fyne hewe helen hauke fro day nyght dothe beſyneſſe might beddes heed ſhe made mewe couered veluettes blewe ſygne trouthe woman ſene al withouten ye mewe peynted grene peynted al theſe falſe foules ben theſe tydefes tercelettes owles ryght diſpyte peynted hem beſyde pyes hem crye chyde thys leue canace hauke kepynge wol nomore nowe ſpeke rynge tyl come efte purpos ſayn faucon gate loue agayn repentant ſtory telleth v mediatyon camballus kynges ſonne whiche tolde henſforthe wol proces holde ſpeken auentures batayls yet neuer herd ſo gret marue • l fyrſt wol tel cambuſcan hys tyme many cyte wan howe wan theodora hys wyfe wol ſpeke algarſyfe ful ofte great peryl ne ben holpen horſe bra wol ſpeke camballo fought liſtes brethern two canace er myght wyn left wol agayn begyn ¶explicit ſecunda par apollo whirleth vp chare ſo hye tyl god mercurius houſe ſlye ¶there founde foreſayd tale whiche hath ben ſought dyuers place ¶here foloweth wordes marchaunt squyer wordes hoſt marchaunt fayth squyer thou haſt wel iquyt gentelly prayſe wel thy wyt quod marchaunt conſydryng thyne youth felyngly thou ſpekeſt alouth dome non eloquence ſhalbe thy pere yf thou lyue god gyue ryght good chaunce vertue ſende perſeueraunce thy ſpekyng haue great deynte haue ſonne trinite leuer thā twenty poūdeſworth londe though nowe fallen honde man ſuche diſcreſſyon ye ben fye poſſeſſyon yf man vertuous haue ſonne ſhybbed yet ſhal vertue lyſteth nat entende play dyſe ſpende leſe al hath vſage leuer talke page cōmen gentyl wight myght lerne gentelneſſe aryght strawe gentylneſſe ꝙ hoſt marchaunt pardy wel thou woſt eche mote tellen leſt tale two breken beheſt know wel ꝙ marchāt certain pray haue nat diſdayn though thys mā ſpeke worde two ¶tel thy tale withouten wordes mo gladly ſyr hoſt ꝙ wol obey vnto wyl nowe herkeneth ſay wol nat contray wyſe farre wittes may ſuffyſe pray god may pleſen wotte wel good ynow ¶thus ende wordes hoſt marchant foloweth marchauntes prologue wepyng waylyng care ſorowe haue ynowe euyn eke morowe quod marchaunt ſo haue mo wedded trowe ſo wel wote fareth ſo haue wyfe worſt may though fende coupled wold ouermatch dare wel ſwere ſhulde reherce ſpecial hygh malyce ſhe ſhrewe longe large difference betwyxt griſyldes great pacience wyfe paſſyng cruelte vnbounde alſo mote wolde neuer efte come ſnare wedded men lyue ſorowe care aſſay ſo wol ſhal fynde ſay ſothe ſaynt thomas inde parte ſay nat al god ſhelde ſhulde ſo befal ah good ſyr hoſt haue wedded theſe monethes two nat parde yet trowe hys lyfe hath wedded thoug men hym ryfe hert ne couthe manere tel ſo moche ſorowe nowe coude tell wyues curſedneſſe ꝙ hoſt marchant ſo god yt bleſſe syn ye ſo moche knowe arte ful hertely pray tell v parte gladly quod myn owne ſore ſory hert tel may ¶here endeth marchauntes prologue foloweth hys tale whylō dwellyng lombardy worthy knyght borne pauy whiche lyued great proſperyte ſyxty yeare wyfeles man folowed aye hys bodely delyte woman appetyte theſe foles ben ſeculeres whan paſt ſixty yeres holyneſſe dotage ſayn ſuche great corage knyght ben wedded man day nyght dothe al eſpy wedded myght prayeng oure lorde graunten hym myghten one knowen blyſful lyfe bitwixt huſbande hys wyfe lyuen vnder holy bonde god fyrſt man womā bonde non lyfe ſayd worthe bean wedlocke ſo eaſy ſo clean worlde paradiſe thus ſaith olde knyght ſo wyſe certaynly ſothe god kyng take wyfe glorious thyng n • mely whan man olde hore wyfe frute hys treſore ſhulde take yonge wyfe faire might engendren heire lede lyfe ioye ſolace theſe bachelers ſyngen ala whan fynden aduerſyte loue whiche ny chyldes vanyte trewly ſytte wel ſo bachelers han ofte payne wo brotel grounde bylden brotelneſſe finde freelte whā wenē ſecreneſſe lyue bryddes beeſtes lyberte vnder nyce areſtes wedded man hys eſtate lyueth lyfe bliſfully ordinate vnder yoke mariage ybounde wel may hert ioye bliſſe habounde ſo buxome wyfe ſo trewe eke ſo tentife kepe hym ſicke hole hys make wel ne wo ſhe nyl hym nat forſake ny nat wery hym loue ſerue though lye bedreed tyl ſterue yet ſome clerkes ſayn nat ſo whiche theophraſt one tho force though theophraſt lyſt lye ne take wyfe ꝙ hyſbondrye ſpare houſholde thy diſpence trewe ſeruaunt doth dilygence thy good kepe thyn owne wyfe ſhe wol clayme halfe parte al lyfe yf thou ſycke ſo god ſaue thy frendes trewe knaue wol kepe better thē ſhe wayteth aye thy good hath done many daye yf thou take wyfe vntrewe ful ofte tyme ſhal ſore rewe thys ſentence hundred ſithes worſe wryteth thys mā god hys bone curſe take kepe ſuche vanyte defyeth theophraſt herkeneth ¶a wyfe goddes yefte verely al maner yeftes hardely landes rente paſture cōmune mouables al ben yeftes fortune paſſen ſhadowe wal drede yf playnly ſpeake ſhal wyfe wol laſt thyne houſe endure wel lenger lyſt parauenture mariage ful great ſacrament whych hath wyfe holde ſhent lyueth helples al deſolate ſpeake folke ſecular eſtate herkneth ſay nouȝt woman mannes helpe ywrought hye god wen adam maked ſawe hym alone belly naked god hys great goodneſſe ſayd let v make helpe thys man lyke hymſelfe made eue may ye ſe hereby may ye preue wyfe mannes helpe comforte hys paradyſe terreſtre hys dyſporte buxome ſo vertuous ſhe muſt nedes lyue vnyte one fleſhe ben two ſoules geſſe one herte wele dyſtreſſe wyfe ah ſaynt mary benedicite howe myght man haue aduerſite hath wyfe certes ſey blyſſe betwyxte hem twey may tonge tellen hert thynke yf poore ſhe helpeth hym ſwynke kepeth hys good waſteth neuer dei al huſbande luſt lyketh wel ſayeth one naye ſayth ye thys ſayeth al redy ſyr ſayth ſhe ¶o blyſful order wedlocke precious thou arte ſo mery eke ſo vertuous ſo cōmended ſo approued eke euery mā halte hym worth leke vpon hys bare knee ought hys lyfe thanken god hym hath ſent wyfe praye god hym ſende wyfe laſt vnto hys lyues ende hys lyfe ſette ſekerneſſe may dyſceyued geſſe werche hys wyues rede may boldely bear • n vp hys hede ben ſo trewe alſo wyſe whych yf thou wolt werchen ye wyſe alway ſo woman wol rede lo iacob theſe clerkes rede good counſayle hys mother rebecke bounde kydde ſkynne hys necke whych hys father beniſon wan lo iudyth ſtory tel wyſe counſayle goddes people kept ſlewe hym holofernes whyle ſlept lo abigail counſayle howe ſhe saued huſbande nabal shulde haue ſlayne loke heſter alſo good counſayle delyuered wo people god made mardochere aſſuere enhaunſed ¶there ny nothynge gree ſuperlatyfe ſayeth senec aboue humble voyfe suffre thy wynes tonge caton byt ſhal cōmaūde thou ſhalt ſuſtre yet ſhe wol obey curteſye wyfe keper thyne huſbondrye wel may ſycke man wayle wepe ny wyfe ye houſe kepe warne yf wyſely thou wylt werche loue wel thy wift chriſt loueth cherch yf thou loue thy ſelfe thou loueſt thy wyfe man hateth hys fleſhe hys lyfe foſtreth therfore byd cheryſhe thy wyfe thou ſhalt neuer ithe huſbande wyfe ſo men iape playe worldly folke holde ſeker waye ſo knit ther may none harme betide namely vpon wyues ſyde ianuary tolde conſydred hath hys dayes olde luſty lyfe vertuous quiete mariage hony ſwete hys frendes daye ſent tellen hem theffecte hys entent ¶wyth face ſadde tale hath hem tolde ſayd frendes hoore olde almoſt god wot pyttes brynke vpon ſoule ſomwhat muſt thynke haue body folyſhly dyſpended bleſſed god ſhal ben amended wol ben certayne wedded man anone al haſt vnto ſome mayde fayre tender age pray ſhapeth mariage ſodeynly wol abyde wol fonden eſpye ſyde may wedded haſtely moche ye ben ye ſhullen rather ſuche thynge eſpyen luſte beſt alyen one thing war • e frēdes dere wol none olde wyfe haue manere ſhal paſſe fyftene yere certayne olde fyſhe yonge fleſhe wol haue fayne better ꝙ pyke pykerel better olde befe tender veel wol woman thyrty wynter age ny anſtrawe great forage eke theſe olde wedowes god wote connen ſo moche crafte wade bote moche broken harme hem lyſt wyth hem ſhulde neuer lyue reſt ſondrye ſcholes maketh ſubtel clerkes woman many ſcholes halfe clerke certaynly yonge thynge may men gye ryght mē may warme war wt hādes ply wherfore ſaye plainly clauſe nyl none olde wyfe haue thys cauſe yf ſo myſchaunce couth haue pleaſaunce ſhulde lede lyfe auoutry ſo ſtreyght deuel dye ne chyldren ſhulde none vpon geten yet leuer houndes eten myne heritage ſhulde fal ſtraunge handes thus tel al dote wote cauſe men ſhulde wedden forthermore wot ſpeaketh many man mariage wot nomore thē doth page whych cauſe men ſhulde take wyfe yf may lyuen chaſt hys lyfe take hym wyfe wyth great deuotion bycauſe leful procreation chyldren honoure god aboue paramour loue ſhulden lechery eſchewe yelde dettes dewe eche man ſhulde helpen myſchefe ſuſter ſhulde brother lyue chaſtite ful heuenly ¶but ſyrs leaue god thanked dare make auaunt fele lymmes hole ſufficiaunt done al man belongeth wote ſelfe beſt may though hore fare doth tre bloſſometh er frute ywoxe bloſſomed tre neyther drye ne deed fele hore heed myne herte lymmes bene grene laurel yere ſene ſythen ye haue herd al myn entent pray wyll ye wol aſſent dyuers men dyuerſly hym tolde mariage many enſamples olde blameth ſome prayſeth certayne laſt ſhortly ta ſayn al daye falleth altereacion betwyxt frendes dyſputation fel ſtryfe betwyxt hys brother two whych one cleped placebo iuſtynus ſothly called ¶placebo ſayd ianuary brother ful lytel nede han ye lorde ſo dere counſayle axe ye ben ſo ful ſapience ne lyketh hye prudence vayne fro worde salomon thys worde ſayth vnto euerychone worke al thynge counſayle thus ſayd ſhalt thou repent tho salomon ſpeake ſuch worde myne owne dere brother lorde wyſely god ſoule bryng eaſe reſt holde owne counſayle beſt brother myne take thys motyfe haue ben court man al lyfe god wote though vnworthy haue ſtanden ful great degre abouen lordes ful great eſtate yet neuer wyth none hem debate neuer hem contraryed truely wote wel lorde ſayeth holde ferme ſtable ſay ſame el thynge ſemblable ful great foole counſaylour ſerueth lorde hye honour dare preſume one thynke coūſaile ſhuld paſſe lordes wy • nay lordes fooles fay ye haue ſelfe ſpoken day hye ſentence ſo holy ſo wel conſent conferme euery del wordes al opinyon god ny man al thys town ne itayle coude bette haue ſayd chriſt holdeth hym thys ful wel payde trewly hye corage man ſtopen age taken yong wyfe father kyn hert hongeth ioly pyn doth matere right leſt finally holde beſt ¶iuſtynus aye ſatte herde right thys wyſe placebo anſwerde nowe brother myne pacyēt pray sith ye haue ſaid herkeneth ſay ¶senec among wordes wyſe saith man ought hym wel auyſe yeueth hys londe catel ſythens ought auyſe right wel gyue good away fro wel moche ought auyſed gyue body alway warne wel childes play take wyfe wichout auyſement men muſt enquere myne aſſent whether ſhe ſobre wiſe dronkelwe proude wayes ſhrewe chider waſter thy good riche poore el man wood al ſo man fynde ſhal non worlde trotteth hole ne man ne beeſt ſuche men deuyſe natheles ought ynough ſuffyſe wyfe yf ſo ſhe mo good thewes vice badde al thys aſketh layſer enquere god wotte haue wept many tere ful preuely ſythe wyfe praiſe ſo wol wedded mannes lyfe certeyn fynde coſt care obſeruaunces blyſſes bare yet god wote neyghbours namely woman many rout sayn haue moſt ſtedfaſt wyfe eke mekeſt one beareth lyfe wot beſt wryngeth ſho ye may right lyſt auyſe ye ben man age howe ye entren mariage namely yonge wife fayre made water erthe ayre yongeſt man al rout beſy ynowe bringe haue wyfe alone truſteth ye ſhal nat pleaſen yeres thre ſayn pleſaunce wyfe aſketh ful moche obſeruaunce praye ye nat yuel apayde wel ꝙ ianuary haſt thou al ſayd strawe thy sence thy prouerbes count nat worth pannyer ful herbes ſchole termes wiſer men thou thou haſt herde aſſenteth right nowe purpoſe placebo ſay ye ſay curſed man ꝙ letteth matrymony ſekerly worde riſen ſodaynly ben aſſented fully ſhulde wedded whan liſt wolde hyghe fantaſy curiouſneſſe fro day day gan ſoule empreſſe ianuary hys mariage many fayre ſhappe many fayre viſage paſſeth throug hert night night al ſo toke myrrour polyſſhed bright ſette comen market place ſhulde ſe many figure pace myrrour ſame wyſe gan ianuary within thought deuyſe maydens whiche dwellen beſyde wyſt nat myght abyde yf one beautie face another ſtout ſo people grace ſadneſſe benignyte people gretteſt voyce ſhe ſome riche badde name natheles bitwixt erneſt game laſt apoynted hym one lete al hert gone cheſe awne authorite loue blynde al day may nat ſe whan yt bedde ybrought purtreyde hys hert hys thought freſhe beaute age tender middle ſmal armes long ſlender wiſe gouernaunce gentylneſſe womanly bearyng ſadneſſe whā condiſcended thoght choiſe myght nat bē amēded whan ſelfe concluded thought eche mannes wyt ſo bad impoſſyble reply ayenſt choice hys fanta • ¶his frendes ſent inſtaunce prayeth hem hym pleſaunce haſtely wolde hym come wolde abrydgen labour al ſome nedeth nomore hym go ne ryde appoynted wolde abyde ¶placebo came eke hys frendes ſone alder fyrſt bad hem al bone none hem none argumentes make ayenſt hys purpoſe hath ytake purpoſe pleaſaūt god ſaid grounde hys proſperite ſaid mayden towne whych beauty hath great renowne al ſo ſhe ſmal degre suffyſeth hym youth beaute whych mayde ſaid wold haue wyfe leden eaſe holyneſſe hys lyfe thanked god yt myght hauen al wyght hys blyſſe parten ſhal prayeth hem labour thys nede ſhapeth fayle ſpede ſayd hys ſprete eaſe ꝙ nothynge maye dyſpleaſe saue thynge prycketh conſcience whych wol reherce preſence ¶i haue ꝙ herde ſayd ful yore ago may mā haue parfyte blyſſes two thys ſay earth eke heuen though kept fro ſynnes ſeuen eke euery braunche thylke tre yet ſo parfyte proſperite ſo great eaſe luſt mariage euer agaſt nowe myne age ſhal lede nowe ſo mery lyfe delycate wythout wo ſtryfe ſhal haue myne heuen earth ſythen heuen bought ſo dere wyth tribulation great penaunce ſhulde lyuyng ſuch pleaſaūce al wedded men done wyth wyues come ye bliſſe ther chriſt eterne lyue thys drede ye brother twey aſſoyleth thys queſtion prey ¶iuſtinus whych hated hys foly anſwered anon ryght hys iapery wolde hys longe tale abrege wolde none authorite allege ſayd ſyr ſo none obſtacle thys god hys hye myracle hys mercy may ſo wyrche er ye han ryghtes holy chyrche ye may repent wedded mannes lyfe whych ye ſayen neyther wo ne ſtryfe el god forbede yf ſent wedded man grace hym repent wel ofter rather ſyngle man therfore ſyr beſt rede dyſpayreth haue memory parauenture ſhe may purgatory may goddes meane goddes whip ſhal ſoule vp heuen ſkip swyfter thē doth arowe bowe hope god ye ſhal knowe ther ny none ſo great felicite mariage ne neuer none ſhal ſhal let ſaluation ye vſe ſkyl reaſon luſtes wyfe attemperatly ye pleaſe amorouſly ye kepe eke fro ſyn tale done wytte thyn beth agaſt herof dere brother let v wade fro thys matter another wyfe bath yf ye vnderſtande mariage whych ye haue hande declareth ful wel lytel ſpace fareth wel god haue hys grace wt worde iuſtyne brother han take leaue eche hem ſawe muſt nedes wrought ſo wyſe ſlye treate ſhe thys mayde whych may hyght haſtely euer ſhe myght shal wedded thys ianuary trowe longe tary yf tolde euery eſcrite bonde whych ſhe feſted hys londe herken ryche arraye fynally ycomen daye chyrch ben went receyue holy ſacrament forth cometh ye preſt wt ſtole neck badde lyke sara rebecke wyſedome trouth mariage ſayd hys oriſons vſage crouched hem bad god ſhuld hem bles made al ſeker ynowe wyth holyneſſe thus ben wedded wyth ſolempnite feeſt ſytteth ſhe wyth worthy folke vpon deys al ful ioye blyſſe paleyes ful inſtrumentes vytayle mooſt deyntes al itaile beforne ſtode inſtrumētes ſuch ſown orpheus ne thebe amphion ne made neuer ſuch melody ¶at euery cours came loude mynſtralcy neuer ioab tromped neyther theodomas yet halfe ſo clere thebe cytie doute bacchus wyne hem ſkynketh al aboute venus laugheth euery wyght ianuary become knyght wolde aſſayen hys corage lybertie eke mariage wyth fyre bronde hōde daunceth bryde al rout certaynly dare wel ſayen ryght emenius god weddynge saw neuer life ſo mery wedded mā holde thou thy peace thou poet marcian wryteſt v ylke weddynge mery philology hym mercury ſonges muſes ſonge ſmal thy penne eke thy tonge dyſcriuen thys mariage whē tēder youth hath iwedded ſtouping age ſuch myrth yt may written aſſayeth ſelfe may ye wytten yf lacke none thys matere may ſytte wyth ſo benigne chere beholde ſemed fayrey quene heſter loked neuer wyth ſuch eye aſſuere ſo meke loke hath ſhe may deuyſe al beaute thus moche beaute tel may ſhe like ye bryght morow may fullylde al beaute pleaſaunce ianuary rauyſhed traunce euery tyme loke face hys herte gan manace yt night ī armes wold ſtrein harder euer parys dyd heleyn natheles yet great pyte ylke nyght offende muſte thought ala tender creature wolde god ye myght wel endure al corage ſo ſharpe kene agaſt ye ſhal ſuſtene god forbede dyd al myght wolde god waxe nyght nyght wolde laſt euer mo wolde al theſe people ago fynally doth hys labour beſt myght ſauynge hys honour haſt hem fro meat ſubtel wyſe tyme came reaſon ryſe men dauncen drynke faſt ſpices houſe caſt ful ioye blyſſe euery man al ſquyer hyght damian whych carfe knyght many day ſo rauyſhed hys lady may payne ny wode almoſt ſwelte ſouned ſtode ſore hath venus hurt hym wt brand freſhe ſhe therto ſo lycande hys bedde went hym haſtely hym thys tyme ſpeke let hym wepe ynowe playne tyl ye freſhe may wol rewen hys payne perilous fyre yt bedſtraw bredeth famyler foe hys ſeruyce bedeth ſeruaunt traytour falſe homely hewe lyke adder ſlye boſome vntrewe ianuary dronken pleſaunce god ſhylde v al iniquitaunce mariage ſe howe thys damian thyne owne ſquyer thy borne man entendeth done villany god graunt thyne homely foe eſpye thys worlde ny wers peſtilence homely foe al daye thy preſence parfourmed hath ſon arke dyurne lenger may body hym ſoiourne oriſont latitude nyght wt hys mantel darke rude gan ſprede hemyſpery whych departed luſty rout fro ianuary wyth thanke euery ſyde home houſes luſtely ryde done thynges leſt ſawe tyme go reſt sone thys luſty ianuary wol go bedde wolde lenger tary drynketh ypocras clarrey vernag • ſpyces hote encreaſe hys corage many lectuary full fyne curſed monke dan cōſtantyne hath wrytten hys boke coitu eaten hem al nolde nothyng eſchewe thus hys preuy frendes ſayd goddes loue ſone may let voyde al houſe curteys wiſe ſone ¶men drinkē trauers drewe anone haſted ianuary muſt done bryd brought bed ſtyl ſton whē bed ye preeſt ybleſſed ye chābre hath euery wight hē dreſſed ianuary hath faſt armes take hys freſhe may hys paradyſe hys make lulleth kyſſeth ful ofte wyth thycke bryſtels hys berde vnſofte lyke ye ſkyn hoūdfyſh ſharp brere ſhaue al newe hys manere rubbeth vpon tendre face ſayd thus ala mote treſpace ſpouſe greatly offende tyme come wol downe dyſcende natheles conſydreth thys ꝙ ny workman ſo euer may wyrche wel haſtely thys wol done leyſer parfytly force howe longe play trewe wedlocke coupled tway bleſſed yoke bene actes mowe ſyn man may ſynne wyth hys wyfe ne hurte hym ſelfe wyth hys owne knyfe haue leaue play v lawe thus laboureth tyl day gan dawe taketh ſoppe fyne clarre vpryght hys bedde ſytteth ſyngeth full loude clere kyſt hys wyfe maketh wantō chere al coltyſhe ful ragery ful gergon flecked pye ſlacke ſkynne aboute hys necke ſhaketh whyle ſonge ſo chaūteth craketh god wot may thought ī herte ſhe hym ſawe vpſyttyng hys ſherte hys nyght cappe hys necke lene prayſeth playeng worth bene ſayd thus reſt wol take daye come may lenger wake downe layd heed ſlept til prime afterward ſaw hys tyme vp ryſeth ianuary freſhe may holdeth chambre fourth day vſage wyues beſt euery labour ſomtyme mote haue reſt el longe may endure thys ſay lyues creature fyſhe beeſt brydde man wol ſpeake woful damian langureth loue ye ſhal therfore ſpeke hym thys manere ¶i ſay ſely damian ala anſwere thys demaunde thys caas howe thou thy lady freſhe may tel thy wo ſhe wol alwaye ſaye nay eke yf thou ſpeke ſhe wol thy wo bewray god thyn helpe better ſay thys ſycke damian venus fyre brenneth dyeth deſyre whych put hys lyfe auenture lenger myght thys wyſe endure priuely penner gan borowe lettre wrote al hys ſorowe maner complaynt lay vnto thys fayre freſhe lady may purſe ſylke hōgyng hys ſhert hath put layde hys hert ¶the mone noone tyde ylke day ianuary hath ywedded freſhe may taure cancre gleden longe hath may chambre bydden cuſtome vnto theſe noble al bryde ſhal eaten hal tyl dayes foure thre leeſt paſſed bene let gon feeſt ¶the fourth day cōplete fro noon noone hye maſſe ydone hal ſat thys ianuary may freſhe thys bryght ſomers day ſo befyl thys good man remembreth hym vpon thys damian ſayd ſaynt mary may thys damian entendeth aye ſycke may thys betyde hys ſquyers ſtodē hym beſyde excuſed hym bycauſe hys ſyckneſſe whych letted hym done hys beſyneſſe none cauſe myght make hym tary forthynketh ꝙ ianuary gentle ſquyer trouthe dyed harme routhe wyſe dyſcrete ſecre man wote hys degre therto manly ſeruyſable thryfty man ryght able meate ſone euer may wol ſelfe vyſete hym eke may done hym al comforte worde hym bleſſed euery man hys bounte hys gentylneſſe wolde ſo comforten hys dyſtreſſe hys ſquyer gentle dede dame ꝙ thys ianuary take good hede meate ye wemen al ye haue ben chābre hal al ye gone ſe thys damian doth hym dyſporte gentyl man telleth hym wol hym viſite haue nothyng reſted lyte ſpede faſt wol abyde tyl ye ſlepe faſt ſyde worde gan hym cal ſquyer marſhal hys hal tolde certayn thynge wolde freſh may hath ſtreight way ihold al woman vnto damyan downe hys beddes ſyde ſat ſhe confortyng hym goodly ſhe may damyan whā tyme ſay ſecrete wyſe hys purſe eke hys byl whiche written al hys wyl hath put honde withouten saue ſyghed wonder depe ſore ſothly ryght thus ſayd merry ye diſcouer nat deed yf thyng kydde purſe hath ſhe boſome hydde went way ye gete vnto ianuary icome ſhe hys beddes ſyde ſhe ſytte ful ſofte taketh kyſſeth ful ofte layde hym downe ſlepe anon fayned ſhe muſt gon ye wote yt euery wight hath nede whan ſhe byl hath taken hede rent al cloutes laſt preuy ſothly ſhe caſt ſtudieth nowe faire freſſhe may adown ianuary ſhe lay ſlepte tyl cough hath hym awaked anon prayde ſtripe al naked wolde ſaid haue ſome pleaſaūce ſaid clothes dyd hym encombraunce ſhe obeyeth ſhe leſe lothe leſt precious folke wt wrothe howe wrought dare nat tel whether ſhe thought paradiſe hel lette hem worche wyſe tyl euynſong ryng muſt aryſe deſteny auenture influence nature conſtellation ſuche eſtate heuen ſtode tyme fortunate put byl venus warkes al thyng hath tyme ſayn clerkes woman gete loue nat ſay great god aboue knoweth non acte cauſeles demeth al wol holde pee ſothe howe yt freſhe may hath take ſuche impreſſyon day pyte thys ſicke damyan fro hert ſhe dryue ne remembraunce downe hym eaſe certayn thought ſhe thys thyng diſpleaſe recke hym aſſure loue hym beſt creature though hys ſhert lo pyte renneth ſoone gentyl hert may ye ſe howe excelent franchiſe woman whan hem narow auyſe tyrant ben many one hath hert harde ſtone wolde haue lete ſterue ye place wel rather thā haue graunted hym grace reioyſed cruel pride nat haue retched homycide thys gentyl may fulfylled al pyte right ſo honde lettre made ſhe whiche ſhe graunteth grace lacketh nought tyme place ſhe might hys luſt ſuffyſe ſhal right wol deuyſe whan ſhe ſawe tyme vpon day viſite damyā goth thys faire may ſubtelly lettre ſhe thryſt vnder hys pyllowe rede yf hym lyſt taketh ye hond herd twiſt ſecretely wight wyſt badde hym ben al hole forth ſhe went ianuary whan ſent vp ryſeth damyan next morowe al paſſed hys ſickeneſſe hys ſorowe kembeth hym proy • eth hym piketh dothe hys lady luſt lyketh eke ianuary gothe lowe euer dyd dogge bowe ſo pleſaunt euery man crafte al euery wight fayn ſpekē gode fully hys ladyes grace ſtode thus lette damyan nede tale forthe wol procede ¶some clerkes holden felycite stont delyte therfore certayn thys noble ianuary al hys might honeſt wyſe longeth knyght shope hym lyue ful delyciouſly hys houſyng hys array honeſtly hys degre made kynges among hys honeſt thynges garden walled al ſtone faire garden neuer none dout verily ſuppoſe wrote romant roſe ne couth beaute wel deuyſe ne priapus ne myght nat ſuffyſe though god garden tell beaute garden wel ſtont vnder laurer alway grene ful ofte tyme kyng pluto hys quene proſerpina al fayrie diſporten hem maken melodye wel daunced men tolde noble knight ianuary olde suche deynte hath walke play wol ſuffre wight bere kay saue hym ſelfe ſmal wicket bare alway ſyluer clycket whan hym lyſt vnſhet whan wolde pay hys wyfe det ſomer ſeaſon thider wolde go may wife wight two thinges whiche yt nat bedde garden parfourmed hem ſpedde thys wyſe many mery day lyued ianuary thys freſhe may worldly ioye may nat alway endure ianuary ne lyueng creature ¶o ſodayne hap thou fortune vnſtable lyke scorpion diſceyuable ſlatreſt wt thy heed whā yu wolt ſtynge thy tayle deth thrugh thyn enuenomyng brotel ioye ſwete poyſon queynt monſter ſo ſodaynly canſt peynt thy gyftes vnder hewe ſtedfaſtneſſe thou diſcryueſt bothe leſſe haſt thou ianuary thus deſceyued haddeſt hym thy frende receyued thou haſt beraft hym eyen ſorowe whiche deſyreth dyen ala noble ianuary ſo fre amydde luſt proſperite woren blynde al ſodaynly dethe therfore forwarde ſhe began wepe haue ꝙ ſhe ſoule kepe wel ye alſo myn honour wyfehode thilke tender flour whiche haue enſured honde whan preeſt body bonde wherfore wol anſwere manere leaue lorde ſo dere pray god neuer dawe day ne ſterue foule woman may yf euer kynne ſhame el empayre ſo name falſe yf lacke ſtripe putte ſacke next ryuer drenche gentyl woman wenche ſpeke ye thus men ben euer vntrew woman haue reprofe aye newe ye non cōmunyng leue ſpeke v vntruſt repreue ye word ſhe ſawe damiā sate buſhe knele began fynger ſygnes made ſhe damyan ſhulde clymbe vp tre charged frute vp went verily knewe right anon thus ſayd hys quene wyfe ꝙ may nat ſay nay experience ſo proueth euery day treaſon woman doth mā tenne hundred thouſande tel notable vntrouth brotelneſſe salomon richeſt al richeſſe pardoner anon nowe dame ꝙ god ſaynt iohn ye ben noble prechour thys caas wedde wyfe ala ſhulde bye fleſhe ſo dere yet leuer wedde wyfe yere abyde ꝙ ſhe tale begon nay thou ſhalt drynke another ton er aſſayled euery ſyde thou ſayſt ſome folke deſyrē v rycheſſe ſhape ſome fairneſſe ſome ſhe eyther ſynge daunce ſome gentylneſſe daliaunce handes armes ſmale thus goeth al deuel thy tale thou ſayſt mē may kepe caſtel wall may ſo longe aſſayled ouer yf ſhe foule thou ſayeſt ſhe coueteth euery man ſhe may ſe ſpaneyl ſhe wol hem lepe tyll yt ſhe fynde ſome man yt wold chepe ne none ſo gray geſe goth lake ſayſt thou wol ben wythout make ſayſt harde thynge welde wyght man wol thanke helde thus ſayſt thou lorel yu goſt bed wyſeman nedeth wedde ne man entendeth vnto heuen wyth wylde thunder dent fyre leuen mote thy wycked necke broke thou ſayſt droppyng houſes eke ſmoke chydyng wyues maken men flee owne houſe ah benedicite ayleth ſuch olde man chyde thou ſayſt wyues wol vyces hyde tyl faſt wol hem ſhewe wel may thys prouerbe ſhrewe thou ſayſt yt ox horſe aſſes houndes ben aſſayde dyuers ſtoundes baſyns lauers er men hem bye spones ſtoles al ſuche huſbondrye ſo pottes clothes arrayes folke wyues maken none aſſayes tyl ben wedded olde dottarde ſhrewe ſayſt wol thē vyces ſhewe thou ſayeſt alſo dyſpleaſeth yf thou wylt prayſe beaute thou pore alwaye face clepe fayre dame euery place thou make feeſt yſke day borne make freſhe gay thou done norice honour chamberer wythin bour father folke hys alyes thus ſayeſt thou olde barel ful lye yet prentyſe ienkyn hys cryſpe heer ſhynyng golde fyne ſquyreth vp haſt thou caught falſe ſuſpectioun wol hym tho yu deed morowe tel hideſt thou wt ſorowe keyes thy cheſt away fro good wel thyne parde weneſt yu make ydiot dame nowe ye lorde yt called ye world hāde thys prouerbe thou ſhalt vnderſtande haue thou ynowe dare ye recke care howe merely folke fare certes olde dottarde leue ye ſhal haue queynte ynowe eue great nygarde wol werne man lyght
