ſaye theſe wordes apoſtels name habyte made chaſtite ſhame ye woman ſhulde appareyle ꝙ treſſed heir gaye perre perle ne wyth golde ne clothes ryche texte ne thy rubryche nyl worche moche gnatte ¶thou ſayeſt alſo lyke catte ſo wolde ſenge cattes ſkynne wolde catte dwellen hys ynne yf cattes ſkyn ſlicke gaye nyl dwel houſe halfe daye forth ſhe wol daye dawed ſhewe ſkyn gon carrewaued ¶thus thou ſayeſt yf gay ſyr ſhrewe wol ren borel ſhewe syr olde foole helpeth ſpyen though thou play argus wt hys c eyen wardcors beſt fayth ſhal kepe leſt yet couth make hys berde ſo mote ¶thou ſayeſt eke yt ben thynges thre whyche troublen al thys erth wyght may endure ferth lefe ſyr ſhrewe ieſu ſhorte thy lyfe yet precheſt thou ſayeſt hateful wyfe rekened one theſe myſchaunces ben none reſemblaunces ye maye lyken parable yf ſely wyfe one tho thou lykeneſt eke woman loue hell barayn londe water may nat dwel thou lykeneſt alſo wylde fyre brenneth hath deſyre conſume thyng brent wolde thou ſaieſt right wormes ſhendē tre right ſo wyfe diſtroyeth huſbonde knowen ben wyues bonde ¶lordīges right thus ye haue vnderſtōd bare ſtiffely myn olde huſbande honde thus ſayden dronkneſſe al falſe toke witneſſe ienkyn nece alſo lorde payne dyd hem wo ful gyltles goddes ſwete pyne horſe couth byte whyne couth playn though gylte el often tyme ben ſpylte ſo fyrſt myl cometh fyrſt grynt playned fyrſt ſo warre iſlynt ful glad excuſen hem blyue thyng gylt neuer lyue wench wol bere hem honde whan yt ſicke vnnethes might ſtond yet tickled hert wende ſo great cheerte ſwore al walkyng nyght eſpy wench dight vnder colour moche myrthe al ſuche witte gyuen v oure birthe diſceite wepyng ſpynnyng god hath gyue woman kyndly lyue thus thyng may auaunt thende beſt eche degre ſleyght force ſome maner thyng contynual murmure grutchyng namely bedde miſchaunce wolde chide bē pleſaunce wolde lenger bedde abyde yf felte hys arme ouer ſyde tyl made raunſom vnto wolde ſuffre hym hys nycete therfore euery man thys tale tel wyue ſo may al ben ſel empty hondes men may haukeslure wynnyng wolde al luſt endure make fayned appetite yet bacon neuer delyte maked euer yt wolde hem chide though pope ſytten hem beſyde wolde nat ſpare hem borde trouth quit hem word word helpe god omnypotent tho right nowe ſhulde make teſtamēt ne owe hem worde quytte brought ſo wytte muſt gyue vp beſt el neuer ben reſt though loked wode lyon yet ſhulde fayle hys concluſyon wolde ſay good lete take kepe howe mekely loketh wylken ſhepe come nere ſpouſe let kyſſe cheke ye ſhulde al pacient meke haue aſwete ſpiced conſcience sithe ye ſo preche iobs pacyence suffreth alway ſyth ye ſo wel preche yf ſhal teche fayre haue wyfe pee one v two mote obeyen doutles ſithe man reſonable woman ye muſt ben ſufferable ayleth grutche thus grone ye wolde haue queynt alone take al lo haue euery del peter ſhrewe ye loue wel wolde ſel belechoſe couth walke freſhe roſe wol kepe owne toth ye blame god ſay ſoth suche maner wordes honde wol ſpeke fourth huſbonde ¶my fourth huſbonde reuelour ſay paramont yong ful ragery stubburne ſtronge ioly pye wel coude daunce harpe finale ſyng ywis nyghtingale whā dronkē draught ſwete wine metellus ſoule churle ſwyne ſtaffe byrafte hys wyfe lyfe ſhe droke wine though wife ne ſhulde nat haue daunted fro drinke wyne venus muſt thynke alſo ſeker colde engendreth hayle lycorus mouth muſt haue lecherous taile woman vynolent defence knowe lechours experience lorde chriſt whan remembreth vpon youth iolyte tickleth myne hert rote vnto day dothe myne hert bote haue worlde tyme age ala al wol enuenyme hath birafte beaute pith let go farewel deuel go therwyth floure gone ny tel bran beſt nowe mote ſel yet ryght mery wol fonde forth tel fourth huſbonde ¶i ſaye hert great dyſpyte delyte quyte god ſaynt ioce made hym ſame wode troce body foule manere certaynly made folke ſuch chere hys owne grece made hym fry anger ielouſy god erth hys purgatory whych hope hys ſoule glory god wote ſatte ful ofte ſonge hys ſhoe ful bytterly wronge none ſaue god wyſt many wyſe howe ſore twyſt dyed came fro hieruſalem lyeth graue vnder rode beem al ny hys tombe ſo curious ſepulture hym darius whych appelles wrought ſo ſubtelly waſt bury hym preciouſly let farwel god giue ſoule good reſt nowe hys graue hys cheſt ¶nowe fyfth huſbande wol tel god let neuer hys ſoule come hel yet moſt ſhrewe fele rybbes al rewe euer ſhal vnto myne endynge day bedde ſo freſhe gay therwythal couth ſo wel gloſe wolde haue bele choſe though bete euery bone couth wynne ayen loue anone trowe loued hym better hys loue ſo daungerous woman haue yf ſhal lye thys matere queynt fantaſy wayte thyng may lightly haue therafter wol alday crye craue forbyd v thynge deſyren preſe faſt wol flee wyth daunger vttren al chaffare great prees market maketh dere ware great chepe holde lytel pryce thys knoweth euery woman wyſe ¶my fyfth huſbande god hys ſoule bleſſe whych toke loue rycheſſe ſomtyme clerke oxenforde lefte ſchole wēt home borde wyth goſſyp dwellynge town god haue ſoule name alyſoun knewe hert eke priuety better paryſhe preeſt ſo mote bewrayed counſayle al huſbande pyſt agaynſt wal done thynge yt ſhulde haue coſt lyfe another worthy wyfe nece whych loued wel wolde haue tolde hys counſayle euery dell ſo dyd ful often god wote made hys face ful ofte reed hote ſhame blamed hym ofte tolde ſo great preuyte ¶and ſo befyl one lent ofte tyme goſſyp went euer yet loued go gaye walke march apryll maye fro houſe houſe herken ſondry tale ienkē clerke goſſep dame ale ſelfe feldes went huſbonde london al lent better layſer pleye ſe eke ſey luſty folke wyſt grace ſhapen ben place therfore made viſytations vigilles proceſſions preachyng eke pilgrymages playes myracles mariages weared gay ſkarlet gytes wormes theſe moghtes ne theſe mite vpon parel frette hem neuer del woſt thou vſed wel nowe wol tel forth happed ſaye feldes walked tyl truely ſuche daliaunce thys clerke purueyaunce ſpeake hym ſayd yf wedowe ſhulde wedde certaynly ſay bobaunce yet neuer wythout purueyaunce mariage ne thynges eke holde mouſſes wytte worth leke hath one hole ſterten yf fayle al ydo bare hym hāde enchaūted dame taught forſoth ſubtylte eke ſayd mette hym al nyght wolde ſlayne laye vpryght al bedde ful blood yet hope truely ſhulde good blode betokeneth gold taught al fals dremed right nauȝt folowed aye dame lore wel thynges ſyr let ſe ſhal ſayne aha god haue tale agayne yt fourth huſbande bere wept algate made ſory chere wyues moten vſage wyth kerchefe couered vyſage pu • ueyed make wept ſmal vndertake church huſbād borne morow wyth neyghbours hym made ſorow ianken clerke one tho helpe god ſawe go bere thought payre legges fete ſo clene ſo fayre al herte yaue vnto hys holde trowe twenty wynter olde fourty yf ſhal ſaye ſothe yet alway coltes tothe gaptothed bycame wele printe dame venus ſeele helpe god luſty one fayre ryche yonge wel bygone truely myn huſbande tolde beſt queynte myght certes al fully venetian felynge herte marcian venus yaue luſt lycorouſneſſe mar yaue ſturdy hardyneſſe myn aſcendent taure mar therin ala ala euer loue ſyn folowed aye myne inclination vertue conſtellation made couth wythdrawe chambre venus good felawe yet haue martes marke vpon face alſo another preuy place god ſo wyſly ſaluation loued neuer dyſcretion euer folowed myne appetyte al ſhorte longe blacke whyte toke kepe ſo lyked howe poore ne eke degre ſhuld ſay▪ ye monethes ende thys ioly clerke ianken ſo hende hath wedded wyth great ſolempnite hym ya • e al lande fee euer yeuen byfore afterwarde repented ful ſore nolde ſuffre nothynge lyſte god ſmote one wyth hys fyſt rente hys boke lefe ſtroke eres wext defe stubborne lyoneſſe tonge tanglereſſe walke wolde done byforne fro houſe houſe although ſworn ful oft tyme wolde preche olde romayne ieſtes teche sulpicius gallus left hys wyfe forſoke terme hys lyfe open heed ſey lokynge hys dore dey romayne tolde name hys wyfe ſommer game wythout hys wetynge forſoke eke wolde vpon hys byble ſeke ylke prouerbe eccleſiaſte cumaundeth forbyddeth faſt mā ſhal ſuffre wife go royle thē wolde ſay ryght thus donte ¶who ſo buyldeth hys houſe al falowes pricketh blynd horſe ouer ye falowes ſuffreth wyfe ſeche hallowes worthy hanged gallowes al nought ſet hawe hys prouerbes ne hys olde ſawe ne wolde hym corrected hate hym vyces telleth ſo mo god wotte thys made hym wood wyth al vtterly nolde nat forbere caas wol ſay ſoth ſaint thomas rent hys boke le • e whych ſmote defe boke gladly nyght daye hys dyſporte wolde rede alway cleped valery theophraſt whych boke lough alway ful faſt eke ther clerke ſomtime rome cardinal hyght ſaynt ierome made boke ayenſt iouinian whych boke eke tertulian criſyppus trotula helowys abbeſſe farre fro parys eke parable salomon ouydes arte bokes many one al theſe bounden one volume euery nyght day hys cuſtome leyſer vacatioun worldly occupatioun reden boke wycked wyues knewe hem mo legendes lyues ben good woman byble truſteth wel impoſſyble clerke wolde ſpeke good wyues yf ben holy ſayntes lyues ne non woman neuer mo peynted lyon tel god yf woman writen ſtories clerkes han within oratory wold haue writtē men wickedneſſe al marke adam may redreſſe chyldren mercury venus ben workyng ful contrarious mercury loueth wyſedom ſcience venus loueth riot diſpence dyuers diſpoſition eche falleth others exaltation thus god wotte mercury deſolate piſces venus exaltate venus falleth wher mercury reyſed therfore woman clerke preyſed clerke whan old may nought venus werkes nat worth olde ſhoe ſytte doun write dotage woman nat kepe mariage nowe purpoſe tolde beten boke parde vpon nyght enken ſyre redde vpon boke ſate fyre eue fyrſt wickedneſſe al mankynde brought wretchedneſſe yt ieſu chriſt hym ſelfe ſlayn bought v hert blode agayn lo expreſſe woman may ye fynde woman loſſe al mankynde tho rad ſāpſon loſt heeres slepyng lemā cut hem ſheres thorowe treſon loſt eyen tho rad yf ſhal nat lyen hercules deianyre cauſed ſette ſelfe fyre nothyng forgate care wo socrates wyues two howe xantippe caſt pyſſe heed ſely man ſatte ſtyl deed wyped heed durſt ſayn er thonder ſtynt cometh rayn paſiphae quene crete ſhreudneſſe thought tale ſwete fye ſpeke griſely thynge horrible luſt lykyng clytenneſtra lechery falſely made huſbande dye rad wel good deuoſion tolde eke occaſyon amphiaraus thebe loſt lyfe huſbonde legende hys lyfe eriphilem ouche golde hath preuely vnto grekes tolde huſbonde hyd place thebe ſory grace lyma tolde lucy made huſbondes dye one loue hate lyma huſbonde euyn late enpoyſoned ſhe foe lucia lykerous loued huſbonde ſo ſhulde alway vpon thynke gaue hym ſuche loue maner drynke deed er morowe thus algates huſbondes han ſorowe tolde howe one latumeus complayned felowe arius garden growed ſuche tree whych ſayd hys wyues thre honged hem ſelfe hertes diſpitous lefe brother ꝙ arius yeue plant thys blyſful tree garden planted ſhal later date wyues hath redde ſome han ſlayn huſbondes bedde let lechour dight hem al nyght while cors lay ſlore vpright ſome dryue nayles brayne while ſlepe thus haue hē ſlayn haue yeue hem poyſon drynke ſpake harme hert may thynke therwithal knewe mo prouerbes world groweth graſſe herbes bette ꝙ thyne habitation lyon foule dragon woman vſyng chyde bette ꝙ hygh rofe abyde angry wife hous ben ſo wicked ſo contrarious haten huſbondes louen aye ſaid woman caſt ſhame away whan ſhe caſt ſmocke farther mo fayre woman ſhe chaſt alſo lyke golde ryng ſowes noſe coude wene coude ſuppoſe wo myne hert pyne whan ſawe wolde neuer fyne reden curſed boke al nyght al ſodaynly thre leues haue plyght hys boke right radde eke fyſt ſo toke hym cheke fyre fell backwarde doun vp ſtert dothe wode lyoun fyſt ſmote myne heed flore laye deed whan ſey howe ſtyl lay gaſt wold haue fledde awaye tyl laſt ſwoun brayde oh haſt thou ſlayn falſe thefe ſayde loude thus haſt thou murdred er deed yet wol one kyſſe nere cam kneled faire doun ſaid dere ſuſter ſwete alyſoun helpe god ſhal neuer ſmyte haue thy ſelfe wyte foryeue beſeke yet efte ſones hytte hym cheke ſayd thefe thus moche wreke nowe wol dye may lenger ſpeke laſt mokel care wo fel accorded within ſeluen two yaf al brydel myne honde haue gouernaunce houſe londe hys tonge hys honde alſo made hym bren boke anon tho whan goten vnto maiſtry al ſoueraynte ſayd myne trewe wyſe dothe thou lyſte terme al thy lyfe kepe thyne honour eke myne eſtate alter day neuer debate god helpe ſo hym kynde wyfe fro denmarke vnto inde alſo trewe ſo praye god ſytte maieſte blyſſe hys ſoule mercy dere nowe wol ſay tale yf ye wol ¶the frere lough whan herd al nowe dame ꝙ ſo haue ioye blyſſe long preamble tale whan sompner herd yt frere gale lo ꝙ ſompner goddes armes two frere wol entermete hym euermo lo good men flye eke frere wol fal euery diſhe eke matere ſpekeſt thou preambulation amble trot eyther peace ſyt doū thou letteſt diſporte matere ¶yea wolt thou ſo ſyr sōpner ꝙ ye frere nowe faye ſhal er go tel sompner ſuche tale two al folke ſhul laugh place nowe el frere beſhrewe thy face quod ſompner ſhrewe yf tel tale two thre freres er come sittyngburne ſhal make thyne hert murne wel wotte thy pacience goon ¶our hooſt cried peace anoon ſayd lette woman tel tale ye faren folke dronken ben ale dame tel forthe tale beſte al redy ſyr ꝙ ſhe ryght leſte haue lycence thys worthy frere yes dame tel forthe tale wol ¶here endeth wyfe bathe prologue begynneth tale olde dayes kynge • toure breton ſpeken great honour al thys londe fulfylled fairy elfe quene ioly company daunſed ful ofte many grene mede olde opinyon rede ſpeke many hundred yere go nowe man ſe none elfes mo nowe great charyte prayer lymytours holy freres ſerchen euery lande euery ſtreme thicke mote ſonne beme bliſſyng halle chambres kichens boures cyties borowes caſtelles hye toures thropes berne ſhepens deyties maketh ben fayries wonte walke elfe walketh lymitour hym ſelfe vndermeles mornynges ſaythe hys matyns hys holy thynges gothe hys lymitacioun woman may go ſafely vp doun euery buſhe vnder euery tre ny none incubus ne wyl done hem diſhonour ¶and ſo fel kyng arrour houſe luſty bacheler day come rydyng fro ryuer happed alone borne ſawe mayde walkyng hym byforne whiche mayde anon maugre hede force berafte maydenhede whiche oppreſſion ſuche clamour ſuche purſute vnto kyng artour dampned knyght deed courſe lawe ſhuld haue loſt heed peraduenture ſuche ſtatute tho quene ladyes mo longe prayden kyng grace tyl lyfe graunted place yaue hym quene al wyl cheſe yt ſhe wolde hym ſaue ſpil quene thāketh ye king wt al might thus ſpake ſhe knyght whan ſhe ſey tyme day ¶thou ſtandeſt yet ꝙ ſhe ſuche aray thy lyfe yet haſte thou ſuerte graunte yt thy lyfe thou cauſt tel thyng woman moſte deſyren beware kepe thy necke bone yren yf thou canſte tel anon yet wol yeue leue gon twelue moneth day ſeke lere anſwere ſuffycient matere ſuertie wol haue er thou paſſe thy body yelde place ¶wo knight ſoroufully ſyketh may done al lyketh laſte cheſe hym wende come ayen ryght yeres ende ſuch anſwer god wold hym puruay taketh leue wēdeth forth way ſeketh euery houſe euery place hopeth fynde grace lerne thyng woman louen mooſt ne couthe aryuen cooſt myght fynde matere two creature accordyng yfere ſayd woman loued beſt rycheſſe ſayd honour ſome ſayd iolyneſſe ſayd riche aray ſome ſaid luſt bedde ofte tyme ben wydowe wedde ſayd herte moſte eſed whan ben flatered ypleſed gothe ful nye ſothe wol lye man ſhal wynne v beſte flaterye attendaunce buſyneſſe ben ilymed bothe leſſe ſome men ſayn yt louen beſte ben fre right v leſte man repreue v vyce ſay wyſe nothyng nyce trewly ny none v al wight wol clawe v gall nyl kyke ſayth v ſothe aſſay ſhal fynde ſo dothe neuer ſo victous within wol holden wyſe clene ſyn ſome men ſayn yt great delite haue ben holde ſtable eke ſecre purpoſe ſtedfaſtly dwel nat bewray thyng men v tel tale nat worthe rake ſtele parde woman con nothyng hele witneſſe midas wol ye tale ¶ouyde among thynges ſmale said midas vnder long heeres growyng heed two aſſes eeres whiche vice hidde beſte myght ful ſubtelly euery mannes ſyght ſaue wyfe wiſt mo loued moſt truſted alſo prayde creature nolde tellen diſfygure ſwore nat al ye world wyn nolde villany ne ſyn makē huſbonde haue ſo foule name nolde nat tel ſhame natheles thought ſhe dyde ſhe ſo long ſhulde counſayle hyde thought ſwole ſo ſore hert nedely ſome worde ſhe moſt ſtert ſyth ſhe durſt tellen man marri faſt ſhe ran tyl ſhe came hert fyre byttour bumbeth myre layd mouth vnto water adown bewray nat thou water thy ſown quod ſhe tel mo huſbonde hath long aſſes eres two nowe myne hert al hole nowe myght lenger kepe dout ¶here mowe ye ſe though tyme abyde yet mote counſayle hyde remenaunt tale yf ye wyl redeth ouyde ye may lere ¶this knight tale ſpecially whan ſawe might come therby ſay woman louen moſte within herte ſorowful hys goſte home gothe myght nat ſoiourne day come muſte home returne way happed hym ryde al hys care vnder foreſte ſyde ſawe vpon daunce go ladyes foure twenty yet mo toward daūce drowe yt yerne hope ſome wyſedome ſhuld lerne certaynly er came fully vanyſhed daūce niſte creature ſawe bare lyfe saue ye grene ſaw ſytting old wife fouler wyght may man deuyſe agayne knyght olde wyfe gan aryſe ſayd ſyr knight forth lyeth way tel ye ſeken fay parauenture may better olde folke conne moche thyng ꝙ ſhe ¶my lyfe mother ꝙ thys knyght certayne nam deed yf ſayne thyng yt womē moſte deſyre coude ye wilſe wolde quite wel hyre plight thy trouth hōde ꝙ ſhe next thyng require thou ſhalte yf thy myght wol tel nyght haue trouth ꝙ ye knight graunt ¶than quod ſhe may wel auaunt thy lyfe ſafe wol ſtonde therby vpon lyfe quene wyl ſay let ſe whiche proudeſt hem al weareth kerchefe cal dare ſay nay ſhal teche let v go forthe without lenger ſpeche tho rowned ſhe piſtel ere bade hym glad haue fere ¶whā ben comē ye court thys knyght sayd holde day hight redy hys anſwere ſayde ful many noble wyfe many mayde many wydowe wyſe quene ſelfe ſyttyng iuſtyſe aſſembled ben anſwere afterwarde knight bode apere euery wight cōmaunded ſylence knyght ſhulde tel audyence thyng worldly woman loued beſt knyght ne ſtode ſtyl doth beſte queſtion anon anſwerde manly voyce al courte herde liege lady generally quod woman deſyren haue ſoueraynte wel ouer huſbondes loue ben maiſtrye hem aboue moſte deſyre though ye kyl dothe lyſte wyl ¶in al courte na wyfe ne mayde ne wydowe contraried ſayde ſayd worthy han lyfe ye worde vp ſterte olde wyfe yt knight fonde ſyttyng ye grene mercy ꝙ ſhe ſouerayne lady quene er couete departe right taught anſwere vnto thys knyght whiche plight hys trouthe fyrſt thyng wolde hym requere wolde yf lay hys might courte thā praye ſir knight quod ſhe thou take vnto thy wyfe wel thou woſte haue kept thy life ſay falſe ſaye nay vpon thy fay ¶this knight anſwerd ala welaway wote right wel ſuche beheſte goddes loue cheſe newe requeſte take al good let body go nay ꝙ ſhe ſhrewe v bothe two though foule olde poore nolde al metal ne ore vnder erthe graue lythe aboue yf thy wyfe thy loue ¶my loue ꝙ nay dampnation ala nacion shulde euer ſo foule diſparaged al naught ende cōſtrayned yt nedes muſt wedde taketh olde wyfe gothe bedde ¶nowe wolden ſome men ſay parauenture neglygence cure tellen ioye array feeſt ylke day thing anſwere ſhortly ſhal ſay ioy ne feeſt al na heuyneſſe moche ſorowe priuely wedded morowe al day hydde hym oule wo hym wife loked ſo foule gret ye ſorow ye knight ī thouȝt whan wife bedde ibrouȝt waloweth turneth fro ¶his olde wyfe lay ſmylyng euermo ſayd dere huſbonde benedicite fareth euery knight thus ye lawe kyng artours houſe euery knyght loue ſo daungerouſe owne loue eke wyfe ſhe whiche ſaued hath lyfe certes yet dyd neuer vnryght fare ye thus fyrſt nyght ye • acen lyke man loſte hys witte fy gilte god loue tel ſhal amended yf may ¶amended ꝙ knyght ala nay nay wol ben amended neuer mo thou arte ſo lothly ſo olde alſo therto comen ſo lowe kynde litel wōder thogh walow wind wolde god ꝙ myne herte wold breſt ¶is ꝙ ſhe cauſe onreſt ye certaynly quod wonder ny ¶nowe ſyr ꝙ ſhe couthe amende al lyſt er dayes thre wel ye myght beare vnto ye ſpeke ſuche gentylneſſe diſcended olde richeſſe therfore ſhullen ye gentilmen suche errogaunce worthe hen lo moſte vertuous alway preuy aperte moſt entendeth aye gentyl dedes take hym greateſt gentylman chriſt wolde claymed hym gentylneſſe elder olde richeſſe though yeue v al herytage claymen ben hye parage yet may byquethe thyng none v vertuous lyuyng made hem gentylmen ycalled badde v folowen hem ſuche degre ¶wel wyſe poete florence hyght daunte ſpeke thys ſentence lo ſuche maner ryme dauntes tale ful ſelde vp ryſeth braunches ſmale proweſſe man god goodneſſe wol clayme hym oure gentylneſſe elder may nothyng clayme tēporal thyng yt mē may hurte maym eke euery wight wote wel gentilneſſe planted naturally vnto certayne lynage downe lyne preuy aperte wolde neuer fyne done gentilneſſe fayre offyce might vilanye ne vice take fyre beare derkeſt hous bytwixt mounte caucaſus let men ſhytte dores go thenne yet wol fyre fayre lye brenne twenty thouſande men might beholde offyce natural aye wol holde vp peryl lyfe • yl dye ¶here may ye ſe wel howe gentrye annexed poſſeſſion sythen folke operacion alway dothe fyre lo hys kynde god wotte men may ful often fynde lordes ſonne done ſhame vilanye wol haue praiſe hys gentrye borne gentil houſe elder noble vertuouſe nyl ſelfe gentil dedes ne folowe gentil auncetre deed ny gentyl duke erle fye vilaynes ſynful dedes maketh cherle gentilneſſe ny renomie thyne aunceters hygh bountie whiche ſtronge thyng thy perſone gentylneſſe cometh fro god alone cometh gentylneſſe grace nothyng byqueth v place ¶thynketh howe noble ſayth valerius thylke tullius hoſtilius pouertie roſe hye nobleſſe redeth senek redeth eke boece ſhal ye ſeen expreſſe drede gentil dothe gentil dedes therfore dere huſbonde thus conclude myne aunceters rude yet may hye god ſo hope graunt grace lyue vertuouſly gentil whan begynne lyue vertuouſly leuen ſynne ye pouertie repren • hye god byleue wylful pouerte cheſe lede lyfe certes euery man mayde wyfe maye vnderſtonde ieſu heuen kyng ne wolde cheſe viciouſe lyuyng glad pouert honeſt thyng certayne wol seneke clerkes ſayne ſo wolde hold payde pouerte holde hym ryche al ſherte coueyteth ful poore wyght wolde han hys myght yt naught hath ne coueyteth haue rych al though ye holde knaue pouert ſynne properly iuuenal ſaythe pouert merily poore man whan gothe way byforne theues may ſynge play pouert hateful good • geſſe ful great bringer buſyneſſe great amendet eke ſapience hym taketh pacience pouert al thoughe ſeme elenge poſſeſſion wyght wolchalenge pouerte ful often whan man lowe maketh hys god eke ſelfe knowe pouert ſpectacle thynketh one may frendes ſe therfore ſyn greue pouert repreue ¶nowe ſyr eke elde ye repreued certes ſyr though none autorite booke ye gentils honour sayne men ſhuld old wight honour clepe hem father gentilneſſe autours ſhal fynde geſſe ¶now ye ſayn yt foule olde drede ben coke wolde fylthe elthe foule alſo mote ben great wardeyus vpon chaſtite natheles ſyn knowe delyte ſhal fulfyl worldly appetyte cheſe ꝙ ſhe one theſe thīges tw • haue foule olde tyl dry trewe humble wyfe neuer diſpleaſe al lyfe el wol ye haue yonge fayre take auenture repayre ſhal come houſe bycauſe ſome place may wel be▪ cheſe ſeluē whether yt lyketh ¶this knyght auyſeth hym ſore ſyketh laſt ſayd manere lady loue wyfe ſo dere put wyſe gouernaunce cheſeth ſelfe maye pleſaūce moſte honour alſo force whether two lyketh ſuffyſeth thā haue gote ye maiſtry ꝙ ſhe syn may cheſe gouerne leſte ye certes wyfe ꝙ holde beſte kyſſe ꝙ ſhe ben lenger wrothe trouthe wol bothe ſay bothe fayre good pray god mote ſterue wood alſo good trewe euer wyfe ſythē ye world newe morowe fayre ſene lady empreſſe quene bytwene eſte eke weſte dothe lyfe right leſte caſt vp courteyn loke howe ¶and whan knyght ſawe al ſhe ſo fayre ſo yonge therto ioy hente armes two herte bathed bathe blyſſe thouſande tymes rowe gan kyſſe ſhe obeyed hym euery thyng mought done hym pleaſure lykyng thus lyued vnto lyues ende parfyte ioy ieſu chriſt v ſende huſbondes meke yonge freſhe bedde grace ouerlyue hem wedde eke pray god ſhort lyues wyl gouerned wyues olde angry nygardes diſpence god ſende hem ſone peſtylence ¶here endeth wyfe bathe tale begynneth ſtreres prologue worthy lymytour thys noble frere made alway maner lourynge chere vpon sompner honeſte vilaynes worde yet hym ſpake laſt ſayd wyfe dame god yeue right good lyfe ye haue touched alſo mote ſchole mater ful great diffyculte ye haue ſayd moche thyng right wel ſaye dame ryden waye v nedeth ſpeken game lete auctorites goddes name prechyng ſchole clargy yf lyke vnto companye wol sompner tel game parde ye may wel knowe name sompner may good ſayde pray none yuel payde ſompner renner vp doun maundementes fornycation ybeate euery townes ende tho ſpake hoſt ſaid ſir ye ſhulde ben hende curteys man eſtate companye wol debate telleth tale let ſompner nay ꝙ sompner let hym ſay ſo hym lyſt whan cometh lote god ſhal hym quite euery grote ſhal hym tel whiche great honour flatteryng lymytour eke many maner cryme whiche nedeth reherſen tyme hys offyce ſhal hym tel iwys hoſte anſwerde peace thys afterwarde ſayd vnto frere tel forthe tale myn maiſter dere ¶here endeth freres prologue foloweth tale whylom dwellyng countre archedeken man hye degre boldly dyd execution puniſhyng fornication withcrafte eke baudrie defamacion aduoutrie churche reues teſtamentes contractes lacke ſacramentes vſure ſymonye alſo certes lechours dyd moche wo ſhulden ſynge yf hente ſmale tythers foule iſhent perſon wolde vpon hem playne might aſterte hem pecunyal payne ſmale tythes ſmal offrynge made people pitouſly ſynge er biſhop caught hem hys hoke archedekens booke hys iurdictyon power done hem correction sompner redy honde ſlyer boye none englonde ſubtelly eſpiayle taught hym myght auayle couthe ſpare lechours one two techen hym foure twenty mo thogh ſōpner wode hare tel harlotrye wol ſpare ben hys correction haue v iurdiction ne neuer ſhullen terme al lyues ¶peter ſo ben woman ſtewes ꝙ sompner yput cure peace miſchaūce miſauenture sayd hoſte let hym tel hys tale telleth forthe let sompner gale ne ſpareth myne owne maiſter dere ¶this fals thefe sōpner ꝙ frere alway baudes redy hys honde hauke lure englonde telleth hym al ſecre knew aquayntaūce come newe aprouers priuely toke hym ſelfe great profyte therby maiſter knewe alway wan without maundement leude man coude ſommon payne chriſtes curſe glad fyllen hys purſe made hym great feeſtes nale right iudas purſes ſmale thefe right ſuche thefe maiſter halfe deutie yf ſhal yeuen hym hys laude thefe ſompner eke baude eke wench hys retinue whether ſyr roberde ſyr hue iohan rafe ſo lay hem tolde eere thus ye wench one aſſent wolde fetche fayned maundement ſommon hem chapitre bothe two pylle man let wenche go wolde ſay frende ſhal thy ſake ſtryken letter blake dare caſe trauayle thy frende may auayle certayne knewe bribries mo poſſible tel yeres two worlde ny dogge bowe hurte dere hole knowe bet sompner knewe ſlye lechour auoutrer el paramour fruite al hys rente therfore ſette al hys entent ſo befyl one day sompner waytynge euer pray rode ſommō old wedowe ribybe faynyng cauſe wolde haue bribe happed ſawe beforn hym ryde gay yoman vnder foreſt ſyde bowe bare arowes bright ſhene vpon courtpye grene hatte vpon heed ſtrynges blake sir ꝙ ſompner haile wel ytake ¶welcome ꝙ euery good felawe whider rideſt yu vnder grenwode ſhawe sayd yoman wolte thou ferre day ſompner hym anſwerd ſayd nay faſt ꝙ myne entent ryden reyſen vp rent longeth lordes dewte arte thou bayly ye ꝙ durſt nat fylth ſhame say sompner name depardieur ꝙ yoman lefe brother thou arte bayly another vnknowen countre thyne acqueyntaunce wol pray eke brotherhed yf thou liſt haue golde ſyluer chiſt yf ye happe come ſhyre al ſhal thyne right thou wolt deſyre graūt mercy ꝙ ſompner faithe euerich trouthe laythe ſworne brethern tyl dey yt worde riden forth wey ſompner wt ful iāgles ful venym ben theſe wariangles euer enquyring vpon euery thyng brother ꝙ dwellyng another day yf ſhulde ſeche yoman hym anſwerde ſoft ſpeche brother ꝙ ferre north countre hope ſomtyme ſhal ſe departe ſhal ſo wel wyſſe myne houſe thou ſhalte neuer myſſe brother ꝙ ſompner pray teche ryden way sith ye ben baylye ſubtelte tel faithfully myne offyce howe may moſt wynne ſpareth nat conſcience ne ſynne brother tel howe ye nowe trouth brother dere ſayd ſhal tellen faithful tale wage ben ful ſtraite ſmale lorde harde daungerous myne offyce ful laborous therfore extortion leue forſothe al men wol yeue algate ſleyght violence yere yere wyn al diſpence better tellen faithfully nowe certes ꝙ ſompnour ſo fate ſpare nat take god wote yf heuy hote may getten counſayle priuely maner conſcience haue nere myne extorcion myght lyuen ſuche iapes wol nat ſhriuen stomake ne conſcience knowe non ſhrewe al theſe ſhrift father euerichon wel met god ſwete ſaynt iame lefe brother tel thy name quod ſompner thys mean yoman gan lytel ſmyle ¶brother ꝙ wolte thou tel fende dwellyng hel ride purchaſyng wete may gete thyng purchaſe theffecte al rent loke howe thou rideſt ſame entent wyne good thou reckeſt neuer howe right ſo fare ride wol nowe vnto worldes ende pray ah ꝙ ſompner benedicite ye ſay wende ye woman trewly ye haue mannes ſhappe wel haue ye fygure determynate hel ye ben eſtate nay certaynly ꝙ haue non whan v lyketh take v one el make ſeme ben ſhape somtyme lyke man lyke ape lyke angel ryde go wonder thyng though ſo louſy iuggler diſceyue parde yet crafte ꝙ sompnour ride ye thā gon ſondrie ſhappe nat alway one ꝙ wol v ſuche forme make moſt able prayes take maketh haue al labour ¶ful many cauſe lefe ſyr sompnour sayd fende al thyng hath tyme day ſhort paſſed pryme yet ne gote nothyng day wol enrende wynnyng yf may nat entende wyttes declare brother myne thy wyttes ben al bare vnderſtand al though wolde tel hē thou aſkeſt laboren ſomtyme goddes inſtrumentes meanes cōmaundementes hym luſt creature dyuers arte dyuers fygures withouten hem haue might certayn yf lyſt ſtonden agayn ſomtyme praye haue leue onely body nought ſoule greue wytneſſe iob deden wo ſomtyme haue myght bothe two ſayn body ſoule eke ſomtyme ben ſuffred ſeke vpon man ſoule vnreſt nat body al beſt whan withſtandeth temptation cauſe hys ſaluation al nat entent ſhuld ſafe wolde hent ſomtyme ſeruauntes vnto man archbyſſhoppe ſaynt dunſtan apoſtel eke ſeruaunt yet tel ꝙ sompnour faithfully make ye newe body thus alway elementes▪ fende anſwered nay somtyme fayn ſomtyme aryſe deed body ſondrie wiſe ſpeke renably fayre wel phitoneſſe dyd samuel yet wolde ſome men ſay nat force deuynite thyng warne wol nat iape thou wolte algates wete howe ſhape thou ſhalt herafterwarde brother dere come nedeth nat lere thou ſhalt thyne experience conne chare rede thys ſentence bette vergyl lyue daunt alſo nowe lette v ride blyue wol holde company tyl ſo thou forſake nay ꝙ ſompnour yt ſhal nat betide yoman knowen ful wyde trouth wol holde yt caas though thou deuyll sathanas trouth wol holde brother ſworne eche v trewe brother caas brother gon purchaas take thou thy parte men wol yeue ſhal myne thus ſhal leue yf v haue let trew parte brother graunt ꝙ deuyl fay wt worde riden forth way right thentrynge rownes ende ye ſompner ſhope wēd ſawe carte charged wt hay carter droue forth way depe way carte ſtode carter ſmote ſtriued wode heit ſcot heit brok ſpare ye ye ſtones fende ꝙ fetch body bone ferforth euer ye yfoled moche wo haue tholed deuyl haue al horſe carte hay ꝙ ſompnour ſhal haue pray nere ye fende drew nouȝt ne ful preuily rowned ere herken brother herken thy fayth hereſt thou carter ſaith hent anon hath yeue hay carte eke caples thre nay ꝙ deuyl god wotte neuer dele nat entent truſt wele aſke thy ſelfe yf thou troweſt nat el ſtynt whyle thou ſhalte ſe carter thacked horſe ye croupe begon drawe ſtoupe heit nowe ꝙ ieſu chriſt bleſſe al hondy werke leſſe wel ytwight myn lyard boy pray god ſaue ſaynt loye nywe carte ſlowe parde lo brother ꝙ fende tolde may ye ſeen myn owne dere brother carle ſpake thīg thouȝt another lette v go forth viage wyn nothyng vpon cariage whā yt comē ſomwhat ye town thys sompner brother gan rown brother ꝙ wonneth olde rebecke almoſt lefe leſe necke yeue peny good wol haue xij pen tho ſhe wood wol ſompne offyce yet god wotte knowe vyce thou canſt nat countre wynne thy coſt take enſample sōpner clappeth ye wedowes gate come ſayd thou olde veritrate trowe thou haſt ſome frere preeſt wt clappeth ther ſaid wife benedicite god ſaue ſyr ſwete wyl haue ꝙ ſommōs byl vp payne curſyng loke thou morowe archdeacon kne anſwere court certayn thynges nowe lorde ꝙ ſhe ieſu kyng kynges wiſely helpe ne may haue ben ſycke ful many day may nat go ſo ferre ꝙ ſhe ne ryde deed ſo pricketh ſyde may nat aſke lybel ſyr sompnour anſwere proctour ſuche thyng men wolde appoſen yes ꝙ sompnour paye anon let ſe twelfe pen wyl acquyte ſhal profyte haue therof lyte maiſter hath profyte nat come lette ryden haſtely gyue xii pen may lenger tary twelf pen ꝙ ſhe lady ſaynt mary wiſely helpe care ſynne wyde world though ſhuld wynne ne haue nat xij pen within holde ye knowe wel poore olde kyth almeſſe poore wretche nay ꝙ foule fende fetche yf excuſe though thou ſhuldeſt ſpylt ala ꝙ ſhe god wotte yet haue gylt ¶paye ꝙ ſwete ſaynt anne wol bere away thy newe panne dette whiche thou oweſt olde whan thou madeſt thyne huſbonde cokolde payde home thy correction thou lyeſt ꝙ ſhe ſaluation ne neuer er nowe wedowe ne wyfe sompned vnto court al lyfe ne neuer na body trewe vnto deuyl blacke rough hewe yeue thy body panne alſo whan deuyll herde curſe ſo vpon knee ſayd manere nowe mably myne owne mother dere wyl erneſt ye ſey deuyl ꝙ ſhe fette er dey pan al wol hym repent nay olde ſtotte nat myne entent quod sompner repent thyng haue wolde thy ſmocke euery clothe nowe brother ꝙ deuyl nat wrothe thy body pan myne right thou ſhalt hel yet nyght thou ſhalte knowen preuyte maiſter deuynite ye worde foule fende hēt body ſoule deuyl went sompnours haue heritage god made hys ymage mankynde ſaue gyde v al ſome leue ſompnour good man become lordīges coud haue told ꝙ frere leyſer sompnour text chriſt poule iohn doctours many one suche peynes hertes myght agryſe albeit ſo tonge may deuyſe though yt might thouſande wynter tel peynes curſed houſe hel kepe v fro curſed place wake prayeth ieſu hys grace kepe v temptour sathanas herkeneth worde beware ī caas lyon ſytteth awayte alway ſlee innocent yf may diſpoſeth aye hertes withſtonde fende yt wolde make thral bonde may tempte ouer myght chriſt wol champion knyght prayeth ſompnour repēte hys miſdede er fende hym hente ¶here endeth freres tale begynneth sompners prologue sompner ſtyropes hye ſtode vpon frere herte ſo wode lyke aſpē lefe quoke yre lordynges ꝙ one thyng deſyre beſeche curteſy sythens ye han herde falſe frere lye ſuffreth may tale tel frere boſteth knoweth hel god wote lytel wonder freres fendes ben lytel ſonder parde ye han ofte tyme herde tell howe frere rauyſhed hel ſpyrit one viſyoun angel ledde hym vp doun ſhewe hym paynes al place ſawe frere folke ſawe ynowe wo vnto aungel ſpake frere tho nowe ſyr ꝙ han freres ſuche grace none hem ſhal come place ¶yes ꝙ aungel many myllyoun vnto sathanas ladde hym adoun nowe hath sathanas ſuche tayle broder caryke ſayle holde vp thy tayle thou sathanas ꝙ shewe forthe thyn erſe let frere ſe neſte freres place er halfe forlonge way ſpace right bee ſwarmen hyue dyuels erſe gan dryue twenty thouſande freres route throughout hel ſwarmed al aboute comen ayen faſte might gon erſe crepten euerychon clapte hys tayle ayen lay ſtyl ¶this frere whan loked fyl vpon turmentes thys ſory place ſpyrite god reſtored hys grace vnto hys body ayen awoke natheles yet fere quoke dyuels erſe aye hys mynde heritage kynde god ſaue al ſaue curſed frere prologue wol ende manere ¶here endeth sompners prologue foloweth tale lordynges ther yorkſhyre geſſe marſhy countrey called holderneſſe whiche went lymytour aboute preach eke begge doute ſo byfel day thys frere preched church manere ſpecially abouen euery thyng exited people hys prechyng trental yeuen goddes ſake wherwith men mighte holy houſes make diuyne ſeruyce honoured waſted deuoured ne nedeth yeuen poſſeſſeioners mowen el lyuen thonked god wele haboundaunce trental delyuereth ſayde fro penaunce frendes ſoules wel olde yonge haſtely iſonge holde preeſt ioly gay ſyngeth one meſſe day delyuereth ꝙ anon ſoules ful harde fleſhe hoke wt oules ben yelawed brenne bake nowe ſpedeth haſtely chriſtes ſake whan frere ſaid al entent qui cum patre forthe hys way went whē folke ī church yeue hē leſt went way • enger wolde reſt ſcryppe typped ſtaffe ytucked hye euery houſe gan pore prye begged mele cheſe el come felowe ſlaſſe typped horne payre table al iuory poyntel poliſhed fetouſly wrote alway name ſtoode al folke yaue hym goode aſkaunce wolde hem prey yeue v buſhel wheate malte rey goddes kychel tryppe cheſe el ye lyſt may cheſe goddes halfpeny maſſe peny yeue v brawne yf ye haue dagon blanket leue dame ſuſter dere lo write name bacon befe ſuche thyng ye fynde ſturdy harlot went hem ay behynde hoſtes man bare ſacke mē yaue hem layde backe whan dore anone planed away name euerychone written • ables ſerued hem ny • le fable ¶nay thou lyeſt sōpner ꝙ frere peace ꝙ hoſt chriſtes mother dere tel forthe thy tale ſpare al thrine ꝙ sompner ſo ſhal ¶so longe went fro hous houſe til came houſe ther wont refreſhed hundred placis sicke lay good man whoſe place bedred vpon couche lowe lay deus hic ꝙ thomas frend good day sayd frere curteſſy ſofte thomas god yelde ful ofte haue vpon benche faren ful wele haue eaten many mery mele fro benche droue away catte layde adowne hys potent hatte eke ſcryppe ſet hym ſofte adowne felowe go walked towne forthe knaue hoſtelrye ſhope ilke night lye ¶o dere maiſter quod ſyke man howe haue ye faren ſythen marche began ſawe fourtenight ¶god wot ꝙ laboured haue ful ſore ſpecially thy ſaluacion haue ſayd many preciouſe oriſon frendes▪ god hem bleſſe haue day ben churche meſſe ſayd ſermon ſymple wytte al text holy writte harde ſuppoſe therfore wol teche al gloſe gloſyng glorious thyng certayne letter ſleeth clerkes ſayne haue hem taught ben charitable ſpende good reſonable ſawe dame ſhe ¶yonder yerde trowe ſhe sayd thys man ſhe wol come anon ¶eye mayſter welcom ye ſaynt iohn sayd wyfe howe fare ye hertely ¶this frere aryſeth vp ful curteſſy enbraſeth armes narowe kyſſeth herſwetely cherketh ſparowe wt lippes dame ꝙ right wele ſeruaunt euery dele thanked god yaue ſoule lyfe yet ſawe day ſo fayre wife al churche ſo god ſaue ye god amende al fautes ſyr ꝙ ſhe algates welcome ye fay graūt mercy dame yt haue foūde alway great goodneſſe leue wol pray ye greue wol thomas ſpeke lytel throwe theſe curate ben ful neglygent ſlowe gropen tenderly mannes conſcience ſchrift prechyng diligence ſtudye peter wordes poules walke fyſhe chriſten mennes ſoules yelde ieſu chriſt propre rent ſprede hys wordes al myne entent ¶nowe leue dere mayſter ꝙ ſhe chydeth hym wel ſaynt charite angry pyſſe myre though haue al deſyre though hī wry anight make hī warme ouer hym lay legge myne arme groneth lyke bore yt lyeth ſtye dyſporte hym ryght none haue may pleaſe hym maner caas thomas ie voꝰ die thomas thomas maketh ye fende muſt ben amēded ire thynge god hyghly defended therof wol ſpeake worde two ¶now mayſter ꝙ wyfe er go wol ye dyne wol go ther aboute dame ꝙ • vous die ſans doute haue capon lyuer whyte breed ſhyuer roſted pygges heed nolde beeſt deed ynowe ſuffyſaunce man lytel ſuſtinaunce ſpirite hath hys foſteryng byble body aye ſo redy ſo penyble wake body dyſtroyde pray dame ye nought anoyde though ſo frendly coūſaile ſhewe god nolde haue tolde fewe ¶nowe ſyr ꝙ ſhe one worde er ye go chylde deed within theſe wekes two sone ye wente thys toun hys death ſawe reuelacioun sayd thys frere home dortoure dare wel ſayne er halfe houre hys death ſawe hym borne blyſſe myne auiſioun god ſo wyſſe dyd ſexten fermerere han ben true freres thys fyftye yere may god thanked hys lone maken • iubely wa • ken alone vp aroſe al couente eke wyth many teere tryllynge cheke wythouten noyſe claterynge belle te deum ſonge nothinge elles saue chriſt ſayd oriſon thankynge hym reuelacion ſyr dame truſteth ryght wel oriſons ben effectuel ſene chriſtes ſecret thinges thē borel folke although kynges lyue pouerte abſtinence borel folke rycheſſe dyſpence meate drynke foule delyte han thys worldly luſte al dyſpyte lazar diues lyueden dyuerſly dyuers guerdon therby ſo wol pray muſte faſte clene fatte hys ſoule make hys body lene fare ſayth apoſtle cloth foode suffyſeth v though ful goode clenneſſe faſtynge v freres maketh chriſt accepteth prayeres ¶lo moyſes fourty dayes fourty nyght faſted er hye god hys myght spake wyth hym mounte synay wyth empty wombe faſtynge many day receyued lawe wrytten wyth goddes fynger hely wel ye witten mount horeb er ſpeche wyth hygh god ſoules leche faſted longe contemplaunce ¶aaron yt temple gouernaunce eke preſtes euerychone temple ſhulde gone prayen people done ſeruyce nolde drynke maner wyſe drynke dronke myght hem make abſtinence praye wake leſt deden take hede ſaye ſobre people praye ware ſaye ſuffyſeth certayn herken yow thomas ſhal ſayn haue texte therof ſuppoſe fynde maner gloſe ſpecially ſwete lorde ieſus spake thys freres ſayd thus bleſſed poore ſpirite bene ſo forth al goſpel maye ye ſene whether lyker perfection ſwymmen poſſeſſion fye pompe glotonye leudneſſe hem defye thynketh lyke iouinian fatte whale walkynge ſwan vinolent botel ſpen • e prayer ful lytel reuerence ſoules ſay ye body welden haſtely ¶god wore ꝙ nothynge therof fele helpe chriſt fewe yeres haue ſpended vpon dyuers maner freres wel many poūde yet fare neuer bette certayne good haue almoſt beſette fare wel good almoſte ago frere anſwered thomas doſt yu ſo nedeth dyuers freres ſeche nedeth hath parfyte leche ſechen lech toun inconſtaunce confuſioun holde ye el couent prayen inſufficient thomas tape ny worth myte maladye haue lyte yeue couent halfe quarter otes yeue couent foure twenty grotes yeue frere penny let hym go nay nay thomas may nothynge ſo ferthyng worth parted twelue lo eche thynge oned hym ſelue ſtronge ſo ſcatered thomas thou ſhalt ben yflatered thou wolſt haue al labour nought hye god yt al thys world hath wrought sayeth yt workman worthy hyre thomas nought treaſoure deſyre ſelfe al couent praye aye ſo dyligent buylden chriſtes owne chyrche thomas yf ye wol lerne wyrche buyldynge vp chyrches may ye fynde yf good thomas lyfe inde ye lyggen ful anger yre ye deuel ſetteth hert fyre chyden thys holy innocent wyfe ſo meke pacient therfore trowe thomas leſte ne chyde wyth thy wyfe beſte beare thys worde awaye thy fayth touchinge ſuch thing lo ye wyſe ſayth wythin thy houſe thou lyon thy ſubiectes thou none oppreſſion ne make thyne acquayntaunce •• e yet thomas eftſones charge beware thy boſome ſlepeth ware ſerpent ſo ſlyly crepeth vnder graſſe ſtyngeth ful ſubtelly beware ſonne herken paciently twēty thouſāde mē han loſt lyues ſtryuinge lēmans wyues nowe ſens ye haue ſo holy meke wyfe nebeth thomas make ſtryfe ny ywyſſe ſerpent ſo cruel mē treden tayle ne halfe ſo fell womā whē ſhe hath caught yre vengeaunce al deſyre ¶ire ſynne one greateſt ſeuen abhominable vnto hygh god heuen hym ſelfe dyſtruction thys euery leude vycare p • rſon ſaye yre engendreth homecyde ire ſoth executour pryde coulde yre ſay ſo muche ſorowe tale ſhulde laſt tyl morowe therfore pray god daye nyght yrous man ſende lytell myght great harme eke great pyte ſet yrous man hye degre whylom yrous poteſtate ſayeth seneke durynge hys eſtate vpon daye rydden knyghtes two fortune wolde ſhulde ſo one hem cam home yt nought anone knyght ye iudge brought ſaid thus thou haſt thy felowe ſlayne whych deme death certayne another knyght cōmaunded go lede hym death charge hapned went wey towarde place ſhulde dey kniȝt came mē wēde dede thought beſt rede lede iudge agayne ſaydē lorde knight hath ſlayne hys felowe ſtante hole alyue ye ſhullen deed ꝙ ſo mote thryue ſaye one two thre fyrſt knyght ryght thus ſpake dampned thou muſt algate deed thou muſte alſo leſe nedes thyne heed thou arte cauſe thy felowe deyth ye thyrde knyght ryght thus ſeyth thou haſt done cōmaunded thus dyd hem ſlayne al thre irouſe c •• hyſes eke dronkelewe aye dely • hym ben ſhrewe ſo byfel lorde hys meyne loued wel vertuous moralite said day betwyxt hem two right thus lorde loſt yf aught vicious dronkenneſſe eke foule recorde man namely lorde many eye many eere awaytynge lorde notte goddes loue drynketh temporatly wyne maketh man leſe wretchedly hys mynde hys lymmes euerychone ¶the reuers ſhalte thou ſe ꝙ anone preue thyne owne experience wyne ne doth folke ſuch offence ny wyne byreueth myght honde foote ne myne eye ſyght diſpyte dronke mochel hundred tymes dyd ryght anone thys curſed yrouſe wretch let thys knyghtes ſonne byforne fetch cōmaūding ſhulde byforne ſtōde ſodaynly toke hys bowe honde vp ſtrynge pulled hys eere wyth arowe ſlough ye childe whether haue ſeker hōde none ꝙ al myght mynde agone hath wyne byreued myne eyen ſyght ¶what ſhulde tel anſwere ye knyght hys ſaynt symon haue ſhryue thys day curate haue tolde hym al myne eſtate nedeth nomore ſpeke ſayeth yf lyſt myne humilite yeue thē thy gold make cloiſtre ꝙ many muſkle many oyſtre men haue ben ful wel lyon falſe churle ꝙ frere goddes bone thys haſt thou dyſpyte none thou ſhalte abye thys farte yf may hys meyny herde thys afraye came leapyng chaſed frere forth goeth wyth ful angry chere fette hys felowe laye ſtore loked wylde bore grynted hys teth ſo wrothe ſturdy pace downe court gothe wōned mā great honour alway confeſſour worthy man lorde vylage thys frere came rage thys lorde ſate catyng borde vnnethes myght frere ſpeke worde tyl laſte ſayd god ſe ¶thys lorde gan loke ſayd benedicite frere ihō maner world ſe wel ſomthynge amys ye loke though ye wod ful theues syt downe tel grefe ſhalbe amended yf may ¶i haue ꝙ dyſpyte day god yelde adowne village world none ſo poore page nolde haue abhominacioun haue receaued toun yet greueth nothynge ſo ſore olde churle wyth locke hore thys frere odious myſchefe thys day betyde myne ordre ſo per conſequens eche degre holy churche god amende ſone syr ꝙ lorde ye wote done dyſtempre ye ben confeſſour ye ben ſalte earth ſauour goddes loue pacience nowe holde telleth grefe anone tolde ye han herde ye wote well lady houſe aye ſtyll ſatte tyl ſhe herde frere ſayde eye goddes mother ꝙ ſhe blyſful mayde nought el tel faythfully madame ꝙ howe thynketh ye therby howe thynketh ſo god ſpede ſaye churle hath done churles dede ſhulde ſaye god let hym neuer hys ſycke heed ful vanite ho • de hym maner freneſye madame ꝙ god ſhal lye wyſe may ben hym awreke ſhal ſlaunder ouer al ſpeke falſe blaſphemour charged parte myght departed euery man ylyche wyth myſchaunce lorde ſate ſtyl traū •• hys herte rolled vp doun howe thys churle ymaginacioun ſhewe ſuche probleme frere neuer erſt ne herde ſuch matere trowe dyuel put hys mynde al arſmetryke ſhal man fynde byforne thys daye ſuche queſtion ſhulde make demonſtracion euery man hym neuer rumblyge farte euery ſonne ny eyre reuerberacyoune euer waſteth lytle lytle away man demen fay yf departed equally lo churle lo yet ſhreudly vnto confeſſour day ſpake holde hym certayne cloth ſyr frere ſo ye ben wroth howe thys farte ſhulde euen ydeled amonges couent yf lyketh tel ꝙ ye lorde thou ſhalt haue anon gowne clothe god ſaynt ihon lorde ꝙ yt weder fayre wythouten wynde perturbynge ayre let brynge carte whele thys hall loke haue hys ſpokes twelue ſpokes hath carte whele cōmenly brynge thē xij freres wote ye thyrtene couent geſſe confeſſour hys worthyneſſe shal perfourme vp nombre couēt thē ſhullē knelen adowne one aſſēt euery ſpokes ende thys manere ful ſadly lay hys noſe ſhal frere noble confeſſour god ſaue shal holde hys noſe vpryght vnder ye naue ſhal churle wt bely ſtyffe tought tabour hyther ben ybrought ſet whele right carte vpon naue make hym let farte ye ſhullen ſe vp peryl lyfe prefe whych demonſtratyfe equally ſowne wyl wende eke ſtynke vnto ſpokes ende saue yt thys worthy man confeſſour bycauſe man great honour shal haue fyrſt frutes reſon noble vſage freres yet thys wortheſt mā hem ſhul fyrſt ſerued certaynly hath wel deſerued hath day taught v ſo moch good wyth prechynge pulpet ſtood may vouchſafe ſaye fyrſt ſmel fartes thre ſo wolde al hys brother hardely beareth hym ſo fayre holyly ¶the lord ye lady eche man ſaue ye towne ¶here endeth sompners tale foloweth clerke oxenfordes prologue sir clerke oxforde hooſt ſayde ye ryde ſtil coye doth mayde newe ſpouſed ſyttynge borde day ne herd mouth worde trowe ye ſtudye ſome ſophyme salomon ſayeth al thynge hath tyme goddes ſake bethe better chere tyme ſtudye tel v ſome mery tale faye man entred playe nedes mote vnto playe aſſent precheth freres done lent make v olde ſynnes wepe ne thy tale make v ſlepe tel v ſome mery thynge auentures termes fygures coloures kepe hem ſtore tyl ſo ye endyte hyghe ſtyle men kynges wryte speketh ſo playne thys tyme pray may vnderſtande ye ſay ¶thys worthy clerke benyngly anſwerde hoſte ꝙ vnder yerde ye haue v nowe gouernaunce therfore wol obeyſaunce farre reaſon aſketh hardely wol tel tale whych lerned padowe worthy clerke preued hys wordes hys werke deed nayled hys cheſte praye god ſende hys ſoule good reſte fraunces petrarke laureat poete hyght thys clerke whoſe rhetoryke ſwete enlumined al tayle poetrye lyuian dyd philoſophye lawe arte perticulere death ye wol ſuffre v dwellen twynklynge eye hem bothe hath ſlayne al ſhal dye ¶but tellen worthy man taught tale fyrſt began ſay fyrſt hye ſtyle endyteth body hys tale writeth proheme whiche diſcriueth piemount saluce countre ſpeketh apenniny hylles hye ben boundes weſt lumbardye mount veſulus ſpecial poo wel ſmal taketh hys fyrſt ſpring hys ſours eſtwarde euer increſeth cours emelle warde ferare venyſe whiche longe tyme deuyſe truly iugement thynketh thyng inpartinent saue hym lyſte conuey hys matere tale ye ſhullen ¶here endeth prologue clerke oxenforde foloweth hys tale weſt ſyde itayle rote veſulus colde luſty playne habundaunt vitayle wher many town tour thou maiſt behold founded tyme father olde many nother delectable ſyght saluces noble countre hight markes whylom londe worthy elder hym byfore obeyſaunt aye redy hys honde al hys liege bothe leſſe thus delyte lyued hath done yore beloued drad fauour fortune bothe lordes hys commune therwith ſpeke lynage gentyleſt yborne al lomberdy fayre perſon ſtronge yong age ful honour curteſye diſcrete ynowe countre gye saue ſome thynges blame walter yonge lordes name blame thus conſydred nou •• tyme cōmyng hym might betyde luſt preſent al thought hauke hunt eueryſyde welny al cure lette ſlyde eke ne wolde worſt al wedde wife ought myght befal onely poynt hys people bare ſo ſore flockmele day hym went one hem wiſeſt lore el lorde wolde beſt aſſent ſhulde tel people mēt el coude ſhewe ſuche matere markes ſayd ye ſhullen ¶o noble marque humanyte aſſureth v yeueth v hardyneſſe ofte tyme neceſſyte may tel heuyneſſe accepteth lorde gentylneſſe pitous hert playne lette eares nat voice diſdayne al haue nat done matere another hath place yet moche ye lorde ſo dere haue alway ſhewed fauour grace dare better aſke ſpace audience ſhewen requeſte ye lorde done right leſte certes lorde ſo wel v lyketh al werkes euer haue ye ne coulde owne ſelfe deuyſen howe myght lyuen felycite saue one thyng lorde yf wyl wedded man leſt thā people ſouerayn hertes boweth necke vnder bliſful yoke ſoueraynte ſeruyſe whiche men clepen ſpouſayle wedloke thīketh lord amōg ſelden tyme founde mariage free mote ben ſeruage natheles ſe true entente truſt vpon wytte haue done aye wherfore fre wyl wol aſſente wedden ſone euer may ye haue profred day cheſe wyfe releſe choyce lette alone cheſynge wyfe charge vpon backe wol endure pray charge vpon lyfe wyfe take ye enſure worſhip while lyfe may dure worde werke el ſhe emperours doughter furthermore thus ſhal ye ſwere yt ye ayenſt choyce ſhal neuer grutch ne ſtryue ſythe ſhal go lyberte requeſt euer mote thryue myn hert ſet wol wyue ye wol aſſent ſuche manere pray ſpeketh matere herty wyl ſworen aſſent al thyng ſayd wight nay beſechyng hym grace er went wolde hem graunt certayn day ſpouſaile ſoone euer may yet alway people ſomwhat dredde leſt markes wolde wyfe wedde graunted hem day ſuche leſt whiche wolde wedded ſekerly ſayd dyd al requeſt humble entent ful buxomly knelyng vpon knee ful reuerently hym thonked al thus han ende entent home ayen wende vpon toke offycers commaundyng feeſt puruay priuy knyghtes ſquyers suche charge yaue lyſt hem lay cōmaundement obey eche hem dothe hys dilygence done feeſt reuerence ¶explicit par prima et incipit par ſecunda nought ferre fro thylke place honorable markes ſhope hys mariage ſtode thrope ſyght ful delectable whiche poore folke village hadden beeſtes • ygage labour toke ſuſtenaunce erthe yaue hem habundaunce amōge poore folke ther dwelled mā holden pooreſt hem hye god ſomtyme ſende grace vnto lytel oxe ſtall ianycola men thrope hym cal doughter fayre ynough • ſyght griſylde yonge mayden hyght ſpeke vertuous beaute ſhe one fayreſt vnder ſonne ful poorely yfoſtred ſhe lykerouſe luſt herte ironne wel ofter wel tonne dronke ſhe wolde vertue pleſe knewe wel laboure ydel eſe though mayde tender age yet breſt virginite encloſed ſadde rype corage great reuerence charyte olde poore father foſtred ſhe fewe ſhepe ſpynnyng felde ſhe kept wolde ben idel tyl ſhe ſlept whā ſhe homward came ſhe wold bring wortes herbes tymes ful ofte ſhe ſhradde ſethe lyuyng made bedde ful hard nothing ſofte aye ſhe kepte father lyfe lofte euery obeyſaunce dilygence childe might father reuerēce ¶vpon griſylde poore creature wel ofte hath markes ſette eye huntyng rode parauenture whan fel myght aſpye wanton lokyng ſolye eyen caſte vpon ſadde wyſe vpon chere wolde ofte auyſe commending herte womāhode eke vertue paſſyng euery wyght ſo yonge age wel chere dede though people haue great inſyght vertue • conſydred ful ryght bounte diſpoſed wolde wedde yf euer wedde ſhulde day weddyng com wight cā tel woman ſhulde whiche maruaile wondred many man ſayden whan priuete wol lorde yet leaue vanyte wol wedde ala ala whyle wol thus ſelfe v begyle natheleſſe markes hath make gemmes ſet golde aſure broches rynges griſyldes ſake clothyng toke meſure mayden lyke ſtatute eke ornamentes al ſuche weddyng ſhulde fal tyme vndren ſame day approched weddyng ſhulde al paleys put array bothe halle chambre eche degre houſes offyces ſtuffed great plente mayſte thou ſe daynteous vitayle may founde fer laſteth itayle royal markes rychely arayde lordes ladyes companye feeſt prayde retinue bachelery many ſowne ſondrie melodye vnto village tolde aray right way hath holde ¶griſylde god wotte ful innocent ſhape al array fetche water wel went cometh home ſone euer ſhe may wel ſhe herde ſay ylke day ye markes ſhuld wedde ſhe might wolde fayne ſeen ſome ſyght thought wold wt maydens ſtōde ben felowes • ſe markes therto wol fonde done home ſone may labour longeth may leyſer beholde ſhe way caſtel holde ſhe wolde ouer threſholde gon markes came gan call ſhe ſette downe water potte anon beſyde threſholde ore ſtal downe vpon knee ſhe gan fal ſadde countenaunce kneled ſtyl tyl ſhe herde lordes wyl thoughtful markes ſpake ye mayd wel ſoberly ſayd manere father griſylde ſayd ſhe reuerence meke chere anſwerde lorde al redy ſhe gothe without lenger lette markes ſhe father fette honde toke olde man ſayd thus whan hym aſyde ianycola neyther may ne lenger pleaſaunce myne herte hyde thou vouchſafe ſo euer betyde thy doughter wol take wende wyfe lyues ende thou loueſt wotte wel certayne arte faythful liege man ybore al lyketh dare wel ſayne lyketh ſpecially therfore tel poynte haue ſaid thou wolt purpoſe drawe take thy ſonne lawe ¶this ſodayne caſe man aſtoned ſo reed wext abaſhed al quakyng ſtode ne vnneth ſayd wordes mo onely thus ꝙ lorde wyllyng ye wol ne ayenſt lykyng wol nothyng ye lorde ſo dere right lyſte gouerne matere wol thus ꝙ markes ſothly thy chambre ſhe haue collation woſt thou wol aſke yf wyl wyfe rule al ſhal ſhe done thy preſence wol ſpeke thyn audyence chambre treties whiche ye ſhal people came houſe without wondred hem honeſt manere tentifly ſhe kept father dere vtterly griſylde wonder myght neuer erſte ſawe ſhe ſuche ſyght wonder though ſhe aſtoned ſe ſo great geſt come place neuer ſuche geſtes woned ſhe loked ful pale face ſhortly fro mater pace theſe wordes yt markes ſayd benygne faythful mayde ¶griſylde ſaid ye ſhal wel vnderſtonde lyketh vnto father wedde eke may ſo ſtonde ſuppoſe ye wol ſo theſe demaundes aſke fyrſt ꝙ ſythen ſhal done haſty wyſe wol ye therto aſſent el auyſe ſay thus ye redy good herte al luſte frely may beſt liketh though ye laugh ſmerte neuer ye grutche nyght ne day whan ſay ye ye ſay one nay neyther word ne frowning coūtenāce swere ſwere aliaunce ¶wōdryng vpō theſe wordes quakyng drede ſaid lorde indigne vnworthy thylke honour ye bede right ye wol ſo wol ſwere neuer wyllyngly word werke ne thouȝt nil diſobey deed though loth dey ¶this ynough griſylde myne ꝙ forthe gothe ſobre chere dore came ſhe people ſaid manere wyfe ꝙ ſtondeth honoureth loueth pray ſo loueth ny ſay thyng olde gere ſhulde bring houſe badde woman ſhulde diſpoyle right theſe ladyes nothing gladde hādle clothes ſhe clad natheleſſe thys mayden bright hewe fro foote heed clothed han al newe heer han kembed yt laye vntreſſed ful rudely fyngres ſmale crowne heed han idreſſed ſet ful ouches great ſmale array ſhulde make tale vnneth people knew fairneſſe whan ſhe tranſfourmed ſuch richeſſe ¶this markes hath ſpouſed wt ringe bought ſame cauſe ſet vpon horſe ſnowe white wel amblynge paleys lenger let ioyful people ladde met conueyed thus day ſpende reuel tyl ſonne gan diſcende ſhortly forthe tale chace ſaye newe markeſſeſſe god hath yſent ſuche fauour hys grace ſemed lykelyneſſe ſhe borne fedde rudeneſſe cote oxe ſtal noriſhed emperoures hal euery wight ſhe woxen ſo dere worſhip ful ye folke ther ſhe bore fro byrthe knewe yere yere vnneth trowed durſt haue ſwore ianycola whiche ſpake doughter na coniecture hem thought ſhe nother creature though euer vertuous ſhe encreaſed ſuche excellence thewes good ſet hye bounte ſo diſcrete fayre eloquence benygne digne reuerence coulde people hertes ſo enbrace eche loued loked face onely saluce town publyſhed bountie name eke beſyde many regioun one ſayd wel ſayd ſame ſpradde bountie ſame men woman bothe yonge olde gone saluces beholde ¶this walter lowly ful royally wedded hath wyth fortunate honeſte goddes peace lyueth ful eaſely outwarde grace ynough ſawe vnder lowe degre honeſt vertue hyd people helde prudent man ſene wel ſelde ¶not griſylde wyt couthe al feate wyfely humbleſſe eke whan caſe required comen profyte coulde ſhe redreſſe na diſcorde rancour ne heuyneſſe al londe ſhe ne couthe apeſe bring hem al wyſely reſt eſe though huſbond abſent none gentylmen countre wrothe ſhe wolde bring hem one wyſe rype wordes ſhe iugement ſo great equite ſhe fro heuen ſent men wende people ſaue euery wronge amende ¶not longe tyme griſylde wedded ſhe doughter ybore al ſhe leuer haue borne man chylde glad ye markes folke therfore though mayde chylde came al may man chylde attayne lykelyhode ſythens ſhe barayne ¶explicit par ſecunda et incipit par tertia fel befalleth oft tymes mo whā childe ſucked throwe markes herte lō ged ſo tempte hys wyfe ſadneſſe knowe ne myght hys herte throwe marueylous deſyre hys wyfe aſſaye nedeleſſe god wot thought affray aſſayed ynoughe fonde euer good nedeth tempte alway though ſome man praiſe ſubtyl wyt ſay ful yuel ſyt aſſay wyfe whan nede put anguyſhe drede markes wrouȝt manere came alone nyght ſhe lay ſterne face right vgly chere ſayd thus griſylde ꝙ day toke thy poore aray put eſtate hye nobleſſe thou haſt forgoten geſſe ſay griſylde preſent dignyte whiche haue put trowe maketh foryetful toke poore aſtate ful lowe wele thou muſt thy ſelfe knowe take hede euery worde ſey wight hereth twey thou wotteſt thy ſelf yt thou came houſe longe ago though thou lefe dere vnto gentyls thou art nothyng ſo ſay hem great ſhame wo ben ſubiette ben ſeruage borne arte ſo ſmal village namely ſyth thy doughter ybore theſe wordes haue ſpoken doutles deſyre haue done byfore lyue lyfe hem reſt pee may caſe recheles mote done thy doughter beſt wolde gentyls leſt yet god wote ful lothe natheleſſe without thy wetyng wol naught thus wol ꝙ thou aſſent thys thyng shewe nowe thy pacience thy werkyng thou hight ſwore village day maked mariage ¶whā ſhe herde al ſhe ameued neyther word chere ne coūtenaunce ſemed ſhe agreued ſayd lorde al lyeth pleſaunce childe hertely obeyſaunce ben al ye may ſaue ſpyl owne worketh owne wyll may nothyng ſo god ſoule ſaue lykyng may diſpleſe ne deſyre nothyng haue ne drede leſe ſaue onely ye wil herte aye ſhal length tyme deth may deface neyther chāge corage another place ¶glad markes anſwering yet fayned ſo al drery chere lokyng whan ſhulde chambre go sone thys forlonge way two priuely tolde al entent vnto man wyfe ſent maner ſergeāt priuy mā faithful ofte founde thynges great eke ſuche folke wel done execucyon thynges badde lorde knewe wel loued dradde whan ſergeant wyſt lordes wil chambre ſtalked hym ful ſtyl ¶madame ſayd ye mote foryeue though thing cōſtrayned ye ful wyſe ful wel knowe ye lordes heſtes may fayned may wel bewayled complayned men muſte nedes vnto luſte obey ſo wol ni ſey childe cōmaunded take ſpake vp chylde hent diſpitouſly gan chere make though wolde haue ſlayne wēt griſylde muſt al ſuffre conſent lambe ſhe ſytteth meke ſtyl let cruel ſergeaunt wyl ¶suſpecte fame man suſpecte face ſuſpecte hys worde alſo suſpecte tyme whiche began ala doughter ſhe loued ſo wende wold haue ſlayne right tho natheleſſe ſhe neyther wepte ne ſyked confyrmyng markes lyked laſte ſpeke ſhe began mekely ſhe ſergeaunt prayde worthy gentilman ſhe might kyſſe chylde er yt deyde barme lytel chylde ſhe leyde ful ſadde face gan chylde blyſſe lulled gan kyſſe thus ſhe ſayd benygne voyce farwel chylde ſhal neuer ſe ſythen haue marked yu croyce thylke father ybleſſed mote thou v dyed vpon rode tree thy ſoule lytel chylde betake nyght ſhalte thou dyen ſake ¶i trowe norice thys caas ben harde routhe ſe wel might mother crye ala natheleſſe ſo ſadde ſtedfaſt ſhe ſhe endured al aduerſyte ſergeaunt mekely ſhe ſayde haue ayen lytel yonge mayde goth ꝙ ſhe doth lordes heſt thing wolde pray grace yf lorde forbyd leſte buryeth lytel body ſome place beeſtes ne byrdes race worde purpoſe wolde ſay toke childe went anon way ſergeaunt came lorde agayne griſyldes wordes chere tolde worde word ſhort playne preſented doughter dere somwhat lord routh ī manere natheleſſe purpoſe helde ſtyl lordes done whā wol haue wyl badde ſergeaunt ful priuely ſhuld child wel ſoft wynd wrappe al circumſtaunce tenderly cary cofre lappe payne hys heed ſwappe man ſhulde knowe entent ne whence came ne whyther went boleyne▪ ſuſter dere thilke tyme pauye counteſſe ſhulde take ſhewe matere beſechyng done buſyneſſe childe foſtre al gentylneſſe whoſe chylde yt bade hyde euery wight ought ye might betyde ſergeaunt gothe hathe fulfylled thys thyng thys markes nowe retourne nowe gothe ful ofte ymaginyng wyues chere myght ſe wordes perceyue ſhe chaunged neuer coulde fynde euer one ilyke ſadde kynde glad humble buſy ſeruyſe eke loue ſhe wont ſhe hym euery maner wyſe ne doughter one worde ſpake ſhe none accident none aduerſyte ſene ne neuer doghters name nempned ſhe erneſt ne game ¶explicit tertia par et incipit par quarta thys eſtate paſſed ben foure yere er ſhe wyth chylde god wolde man chylde ſhe bare waltere wel gracious fayre beholde folke father tolde onely al countre merye chyld god thonke herye two yere olde breſt departed hys noryce daye thys markes caught yet another leſt tempten hys wyfe efte ſones yf maye onedeleſſe ſhe tēpted dare wel ſaye wedded men ne conne meſure fynde pacient creature wyfe ꝙ markes ye haue herd people heuely bareth mariage namely ſythen ſonne borne worſe euer age murmure ſleeth herte corage myne eeres cometh ye voyce ſo ſmerte wel nye deſtroyed hath herte ſay thus whē walter agone ſhal bloode iamcula ſuccede ben lorde haue none suche wordes ſay people drede wel ought ſuche murmure take hede certaynly drede ſuche ſentence though playnly ſpeke ī audiēce wolde lyue peace yf myght wherfore dyſpoſed vtterly hys ſyſter ſerued nyght ryght ſo thynke ſerue hym priuely thus warne ye ſodeynly ſelfe wo ſhulde outraye beth pacient therof praye haue ꝙ ſhe ſayd euer ſhal wol • yl nothynge certayne lyſt nought greueth al though yt doughter ſōne ſlayne cōmaundement thys ſayne haue parte chyldren twayne fyrſt ſyckneſſe wo payne ye ben lord doth wt owne thyng ryght lyſte taketh rede lefte home clothyng came fyrſt ryght ſo ꝙ ſhe lefte wyll al lyberte toke clothing wherfor pray wyl wol obey certes yf preſcience wyl knowe er ye luſt tolde wolde done wythout negligence wote luſt ye wolde al pleſaunce fyrme ſtable holde wyſte yt death wolde done eſe gladly wolde ſuffre pleaſe death may make compariſoun vnto loue whē thys markes ſay conſtaūce hys wyfe caſt adoun hys eyen two wondred ſhe may ſuche pacience ſuffreth al thys array forth goeth wyth drery countenaūce hys herte ful great pleaſaūce thys eygre ſergeant ſame wyſe doughter caught ryght ſo worſe yf coulde werſe deuyſe hath hente ſonne yt ful beaute euer one ſo pacient ſhe ſhe chere made heuyneſſe kyſſeth chylde gan bleſſe saue thys ſhe prayd yf might lytel ſonne wolde erth graue hys tendre lymmes delycate ſyght fro foules fro beaſtes ſaue ſhe none anſwere hym myght haue went hys waye nothynge rought boleyne tenderly brought markes wōdred euer lēger ye vpon pacience yf ne ſothely knowen parfytly chyldren loued ſhe wolde haue wende yt ſome ſubtelte malyce cruel corage ſhe ſuffred thys wt ſadde vyſage knewe wel yt next hym ſelfe certayne loued chyldren beſt euery wyſe woman wolde aſke fayne yf theſe aſſayes mayght ſuffyſe coulde ſturdy huſbonde deuyſe preue wyfehode ſtedfaſtneſſe contynuynge euer ſturdyneſſe folke ſuche condicion whē han certayne purpoſe take couth ſtynte entencion bounden ſtake wol purpoſe ſlake ryght ſo thys markes hath fully purpoſed tēpte hys wyfe fyrſt dyſpoſed wayteth yf wordes coūtenaunce hym chaunged corage neuer coulde fynde variaunce aye one herte vyſage euer ſhe age truer yf poſſible hym loue penyble whych ſemeth thus hem two na one wyl walter leſt ſame luſt pleaſaunce alſo god thanked al fel beſte ſhewed wel worldly vnreſte wyfe ſelfe nothynge ſholde wyllen effecte huſbonde wolde ſclaūder walter wōder wyde ſprad cruel herte ful wretchedly poore woman wedded hath murdred hys chyldren priuely murmure amonge hem comenly wonder people ere ther cāe word yt murdred whych hys people ther loued wel diſclaūdred defame made hem hated hym therfore ben murtherer hateful name natheleſſe erneſt ne game hys cruel purpoſe wolde ſtent tempt hys wyfe al hys entent yt hys doughter xii yere age court rome ſubtel wyſe enfourmed hys wyl ſent hys meſſage cōmaundyng hem ſuche bylles deuyſe hys cruel purpoſe may ſuffyſe howe pope hys people reſte bade hym wedde another yf hym leſte ſaye bade ſhulde countrefete pope bulle makynge mencion hath leue hys fyrſt wyfe lete pope dyſpenſacion ſtynte rancoure dyſcencion betwyxt hys people thus ſpake yt bul whych han publyſhed full rude people wonder ny wenden ful wel ben ryght ſo theſe tydynges come griſyldes deme herte ful wo ſhe lyche ſadde euermo dyſpoſed thys humble creature aduerſite fortune endure abydynge euer hys luſte hys pleaſaūte whome ſhe yeuen herte worldly ſuffyſaunce certaynly yf thys ſtorie tel ſhal thys markes ywritten hath ſpecial letter whych ſhewed hys entent priuely boloyne ſent erle pauy whych wedded hys ſyſter prayde ſpecially bryngen ayen hys chyldren two honorable eſtate al openly one thynge hym prayde al vtterly wight though mēwold enquire shulde tellen whoſe chyldren ſay yt mayden ſhulde wedded vnto markes saluce anone erle prayde ſo dyd daye yſette hys way gone towarde saluce lordes many one ryche aray thys mayden gyde yonge brother rydynge ſyde arayed towarde mariage thys mayden freſhe ful gemmes clere brother ſeuen yere age arayed eke freſhely hys manere thus great nobleſſe glad chere towarde saluce ſhapen iournay fro day day rydynge forth way ¶explicit quarta par et ſequitur par quinta amonge al thys hys wycked vſage thys markes hys wyfe yet tempte vttereſt profe corage fully haue experience lore yf ſhe ſtedfaſt daye open audience ful boyſtouſly hath ſayd thys ſentence certes griſylde ynough pleſaūce han wyfe goodneſſe trouth obeyſaunce lynage ne rycheſſe nowe knowe ſothfaſtneſſe great lordſhyp yf wel aduyſe great ſeruitude ſondry wyſe may done euery ploughmā maye people conſtrayneth take another wyfe cryen daye daye eke pope thys rancoure ſlake conſenteth dare vndertake truely thus moche wol ſaye newe wyfe comynge waye ſtrōge herte voyde anone place thylke dowry ye brought take ayen graunt grace retourneth father houſe ꝙ man may alwaye haue proſperite wyth euen herte rede endure ſtroke fortune auenture ſhe ayen anſwerde pacience lorde ꝙ ſhe wote wyſt alwaye howe bytwyxte magnificence pouert man ne maye maken compariſon naye helde neuer dygne manere ben wyfe ne yet chamberere thys houſe ye lady made hye god take wytneſſe alſo wyſely ſoule glade helde neyther lady ne mayſtreſſe humble ſeruaunt worthyneſſe euer ſhal whyle lyfe may endure abouen euery worldly creature ye ſo longe benignite haue holde honour nobley worthy thanke god prey yelde ſey vnto father gladly wolde wende wyth hym dwel lyues ende foſtred chylde ful ſmale tyl deed lyfe wol lede wydowe clene herte body al ſythen yaue maydenhede trewe wyfe drede god ſhylde ſuche lordes wyfe take another man huſbonde make newe wyfe god hys grace graunt welth hygh proſperite wol gladly yeue place whych blyſful wonte ſythen lyketh lorde ꝙ ſhe whylom al hertes reſte ſhal gone ſhal go leſte ye profred ſuch dowayre fyrſt brought wel mynde wretched clothes nothing fayre wer ful hard finde oh good god howe gentel kynde ye ſemed ſpeche vyſage daye maked mariage ſoth ſayd algate fynde trewe effecte proued nowe loue olde newe certes lorde none aduerſite dyen thys caſe ſhal neuer euer worde worke ſhal repent yaue myne herte good entent lorde ye wote father place ye dyd ſtrype poore wede rychely ye cladde grace brought nought el drede fayth nakedneſſe maydenhede ayen clothynge reſtore eke weddynge rynge euermore remenaunt iewels redy wythin chambre dare ſafely ſayne naked father houſe ꝙ ſhe came naked mote turne agayne al pleaſaunce wolde folowe fayne yet hope entent ſmockleſſe paleys went ye coulde ſo dyſhoneſt thynge ylke wōbe whych chyldrē lay shulde people walkinge ſene al bare wherfore pray let lyke worme go way remembreth myne owne lorde ſo dere wife though vnworthy wherfore rewarde maydenhede brought ayen bere voucheſafe yeue mede ſuche ſmocke wonte therwith may wrie ye wombe wyfe take leue myne owne lorde leſt greue ¶the ſmock ꝙ yt thou haſt thy bake let ſtyl bere forthe wel vnneth worde ſpake went way routhe pyte folke ſelfe ſtrypeth ſhe ſmocke foote heed al bare towarde father houſe forth ſhe fare folke folowed wepyng wey fortune euer curſed gone ſhe fro wepyng kept eyen drey ne tyme worde ſpake ſhe none father tydinges herde anone curſed day tyme nature shope ben lyues creature doute olde poore man euer ſuſpecte maryage euer demed ſythen began whan lorde ifylled corage hym wolde thynke diſparage eſtate ſo lowe alyght voyden ſone euer might ¶ayenſt doughter haſtely gothe ye noyſe folk knew cōming olde cote might couered ful ſore wepyng body might bring rude clothe ſhe age dayes fele mariage ¶thus father certayne ſpace dwelleth floure wyſely pacience neuer wordes ne face byfore folke ne eke abſence ne ſhewed ſhe done offence ne hye eſtate remembraunce ne ſhe countenaunce wonder great eſtate goſte euer playne humylite tender mouthe ne herte delycate ne pompe ne ſemblaunce royalte ful pacience benygnyte diſcrete prideleſſe aye honorable huſbonde euer meke ſtable ¶men ſpeke iob moſt hūbleſſe clerkes whan hem lyſte wel endyte namely men ſothfaſtneſſe though clerkes prayſe woman lyte man humbleſſe hem aquyte woman ne halfe ſo trewe woman ben befal newe ¶explicit quinta par et ſequitur par ſexta fro boloyne erle pauy come whiche fame ſpronge leſſe people eeres al ſome couthe eke howe newe marqueſeſſe wt brought pompe ſuche richeſſe neuer ſene mannes eye noble aray weſt lumbardye▪ ¶the markes ſhope knewe al er yt erle come ſent hys meſſage thylke poore ſely griſyldis ſhe humble herte glad vyſage ſwellyng herte corage came heſte knee ſette reuerently wyſely ſhe hym grette ¶griſylde ꝙ wyl vtterly mayde wedded ſhal vnto receyued morowe al ſo royally poſſyble houſe eke euery wyght degre haue eſtate ſyttyng ſeruyſe alſo pleſaunt ye beſte deuyſe haue woman ſuffycient certayne chambres araye ordynaunce luſte therfore wolde fayne thyne al ſuche gouernaunce thou knoweſt eke olde al pleſaunce though thyn aray badde yuel beſey thou thy deuer leſte wey ¶not onely lorde glad ꝙ ſhe done luſte deſyre alſo pleaſe ſerue degre withouten faynyng ſhal euer mo ne neuer wele ne wo ne ſhal goſte wythin herte ſtent loue beſt wyth true entent yt word ſhe gan ye houſe dyght table ſette beddes make payned done al ſhe myght prayenge chamberers goddes ſake haſten hem faſt ſwepe ſhake ſhe moſte ſeruiſable hem al hath euery chambre arayed hys hal abouten vndren gan thys erle alyght wt hī brought theſe noble childrē twey whych people ranne ſe ſyght araye ſo rychely beſey erſte amonges hem ſey walter foole though hym leſt chaunge hys wyfe ye beſt ſhe fayrer demen al griſylde tender age fayrer frute bytwene hem ſhal fal pleaſaunce hye lynage brother eke ſo fayre hys age hi ſene ye people cauȝt pleſaūce comendyng markes gouernaūce ſterne people vnſad vntrewe aye vndiſcrete chaungynge fane delytynge euer rumer newe lyke moone euer waxe ye wane euer ful clappynge dere ynough iane dome falſe cōſtāce euel preueth ful great foole leueth thus ſayden ſad folke cyte people gaſed vp downe glad ryght wyth nouelte haue newe lady toun nomore thys make nowe mencioun griſylde ayen wol dreſſe tellen conſtaūce buſyneſſe wel buſy griſylde euery thyng feeſt appertinent right nauȝt ſhe abaſhed clothing though rude ſomwhat rent wyth glad chere yate went wyth folke greten marqueſeſſe doth ſhe forth buſyneſſe wyth ryght glad chere ye geſtes ſhe receiueth buromly euerych hys degre man defaute perceyueth euer wondren ſhe myght ſo poore araye ſe coulde ſuche honour reuerence worthely prayſen prudence al meane whyle ſhe ne ſtente thys mayden eke brother cōmēde wyth al herte benygne entente wel man coude pryſe amēde laſte theſe lordes wende ſytten adowne meate gan cal griſylde ſhe buſy hal griſylde ꝙ hys play howe lyketh wyfe beaute ryght wel lorde ꝙ ſhe good fay fayrer ſawe neuer none ſhe praye god ſo yeue proſperite ſo hope wol ſende pleſaunce ynough vnto lyues ende one thynge beſech warne alſo ye prycke wyth turmentynge thys tender mayden ye han mo ſhe foſtred noryſhynge tenderly ſuppoſynge coulde aduerſite endure coulde poore foſtred creature thys walter ſawe pacience glad chere malyce al ſo ofte hath done offence ſhe aye conſtante ſtable wal contynuyng euer innocence ouer al thys ſturdy markes gan hys herte dreſſe rewe vpon wyfely ſtedfaſtneſſe thys ynough griſylde myne ꝙ agaſte ne yuel apayde haue thy fayth thy benignite wel euer woman aſſayde great eſtate poorely arrayde nowe knowe dere wyfe thy ſtedfaſtneſſe armes toke gan keſſe ſhe wonder toke therof kepe herde thynge ſayde fared ſhe ſterte ſlepe tyl ſhe maſedneſſe abrayde griſylde ꝙ god v deyde thou arte wyfe none haue ne neuer god ſoule ſaue thys thy doghter yu haſt ſuppoſed ben wyfe none faythfully ſhal bē myn heyre haue dyſpoſed thou bare hem thy body truely boleyne haue kepte hem ſekerly take hem ayen mayſt thou ſay yu haſt lorne thy chyldren tway folke wyſe han ſayd warne hem wel yt haue done thys dede malyce ne cruelte aſſaye thy womanhede ſlee chyldren god forbede kepen hem priuely ſtyl tyl thy purpoſe knewe al thy wyl whē ſhe herd ſowne ſhe falleth pytous ioye ſownynge yonge chyldren calleth armes pytouſly wepynge enbraſed hem tenderly kyſſynge ful lyke mother wyth ſalte teeres bathed vyſage heeres whych pytous thynge ſe ſownynge pytous voyce graūt mercy lorde god thanke ꝙ ſhe ye haue ſailed chyldren dere nowe recke neuer deed ryght sythē ſtāde loue grace force deth ne ſpirite pace tendre dere yonge chyldrē myne woful mother wende ſtedfaſtly cruel hoūdes ſome foule vermyne eaten god hys mercy benigne father ſo tenderly hath done kepe ſame ſtounde al ſodainly ſhe ſwapte downe groūde ſwounyng ſo ſadly holdeth ſhe chyldrē two ſhe gan hem enbrace wyth great ſleyght dyfficulte chyldrē frō armes gan race many tere many pytous face downe ran hem ſtoden beſyde vnneth aboute myght man abyde walter gladdeth ſorowe ſlaketh ryſeth vp al abaſhed traunce euery wyght ioye feeſt maketh tyl ſhe hath caught ayen countinaunce walter doth ſo faythfully pleſaunce deynty ſene chere betwyxt hem two whē met yfere theſe ladyes tyme ſey han taken chambre gon ſtrypen rude arrey cloth golde bryght ſhone wyth crowne many ryche ſtone vpon heed hal brought ſhe honoured ſhe ought thus hath pytous day blyſful ende euery man woman doth hys myght thys daye myrth reuel dyſpende tyl welken ſhone ſterres bryght ſolempne euery mannes ſyght thys feeſt greater coſtage reuel mariage wel many yere hye proſperite lyuen theſe two concorde reſt rychely hys doughter maried vnto lorde one worthyeſt al itayle peace reſt hys wyues father hys courte kepte tyl hys ſoule hys body crepte hys ſonne ſuccedeth hys heritage reſte peace hys father day fortunate eke mariage al put hys wyfe great aſſaye thys worlde ſo ſtronge naye hath ben olde tymes yore herkneth thautour ſayth therfore ſtory ſaid ye wiues ſholde felowē griſyld al humilite importable tho wolde euery wyght hys degre sulde conſtante al aduerſite griſild wherfore petrarke writeth ſtory whych wt hye ſtyle endyteth ſythe woman ſo pacient vnto mortal man wel ought receyue al gree god v ſent great ſkyll preueth wrought ne tempteth man bought ſayeth ſaynt iame yf ye hys pyſtel rede preueth folke daye drede ſuffreth v exercyſe wyth ſharpe ſcourges aduerſyte wel ofte beaten ſondry wyſe knowe wyl certes borne knewe al frelte beſt al hys gouernaunce let v lyue vertuous ſuffraunce▪ one word herkneth lordynges ye go ful harde fynde dayes al countre griſyldes thre two yf put ſuche aſſayes golde hem hath ſo bad layes wyth braſſe though fayre eye wolde rather braſte two plye ye wyues loue bathe whoſe lyfe ſecte myghty god mayntene hygh mayſtry el ſkathe wyl wyth luſty herte freſhe grene saye ſonge glade wene let v ſtynte erneſt matere herkeneth ſonge yt ſayth thys manere ¶lenuoye de chaucer le mariz de noſtre temp griſylde deed eke pacience one buryed itayle crye open audience wedded man ſo hardy aſſayle hys wyues pacience truſte fynde griſyldes certayne ſhal fayle ¶o noble wyues ful hye prudence let humilite tonge nayle ne let clerke haue cauſe ne deligence wryte ſtorye ſuche maruayle griſylde pacient kynde leſt chechiface ſwalow entraile ¶foloweth ecco holdeth ſylence euer anſwereth countre tayle beth adaffed innocence ſharpely taketh gouernayle enprinteth wel thys leſſon mynde cōmen profyte ſythneſſe maye auayle ne dredeth hem doth hem reuerēce though thyn huſbād armed mayle arrowes thy crabbed eloquence shal perce hys breſt eke hys aduentayle ielouſye eke loke thou hym bynde yt ſhal make couch doth quayle yf yu fayre folke bene preſence shewe thou thy vyſage thyne apparayle yf thou foule fre thy dyſpence get frendes aye
