thy trauayle aye chere lyght lefe lynde let hym care wepe wrynge wayle ye archwyues ſtōdeth aye defence syth ye ſtronge great camayle ne ſuffreth men offence ye ſklendre wyues feble batayle beth eygre tygre inde aye clappeth myl counſayle ¶here endech clerkes tale oxforde foloweth wordes hooſt worthy clerk whē ended tale hooſt ſayd ſwore cockes bone leuer barel ale wyfe home herd legēde one thys gentle tale none purpoſe wyſte ye wyl thynge wol let ſtyl ¶here ende wordes hoſte foloweth frankeleyns prologue theſe old gētyll briton dayes dyuers auentures maden layes rymed fyrſt mother tonge layes wt inſtrumentes ſonge el reden hem pleaſaunce one hem haue remembraunce whyche ſhal ſaye wyllinge ſyrs bycauſe borel man begynnynge fyrſt beſeche haue excuſed rude ſpeche lerned neuer rethorike certayne thynge ſpeke mote bare playne ſlepte neuer mounte pernaſo ne lerned neuer marcus tullius cicero coloures ne knowe none withoutē drede ſuche coloures growen mede el ſuche men dyen paynte coloures rhetoryke ben quaynte ſpirite feleth ſuche matere thys tale yf ye wol ¶here endeth frankeleyns prologue ¶here begynneth frankeleyns tale armorike ye called britain knyght loued dyd hys payne ſerue ladyes hys beſt wyſe many labour many great empryſe hys lady wrought er ſhe wonne ſhe one fayreſt vnder ſonne eke therto cōmen hye kynrede wel vnneth durſt thys knyȝt drede tel hys wo hys payne dyſtreſſe laſte ſhe worthyneſſe namely hys meke obeyſaunce hath ſuche pyte caught hys penaunce priuely ſhe fyl hys accorde take hym huſbonde lorde ſuch lordſhip mē haue ouer wiues lede blyſſe lyues hys fre wyl ſwore knyght neuer al lyfe daye ne nyght ne ſhulde take vpon hym mayſtry agayne wyl ne kythe ielouſye obeye folowe wyl al louer hys lady ſhal saue name ſoueraynte wolde haue ſhame degre thāked ful great humbleſſe ſayd ſyr ſyth gentylneſſe ye profred haue ſo large rayne ne wolde god neuer betwyxte v twayne gylt eyther warre ſtryfe syr wol trewe humble wyfe haue trouth tyl herte breſte thus ben quiete reſte one thynge ſyrs ſafely dare ſeyne frendes eueryche muſt obeyne yf wol longe holden companye loue wol conſtrayned mayſtry mayſtry cōmeth god loue anone beateth hys wynges farewel gone loue thynge ſpirite free woman kynde deſyren lyberte conſtrayned thral ſo done men yf ſothe ſay ſhal loke moſte pacient loue hys auauntage al aboue pacience hye vertue certayne vaynquyſheth theſe clerkes ſayne thynges rygour ſhal neuer attayne euery word mē may chyde playne lerneth ſuffre el ſo mote gone ye ſhal lerne whether ye wol none thys world certayn • wyght ther ne doth ſayeth ſomtyme amys ire ſyckneſſe conſtellacion wyne wo chaungynge complection cauſeth ful often done amyſſe ſpeken euery wronge mā may wreken tyme muſt temperaunce euery wight gouernaunce therfore hath worthy wyſe knight lyue eaſe ſuffraunce hight ſhe hym ful wyſely gan ſwere neuer ſhulde defaut may men ſe humble wyſe accorde thus hath ſhe take ſeruant lorde seruaunt loue lorde mariage bothe lordſhip ſeruage seruage nay lordſhyp aboue sythen hath lady loue lady certes wyfe alſo lawe londe accordeth whan proſperite home wife goth coūtre nat fer fro dēmarke ther dwelling lyueth ioye ſolas coude tel wedded ioye eaſe proſperite bitwixt huſbande wyfe euermore laſted blyſful lyfe tyl knyght ſpeke thus caere iuda cleped arueragus shope dwel yere twayne englande cleped britayne ſeken armes worſhip honour al luſt ſette ſuche labour dwelt two yere boke ſaith thus ¶nowe wol ſtynt arueragus ſpeke wol dor • gen wyfe loueth huſbonde hertes lyfe abſence wepeth ſhe ſyketh theſe noble wyues whan hem lyketh mourneth wayleth faſteth playneth deſyre preſence ſo conſtrayneth al wyde worlde ſet ſhe nought frendes whiche knewe heuy thouȝt conforten al euer may prechen tellen night day cauſeles ſhe ſlewe ſelfe ala euery comfort poſſyble caas al buſyneſſe al maken leue heuyneſſe ¶by proceſſe ye knowē euerychone men mowen ſo longe grauen ſtone tyl ſome fygure therin printed longe han comforted tyl ſhe receyued hath hope reſon enprintyng conſtellacion great ſorow gā aſwage may alway induren ſuche rage eke aruyragus al care hath ſent letter home welfare wol come haſtely agayne el ſorowe herte ſlayne frendes ſawe ſorowe gan ſlake prayden knee goddes ſake come roman companye away driuen derke fantaſye fynally ſhe graunted requeſte wel ſhe ſawe beſte ¶nowe ſtode caſtel faſte ſee ofte frendes walked ſhe diſporte bankes hey ſhe may ſhyppes barge ſey salyng courſe hem lyſt go yet parcel wo ſelfe ful ofte ala ſayd ſhe ſhyppe ſo many ſe wol bring home lorde▪ thā herte wariſhed theſe bytter paynes ſmerte ¶another tyme wolde ſhe ſytte thynke caſte eyen downward fro brinke whan ſhe ſawe gryſly rockes blake feare ſo wolde herte quake fete ſhe myght ſuſtene wolde ſhe ſytte adown vpon grene pitouſly ſee beholde ſay right thus ſorouful ſykes colde ¶eterne god thy purueyaūce ledeſt worlde certayne gouernaūce ydle mē ſayn doſte thou nothing make lorde theſe griſly fendely rockes blake ſemen rather foule confuſyon werke fayre creacion ſuche parfyte god wyſe ful ſtable haue ye wrouȝt werke vnreſonable werke northe ſouth weſt ne eſte ny foſtred man byrde ne beſte dothe good anoyeth se ye lorde howe mākinde diſtroyeth hundred thouſande bodyes mankynde haue rockes iſſayn al mynde sin mākind ſo fayre aparte thy werke thou madeſt like thyn owne werke ſemed ye great cherte towarde mākynde thā may ye ſuche menes maken diſtroyen menes good euer anoyen ¶i wote wel clerkes wol ſayne hem leſt argumentes al beſt though ne cauſes wel knowe thilke god yt made wynde blowe kepe lorde concluſyon clerkes let al thys dyſputacion wolde god al theſe rockes blake ſonken hel hys ſake theſe rockes ſlee myne herte feare thus wolde ſhe ſay wt many pytous teare frendes ſawe dyſport roman ſee dyſcomfort ſhapen hem playen ſomwhere elles leden ryuers welles eke place delytables dauncen playen table daye ryght morowe tyde vnto gardeyne beſyde made ordinaūce vytayles purueyaunce gone playen hem al longe day thys ſyxte morowe may may hath paited wt ſofte ſhoures thys gardayne ful leues floures crafte mannes hande ſo curiouſly arayed thys garden truely neuer na garden ſuch pryſe yf paradyſe odour floures freſhe ſyght wolde haue made herte lyght euer borne yf gret ſickneſſe great ſorowe helde dyſtreſſe ful beautye wyth pleaſaunce dyner gone daunce ſynge alſo ſaue dorigene alone yet vnto ſelfe made mone ſhe ne ſey hym daunce go huſbande loue alſo nathelaſſe ſhe muſte tyme abyde wyth good hope let ſorowe ſlyde ¶vpon thys daunce amonge men daunced ſquyer dorigen freſher iolyer aray dome moneth may ſyngeth daunſeth paſſynge euery man ſythen worlde began therwythal men ſhulde hym dyſcriue one beſt farynge men lyue yonge ſtronge vertuouſe ryche wyſe welbeloued holden great pryſe ſhortly yf ſoth tel ſhal vnwetynge thys dorigene al thys luſty ſquyer ſeruaunt venus whych yclypped aurelius loued beſte creature two yere hys auenture neuer durſt tel hys greuaunce wythouten cuppe dronke al hys penaunce dyſpayred nothynge durſt ſay saue hys ſōges ſomwhat wold wray hys wo general complayninge ſaid loued beloued nothinge whych matter made many layes songes complayntes roundel verilayes howe durſte hys ſorowe tel languyſhe doth fury hel dye muſte ſayd dyd ecco narciſſus durſt tel hys wo ¶in maner ye herde ſay ne durſt hys wo bewray saue perauenture ſomtyme daunces yonge folke kepen obſeruaunces maye wel loked face ſuche wyſe men aſken grace nothynge wyſt ſhe hys entent natheleſſe happed er thence went bycauſe neyghbour man worſhyppe honour knowen hym tymes yore fel ſpeche ſo forth vnto hys purpoſe drowe aurelius ſawe hys tyme ſayd thus ¶madame ꝙ god yt world made yt wyſte yt myght herte glade wolde day aruyragus went ouer ſee aurelius went ther yt ſhuld neuer come agayne wel wote ſeruyce vayne guerdon ny breſting myne herte madame rueth vpon paynes ſmerte one worde ye may ſlee ſaue foote god wold yt graue ne haue nowe leyſer ſey haue mercy ſwete ye wol dey ¶she gan loke vpon aurelius thys wyl ꝙ ſhe ſaye ye thus neuer erſte ꝙ ſhe ne wyſt ye mente nowe knowe aurelius entente thylke god yaue ſoule lyfe ne ſhal neuer vntrewe wyfe word ne ī w • rke ferre haue wyt wol hys knyt take thys fynal anſwere thys play thus ſayd ſhe ¶aurelius ꝙ ſhe god aboue yet wol graunt ben loue sythen ſe ſo pytouſly complayne loke daye endelonge britayne ye remeue al rockes ſtone ſtone ne let ſhyppe ne bote gone ſay whē ye haue made theſe coſtes ſo clene rockes ny ſtone yſene wol loue beſt man • haue trouth al euer none grace ꝙ ¶no lorde ꝙ ſhe maked wel wote ſhal neuer betyde let ſuche foly herte glyde deyntye ſhulde man haue hys lyfe go loue another mannes wyfe hath body whē ſo hym lyketh ¶aurelius ful ofte ſore ſyketh wo aurely thys herde wt ſorowful chere thus anſwerde ¶madame ꝙ thys impoſſible mote dye ſodayne death horrible wyth worde turned hym anone ¶tho come frendes euerychone aleyes romeden vp doun nothynge wyſt thys concluſioun ſodeynly began reuel newe tyl bryght ſonne loſte hys hewe orizont hath • te ſonne light thys much ſaye nyght home gone ioye ſolas saue onely wretched aurelius ala hys houſe gone ſorowful harte ſayd myght hys death aſtarte hym ſemed felte hys herte colde vp heuen hys handes gan holde hys knee bare ſet hym adoun hys rauynge ſayd thys oriſoun wo hys wytte brayde ne wyſt ſpake thus ſayde pitous hert hath cōplaynt begonne vnto goddes fyrſt vnto ſonne ſayd god appollo gouernour euery plante herbe tre flour yeueſt thy declinacion ylke hem hys tyme ceſon thyne herberowe chaungeth lowe hye lorde phebus caſte thy merciable eye wretched aurelius whych lorne lo lorde lady hath death yſworne wythout gylte thy benignite vpon deadly herte haue ſome pyte wel wote lorde phebus yf ye leſte ye maye helpe ſaue lady beſte nowe vouche ye ſaue deuyſe howe may holpen wyſe ¶your blyſful ſuſter lucina ſhene ſee goddeſſe quene though neptunus hath deite ſee yet empreſſe abouen hym ſhe ye knowen wel lorde ryght deſyre quyckened lyghted fyre whych ſhe foloweth ful beſely ryght ſo ſee deſyreth naturally folowen goddeſſe ſee ryuers leſſe wherfore lorde phebus thys requeſt thys myracle myne herte breſt nowe nexte thys oppoſicion ſygne ſhalbe lyon prayeth ſo great floode brynge fyue fadome leſt ouer ſprynge hyeſt rocke armoryke britayne let thys floode dure yeares twayne rertes lady may ſaye holdeth heſte rockes ben awaye thys thynge may ye lyghtly done pray gone faſter courſe ye ſay thus prayeth ſ • ſter ſhe go faſter courſe ye yeres two ſhal ſhe ful alway ſpryng floode laſtyng nyght day ſhe vouchſafe ſuche manere graunt ſouerayne lady dere pray ſynken euery rocke adoun owne darke regioun vnder grounde pluto dwelleth neuer ſhal lady wyn thy tēple delphos wol barefote ſeke lorde phebus ſe teres cheke payne haue ſome compaſſioun wyth ye worde ſwoune fel adoun longe tyme lay traunce brother yt knew penaūce vp caught hym bed hym brought dyſpayred thys turmēt thought lette thys woful creature lye cheſe whether wol lyue dye ¶aruyragus wyth heale great honour chyualry floure comen home worthy men blyſful arte thou nowe dorigen haſt thy luſty huſbōde thyne armes freſhe knight ye worthy man armes thot loueth hys owne hertes lyfe nothynge lyſt hym ymaginatyfe yf wyght ſpokē loue therof dout entendeth ſuche matere dāceth luſteth maketh good chere thus ioye blyſſe let hym dwel woful aurelius wol tel ¶in langour tourment dyſpitous two yere lay wretched aurelius er fote erth myght gone ne comforte thys tyme none saue hys brother whych clerke knewe al thys wo al thys werke none creature certayne thys mater durſt worde ſayne vnder hys breſt bare ſecre euer dyd pamphilus galathe hys breſt hole wythout ſene hys herte aye arowe kene wel ye knowen ſurſanure ſurgery perlous cure mē myght touch ye arow come therby hys brother wepeth wayleth priuely tyl laſt hym fel remembraunce whyle orliaūce fraūce theſe clerkes yonge ben lykerous reden artes ben curiouſe seken euery halke euery herne perticuler ſcience lerne hym remembred vpon dey orliaunce ſtudye boke ſey magyke naturel whych hys felawe tyme bacheler lawe al lerne another crafte priuely vpon hys dere ylafte whych booke ſpake mochel aperacions touchynge xxiiij manſions longen moone ſuch folye dayes worth flye holy church ſayeth byleue ne ſuſtreth none illuſyon v greue thys boke remēbraūce anone ioye hys hyrte gan daunce hym ſelfe ſayd priuely brother ſhalbe waryſhed ſykerly ſyker ſciences whych men maken dyuers aparences suche theſe ſubtel tregetores play ofte feeſtes haue wel herde ſay tragetors wythin hal large haue made come water barge hall rowen vp doun somtyme hath ſemed grym lyoun ſomtyme floures ſprynge meede somtyme vyne grape whyte rede somtyme caſtel lyme ſtone hym lyked voyden hem anone thus ſemed euery mannes ſyght ¶now conclude thus yf yt myght orliaunce ſome olde felowe fynde moones manſions mynde magyke naturel aboue ſhuld wel make brother haue loue wyth apparaunce clerke may make mannes ſyght al rockes blake britayne yuoyded euerychone ſhyppes brynke comen gone ſuch forme enduren yere two brother waryſhed hys wo muſte ſhe nedes holde beheſt el ſhal ſhame leſt ¶what ſhuld make lenger tale thys vnto hys brother bedde comen ſuche comforte yaue hym gone orliaunce vp ſterte anone hys way forth yfare hope ben leſſed hys care ¶when comen almoſte ye cyte yf two furlonge thre yonge clerke roming ſelfe met whych latyn thryftely hem gret afterwarde ſayd wonder thynge knowe cauſe cōmynge er farther foote wente tolde hem al entente ¶thys breton clerke aſked felowes whych knowen olde dayes anſwered hym deed whych wept ofte ful many tere ¶downe horſe aurelius light anone wyth magicien forth gone home hys houſe made hym wel eſe hem lacked vytaile hem might pleſe wel arayed houſe one aurelius hys lyfe ſawe neuer none ¶he ſhewed hym went ſuppere foreſtes parkes ful wylde dere ſawe hertes wyth horne hye greateſt euer ſene wyth eye ſe hem hundred ſlaine hoūdes ſome arowes bled wt bytter woūdes ſawe voyded wylde dere theſe fauconers vpon fayre ryuere wyth haukes han heron ſlayne tho ſaw knightes iuſtyng playne thys dyd hym ſuche pleaſaunce hym ſhewed hys lady daunce ſelfe daūced hym thought whā maiſter yt magike wrouȝt sawe tyme clapped hōdes farwel reuel al ago remeued neuer houſe whyle ſawe al ſyght merueylouſe ſtudye bokes ſaten ſtyl wight thre ¶to maiſter called ſquyer ſayd hym thus redy ſupper almoſt hour vndertake sythen bade ſupper redy make whan theſe worthy men went ſtudye bokes ¶sir ꝙ ſquier whan lyketh al redy though ye wol right nowe ¶go ſuppe ꝙ beſt theſe amerous folke ſōtyme mote haue reſt ſupper fel trete ſomme ſhuld maiſters guerdon remeue al rockes britayne eke frō gironde mouth ſayne ¶he made ſtrāge ſwore ſo god ſaue laſſe thā thouſād poūde wold haue ne gladly ſomme nolde ¶aurelyus blyſful herte anon anſwerde thus fye thouſande poūde wyde worlde men ſay roūde wolde yeue yf ſorde bargayne ful driue knyt ye ſhal payde truely trouthe loke nowe negligence ſlouthe ye taryen v lenger morowe nay ꝙ clerke trouth borow ¶to bedde gon aurelius whan leſte wel nye alnight reſte labour hope blyſſe woful herte penaunce lyſſe▪ ¶vpon morowe whan day britayne toke right way aurelius magicyen beſyde ben diſcended wolde abyde boke dothe remembre colde froſty ceſon decembre ¶phebus waxed olde hewed ilyke laton afore hote declynacion shone ye brēning golde wt ſtremes bright nowe capricorne adowne lyght ſhone ful pale dare wel ſayne bytter froſte ſlidder rayne diſtroyed hath grene euery yerde ianus ſyt fyre double berde drinketh bugle horne wyne biforn ſtont braune tuſked ſwyne nowel cryeth euery luſty man ¶aurelius al euer dothe maiſter chere reuerence prayeth dyligence bryngen paynes ſmerte ſwerde wold ſlyt herte clerke ſuche routhe hath mā night day ſpedeth wayte tyme hys concluſyon ſay make illuſyon ſuche apparence iogelrye ne termes aſtrologye ſhe euery wight ſhulde wene ſay britayne rockes away el ſonken vnder grounde tyl laſte hath tyme yfounde make iapes wretchydneſſe ſuche ſuperſtycious curſydneſſe tollytan table forthe brought ful wel corrected hym lacked nought neyther collecte ne expans yeres ne rootes ne geres byn centrys argumentes proporcionel conuenyences equacions euery thyng eyght ſperes werkyng knew ful wel howe far alnath ſhoue fro heed thylke ſyxe aries aboue nynthe ſpere conſydred ful ſubtelly calked al whan founde hys fyrſt manſyon knewe remenaunt proporcion knewe ryſyng moone wele ſuche face terme euery dele knewe alſo obſeruaunces ſuche illuſyons ſuche miſchaunces hethen folke vſed thylke dayes whiche ne maked lenger delayes magike weke tway ſemed al rockes away ¶aurelius whiche diſpayred whether ſhal haue loue fare amys awayteth night day thys myracle whan knewe non obſtacle yt voyded theſe rockes euerychon downe maiſters fete fel anon ſayd woful wretche aurelius thanke lorde lady myne venus hath holpen fro care colde ye temple way forth hath holde knewe ſhulde lady ſe whan ſawe tyme anon right dredful herte humble chere salued hath ſouerayne lady dere ¶my rightful lady ꝙ woful man ſerue loue beſt lotheſt al worlde diſpleſe nere haue ſuche diſeſe muſt dye fete anon nought wold tel wome begō certes eyther muſte dye playne ye ſlee gyltleſſe payne dethe though ye haue routhe auyſen er ye breken trouthe repenteth ylke god aboue ye ſlee bycauſe loue madame wel ye wote ye haue hight chalenge thyng right ſouerayn lady grace garden yonde ſuche place ye wotte right wel ye heyght myn honde trouth plyght ye loue beſt god wotte ye ſayd ſo al vnworthy therto madame ſpeke honour ſaue myn hertes lyfe nowe haue done right ye commaunded yf ye vouchſafe ye may go ſe doth liſt haueth heſte mynde quicke deed right ther ye ſhal fynde lythe al lyue deye wel wote rockes ben aweye toke leue ſhe aſtonyed ſtode al face na droppe bloode wende neuer han come ſuch trappe ¶alas ꝙ ſhe euer ſhulde happe wende neuer poſſibylite ſuch miſter meruayle might ayenſt proceſſe nature home ſhe gothe ſorouful creature feare vnnethes may ſhe go wepeth wayleth day two ſwonneth routhe ſe wight tolde ſhe towne gon arueragus ſelfe ſhe ſpake ſayd thus complaynt ye ſhal face pale ſorouful chere ala ꝙ ſhe fortune playne vnware haſt wrapped ī thy chayne fro whiche eſcape wot ſocoure saue onely dethe el diſhonoure one theſe two behoueth cheſe natheleſſe yet leuer leſe lyfe body haue ſhame knowe ſelfe falſe leſe name dethe may quyt iwys hath many wyfe er many mayd iſlayn ſelfe ala rather body done treſpas certes lo theſe ſtories beren wytneſſe whan thurty tyrantes ful curſydneſſe ſtayne phidon athene feeſt commaunded doughters areſte bringen hem byforne hem diſpyte al naked fulfyl foule delyte father bloode dyd hem daūce vpon pauemēt god yeue miſchaunce theſe woful maydens ful drede rather thē wold leſen maydenhede priuely ben ſterte wel drenched hem ſelfe bokes tell meſſene let enquire ſeke lacidomony fyfty maydens eke wolde haue lechery none al company ſhe na ſlayne glad enten • cheſe rather dyen aſſent ben oppreſſed maydenhede ſhulde dye ben drede lo eke tyraunt ariſtoclides loued mayde yt hight symphalydes whan father ſlayne nyght vnto dyanes temple gothe ſhe anon ryght hente ymage armes two fro whiche ymage wolde ſhe neuer go wight might fro hondes race tyl ſhe ſlayne right ſelfe place ſythnes yt maydens ſuch diſpyte ben defouled mannes foule delyte wel ought wyfe rather ſelfe ſlee defouled thynketh ſhal ſay haſdruballes wyfe cartage byrafte ſelfe lyfe whā ſhe ſawe ye romanes wan town toke chyldren al lepte adown fyre cheſe rather dye roman dyd villanye hath lucrece iſlayne ſelfe ala rome ſhe oppreſſed tarquyne thought ſhame lyue whan ſhe loſt name eyght maydens meleſye alſo han ſlayn hem ſelue drede wo rather folke gaule ſhuld hē oppreſſe mo thouſande ſtories geſſe couthe nowe tel touchyng matere ¶whan abradas ſlayn wife ſo dere ſelfe ſlowe let bloode glyde abradas woundes brode wyde ſayd body leſte way ſhal wight defoule yf may ¶what ſhulde mo enſamples herof ſayn sythens ſo many han hem ſelfe ſlayn wel rather wolde defouled wol conclude beſt wel rather ſlee ſelfe ſome manere dyd demo • tious doughter dere bycauſe ſhe nolde defouled ¶o sedaſus ful great pyte reden howe thy doughters dyden ala ſlowen hem ſelfe ſuch maner caas great pyte wel theban mayden nychanore one macedone oppreſſed dethe maydenhede ſhe redreſſed ¶what ſhal ſayne nycerates wyfe ſuche caſe birafte ſelfe lyfe ¶howe trewe eke alcibyades loue dyen rather thees ſuffren body vnburyed ¶lo whiche wyfe alceſte ꝙ ſhe ſaythe homere good penelope al grece knoweth chaſtyte ¶parde laodomia written thus whā troy ſlayn protheſelaus lenger nolde ſhe lyue day ¶the ſame noble portia tel may withouten brutus couthe ſhe lyue ſhe al herte igyue ¶the parfyte wyfehode artemiſy honoured throughout al barbary ¶oh thenta quene thy wifely chaſtyte al wyues may myrrour ſame thyng ſaye bil • rodogone eke valeria ¶thus playned dorigene day twey purpoſyng euer ſhe wolde dey natheleſſe vpon thyrde nyght home came arueragus worthy knight aſked ſhe wepte ſo ſore ſhe gan wepen euer lenger ¶alas ꝙ ſhe euer borne thus haue ſaid ꝙ ſhe thus haue ſworn tolde al ye haue herde nedeth reherce ¶this huſbōde wt glad chere ſōdrie wyſe anſwerde ſayd ſhal deuyſe aught el dorigene ¶nay nay ꝙ ſhe god helpe ſo wy moche goddes wyl ¶ye wyfe ꝙ let ſlepe ſtyl may wel yet parauenture day ye ſhal trouthe holde fay god ſo wyſly haue mercy wel leuer ſtycked loue whiche haue yf ye ſhulde trouthe ſaue trouth hyeſt thyng mē may kepe worde braſt anon wepe ſaid forbyd payne dethe neuer while laſteth lyfe brethe wight tel miſauenture may beſte wol wo endure ne make countenaunce heuyneſſe folke may deme harme ne geſſe forthe cleped ſquier mayde gothe forthe anon dorigene ſayde bringeth ſuche place anone toke leue way gone ne wyſte ſhe thyder went nolde wight tel entent ¶this ſquier whiche hyght aurelius dorigen whiche ſo amerous auenture happed mete amydde towne right hye ſtrete ſhe wolde haue gon way forthe right towarde garden ſhe hyght garden warde alſo wel ſpyed whan ſhe wolde go houſe maner place thus met auenture grace ſalueth glad entent aſked whyther ſhe went ¶and ſhe anſwerde halfe ſhe madde vnto garden huſbonde badde trouthe holde ala ala aurelius gan wondren caas hert great compaſſyon chere lamentation aruyragus worthy knyght bade holde al ſhe hyght loth yt ſhe ſhuld breke trouth hys herte caught great routh conſydryng beſte euery ſyde fro luſte better abyde ſo hye churliſhe wretchydneſſe ayenſt fraunchiſe ayenſt al gentylneſſe whiche fewe wordes ſaid thus madame ſaythe lorde aruiragus ſythen ſe great gentylneſſe hym eke ſe wel diſtreſſe ye thus ſhuld holde trouthe certes thynketh great routhe haue wel leuer euer ſuffre wo departe loue bytwyxt two releſe madame honde quyte euery ſurement euery bonde ye haue made byforne sythens thylke tyme ye borne trouth plight ſhal neuer repreue beheſte take leue treweſt beſte wyfe euer yet knewe al lyfe euery wight beware byheſte dorigene remembreth leſte thus ſquyer done gently dede wel knyght withouten drede ¶she thonked hym vpon knee al bare home vnto huſbonde ſhe fare tolde al ye han herde ſayde ye ſyker ſo wel apayde vnpoſſible write ſhulde lenger caſe endyte arueragus dorigen wyfe ſouerayne blyſſe leden forthe lyfe neuer anger hem bytwene cheriſhed though ſhe quene ſhe trewe euermore theſe two folkes ye get nomore aurelius coſte hath al forlorne curſeth tyme euer borne ala ꝙ ala euer beheyght pured golde thouſand poūde wright vnto philoſopher howe ſhal ſe myne heritage nedes ſel ben begger may lēger dwel ſhame al kynrede place hym may get better grace natheleſſe wol hym aſſay certayne dayes yere yere pay thonke hym hys great curteſye trouthe wol kepe wol lye herte • ore gothe vnto cofer brought golde vnto phyloſopher value fyne hundred poūde geſſe hym beſecheth hys gentylneſſe graunt dayes remenaunt ſayd mayſter dare wel make auaunt fayled neuer trouthe yet ſykerly hette ſhal quyt towardes howe euer fare gon beggyng kyrtel bare wolde ye voucheſafe vpon ſuerte two yere thre reſpyte wel el mot ſel myne heritage tel philoſopher ſoberly anſwerde ſayd thus whan worde herde haue holde couenaunt vnto yes certes wel truely ꝙ haſte thou thy lady lyketh ꝙ ſorily ſyketh cauſe tel yf thou aurelius anon tale began tolde hym al ye han herde byfore nedeth reherce ſayd arueragus gentylneſſe leuer dye ſorowe diſtreſſe wyfe trouthe fals ſorowe dorigene tolde hym al howe lothe ſhe ben wycked wyfe ſhe leuer haue loſte lyfe yt trouth ſhe ſwore throug innocēce neuer erſte herde ſpeke apparence made haue ſo great pyte right frely ſent frely ſent hym agayne al ſome ny ſame philoſopher anſwerde leue brother eueriche dyd gentilly thou arte ſquier knyght god forbyd bliſful myght yf clerke coulde done gentyl dede wel drede syr releſe thy thouſande pounde thou crope grounde ne neuer er nowe haddeſt thou knowen ſyr wol taken peny al crafte ne nought trauayle thou haſte • payed right wel vitayle ynough farwel haue good day toke horſe rode forthe way lordynges queſtion wold aſke whiche moſte fre thynketh nowe telleth er ferther wende tale ende ¶here endeth frankeleyns tale begynneth ſeconde nonnes prologue myniſtre norice vnto vyces men clepen engliſhe idleneſſe porter yate delyces eſchue contrarie oppreſſe ſayne leful beſyneſſe wel ought entent leſte fende idleneſſe v hēt thouſande cordes ſlye contynually v wayteth clappe whan may man ydleneſſe eſpye ſo lightly catche trappe tyl man hente right lappe ni ware fende hath honde wel ought v werche ydleneſſe witſtonde though men dredden neuer dye yet ſe men wel reſon doutles ydleneſſe rote ſlogardye cometh neuer good encres ſythnes ſlouth holdeth hē lee ſlepe eate drynke deuouren al ſwynke put v ſuche ydelneſſe cauſe ſo great confuſyon haue done faythful beſyneſſe legende tranſlacion right thy glorious lyfe paſſyon thou wt thy garlōde wrought wt roſe lely mene mayd marter ſeynt cecely ¶and thou arte floure virgin bernarde lyſt ſo wel write begynnyng fyrſt cal thou comforte v wretch endyte thy maydēs deth yt wan thorow merite eternal lyfe fende victorie men may rede ſtorie thou maydē mother doughter thy ſōne thou wel mercy ſynful ſoules cure god boūte cheſe wōne thou humble hye ouer euery ceature thou nobleſt ſo farre ouer nature diſdayne maker kynde ſōne bloode fleſhe clothe wynde whiche cloyſtre thy bliſful ſydis toke mannes ſhappe eterne loue pee true compas lorde gyde heuen erthe ſee withouten le aye heryen thou virgyne wemles bare thy body dweldeſt mayden pure creatour euery creature aſſembled magnifycence mercy goodneſſe ſuche pyt thou arte ſonne excellence onely helpeſt hem prayenth often tyme thy benignyte ful frely men thyne helpe beſeche thou goeſt beforne arte lyues leche helpe thou bliſful meke fayre mayde flemed wretche deſerte gal thynke woman canane ſayd whelpes eaten ſome ye crōmes ſmal lordes table ben iſal though yt vnworthy doughter eue ſynful yet accepteth beleue ye fayth deed withouten werkis werche yeue wytte ſpace quyt ye place yt moſt derke thou arte ſo fayre ful grace myne aduocate hye place without ende ſonge oſanna thou chriſtes mother doughter anna thy light ſoule priſon lyght troubled contagyon body alſo wyght erthly luſte alſo falſe affection hauen refute ſaluacion hem ben ſorowe diſtreſſe helpe werke wol dreſſe yet pray reden write foryeueth dyligence ylke ſtorie ſubtelly endyte bothe haue wordes ſentence hym ſayntes reuerence ſtorie wrote folowen legende pray ye wol werke amende ¶fyrſt wol name ſeynt cecily expowne men may ſtorie ſe ſay engliſhe heuens lylly pure chaſtneſſe virgynite ſhe wytneſſe honeſte grene conſcience good fame ſote ſauoure lylye name cecily ſay way blynde ſhe enſample good techyng el cecily written fynde ioyned maner conioynyng heuen lya fyguring heuen ſet thought holyneſſe lya laſtyng beſyneſſe cecily may eke ſayd manere wantyng blyndneſſe great lyght ſapience thewes clere el lo maydens name bright heuen leo cometh whiche ryght men might heuen people cal enſample good wyſe werkes al leo people engliſhe ſay right men may heuen ſe ſunne moone ſterres euery way right ſo men goſtly mayden fre sawen faythe great magnanymite eke clereneſſe hole ſapience ſondrie werkes bright excellence right ſo theſe philoſophers write heuen ſwyfte rounde eke brēnyng right ſo fayre cecily whyte ful ſwyfte beſy euery good workynge rounde hole good perſeuerynge brennyng euer charyte ful bright nowe haue declared ſhe hight ¶here endeth ſeconde nonnes prologue begynneth tale mayden bright cecile lyfe ſayth comen romanes noble kynde ſo forthe foſtred vp fayth chriſt bare goſpel mynde neuer ceſſed written fynde prayere god loue drede beſechyng hym kepe maydenhede whan mayde ſhulde vnto man wedded ful yonge age whiche yeleped valeryan daye come maryage ful deuoute humble corage vnder robe golde ye ſate ful fayre next fleſhe yclad heyre whyles organ made melodye god alone thus herte ſonge ſhe lorde ſoule eke body gye vnwemmed leſte counfounded hi • loue dyed vpon tre euery ſeconde thirde day ſhe faſte aye byddyng oriſons ful faſte ¶the night came bedde muſt ſhe gone huſbonde often manere priuely ſhe ſayd vnto hym anon ſwete wel byloued ſpouſe dere counſayle ye wol right fayne wold ſayne ye enſure bewrayne ¶valeryan gan faſte vnto ſwere caſe ne thyng myght ſhulde neuer none bewrayen erſte thus hym ſayd ſhe haue angel whiche loueth wt gret loue ſo wake ſlepe redy aye body kepe yf may felen drede ye touche loue vylonye right anon wyl ſlee dede youthe thus ſhal ye dye yf ye clene loue gye wol loue clenneſſe ſhewe hys ioye brightneſſe ¶this valeryan corrected god wolde anſwerde ayen yf ſhal truſt let aungel ſe hym beholde yf aungel wol done thou haſte prayde yf thou loue another man forſothe right wt ſworde thā wol ſle ¶cecyle anſwerde anon wyſe ye luſte angel ſhul ye ſe ye trowe chriſt baptyſe gothe forthe v • apia ꝙ ſhe town ne ſtāt myles thre poore folke dwel say hem right thus ſhal tel tel hem cecyle hem ſende ſhewen good vrban olde ſecret nedes good entent whan ye ſaynt vrban han beholde tel hym wordes tolde whā hath purged fro ſynne ſhal ye ſe aungel er ye twynne valeryan place ygon right taught lerning founde holy vrban anon amonge theſe ſayntes buryals loutyng anon without taryeng dyd meſſage whan tolde vrban ioy gan hondes vp holde teres eyen let fall almighty god ieſu chriſt ꝙ sower chaſte counſayle hierde v al frute thilke ſede chaſtyte thou haſte ſowe cecyle take lo lyke beſy bee withouten gyle ſerueth aye thyne owne thral cecyle thylke ſpouſe ſhe toke newe ful lyke fierſe lyon ſhe ſendeth meke lambe ewe worde anon gan apere olde man cladde whyte clothes clere boke letter gold hōde gan byforne valeryan ſtonde ¶valeryan deed fel downe drede whan olde man ſawe ſtandyng ſo whiche forwith anon herde rede lorde faythe god withouten mo chriſtendom father al alſo abouen al ouer al euery theſe wordes al golde written whā radde thā ſayd olde mā leueſt thou thyng none ſay ye nay leue al thyng ꝙ valeryan vnder heuen wight ne thynke may sother thyng dare wel ſay tho vanyſhed olde man nyſt pope vrban hym chriſtened right ¶valeryan gothe home fyndeth cecilye within chambre aungel ſtonde aungel roſe lyllye crownes two whiche bare honde fyrſt cecyle vnderſtonde yaue one gan take valeryan make body clene wt vnwemmed thought kepeth aye wel theſe crownes ꝙ paradyſe haue hem brought ne neuer ſhullen rotten ne leſe ſwete ſauour truſteth ne neuer wight ſhal ſene hem eye chaſte hate vilonye thou valeryan thou ſo ſone aſſenteddeſt good counſayle alſo say yu lyſt thou ſhalt haue thy bone haue brother ꝙ valeryan tho world loue man ſo pray brother may haue grace knowe trouthe place angel anſwerd god lyketh requeſt bothe palme martyrdome shal ye come vnto bliſful feeſt ye word tyburce brother come whan ſauoure vndernome whiche roſes lylyes caſte within herte gan wonder faſte ¶and ſayd wōder tyme yere whence ſote ſauoure cometh ſo roſes lylyes ſmel though hem myne hondes two ſauour might deper go ſwete ſmel herte fynde hath chaunged al another kynde ¶valeryan ſayd two crownes haue snowe whyte roſe reed ſhyneth clere thyne eyen han might ſe thou ſmelleſt hem thrugh prayere ſhalt thou ſeen hem leue brother dere ſo thou wylte without ſlouthe byleue right knowe trouthe ¶tyburce anſwerd ſayeſt thou ſothneſſe dreme herken dremes ꝙ valerian han vnto tyme brother myne iwys nowe erſt dwellyng trouthe howe woſt thou quod tyburce wyſe quod valeryan ſhal deuyſe angel god hath ye trouth itaught thou ſhalt ſeen thou wilt reney ydols clene el naught myracles theſe crownes twey saynt ambroſe preface luſte ſey solempnly noble doctour dere cōmendeth ſaythe manere ¶the palme martyrdom receyue seynt cecile fulfylled goddes yefte world eke chambre gan ſhe weyu • witneſſe tyburce cecyles ſhrifte god bounte wolde ſhyfte crownes two floures wel ſmellyng made angel hē tho crownes bryng mayde hath brought hem bliſſe aboue world hath wiſt worth certal deuotion chaſtyte wel loue tho ſhewed cecyle al open playn al ydolles ben thynges vayne ben dombe therto ben defe charged hym hys ydoles lefe troweth beeſt quod tyburce yf ſhal lye kyſſed breſt whan ſhe herde ful glad couthe trouthe eſpye day take myne allye sayd bliſful mayden fayre dere ſhe ſayd ye may ¶lo right ſo loue chriſt ꝙ ſhe made thy brother wyfe right yt wyſe anon myn alye take sythēs thou wolte thyn ydoles diſpyſe go thy brother nowe baptyſe make clene ſo yt thou mayſt beholde angel face whiche thy brother tolde tyburce anſwerd ſaid brother dere fyrſt tel whyther ſhal • ſayd come forth wt good chere wol lede vnto pope vrban vrban brother myne valeryan ꝙ tyburce wylt thou thyder lede thynketh wonder dede ne meneſt thou vrban ꝙ tho ſo ofte dampned deed wonneth halkes fro dare one put forthe heed men ſhulde brenne fyre ſo reed founde men might hym ſpye alſo bere companye whyles ſeken thylke diuinite yhidde heuen priuely algate ybrent worlde ſhulde cecile anſwerde boldely men might drede wel ſkylfully lyfe leſe myne owne dere brother lyuing non better lyuyng place neuer ſhal loſte ne drede nought goddes ſōne v told grace father ſonne hath al thyng wrought al ye wrought ſkilful thought goſte father gan procede hath ſouled hym without drede worde myracle lo goddes ſoune whan worlde declared lyfe ther men may wōne anſwerde tyburce ſuſter dere ne ſaydeſt thou right nowe manere na one god lord ſothfaſtneſſe nowe thre howe may yu bere witneſſe ¶that ſhal tel ꝙ ſhe go right man hath ſapyences thre memorye engyne intellecte alſo ſuche beyng diuinite thre perſons may right wel tho gan ſhe ful beſily hym preche chriſtes ſonne paynes teche many poyntes paſſyon howe goddes ſonne thys worlde witholde mankynde playne remyſſyon bounde ſynnes care colde al theſe thynges ſhe vnto tyburce tolde tyburce good entent valeryan pope vrban went thonked god glad hert light chriſtned made place perfyte lernyng goddes knyght tiburce gate ſuche grace euery day ſawe tyme ſpace aungel god euery maner boone god aſked ſped ful ſoone ¶it ful harde order ſayne many wonder ieſu wrought laſte tel ſhorte playne ſergeaunt towne hem ſought hem byfore almache ye preuoſt brought whiche hem apoſed knewe al entent ymage iupiter hem ſent ſayd ſo wol ſacrifyce swappe heed ſentēce anon theſe martyr deuyſe one maximus officere prefectes councelere hem hent whā forth ſayntes ladde hym ſelfe wept pyte whan maximus herde ſayntes lore gate hem turmentours leue hem hys houſe withouten prechyng er eue gonne turmentour reue maximus hys folke echon falſe faythe trowen god alone ¶cecyle came whan woxen nyght preeſtes hem chriſtened al fere afterward whan day woxen light cecile hem ſayd ſober chere nowe chriſtes owne knyghtes leue dere caſteth al away werkes derkneſſe armeth armoure brightneſſe ye han ſothe ydone great batayle cours fayth hath conſerued gothe ye crowne life may fayle rightful iudge ye han ſerued shal yeue ye deſerued whan thing ſayd deuyſe men ladde hem forth done ſacrifyſe whā vnto place ibrought tel ſhortly concluſyoun nold enſence ne ſacrifyce right nought knee ſaten hem adoun humble herte ſadde deuocioun loſten bothe heedes place ſoules went kyng grace ¶this maximus yt ſaw thyng betyde pytouſe teres tolde anon right ſoules ſawe heuen glyde aungels ful clereneſſe lyght word cōuerted many wight almachius dyd hym ſo bete whyppes leede tyl lyfe gā lete cecyle hym toke buryed hym anone tyburce valeryan ſothly within buryeng place vnder ſtone almachius haſtely bad hys myniſters fetchen openly cecily ſo ſhe might preſence ſacrifyce iupyter encence conuerted wyſe lore wepten ful ſore yaue ful credence vnto worde cryden chriſt goddes ſonne without difference god ſentence hath ſeruaunt ſo good ſerue thus wt voyce trow though ſterue ¶almachius herde al doyng bad fetche cecily might ſe alderfyrſt aſkyng maner woman arte thou ꝙ gentylwoman borne ꝙ ſhe aſke ꝙ thought greue thy relygion thy byleue ¶ye haue bygon queſtion foliſhly ꝙ ſhe wolde two anſwers conclude one demaunde ye aſken leudly almachius anſwerde ſymilitude whence cōmeth thyn anſwere ſo rude whence ꝙ ſhe whā ſhe frayned conſcience good fayth vnfayned ¶almachius ſayd ne takeſt thou none hede power ſhe hym anſwerde thys might ꝙ ſhe ful lytel drede euery mortal mannes power ny ilyke bladder ful wynde iwys nedels poynte whan yblowe may al boſ • e layde ful lowe ful wrongfully beganſte thou ꝙ yet wronge thy perſeueraunce woſte thou howe mighty prince fre haue thus cōmaunded made ordinaunce euery chriſten wight ſhal haue penaūce yf criſtendome withſey gon al quyte yf wol reney ¶your prince erren noble dothe quod tho cecile wode ſentence ye make v gilty ſothe ye knowen wel innocence moche done reuerence chriſte bere chriſten name ye put v cryme eke blame knowen thilke name ſo vertuous may withſey almachius anſwerd cheſe one theſe two ſacrifyce chriſtendom reney thou may ſcapen wey worde holy bliſful mayde gan laught iuge ſhe ſayde ¶o iugge confuſed thy nycete wolte thou renye innocence make wycked wight ꝙ ſhe lo diſſymuleth audience ſtareth wodeth aduertence almachius ſayd ſely wretch thou woſt far miȝt may ſtretch hath mightye prince yeuen bothe power eke auctorite make folke dyen lyuen ſpekeſt thou ſo proudely ne ſpeke ſtedfaſtly ꝙ ſhe proudly ſay ſyde hate deedly thilke vyce pryde yf thou drede ſothe wol ſhewen al openly right thou haſt made ful great leſyng thou ſayſte thy prince han yeue might bothe ſlee eke quicke wight thou ne mayeſt lyfe byreue thou haſte non power ne leue thou mayſt ſay thy prince hā ye make • myniſtre dethe yf thou ſpeke mo thou lyeſt thy power ful naked doway thy boldneſſe ſayd almachius th • ſacrifyce goddes er thou go recke wronge thou profice ſuffre philoſopher thilke wronges may endure thou ſpekeſt goddes ꝙ cecile anſwerde nyce creature thou ſaydeſt worde ſythens thou ſpakeſt ne knewe therwith thy nycite thou euery maner wyſe leude offycer vayne iuſtyce lacketh nothyng thyne vtter eyen thou nart blynd thing yt ſeen al ſtone men may wel eſpyen ylke ſtone god thou wolte cal rede let thyn honde vpon fal taſte wel ſtone thou ſhalte fynde sen thou ſeeſt wt thyn eyen blynde ſhame people ſhal ſcorne laugh thy folye comenly men wotte wel ouer al mighty god heuens hye theſe ymages wel mayſte thou aſpye ne hem ſelfe may profyte effecte worthe myte ¶thus ſuche wordes ſayde ſhe woxe wrothe bad ſhe ſhulde lede home houſe houſe ꝙ brenne bathe flame rede bade right ſo done dede bathe gan faſte ſheten nyght day great fyre vnder beten al longe night eke day alſo al fyre eke bathe hete ſate al colde felte wo made droppe ſwete bathe lyfe ſhe mote lete almachie ful wicked entent ſleen bathe hys ſonde ſente thre ſtrokes necke ſmote tho turmentour maner chaunce might ſmyte al necke two tyme ordynaunce mā ſhuld perſon ſuch penaūce fourth ſtroke ſmyte ſofte ſore turmentour durſte ſmyte halfe deed necke ycoruē lette lye way went chriſten folke aboute ſhetes home ful fayre hente thre dayes lyued ſhe turmente neuer ceſed ſhe faythe teche ſhe foſtred hem ſhe gan preche hem ſhe yaue mouables thyng pope vrban bytoke hem tho ſayd aſked heuen kyng haue reſpyte thre dayes mo recōmaunde er go theſe ſoules might ſo werche myne houſe perpetuellyche cherche saynt vrban dekens priuely body fette buryed night amonge ſayntes honeſtly houſe churche ſaynt cecile hyght saynte vrban halowed wel might vnto day noble wyſe men chriſt ſayntes ſeruyce ¶here endeth ſeconde nonnes tale begynneth prologue chanons yeman whā ended lyfe ſaynt cecyle er fully rydden fyue myle boughton vnder blee v gan take man clothed clothes blake vnder whyte ſurplyſe hakeney al pomely gryſe ſwette wonder ſe ſemed pricked myles thre horſe eke yoman rode vpon ſwette vnneth might gon aboute paytrel ſtode fome ful hye fome flecked pye male twyfolde croper lay ſemed caryed lytel aray al lyght ſommer rode worthy man herte wondren began tyl vnderſtode howe cloke ſewed hode whan longe auyſed demyd ſome chanon hatte hynge backe alace rydden trot pace rode aye prickyng wode clote lefe layde vnder hys hode ſwette kepe heed fro hete inye ſe hym ſwete forheed dropped ſtyllatorie ful plantayne peritorie whan come gan crye god ſaue ꝙ ioly companye faſte haue pricked ꝙ ſake bycauſe wolde ouertake ryden mery company ¶his yoman eke ful curteſye ſayd ſyrs nowe morowe tyde hoſtery ſawe ryde warned lorde ſouerayne whiche ryden ful fayne diſporte loueth dalyaunce frēde thy warnīg god yeue ye good chāce ſayd hoſt certayne wolde ſeme thy lorde wyſe ſo may wel deme ful ſoconde alſo dare lay ought tel mery tale tway glade may companye ¶who ſyr lorde ye without lye myrthe eke iolyte ynough alſo ſyr truſteth ye hym knewe alſo wel ye wolde wonder howe wel thriftely couthe werke ſondrie wyſe hath taken many great empriſe ful harde bring aboute lere homely rydeth amonge ye knewe wold ben prowe ye nolde forgon aquayntaunce mochel good dare lay balaunce al haue poſſeſſyon man hye diſcreſſyon warne wel paſſyng wyſe man ¶wel ꝙ hoſte pray tel clerke non tel ¶a clerke nay greter thā clerke iwys sayd yoman wordes fewe hoſte crafte ſomwhat wol ſhewe ſay lorde ſuche ſubtelte al crafte ye may wete ſomwhat helpe yet worchyng al grounde rydyng tyl come caunterbury towne coulde al clene turne vp downe paue al ſyluer golde ¶and whan yoman thus ytolde vnto hoſte ſayd benedicite thyng wonder meruaylous sen thy lorde ſo hye prudence bycauſe men ſhuld hym reuerēce worſhyp recketh ſo lyte ouereſt ſloppe worthe • e effecte hym ſo go al bandy tore alſo thy lorde ſo ſlotlyche pray power better clothes bey dede acorde thy ſpeche tel beſeche ¶why ꝙ yeman wherto aſke ye god helpe ſo ſhal neuer ythe wol auowe ſaye therfore kepe ſecret praye wyſe fay beleue ouerdone nyl preue right clerkes ſayne vyce wherfore holde hym leude ny •• whan man hath ouer great wytte ful ofte happeth hym miſuſen dothe lorde greueth ſore god amende ſay ¶therof force good yeman ꝙ hoſt sen connyng thy lorde thou woſt tel howe dothe pray hertely sen ſo crafty ſo ſly dwellen ye yf tel ¶in ſubbarbes towne ꝙ lurkyng corner lane blinde theſe robber theues kynde holden priuy fearful reſydence dare ſhewen preſence fare yf ſhal ſay ſoth ¶yet ꝙ hoſte let talke tothe arte thou ſo diſcoloured thy face ¶peter ꝙ god yeue harde grace ſo vſed hotte fyre blowe hath chaūged colour trowe wonte myrrour prie ſwynke ſore lerne multiplye blondren euer pooren fyre al faylen deſyre euer lacken concluſyon moche folke illuſyon borowe golde pounde two ten twelue many ſommes mo make hem wene leſte way pounde coulde make tway yet falſe aye han good hope done grope ſcience ſo ferre v byforne mowe al though ſworne ouertake ſlytte away ſo faſt wol v make beggers laſte ¶whiles yeman thus ī talkyng chanon drewe nere herd al thing yeman ſpake ſuſpection mennes ſpeche euer chanon cato ſaythe gyltye demeth al thing ſpoke hym iwys bycauſe ge gan ſo nyghe drawe yeman herken al ſawe thus ſayd vnto yeman tho holde thy peace ſpeke wordes mo yf thou thou ſhalt ſore abye thou ſlaūdreſt thys companye eke dyſcouereſt yt thou ſhuldeſt hyde ¶ye ꝙ hoſt tel ſo euer betyde al hys threatyng recke myte ¶in fayth ꝙ lyte thys chanon ſawe wolde hys yeman wolde tel hys priuite fled away ſorowe ſhame ꝙ yeman ſhal ryſe game al anone wol tel sen gone foule fende hym quel neuer wol wyth hym mete peny ne pounde behete brought fyrſt vnto game er dye ſorowe haue ſhame erneſt fayth fele wel ſo man ſayeth yet al ſmerte al grefe al ſorowe laboure myſchefe couth neuer leaue wyſe nowe wolde god wytte myght ſuffyce tellen al longeth arte natheleſſe yet wol tel parte sen lord gone wol ſpare suche thynge knowe wol declare ¶here endeth prologue chanons yeman foloweth hys tale thys chanon dwelt ſeuen yere hys ſcience neuer nere haue loſt therby god wote ſo hath many mo wonte ryght freſh gay clothynge eke good aray nowe may weare hoſe vpon heed wher colour freſhe reed nowe wanne leeden hewe ſo vſeth ſore ſhal hym rewe ſwynke yet blered myne eye lo whych auauntage multiplye ſlydynge ſcience hath made ſo bare haue good yt euer fare yet endetted ſo therby golde haue borowed trewly whyle lyue ſhal quyte neuer let euery man beware euer maner man caſteth hym therto yf continue holde hys thryfte ydo helpe god therby ſhal neuer wyn empte purſe make wittes thyn thorow hys madneſſe foly hath loſt hys owne good ieopardy excyteth men therto leſe good hym ſelfe hath vnto ſhrewes ioye eſe haue felowes payne dyſeſe thus one lerned clerke yt charge wol ſpeake werke ¶when ſhal exercyſe eluyſh crafte ſemen wonder wyſe termes ben ſo clergial ſo quaynte blowe fyre tyl myne herte faynte ¶what ſhulde tel eche proporcion thynges whych werchen vpon fyue ſyxe vnces maye wel ſyluer ſome quantite beſye tellen name orpyment brent bone yron ſquames poudre grounden ben ful ſmall erthen potte howe put ſalt yput alſo papere byfore theſe poudres ſpeake wel ycouered wyth lampe glas moche thynge pottes glas englutynge ayre myght paſſe thynge eſy fyre ſmerte alſo whych made care wo matter ſublymynge amalgamyng calſenynge quycſyluer yclypped mercurye crude al ſleyght conne conclude orpyment ſublymed mercurye grounde lytarge eke porphirye eche theſe vnces certayne helpeth v labour vayne ne eke ſpirites aſſencioun ne yet matter lyen al ſyre adoun mowe werkynge nothynge auayle loſte al laboure trauayle al coſte twenty dyuel waye loſte alſo whych vpon laye ¶there alſo ful many thynge crafte apertaynynge though ordre hem ne reherce bycauſe leude man yet wol tellen hem come minde though ne ſette hem kynde bole armonyake verdegrece boras ſondry veſſels made erth glas vrinals dyſcenſories vyols croſſelettes ſublymatoryes concurbytes alembykes eke ſuche dere ynough leke nedeth reherce hem al water rubyfyeng bole gal arſneke ſal armoniake brymſtone herbes coulde tel eke many one egrimonye valerian lunarye ſuche yf lyſt tarye lampes brennyng nyght daye bryngē aboute craft yf maye fournyce eke calcinacion water albifycation vnſleked lyme chalke gleyre eye poudres dyuers aſhes donge pyſſe cley sered pokettes ſalt peter vytriole dyuers fyres made woode cole sal tartre alcaly ſal preparate combuſt mater coagulate cley made wt horſe dūge man heere oyle tartre al • n glas berme worte argo •• reſalgor mater enbybynge eke mater encorporynge ſyluer cytrination ſementynge eke fermentacion ingottes teſtes many mo wol tel taught alſo foure ſpirites bodyes ſeuen order ofte herde lorde nemene ¶the fyrſt ſpirite quycke ſyluer cleped ſeconde orpyment thyrde ywys sal armonyake fourth brymſtone ¶the bodyes ſeuen eke lo hem anone sol golde luna ſyluer threpe mar yron mercurye quyckſyluer clepe saturnus leede iupiter tynne venus coper father kynne ¶thys curſed crafte ſo wol exercyſe ſhal good haue may hym ſuffyſe al good ſpendeth theraboute leſe ſhal therof haue doute ſo lyſten vtter hys folye let hym come forth lerne multiplye euery man hath aught hys cofer let hym apere philoſopher aſkaunce crafte ſo lyght lere nay nay god wote al monke frere preeſt chanon wyght though ſyt boke day nyght lernynge thys eluyſhe nyce lore al vayne parde moche lere leude man thys ſubtelte fye ſpeake therof wol al coulde lettrure coulde none effecte ſhal fynde al one two ſaluacion concluden multiplicacion lyche wel haue al ydo thys ſayne faylen two ¶yet forgate moche reherſayle water coroſyfe lymayle bodyes mollifycacion alſo induracion oyles ablucions metal fuſyble tellen al wolde paſſe byble wherfore beſte al theſe name nowe wol reſte trowe haue tolde ynowe reyſe fende al loke neuer ſo rowe ¶a nay let phyloſophers ſtone alixer cleped ſeken faſte echeone thē ſyker ynowe vnto god heuen make auowe al crafte han al ydo al ſleyght wol come v hath made v ſpende moche good ſorow almoſt waxē wood good hope crepeth herte suppoſynge euer though ſore ſmerte ben releued hym afterwarde suppoſynge hope ſharpe harde warne wel ſyken euer future temp hath made men dyſceuer truſt therof euer yet arte coulde waxe ſad vnto hym bytter ſwete ſemed ne ſhete yt myght wrappē thē anyght bratte walken daye lyght wolden hem ſel ſpēde craft conne ſtynte tyl nothynge laft euer euer gone men may hem ken ſmel brymſtone al worlde ſtynken gote ſauour ſo rammyſh ſo hote though man myle hem ſauour wol enfecte hym truſteth lo thus ſmellyng thred bare aray yf men lyſt thys folke knowe may yf man wol aſke hem priuely clothed ſo vnthryftely ryght anone wol rowne hys ere ſayne yf aſpyed men wolde hem ſlee bycauſe ſcience lo thus theſe folke bytrayen innocence paſſe ouer thys go tale vnto ¶er potte fyre ydo metalles wyth certayne quantyte lorde hem tempreth man nowe gone dare ſaye boldely men ſayne craftely algate wotte wel hath ſuche name yet ful ofte renneth blame wote ye howe ful ofte happeth ſo potte breketh farewel al go theſe metalles ben ſo great violence walles may make hem reſyſtence yf wrought lime ſtone percen ſo wal gone ſome hem ſynken grounde thus haue loſt tymes many poūde ſome ſcatered al floore aboute lepen rofe wythouten doute tho yt fende ſyght hym ſhewe trowe v ylke ſhrewe hel lorde ſyre ne wo ne angre ne yre potte broke haue ſayd euery man chyte holte hym yuel apayde ſayd longe fyre makyng ſayd nay blowyng ferde myn offyce ¶strawe ꝙ thyrde ye ben leude nyce tempred ought ¶nay ꝙ fourth ſtynte herken bycauſe fyre made beche cauſe none ſo theche tel wheron alonge wel wote great ſtryfe v amonge ꝙ lord ther ny done theſe perylles wol beware efte ſone ryght ſyker potte craſed maye ye amaſed vſage let ſwepe floore ſwythe plucke vp hert glad blythe mullocke heape yſwepte floore caſte canuas al thys mulloke ſyue ythrowe yſyfted aplucked many throwe parde ꝙ one ſomwhat metall yet though haue tho thyng miſhapped hath tyme may ben wel ynow put good auenture marchaunt parde maye aye endure truſteth wel hys proſperite somtyme hys good drowned ſee ſomtyme cometh ſafe vnto londe peace ꝙ lord ye next tyme wol fonde brynge crafte al plyte ſyrs let haue wyte defaute ſomwhat wel wote ¶an ſayd fyre ouer hote hote colde dare ſaye concluden euer amys faylen whych wolde haue madneſſe euer raue together euerychon euery man ſemeth wyſe salomon al thyng whych ſhyneth ye golde golde haue herde tolde ne euery appel fayre eye ny good ſo men clappe crye ¶ryght ſo fareth amonge v ſemeth wyſeſt ieſus mooſt foole cometh prefe ſemeth trueſt thefe ſhal ye know er wēde tale haue made ende ¶there chanon religioun amonges v wolde enfecte al toun though great niniue rome alyſaundre troye thre hys ſleyght hys infinite falſneſſe couth man wryten geſſe though might lyue thouſand yere al thys worlde falſneſſe ny hys pere hys termes wol hym ſo wynde ſpeake hys wordes ſo ſlye kynde comen ſhal wyth wyght wol make hym dote anone ryght fende hym ſelfe ful many man hath begyled er thys mo wol yf may lyue whyle yet men ryden gone ful many myle hym ſeke haue aquayntaunce knowynge hys falſe gouernaunce yf ye luſt gyue audience wol tellen preſence ¶but worſhypful chanons religiouſe ne demeth ſclaunder houſe al though tale chanon euery ordre ſome ſhrewe parde god forbyd al companye shulde rue ſyngler mannes folye ſlaunder myne entente correcte myſſe mente thys tale tolde eke mo ye wote wel howe amonge chriſtes apoſtles twelue ther traytour iudas hym ſelue ſhulde remnaūt haue blame gyltleſſe ſaye ſame saue thys yf ye wol herken yf iudas couent remeueth hym betyme rede yf ſhame loſſe may cauſen drede nothynge dyſpleaſed praye thys caſe herkeneth ſaye londen preeſt annuellere therin dwelt many yere whych ſo pleaſaunt ſo ſeruyſable vnto wyfe table ſhe wolde ſuffre hym nothynge pay borde ne clothyng went neuer ſo gay ſpendynge ſyluer ryght ynowe therof force wol procede nowe tel forth tale chanon brought thys preeſt confuſyon ¶thys falſe chanon came vpon daye vnto thys preeſtes chambre laye beſechynge hym leue hym certayne golde wolde quyte hym ayen leueth marke ꝙ dayes thre daye wol quyte yf ſo chat thou fynde falſe another daye hange halfe preſt toke marke ſwyth thys chanon hym thanked ofte ſyth toke hys leaue went forth hys wey thyrde daye brought hys money thys preeſt toke thys golde acyen wherof thys preeſt glad fayn ¶certes ꝙ nothynge anoyeth leue man noble two thre thynge poſſeſſion ſo trewe condicion wyſe breke wol hys daye ſuche man neuer ſaye naye ꝙ chanon ſhulde vntrewe nay thynge fallen newe trouth thynge wol euer kepe vnto daye whych ſhal crepe graue el god forbede beleueth thys ſyker crede god thanke good tyme ſayde na neuer man yet yuel apayde golde ne ſyluer lent ne neuer falſhede myne herte ment ſyr ꝙ nowe priuete sen ye ſo goodlyche haue ben kythe ſo great gentylneſſe somwhat quyte kyndeneſſe wol ſhewe yf ye wol lere ſhal ſhewe anon right howe werche philoſophye taketh good hede ye ſhal ſe eye wol done maiſtrye go ¶ye ſyr ꝙ preeſt wol ye ſo marye therof pray hertely ¶at cōmaundement ſer truely ꝙ chanon el god forbede lo howe thefe couthe ſeruyce bede ful ſothe ſuche profered ſeruyſe stynketh wytneſſeth olde wyſe ful ſone wol verifye chanon rote al trecherie euermore delyte hath gladneſſe fendely thoughtes hert empreſſe chriſtes people may miſchefe bring god kepe v falſe diſſymulyng ¶what wyſt thys preeſt wt yt delte ne hys harme cōmyng nothyng felte ſely preeſt ſely innocente couetyſe anon thou ſhalte blente graceleſſe ful blynde thy conceyte nothyng arte thou ware hys diſceyte foxe hath ſhapen wylye wrench thou mayſte fle wherfore go concluſyon referreth thy confuſyon vnhappy man anon wol hye tel thyne vnwytte ne thy folye eke falſneſſe wretche ferforthe connyng wol ſtretche ¶this chanon lord ye wolde wene syr hoſt faythe heuen quene another chanon hundred folde ſubtelte hath betrayed folke many tyme falſneſſe doleth ryme euer whan ſpeke hys falſeheed ſhame hym chekes waxen reed algates begynnen glowe redneſſe haue non right wel knowe viſage ſumes dyuerce metal whiche ye haue herde reherce conſumed waſted hath redneſſe nowe take hede chanons curſydneſſe syr ꝙ preeſt let man gon quick ſyluer anon let hym brynge vnces two thre whan cōmeth faſte ſhul ye ſe wonder thyng ye ſaw neuer er syr ꝙ preeſt ſhal done iwys badde ſeruaunt fetch thyng al redy hys byddyng went forth came anon agayne quickſyluer ſhortly ſayne toke theſe vnces thre chanoun hem layde wel fayre adoun bade ſeruaunt cole bryng anon might go hys werkyng ¶the cole right anon yfet chanon toke croſſelet boſome ſhewed preeſt inſtrument ꝙ thou ſeeſt take thy honde put thy ſelfe therin quickſyluer vnce begyn name chriſt wexe philoſopher ful fewe whiche wolde profer ſhewe hem moche ſcience ſhul ye ſe experience quickſyluer wol mortifye right ſyght anon withouten lye make good ſyluer fyne purſe myne el make malliable el holde falſe vnſtable amonges folke euer appere ¶i haue poudre coſte dere shal make al good cauſe al connyng whiche ſhewe ſhal voydeth man let therout ſhette dore whyles ben aboute priuetie man v eſpye whyles werken philoſophye al bade fulfylled dede ylke ſeruaunt anon yede hys maiſter ſhette dore anon labour ſpedily gon preeſt curſed chanons byddyng vpon fyre anon ſet thyng blewe fyre beſyed hym ful faſte chanon croſlet caſte pouder wherof ymade eyther chalke erthe glaſſe ſomwhat el worthe flye blynde preeſt badde hym hye theſe cole couchen al aboue croſſelet token loue quod chanon thyne hondes two shal werke al thyng ſhal graunt mercy ꝙ preeſt ful glad couched cole chanon bad whyle buſy thys fēdely wretch thys falſe chanon foule fende fetch hys boſome toke bechen cole whych ful ſubtelly made hole therin put ſyluer limayle vnce ſtopped wythout fayle hole wyth waxe kepe limayle vnderſtandeth thys falſe gyn made made thynges ſhal tel hereafter whych wyth brought er came begyle hym thought ſo dyd er wente twynne tyl turned hym could blynne dulleth hym ſpeke hys falſhede fayne wolde wreke yf wyſt howe ſo variaunt hydeth ¶but taketh hede ſyrs goddes loue toke hys cole whych ſpake aboue hys hande bare priuely whyles preeſt couched beſely cole tolde er thys thys chanon ſayd frende ye doue amys thys couched ought ſone ſhal amende ꝙ nowe let medle therwyth whyle haue pyte ſaynt gyle ye ben ryght hotte ſe wel howe ye ſwete haue cloth wype awaye wete whyle preeſt hym wyped hace chanon toke cole ſhrewe face layde abouen vpon mydwarde croſlet blewe well afterwarde tyl cole gonne faſte brenne ¶nowe yeue v drynke ꝙ thys chanō ſwyth al ſhall wel vndertake sytte downe let v mery make thys chanons bechen cole brent al limayle hole croſſelette anone fel adoun ſo muſte nedes reſoun sen ſo euen aboue couched therof wyſt preeſt nothynge ala demed al cole lyche goode ſleyght nothynge vnderſtode whē thys alkamyſtre ſawe tyme ryſeth vp ſyr preeſt ꝙ ſtandeth wote wel yngot haue none goth walketh forth brynge chalke ſtone wol make ſame ſhappe yngot yf maye haue happe brynge eke wyth bolle panne ful water ye ſhal ſe thanne howe buſyneſſe ſhal happe preue yet ye ſhal haue myſbeleue ne wronge conceyte abſence wol ben preſence go wyth come wyth agayne chambre dore ſhortly ſayne opened ſhette went forth wey forth wyth hem caryed key comen ayen wythouten delaye ſhulde tarye al longe daye toke chalke ſhope wyſe yngot ſhal deuyſe ſaye toke hys owne ſleue teyne ſyluer yuel mote cheue whych vnce weyght taketh hede nowe hys curſed ſleyght ſhope hys yngot lenght brede teyne wythouten drede ſlyly preeſt aſpyde hys ſleue agayne gan hyde fyre toke vp hys matere yngot put wyth mery chere water veſſel caſte hym lyſt bad preeſt faſte loke ther put thyn hāde grope thou ſhalt fynde ſyluer hope dyuel hel ſhulde el shauynge ſyluer ſyluer parde put hys hande toke vp reyne ſyluer fyne glade euery vayne thys preeſt ſawe ſo goddes blyſſynge hys mother alſo al hallowes haue ye ſyr chanon sayd thys preeſt malyſon ye vouchſafe teche thys noble crafte thys ſubtelte wol al euer may ꝙ chanon yet wol make aſſay ſeconde tyme ye mowe take hede ben expert thys nede another daye aſſay myne abſence thys dyſciplyne thys crafty ſcience lette take another ounce ꝙ tho quycke ſyluer wythouten wordes mo done therwyth haue done er thys wyth whych nowe ſyluer ¶thys preeſt hym beſyeth al done thys chanon thys curſed man commaunded hym faſte blewe fyre come effecte deſyre chanon right mean al redy preeſt efte begyle countynaunce honde bare holowe ſticke take kepe beware thende vnce ſyluer lymaile putte al cole ſtopped wexe wele kepen lymaile euery dele while peeſt beſyneſſe chanon ſticke gan dreſſe hym anon pouder caſt dyd erſt deuyl hys ſkyn torne praye god falſhede euer falſe thought dede ſticke aboue croſſelette ordayned falſe iette ſtyrreth cole tyl al relent gan waxe agayne fyre euery man fole wot wel mote nede al hole yede croſſelet haſtely fel preeſt ſuppoſed nothynge wel beſyed hym faſte wonder fayne suppoſyng nought trouth ſoth ſayn ſo glad nat expreſſe manere hys myrthe gladneſſe chanon profered efte ſone body good ye ꝙ chanon anone tho poore crafty thou ſhalt fynde warne yet behynde coper within ſayd ¶ye ſyr ꝙ preeſt trowe el go bye ſome aſwythe nowe good ſyr go forth thy way hythe ¶he went way ye coper came chanon honde name coper wayed vnce al ſymple tonge pronounce minyſtre wytte doubleneſſe chanon rote al curſydneſſe ſemed frēdly hem yt knew nought fendly werke thought weryeth tel hys falſeneſſe natheleſſe yet wol expreſſe entent men may beware therby none cauſe truely ¶he put vnce coper croſſelet fyre ſwythe hath ſette caſt pouder made ye preeſt blowe workyng ſtoupe lowe dyd erſte al na iape ryght hym lyſt ye preeſt made hys ape afterwarde yngot caſte panne put laſte water put hys owne honde hys ſleue ye beforehonde herde tel ſyluer teyne ſlily toke thys curſed heyne vnwetynge thys preeſt hys falſe crafte pannes botome hath lafte water rombleth fro wonder priuely toke vp alſo coper teyne knowynge thys preeſt hyd hent hym breſt hym ſpake thus ſayd hys game stoupeth adowne god ye blame helpeth nowe dyd wylere put honde loketh ¶this preeſt toke vp ſyluer teyne anon ſayd chanon let v gon theſe thre teines han wrouȝt ſome goldſmyth wete yf ought fayth nolde hoode yf ſyluer fyne good ſwyth proued ſhalbe ¶vnto ye goldſmyth theſe teynes thre went put aſſaye fyre hāmer might man ſay naye ought ſotted preſt gladder thē neuer byrde gladder ayenſt day ne nyghtyngale ayenſt ceſon may neuer none lyſte better ſynge ne lady luſtyer carollynge ſpeake loue womanhede ne knyght armes hardy dede ſtanden grace hys lady dere thys preeſt thys crafte lere chanon thus ſpake ſayd loue god v al deyd may deſerue vnto ſhal receit coſt telleth nowe ¶by lady ꝙ thys chanon dere warne wel ſaue frere englande man make force ꝙ nowe ſyr goddes ſake ſhall paye tel praye wy ꝙ ful dere ſaye syr one worde yf ye lyſt haue ye ſhal pay fourty pounde ſo god ſaue nere frendſhyp ye dyd er thys ye ſhulde paye ywys ¶this preeſt ye ſūme fourty poūde anone noble fette tolde hem euerychone thys chanon thys ylke receyte al hys worchynge fraude dyſceyte sir preſt ſaid kepe haue loo crafte wolde kept cloos ye loue kepeth ſecre men knowe al ſubtelte god men wolde haue ſo great enuye bycauſe philoſophye ſhulde deed none way ¶god forbyd ꝙ preeſt ye ſay yet leuer ſpende al good whych haue el waxe wood ye ſhulde fallen ſuche myſchefe good wyl haue ye ryght good prefe ꝙ chanon farewel graunt mercy went hys way neuer preeſt hym ſey day thys preſt ſholde maken aſſay ſuch tyme wolde thys receyte farewel nolde lo thus iaped begyled thus maketh hys introduction brynge folke deſtruction conſydereth ſyrs howe eche eſtate betwyxt men golde debate ferforth vnnethes none thys moultiplyenge blyndeth ſo many one good fayth trowe greateſt cauſe ſuche ſcarſite theſe phyloſophers ſpeaken ſo myſtely craft men come therby wytte men haue dayes may wel chattre iāgle ye iayes termes ſet luſte payne purpoſe ſhul neuer attayne man may lyghtly lerne yf haue ought multiplye brynge hys good nought lo ſuche lucre thys luſty game man myrth wol turne al grame empten alſo great heuy purſes maken folke purchaſe curſes hem han alſo good ylente fye ſhame han brente ala flye fyres hete ye vſen rede ye lete leſt yt ye leſen al better thē neuer late neuer thryue longe date though yt ye prolle aye ye ſhal neuer fynd ye ben bolde bayarde blynd blōdereth forth peryl caſteth none bolde renne ayenſt ſtone go beſyde waye faren ye multiplyen ſaye yf eyen ſene aryght loketh mynde lacke ſyght though ye loke neuer ſo brode ſtare ye ſhal wynne myte chaffare waſt al ye may repe renne wythdrawe fyre leſte faſt brenne medleth wyth arte mene yf ye done thryfte gone ful clene ryght ſwyth wol tellen yt philoſophers ſayn matere ¶lo thus ſayeth arnolde new toun hys roſarye maketh mencioun ſayeth ryght thus wythouten lye may man mercurye mortifye yf wyth hys brother knowlegyng lo howe yt whych fyrſt ſayde thys thyng philoſophers father hermes ſayeth howe dragon doutles ne dyeth yf ſlayne wyth hys brother thys ſayne dragon mercurye none vnderſtode yt brimſtone brother sol luna ydrawe therfore ſayd take hede ſawe let mā buſye hym arte ſeche entencion ſpeche philoſophers vnderſtande yf lende man thys ſcience thys connyng ꝙ ſecre ſecres parde ¶alſo dyſciple plato tyme ſayd hys mayſter hys boke semor wol bere wytneſſe thys hys demaūde ſothfaſtneſſe tel name preuy ſtone ¶and plato anſwered vnto hym anone take ſtone tytanos men name ¶whych ye ꝙ magnatia ſame sayd plato yea ſyr thus thys ignotum per ignotius magnatia good ſyr pray ¶it water made ſay elementes foure quod plato ¶tel roche good ſyr ꝙ tho water yf wyl nay nay ꝙ plato certayne nyll philoſophers yſworne echone ſhulde dyſcouer vnto none ne boke wryte manere vnto chriſt ſo lefe dere wol dyſcouered lyketh hys deite man enſpyre eke defende hym lyketh lo thys ende ¶then conclude thus ſens ye god heuē ne wyl phyloſophers nemen howe mā ſhal come vnto thys ſtone rede beſt let gone ſo maketh god hys aduerſarye werch thynge contrarye vnto hys wyl certes neuer ſhal thriue though multiplye terme lyue poynte ended tale god ſende euery true man bote hys bale ¶here endeth tale chanons yeman foloweth doctour phiſykes prologue thys yeman hys tale ended thys falſe chanon whych ſo bad hoſte gan ſaye truely certayne thys preeſt begyled ſothe ſayne wenynge philoſopher tyl ryght golde lefte hys cofer ſothly thys preeſt alther iape thys curſed chanon put hys hode ape al thys paſſe ouer syr doctour phiſyke yet pray tel v tale ſome honeſte matere ſhalbe done yf ye wol sayd thys doctour hys tale began anone good mē ꝙ herkeneth euerychone ¶here endeth doctour phiſykes prologue begynneth hys tale telleth v tytus liuius knyght clypped virginius fulfylled honour worthyneſſe ſtronge frendes rycheſſe doughter hys wyfe neuer mo al hys lyfe fayre thys mayde excellent beaute abouen euery wyght man may ſe nature hath wyth ſouerayne diligence formed ſo great excellence though ſhe wolde ſay lo nature thus forme paynt creature lyſte counterfete pigmaliō though alway forge bete graue paynte dare wel ſayne appelles zeuſis ſhulde werche vayne graue paynte forge bete yf preſumed counterfete former principall hath made hys vycar generall fourme paynte erthely creaturis right lyſte al thyng cure vnder moone may wane waxe werke nothyng wol axe lorde ben fully corde made worſhyp lorde al myne creature coloure fygures thus ſemeth nature wolde ſay mayd age twelue yere tway nature hath ſuche delyte right ſhe paynte lyllye whyte rody roſe right ſuche paynture paynted hath noble creature er ſhe borne vpon lymmes fre al bright ſuche colour ſhulde phebus died treſſes grete lyke ſtremes burned hete yf excellent beaute thouſande folde vertuous ſhe ne lacketh conditioun preyſe diſcretioun wel body goſt chaſte ſhe whiche ſhe floured virginite al humylyte abſtynence al attemperaunce pacience meſure eke beryng array diſcrete ſhe anſweryng alway tho ſhe wyſe pallas dare ſayn faconde eke ful womanly playn counterfayted termes ſhe ſeme wyſe degree ſpake al wordes leſſe sownyng vertue gentylleſſe shamfaſt ſhe ī maydēs ſhamfaſtneſſe conſtant hert euer buſyneſſe dryue al ſlogardry bacchus mouthe maiſtry wyne youth done venus encrece men fyre wol caſten oyle grece owne vertue vnconſtrayned hath ful ofte ſicke yfayned ſhe wolde ſlye company lykely treten foly feeſtes reuels daunces ben occaſyons dalyaunces suche thynges maken chyldren ſone rype bolde men may ſe whiche ful perillous hath ben yore al ſone may ſhe lerne lore boldneſſe whan ſhe wyfe ye maiſtreſſes olde lyfe lordes doughters han gouernaunce ne taketh worde dipleſaunce thynke ye ben ſet gouernynges lordes doughters onely two thynges eyther ye han kepte honeſte eyther ye han fal freelte knowen wel ynough olde daunce conne forſake fully miſchaunce euermore therfore chriſtes ſake kepeth wel tho ye vndertake ¶a thefe venyſon hath forlafte lykerouſneſſe al theues crafte kepe foreſt beſt man nowe kepeth hem wel ye wol ye loketh wel vice ye aſſent leſt ye dampned yuel entent ſo dothe traytour certayn taketh kepe ſhal ſayn al treyſon ſouerayne peſtilence whan wight betrayeth innocence ye father eke ye mother alſo though ye han chyldren one mo charge al ſufferaunce while ben gouernaunce beth ware enſample lyueng eyther neglygence chaſtiſynge ne periſhe dare wel ſay ye ſhal ful ſore obey vnder ſhepeherde ſofte neglygent wolf hath many ſhepe lambe rent suffyſeth one enſample nowe mote turne ayen matere ¶this maid tel tale expreſſe kepte ſelue ſhe neded maiſtreſſe lyueng maydens myght rede boke euery good worke dede longeth mayde vertuous ſo prudent ſo bountuous whiche ſpronge euery ſyde bothe beaute bounte wyde thorowe ye lōde preyſed echon loued vertue ſaue enuy alone ſorye mennes wele gladde ſorowe vnhele doctour maketh diſcriptioun mayde went day toun towarde temple mother dere yonge maydens manere ¶nowe iuſtice toun gouernour regioun ſo befyl iuſtice eyen caſt vpon mayde auiſyng ful faſt ſhe came foreby iuge ſtode anone hys herte chaungeth hys mode caught wt beaute mayde hymſelfe ful priuely ſayde thys mayde ſhalbe myne man anone fende hys herte taught hym ſodeynly ſleyght mayde purpoſe wynne myght certes force ne mede hym thought able ſpede ſhe ſtronge frendes eke ſhe confyrmed ſuch ſouerayne beaute wel wyſt myght neuer wyn make wyth body ſynne whych wyth great delyberatioun ſent clyent toun whych knew ful ſubtyl full bolde iuge vnto thys cliēt tale hath tolde ſecrete wyſe made hym enſure ſhulde 〈◊〉 vnto creature yf • yd ſhulde leſe hys hede aſſented thys curſed rede glad iuge made good chere yaue hym gyftes precious dere ¶when ſhapen al thys conſpiracie fro poynt poynt howe hys lecherie parfourmed ſhulde ful ſubtelly ye ſhullen openly home goeth thys clyent ye hyght claudius thys falſe iuge hyght appius hys name fable knowe hyſtorial thynge notable ſentence ſothe doute thys falſe iuge goeth nowe faſt aboute haſten hys delyte al maye ſo byfell ſone daye thys falſe iuge telleth v ſtorie wonte ſate hys conſyſtorie yaue hys dome vpon ſondry caas thys falſe client came forth ful gret paas ſayd lorde yf wyll doth ryght vpon thys pytous byll whych playne vpon virginius yf wol ſay thus wol proue fynde good wytneſſe ſoth byl wol expreſſe iuge anſwerde thys hys abſence maye yeue diffynite ſentence let hym cal wol gladly thou ſhalt haue ryght wronge virginius came wete iuges wyl ryght anone radde thys curſed byl ſentence ye ſhal ¶to lorde appius ſo dere sheweth poore ſeruaunt claudius howe knyght called virginius ayenſt lawe ayenſt al equite holdeth expreſſe ayenſt wyl ſeruaunt whych yt thrale right whych frō myne houſe ſtolē night whyles ful yonge wol preue wytneſſe lorde ſo ye greue hys doughter ſo ſaye wherfore lorde iuſtyce praye yelde thrale yf wyll lo thys al ſentence byll ¶virginius gan vpon clyent beholde haſtely er hys tale tolde wolde haue defēded ſhulde knight wytneſſe many trewe wyght al falſe ſayd hys aduerſarye thys curſed iuge wolde lenger tarye ne worde virginius yaue hys iudgement ſayd thus ¶i deme anone client ſeruaūt haue thou ſhalt lēger thyne houſe ſaue go brynge forth put warde cliēt ſhal haue thral thus award ¶and whē thys worthy knyght virginius aſſent iudge appius muſte force hys dere doughter yeuen vnto iudge lechery lyuen goeth hym home ſet hym hys hall let anone hys dere doughter call wyth face deed aſhen colde vpon humble face gan beholde father pyte ſtickyng hert al wolde hys purpoſe conuert ¶doughter ꝙ virginia thy name ben two wayes eyther deth ſhame thou muſte ſuffre ala yt borne neuer thou deſeruedeſt wherforne dyen wyth ſworde wyth knyfe oh dere doughter comforte lyfe whych haue foſtred vp wyth ſuch pleſaūce thou ne remembraūce doughter whych arte laſt wo lyfe laſt ioye alſo iemme chaſtite pacience take thou thy death thys ſentence loue hate thou muſt deed pytous hande mote ſmyte thyne heed ala euer appius ſey thus hath falſly iudged dey tolde al caſe ye han herde nedeth tel ¶o mercy dere father ꝙ thys mayde wyth worde armes layde hys necke ſhe wont teeres braſte eyen two ſayd good father ſhal dye grace remedye ¶no certes dere doughter myne ꝙ yeue leaue father myne ꝙ ſhe death complayne lytel ſpace parde iepte yaue hys doughter grace complayne er ſlough ala god wote nothynge treſpas ſhe ranne father fyrſt ſe welcome hym wyth great ſolempnyte word ſhe fel ſwoune anone whon ſwounynge gone ryſeth vp father ſayd blyſſed god ſhal dye mayde yeue death er haue ſhame doth wt child wil goddes name wyth ye worde ſhe prayeth hym ful ofte wt ſwerd ſhould ſmitte ſofte word ſwoune ſhe fel father wyth ſorowfull herte fell heed ſmote toppe hente iudge yaue preſente ſate dome conſyſtorye iudge ſawe ſayth ſtorye bade take hym hange hym alſo faſte ryght anone al people thraſt ſaue knyght routh pytie knowen iudges iniquitie people anone ſuſpect thing maner thys clyentes chalengynge aſſent appius wyſte wel lecherous whych vnto appius gone caſten hym priſon ryght anone ſlowe hym ſelfe claudius ſeruaunt vnto thys appius demed hanged vpon tre virginius hys great pyte prayed hym exiled el certes ben begyled remnaunt hanged leſſe conſented thys curſydneſſe may men ſe ſyn hath hys meryte beware mā wot god wyl ſmyte degre ne maner wyſe worme conſcience wol aryſe wycked lyfe though ſo priuy man wote god whether leude man lered howe ſone may affered therfore rede thys counſayle take forſake ſynne ſynne forſake ¶here endeth doctour phiſykes tale foloweth wordes hooſt ovr hoſte gan ſwere woode harowe ꝙ nayles bloode thys falſe thefe curſed iuſtyce ſhameful death herte may deuyſe come iuſtyce adu • ca algate thys ſely mayden ſlayne ala ala dere bought ſhe beaute wherfore ſaye al men maye ſe yeftes fortune nature ben cauſe death many creature beaute death dare wel ſayne ala ſo pytouſly ſhe ſlayne wol procede nowe men haue ful ofte harme prowe truely myne owne mayſter dere thys pytous tale natheleſſe paſſe ouer force pray god ſaue thy gentel cors thy vrinalles thy iordanes thyne ypocras eke thy galyanes euery boxe ful letuarye god bleſſe hem lady ſaynt marye mote thou arte propre man ylyke prelate ſaynt runian saue ſpeake wel terme wel wote yu doeſt myn herte yerne haue almoſt ycaught cardyacle corpus domini haue tryacle el draught moyſte corny ale anone mery tale herte loſte pyte thys mayde thou belamy thou iohan pardoner ſaid tel v ſome mery tale iape ryght anone ſhalbe done ꝙ ſaynt runyon fyrſt ꝙ thys ale ſtake wol drynke eate cake ryght anone theſe gentyls gan crye nay let hym tel v rebaudrye tel v ſome moral thing mow lere wytte wol gladly graunt ꝙ twys mote thynke ſome honeſt thyng whyles yt drynke ¶here ende wordes hoſt foloweth prologue pardoner lordynges ꝙ chyrche whan preche payne haue hauteyn ſpeche ring rounde dothe bel al roote tel teme alwaye euer radix omnium malorum eſt cupiditas fyrſt pronounce fro whens come bylles ſhewe al ſome •• ege lorde ſeale patent ſhewe fyrſt body warent man ſo bolde preeſt ne clerke • diſtourbe chriſtes holy werke tel forthe tale bulles pope cardynales patriarkes byſhoppes ſhewe latyn ſpeke wordes fewe ſauer predication ſteere men deuotion ſhewe forth long chriſtal ſtones ycrammed ful cloutes bone relykes ben wene echone haue laton ſholderbone whiche holy iewes ſhepe good men ſaye take wordes kepe bone waſhen wel cowe calfe ſhepe oxe ſwel worme hath eeten hem ſtonge take water wel waſhe tong hole anon farthermore pockes ſcabbes euery ſore shal ſhepe hole wel drinketh draught take kepe tel ¶if good man beeſtes oweth wol euery day er cocke croweth faſtyng drynke wel draught thilke holy iewe elder taught beeſtes ſtore ſhal multiplye ſyrs alſo healeth ielouſye though man fal ielous rage let make water potage neuer ſhal wyfe miſtryſt though ſothe defaute wyſt al ſhe take preeſtes two thre ¶here myttayne eke ye may ſe honde wol put thys mittayne ſhal haue multiplyeng grayne whan hath ſowen whete otes offer good pen grotes men woman thyng warne wight ben churche nowe hath done ſynne horrible dare ſhame ſhriuen woman ſhe yonge olde hath made huſbonde coke wolde suche folke ſhul haue powre ne grace offre relykes place ſo fyndeth hym ſuche blame commeth vp offre goddes name aſſoyle hym auctorite suche bulle graunted ¶by gaude haue wonne euery yere hundred marke ſythen pardonere ſtonde lyke clerke pulpet leude people byn downe yſet preche ſo ye haue lered tel hundred iapes payn ſtretche forth necke eſte weſt vpon people becke dothe doue ſyttyng vpon berne hondes tonge gon ful yerne ioy ſe beſyneſſe auarice ſuche curſydneſſe al prechyng maken hem fre yeuen pen namely vnto myne entent wynne nothyng correction ſynne recke neuer whan ben beryed thoughe ſoules gon blacburyed certes many predycation cometh oft tyme yuel entencion ¶some pleaſaunce folke flatery ben auaunced hipocryſy ſome veyne glorie ſome hate whan dare wayes debate wol ſting hem tōge ſmerte prechyng ſo ſhal aſterte ben diffamed falſly yf hath treſpaſed bretherne though tel propre name men ſhal wel knowe ſame ſignes circunſtaunces thus quyte folke yt dothe v diſpleſaūces thus put venym vnder hewe holyneſſe ſemen holy trewe ſhortly myne entent wol deuyſe preche nothyng couetyſe therfore teme yet euer radix omnium malorum eſt cupiditas ¶thus preache ayenſt ſame vyce whiche vſe auarice though ſelfe gilty ſynne yet maken folke twynne auarice ſore hem repent principal entent preche nothyng couetyſe matere ought ynough ſuffyſe tel hem enſamples many one olde ſtories longe tyme agone leude people louen tale olde thynges wel reporte holde trow ye while may preche wynne golde ſyluer teche wol lyue pouert wilfully nay nay thought neuer trewly wol preche begge ſōdrie londes wol labour myn hondes ne make baſkettes lyue therby bycauſe wol begge idelly wol none apoſtels counterfete wol haue money mault cheſe whete al yeuen pooreſt page pooreſt wydowe village though child ſhuld ſterue famy • nay wol drinke lycoure wyne haue ioly wenche euery toun herkeneth lordynges concluſyoun lykyng ſhulde tel tale nowe haue drōken draught corny ale god hope ſhal tel thynge ſhal reſon ben lykynge though ſelfe ful vycious man morall tale yet tel whiche wonte preche wynne nowe holdeth peace tale woll begyn ¶here endeth pardoner prologue foloweth tale flaunders whilō ther company yonge folke haū ted foly haſarde ryotte stewes tauernes wyth harpes lute geternes dauncen playen dyce nyght day eeten alſo ouer might may dyuel ſacrifyce within dyuels temple curſed wyſe ſuperfluite abhominable othes ben ſo great ſo damnable griſly hem ſwere bliſſed lordes body al tere hem thought iewes rent ynough eche hem others ſynne lough right anon comen tombleſteres fetys ſmale yonge froytereres syngers wilh harpes bandes waferers whiche ben verely dyuels offycers kyndlen blowe fyre lechery anexed vnto glotony holy writte take wytneſſe lechery wyne dronkeneſſe ¶lo howe dronken lothe vnkyndly lay doughters two wetyngly dronke niſt wrought therfore ſore repent hym ought herodes ſo wol ſtories ſeche may ye lerne enſample teche whan wyne replete feſte right owne table yaue heſte ſleen iohan baptiſte ful giltleſſe seneke ſaythe eke good wordes doutleſſe ſaythe difference fynde betwixt man mynde man dronklewe woodneſſe fallen ſhrewe perſeuereth lenger dothe dronkneſſe gloteny ful curſydneſſe cauſe fyrſt confuſyon original dampnacion tyl chriſt bouȝt v wt blode agayn lo howe dere ſhortly ſayn bought fyrſt curſed vilanye corrupt al world glotony adam forn father wyfe alſo fro paradyce labour wo driuen vyce drede whyles adam faſted rede paradyce whan ete frute defended tre anon caſte wo payne gloteny wel ought v playne ¶oh wyſte man howe many maladyes foloweth exceſſe glotenyes wolde ben meſurable dyete ſyttyng table ala ſhorte throte tender mouthe maketh eſte weſt northe ſouthe erthe eyre water man ſwynke getten gloton dayntye mete drinke mater poule wel canſte thou trete mete vnto wombe wombe eke vnto mete shal god diſtroy bothe poule ſaythe ala ſoule thyng faythe ſay worde fouler dede whan men ſo drinketh whyte rede trothe maketh priue thilke curſed ſuperfluite ¶the apoſtle ſayth wepyng ful pitouſly walken many tolde haue ſay nowe wepyng pitous voyce ben enemyes chriſtes croyſe ye ende deth wombe god bely wombe ſtynkyng cod fulfylled donge corrupcioun eyther ende ſoule ſoun howe great coſte laboure fynde theſe coke ſtāpe ſtrain grinde turne ſubſtaunce accident fulfyl al thy lykerous talent harde bone knocken mary caſte awey may go gullet ſafe ſote ſpycerie leues
