barke rote shal ben ſauce ymade delyte maken hym haue newer apetyte certes haunteth ſuche delytes deed while lyueth vyces ¶a lecherouſe thyng wyne drōkneſſe ful ſtryuyng wretchydneſſe oh dronken man diſfygured thy face sower thy breth foul art thou enbrace thy drōkē noſe ſowneth ye ſoun tho thou ſaydeſt aye sampſon sāpſon yet god wote sāpſon drōk neuer wyne thou falleſt ſtycked ſwyne thy tonge loſt al thyne honeſt cure drynkenneſſe ſepulture mannes wytte diſcretion drinke hath domynation counſayle kepe drede nowe kepe fro whyte fro ye rede namely fro white wyne lepe ſel fiſhe ſtrete chepe wyne spayne crepeth ſubtelly wynes growyng faſt whiche riſeth ſuche fumoſyte whan mā hath drōck draughtes thre weneth home chepe spayne right towne lepe nought rochel ne burdeaux toun wol ſay sampſoun sāpſoun herkeneth lordiges word pray al ſouerayne actes dare ſay victory olde teſtament thorowe god omnipotent abſtinence prayere loketh byble ye mow lere loketh attyla great conquerour deyd ſlepe ſhame diſhonour bledyng aye noſe dronkneſſe capitayne ſhulde lyue ſoberneſſe ouer al auyſe right wel cōmaunded vnto lamuel nat samuel lamuel ſaye redeth byble fyndeth expreſly wyne yeuyng hem haue iuſtyce may ynoughe ſuffyce nowe haue ſpoke glotenye nowe wol defende haſardrie haſarde mother leſynges diſceyte curſed ſwerynges blaſpheme chriſt māſlauȝter waſt alſo batayle ofte tyme mo reprefe contrarye honour holden cōmen haſardour euer hyer eſtate holden deſolate prince vſe haſardrie al gouernaunce policie comen opinyon holde leſſe reputacion ¶styllebon holde wyſe ambaſſadour ſent corinthe wt ful great honour fro calydone maken hem alyaunce whan came happed chaunce al greateſt londe playeng haſarde hem fonde whiche ſone might ſtale hym home ayen countre ſayd wol leſe name nyl take ſo great defame alye none haſardours sendeth wyſer enbaſſadours trouthe leuer dye ſhulde haſardours alye ye ben ſo gloriouſe honour shal alye haſardours wyl ne tretie wyſe philoſopher thus ſayd ¶loke eke howe kyng demetrius kyng parthes boke ſaythe v sent hym payre dyce golde ſcorne vſed haſardrie byforne helde glorie renoun value reputacioun lordes might fynde maner play honeſt ynough driue day away nowe wol ſpeke othes falſe great worde two bokes entreat great ſweryng thyng abhomynable falſe ſweryng yet reprouable hye god forbade ſweryng wytneſſe mathew ſpecyall ſweryng ſaythe holy ieromye thou ſhalte ſwere ſoth thyn othes lye ſwere dome eke rightwyſneſſe ydle ſweryng curſydneſſe ¶beholde ſe fyrſt table hye goddes heſtes honorable howe ſeconde heſte hym take name ydelneſſe amys lo rather forbyddeth ſuch ſweryng homicide curſed thyng ſay thus order ſtondeth knoweth yt heſtes vnderſtondeth howe ſeconde heſte god wol tel al plat vengeaūce ſhal parte fro hou • hys othes outragyous goddes preciouſe herte bone blode chriſt ſhed v one seuen chaunce thyn fyue thre goddes armes yf thou falſly play daggar ſhal thorowe thyn herte go frute cometh thylke bone two ſwering ire falſneſſe homicyde yt loue chriſt v dyde leaueth othes bothe great ſmale ſhal tel meruaylous tale ¶theſe ryottours thre tel longe erſte prime ronge bel ſet hem tauerne drinke ſate herde bel clynke byforne cors yt caryed graue one hem gan cal knaue go bette ꝙ aſke redely cors paſſeth forthe loke thou reporte name wele ¶syr ꝙ nedeth neuer dele told er ye came two houres parde olde felowe al ſodaynly ſlayne nyght dronke ſate benche vpright came priuy thefe men clepen dethe countrey al people ſlethe ſpeare ſmote hert two went way withouten wordes mo hath thouſande ſlayne peſtilence mayſter er ye come preſence thynketh neceſſarye beware ſuche aduerſarye bethe redy meten hym euer thus taught dame ſay ¶by ſaynt mary ſayd tauernere chylde ſayth ſothe hath yere hence ouer myle ſlayne great village bothe man woman chylde page nowe habytacioun ben auyſed great wyſedome er dyd man diſhonour ¶yea goddes armes ꝙ ryottour ſuche peril mete ſhal hym ſeche ſtyle eke ſtrete make vowe goddes digne bone herkeneth felowes thre ben al one let eche v holde vp honde eche v become others brother wol ſlee falſe traytour dethe ſhal ſlayne ſo many ſlethe goddes dignite er nyght ¶to gider hā theſe thre trouthes plight lyue dye eche hym though owne brother vp ſterten al dronken rage forthe gone towarde village tauerner hath ſpoke many griſly othe han ſwore chriſtes bleſſed body rent dethe ſhal deed may hym hent ¶whan han gone fully myle right wold haue troden ouer ſtyle olde poore man hem mette olde man ful mekely hem grette ſayd nowe lordynges god ſe ¶the proudeſt theſe ryottours thre anſwerde ayen chorle wt harde grace art thou al forwrapped ſaue thy face lyueſt thou ſo longe ſo great age ¶this olde man gan loken hys viſage ſayd thus fynde man though walked iude neyther cyte ne village wol chaunge youthe myne age therfore mote haue myn age ſtyl longe tyme goddes wyl ne dethe ala nyl haue lyfe thus walke lyke reſtleſſe caityfe ye ground mother gate knocke ſtaffe erlyche late ſay leue mother let lo howe vanyſhe fleſhe bloode ſkyn ala whan ſhal bone ben reſte mother wolde chaūge cheſte chamber longe tyme hath ye heren cloute wrappe yet ſhe wol done grace whiche ful welked face ſyrs curteſye ſpeken vnto olde man villanye treſpace worde eyther dede holy writte ye may ſelfe wel rede ayenſt olde man hoore vpon heede ye ſhulde aryſe therfore rede ne doth vnto old man harme ye wolde man dyd age yf may ſo longe abyde god whether ye go ryde mote go thyder haue go ¶nay olde chorle god thou ſhalt ſo sayd theſe haſardours anon thou parteſt ſo lightly ſaynt iohn thou ſpakeſt right thilk trayter deth countre al frendes ſlethe haue trouthe thou arte eſpye tel el thou ſhalt dye god holy ſacrament ſothely thou arte hys aſſent ſlee v yonge folke thou falſe thefe ¶nowe ſyrs yf ſy lefe fynde dethe turne vp croked way groue lefte hym fay vnder tree wol abyde ne boſte nyl hym nothyng hyde se ye yōder oke right ye ſhal hī fynde god ſaue bought ayen mankynde amende thus ſayd thus olde man ¶than eueryche theſe ryottours ran tyl came tree foūde floreynes golde fyne ycoyned rounde wel nye ſeuen buſhels hem thought lenger dethe ſought eche hem ſo glad ſyght floreyns ſo fayre ben bright downe ſytte precious hord worſt hem ſpake fyrſt word ¶brethern ꝙ take kepe ſay wytte great though borde play treſure hath fortune v yeuen myrthe iolyte lyfe lyuen lightly cōmeth ſo wol ſpende hey goddes precious herte wende day ſhulde haue ſo fayr grace might thus gold caryed fro place home houſe el wel wote al golde hye felycite trewly day may men wolde ſay theues ſtrōge owne treſoure v honge treſour muſte ycaried night wiſely •• ily might wherfore rede let loke amonge v al drawe let ſe cutte wol fal hath yt ſhorteſt cutte hert blyth shal renne towne ful ſwythe bring v breed drinke ful priuely two v ſhal kepe ful ſubtelly treſour wel yf wol tarye whan night wol treſour carye one aſſent v lyſte beſt one hem brought graſſe feſt bad hē draw loke whō wold fal fel yongeſt hem al forth towarde towne went anon al ſo ſone gone one hem ſpake vnto thou woſt wel thou art ſworn brother thy profyte wol tel right anone thou woſte wel felowe gone golde ful great plente ſhal departed amonge v thre n • theleſſe yf ſhape ſo departed amonge v two done frendly turne anſwerd yt might wol wel golde two ſhulde might ſo ¶shal coūſayle ſaid fyrſt ſhrewe ſhal tel wordes fewe wol done bryng wel aboute graunt ꝙ doute trouth wol yt bewrayne ¶now ꝙ thou woſt wel ben twayn twayne v ſhal ſtronger one loke whan ſette anone aryſe though thou woldeſt wt hym play ſhal ryuen ye ſydes tway whyles yt thou ſtruggleſt wt hym game thy dagger loke thou ſame ſhal al golde departed dere frende betwixt may bothe luſtes fulfyl play dyce right owne wyl thus accorded ben theſe ſhrewes tway ſlee thyrde ye herde ſay yongeſt yt went towne ful often herte rolled vp beautie theſe floreyns fayre bright lorde ꝙ yf ſo might haue al treſour ſelfe alone ny man lyueth vnder trone god ſhulde lyue ſo mery laſte feude enemy put thought ſhuld poyſon bey might ſleen felowes twey fende fonde hym ſuch lyuing leue ſorowe hym bryng vtterly hys entente ſleen hem bothe neuer repente ¶and forth goth lenger wold tary towne vnto potecary prayde hym wol hym ſel poyſon might rattes quel eke polkat hawe ſayd capon yſlawe ſayd wold wreken hym yt might vermyn diſtroyed hem night ¶the potecary anſwerde thou ſhalt haue thyng wiſely god ſoule ſaue al worlde ny creature eateth drinketh confecture moūtenaūce corne whete ne ſhal hys lyfe anon forlete yea ſterue ſhal leſſe whyle thā thou woldeſt gon pace myle poyſon ſo harde ſo violent ¶this curſed man hath honde hent poyſon bore ſythe ran next ſtrete vnto man borowed hym large botels thre two poyſon poured thyrde kept clene drinke al night ſhope hym ſwynke caryeng golde place whan riottour ſorie grace fylde hym hys great bottels thre felowes ayen repayred ¶what nedeth therof ſermon right caſte dethe right ſo han hym ſlayne anone whan done ſpake ye one nowe let v ſyt drinke make v mery afterwarde wolne body bury happed hem per caas one toke botel therin yt poyſon dronke yaue felowe drinke alſo anon ſterne two ¶but certes ſuppoſe auicenne wrote neuer cannon ne fenne wonder ſorowes enpoyſonnyng theſe wretch two ending thus ended ben theſe homicide two eke falſe enpoyſonner alſo curſed ſynne ful al curſydneſſe traytours homicide wickydneſſe glotenye luxure haſardye thou blaſphemour chriſt wyth vilanye othes great vſage pryde ala mankynde howe may betyde thy creatoure yt wrought precious bloode bought thou arte ſo falſe ſo vnkynde ala good mē godforyeue treſpas ware fro ſynne auaryce myne holy pardon may al waryſhe ye offre noble ſtarlynges el ſyluer ſpones broches rynges boweth heed vnder bulle cometh vp ye wyues offreth wol name entre rolle anon bliſſe heuen ſhul ye al gon aſſoyle myne high powere ye offren clene eke clere ye borne lo ſyrs thus preche ieſu chriſt ſoules leche graunt hys pardon receyue beſte wol diſceyue ſirs one worde yate tale haue relykes pardon male fayre man englonde whiche yeuen pope honde wol deuocion offren haue myne abſolucion cometh forthe anon kneleth adoun ye may haue parte pardoun el taketh pardon ye wende al newe freſhe euery townes ende ye offren alway newe newe noble pen whiche ben good trew great honour eueryche ye may haue ſufficient pardonere aſſoyle countre ye ryde auentures whiche may betyde perauenture may fal one two downe horſe breke necke two loke whiche ſuertie al felowſhyp yfal maye aſſoyle bothe laſſe whan ſoule ſhal fro body paſſe rede oure hoſte ſhal begynne moſte enuelopte ſynne cometh forthe ſir hoſte offre fyrſt anon thou ſhalte kyſſe relykes euerychon yea grote vnbokyl anon thy purſe ¶nay nay ꝙ haue chriſtes curſe let ꝙ ſhal ſo theiche thou woldeſt make kiſſe thyn old breche ſwere relyke ſeynt though wt thy foundemēt depeynt croſſe ſeynt helayne fonde wolde thy coylons myne honde ſtede relykes ſanctuarye let cutte hem wol helpe ye hem cary ſhul ſhrined hogges torde pardoner anſwerde worde wrothe wolde worde ſay ¶now ꝙ oure hoſte wol lenger play ne non angry man ¶but right anon worthy knight began whan ſawe al people loughe nomore right ynoughe sir pardoner mery glad chere ye ſir hoſte ben ſo dere praye ye kyſſe pardoner pardoner pray drawe ner dyd let v laughe play anon kyſſed ryden forthe way ¶here endeth pardoner tale begynneth shipmans prologue nowe frendes ſayd oure hoſte ſo dere lyketh iohn pardonere hathe vnbokeled wel male hath v tolde right thrifty tale touchyng hys myſgouernaunce pray god yeue hym good chaunce ye han herde theſe ryottours thre nowe gentyl mariner hertely pray tel v good tale right anon ſhal done god ſaynt iohn sayd maryner wel euer right anon tale thus began ¶here endeth shypmans prologue foloweth hys tale marchaunt whilom dwelled ſaīt deniſe ryche mē held hī wiſe wyfe excellent beaute cōpynable reuelous ſhe whyche thynge cauſeth diſpence worthe al chere reuerence men hem done feeſtes daunces suche ſalutations countynaunces paſſeth dothe ſhadowe wal wo hym paye mote al ſely huſbonde algate mote paye mote v bothe cloth eke araye al owne worſhippe richely whiche array dauncen iolyly yf may nat parauenture el luſt ſuche ſpence endure thynketh waſt yloſt mote another paye coſte lende v golde perilous noble marchant held noble hous whiche al day great repayre largeſſe hys wyfe fayre wonder herkeneth tale amonge al geſtes great ſmale monke fayre man bolde trowe thurty wynter olde euer one drawing place yonge monke yt ſo fayre face aquaynted good man sythens fyrſt knowlege began houſe famylier poſſyble frende moche good man eke monke began bothe two borne one village monke hym claymed coſynage agayne ſayd one nay glad therof foule day herte great pleaſaunce thus ben knytte wt eterne aliaunce eche hem gan enſure brotherheed whyles lyfe may dure ¶fre dan iohan namely diſpēce houſe ful diligence pleaſaunce eke great coſtage foryate yeue leſte page al houſe degre yaue lorde ſythen hys meyne whan yt came ſome maner honeſt thyng whiche glad cōming foule fayne whan ſonne vp ryſeth herof nowe ſuffyſeth ¶but ſo byfel marchaunt day shepe hym make redy hys aray towarde towne bruges fare •• bye porcion ware whiche hath ſent parys anon meſſanger prayde hath dan iohn ſhuld come ſaint denys playn wife day twayn bruges went al wyſe ¶this noble monke deuyſe hath abbot hym lyſt lycence bycauſe man hye prudence eke offycer ryde ſeen graunges berne wyde vnto ſaynt denys cometh anon ſo welcome lord dan iohn dere coſyn ful curteſye brought iubbe malueſy • eke another ful fyne vernage volatily aye vſage thus let hem eate drinke play marchant monke day tway ¶the thyrde day marchaunt vp ryſeth nede ſadly hym auyſeth vp countyng houſe gothe reken hym ſelfe wel may thilke yere howe hym ſtoode howe ſpended goode yf encreſed none bokes bagges many one laythe afore hym counter borde ful ryche hys treſour horde whiche ful faſte counter dore ſhet eke nolde man ſhulde hym let hys accomptes mene tyme thus ſate tyl paſſed prime dan iohan ryſen morow alſo garden walked two fro hath hys thynges ſayd ful curteſly ¶this good wyfe come walkyng priuely garden walked ſofte hym ſalueth ſhe hath done ful ofte mayden chylde came companye luſte ſhe may gouerne gye yet vnder yerde mayde ¶o dere coſyn dan iohan ſhe ſayde eyleth ſo rathe ryſe ¶nece ꝙ ought ynough ſuffyſe fyue houres ſlepen night olde palied wight ben theſe old wedded men lye dare forme ſytteth wery hare al forſtraught houndes gret ſmale dere nece loke ye ſo pale trowe certes good man hath laboured ſythe night began nede reſten haſtely worde lough ful merily owne thought woxe al reed fayre wyfe gan ſhake heed ſayd thus yea god wote al ꝙ ſhe nay coſyn myne ſtondeth ſo god yaue ſoule lyfe al realme fraunce wife leſſe luſte hath ſory play may ſyngen ala welaway borne wight ꝙ ſhe dare tel howe ſtonte wherfore think world wed el ſelfe ſone make ende ful drede eke care ¶this mōke began vpon wyfe ſtare ſayd ala nay nece god forbede ye ſorowe drede ſelfe telleth grefe perauenture may miſchefe counſayle helpe therfore telleth al anoye ſhal ſecret portouſe make othe neuer lyfe lefe ne lothe ne ſhal counſayle bewray ſame ayen ꝙ ſhe ſay god portouſe ſwere thoug men wolde al peces tere ne ſhal neuer go hel bewray worde thyng ye tel coſynage ne alyaunce verily loue affyaunce thus ben ſworne vpon kyſte ylke hem tolde hem lyſte ¶coſyn ꝙ ſhe yf ſpace haue none namely place wolde tel legende lyfe ſuffred haue▪ ſythe wyfe myn huſbonde though coſyn nay ꝙ mōke god ſeynt martyn ni coſyn vnto lefe hongeth tre clepe ſo ſaynte denys fraunce haue cauſe aquayntaunce haue loued ſpecially abouen al woman ſykerly ſwere profeſſyoun telleth grefe leſte come adoun haſteth goth way anon dere loue ꝙ ſhe dan iohn ful lefe counſayle hyde mote may lenger abyde huſbonde worſte man euer ſythe worlde began ſythen wyfe ſytte tellen wight priuyte neyther bedde ne none place god ſhylde ſhulde tel grace wyfe ne ſhulde ſay huſbonde al honoure vnderſtonde saue vnto thus moche tel ſhal helpe god nought worthe al degre value flye yet greueth moſte nygardye wel ye wote woman naturally deſyren thynges ſyxe wel wolden huſbondes ſhulde hardy wyſe riche therto fre buxom wyfe freſhe bedde ylke lorde v bledde hys honoure ſelfe arraye ſonday next mote nedes paye hundred frankes el lorne yet leuer vnborne done ſlaunder vilanye yf myn huſbonde eke might aſpye nere loſte therfore prey lene ſomme el mote dey dan iohn ſay lene hūdred frākes parde wol fayle thankes ye lyſte pray certayne day wol pay done pleſaunce ſeruyce may right ye lyſte deuyſe god take vengeaunce foule euer genilion fraunce ¶this gētil mōke anſwerd manere nowe truly myne owne lady dere haue ꝙ ſo great routhe ſwere plight trouthe whā huſbōd flaūders • fare wol delyuer al care wol brynge hundred frankes caught flankes enbraced herde kyſſed ofte go nowe way ꝙ al ſtyl ſofte let v dyne ſone euer ye may kalender prime day gothe nowe beth true ſhal nowe el god forbyd ſyr ſayd ſhe forthe ſhe gothe ioly pye bade coke ſhulde hem hye men might dyne anone vp huſbonde wyfe gone knocked counter • e boldely qui eſt la ꝙ peter quod ſhe howe longe wol ye faſt howe longe tyme wol ye recken caſte ſommes bokes thynges dyuel haue parte al ſuch reckeninges ye haue ynough ꝙ ſhe goddes ſonde come day let bagges ſtonde ne ye ſhamed dan iohn shal faſtyng al longe day gon let v go maſſe go dyne ¶wyfe ꝙ mā lytel canſt thou diuyne curyous beſyneſſe haue chapman ſo god ſaue lorde called ſeynt iue scarſly amonge twenty twelue ſhal thriue contynually laſtyng vnto theyr age may wel make chere good vyſage driue forthe worlde may kepe eſtate priuyte tyl deed el play pylgrimage gone way therfore haue great neceſſyte vpon queynte worlde auyſe euermore mote ſtonde drede happe fortune chapmanhede flaūders wol gone morow day come ayene ſone euer may whiche dere wyfe beſeke euery wight buxom meke kepe good curyouſe honeſtly gouerne wel houſe thou haſte ynough euery maner wyſe thrifty huſwyfe may ſuffyſe lacketh none array ne vitayle ſyluer thy purſe thou mayſt fayle ye worde counter dore ſhette gothe lenger wold lette haſtely maſſe iſayde ſpedely table ilayde dyner faſte hem ſpedde richly chapman monke fedde dyner dan iohan ſoberly chapman toke parte al priuely ſayd hym thus coſyn ſtondeth ſo ••• wel ſe bruges ye wol go god ſaynt auſten ſpede gyde pray coſyn wyſely ye ryde gouerneth alſo wel dyete al temperatly namely hete betwixt v two nedeth ſtraunge fare farwel coſyn god ſhylde fro care thyng day night lye power might ye wol cōmaunde wyſe ſhal done right ye wol deuyſe thyng ye go yf may wolde pray leue hundred frankes weke twey certayne beeſtes mote nedes bey ſtore place god helpe ſo wolde ſhal fayle ſurely day thouſande frankes myle way let thyng ſecret pray yet night theſe beeſtes mote bey fare nowe wele myne owne coſyn dere graunt mercy coſte chere ¶this noble marchaunt gentilly anon anſwerde ſayd coſyn dan iohn nowe ſikerly ſmal requeſt golde whan leſte golde chaffare take ye lyſte god ſhilde ye ſpare one thyng ye knowe wel ynough chapman money plough may creaunce whyle haue name goldleſſe ſhame paye ayen whan lythe eſe might fayne wolde pleſe ¶theſe hundred frankes ſet forthe anon priuely toke hem dan iohn wight worlde wyſt thys lone sauyng marchaūt dan iohan alone drinke ſpeke rome pley tyl dan iohan rydeth abbey morow came forth ryd marchāt flaūders warde prētes brought auāt tyl came bruges wel merily nowe gothe marchaunt wel beſily nedes byeth creaunſeth neyther playeth dyce ne daunſeth marchaunt ſhortly tel ledde lyfe let dwel ¶the ſonday next yt marchāt gon ſaynt denys comen dan iohn crowne berde al freſhe newe iſhaue al houſe na ſo lytel knaue ne wight el ful fayne yt lorde dan iohn comen agayn ſhortly poynte gon fayre wyfe acordeth dan iohn theſe hundred frankes ſhulde al night haue armes bolte vpright acorde parformed dede myrthe al nyght beſy lyfe lede tyl day yt dan iohn yede way bade meyne farwel haue good day none hem ne wyght toun dan iohan ſuſpection forthe rydeth home abbey hym lyſte hym ſey ¶this marchaunt whan ended ye faire ſaynte denys gan repaire wyfe maketh feeſt chere telleth chaffare ſo dere nedes muſte make cheueſaunce bounden reconiſaunce pay twenty thouſande ſhildes anon whiche marchaunt paris gon borowe certayne frendes certayne frankes ſome hym lad whan comen toun chierte great affection vnto dan iohn fyrſt gothe hym pley nought borowe hym money wete ſe welfare tellen chaffare frendes done whā ben mette fere dan iohan maketh feeſt mery chere tolde ayen ful ſpecially howe bought ful wel graciouſly thonked god al hole hys marchaundyſe saue muſte al maner wyſe maken cheueſaunce beſte ſhulde ioye reſte dā iohn anſwerd certes right fayn ye heale comen home agayne yf riche haue bliſſe twēty thouſand ſhildes ſhuld ye miſſe ye ſo kyndely day lent golde may thonke god ſaynt iame natheleſſe toke vnto dame wyfe home ſame golde agayne vpon benche ſhe wote wel certayne certayne token tel nowe leue may lenger dwel abbot wol towne anon hys companye mote gon grete wel dame myne owne nece ſwete farwele dere coſyn tyl mete ¶this marchant ful ware wyſe creaunced hath eke payde parys certayne lombardes redy houdes ſomme gold gate hem ye bondes home gothe mery popyngay wel knewe ſtode ſuche aray nedes muſte wyn viage thouſande frankes aboue al coſtage ¶his wyfe ful redy met hym yate ſhe wonte olde vſage algate al night myrthe ſette ryche clerely dette whā day marchāt gan enbrace wyfe al newe kyſſed face vp gothe made wonder tough ꝙ ſhe god ye haue ynough wantonly ayen hym ſhe playde tyl laſte marchant thus ſayde god ꝙ lytel wrothe wyfe al though lothe wot ye god geſſe ye haue made maner ſtraungeneſſe betwixt coſyn dan iohn ye ſhulde haue warned gon hundred frankes payde redy token helde hym yuel apayde hym ſpake cheueſaunce ſemed ſo countenaunce natheleſſe god heuen kyng thought aſke hym nothyng pray wyfe ne ſo tel alway er fro go dettour hath myne abſence ypayde leſte thy neglygence might hym aſke thyng hath payd ¶this wyfe ferde ne affrayde boldely ſhe ſayd anon mary defye falſe monke dan iohn kepe hys token neuer dele toke certayne golde wot wele yuel thedom monkes ſnoute god wotte wende without doute yeue bycauſe therwith myne honoure prow coſynage eke bellye chere hath ful often tymes ſythe ſe ſtonte ſuche diſioynte wol anſwere ſhortly poynte ye haue mo ſlacker dettours wol pay wel redily fro day day yf ſo fayle wyfe ſcore tayle el ſhal pay ſone euer may trouth haue myne aray waſte beſtowed euery dele haue beſtowed ſo wele honour goddes ſake ſay wrothe let v laughe play ye ſhal ioly body haue wedde god nyl pay bedde foryeue myne owne ſpouſe dere turneth hitherwarde make better chere ¶this marchant ſawe ther remedy chyde folye sythen thyng may amended nowe wyfe ſayd foryeue thy lyfe ſo large kepe bet good yeue charge thus endeth nowe tale god v ſende talynge ynough vnto lyues ende ¶here endeth shypmans tale foloweth wordes hoſt wel ſayd corpus domini ꝙ hoſte nowe longe mote thou ſayle coſte thou gentyl mayſter gentel marinere god gyue ye mōke thouſand laſt quad yere ha felowes beware ſuche iape mōke put marchātes hode ape hys wyues eke ſaynt auſtyn draweth mōkes inne nowe paſſe ouer let v ſeke aboute ſhal tell nowe fyrſt thys route tale wyth worde ſayde curteouſly bene mayde lady prioreſſe leue wyſte ſhuld greue wol deme ye tellen ſholde tale nexte yf ſo ye wolde nowe wol yt vouchſafe lady dere gladly ꝙ ſhe ſayd thys manere ¶here ende wordes oure hoſte begynneth prioreſſe prologue domine dominus noſter quam admirabile eſt nomen tuum vniuerſa terra lorde lorde thy name maruaylous thys wyde worlde yſprad ꝙ ſhe thy lande precious parfourmed men dygnite mouth chyldren thy bounte parfourmed breſt ſoukynge sometyme ſhewen thyne heryenge wherfore laude beſt may whyte lylly floure whych bare mayde alway tellen ſtorye wol laboure nought may encreſe honoure ſhe ſelfe honoure rote bountye nexte ſonne ſoules bote mother mayden mayden mother fre buſhe vnbrent brennyng moſes ſyght rauyſhedeſt downe fro deyte thyn hūbleſſe ye goſt yt light whoſe vertue whē thine hert pight conceyued father ſapience helpe tel thy preſence lady thy bounte thy magnifycence thy vertue thy great humilite may tonge expreſſe ſcience ſomtyme lady er men pray thou goeſt thy benignyte getteſt v ye lyght thy prayere gyden v vnto thy ſonne ſo dere connyng weake blyſful quene declare thy hygh worthyneſſe ne may weyght ſuſtene child twelue moneth olde leſſe vnnethes worde expreſſe ryght ſo fare therfore praye gydeth ſonge ſhal ſay ¶here endeth prioreſſes prologue foloweth tale aſye great cytie amonges chriſten folkes iewrye suſtayned lorde countre foule vſure lucre villany hateful chriſt hys company ye ſtrete mē myght ryde wēde free open euery ende lytel ſchole chriſten folke ſtode downe ye farther end ther chyldren hepe comen chriſten blode lerned ſchole yere yere suche manere doctrine men vſen thys ſaye ſynge rede ſmale chyldren done chyldhede amōges theſe childrē wedowes ſon lytel clergion vij yere age daye daye ſchole hys alſo eke ſey ymage chriſtes mother vſage hym taught knele adowne ſay aue maria goeth way thus hath wedow litel child icauȝt blyſſed lady chriſtes mother dere worſhyp aye foryate naught ſely chylde wolde al day ſoone lere aye whē remēbre thys matere saint nicholas ſtādeth euer preſence ſo yonge chriſt dyd reuerence thys lytel chylde hys lytel boke lernyng ſate ſchole hys prymere alma redemptoris mater herde ſynge chyldren lered antiphonere durſt drewe aye nere nece herkened wordes note tyl fyrſt verſe couth al rote nought wyſt latin ſay ſo yonge tender age daye hys felowe gan pray expoune hym ſonge langage tellen thys ſonge vſage thys prayde hym conſtre declare ful ofte tyme vpon hys knee bare hys felowe whych elder thē anſwerd hym thus thys ſong haue herde ſay made bleſſed lady free ſalewe eke prey ben helpe ſocoure dey erpowne thys mater lerne ſonge ſmal grammer thys ſonge ymade reuerence chriſtes mother ſayd thys innocent nowe certes wol done diligence tonne al er chriſtmaſſe went though primer ſhalbe ſhent ſhulde beten thryſe houre wol conne lady honoure hys felowe taught homewarde priuely fro daye daye tyl couth rote ſonge wel boldely fro worde worde accordynge note twyſe day paſſeth hys throte ſcholewarde homeward whē went chriſtes mother ſet al hys entent haue ſayd iewrie thys lytel chylde came fro ful merely wolde ſynge crye alma redemptoris mater euer mo ſwetneſſe hath hys herte perſed ſo chriſtes mother praye ſtynte ſyngynge waye fyrſt foe ſerpent sathanas iewes herte hys waſpes neſt vpſwale ſayd • brake people ala thys thynge honeſt ſuch boy ſhal walke hym leſt dyſpyte ſyngen ſuch ſentence whych ayenſt lawes reuerence ¶from thence forth ye iewes han conſpyred thys innocent thys worlde chaſe homicide therto han hyred aley priuy place chylde gan forby pace thys curſed iewe hym hent helde faſt cutte hys throte pytte hym caſte ſay wardrope threwe iewes purged intrayle curſed folke heraudes al newe may yuel entent auayle murther wol certes wol fayle namely ther ye honour god ſhalſprede bloode cryeth curſed dede ¶o mater ſowned vnto virginite mayſt thou ſynge folowyng euer whyte lambe celeſtial ꝙ whiche great euangelyſt ſaynt iohn pathmos wrot whiche ſayth yt gon lambe ſynge aſonge newe neuer fleſſhly woman ne knewe ¶this poore wydowe awayteh al yt nyght lytel childe came nought whiche ſone day lyght face pale drede beſy thought hath ſchole el hym ſought tyl fynally ſhe gan ſo farre aſpye laſte ſeyne iurye wyth mother pyte breſte encloſed goth ſhe halfe mynd euery place ſhe hath ſuppoſed lyklyhede childe fynde euer chriſtes mother meke kynde cryed laſt thus ſhe wrought amonge curſed iewes ſhe hym ſought freyneth ſhe prayeth pytouſly euery iewe dwelleth thylke place tellen yf chylde went ſayd nay ieſu hys grace yaue thought wythin lytel ſpace place ſonne ſhe cryde caſt pyt beſyde great god perfourmeſt thy laude mouth innocence lo thy myght thys iemme chaſtite thys emeraude eke martyrdome rubye bryght wyth throte yeorne lay vpryght alma redemptoris gan ſynge loude al place gan rynge chriſten folke yt ye ſtrete wēt comen wonder thys thynge haſtely prouoſte ſent came anone wythout taryenge heryeth chriſt heuen kynge eke hys mother honour mankynde iewes let bynde thys chylde wyth pytous lamentacion vptaken ſyngyng ſonge alway wyth honoure great proceſſyon caryen hym next abbey hys mother ſwounyng bere lay vnneth myght people thys newe rachel bringe fro bere turmēt ſhamful deth ilke one thys prouoſt doth theſe iewes ſterue thys murder wyſte anone nolde ſuche curſedneſſe obſerue yuel ſhal haue yuel wol deſerue therfore wt wylde horſe dyd hem drawe afterwarde honge hem lawe vpon hys bere aye lyeth thys innocent beforne chefe aulter whyles ye maſſe laſt abbot wyth hys couent hem ſpedde burye hym al faſt holy water hym caſt yet ſpake ye child whē ſpreit holy water ſonge alma redemptoris mater thys abbot whych holy man monkes ben el ought yonge chylde couer began ſayd dere chylde haylfe vertue holy trinite tel thy cauſe ſynge sythens thy throte cutte ſemynge throte cutte vnto necke bone sayd thys chylde waye kynde ſhulde haue deyde ye longe tyme agone ieſu chriſt ye bokes fynde wol hys glorye laſte mynde worſhyp hys mother dere yet may ſynge alma loude clere wel mercy chriſtes mother ſwete loued alway connynge lyfe ſhulde forlete ſhe came bad ſynge thys antem verely dyenge ye han herde ſonge thought ſhe layde grayne vpō tōge wherfore ſynge ſynge mote certayne honoure blyſfull mayden fre tyl fro tonge taken grayne thus ſhe ſayd lytell chylde nowe wol fetche grayne fro thy tonge ytake agaſte wol forſake thys holy monke thys abbot mene hys tonge caught toke away ye graine yaue vp goſte ful ſoftly thys abbot thys wōder ſeyne hys ſalt teeres trykled downe rayne grofe fell al platte grounde ſtyll laye ben ybounde couent lay eke vpon pament wepyng heryeng chriſtes mother dere ryſen forthe ben went toke away martyr fro bere tombe marble ſtones clere encloſen lytel body ſwete nowe god lene v mete yonge hewe lyncoln ſlayne alſo curſed iewes notable lytel whyle ago pray eke v ſynful folke vnſtable hys mercy god merciable v hys great mercy multiply reuerence mother mary ¶here endeth prioreſſe tale folowe wordes hoſt chaucer whan ſayde thys myracle euery man ſobre wōder ſe tyll oure hoſte iapen began erſte loked vpon ſayd thus man arte thou ꝙ thou lokeſt thou woldeſt fynde hare euer vpon grounde ſe ſtare aproche nere loke vp merily ware ſyrs let mā haue place waſt ſhapen wel popet armes enbrace woman ſmal fayre face ſemeth eluyſhe countenaunce vnto wight dothe dalyaunce say ſōwhat ſithēs folke hā ſayd tel v tale myrthe anon hoſte ꝙ ne yuel apayde tale certes none ryme lerned yore agone yea good ꝙ ſhullen som daynte thing thinketh thy chere ¶here endeth wordes hoſt foloweth ryme ſyr thopas lyſteneth lordinges good intēt wol tel verament myrth ſolas al knight fayre gent batayle turnament hys name ſyr thopas iborne farre countre flaundres al beyonde ſee poperynge place hys father man ful fre lorde countre goddes grace syr thopas doughty ſwayne whyte hys face payne mayne hys lyppes reed roſe hys rudde lyke ſcarlet grayne tell good certayne ſemely noſe hys heer hys berde lyke ſafroun hys gyrdel raught adoun hys ſhone cordewane bruges hys hoſen broun hys robe chekelatoun coſte many iane couth hunte wylde dere ryde haukynge forby ryuere wyth gray goſhauke hande therto good archere wraſtlynge none hys pere ram ſhulde ſtande full many mayde bryght houre mourne hym paramoure hem bet ſlepe chaſte lechoure ſwete bramble floure beareth reed hype ſo byfel vpon daye forſoth tel maye syr thopas wolde ryde worth vpon hys ſtede graye hys honde launce gaye longe ſworde hys ſyde prycketh thorowe fayre foreſte therin many wylde beeſt yea bucke hare prycketh north eſte tell hym almeſte betydde ſorye care ſpryngen herbes great ſmale lycores ſetuale many clowe gelofer nutmygges put ale whether newe ſtale lye cofer byrdes ſyngen naye ſperhauke popyngaye ioye throſtell eke made hys lay wodcocke vpon ſpray ſonge full loude clere ¶syr thopas fyl loue longynge herde throſtel ſynge prycked wode hys fayre ſtede hys pryckynge ſwette men myght hym wrynge hys ſydes blode ¶syr thopas eke ſo wery prickynge ſofte gras fyers hys corage downe layde hym place maken hys ſtede ſome ſolace gaue good forage ¶oh ſaynt mary benedicite ayleth thys loue blynde ſo ſore dremed al thys nyght parde elfe quene ſhal lemman ſlepe vnder gore ¶an elfe quene wol loue ywys thys worlde woman worthy make towne woman forſake elfe quene betake dale eke downe ¶into hys ſadell clombe anone pricketh ouer ſtyle ſtone elfe quene eſpye tyll ſo longe hath rydden gone fonde pryue wone countre fayrie wylde countre na none neyther wyfe ne chylde tyl hym came great giaunt hys name called ſyr oliphaunt peryllous man dede ſayd chylde termagaunt yf thou prycke haunt anone ſlee thy ſteed wyth mace euer go thys place ¶here quene fayry wyth harpe pype ſymphony dwellynge thys place chylde ſayd al ſo mote morowe wol meten whan haue myne armure yet hope par faye thou ſhalte launce gay abyen ful ſore thy mawe shal perce yf maye fully prime daye thou ſhalt ſlawe sir thopas drowe abacke ful faſte gyaunt hym ſtones caſte fel ſtaſte ſlynge fayre eſcaped ſir thopace al goddes grace thorowe hys fayre beryng ¶yet lyſteneth lordynges tale meryer nyghtyngale nowe wol ye rowne howe ſir thopas ſydes ſmale prickyng ouer downe dale comen ayen towne hys mery man commaunded maken hym bothe game gle nedes muſte fyght gyaunt heedes thre paramoures tolyte one ſhone ful bright come ſayd mynſtrales ieſtours tellen v tale anon myne armyng romaunces ben royal pope cardynals eke loue longyng fette hym fyrſt ſwete wyne meede eke mazelyne royal ſpycerye gynger breed ful fyne lycores eke comyne wyth ſugre trye dyd nexte hys whyte lere clothe lake fyne clere breche eke ſherte next ſherte ha •• ton ouer haberion percyng hys herte ouer fyne hauberke al ywrought iewes werke ful ſtronge plate ouer hys core armoure whyte lylly floure whiche wolde debate ſhylde al golde ſo reed therin bore heed carbocle ſyde ſwore ale breed howe gyaunt ſhulde deed betyde betyde tambeux cure buly ſwordes ſhethe yuorie helme laton bright ſadel ruel bone bridel ſunne ſhoue moone light ſpere fyne ſypres byddeth warre nothyng pee heed ful ſharpe ygrounde ſtede al dappel gray gothe aumble way ful ſoftely rounde londe ¶lo lordes myne fyt ye wol tellen wol fonde nowe holde mouthe cha • rite bothe knight lady fre herkeneth ſpel batayle cheualrye ladyes loue diery anon wol tel men ſp • ken romaunces pris hornechilde potys beuys ſyr gye ſyr lybeaur blayndamoure ſir thopas bereth floure royal cheualrye good ſtede ſtrode forthe vpon way glode ſparke bronde vpon creſte bare toure therin ſtycked lilly floure god ſhylde cors fro ſhonde knyght auentrouſe nolde ſlepen none houſe lygge hood bright helme hys wangre hym fedde hys deſtper herbes fyne good hym ſelfe dronke water well dyd knight ſir perſyuel worthy vnder wede ¶here endeth ryme ſyr thopas beginneth wordes oure hoſte thys goddes dignite ꝙ hooſt thou makeſt wery thy leudeneſſe alſo wyſly god ſoule bleſſe myne eares aken thy drafty ſpeche nowe ſuche ryme dyuell beteche thys may wel cleped ryme dogrel ꝙ ſo ꝙ wolt thou let tale man sen beſt ryme god ꝙ playnly worde thy drafty rymynge worth torde thou doeſt nought el ſpendeſt tyme syr one worde thou ſhalt lēger ryme let ſe whether thou canſt tell ought geſte tel proſe ſomwhat leſte ther may ſom myrth doctrine gladly ꝙ goddes ſwete pyne woll tell lytell thynge proſe ought lyke ſuppoſe el ye certes daungerous morall tale vertuous albe tolde ſomtyme ſondry wyſe ſondrye folke ſhall deuyſe thus ye wote euery euangelyſte telleth v payne ieſu chriſte ne ſayth al thynge hys felowe doth natheleſſe ſentente al ſoth al accorden ſentence al tellynge dyfference ſome hem ſayne ſome leſſe hys pytouſe paſſion expreſſe meane marke mathen luke iohn doutleſſe ſentence al one therfore lordynges beſeche yf ye thynke vary ſpeche thus though tell ſomwl prouerbes ye han herde byfore comprehended thys lytel treatyſe enforcen wyth effecte matere though ſame wordes ſaye ye han herde yet praye blameth ſentence sul ye fynde mochel dyfference fro ſentence thys treatyſe lyte whych thys mery tale wryte therfore herkeneth ſhall ſaye let tell tale praye ¶here ende wordes hoſt begynneth chaucer tale melibeus yonge mā called melibeus myghtye ryche begat vpon hys wyfe called prudence doughter called sophye ¶vpon daye byfell dyſport wente feldes hym playe hys wyfe eke hys doughter hath left hys houſe whyche dores faſte yſhette foure hys olde foe han aſpyde ſettē ladder walles hys houſe wyndowes ben entred bete wyfe wounded hys doughter fyue mortall woundes fyue ſondrye place ſaye fete handes eeres noſe mouth leften deed wente waye melibeus retourned hys houſe ſe thys myſchefe lyke madde mā rentyng hys clothes gan wepe crye prudence hys wyfe ferforth ſhe durſte beſought hym hys wepynge ſtynte thy gan wepe crye euer lenger thys noble wyfe prudence remembred vpon ſentence ouyde hys boke cleped remedye loue ſayeth foole dyſtourbeth mother wepe death chylde tyl ſhe haue wept fyll certayne tyme ſhall man done diligence wyth amiable wordes recomforte praye wepynge ſtynte whych reaſon thys noble wyfe prudence ſuffred huſbonde wepe crye certayne ſpace ſhe ſawe tyme ſhe ſayd hym thys wyſe ala lorde quoth ſhe make ye ſelfe like foole forſoth apperteyneth vnto wyſe man maken ſuche ſorowe youre doughter wyth grace god ſhall waryſhe eſcape ſo ſhe ryght deed ye ne oughte death ſelfe diſtroye seneke ſaythe wyſe man ſhal take gret diſcomforte dethe hys child certes ſhuld ſuffre paciēce wel abydeth ye deth hys owne proper perſon ¶thys mellebeus anſwerde anon ſayd man ꝙ ſhuld hys wepynge ſtynt hath ſo great cauſe wepe ieſus hym ſelfe lorde wepte ye dethe lazarus hys frende prudence anſwerd certes wel wote temperate wepynge nothyng defended hym ſorouful amonge folke ſorowe rather graū ted hym wepe apoſtel poule vnto ye roman writeth men ſhuld reioyce hē maketh ioye wepe ſuche folke wepen though temperate wepyng graunted certes outragyous wepynge defended meſure wepyng ſhulde cōſydred lore techeth v sencke whan thy frende deed ꝙ let thyne eyen moiſt ben teeres ne moch drie although teeres comen thyn eyen let hem fal whan thou haſt forgon thy frende diligence gette nother frende wiſdom thā wepe thy frende thou haſt lorne therin bote therfor yf ye gouerne ſapience put away ſorowe herte remembreth ieſus sirake ſayth man ioyus glad herte conſerueth ſtoriſhyng hys age ſothely ſorowful maketh hys bone drie ſayth eke thus ſorowe herte ſleeth ful manye man salomon ſayth right moughthes ſhepes ſleyſe anoyeth clothes ſmale wormes yt tree ryght ſo anoyeth ſorowe hert man wherfore v ought wel dethe child loſſe temporal goodes haue pacience remembre vpon pacient iobe whā loſte hys child hys temporal ſubſtaunce hys body endured receyued ful many greuous trybulacion yet ſayde thus oure lorde ſent oure lorde hath byrafte right ſo lorde wold right ſo done ibleſſed name lorde theſe forſayd thinges melibeus vnto hys wyfe prudence anſwerd al thy wordes ꝙ ben true therto profytable truely myn herte troubled ſorow ſo greuouſly let cal ꝙ prudence youre true frendes al thy lynage ben wyſe telleth hem caſe herkeneth ſay counſaylyng gouerne ſentence salomon ſaythe werke thy thynges counſayle thou ſhalte neuer rue coūſayle wife prudēce melibeus let caule great congrygacion people ſurgyens phyſicions olde folke yong ſome hys olde enemyes reconciled ſemblant hys loue hys grace therwithal ther came ſome neighbour dyd hym reuerēce drede thā loue happeth oft comen alſo ful many ſubtyl flaterers wyſe aduocates lerned law whā theſe folke togyders aſſembled melibeus ſorowfull wyſe ſhewed hem caſe maner ſpeche ſemed herte bare cruel yre redy vengeaunce vpon hys foos ſodainly deſyred yt • e ſhulde begyn natheleſſe yet aſked counſayle vpon mater ſurgyen lycence aſſent ſuche wyſe vp roſe vnto melibeus ſayd ye ſhal ¶sir ꝙ v ſurgiens apertayneth euery wight beſt ben withholdē pacient damage wherfore happeth many tyme ofte whan two men haue eueriche wounded one ſurgyen healeth hem wherfore vnto oure arte pertinēt noriſhe werre ne party ſupporte certes waryſſhyng doughter al ſo perilouſly ſhe wounded ſhal ſo tentyfe beſyneſſe fro day night ye grace god ſhe ſhal ben hole ſounde ſont poſſible almoſt right ſame wyſe phyſiciens anſwerd ſaue ſayde fewe wordes ryght malady ben contrary cured right ſo ſhal man wariſſhe werre peace hys neyghbours full enuye hys fayned frendes ſemed reconciled flatterer maden ſemblaūce wepyng enpayred agrutched moche mater prayſinge greatly melibe might power richeſſe frendes diſpyſing power aduerſaries ſayd vtterly anon ſhulde wreken hym hys foos begyn warre vp roſe aduocat wyſe byleue counſayle wyſe ſayd nede whych bene aſſembled thys place full heuye thynge great mater bycauſe ye wronge wyckedneſſe hath done eke reaſon great damage tyme commynge ben poſſyble fallen ye ſame eke reaſon great rycheſſe power partyes whyche reaſons full greate peryll erren thys matter wherfore melibeus thys oure ſentence counſayle abouen thynge ryghte anone thou thy delygence kepynge thy proper perſone ſuche wyſe thou ne wante none eſpye ne watche thy bodye ſaue counſayle thyne houſe thou • et ſuffyciēt garryſon ſo may well thy bodye thy houſe defende certes mouen warre done ſodeynly vengeaūce maye deme ſo lytel tyme yt profytable wherfore aſke leyſer ſpace haue delyberacion thys caſe deme commen prouerbe ſayeth thus ſone demeth ſone ſhall repente eke men ſayne thylke iudge wyſe ſone vnderſtandeth matter iugeth leyſer taryenge noyfull algate reproued yeuynge iudgemente ne vengeaunce takynge ſufficyent reſonable ſhewed oure lorde ieſu chriſte enſample woman takē auoutry brought hys preſens knowen ſhulde done perſone al wyſt wel hym ſelf wold anſwere yet ne wold anſwere ſodeynly wolde haue delyberacion grounde wrote twyſe thys cauſe aſken delyberation ſhall grace god coūſayle yt thynge ſhalbe profytable vp ſterte yonge folke one ye moſte parte company haue ſcorned thys olde wyſe man begā make noyſe ſayde ryght ſo whyles yron hote men ſhulde ſmyte ryghte ſo men ſhulde wreken wronges whyle bene freſhe newe wyth loude voyce tryed warre warre vp roſe tho one ye old wyſe wyth hys hande made coūtenaunce ſhulde holdē hem ſtyl yeuen hym audience lordynges ꝙ ther ful many man cryeth warre warre ye wote full lyte warre amounteth warre hys begynnynge hath ſo great entryng ſo large euery wyght may entre whē hym liketh lightly fynd warre certes ende therof ſhal fal lightly know ye warre one bygon full many chylde vnborne hys mother yt ſhal ſterue yōge bycauſe thilke warre el lyue ſorowe dye wretchedneſſe therfore yt warre bygon men muſte haue great counſayle good delyberation thys olde man wende enforcen hys tale reſon well nye one bygon ryſe breken hys tale byddē ful ofte hys wordes abrege certes yt precheth hem lyſt wordes ſermō hem anoyeth ieſus syrake ſayth yt weping muſyke noyous thynge moch ſay moch auayleth ſpeake byforne folke ſpeche anoyeth ſyngen byforne hem wepe thys wyſe man ſawe yt wāted audiēce al ſhamfaſte ſet adowne ayen salomō ſayth thou mayſt haue audience enforce ſpeake ſe wel ꝙ thys wyſe man cōmen prouerbe ſoth yt good counſayle wanteth moſte nede yet thys melibeus hys counſayle many folke priuely hys eere counſayled hym certayne thynges counſayled hym contrary general audience melibeus herde greateſt parte hys counſayle accorded ſhuld make warre anone conſented coū ſaylynge fully affyrmed ſentence dame prudence ſhe ſawe huſbonde ſhope hym awreke hym hys enemyes begyn warre ſhe ful hūble wyſe ſhe ſawe tyme ſayd hym theſe wordes lord ꝙ ſhe ſeche hertely dare ne haſt faſt guerdon yeue audiēce peter alphōs ſayth ſo doth good harme haſt quyte thys wyſe thy frende woll abyde thyne enemye ſhall lenger lyue drede prouerbe ſayth haſteth wel yt wiſely abyde wycked haſt profyte thys melibe anſwered hys wyfe prudence purpoſe quoth werke thy counſayle many cauſes reaſons certes euery wyght wolde holde foole thys ſaye yf thy counſaylynge wolde chaunge thynges bene ordayned affyrmed ſo many wyſe secondly ſaye woman bene wycked none good hem thouſande men ſayeth salomon founde one good man certes woman foūde neuer none alſo certes yf gouerned thy counſayle ſhulde ſeme yeue ouer mayſtrye god forbyd yt ſo ieſus syracke ſayeth yf wyfe haue mayſtrye ſhe contrarious huſbande salomon ſayeth neuer thy lyfe thy wyfe ne thy chylde ne thy frende ne yeue power ouer thy ſelfe better thy chyldren aſke thy thinges hem nedeth thy ſelfe handes thy chyldren alſo yf woll werche thy coūſayle certes counſayle muſt ſomtyme ſecret til tyme muſte knowen thys ne maye yf ſhulde counſayled dame prudence full debonairly great paciēce herde al huſbonde lyked ſaye aſked ſhe hym lycence ſpeake ſayd thys wyſe lorde quoth ſhe youre fyrſte reaſon maye lyghtly ben anſwered ſaye folye chaunge counſayle thynge chaunged el ye thynge ſemeth otherwyſe thē ſemed afore ouer ſaye thoughe ye haue ſworne behyght performe youre empryſe iuſte cauſe ye men ſhulde ſaye therfore ye lyer forſworne boke ſayeth wyſe man maketh leſynge turneth hys corage better albeit empryſe eſtablyſhed ordeyned great multytude folke yet dare accomplyſhe thylke ordynaunce lyketh trouth thynges profyte ben rather founden fewe folke ben wyſe full reaſon greate multytude folke euery man cryeth clattereth hym lyketh ſothly ſuche multytude honeſt ſeconde reaſon ye ſaye womē ben wycked ſaue grace certes ye dyſpyſe woman thys wyſe deſpyſeth ſayeth boke dyſpleaſeth senecke ſayeth ſo woll haue ſapience ſhal man dyſprayſe ſhall gladlye teache ſcience wythout preſumption pryde ſuche thynges nought ne ſhall ben aſhamed lerne hem enquyre leſſe folke hym ſelfe hath bene many good woman maye lyghtly proued certes ſyr lorde ieſu chriſt nolde neuer haue deſcended borne woman yf al womē wycked ye great bounte womē lorde ieſu chriſt whē ryſen fro death lyfe apered rather womā apoſtles though salomon ſayde founde neuer woman good foloweth therfore woman wycked thoughe ne founde good woman certes many man hathe founde many woman full good trewe el parauenture entente salomon thys ſouerayne bountye founde woman thys ſaye wyght hath parfyte bountye ſaue god alone hym ſelfe recordeth hys euangelye ny creature ſo good hym ne wanteth ſomwhat perfection god hys maker youre thyrde reaſon thys ye ſaye yf yt gouerne counſayle ſhulde ſeme ye yeue mayſtrye lordſhyppe youre perſone syr ſaue youre grace ſo yf ſo man ſhulde counſayled onely hem han lordſhyppe mayſtrye hys perſone men nolde counſayled ſo ofte ſothly thylke man aſketh counſayle purpoſe yet hathe free wyl whether woll counſayle none fourth reaſon ye ſayne ianglerye woman hyde thinges wote ſayeth woman hide ſhe wote syr theſe wordes ben vnderſtande woman ben ianglers wycked woman men ſayne thre thynges dryuen mā hys houſe ſaye ſmoke droppynge rayne wycked wyues ſuche woman salomon ſayeth man better dwell deſerte wyth woman riottous ſyr leaue ye haue ful oft aſſayde great ſylence greate pacience eke howe well hyde heale thynges men oughten ſecretly hyden ſothly youre fyfth reaſon ye ſaye wycked counſayle woman venquyſhe men god wote thylke reaſon ſtante ſtede vnderſtandeth nowe ye aſken counſayle wyckedneſſe yf ye wolde werken wyckedneſſe wyfe reſtrayneth thylke wycked purpoſe ouercome reaſon good counſayle certes wyfe oughte rather prayſed blamed thus ſhuld ye vnderſtande philoſopher ſayeth wycked counſayle woman venquyſhe huſbandes ye blame woman reaſons ſhall ſhewe many enſamples manye woman haue full good yet bene counſayle holſome profytable eke ſome men haue ſayde counſayle woman eyther dere lytell worthe ſo full many woman bene badde counſayle vyle noughte worthe yet han men foūde full many good woman full dyſcrete wyſe counſaylynge lo iacob counſayle hys mother rebecke wanne benyſon hys father ye lordſhyp hys brother iudith good counſayle delyuered cyte bethule whyche ſhe dwelt hāde holoferne al beſeged wolde haue dyſtroyed abigayle delyuered naball huſbande fro dauid kynge wold haue ſlayne apeaſed yre kynge wyte good counſayle heſter coū ſell enhaunſed greatly ye people god raygne aſſuerus kynge ſame bountye good coūſaylyng many good woman may men rede tell furthermore lorde created adam oure former father ſayd thys wyſe good man alone make helper hym ſelfe ſemblable maye ye ſe yf woman good counſayle good profytable lorde god heuen ne wolde neither han wrought hem ne called hem helper man rather confuſyon man ſayde clerke one two verſes better thē gold iaſper better iaſper wyſedome better wyſedome womā better good woman good man better good man nothynge ſyr many reaſons maye ye ſene many woman bene good eke counſayle good profytable therfore ſyr yf ye woll truſte counſayle ſhall reſtore doughter hole ſounde eke woll ſo moche ye ſhall haue honoure thys caſe melibe herde wordes hys wyfe prudence ſayd thus ſe well wordes salomon ſoth ſayeth wordes ſpoken dyſcretlye ordynaunce bene honycombes yuen ſwetneſſe ſoule holſomneſſe bodye wyfe bycauſe thy ſwete wordes eke haue proued aſſayed thy greate ſapience thy greate trouthe woll gouerne thy counſayle thynge nowe ſyr quoth dame prudence ſythens ye vouchſafe gouerned counſayle woll enfourme howe ye ſhall gouerne youre ſelfe choſynge counſaylours ye ſhall fyrſte youre werke mekelye beſechynge hye god wolde counſaylour ſhapeth ſuche entent yeue counſayle comforte taught thobye hys ſonne tymes thou ſhalte blyſſe god praye hym dreſſe thy wayes loke eke thy counſayles ben hym euer saynt iames ſayeth yf anye man haue nede ſapience aſke god afterwarde ſhullen ye take counſayle youre ſelfe examyne well youre owne thoughtes ſuche thynges thynketh ben beſt youre profyte ſhall ye dryue frō herte thynges cōtrarious good coūſayle ſaye yre couetous haſtyneſſe fyrſte aſketh counſayle hym ſelfe certes muſte wythouten yre wrath hym ſelf many cauſes fyrſt thys hath greate yre wrathe ſelfe weneth alwaye maye thynge yt may ſecōdly yrous wrothfull maye wel deme maye wel deme maye well counſell thyrde thys yrous wroth ſayeth seneke maye ſpeake blamefull thynges wyth thylke vycious wordes ſtyreth folke anger yre eke ſyr ye muſte dryue couetyſe herte apoſtle ſayeth couetyſe roote harmes truſteth ryght wel couetous man ne deme ne thynke fulfyll ende hys couetyſe certes ne maye neuer accomplyſhed euermore aboūdaunce hath rycheſſes deſyreth ſyr ye muſte alſo dryue herte haſtynes certes ye maye deme beſt ſo dayne thought falleth herte ye muſte auyſe full ofte ye haue herde byfore comē prouerbe thys ſone demeth ſone repenteth syr ye ne alwaye lyke dyſpoſicion certes ſome thynge ſemeth ſomtyme yt good time ſemeth contrarye ye han taken counſaile ſelfe han demed good delyberacion ſuche thynge ſemeth beſte rede ye kepe ſecrete bewraye ye counſayl perſone yf ſo ye wene ſekerly youre bewrayeng cōdicion ſhalbe profytable ieſus syrack ſayeth neyther thy foe ne thy frende dyſcouer thy ſecrete ne thy folye wol yeue audience lokynge ſupportacion youre preſence ſcorne abſence clerke ſayth ſcarſly ſhal fynde perſone maye kepe coūſayle ſecretly boke ſayeth whyle thou kepeſt thy counſayle thyne herte thou kepeſt thy pryſon thou bewrayeſt thy counſayl wyght holdeth yt hys ſnare therfore better hyde coū ſayle herte pray hym whō ye haue bewrayed counſayle yt woll kepe cloſe ſtyl seneca ſayth yf ſo yt thou mayſt thyne owne counſayle hyde howe darſte thou praye wight thy counſayle ſecrete kepe natheleſſe yf thou wene ſykerly bewrayeng thy counſayle perſone woll make thy condycion ſtonde ye better plyght ſhalt thou tell hym thy counſayle thys wyſe fyrſt thou ſhalte make ſemblaunt whether leuer peace warre thys ne ſhewe hym thy wyll ne thyne entent truſt well comenly theſe coūſaylers ben flatterer namely counſaylers greate lordes enforce hem alway rather ſpeake pleaſaunt wordes enclynynge lordes luſte wordes bene trewe profytable therfore men ſaye yt rych man hath ſelde good coūſayle yf haue hym ſelfe thou ſhalt conſyder thy frendes thyne enemyes touchynge thy frendes thou ſhalte conſyder whych hem ben moſte faythful moſt wyſe eldeſt moſte approued coū ſaylynge hem ſhalt thou aſke thy coū ſayle caſe requyreth ſaye fyrſt ye ſhal call counſayle frendes ben trewe salomon ſayeth ryght herte man delyteth ſauoure ſote ryght ſo counſayle trewe frendes yeueth ſwetneſſe ſoule ſayeth alſo may thynge lykened trewe frēde certes golde ne ſyluer ſo moche worth good wyll trewe frende alſo ſayeth trewe frende ſtronge defēce ſo fyndeth hath great treaſure ſhall ye alſo conſyder yf true frendes dyſcrete wyſe boke ſayeth aſke alwaye thy counſayle ben wyſe thys ſame reaſon ſhall ye call counſayle frendes ben age ſuche ſeme ben experte many thynges ben approued coūſaylyng boke ſayeth olde men ſapience longe tyme prudence tullius ſayeth great thynges bene aye accomplyſhed ſtrength ne delyuerneſſe body coūſayle auctorite perſones ſcience whych thre thinges ne ben feoble age certes enforce encreaſe daye daye ſhall ye kepe thys generall rule fyrſte ſhall ye call counſayle fewe frendes ben eſpecial salomon ſayeth many frendes haue thou amonge thouſande choſe one thy coūſaylour al ſo thou fyrſt ne tell thy counſayle fewe thou mayſte afterwarde tel mo folke yf nede loke alway thy counſaylers haue thoſe condicions haue ſayd ſaye trewe wyſe olde experience werke alway euery nede one counſayler alone ſomtyme behoueth counſayled many salomon ſaythe ſaluaciō thynges many counſaylers ¶nowe haue tolde folke ye ſhall counſayled nowe wol tel whiche counſayle ye ought eſchue fyrſte ye ſhall eſchue counſaylynge fooles salomon ſayth take counſayle foole wol counſayle owne luſt hys affection boke ſaythe propertie foole troweth lightly harme euery man lightly troweth al bountie ſelfe thou ſhalt eſchue counſaylyng al flatterer enforcē hem rather prayſe perſone ſlatterye tell ſothfaſtneſſe thynges wherfore tullius ſaith amonge al peſtelencie ben frendſhyp greateſt flaterye therfore nede thou eſchue drede flaterers thā people boke ſayth thou ſhalt rather flee fro ſwete wordes flatering prayſynge fro eygre wordes thy frendes ſayth ſothes salomon ſayth wordes flaterer ſnare catche innocence ſayth alſo ſpeketh frende wordes flatery pleſaunce ſetteth nette beforne hys fete catche hym therfore tullius ſayth enclyne thyne eares flatterer caton ſaythe auyſe wel eſchue ye wordes ſwetneſſe pleaſaunce eke thou ſhalt eſchue counſaylynge thyne olde enemyes ben reconciled boke ſaythe wight retourneth ſafely grace olde enemy eſope ſaith ne truſt hem whiche thou haſt ſomtyme werre enemyte ne tell hem thy counſayle seneke telleth cauſe may ſaith great fyre hath longe tyme endured yt dwelleth ſome vapoure hete therfore ſaith salomon thyn olde foe truſt thou neuer ſikerly though thy enemy reconciled make ſygne humilite lout hys heed truſte hym neuer certes maketh thilke fayned humylite hys profyte humilite loue thy perſon bycauſe yt demeth haue victorie ouer thy perſone ſuche fayned countynaunce whych vyctorie myght haue ſtryfe werre petrus alphons ſaith make felowſhip thyne olde enemyes yf thou hem bountye wollen peruerte wyckedneſſe eke thou muſt eſchue counſaylynge hem ben thy ſeruauntes beren ye gret reuerence parauenture ſayen drede loue therfore ſaythe philoſopher wyſe wyght parfetly true hym yt dredeth tullius ſaith might ſo great emperour longe may endure haue loue people drede ye ſhall eſchue alſo counſaylyng folke ben dronklewe ne coūſayle hyde salomon ſaythe ny priuyte ther reygneth dronkneſſe ye ſhal haue alſo ſuſpecte counſaylyng ſuche folke counſayle one thynge priuely counſayle contrary openly caſſidorie ſaith maner ſleight hynder enemye whan ſheweth done thynge openly werketh priuely contrarye thou ſhalte haue alſo ſuſpecte counſaylyng wycked folke alway ful fraude dauid ſaythe bliſful man hath folowed counſaylyng ſhrewes thou ſhalte alſo eſchue counſaylynge yonge folke counſaylynge rype salomon ſaythe ¶nowe ſir ſythens haue ſhewed ſuche folke ye ſhal counſayled folowe nowe woll teche howe ye ſhal examyne counſayle doctryne tullius examenynge youre counſayloures ye ſhall conſydere manye thynges fyrſt thou ſhalt cōſyder thylke thyng thou purpoſeſt vpon thynge yt thou wolt haue counſayle trouth ſaid cōſerued ſay tel truely thy tale ſayth falſe may well counſayled caſe whiche lyeth thou ſhalte conſyder thynges acorden thou purpoſeſt thy coūſaylours reaſon accorde therto eke yf thy might maye attayne therto parte better parte counſaylours accorden therto ſhalte thou conſyder thynge ſhal folowe coūſaylinge hate peace werre grace profyte damage many thinges al thynges thou ſhalte choſe beſte weyue al thynges thā ſhalt thou conſyder rote engendred mater thy counſayle fruite maye conceyue engender thou ſhalt eke conſyder al thy cauſes frome whence ſpronge whan thou haſt examyned thy counſayle haue ſayd whiche party better profytable haſte approued many wyſe folke olde thou ſhalt conſyder yf thou mayſte performe make good ende certes reſon wol mā ſhal begyn thyng yf myght performe hym ought ne wight ſhuld take vpon hym ſo heuy charge might beare prouerbe ſayth moch enbraceth diſtrayneth lytel caton ſaythe aſſay ſuch thinges thou haſte power done leſte charge oppreſſe ſore behoueth weyue thyng thou haſte begon yf ſo thou dout whether thou mayſt perfourme thynge none choſe rather ſuffre begynne peter alphons ſaythe yf thou haſte myght thynge whiche thou muſte repente better holde thy tonge ſtyl ſpeke mayſt thou vnderſtonde ſtronger reſons yf thou haſte power perfourme werke thou ſhalt repente better thou ſuffre begyn wel ſayne defenden euery wyght aſſaye thyng doute whether may performe none whan ye haue examined counſayle haue ſayde know wel ye maye performe empriſe conferme thā ſadly tyl ende ¶nowe reaſon tyme ſhewe whan wherfore ye maye chaunge counſayle wythouten reprofe sothly man may chaunge hys purpoſe hys counſayle yf cauſe ceaſeth whan newe caſe betydeth lawe ſayth vpon thinges newly betyden behoueth newe counſayle seneke ſaythe yf thy counſayle come eeres thyne enemyes chaunge thy counſayle thou mayſte alſo chaunge thy coūſayle yf ſo thou fynde errour anye cauſe harme damage may betyde alſo yf thy counſayle dyſhoneſt el come dyſhoneſt cauſe chaunge thy counſayle lawe ſaythe al beheſtes diſhoneſt ne ben value eke yf ſo vnpoſſyble may gladly parformed kepte take thys general rule euery counſayle enfourmed ſo ſtrongly may chaunged condycion may betyde ſay ilke counſayle wycked melibeus whan hadde herde doctryne hys wife dame prudēce anſwerde thys wyſe dame ꝙ yet vnto tyme ye han well taught gouernayle howe ſhall gouerne choſynge wytholdynge counſayle nowe wolde fayne yt ye wolde condiſcende eſpecial howe ye ſemeth counſaylours haue choſe preſent nede ¶my lorde ꝙ ſhe beſeche humbleſſe ye wol wylfully replye ayenſt reaſons ne diſtemper youre herte though ſpeke thynge yt diſpleſe god wote myne entent ſpeke beſte honoure profyte eke ſothly hope benygnyte wol take pacience truſteth wel counſayle caſe ne ſhuld ſpeke properly called counſaylyng mocion mouynge folye counſayle ye haue erred many ſondrie wyſe fyrſt ye haue erred aſſemblynge counſaylours fyrſt ye ſhulde haue cleped fewe folke counſayle ye might haue ſhewed mo yf nede ye haue cleped counſayl great multytude people ful chargeous ful noyous alſo ye haue erred ye ſhulde haue onely cleped counſayle trewe frendes olde wyſe ye haue cleped ſtraunge folke yonge folke falſe flatterer enemyes reconcyled folke done reuerēce withouten loue eke ye haue erred ye haue brought counſayle ire couetyſe haſtyneſſe thre thynges ben contrary euerye good counſayle honeſt profytable whiche thre thynges ye haue diſtroyed neyther youre ſelfe • e counſaylours ye ought ye haue erred alſo ye haue ſhewed counſaylours talent affectiōs make werre anon vengeaunce haue eſpyde wordes thyng ye ben enclyned therfore haue rather counſayled talente profite ye han erred eke ſemeth ſuffyſeth haue counſayled theſe counſailours onely lytel auyſement ſo hye ſo great nede ben neceſſary mo counſaylours delyberacion performe empriſe ye hā erred alſo ye haue examyned counſayle forſayd mater ne dewe maner caſe requireth ye haue erred alſo ye made diuiſion bytwene true frendes fayned coūſaylours ne ye haue knowē ye wil trew coū ſaylours frendes olde wyſe ye haue caſte al wordes hochepot encyned herte parte gretter nombre fooles wyſe men therfore counſaylynges ben congregacions multitude folke men take regarde nomber ſapiēce perſons ye ſene wel ſuch counſaylinges fooles han maiſtrye melibe anſwerde ſayd ayen graunt wel haue erred thou haſt tolde byforne yt ny blame chaungeth coūſayle certayne caſe certayne iuſte cauſe al redy chaunge counſaylours ryght thou woldeſt deuyſe prouerbe ſaythe done ſynne mannyſſhe certes perceuer longe ſynne werke dyuell thys ſentence anſwereth anon dame prudence ſayd examyneth ꝙ ſhe wel counſayle let v ſe whyche hem hath ſpoke moſte reſonably taught beſte counſayle moche examinacion neceſſarye lette v begyn ſurgens phyſiciens fyrſt ſpake thys mater ſaye phyſiciens ſurgiens haue ſayd counſayle diſcretly hem ought ſpeche ſayd ful wiſely office hem apertayneth done euery wight honoure profyte wyght anoye crafte great dyligence vnto cure hem whych haue gouernaunce ſir right haue anſwerde wyſely diſcretly right ſo rede ben hyely ſoueraynly guerdoned noble ſpeche eke ſhul done theyr ententyfe beſyneſſe curacion doughter al ſo ben frendes therfore ſhullē ye ſuffre ſerue naught ye ought therafter guerdō hem pay hem largeſſe touchyng propoſicion whyche phyſiciens entreteden caſe ſayne malady contrarie wariſhed cō trarie wolde fayne knowe howe ye vnderſtonde thylke texte ſentence certes ꝙ melibeus vnderſtonde thys wyſe right han contrarye ſo ſhulde done hem ryght han venged hem vpon done wronge ryght ſo woll venge vpon hem hem wronge haue cured one contrarie lo lo ꝙ dame prudence lightly euery man enclyned hys owne deſyre hys owne pleſaunce certes ꝙ ſhe wordes phyſiciens ne ſhuld ben vnderſtonde wyſe certes wyckedneſſe contrarie wickedneſſe ne vengeaunce contrarie vengeaunce ne wronge wronge euery hem encreſeth engendreth certes ye wordes phiſiciens ſhulde vnderſtonde thys wyſe good wyckydneſſe ben two contrary peace werre vengeaunce ſuffraunce diſcorde acorde many thynges certes wyckidneſſe ſhalbe wariſhed goodnes diſcorde acorde werre peace ſo forthe thynges therto acordeth ſaynt poule apoſtel many place ſaith ne yeld harme harme ne wicked ſpeche wycked ſpeche wel hem harme bleſſe ſayd harme manye place amoniſſheth peace acorde nowe wol ſpeke counſayle whiche lyeue vnto men law wyſe folke olde folke ſaydē al one accorde ye herde byforne ouer al thynges ye ſhal done beſyneſſe dyligence kepe youre perſon warnſtore houſe ſayd alſo yt thys caſe ye ought werchenfull wyſely great delyberacion ſyr fyrſte poynte toucheth kepynge perſon ye ſhall vnderſtonde hath werre ſhal euer deuoutely mekely prayen byforne thynges ieſu chriſt mercy wol haue protection ſouerayne helper nede certes worlde ny wight maye counſayled ykepte ſuffyciently without kepynge lord ieſu chriſt thys ſentence acordeth prophete dauid ſayth god ne kept cyte ydel waketh kepeth nowe ſir ſhulde commytte kepynge perſon youre true frendes ben approued yknowe hem ſhul ye aſke helpe perſon kepe caton ſaith thou haue nede helpe aſke thy frendes ny none ſo good phyſicien thy true frende ſhal ye kepe fro al ſtraunge folke fro lyers haue alway ſuſpecte cō panye peter alphons ſaythe ne take company way ſtraunge man yf ſo thou haſte knowen hym lenger tyme yf ſo fal thy companye parauenture withouten thyn aſſent good wyl enquire ſubtelly thou canſt conuerſacion hys lyfe byforne fayne thy way ſayeng thou woldeſt go thyder thou wolte go yf beare ſpere hold right ſyde hym yf beare ſwerde hold lefte ſyde hym ſhal ye kepe wyſely maner ſuch people haue ſaid byfore hem counſayle eſchue ſhal ye kepe ſuche maner anye preſumpſion bodely ſtrength ye diſpyſe ne acounte might aduerſary ſo lyte ye lete keping perſon preſumpcion euery wyſe mā dredeth enemy salomon ſaith foole al hath drede certes yt thorowe hardyneſſe herte hardyneſſe ſelf hath great preſumpcion hym ſhall yuel betyde ſhal ye euermore encountrewayte enbuſhementes eſpyaile seneke ſaythe wyſe man dredeth harmes eſcheweth harmes ne falleth perylles peryll eſcheweth al ſo thou ſeme yt thou ſecret place yet ſhalt thou alway dyligence kepyng thy perſon ſay ne neglygent kepe thyne owne perſon onely thy greateſt enemy alſo thy leſte enemy seneke ſayth man wel aduyſed dredeth leſte enemye ouyde ſaythe lytel weſel wol ſlee great bulle th • wylde herte prouerbe ſaythe lytel thorne wol greue kyng ful ſore lytel hounde wol holde wylde bore natheleſſe ſay thou ſhalt ſo cowarde thou doute drede boke ſaythe ſome men haue great luſte diſceyue yet drede diſceyued kepe fro companye ſkorners boke ſayth ſkorners ne make companye flye wordes venym ¶nowe ſeconde poynte wyſe counſaylours counſayled warne ſtore youre houſe greate delygence wolde fayne knowe howe ye vnderſtōde thylke wordes ſentēce melibeus anſwerd ſayd certes vnderſtonde wyſe ſhal warne • ſtore myn houſe wyth toures ſuche haue caſtels maner edyfices armurye archery bitwene thynges maye perſon houſe ſo kepe defende myne enemyes ſhullen drede myne houſe aproch ſentence anſwerde anon prudence warniſhyng ꝙ ſhe hye toures hye edyfices great coſtages great trauayle whan ben accōpliſhed yet ben worth ſtrawe yf ben defended trew frendes ben olde wyſe vnderſtondeth wel ye greateſt ſtrōgeſt garnyſon ryche men maye haue wel kepen parſone goodes yt byloued ſubiectes neyghbours thus ſaythe tullius maner garryſon man may venquiſhe ne diſcomfyte lorde byloued cytezyns people ¶nowe ſir thyrde poynte olde wyſe counſaylours ſayde ye ought ſodainly ne haſtely procede nede▪ ye oughten puruayen aparayle caſe great dylygence delyberacion verily trowe yt ſayde right trewly ryght ſothe tullius ſayth euery dede thou begyn apparayle great dyligence ſay vengeaunce takyng werre batayle warneſtoryng thou begyn rede thou apparayle therto great delyberaciō tullius ſaith longe apparelynge fore batayle maketh ſhorte victorie caſſidorus ſaith garryſon ſtronger whan longe tyme auyſed nowe let v ſpeke counſayle acorded neyghbours ſuche reuerence withoutē loue olde enemyes reconciled flatterer counſayled certayne thynges priuely openly counſayled contrarye yong folke alſo counſayled venge make werre anon certes ſyr haue ſayde byfore ye haue greatly erred clepe ſuche maner folke youre counſayle whiche counſaylours ben ynoughe reproued reſons forſayd natheleſſe let v nowe diſcende ſpecial ye ſhul fyrſte procede doctryne tullius certes trouthe thys mater thys counſayle nedeth dyligently enquire wel wyſte ben han done treſpas vilanye howe many treſpaſours maner haue done al thys wronge al vilanye thys ſhul ye examyne ſeconde condicion whiche tullius addeth thys mater tullius putteth thyng whiche clepeth conſentyng ſay ben whiche ben howe manye cōſenten thy counſayle thy wylfulneſſe done haſty vengeaunce let v conſyder alſo ben howe manye ben conſented youre aduerſaries fyrſt poynt wel knowen whiche folke cōſented haſty wylfulneſſe trewly al tho counſayl maken ſodayne werre ne frendes let ſe nowe whiche ben ye holden ſo greatly frēdes perſon al ſo ye mighty rich certes ye ben alone trewly ye ne haue chyld doughter ne ye haue brethern ne coſyns germayns ne none nye kynrede wherfore enemyes ſhuld ſtynte plede ne diſtroye perſon ye knowe alſo youre rycheſſe mot diſpended dyuers party whā euery wight hath parte wollen take lytell regarde venge dethe thyne enemyes ben thre haue manye brethern child coſyns nye kynred though ſo thou haddeſt ſlayne hem two thre yet dwelleth ther ynowe auenge dethe ſlee thy perſon though ſo kynrede ſtedfaſte ſyker kyn aduerſaryes yet neuer leſſe kynrede kynrede ben lytel ſybbe kynne enemyes ben nye ſybbe hem certes condicion better let v conſyder alſo counſaylynge hem counſayled take ſodayne vengeaunce whether acorde reſon non certes ye know wel nay ryght reſon maye man take vengeaunce wight iuge hath iuriſdiction whan graunted hym take vengeaunce haſtely attemperatly lawe requireth yet ouer thylke worde tullius clepeth cōſentynge thou ſhalte cōſent yf thy might thy power may conſente ſuffyſe thy wilfulneſſe thy counſaylours certes thou mayſte wel ſaye naye ſykerly ſpeke properly may nothyng ſuche thynge may done ryghtfully certes righfully ye may take vengeaunce propre auctorite maye ye ſe youre power ne conſenteth ne accordeth wylfulneſſe nowe let v examyne thyrde poynt tullius clepeth conſequence thou ſhalte vnderſtonde vengeaunce yt thou purpoſeſt take conſequent therof foloweth vengeaunce peryl werre damage withouten nombre whiche ware tyme touchynge fourth poynte yt tullius clepeth engendring thou ſhalte conſyder wrong whiche done engendred ye hate thyne enemyes ye vengeaunce takyng vpon hem wolde engender nother vengeaunce mochel ſorowe waſtyng rycheſſe ſayde ere nowe ſir touchyng fylte poynte tully clepeth cauſes whiche laſte poynte thou ſhalte vnderſtonde wronge thou haſte receyued hathe certayne cauſes whiche clerkes callen orien efficien cauſa longinqua cauſa propinqua ſaye ferre cauſe nyghe cauſe ferre cauſe almyghty god cauſe al thynges nere cauſe thre enemyes cauſe accidental hate cauſe material ben fyue woundes thy doughter cauſe formal maner theyr werkynge brought ladder clambe thy wyndowes cauſe fynal ſle thy doughter letted moche ſpeke yu ferre cauſe ende ſhulde come fynally ſhal betyde thys caſe ne canne deme coniectynge ſuppoſynge ſhall ſuppoſe ſhall come wycked ende bycauſe boke decree ſaythe selde wyth greate payne ben cauſes brought good ende whan ben badly begonne ſir yf men wolde aſke god ſuffred men villanye truly wel anſwere ſothfaſtneſſe apoſtel ſaythe ſcyences iugementes lorde god almighty ben ful depe may man comprehende ne ſerche hem natheleſſe certayne preſumpcyous coniectynges holde byleue god whyche ful iuſtyce rightwiſneſſe hathe ſuffred thys betyde iuſte cauſe reſonable ¶thy name melibee ſaye man drinketh hony thou haſte dronke ſo moche hony ſwete temporel rycheſſes delyces honour worlde thou arte dronke haſte forgoten ieſu chriſt thy creatour thou ne haſte done hym ſuche honoure reuerence ought ne thou ne haſte taken kepe wordes ouide ſayth vnder ye hony goodes thy body hyd venym ſleeth thy ſoule salomon ſayth ſo thou haſt founde hony eete ſame hony ſuffyſeth yf ſo thou eete ye ſame hony meſure thou ſhalte ſpewe alſo nedy poore parauenture almyghty god ieſu chriſt hath diſpyte hathe turned awaye fro hys face eeres myſerycorde mercye alſo hath ſuffred gyue lycence thou thus ſhuldeſt puniſhed chaſtiſed ye maner thou haſte treſpaſed offended thou haſt done ſynne agaynſt lorde chriſt certes thre enemyes mankynde ſay fleſhe fende worlde thou haſte ſuffred hem entre thyne herte wylfully wyndowes thy body haſt defended thy ſelfe ſuffyciently agaynſt aſſautes temptacions ſo haue wounded thy ſoule fyue place ſhy deedly ſynnes ben entred thy hert thy fyue wyttes ſame maner oure lorde chriſt hathe wolde ſuffred thy thre enemyes bē entred thy houſe ye wyndowes haue wounded thy doughter forſayd maner truely ꝙ melibee ſe well ye enforce moche wordes ouercome ſuche maner ſhall venge myn enemyes ſhewynge perilles yuels myght fal vengeaunce ſo wolde conſyder al vengeaunces peril yuels myght ſ • e vengeaunce takyng man wolde neuer take vengeaunce harme ye vengeaunce takynge ben wycked men diſceuered good men haue wyll wickedneſſe reſtrayn theyr wycked purpoſe whan ſe poniſhyng chaſtyſyng ye treſpaſours yet ſay ryght ſynguler perſon ſynneth takynge vengeaunce nother • ryght ſo ſynneth iuge yf vengeaūce hem haue deſerued seneke ſaythe thus mayſter ſaythe good preueth ſhrewes caſſyodor ſaythe man dredeth outrage whan wote knoweth dyſpleaſeth iuges ſoueraynes ſaythe iuge dredeth ryght maketh men ſhrewes ſaynt poule apoſtle ſaythe hys epyſtle whan wryteth vnto romayns iuges beare ſpeere wythout cauſe beare punyſhe ſhrewes myſdoers defende good men ¶yf ye woll take vengeaunce enemy ye ſhul returne haue recourſe iuge hath iuriſdyction vpon hem ſhall punyſhe hem lawe aſketh requyreth ha ſayd melibee thys vēgeaūce lyketh nothynge bethynke nowe take hede howe fortune hathe nouryſhed fro childhode hath holpe paſſe many ſtronge paas nowe woll aſſaye trowynge wyth goddes helpe ſhe ſhall helpe ſhame auenge truely ſaid prudēce yf ye wol werke counſayle ye ſhal aſſay •• ne waye ne ye ſhall lene bowe vnto worde senek thynges bene foolyſhlye done bene done hope fortune ſhal neuer come good ende ſame seneke ſayeth clere ſhynynge fortune brytel ſoner broke ſhe truſteth ſhe ſtedfaſt ne ſtable thou troweſt moſte ſure ſtedfaſte helpe ſhe woll fayle dyſceyue ye ſaye fortune hath nouryſhed fro youre chyldhode ſaye ſo moche ye ſhall leſſe truſte wytte seneke ſayeth man noryſhed fortune ſhe maketh great foole nowe ſyth ye deſyre aſke vēgeaūce vengeaunce done lawe iuge ne lyketh vengeaunce done hope fortune peryllous vncertaine haue ye none remedye haue recourſe vnto ſoueraine iuge vēgeth vylanyes wronges ſhal vēge hym ſelfe wytneſſeth ſayeth leaue vengeaunce ſhall melibee anſwered yf ne venge villany men haue done ſōmmō warne hem haue done vyllanye al vyllanye wrytten yf thou take vengeaūce olde vyllany thou ſōmoneſt thyne aduerſaryes newe vyllany alſo ſuffraūce men wolde ſo moche vyllany myght neither bere ne ſuſtayne ſo ſhulde put holden ouer lowe men ſayne mykel ſufferyng ſhal many thynges fal vnto thou ſhalt mowe ſuffre certes ꝙ prudence graunt ouer moch ſuffraunce good yet ne foloweth therof euery perſone whome men vyllanye ſhulde take vē geaunce appertayneth longeth iuges ſhulde venge ye vyllanyes iniuryes therfore thoſe two authority ye haue ſayd afore bene vnderſtande iuges ſuffre ouer moche wrōges vyllanyes done wythout punyſhment ſommon man newe wronges cōmaunde alſo wyſe man ſayeth iuge correcteth ye ſynner cōmaundeth byddeth hym ſynne ye iuges ſouerayns myght theyr lande ſo moch ſuffre ſhrewes myſdoers ſhulde ſuch ſuffraūce proceſſe tyme wexe ſuch power myght ſhulde put iuges ſoueraynes frō theyr place laſte make hem leſe lordſhyppes let v ſuppoſe ye haue leue venge ſaye ye myght power nowe venge yf ye woll make comparyſon vnto myghte youre aduerſaryes ye ſhulde fynde many thynges haue ſhewed er thys yt theyr condicyon better therfore ſaye good nowe ye ſuffre pacient furthermore ye knowe well cōmen ſawe woodneſſe man ſtryue wyth ſtronger mighty mā hym ſelfe ſtryue wyth man euen ſtrength ſaye wyth ſtronge man peryl ſtryue wyth weaker man folye therfore ſhulde man ſlye ſtryuynge mykel myght salomon ſayeth great worſhyppe man kepe hym fro noyſe ſtryfe yf ſo befal happe man greater myght ſtrength thou arte greuaūce ſtudy beſye rather ſtyll ſame greuaunce venge seneke ſayeth putteth hym great peryll ſtryueth wyth greater man hem ſelfe caton ſayth yf man hygher aſtate degre mighty thou anoye greuaunce ſuffre hym one hath greued maye tyme releue helpe yet ſette caſe ye haue lycence venge ſaye ben ful many thynges ſhal reſtrayne vengeaunce takyng make enclyne ſuffre haue pacience wronges haue ben done fyrſt formeſt yf ye wol conſyder fautes ben owne perſon whyche fautes god hath ſuffred haue trybulacion haue ſayd poete ſaythe ought paciently take trybulacions come v whan thynke conſyder haue deſerued haue ſaynt gregorie ſaythe whan man conſydereth wel nombre hys defautes hys ſynnes paynes trybulacions ſuffreth ſeme leſſe vnto hym moche thynketh ſynnes heuy greuous ſo moche ſemeth payne lighter eſyer vnto alſo ye owe enclyne bowe herte take pacience lorde ieſu chriſt ſayth ſaynt peter epyſtles ieſu chriſt ſaythe hath ſuffred v yeuen enſample euerye man folowe ſewe hym dyd neuer ſynne ne neuer came villaynous worde hys mouthe whan men curſed hym curſed hem whan men bete hym manaced hem alſo great pacience whyche ſayntes ben paradyſe haue tribulacyon haue ſuffred wythout deſerte gylte ought moche ſtyrre pacience ferthermore ye ſhul enforce haue pacience cō ſydryng trybulacions thys world lytel whyle endure ſone paſſed ben gon ye ioy man ſeketh haue pacience tribulacions perdurable apoſtle ſaythe epyſtle ioye god ſayth perdurable ſaye euerlaſtyng alſo troweth byleueth ſtedfaſtly wel nouriſhed wel taught haue pacience wol receyue pacyence salomon ſaythe doctryne wytte man knowen pacience place ſayth pacient gouerneth hym great prudence ſame salomon ſaythe angry wrathful man maketh noyſes pacient mā attempreth ſtylleth hem ſaythe alſo worth pacient ryght ſtronge maye haue lordeſhip owne herte prayſe thā force ſtrength taketh great cyties therfore ſayth ſaynt iame hys epyſtle pacyence great vertue perfectyon certes ꝙ melibee graunt dame prudence pacience great vertue perfection euerye man maye haue perfection ye ſeke ne nō bre ryght perfyte men myn herte may neuer peace vnto tyme auenged al ſo great peryl myne enemyes villanye taking vengeaunce vpon yet toke hede peryl fulfylled wycked wyll corage therfore thynketh men ought repreue though put lytel peryl auenge though great exceſſe ſaye venge one outrage ¶ah ꝙ dame prudence ye ſay wyl lyketh caſe worlde man ſhulde outrage ne exceſſe venge caſſiodor ſayth yuel dothe vengeth outrage dothe outrage therfore ye ſhal venge order right ſaye lawe exceſſe ne outrage alſo yf wol venge outrage aduerſaries maner right commaundeth ye ſynne therfore ſaythe seneke man ſhal neuer venge ſhreudneſſe ſhreudneſſe yf ye ſaye right aſketh defende violence violence fightyng fighting certes ye ſaye ſoth whan defence done without interual without taryeng delay defende hym venge hym behoueth man put ſuche attemperaūce defence mē haue cauſe ne mater repreue yt defendeth hym outrage exceſſe el agayne reſon parde ye knowe wel ye make defence nowe defende venge ſo ſheweth ye haue wyll dede attemperatly therfore thynketh pacience good salomon ſayeth pacient ſhall haue great harme certes ſayd melibee graūt mā impacient wroth toucheth appertaineth vnto though harme hym wonder lawe ſayth culpable entremetleth meteth wyth ſuche thynges apertayneth vnto hym salomō ſayeth▪ entremetleth noyſe ſtryfe another man lyke hym taketh ſtraunge hounde cere ryght taketh ſtraūge hoūde ye cere whyle byttē ye honde right ſo ſame wyſe reaſon haue harme hys impacience medleth hym noyſe man appertayneth vnto hym ye knowe wel thys dede ſaye grefe dyſeaſe toucheth ryght nyghe therfore though wrothe impacient maruayle ſauynge youre grace ſe yt myght greatly harme thoughe toke vengeaunce rycher myghtye myne enemyes well knowe ye money hauynge great poſſeſſyons ben thynges thys worlde gouerned salomō ſayeth al theſe thynges obey money prudence herde huſbande auaunt hym hys rycheſſe hys money dyſprayſynge ye power hys aduerſaryes ſhe ſpake ſayd thys wyſe certes dere ſyr graunt ye ryche myghty ye rycheſſe good hem haue well gotten hem well vſe hem ryght body man may lyue wythout ſoule may lyue temporel goodes ryches may man get hym great frendes therfore ſayeth pamphillus yf nerthes doughter ſayth riche ſhe may chefe thouſand men whyche ſhe woll take huſbande thouſande one woll forſake ne refuſe thys pamphillus ſayeth alſo yf thou ryght happy ſay yf thou ryche thou ſhalte fynde greate nombre felowes frendes yf thy fortune chaūge farewel frendſhyp felowſhyp thou ſhalte alone wythout cōpany yf companye poore folke yet ſayeth thys pamphillus ouer bene bonde thrall lynage ſhall made worthye noble rycheſſes ryghte ſo rycheſſes come many goodneſſes ryghte ſo pouertie come many harmes yuels greate pouertie cōſtrayneth man many yuels therfore calleth caſſiodor pouertye mother ruyne ſaye mother ouerthrowynge fallynge downe therfore ſayeth peter alfonce one greateſt aduerſyties thys worlde free man kynde byrth conſtrayned pouerty eat almeſſe hys enemye ſame ſayeth innocent one hys bokes ſayeth ſorowfull myſhappy condicion poore begger yf aſke hys meate dyeth honger yf aſke dyeth ſhame algates neceſſite conſtrayneth hym aſke therfore ſayeth salomon better
