dye haue ſuche pouerte ſame salomon ſayeth better dye bytter deth lyue ſuche wyſe theſe reaſons haue ſaid vnto many reaſons coulde ſay graunt rycheſſes ben good hem yt getten hem well hem wel vſen tho rycheſſes therfore wol ſhewe howe ye ſhal behaue gatherynge rycheſſes maner ye ſhullen vſe hem fyrſt ye ſhall get hem wythout great deſyre good leyſer ſokynglye ouerhaſtelye man deſyrynge get rycheſſe habandoneth hym fyrſte thefte yuels therfore ſayeth salomon haſteth hym beſely waxe ryche ſhall none innocent ſayeth alſo rycheſſe haſtely cometh man ſone lyghtly goeth paſſeth man rycheſſe cometh lytel lytel wexeth alwaye multiplyeth ſyr ye ſhall gette rycheſſe wyte trauayle vnto profyte wythout wronge harme doynge perſone lawe ſayeth maketh mā ſelfe riche yf harme wyght thys ſay nature defendeth forbyddeth ryghte man make hym ſelfe ryche vnto harme perſon tullius ſayeth ſorowe ne drede death ne nothing maye fall vnto man ſo moche ayenſt nature man encreace hys owne profyte harme mā though great myghty mē get rycheſſes lyghtly thou yet ſhalte thou ydell ne ſlowe thy profyte thou ſhalte wyſe flye ydelneſſe salomon ſayeth ye ydelneſſe teacheth man many yuels ſame salomon ſayeth trauayleth beſyeth hym tylth lāde ſhall eate breed ydell caſteth hym beſyneſſe ne occupacion ſhal fal pouerte dye honger ydell ſlowe neuer fynde couenable tyme hys profyte verſyfyer ſayeth ydel man excuſeth wynter bycauſe greate colde ſommer bycauſe heete theſe cauſes ſayeth caton waketh enclyne net ouer moche ſlepe ouer moche reſte nouryſheth cauſeth many vyces therfore ſayeth ſaynt ierom ſome good dedes deuell whyche enemye ne fynde vnoccupyed dyuel ne taketh lyghtly vnto wer kynge ſuche fyndeth occupyed good werkes thus gettynge rycheſſes ye muſt flye ydelneſſe afterward ye ſhul vſe rycheſſes whyche ye haue gote wyte youre trauayle ſuche maner men holde ſcarce ne ſparyng ne foole large ſay ouer large ſpēder ryghte men blame auaricious mā bycauſe hys ſcarcite chynchery ſame wyſe blame ſpendeth ouer largelye therfore ſayeth caton vſe ſayeth rycheſſes thou haſte gotten ſuche maner men maye haue mater ne cauſe call nother wretche ne chynche greate ſhame man haue poore herte ryche purſe ſayeth alſo goodes thou haſte gote vſe meaſure ſaye ſpende meſurably foolyſhly waſte dyſpende goodes haue haue propre owne ſhape hem take ye goodes man ſaye ye ſhall flye auaryce vſynge youre rycheſſe ſuche maner men ſaye youre rycheſſes bene buryed ye haue hem myghte youre weldynge wyſe man repreueth auaricyous man ſayeth thus thys verſes two wherto buryeth man hys goodes hys great auaryce knoweth well nedes muſte dye death ende euerye man▪ thys preſente lyfe cauſe encheſon ioyneth hym knytteth hym ſo faſte vnto hys goodes hys wyttes mowe dyſceuer hym ne departe hym fro hys goodes knoweth well ought knowe deade ſhall nothynge beare wyth hym thys worlde therfore ſayeth ſaynt auguſtyne auaricyous mā lykened vnto hell ſwaloweth deſyre hathe ſwalowe deuoure well ye wolde eſchewe called auaricyous man chynche well ſhulde ye kepe gouerne ſuch wyſe men call foole large therfore ſayeth tullius goodes thyne houſe ne ſhulde hydde ne kepte ſo cloſe myghte opened pyte debonayrte ſaye yeue hem parte haue greate nede ne thy goodes ſhulde ſo open euerye man goodes afterwarde gettynge youre rycheſſes vſynge hem ye ſhall alwaye haue thre thynges youre herte ſay lorde god conſcience good name fyrſt ye ſhall haue god herte ryches ye ſhuld thyng whych may maner dyſpleaſe god creatour maker worde salomon better haue lytell good ye loue god haue moche good treaſoure leſe loue lorde god prophete ſayeth better good man haue lytel good treaſour holden ſhrewe haue great rycheſſe yet ſay furthermore ye ſhulde alwaye buſyneſſe get rycheſſes ſo ye get hem good conſcience apoſtle ſayeth ny thynge thys worlde whyche ſhulde haue ſo great ioye oure conſcience beareth v good wytneſſe wyſe man ſayeth ſubſtaunce man full good ſynne man conſcience afterwarde gettyng rycheſſes vſynge hem ye muſte haue great beſyneſſe great diligence good name alwaye kept conſerued salomon ſayeth better auayleth man haue good name haue many rycheſſes therfore ſayth place great diligence ſayeth salomon kepynge thy frendes thy good name ſhall lenger abyde wyth thē treaſure neuer ſo precious certes ſhuld called great gentylman god good conſcience thynges lefte ne doth hys deligence beſyneſſe kepe hys good name caſſyodor ſayeth ſygne gentyll herte mā loueth deſyreth haue good name therfore ſayeth ſaynte auguſtyne ben two thynges ben ryght neceſſarye alſo nedefull good conſcience good loſe ſaye good cō ſcience thyne owne perſone inwarde good loſe thy neyghbour outwarde truſteth hym ſo moch hys good cō ſcience dyſpyſeth ſetteth nought good name looſe recketh though kepe hys good name ny cruell churle syr nowe haue ſhewed howe ye ſhulde gettynge rycheſſes howe ye ſhulde vſe hem ſe well truſt ye haue rycheſſes ye woll moue warre batayle counſayle ye begyn warre truſte youre rycheſſes ne ſuffyſe warres maynteyne therfore ſayeth philoſopher mā deſyreth wolde algates haue warre ſhall neuer haue ſuffyſaunce rycher greater dyſpēces muſt make yf woll haue worſhyppe vyctorye salomon ſayeth greater rycheſſes yt man hath dyſpendours hath therfore ſyr ſo youre ryches ye maye haue moche folke yet behoueth ne good begynne warre ye maye maner haue peace vnto youre worſhyppe profyte vyctorye batayls bene thys worlde lyeth great nombre multytude people ne vertue mā lyeth wyll hande oure lorde god almyghtye therfore iudas machabeus whyche goddes knyght ſhulde fyght ayenſt hys aduerſarye hadde greater nombre greater multytude folke ſtrōger hys people machabee yet recomforted hys lytell company ſayd ryght thys wyſe alſo lyghtly ſayd maye lorde god yeue vyctorye fewe folke many folke vyctorye batayle cometh greate nombre people cōmeth oure lorde god heauen dere ſyr moche man certayne yf worthye god yeue hym vyctorye salomon ſayeth therfore euery man ſhuld greatlye drede warres begyn bycauſe batayles fall many peryls happeth whyle ſone greate man ſlayne lytel man wrytten ſeconde boke kynges dedes batayles ben aduenturous nothyng certayne lyghtlye one hurte wyth ſpeere ther great peryll warre therfore ſhulde man ſlye eſchue warre moch man may goodly salomō ſayeth loueth peryl ſhall fall peryll dame prudence ſpoken thys maner melibe anſwered ſayd ſe well dame prudence fayre wordes reſons ye haue ſhewed warre lyketh nothynge haue yet herde youre counſayle howe ſhall thys nede certes ſaid ſhe coūſayle ye accorde wyth aduerſaries ye haue peace wyth hem ſaynt iames ſayeth hys epyſtle concorde peace ſmall ryches waxe great debate dyſcorde ryches decaye ye knowe well one greateſt moſte ſouerayne thyng worlde vnite peace therfore ſayeth oure lorde ieſu chriſte hys apoſtles thys wyſe wel happy ben loue purchace peace called chyldren god ah ſayd melibee ſe wel ye loue myne honour ne worſhyp ye knowe wel myne aduerſaryes haue begon debate bryge theyr outrage ye ſe well ne requyre ne praye peace ne aſke reconſiled wol ye go meke obey crye hem mercye forſoth yt worſhyp ryghte men ſaye ouer great humbleneſſe engendreth dyſprayſynge ſo fareth great • humilite mekeneſſe began dame prudence make ſemblant wrath ſayd certes ſyr ſaue grace loue honour profyte myne owne euer haue ye ne none neuer ſe cōtrary yet yf ſaid ye ſhulde haue purchaſed peace reconſiliation ne moche myſtake ne ſayd amyſſe wyſe man ſayeth dyſcention begynneth man reconſylynge begynneth thy ſelfe prophete ſayeth flye ſhreudneſſe goodneſſe ſeke peace folowe moch yet ſaye ye ſhulde rather purſue youre aduerſaries peace ſhulde knowe well ye bene ſo harde herted ye woll nothynge salomon ſayeth hath ouer harde herte laſte ſhal myſhappe myſbetyde melibee herde dame prudence make ſemblaunt wrathe ſayde thys wyſe dame praye ye dyſpleaſed ye thynge ſaye ye knowe well angrye wroth wonder wrothe wote well ne ſaye therfore prophete ſayeth troubled eyen haue clere ſyght ſaye coū ſayle lyketh ready ryght ye wol deſyre yf ye reprefe folye holden loue prayſe salomō ſayeth repreueth hym doth foly ſhall fynde greater grace dyſceyueth ſwete wordes ſayde dame prudence make ſemblaunt wrath ne anger great profyte salomon ſayeth worth repreueth chydeth fole hys folye ſhewynge hym ſemblaunt wrath ſupporteth prayſeth hym hys myſdoynge laugheth • hys folye thys ſame salomon ſayeth afterwarde ſorowfull vyſage man ſaye ſorye heuy countenaunce man foole correcteth amendeth hym ſelfe ſayde milibee ſhall con anſwere vnto ſo many fayre reaſons ye put ſhewe ſaye ſhortly wyl youre counſayle readye performe fulfyll ¶then dame prudence dyſcouered wyll vnto hym ſayde counſayle ſayd ſhe aboue al thynges ye make peace bytwene god reconſyled vnto hym hys grace haue ſayd god hath ſuffred haue thys tribulation dyſeaſe ſynnes yf ye ſaye god wyl ſende youre aduerſaryes vnto make hem fall fete ready youre wyll commaundement salomon ſayeth condicion man pleaſaūt lykynge god chaū geth hertes man aduerſaries conſtrayneth hem beſeche hym peace grace praye let ſpeke aduerſaryes priuelye ſhal knowe wyll aſſent knowe theyr wyll theyr entente maye counſayle ſurely dame ſayde melibee dothe youre wyll lykynge put holy dyſpoſicion ordynaunce dame prudence ſhe ſawe good wyll huſbonde delybered toke aduyſe ſelfe thynkyng ſhe myght brynge thys nede vnto good concluſion good ende ſhe ſawe tyme ſhe ſente theſe aduerſaries come vnto priue place ſhewed wiſely vnto hem ye great goodes come peace greate harmes peryls bene warre ſayd hem goodly maner howe hem ought haue great repentaūce iniury wronge done melibeus lorde vnto doughter herde ye goodly wordes dame prudence ſo ſuppryſed rauyſhed ſo great ioye wonder tel ¶ah ladye ſayde ye haue ſhewed vnto v bleſſyng ſwetneſſe ſayeng dauid prophete reconſyling nat worthy haue manere ought require great cōtricion humilite ye goodneſſe haue preſented vnto v ſe wel ſcience cōnyng salomon ful trewe ſaith ſwete wordes multiply encreace frendes maketh ſhrewes debonaire meke certes ſayd put dede al mater cauſe al holy goodwyl redy obey cōmaundement oure lorde melibeus therfore dere benygne lady praye beſeche mekely maye lyke vnto great goodneſſe fulfyll dede goodly wordes conſyder knowe haue offended greued oure lorde melibeus meaſure ſo forforth nat power make hym amendes therfore oblige bynde v frendes hys wyll commaundement parauenture hath ſuche heuyneſſe ſuche wrathe v warde bycauſe offence woll enioyn v ſuche payne mowe nat beare ne ſuſtayne therfore noble lady beſech womanly pyte take ſuche aduyſement thys nede ne frē de nat diſherited ne diſtroyed foly certes ſayd prudence harde thynge ryght perilous man put al vtterly arbytration iugement might power hys enemye salomon ſaythe leueth yeueth credence ſhal ſaye ne yeueth neuer power ne gouernaunce thy goodes thy ſon thy wyfe thy frende ne thy brother ne yeue thou neuer might ne maſtry ouer thy body thou liueſt nowe ſyth defendeth man ſhulde nat yeue brother ne frende might body ſtronger reaſon defendeth forbedeth man yeue hym ſelfe enemy natheleſſe counſaile ye myſtruſt nat lorde wot wel know verily debonair meke large curteys nothynge deſirous ne couitous goodes ne ryches nothynge worlde deſyreth ſaue onely worſhyp honoure ferthermore knowe ryght ſure ſhal nothyng thys nede without coūſayle ſhall ſo worke thys caſe grace lorde god ye ſhalbe reconſyled vnto v ſayd one voyce worſhypful lady put v oure goodes fully wyl diſpoſycion ben redy come day lyketh vnto nobleſſe lymyte v aſſyne v make oblygacion bonde ſtronge lyketh vnto goodnes mowe fulfyl wyl lorde melibe whan dame prudence herde anſwere theſe men ſhe bad hem go ayen priuely ſhe returned lorde melibe tolde hym howe ſhe founde hys aduerſaries ful repentaunt knowlegynge ful lowly ſynnes treſpas redy ſuffre al payne requiryng prayīg mercy pyte ſayde melibe wel worthy haue pardon foryeueneſſe hys ſynne excuſeth hys ſynne knowlegeth repenteth hym aſkyng indulgynce seneke ſayth remiſſion yeueneſſe confeſſyon confeſſyon neyghbour innocence therfore aſſent confyrme haue peace good nought wtout aſſente wyl frendes prudence ryght gladde ioyful ſayde certes ſir ye haue wel goodly anſwered ryght counſayle aſſent helpe frendes ye haue ſteered venge make werre right ſo without counſayle ſhall ye accorde ne haue peace aduerſaries lawe ſayth nothyng ſo good waye kynde thyng vnbounde ybounde dame prudence wythout delay taryenge ſent anone meſſanger kynſfolke olde frendes whyche trewe wiſe told hem order preſence melibe al mater aboue expreſſed declared prayed hem wolde ſaye theyr aduyſe counſayle beſt nede whan melibeus frendes taken aduyſe delyberacion forſayd mater examyned great buſyneſſe dilygence yaue ful counſaile haue peace reſt melibee ſhulde receyue wyth good hert hys aduerſaris foryeueneſſe mercy whan dame prudence herd thaſſent lorde melibee counſayle hys frendes accorde wyl entencion ſhe wonderſly gladde hert ſayde olde prouerbe ſayd ſhe ye goodneſſe thou maiſt day abyde nat ne delay nat tyl next daye therfore counſayle ye ſende meſſengers ſuche diſcrete wyſe vnto aduerſaries tellyng hem behalf yf wol treat peace accorde ſhape hē wyth delay taryeng come vnto v whyche thyng performed dede whan theſe treſpaſours repentyng folke folie ſay aduerſaries melibeus herde theſe meſſangers ſayd vnto hem ryght gladde ioyful anſwered ful mekely benygnely yeldyng grace thankes lorde melibe • al hys companye ſhope hem without delaye go wyth meſſangers obeyed commaundement lorde melibeus ryght anone toke way courte melibe toke hem ſome true frēdes make faythe hem borowes whā comen preſence melibee ſayd hem theſe wordes ſtondeth thus ſayde melibee ſoth cauſeleſſe without ſkyl reſon ye haue done great iniuries wronges wyfe prudence doughter alſo ye haue entred houſe violence haue done ſuche outrage men knowe wel ye haue deſerued dethe therfore woll knowe wete whether ye woll put puniſhynge chaſtylyng vengeaunce thys outrage wyl wyfe ye wol wyſeſt hem thre anſwerd hem al ſayd sir ſayd know wel ben vnworthy come courte ſo great lorde ſo worthy ye haue ſo gretly miſtaken v haue offended agylted ſuch wyſe agayn hygh lordſhyp truely haile deſerued dethe yet great goodneſſe debonairte al worlde wytneſſeth perſon ſubmytte v ye excellēcye benygnytye gracious lordeſhyp ben redy obey al commaundementes beſechynge mer • iable pyte ye wel conſyder oure great repentaunce lowe ſubmyſſyon graunt v foryeueneſſe outragyous treſpace offence wel knowe liberal grace mercye ſtretcheth ferther goodneſſe oure outragious gyltes treſpaces wyckedneſſe al curſedly damnably haue agilted agaynſt hygh lordſhyp melibee tooke hem vp fro grounde ful benygnely receyued oblygacions bondes othes vpon pledge borowes aſſyned hem certayne day retourne vnto hys courte receyue accept ſentence iugement melibeus wolde cō maunde hem cauſes aforſayd thynges ordayned euery man returned hys houſe whan dame prudēce ſawe tyme ſhe fayned aſked lorde melibe vengeaunce thought take hys aduerſaries whyche melibe anſwerde ſayde▪ certes ſayde thynke purpoſe fully diſherit thē al euer haue putte exile euer certes ſayd dame prudence thys cruel ſentence moche ayenſt reaſon ye rich ynough haue nede mennes rich ye might lyghtly wyſe gete couetous name whiche vicious thyng ought eſchewed euery good man ſayeng apoſtel couetiſe rote al harmes therfore wer better leſe ſo moch good owne take theyr good thys maner better leſe good worſhip wyn good vilanye ſhame euerye man ought dilygence buſyneſſe gette good name yet ſhal onely buſy kepyng hys good name ſhal al ſo enforce hym alwaye ſome thynge whiche may renewe hys good name writtē old good loſe mā good name ſoone gone paſt whan renewed touchynge ye ſay ye wol exile aduerſaries thynketh moche ayenſt reaſon meaſure conſydringe power haue yeue vpon ſelfe wrytten worthy leſe hys pryuilege myſuſeth ye might power gyuen hym ſette caſe ye might enioyne hem yt payne right lawe whiche trowe ye maye nat ſaye ye myghte put execution parauenture lyke tourne ye werre therfore yf ye woll men obeyſaunce ye muſte demean curteiſly ſaye ye muſte yeue eaſy ſentences iugement wrytten moſt curteiſly commaundeth hym men mooſt obey therfore praye thys neceſſyte thys nede ye caſte ouercome youre hert senet ſayth ouercometh hys herte ouercometh twiſe tully ſayth nothyng ſo commendable great lorde whan debonaire meke apeſeth hym lyghtly praye ye woll nowe forbere vengeaunce ſuche maner youre good name maye kepte conſerued men may haue cauſe mater prayſe pyte mercye ye haue cauſe repent thynge done senecke ſaythe ouercometh yuel manere repenteth hym hys victorie wherfore praye let mercy hert theffecte entent god almyghty • haue mercy vpō hys laſt iugement ſaynt iames ſayth hys epiſtel iugement without mercye ſhal hym hath mercy another wight whan melibee herde great ſkylles reaſons dame prudence wyſe information techynges hys herte gan enclyne wyl hys wyfe conſydryng trew entent confirmed hym anon aſſented fully worke counſayle thanked god whome procedeth goodneſſe vertue hym ſent wyfe ſo great diſcretion whan day came aduerſaries ſhulde appere prenſence ſpake hem goodly ſayde thys wyſe al ſo pryde high preſumption foly negligence vnconnyng ye haue miſborne treſpaced vnto yet mikel ſe beholde great humilyte ye ſory repentaūt gyltes cōſtrayneth grace mercy wherfore receyue grace forgyue holy al offence iniuries wronges ye haue agaynſt myne theffecte ende god endleſſe mercy wol tyme oure dyeng forgyue v gyltes haue treſpaced thys wreched worlde doutleſſe yf ſory repentaunt ſynnes gyltes whyche haue treſpaced ye ſyght oure lord god ſo fre ſo merciable woll forgyue v oure gyltes brynge v blyſſe neuer ſhall haue ende amen ¶here endeth tale chaucer foloweth monkes prologue whan ended tale malibee prudence benygnyte hoſt ſayd faythfull man precious corp madrian leuer barel ale goodlefe wyfe herd thys tale ſhe nothyng ſuche pacience thys melibeus wyfe prudence goddes bone whā bete knaues bringeth great clubbed ſtaues crieth ſlee dogges euerichone breke bothe backe euery bone yf neyghbour myne wol churche wyfe enclyne ſo hardy treſpace whan ſhe cometh hom ſhe rāpeth face cryeth falſe cowarde wreke thy wyfe corpus domini wol haue thy knyfe thou ſhalt haue diſtaffe go ſpynne fro day tyl nyght ſhe wol thus begynne ¶alas ſhe ſaith euer ſhe ſhape wedde mylkſop cowarde ape wol ouerleyde euery wight thou darſt ſtonde thy wyues right lyfe yf wold fight dore anon mote dight el loſt yf lyke wylde lyon fole hardy wote wel ſhe wol ſlee ſome day neyghbour go way perlous knyfe honde al dare withſtonde ſhe bygge armes faithe ſhal fynd myſdoth ſaith lette v paſſe away matere ¶my lord ſayd ſir mōke mery chere ye ſhal tel v tale trewly lo rocheſter ſtondeth faſt ride ſorth myne owne lorde breke oure game trouthe knowe name whether ſhal cal lorde dan iohn dan thomas dan robert dan albon houſe ye farther kyn vowe god thou haſt ful fayre chyn gentyl paſture thou goſt thou arte lyke pynaunt ghoſt vpon faythe thou arte ſome officere worthy sexten ſome celerere father ſoule dome thou art mayſter whan thou art home poore cloyſterer ne poore nouyſe gouernoure ware wyſe therwith brawne bone wel faryng perſon none pray god yeue confuſyon fyrſt brought religyon thou woldeſt trede foule right haddeſt thou gret leue thou haſt might perfourme al thy luſt engendrure thou haddeſt begoten many creature ala wereſt thou ſo wyde cope god yeue ſorowe pope thou euery mighty man though ſhore hyghe vpon pan shuld haue wyfe al world lorn religyon hath take vp al corne tredynge borel men ben ſhrimpes feble tree cometh wretched impes maketh heires ſo ſlender feble maye wel engender maketh wyues wol aſſay religious folke may better pay venus paymentes mowe god wote luſheburghs paye ye wroth lorde though playe full ofte game ſothe haue herde ſaye worthy monke toke al pacience ſayd wol dilygence ferre ſowneth honeſte tel tale ye two thre yf ye lyſt herken hytherwarde wol ſayne lyfe ſaynt edwarde el tragedyes fyrſt wol tel whiche haue hundred cel tragedy tel certayne ſtory olde bokes maken memory hem ſtode great proſperyte fallen hye degre myſery ended wretchedly ben vercifyed comenly ſyxe fete whiche men cal exametron proſe eke ben endyted many metre many ſondrye wyſe lo ought ynough ſuffyſe nowe herkeneth yf lyſte fyrſt beſeche matere though order tel nat theſe thynges pope emperours kynges age men written fynde tellen hem ſome ſome behynde cometh nowe remembraunce haue excuſed myne ignoraunce ¶here endeth monkes prologue begynneth hys tale wyl bewayle maner tragedy harme hem ſtoden hye degre fyl ſo na remedy bryng hem aduerſyte certayn whan fortune lyſt flye may mā courſe withold lette man truſt blynde proſperite bethware enſample yonge old ¶lucifer lucifer though angel nat mā wyl begynne though fortune maye nat angel dere frō hye degre yet fel ſynne doun hel yet inne lucifer brighteſt angel al art thou sathanas yt maiſt nat twyn myſery whiche thou arte fal ¶adam ¶lo adam felde damaſcene goddes fynger wrought begotten mannes ſperm vnclene welte al paradiſe ſauyng tree neuer worldly man ſo hye degre adam tyl myſgouernaunce dryuen hys hygh proſperite labour hel myſchaunce ¶sampſon ¶lo samſon yt annunciate angel longe hys natiuite god almighty conſecrate ſtode noble myght ſe neuer ſuch another ſpeke ſtrength therto hardyneſſe wyues tolde ſecre ſlough wretchedneſſe sampſon noble mighty champion without wepen ſaue hondes twey ſlough al rent lyon toward hys weddyng walking wey falſe wyfe coulde hym ſo pſeſe praye tyl ſhe counſayle knewe ſhe vntrewe vnto foe counſayle gan vewray hym forſoke toke another newe hundred fox toke sampſon yre al tayles togyther bonde ſet fox tayles al fyre euery tayle hath put bronde brent al cornes londe olyues vynes eke thouſand men eke ſlough hond wepen aſſe cheke whā ſlayne ſo thriſted yt wel nye lorne gan prey god wold payn haue ſome pyte ſende drinke el mote dey aſſe cheke ſo drey wange tothe ſprange anon wel whiche dronke ynough ſhortly ſey thus holpe god iudicum tel force gaſa nyght maugre philyſtens cyte gate towne hath vp plyght hys backe ycaried hem hath high hyl men myght hem ſe noble mighty sampſon lefe dere thou nat tolde woman thy ſecre al wrolde ne thy pere sāpſon neither ſyder drāke ne wyne ne heed cam raſour none ne ſhere precepte meſſangere diuyne al hys ſtrength heeres fully twenty yere yere iſrael gouernaunce ſoon ſhal wepe many tere woman ſhal bryng hym myſchaunce vnto lemman dalyda tolde heeres al ſtrength lay falſely hys foe ſhe hym ſolde ſlepyng barme vpon day mad clyppe ſhere heeres away made fomen al crafte eſpyen whan fonde ſuche aray bounde faſte put eyen er hys heeres clypped iſhaue bonde might bynde nowe put priſon caue made hym ye querne grynde noble sāpſon ſtrongeſt mankynde whylom iuge glorie rycheſſe mayſt thou wepe wt thyn eyen blynde sith yu art wele fal wretchidneſſe ende caytife ſhal ſey fomen made feeſt vpon daye made foole byfore hē pley temple great araye laſt made foule afray two pyllers ſhoke made hem fal downe fel temple al lay ſloughe hym ſelfe eke fomen ſay prince euerychone eke thre thouſād bodyes ther ſlayn fallyng great temple ſtone sampſon wol ſayne beth ware enſample olde playne men tel counſayle wyues ſuch thyng wold haue ſecret fayn touche lymmes lyues ¶hercules hercules ſouerayne conqueroure syngen hys werkes laude hye renoun hys tyme ſtrength bare floure ſlough rafte ſkyn lyoun centaur layde boſte adoun harpia ſlewe cruel byrdes fel golden appels rafte fro dragon drewe cerberus hounde hel ſlewe cruel tyraunt buſtrus made horſe frete fleſh bone ſlough ſerpent venemous achelous two horne brake one ſlewe cacus caue ſtone ſlough gyaunt antacus ſtronge ſlough griſly bore anon bare heed vpon ſpere longe neuer wight ſythe worlde began ſlough ſo many monſters dyd wyde worlde name ran ſtrenght bounte euery realme went ſe ſo ſtronge yt man might let bothe worldes endes trophe ſtede boundes braſſe pyllour ſet ¶alemman noble champyon hight de • anire freſhe may clerkes make mencion hath ſent ſhyrte freſhe gay ala ſhirte ala wel awaye enuenomed ſubtelly al er weared halfe daye made fleſhe al fro hys bone fal natheleſſe ſome clerkes excuſen one hight neſſus maked may wol accuſen body ſhyrte ware al naked tyl fleſhe venym ſlaked whan ſawe none remedye hote cole hath ſelfe iraked venym dayned dye thus ſterfe worthy mighty hercules lo may truſte fortune throwe foloweth al world prees ware ofte layde ful lowe ful wyſe hym ſelfe knowe beware whan fortune lyſt gloſe wayteth ſhe mā downe throwe ſuche waye wolde leſte ſuppoſe ¶nabugodonoſor mighty trone precious treſore glorious ſeptre royal mayeſte kynge nabugodonoſore tonge vnneth may diſcryu • twyſe wanne hieruſalem cyte veſſel temple lad babilon ſouerayne ſe whiche glorie delyte fayreſt child blode royal hieruſalem dyd gelde anone made eche hem ben hys thral amonge al danyel one wyſeſt euerychone dre •• kyng expowned caldee clerkes non • wyſt fyne dreme ſowned proude kyng let make ſtatu gold sixty cubites longe ſeuen brede whiche ymage bothe yonge olde commaunded loute haue drede furneys ful flame rede ſhulde deed wolde obey neuer wolde aſſent dede danyel ne yonge felowes twey ¶thys kynge kynges proude elate wende god ſytteth maieſte ne myght hym byreue hys eſtate ſodeynly loſt hys dygnite lyke beeſt hym ſemed eate hey oxe laye therout rayne wyth wylde beeſtes walked tyll certayne tyme come aboute lyke egles fethers hys heeres hys nayles lyke byrdes clawes god releued hym certayne yeres yaue wytte thē many tere thanked god hys lyfe fere amyſſe treſpace er layde hys bere knewe yt god full myght grace ¶balthaſer ſonne whyche hyght balthaſare helde reygne hys father daye hys father coulde beware proude herte aray eke ydolaſter aye hys hygh eſtate aſſured hym pryde fortune caſt hym downe laye ſodeynly hys raygne gan deuyde feeſt made vnto hys lordes al vpon tyme made hem blyth hys offycers gan call gothe brynge forth veſſels ꝙ whych father hys proſperite temple hieruſalem byrafte goddes thanken honoure elder v lafte hys wyfe hys lordes hys cōcubynes aye dronken whyles appetytes laſte theſe noble veſſels ſondrye wynes wall thys kynge hys eyen caſte ſaw hōde armeleſſe wrote faſte feare whych quoke ſyghed ſore honde ye balthaſar made ſore agaſte wrote mane techel phares ¶in al lande magicien ther none coude expowne thys letter ment daniel expowned anone ſayd kynge god thy father ſent glorye honoure reygne treaſour rent proude nothynge god drad therfore great wrath god vpō ſente hym byrafte raygne caſte mannes companye wyth aſſes hys habitacion eate hey beeſt wete drye tyl knewe grace reſon god heauen hath domination ouer euery reygne euery creature god hym compaſſyon hym reſtored reygne fygure ¶eke thou ye art hys ſonne arte proude alſo knoweſt theſe thynges priuely arte rebell god hys foe thou dranke eke hys veſſels boldly thy wyfe eke thy wench ſynfully dronke ſame veſſels ſondrye wynis heryed falſe goddes curſedly therfore ſhapen great payne honde ſent fro god yt wall wrote mane techel phares truſte thy reygne done thou woreſt al deuyded thy realme ſhalbe medes perciens quod ſame nyght kynge ſlawe darius occupyed hys dignite though therto nether ryght ne lawe lordynges emſample mowe ye take howe lordſhyp ſykerneſſe fortune wol man forſake bereth away hys raygne hys rycheſſe eke hys frendes leſſe man hath frēdes fortune myſhap wol make hym enemyes geſſe thys prouerbe ful ſoth ful comune ¶zenobia zenobia palmerye quene wryteth perciēs nobleſſe worthywas armes ſo kene yt wight paſſed hardyneſſe ne ī linage ne ī none gētilnes kynges blode perce ſhe dyſcended ſay ſhe moſte fayrneſſe ſhape ſhe myght amended chylhode fynde ſhe fledde offyce woman woode ſhe went many wylde hertes bloode ſhe ſhedde wyth arowes brode ſhe hem ſent ſo ſwyfte ſhe anone hem hent ſhe elder ſhe wolde kyll lyon lybardes beeres al rent armes welde hem wyll durſt wylde beeſtes dennes ſeke renne mounteyns al nyght ſlepe vnder buſhe ſhe coulde eke wraſtell force myght wyth yōge mā neuer ſo wyght myght thynge armes ſtonde kept maydenhede frō euery wyght man dayned ſhe bonde laſt frendes hath maryed odenat prince countre al ſo ſhe hem longe taryed ye ſhall vnderſtande howe ſuche fantaſyes ſhe natheleſſe knyt fere lyued ioye felicite eche hem lefe dere saue one thynge ſhe nolde neuer aſſent waye ſhulde lye one playne entent haue chylde worlde multyplye alſo ſone ſhe myght aſpye ſhe wt chylde wyth dede wolde ſhe ſuffer hym hys fantaſye efte ſones one drede yf ſhe wyth chylde caſte nomore ſhulde playe game tyll fully fourty dayes paſte wolde ſhe one ſuffre hym ſame thys odenat wylde tame gate nomore thus ſhe ſayd wyues lechery ſhame caſe yf men wyth hem playde ¶two ſonnes thys odenat ſhe whych ſhe kept vertue lettrure nowe vnto tale turne ſaye ſo worſhypfull creature wyſe therwyth large wyth meſure penyble warre curteys eke ne laboure myght warre endure none though al thys worlde mē wolde ſeke ryche araye ne myght tolde well veſſell clothynge al clad pierry golde eke ſhe lefte none huntynge haue ſondry tonges folke knowynge ſhe leyſer entende lerne bokes lykynge howe ſhe vertue lyfe myght dyſpende ſhortly thys ſtorye treate doughty huſbonde ſhe cōquered many reygnes gre •• orient wyth many fayre cyte apperteynaunt vnto maieſte rome wyth ſtrength helde faſte ne neuer myght men ſlee whyle odenates dayes laſte batayles ſo lyſte hem rede agayne sapor kynge mo howe thys proces fyll dede ſhe cōquered title ſhe therto myſchefe wo howe ſhe beſieged ytake let hym mayſter petrarke go wryteth ynough thys vndertake ¶when odenat deed ſhe myghtely realmes helde wyth owne honde agaynſt foe ſhe fought truely ther prince ne kynge al londe glad yf grace fonde ſhe ne ſhulde vpon hys lande werrey wyth made alyaunce bonde peace let hem ryde pley emperour rome claudius ne hym beforne romayne galyen ne durſt neuer ſo coragius ne none armen ne none egypcien ne surrien ne none arabien wythin felde durſt wyth fyght leſt yt ſhe wolde hem wyth hondes ſle •• wyth meyne put hem flyght kynges habyte wente ſonnes two heyres realmes hermanno titamallo name perciens hem call aye fortune hath hony gall myghty quene may whyle endure fortune reygne made fal wretchedneſſe myſauenture ¶aurelian gouernaunce rome came hys hondes twey ſhope vpon thys quene vengeaunce wyth hys legion toke hys wey towarde zenobia ſhortly ſay made flye laſte hent fettered eke chyldren tway wan lōde home rome went amonge thynges wan chare yt golde wrought pierre thys great romayne thys aurelian hath wyth hym ladde men ſhulde ſe beforne hys tryumphe walked ſhe wyth golden chaynes necke hongyng crowned ſhe degre full pier • e charged clothynge ¶alas fortune ſhe whylom dredfull kynges emperoures nowe gaureth people ala ſhe helmed ſtarke ſtoures wan force townes ſtronge toures shall heed nowe autremyte ſhe bare ſeptre ful floures shal beare dyſtaffe coſte quyte ¶nero although nero vicious fende lyeth full lowe adoun yet telleth v ſuetoniꝰ al worlde ī ſubiectiō eſte weſt septentrion rubyes ſaphers perles whyte al he clothes broudred vp doun gemmes greatly gan delyte delycate pompous aray proude neuer emperour thē ylke cloth wered day tyme nolde neuer ſe nettes golde threde great plente fyſhe tyber lyſt play hys luſtes lawe hys degre fortune hys frende wolde hym obay rome brent hys delycacye senatours ſlewe vpon day wyues wolde wepe crye ſlough hys brother ſyſter laye hys mother made pytouſe aray wombe let ſlytte beholde conceyued ſo welaway ſo lytell hys mother tolde teeres hys eyen ſyght ne came ſayd fayre womon ſhe great wonder coude myght domyſman deed beaute wyne brynge hym commaunded dranke anone none wo made myght ioyned vnto cruelte ala depe wyl venyme wade youth mayſter thys emperoure teache hym lettrure curteſye moralite floure hys tyme yf hys bokes lye whyles mayſter maſtrye made hym ſo connynge ſo ſouple longe tyme tyrannye vyce durſte hym vncouple senec maiſter deuyſe bycauſe nero hym ſuche drede hys vyces wolde hym chaſtyſe dyſcretly worde dede syr wolde ſaye emperour mote nede vertuouſe hate tyrannye whych made hym bath blede hys armes tyll muſte dye thys nero eke cuſtomaunce youth ayenſt hys mayſter ryſe afterward though gret greuaūce bycauſe ofte wolde hym chaſtyſe therfore made hym dye thys wyſe choſe bath dye thys manere rather haue another turmentyſe thus hath nero ſlayne hys maſter dere ¶nowe fell ſo fortune lyſt longer hygh pryde nero cheryſhe tho ſtronge yet ſhe ſtrōger thought thus god nyce ſet man fulfylled vyce hye degre emperour hym call god hys ſete woll hym tryce leſt weneth ſoneſt ſhall fall people roſe vpon hym nyght hys defaute aſpyed dores anon hath dyght alone wende haue ben alyed knocked faſte aye cryed faſter ſhette dores tho wyſte wel ſelfe begyled went way lenger durſte call people cryed rombled vp doun wt eeres herde howe ſayde vhere falſe tyraunt neroun feare ful nere wytte brayde goddes right pitouſly prayde ſocoure might betyde drede thought deyde ranne gardeyn hyde gardayne foūde chorles twey syttyng fyre great reed chorles two gan prey flee gyrde heed bodye whan deed diſpyte done diffame ſelfe ſlough coulde better rede whiche fortune lough game ¶holofernes neuer capitayne vnder kyng reignes mo put ſubiectyō neſtrōger feld al thing ī tyme ne greater ofrenoū ne pompous hygh preſumpcioun holopherne fortune aye kyſte ſo lycorouſly ladde vp doun tyl deed er wyſte world awe leſyng rycheſſe lyberte made euery man renye lawe nabugodonoſor lorde ſayd none god ſhulde honoured ayenſt heſt dare wight treſpace saue bethulia ſtronge cyte eliachym preeſt place ¶but take kepe ye dethe holopherne amyd hoſt dronke laye al nyght within tent large berne yet al pompe al might iudith woman lay vpright sleping heed ſmote fro tente ful priuely ſhe ſtale euery wight heed vnto towne ſhe wēte ¶antiochus nedeth kynge antiochus tell hys hyghe royall maieſte hys great pryde hys werke venemus ſuche man na neuer redeth machabe redeth proude wordes ſayde fyl proſperyte hyl howe wretchedly deyde fortune enhaunſed ſo pryde verily wende might attayne vnto ſterres vpon euery ſyde balaunce wey eche mountayne al floodes ſee reſtrayne goddes people moſte hate hem wolde ſlee turment payne wenyng god ne might pryde abate nychanore tymothe iewes venquiſhed mightyly vnto iewes ſuche hate bad greythe chare full haſtely ſwore ſayd ful diſpytouſly vnto hieruſalem wolde eftſone wreke yre ful cruelly purpoſe let ful ſone god manace ſore ſmote inuyſible wounde aye incurable guttes carfe ſo bote hys paynes importable certaynly wreche reſonable many mannes guttes dyd payne purpoſe curſed dampnable al ſmerte nolde reſtrayne bade anon aparayle hoſte ſodainly ware god daunted al pride al boſte ſo ſore fel chare al lymmes ſkyn tare ne myght go ne ryde chayre men aboute bare al forbruſed bothe backe ſyde wreche god ſmote ſo cruelly body wicked wormes crept therwith al ſtanke ſo horribly none hys meyne hym kept whether woke el ſlept ne myght hym ſtynke endure hys myſchefe wayled eke wept knewe god lorde euery creature hys hoſte hym ſelfe alſo ful lothſome ſtynke hys carayne man myght hym beate ne fro hys ſtynke hys horrible payne ſterfe ful wretchedly mountayne thus hath thys robbour thys homicide many man made wepe plaine suche gue • belongeth pryde ¶alexander ſtorye alexander ſo commune euery wyght hath dyſcretion hath herde ſomwhat al hys fortune thys wyde worlde concluſyon wanne ſtrength hys renoun glad peace vnto hym ſende pryde man boſt layde adoun ſo came vnto worldes ende compariſon myght yet neuer maked betwyrre hym conqueroure al thys world dred hi hath quaked knyghthode fredome floure fortune hym made ye heyre hygh honoure saue wyne womē nothīg might aſwage hys hygh entent armes laboure full louynge corage price though told darius hundred thouſande mo prynces erles knyghtes bolde whych conquered brought wo ſaye ferre man may ryde go world ſhuld deuiſe though wrote told euer mo hys knyghthode myght ſuffyſe twelue yere reigned rede ī machabe philippes ſonne macedone fyrſt kyng grece countre worthy gentyl alexander ala euer ſhulde fall ſuche caas enpoyſoned thy folke thou thy ſyce fortune hath tourned ace yet ne wept ſhe neuer tere ſhal yeue men teares complayne death gentylneſſe fraunchyſe worlde welded hys demayne yet hym thought myght ſuffyſe ful hys corage hygh empryſe ala ſhall helpe endyte falſe fortune poyſon dyſpyſe whych thys wo wyte ¶iulius ceſar wyſdome manhode hyghe laboure humble bedde royal maieſte vp roſe iulius conqueroure al occident londe ſee wan ſtrength honde el trete vnto rome made hem trybutary ſyth rome emperour tyl fortune wexte hys aduerſary myghty ceſar theſſaly ayenſt pompei father thyne lawe orient chyualry ferre daye begynneth dawe knyghthod haſt take ſlawe saue fewe folke ye wyth pompeius fledde whych yu putteſt ye oriēt awe thanke fortune ſo wel ſpedde ¶but nowe lytel whyle wol bewayle pompei thys noble gouernoure rome whych fledde thys batayle ſaye one hys men falſe traytour hys heed ſmote wynne hym fauour iulius hym heed brought ala pompei orient conquerour fortune vnto ſuche fyne wrought ¶to rome agayne repayreth iulius wyth hys triumphe lauriate ful hye tyme brutus caſſius euer hys hye eſtate enuye full priuely made conſpyracye ayenſt thys iulius ſubtel wyſe caſte place whych ſhulde dye wyth bodkyns ſhal deuyſe thys iulius vnto capitol went vpon daye wonte gone capitol anone hym hent thys falſe brutus hys fone ſtycked hym wyth bodkyns anone wyth many woūde thus let lye neuer geueched ſtroke one el two yf hys ſtorye lye manly thys iulius herte ſo well loued eſtately honeſte tho hys deedly woūdes ſo ſore ſmerte hys mantel ouer hys • yppes caſte man ſhulde ſe hys priuety laye dyenge traunce wyſte verely dye ſhulde honeſtye yet remembraunce ¶lucan thys ſtorye recomende sueton valery alſo thys ſtorye wrytten worde ende howe theſe conquerours two fortune fyrſt frende ſythe foe man truſte vpon fauoure longe haue awayte euer mo wytneſſe conquerours ſtronge ¶creſus ryche creſus whylom kynge lyde whyche creſus cirus ſore hym drad yet caught amydde hys pryde brenne men fyre hym lad ſuch raine downe frō yu fyrmamēt ſhad queynt fyre made hym ſcape beware yet grace tyl fortune galowes made gape eſcaped could ſten • begyn newe araye agayne wende wel fortune hym ſent suche happe yt eſcaped ye rayne hys foe myght ſlayne eke ſweuen vpon nyght mette whych ſo proude eke ſo fayne vengeaunce hys herte ſette vpon tree hym thought ther iupiter hym wyſhe backe ſyde phebus eke fayre towel brought drye therwith wext prid hys doughter ſtode hym beſyde whych yt knewe hye ſentence habounde bade tell ſygnyfyed ſhe dreme ryght thus dyd expounde tree ꝙ ſhe galous mene iupiter betokeneth ſnowe rayne phebus wyth hys towel ſo clene betokeneth ſonne beames ſoth ſayne thou ſhalt honged father certayne rayne ſhall waſhe ſonne ſhall drye thus ſhe warned hym full plat ful payne hys doughter called phanye honged creſus proude nowe good men pray herken al lo howe fortune turneth ſodainly hope pride enemy cocke lay vpon fox bake al drede vnto foxe ſpake ſayd ſyr ye yet ſhulde ſay wyſe god helpe turneth ayen ye proude churles al peſtylence vpon fal nowe come vnto woodes ſyde maugre heed cocke ſhal abyde wol hym eete faythe anone ¶the foxe anſwerd fayth ſhal done ſpake worde al ſodaynly cocke brake mouthe deliuerly hygh vpon tree ſlewe anon whan foxe ſawe gon ala ꝙ chaunteclere ala haue ꝙ treſpas moche made aferde whā hent brought yerde ſir dyd wicked entent come downe ſhal tel ment ſhal ſay ſothe god helpe ſo ¶nay ꝙ ſhrewe v bothe two firſt ſhrew ſelf blode bone thou begyle ofter one thou ſhalte thy flaterye ſynge wynkyng eye wynketh whan ſhulde ſe al wylfully god let neuer thee nay ꝙ ye foxe god yeue miſchāce ſo indiſcrete gouernance iangleth whā ſhuld haue pee ¶lo ſuche recheles neglygent truſte f • aterye ye holde tale lye foxe cocke hen taketh moralyte good men ſaynt poule ſaythe al written doctryne written iwys taketh fruyte let chaffe ſtyl nowe good god yf thy wyl ſaythe lorde ſo make v al good men brynge v thy hygh blyſſe amen ¶here endeth tale nonnes preeſt foloweth manciples prologue sir nonnes preeſt oure hoſte ſayd anone ybleſſed thy breche euery ſtone mery tale chauntecler trouthe yf thou ſeculer thou woldeſt tredfoule right yf thou haue corage thou haſt might nede hennes wene ye ſeuen tymes ſeuentene se whiche brawnes hath gentil preeſt great necke ſuche large breeſt loketh ſperhauke hys eyen nedeth colour dyen braſyl ne grayne portyngale ſir fayre fal tale ful mery chere sayd nother man ye ſhal ¶wote ye ſtondeth lytel towne whiche called bob vp downe vnder blee cauntebury way gan hoſte • ape play ſaid ſirs dunne myre man prayer ne hyre wol awake felowe behynde thefe might ful lightly robbe bynde se howe nappeth ſe cockes bone howe wol fal horſe atones coke london miſchaunce conforte knoweth penaunce ſhal tel tale fey al thought worthe botel hey awake thou coke ꝙ god yeue ſorowe eyleth ſlepe morowe haſt thou ſteen al night art yu dronke haſt yu al night ſom queen iſwonke thou mayſte hold vp thyn heed coke ful pale nothing reed sayd ſir hoſt ſo god ſoule bleſſe fal great heuyneſſe leuer ſlepe beſt gallon wyne chepe ¶wel ꝙ manciple yf may eſe ſir coke wight diſpleſe whiche ryde companye hoſte wyl curteſye wol nowe excuſe thy tale good faythe thy viſage ful pale thyn eyen daſe ſothely thynketh wel wot thy breth ful ſowre ſtinketh ſheweth wel thou art wel diſpoſed certayne thou ſhalt gloſed se howe galpeth lo dronkē wight though wolde v ſwalow anon right holde cloſe thy mouthe thy father kyn dyuel hel ſet fote therin thy • urſed • rethe wyl enfecte v al fye ſlynking ſwyne fye ſoule mote befal taketh hede ſirs luſty man • owe ſwete ſir wol ye iuſte van therto thynketh ye wel ſhape trowe ye haue dronken wyne ape whan men play ſtrawe wt ſpeche coke wexed al wrawe manciple gan nodde faſte lacke ſpech • horſe caſt lay tyl men vp toke fayre cheueſaunce coke ala ne holde ladyl er ayen ſadyl great ſhouyng fro lyfte vp moche care wo vnweldy ſely palled goſte manciple ſpake hoſt ¶bycauſe drinke hath domynation vpon man ſaluation trowe leudely wol tel tale wyne olde moyſty ale hath dronke ſpeketh ſo ye noſe ſnyueleth faſt eke hathe poſe alſo hath ynough kepe caple ſlough yf fal caple efte ſone ſhal al haue ynough done lyftyng vp dronken corce tel thy tale hym make force yet manciple fayth thou art nyce thus openly repreue vyce day wol parauenture recleyme bring thy lure mene ſpeke wyl ſmale thynges pynche thy rekenynges honeſt yf came prefe ¶no ꝙ ye manciple yt gret miſchefe myght bringe ſnare yet leuer paye mare rydeth thā ſhuld wt ſtryue wol wrathe ſo mote thriue ſpake ſayd bourde wote ye haue gourd draught wyne ye rype grape right anon ye ſhal ſe good iape coke ſhal drinke therof yf maye vp payne lyfe wol ſay naye certaynly tellen veſſel coke dranke faſte ala nedeth dranke ynough beforne whan pouped horne manciple toke gourde agayne drinke coke ful fayne thonked ſuche wyſe coude gan hoſt laugh wōder loude ſayd ſe wel neceſſary wher gon good drinke wt v cary wyl turne rancoure diſeſe accorde loue many worde peſe bacchus ybleſſed thy holy name ſo canſte turne erneſt game worſhyp thonke thy deite mater ye get tel thy tale thou manciple pray wel ſir ꝙ herkeneth ſay ¶here endeth manciples prologue foloweth hys tale whan phebus dwelled erth adoun old bokes make mē cioun moſte luſty bacheler al worlde eke beſt archer ſlough phetou ſerpent lay slepyng ayenſt ſunne vpon day many nother noble worthy dede bow wrought mē mow rede play coulde euery mynſtralcye ſynge melodye clere voyce ſoun certes kyng thebe amphion ſonge walled cyte coude neuer ſynge halfe ſo wel therto ſemelyſt man ſythe worlde began nedeth feture diſcryue worlde na none ſo fayre lyue therwith fulfylled gentylneſſe honoure perfyte worthyneſſe phebus yt floure bachelerye wel fredome chyualrye diſporte ſigne eke victory pheton ſo telleth v ſtory wonte beare honde bowe phebus houſe crow within cage ifoſtred many daye taught ſpeche men teche iaye whyte thys crowe whyte ſwan countrefete ſpeche euery man coulde whan ſhulde tel tale al world nightyngale ne coulde hundred thouſande dele synge ſo wonderly mery wele phebus houſe wife whiche loued lyfe nyght day dyd euer dyligence pleſe reuerence saue onely yf ſothe ſhal ſayne ielous wolde haue kept fayne lothe iaped ſo euery wight ſuche degre al naught auayleth nought good wife yt clene werke thought shulde kept none awayte certayn trewly labour vayne kepe ſhrewe wol holde nycete ſpyl laboure kepe wyues thus writen olde clerkes lyues nowe purpoſe fyrſt began worthy phebus dothe al pleſe wenyng ſuch pleſaūce manhode gouernaunce man ſhulde put grace god wote may man enbrace diſtrayne thyng nature hath naturally ſet creature take byrde put cage al thyne entent thy corage foſter tenderly meate drinke al daynties thou canſte thynke kepe alſo clenly thou may al though cage golde neuer ſo gay yet byrde twēty thouſand folde leuer foreſt wyde colde go cete wormes ſuche wretchydneſſe euer byrde wyl beſyneſſe eſcape cage whan maye lyberte byrde deſyreth aye let take catte foſter mylke tender fleſhe make couche ſylke let ſe mouſe go wal anon ſhe weyueth fleſhe couche al euery deyntie houſe suche appetyte hath ſhe erte mouſe lo hath luſte domynacion appetyte flemeth diſcrecion ſhe wolfe hath alſo vylanous kynde leudeſt wolfe ſhe may fynde l • ſte reputacion wol ſhe take tyme whan luſte haue make al theſe enſamples ſpeke theſe men ben vntrue thyng woman men haue euer lycorouſe appetyte lower thyng perfourme delyte wyues neuer ſo fayre ne neuer ſo trewe ne ſo debonayre fleſhe ſo newfangel miſchaunce ne conne nothyng haue pleaſaūce ſowneth vnto vertue whyle ¶this phebus whiche thought gyle diſceyued al io • yte vnder ſhe man lytel reputation nought worthe phebus comparyſon harme happeth ofte ſo whiche cometh moche harme wo ſo befel whan phebus abſent wyfe anon hath lemman ſent lemman certes knauyſh ſpeche foryeue beſeche ¶the wyſe plato ſaythe ye mowe rede worde muſt nedes acorde dede men ſhulde tel properly thyng worde muſte coſyn werkyng boyſtouſe man right thus ſay lytel difference truely betwyxt wyfe hye degre body diſhoneſt ſhe poore wenche ſo werke bothe amys gentyl eſtate aboue ſhal called lady loue tother poore woman ſhal called wench lemmā god wote myn owne dere brother men lay lowe one right ſo betwixt tytleleſſe tyraunt outlawe thefe erraunt ſame ſay dyfference alyſaunder tolde ſentence tyraunt greater might force meyne ſlee downe right brenne houſe home make al playn lo therfore called capitayne outlawe hath ſmal meyne may ſo great harm ne brynge countrey ſo great miſchefe men callen outlawe thefe ¶but man textuele wol tel textes neuer dele wol go tale began whā phebus wife ſent lemmā anon wrought al theyr luſte volage whyte crowe hynge aye yt cage behelde werke ſaid neuer worde whā hom come phebus ye lorde crowe ſonge cuckow cuckow cuckow birde ꝙ phebus ſyngeſt thou ne thou wont ſo merily ſynge herte reioyſyng thy voyce ala ſonge ¶by god ꝙ ſynge amys phebus ꝙ al thy worthyneſſe al thy beaute thy gentylneſſe al thy ſonge thy mynſtralſye al thy waytyng blered thyn eye one lytel reputatyon worthe compariſon mountenāce gnat ſo mote thriue thy bed thy wife ſawe hym ſwyne wol ye ye crow anon told ſadde token wordes bolde howe wyfe done lechery great ſhame great vyllany tolde eft ſawe eyen ¶this phebus gan awayward priē thought woful herte braſte two bowe bent ſet therin flo yre hath wyfe ſlayne effecte ſayne ſorow wherof brake mynſtralſye bothe harpe lute getern ſautrye eke brake arowes bowe thus ſpake crowe ¶traytour ꝙ tonge ſcorpion thou haſte brought confuſyon ala wrought nere deed dere wyfe gemme luſty heed ſo ſadde eke ſo trewe lyeſt thou deed face pale hewe ful gyltleſſe durſt ſwere iwys rakel honde ſo foule amys troubled wytte yre retcheleſſe vnauyſed ſmyteſt gyltleſſe wantruſt ful falſe ſuſpection thy wytte thy diſcretion oh euery man beware rekylneſſe ne trowe thyng without ſtrōg wytneſſe smyte ſone thou wete auyſed wel ſykerly ye execution vpon yre ſuſpection ala thouſande folke hath rekel yre fully fordone brought hem myre ala ſorowe wol ſelfe ſle crowe falſe theſe ſaid wol quite anon thy falſe tale thou ſonge whylom lyke nyghtyngale nowe ſhalt thou falſe thefe thy ſong forgon eke thy whyte fethers euerychon ne neuer al thy lyfe ſhalte thou ſpeke thus ſhul men traytour awreke thou thyn ſpring euer ſhal blake ne neuer ſwete noyſe ſhal ye make euer cryen ayenſt tempeſt rayne token wife ſlayne crowe ſterte anon pulled hys whyte fethers euerychon made blacke reft al ſonge eke ſpeche dore ſlonge vnto dyuel whiche betake cauſe ben al crowes blake ¶lordīges enſāple wol pray beware take kepe ſay ne telleth neuer man lyfe howe mā hath dight wife wol hate mortally certayne dan salomon wyſe clerkes ſayne techeth man kepe tonge wel ſayd tertuel natheleſſe thus taught dame ſonne thinke ye crowe goddes name ſōne kepe wel thy tonge kepe thy frēde wycked tonge worſe fende ſonne fende men may hem bleſſe ſonne god endeleſſe goodneſſe walled tonge tethe lyppes eke man ſhulde auyſe ſpeke ſonne ful ofte mykel ſpeche hath many man ſpylte clerkes teche lytel ſpeche ſpoken auyſedly man ſhente ſpeke generally ſonne thy tonge ſhuldeſt thou reſtrayne al tymes whan thou doeſt thy payne ſpeke god honoure prayere fyrſt vertue ſonne yf thou wolt lere reſtrayne kepe wel thy tonge thus lerne child whan yonge ſonne mykel ſpekyng vnauyſed laſſe ſpekyng ynough ſuffyſed cometh mykel harme thus taught moche ſpeche ſynne wanteth naught woſte thou wherfore rakel tonge ſerueth right aſworde forcutteth forke • ueth arme two dere ſonne right ſo tonge cutteth frendſhyp al tangler god abhomynable rede salomon ſo wyſe honourable rede dauid pſalmes rede senecke ſonne ſpeke ne wyth thy heed deck • diſſimule thou deefe yt thou ianglour ſpeketh perious matere flēming ſayth lerne thou leſte lytel ianglyng cauſeth moche reſte ſonne thou wicked word haſt ſaide dare drede bewrayde hath miſſayd dare wel ſayne may way clepe worde agayne thyng ſayd ſayd forthe gothe though repent neuer ſo loth thral hath ſayde tale whiche nowe yuel apayde ſonne beware none auctour newe tidynges whether falſe trewe ſo thou come amonge hye lowe kepe wel thy tonge thynke crowe ¶here endeth manciples tale begynneth perſons prologue manciple hys tale ended ſonne fro ſouth ſyde dyſcended lowe ſyght degree fyue twē tye hyghte ten clocke ſo geſſe elleuen foote lytell leſſe ſhadowe tyme ſuche fete lengthe parted ſyxe fete equally proportion ••• rwyth moones exaltation meane libra alwaye gan aſcende entrynge thropes ende hoſte wont gye aye thys caſe thys ioly companye sayd thys wyſe lordynges euerychone nowe lacketh v tale one fulfylled ſentence decre woll nowe tell tale let ſe almoſte fulfylled myne ordinaunce pray god ſo yeue ryght good chaūce telleth thys tale v luſtely syr preeſt ꝙ arte thou vicary arte thou perſon ſay ſoth thy fay thou breke thou play euery man ſaue thou hath tolde tale vnbokell ſhewe v thy male truely thynketh thy chere thou ſhuldeſt knyt vp well great matere tell v fable anone kockes bone ¶thys perſon hym anſwerde one thou getteſt fable none tolde paule wryteth timothe repreueth hem wayuen ſothfaſtneſſe teachen fable ſuche wretchedneſſe ſhulde ſowe draffe fyſt maye ſowe wheate yf lyſt whych ſaye yf ye lyſt moralite vertuous matere yf ye woll yeue audience wolde full fayne chriſtes reuerence done pleaſaunce lefull truſteth well ſotherne man ieſte rum ram ruf letter god wote ryme holde lytel better therfore yf ye lyſt woll gloſe woll tell lytell tale proſe knyt vp al thys feeſt make ende ieſu hys grace wyt ſende ſhewe waye thys voyage thylke perfyte gloriouſe pylgrimage hyght hieruſalem celeſtiall yf ye vouchſaue anone ſhall begyn vpon tale whych pray tel aduyſe better ſay natheleſſe thys meditacion put aye vnder correction clerkes textuell take ſentence truſteth well therfore make proteſtation woll ſtande correction ¶vpon thys worde haue aſſented ſone ſemed done ende ſome vertuous ſentence yeue hym ſpace audience bad hoſte ſhulde hym ſaye tell hys tale hym pray hoſte wordes v syr preeſt ꝙ nowe fayre mote befal sayeth ye lyſte ſhal gladly wyth word ſayd manere telleth ꝙ meditation haſteth ſunne woll adoun beth fructuous lytell ſpace wel god ſende grace ¶here endeth perſones prologue foloweth hys tale ¶ieremi vi state ſuper vias et vt dete et interrogate de ſemitis antiquis que ſit via bona ambulate ea et inuenietis refrigerium animabus veſtris ovr ſwete lorde god heuen wolde mā ſhulde peryſhe tourne al know lege hym blyſfull lyfe perdurable amonyſheth v prophete ieremye ſayeth thys wyſe standeth vpon wayes ſeeth aſketh olde pathes ſaye olde ſentences whych good waye walketh waye ye ſhall fynde refreſhynge ſoules c many wayes eſpirituels lede folke oure lorde ieſu chriſte reygne glorye whych wayes full noble way full couenable maye fayle man ne woman ſynne hath myſgone fro ryght waye hieruſalem celeſtiall thys waye called penitence whych man ſhulde gladly herkē enquire wyth al hys herte wete penitēce whych called penitence many maners bene action werkynges penitence howe many ſpeces bene penitence whych thinges appertayne behoue penitence thynges dyſtourbe penitence saynt ambroſe ſayeth penitence playnynge man gylte yt hath done thynge whych ought playne ſome doctoure ſayeth penitence waymentynge man ſoroweth ſynne paineth ſelfe hath myſdone penitēce wyth certayne circumſtaunces repentaūce man holt hym ſelfe ſorowe payne hys gyltes ſhalbe penytent ſhall fyrſt bewayle ſynnes hath done ſtedfaſtlye purpoſe hys herte haue ſhryfte mouth ſatiſfaccion neuer thynge whyche hym ought bewayle complayne continue good workes el hys repentaunce maye auayle ſaint iſoder ſayeth iaper lyer repentaunt eftſone doth thinge hym ought repent wepynge ſtynte ſynne may auayle nattheleſſe mē ſhal hope euery tyme man falleth neuer ſo ofte maye aryſe penaūce yf haue grace certayne great doute ſayeth ſaynt gregorye vnnethes aryſeth ſynne charged wyth ye charge yuel vſage therfore repentaunt folke ſtynt ſynne leue ſynne ſynne leue holy churche holdeth ſyker theyr ſaluacion ſynneth verely repē teth hym hys laſte ende holy churche yet hopeth hys ſaluacion great mercye lorde ieſu chriſt hys repentaunce take ſyker waye ¶and nowe ſyth haue declared thynge penitence ye ſhal vnderſtād ben thre action penitence fyrſt man baptyſed hath ſynned saynt auſtyn ſayeth penitent hys olde ſynfull lyfe maye begynne newe clene lyfe certes yf baptyſed wythout penitence hys olde gylte retayneth ye marke baptyme grace ne remiſſyon hys ſynnes tyll haue repentaunce defaute thys men deedly ſynne haue receyued baptyſme thyrde defaute thys men fall veniall ſynnes baptyſme fro day day therof ſayeth ſaynt auguſtyne penitence good humble folke penitence euery daye ſpeces penitence ben thre one hem ſolempne cōmune thyrd priuy penaūce ſolempne two maners put holy churche lent ſlaughter chyldren ſuche maner thynge man hath ſynned openly whyche ſynne fame openly ſynnes whych ſhryue v priuely receyue priuy penaunce ¶nowe ſhalt thou vnderſtande behouefull neceſſarye perfyte penytence thys ſtonte thre thynges contricion herte confeſſion mouthe ſatiſfaction whych ſayth ſaynt iohn chriſoſtome penitence dyſtrayneth man accept benignely euery payne hym enioyned wyth contricion herte ſhryfte mouthe wyth ſatiſfaction werdynge maner humilite thys frutefull penitence ayenſt thre thynges whyche wrath lorde ieſu chriſte thys ſaye delyte thynkynge retchleſneſſe ſpeakinge wycked ſyn full werkynge ayenſt theſe wycked gyltes penitence maye lykened vnto tree roote thys tree contricion hydeth hym herte hym verye repentaūt ryght roote tree hydeth hym earth thys roote contricion ſpryngeth ſtalke beareth braunches leues confeſſyon frute ſatiſfaction whych chriſt ſayth hys goſpel doth digne fruyte penitence thys fruyte men maye knowe tre rote hyde herte man ne ye braū ches ne leues confeſſion therfore lorde ieſu chriſt ſayeth thus fruyte hem ſhall ye knowe hem thys roote alſo ſpryngeth ſede grace yt whych ſede mother ſykerneſſe thys ſede egre hote grace thys ſede ſpryngeth god remembraunce daye dome paynes hell thys mater ſayeth salomon ye drede god man forletteth hys ſynne heate thys ſede loue god deſyrynge ioye perdurable thys hete draweth herte man god doth hate hys ſynne ſothly nothynge ſauoureth ſo well chyld ye mylke hys nouryce ne nothynge hym abhominable malke whē medled wyth meate ryght ſo ſynfull man loueth hys ſynne hym ſemeth hym mooſt ſwete thynge fro tyme loueth ſadlye lorde ieſu chriſte deſyreth lyfe perdurable hym nothinge abhominable ſothly lawe god loue god whyche dauid prophete ſayeth haue loued thy lawe hated wyckedneſſe loueth god kepeth hys lawe hys worde ¶thys tree ſawe prophete daniell ſpirite viſyon nabuchodonoſor counſayled hym penitence penaunce tree lyfe hem receyue holdeth hym penitence bleſſed ſentence salomon thys penitence contricion man ſhal vnderſtand foure thynges ſay contrityon whyche ben cauſes moue man contricion howe ſhulde contryte contricion auayleth ſoule thus contricion ſorowe mā receyueth hys herte hys ſynnes wyth ſadde purpoſe ſhryue hym penaunce neuer ſynne thys ſorowe ſhalbe thys maner ſayeth ſaynt bernarde ſhalbe heuye greuous full ſharpe poynaunt herte ¶fyrſte man hath agylted hys lorde hys creatoure ſharpe poynaunt hath agylted hys father celeſtiall yet ſharpe poynaunt hath wrathed agylted bought hym wyth hys preciouſe bloude hath delyuered v fro bondes ſynne fro cruelte dyuell fro paynes hell cauſes ought moue man cō tricion bene ſyxe fyrſte man ſhall remembre hym hys ſynnes loke remembraunce ne hym delyte waye great ſhame ſorowe hys ſynnes iob ſayeth ſynfull men done workes worthy confeſſyon therfore ſayeth ezechiel wol remembre al yeres lyfe bytterneſſe herte god ſayeth apocalypſe remē bre ye whence ye fall tyme ye ſynned ye chyldren god lymmes raygne god youre ſynne ye waren thrall foule membres fende hate aungels ſlaunder holye churche foode falſe ſerpent perpetual matere fyre hel yet foule abhominable ye treſpace ſo oft tymes doth hoūde returneth ayen eate hys owne ſpewynge yet ye fouler youre longe cō tinuynge ſynne youre ſynfull vſage whyche ye rooted youre ſynne beeſt hys donge suche maner thoughtes make man haue ſhame hys ſynne delyte god ſayeth prophet ezechiel ye ſhal remēbre wayes ſhal dyſpleaſe ſothly synnes ben wayes lede folke hell ſeconde cauſe oughte make man haue dyſdayne ſinne ſayeth ſaynt peter ſo doth ſyn thrall ſynne ſynne putteth man great thraldome therfore ſayeth prophete ezechiel wente ſorowfull dyſdayne ſelfe certes well ought mā haue dyſdayne ſynne wythdrawe hym fro thraldome vylanye lo ſayeth seneke thys mater ſayeth thus though wyſte neyther god ne man ſhulde neuer knowe yet wolde haue dyſdayne ſynne ſame seneke alſo ſayeth borne greater thynge thē thral body make body thral ne fouler thrall maye man ne woman make hys bodye yeue body ſynne al ye fouleſt churle fouleſt woman lyueth leſt value yet foule ſeruitude euer fro hygher degre man falleth thrall god worlde vyle abhomynable good god well ought man haue great dyſdayne ſynne ſythe throughe ſynne free made bonde therfore ſayeth ſaynt auſtyne yf thou haſt dyſdayne thy ſeruaunt yf oftēde ſynne haue thou dyſdayne thou thy ſelfe ſhuldeſt ſynne take rewarde thyne owne value thou ne foule thy ſelfe ala wel ought haue dyſdayne ſeruaū te thralles ſynne ſore aſhamed ſelfe god hys endleſſe goodneſſe hathe ſette hygh aſtate yeue hem wytte ſtrength bodye heale beauty proſperite boughte hem fro death wyth hys herte bloude ſo vnkyndlye agaynſt hys gentylneſſe quyte hym ſo vylaynouſly ſlaughter owne ſoules good god ye woman bene greate beautye remembreth prouerbe salomon ſayeth lykeneth fayre woman foole body rynge golde yt worne groyne ſowe ryghte ſow wroteth euery ord • ne ſo wroteth ſhe beaute ſtynkyng ord •• e ſynne thyrde cauſe oughte meue man contricion drede daye dome horrible paynes hel ſaynt ierome ſayeth euery tyme remē breth daye dome quake whē eate drynke ſo euer ſemeth trompe ſowneth myne eare ryſeth ye vp bene deed cōmeth iudgement good god moch ought man drede ſuche iugement ther ſhalbe al ſaint poule ſayeth ye ſete lorde ieſu chriſte ſhal make generall congregation man may abſent certes auayleth none eſſoyne ne excuſation oure defautes ſhalbe iuged alſo w • rkes ſhal opēly knowē ſayeth ſaint bernarde ne ſhal pleading auayle ne ſleyght ſhal yeue rekenyng euery ydell worde ſhall haue iuge maye dyſceyued ne corrupte certes thoughtes bene dyſcouered hym ne prayer ne mede ſhall corrupte therfore ſayeth salomō wrath god ne wol ſpare wyght prayer ne yeffe therfore daye dome hope eſcape wherfore ſayeth ſaint anſelme full greate anguyſhe ſhall ſynfull folke haue tyme ſhal ye fyerce wroth iuge ſytte aboue vnder hym horrible pytte hell open deſtroy muſte knowe hys ſynnes whych ſynnes openlye ben ſhewed god euery creature lefte ſyde mo dyuels herte may thynke hale drawe ſynfull ſoules payne hel wythin hertes folke ſhalbe bytynge conſcience wythout forth ſhall worlde al brennynge whyther ſhal wretched ſynfull man flye hyde hym certes maye hyde hym muſt come forth ſhewe hym certes ſayeth ſaynt ierome earth ſhall caſt hym ſee alſo ayre ſhalbe ful thonder clappes lyghtenynges ſothly ſo woll remembreth theſe thynges geſſe thys ſynne ſhall turne hym delyte greate ſorowe dredde payne hell therfore ſayeth iob god ſuffre lorde may whyle bewaile wepe er go without returnynge derke londe couered wyth darkeneſſe death lāde myſeſe derkneſſe ſhadowe death none ordre ordynaunce ferefull drede euer ſhall laſt lo maye ye ſe iob prayed reſpyte whyle bewepe wayle hys treſpace ſothly one day reſpyte better al treaſoure thys worlde moche man maye acquyte hym ſelfe god penitence thys worlde treaſoure therfore ſhulde praye god yeue hym reſpyte whyle bewepe wayle hys treſpace certes al ſorowe man myght make fro begynnynge worlde ny lytell thynge regarde ſorowe hell cauſe iob calleth hell lande darkneſſe vnderſtandeth calleth lande earth ſtable neuer ſhal fayle derke hell hath defaute lyght material certes darke lyght ſhall come fyre euer ſhall brenne ſhall turne hym payne hell ſheweth hym horrible deuels hym turmenteth couered wyth darkeneſſe death ſaye hel ſhal haue defaute ſyght god certes ſyght god ye lyfe perdurable derkeneſſe death bene ſynnes wretched man hath done whyche dyſtourbe hym ſe face god ryght derke cloude betwyxt v ſunne londe myſeſe bycauſe ben thre maner defautes ayenſt thre thynges folke thys worlde haue thys preſent lyfe ſaye honour delyces richeſſe ayenſt honoure haue hell ſhame confuſyon well ye wote men call honoure reuerence man doth man hell none honoure ne reuerence certes reuerence ſhalbe kynge knaue whyche god ſayeth prophete ieremye thoſe folke dyſpiſe ſhalbe dyſpyte honour alſo called great lordſhyp ſhall wyght ſerue harme turment honoure alſo called great dygnite hyghneſſe hel ſhal al fortroden dyuels god ſayeth horrible deuels ſhall go come vpon heedes dampned folke thys moche ye hygher preſent lyfe ſhal abated defoyled hell ayenſt rycheſſe thys worlde ſhal haue myſeſe pouerte ſhal foure thynges defaute treaſoure whyche dauid ſayeth ryche folke enbraſe knytte herte treaſoure thys worlde ſhall ſlepe ſlepynge death nothynge ne ſhul fynde hondes treaſoure ouer myſeſe hel ſhalbe defaute meate drynke god ſayeth thus moſes ſhalbe waſted wyth honger byrdes hell ſhal deuoure hem wyth bytter death gall dragon ſhall drynke venym dragon morſels alſo myſeaſe ſhalbe defaute clothynge ſhalbe naked bodye clothynge ſaue fyre whych brenne fylthes naked ſhall ſoule maner vertues whyche clothynge ſoule bene gaye robe ſofte ſhetes ſmale ſhertes lo ſayeth god hem prophete iſaye vnder hem ſhall ſtrewed moughtes couertures ſhall wormes hell alſo myſeaſe ſhalbe defaut frendes poore hath good frendes frende neyther god ne creature ſhalbe frende eche hem ſhall hate wyth deedly hate ſonnes doughters ſhall rebell ayenſt father mother kynrede ayenſt kynred chyde diſpyſe eche daye nyght god ſayeth prophete micheas louynge chyldrē yt whylom loued ſo fleſhlye eche wolde eche hem eate yf myght howe ſhulde loue togyther paynes hell whē hated eche ī ye proſperite life truſt wel fleſhly loue deadly hate ſayeth prophet dauid ſo yu loueth wyckedneſſe hateth ſoule ſo hateth hys owne ſoule certes may loue none wyght maner therfore hel ſolace ne frendſhyp euer yt kynredes ben hel curſynges chydynges ye deedly hate amonge alſo ſhal haue defaute maner delyces certes helyces ben appetite fyue wittes ſyght hearynge ſmellynge ſauourynge touchynge hell ſyght ſhalbe ful derkneſſe ſmoke therfore full teares hearynge full waylynge gryntynge tethe ſayeth ieſu chriſte noſtrylles ſhalbe ful ſtynkynge ſayeth iſaye prophete ſauourynge ſhalbe full bytter gall touchynge al bodyes ycouered wyth fyre neuer ſhall quenche wyth wormes neuer ſhall dye god ſayeth mouthe iſaye moche ſhall wene maye dye payne death flye fro payne maye vnderſtande wordes iob ſayeth ſhadowe deathe certes ſhadowe hath lykenes thynge whych ſhadowed ſhadowe ye ſame thynge whych ſhadowed ryght ſo fareth payne hel lyke death horrible anguyſhe payneth hem euer though ſhulde dye anone certes ſhal dye ſayeth ſaynt gregory wretched caytyſes ſhall death wythout death ende wythout end defaute wythout fayling death ſhal alway lyue ende ſhall euer begyn defaute ſhal fayle therfore ſayeth ſaynt iohn euangelyſt ſhal folowe death ſhall fynde hym ſhall deſyre dye death ſhall ſlye fro hem alſo iob ſayeth hel ordre rule al ſo god hath create al thynge ryghte order nothynge wythout order thynges ben ordred nombred yet natheleſſe ben dampned ben nothynge order ne hold none order erth ne ſhal beare hem frute prophete dauid ſayeth god ſhall deſtroye frute earth hem ne water ne ſhal yeue hem moyſture ne eyre refreſhynge ne fyre lyght ſayeth ſaynt baſil • e brennynge fyre thys worlde ſhal god yeue hell hem bene dampned lyght clereneſſe ſhall yeue heauen hys chyldren ryghte good men yeue fleſhe chyldren bone houndes ſhal haue none hope eſcape ſayeth ſaynt iob laſt ſhal errour griſly dreade dwell without ende horrour alway dred come drede ſhal alwaye dwell hertes hem damned therfore haue loſt hope vii cauſes fyrſt god yt iuge ſhalbe without mercye hem maye pleaſe hym ne none ſaynctes ne maye gyue nothyng raunſom ne ſhall haue voyce ſpeke hym ne may ſtye fro payne ne haue goodneſſe hem maye ſhewe delyuer hem fro payne therfore ſayeth salomon wycked man dyeth whā deed ſhal haue hope eſcape fro payne▪ ſo wolde wel vnderſtonde paynes bethynke hym well hath deſerued thoſe paynes ſynnes ••• e ſhuld haue talēt ſygh w • ye ſynge playe ſayth salomon whoſo ſciēce knowe paynes ben ordeyned ſynne wolde make ſorowe ſcience ſayeth ſayncte auſtyn maketh man weyment herte fourth poynt ought make man haue contrition ſorowfull remembraunce good hath lefte erthe alſo good hath loſte sothlye good werkes hath left eyther good werkes wroughte er fyll deedly ſinne el good werkes wrought whyle laye ſynne sothlye good werkes dyd fell ſynne ben mortifyed aſtonyed dull oft ſynnynge werkes dyd whyle laye ſyne deed lyfe perdurable heuen good werkes ben mortifyed oft ſynning whiche dyd beinge charitie may quyck ayen without penitēce ſayth god mouth ezechiel yf ryght full man returne ayen fro ryghtouſneſſe wyckedneſſe ſhall lyue nay al good werkes hath done ſhal neuer remembraunce ſhall dye ſynne vpon chapter ſayth gregorye thus ſhall vnderſtonde principally yf deedly ſyn nought reherſe drawe memory good werkes haue wrought certes werkynge deedlye ſyn truſte good werke haue done ſaye haue therby lyfe perdurable heuē natheleſſe good werkes quycken come agayne helpe auayle haue lyfe perdurable heuen whan haue contrition ſothlye good werkes men whyle deedly ſynne moch wer deedly ſyn may neuer quycke ce • te thynge neuer lyfe maye neuer quycke natheleſſe al auayle haue lyfe perdurable yet auayle abredge payne hel el get tēporall rycheſſes el god wol rather enlumyn lyght hert ſynful man haue repentaūce eke auayl vſe man good werkes fende haue leſſe power ſoule thus carteys lorde ieſu chriſt ne wol good werke loſt ſomwhat ſhal auayle moch good werkes men done whyle ben good lyfe ben amortified ſyn folowyng alſo ſyth good werkes men whyle ben dedly ſyn ben vtterly deed haue ye lyſe perdurable wel may man good werke ne doeth ſynge freſſhe newe ſonge iay tout perdu mon temp et mon labure certes ſynne byreueth man bothe goodneſſe nature alſo goodneſſe grace ſothlye grace holye ghooſte fareth lyke fyre maye ydle fyre fayleth anon forletteth werkyng ryght ſo grace fayleth anon forletteth werkynge leſeth ſynfull man goodneſſe glory onely behyght good men labour werke wel maye ſory oweth hys lyfe god lōge hath lyued alſo longe ſhall lyue goodneſſe ne hath pay det god whome oweth hys lyfe truſt well ſhall yeue accōptes ſayth ſaynct bernarde goodes haue ben yeue hym preſent lyfe hath hem diſpēded inſomoch yt ther ſhall peryſh heer heed ne moment houre ne ſhal periſſhe hys tyme ne ſhall yeue rekenynge fyfth thynge ought moue man contrition remembraunce paſſion lorde ieſu chryſt ſuffred ſynnes ſayth ſaynt bernard whyle lyue ſhall haue remēbraūce trauayles lord ieſu chriſt ſuffred preachynge weryneſſe trauaylynge temptation whan faſted longe wakynges whan prayed hys teares whan wept pytie good people wo ſhame fylth men ſayde hym foule ſpyttynge men ſpyt face buffettes yt men yaue hym foule mowes reproues men ſayde hym nayles wyth whiche nayled croſſe remnaunt paſſion ſuffred ſynnes nothyng gylt ye ſhal vnderſtond man ſynne euerye maner ordre ordynaunce turned vp ſo downe ſoth god reaſon ſenſualitie body man bene ordayned eche theſe foure thynges ſhoulde haue lordſhyppe ouer thus god ſhould haue lordſhyppe ouer reaſon reaſon ouer ſenſualytye ſenſualitie ouer body man ſothly whan man ſynneth ordre ordinaunce turned vp ſo downe therfore moche reaſon man ne woll ſubiect ne obeyſaūt god lorde ryght therfore leſeth lordſhyppe ſhulde haue ouer ſenſualytie alſo ouer bodye man ſenſualitie rebelleth ayenſt reſon way ledeth reſon lordſhyp ouer ſenſualitie ouer body ryght reaſon rebell god ryght ſo ſenſualitie rebell reaſon body alſo certes diſordinaunce rebellion lord ieſu chriſt bought vpon precious body full dere hearken wyſe moche reaſon rebel god therfore man worthye haue ſorowe deed ſuffred oure lord ieſu chriſt man betrayed diſciple diſtrayned bound ſo bloude braſt euery nayle hondes ſayth ſ auſtin ferthermore moche reaſon man wol daunt ſenſualite may therfore man worthye haue ſhame thys ſuffred lord ieſu chriſt man whan ſpyt viſage ferthermore moch thā caytif body man rebel reſō ſenſualitie therfore worthy death ſuffred lord ieſu chryſt vpon croſſe parte bodye free withoute greate payne bytter paſſyon ſuffred lord ieſu chryſt neuer forfayted therfore reſonably maye ſayd ieſu maner moch pained thinges neuer deſerued moch defouled ſhame man worthye haue therfore may ſynful man wel ſay ſaynt bernarde accurſed bytterneſſe ſynne ther muſt ſuffred ſo moche bitterneſſe certes dyuers diſcordaunce wickedneſſe paſſyon ieſu chryſte ordayned dyuers thynges thus certes ſynfull man ſoule betrayed deuyll couetyſe temporal proſperitie ſcorned diſceyte cheſeth fleſhly deſyres yet turmented impatience aduerſitie beſpet ſeruage ſubiection ſyn laſt ſlayne fynallye diſordinaūce ſynful man ieſu chriſt betrayed yt boūde came vnbynde v ſynne payne beſcorned yt ſhuld haue honoured al thinges thā vyſage ought deſyred ſene al mā kynde viſage angel deſire loke vylaynſly beſpet ſcourged yt nothing treſpaſſed finally thā crucifyed ſlayne accōpliſſhed wordes eſay woūded myſdedes defoyled felony ſith ieſu chriſt toke paine wickedneſſes moch ought ſynful man wepe bewayle hys ſynnes god ſonne heuen ſhould al payne endure ſixt thing ſhuld meue man cōtrition ye hope thre thinges ſay foryeueneſſe ſyn ye yeft grace well ye glory heuen wt god ſhall rewarde man good dedes moche ieſu chriſt yeueth v theſe yeftes largeneſſe ſouerayn boūty therfore called ieſus nazarenus rex indeorū ieſus ſaye ſauyour ſaluaciō men ſhall hope haue foryeueneſſe ſynnes proprely ſaluacion ſynnes therfore ſaid angel ioſeph thou ſhalte call name ieſus ſhall ſaue people ſynnes ſayth ſ peter none name vnder heuen yt yeue man man maye ſaued ieſus nazarenus moche ſaye floryſhing mā ſhal hope yeueth hym remyſſyon ſynnes ſhall yeue hym al ſo grace well dore thyne hert ſayth ieſus called enter openeth ſhal haue foryeuenes ſynne wyl entre hym grace ſuppe hym good werkes ſhall whiche werkes ben foode ſoul ſhal ſuppe ye great ioye ſhal yeue hym thus ſhall man hope werkes penaunce god ſhall yeue hym hys reygne behyghte hym goſpell ſhal man vnderſtonde whiche maner ſhall contrytion ſaye ſhalbe vniuerſall totall ſaye man ſhalbe repentaunt ſynnes hath done delyte thought ryght peryllous ben two maner conſentinges one hem called conſentyng affection whan man moued ſyn delyteth hym longe thynke ſynne reaſon apperceyueth well ſynne ayenſt law god yet reaſon refrayneth foule delyte talent though ſe well apertlye ayenſte reuerence god although reaſon ne conſent ſynne dede yet ſaye ſome doctoures ſuche delyte dwelleth longe ful perillous albeit neuer ſo lytle alſo man ſhoulde ſorowe namely euer hath deſyred ayenſt lawe god wyth perfyt conſentyng reaſon thereof doubt deedly ſynne conſentyng certes deedly ſynne fyrſte man thought delyte ſo forth conſentynge dede wherfore ſaye many mē ne repēt hem neuer ſuch thoughtes delytes ne neuer ſhryue hym onelye dede greate ſynnes outwarde wherfore ſaye ſuche wycked delytes bene ſubtyll begylers ſhalbe dampned moreouer man ought ſorowe wycked wordes well hys wycked dedes certes repentaūce ſynguler ſyn repentaunt ſynnes el repent hym ſynnes ſyngular ſyn may auayle certes god almightye good therfore eyther foryeueth el ryght nought therfore ſayth ſaynct auſtyn wot certaynly god enemye euery ſynner thā obſerueth one ſynne ſhal haue yeueneſſe thoſe ſynnes naye moreouer cōtrition ſhuld wonder ſorowfull anguiſhous therfore yeueth hym god playnly hys mercy therfore whā ſoule anguyſhed ſorowfull wt remembraunce god prayer myght come hym ferthermore contrition muſt contynuall man haue ſtedfaſte purpoſe ſhryue hym amende hym lyfe ſothly whyle contrition laſteth man maye euer hope haue foryeueneſſe thys cōmeth hate ſynne deſtroyeth bothe ſynne hym ſelfe alſo folke hys power ſayeth dauid loue god hate wyckedneſſe loue god loue loueth hate yt hateth laſt thynge men ſhal vnderſtande wherfore auayleth contrition ſaye contrition ſomtyme delyuereth man fro ſynne dauid ſayth ſaye ſayd dauid purpoſed fermely ſhryue thou lorde releaſeddeſt ſynne ryght ſo contrition auayleth without ſad purpoſe ſhrift mā haue oportunitye ryght ſo lytle worth ſhryfte ſatiſfaction withoute contrition moreouer contrition deſtroyeth priſō hell maketh weake feble ſtrengthes deuylles reſtoreth yeftes holy ghoſt al good vertues clenſeth ſoule ſyn delyuereth fro payne hell fro company dyuel fro ſeruage ſynne reſtoreth goodes ſpirituels companye communion holy churche ferthermore maketh hym whylom ſonne yre ſonne grace theſe thynges ben proued holye wrytte therfore wolde ſet hys entent theſe thynges full wyſe truly ne ſhulde haue al life corage ſynne yeue hert body ſerue chryſt therof hym homage truly lord hath ſpared v ſo meke lye follyes yf ne pytye mannes ſoule ſorye ſonge myghte ſynge ¶explicit prima par penitentie et incipit par ſecunda ſeconde parte penitence confeſſyon ſigne contrition ſhul ye vnderſtōd confeſſyon yf ought done thynges couenable confeſſyon fyrſt ſhalt thou vnderſtond ye confeſſyon ſhewyng ſynnes preſt ſaye muſt confeſſe hym condicions belonge ſynne ferforth al muſt ſaid nothing excuſed ne hydde auaunt thy good werkes alſo neceſſary vnderſtonde whence ſynnes ſpring howe entre ben ſpringyng ſynnes ſayeth ſaynt poule proſperite el good mē haue aduerſite theſe thynges ſhulde men ſuffre paciently come ryghtfull iudgement ordinaunce god somtime cometh grutching auarice iudas grutched ayenſt maudelen whan ſhe
