grutched ayenſt maudeleyn whan ſhe aproched ieſu chriſt wepte hys fete ſynnes ſomtyme ſourdeth enuy whā mē diſcouer man harme yt priuy bereth hand thing falſe murmure alſo ofte among ſeruaūtes ye grutche whā ſoueraynes byd hem lefull thynges much dare opēly wythſay ye cō maūdemēt ſoueraynes yet woll ſay harme grutche murmure priuely diſpite wordes cal dyuels pater noſter though ſo dyuel neuer pater noſter yt lende folke yeueth ſuch name somtyme cometh yre pryuy hate yt nouryſheth rancoure herte afterwarde ſhall declare cometh alſo bytterneſſe herte thorowe whych bytterneſſe euery good dede hys neyghboure ſemeth hym bitter vnſauery cometh diſcorde vnbyndeth al maner frendſhyp cometh ſcornyng hys neyghbour neuer ſo well cometh accuſynge whan man ſeketh occaſion anoy neighbour whych lyke craft dyuel yt wayteth daye nyght accuſe v cometh malignitie whyche man anoyeth hys neyghbour priuely may yf may algate hys wycked wyll ſhall let brenne houſe priuely enpoyſon ſle hys beaſtes ſemblable thynges nowe woll ſpeke remedye ayenſt thys foule ſynne enuy firſt loue god principally louyng hys neyghbour hym ſelfe ſothly one ne may wythout truſte well name thy neyghbour thou ſhalte vnderſtande name thy brother certes haue one father fleſhly one mother yt ſaye adam eue alſo one father ſpirituell yt god heuen thy neyghboure art thou bounde loue wyll goodneſſe therfore ſayth god loue thy neighbour thy ſelfe yt ſaye ſaluatiō lyfe ſoule moreouer thou ſhalte loue hym worde benigne admonyſhynge chaſtyſyng comforte noyaunces pray al thy hert dede thou ſhalte loue ſuch wyſe thou ſhalt charitie thou woldeſt done thine owne perſon therfore thou ne ſhalt hym damage wicked worde ne harme bodye ne catel ne hys ſoule entyſyng wicked enſample thou ſhalte deſyre hys wyfe ne none hys thynges vnderſtande alſo name neyghbour comprehēded hys enemy certes man ſhal loue hys enemy commaundement god ſothly thy frende thou ſhalt loue god ſaye thine enemy ſhalt thou loue goddes ſake▪ hys cōmaūdemēt reaſon man ſhulde hate enemy forſoth god wolde receyue v hys loue yt ben hys enemy ayenſt thre maner wrō ge enemy doth ſhall thre thynges thus ayenſt hate rācour hert ſhal loue hym hys hert ayenſt chiding wicked wordes ſhall praye enemy ayenſt wicked dedes ſhal bountie chriſte ſayeth loue enemy pray hem yt ſpeke harme hem chaſe purſue bounte hem yt hate lo thus cōmaū deth v lorde ieſu chriſt enemy ſoth nature driueth v loue frendes parfay enemyes haue nede loue frendes yt nede haue certes hem ſhall men goodneſſe certes dede haue remembraunce loue ieſu chriſt yt dyed hys enemyes aſmuche loue greuous perfourme ſo much gret merite therfore louyng enemye hath cōfounded ye dyuels venym ryght dyuel cō founded humilitie righte ſo wounded deth loue enemy certes thā loue medicyn caſteth venym enuie fro mannes herte ſpeces place ſhall largely declared chapiter folowyng ¶de ira enuye wol diſcriue ſynne ire ſothly ſo hath enuye vpon hys neyghbour anone woll comenlye fynde hym mater wrathe word dede ayenſt hym whō hath enuye wel cometh ire pride enuy ſothly proud enuyous lyghtly wrothe thys ſynne yre diſcriuynge ſaynte auſtyn wycked wyll auēged worde dede ire phyloſopher feruent bloude mā yquycked hys hert wolde harme hym hateth certes herte man eſchaufynge mouyng hys bloude wexeth ſo troubled al maner iugement reaſon ye ſhal vnderſtande ye ire two maners one hem good wicked good ire ielouſye goodnes mā wrothe wickednes ayenſt wickedneſſe therfore ſaith wiſe man ire bet thā playe ire debonairte wroth without bitternes wroth ayenſt man wrath miſdede man ſaith prophete dauid iraſcimini et nolite peccare nowe vnderſtande wicked ire two maners ſaye ſodayn ire haſty ire wythout auyſement conſentyng reaſon meaning ſence reaſon mā ne cōſent ſodayne ire venyal another ire ful wycked cometh felony hert auyſed caſt wyth wicked wyl vengeaunce therto reaſon cōſenteth ſothly thys deedly ſynne thys ire ſo diſpleaſaunt god troubleth hys houſe chaſeth holy goſte man ſoule waſteth diſtroyeth likeneſſe god ſay vertue man ſoule putteth hym lykeneſſe dyuel taketh man fro god rightful lord ful great pleaſaūce dyuell dyuels fournayes eſchaufed fyre hell certes ryght ſo fyre myghtye diſtroy erthly thinges thā elemēt ryght ſo ire myghty diſtroy al ſpirituel thynges loke fyre ſmale cole ben almoſt deed vnder aſſhen woll reuyue quycke ayen whan bene pride many tymes mater ire ryghte ſo rancour nourice keper ire maner tree ſayth ſaynt iſodore yt whan man maketh fyre ſayd tree couer cole wyth aſſhen ſothly fyre wol laſt yere right ſo fareth rācoure whā one conceyued hertes ſome men certes wol laſt perauēture one eſter day vntyl another eſter day certes ſame man ful ferre mercy god al whyle forſayde dyuels fourneis forge thre ſhrewes pride aye bloweth encreaſeth fyre chiding wicked wordes ſtandeth enuy holdeth hote yron ye fyre vpon hert man payre longe tonges long rācour thā ſtādeth ſyn cōtumely ſtrife cheſt battereth forgeth vilaynous repreuinges certes curſed ſyn anoyeth man hym ſelfe alſo hys neyghbour ſothly almooſt al harme damage anye mā doth neighbour cōmeth wrath certes outragious wrath dothe euer foule fende willeth cōmaundeth hym ne ſpareth neither lorde ieſu chriſte neyther ſwete mother hys outragiouſe angre yre ala ala ful many diuers time feleth hert ful wickedly chriſt alſo al halowes curſed vice yes certes ala taketh fro mā witte hys reaſon debonayre lyfe ſpirituell ſhulde kepe ſoule certes wythdraweth alſo goddes dewe lordſhyp man ſoule loue hys neighbour ſtryueth alſo day ayenſt trouth reueth quyete hert ſubuerteth hys ſoule tre cōmeth theſe ſtinkinge engendrures firſt hate yt olde wrath diſcord man forſaketh olde frend yt hath loued ful long cometh warre euerye maner wrong mā doth neyghbour body catell curſed ſyn 〈◊〉 cometh alſo māſlaughter vnderſtand wel homicide manſlaughter diuers wyſe maner homicide ſpirituell ſome bodily spirituell manſlaughter vi thynges fyrſt hate ſayth saynte iohan hateth hys brother homicide homicede alſo backebytynge whyche backebytinge ſayeth salomon haue two ſweatdes wyth whych ſlee neyghbours ſothlye wycked take hym hys good name hys lyfe homicide alſo geuing wycked counſel fraude geue counſayle areyſe wrongfull cuſtomes talages whyche ſayeth salomon lyon roringe •• e hongry lyke cruel lordes wythholdyng abredging ſhepe ye hyre wage ſeruauntes el vſury wythdrawyng almeſſe poore folke whyche wyſe man ſayeth fedethe hym almooſte dyeth honger ſothly ye fede ye ſlee al theſe bene deedlye ſynnes bodylye manſlaughter thou ſleeſt hym wyth thy tonge maner thou commaundeſt ſlee mā el yeueſt coūſayle ſlee man manſlaughter dede foure maners one lawe ryghte iuſtyce dampneth hym coulpable death let iuſtice ware ryghtfully delyte ſpyll bloode kepyng ryghteouſnes homicide done neceſſitie mā ſleeth defence ne maye none otherwyſe eſcape wythout ſlaughter hys aduerſary doth ſynne ſhal beare penaunce deedly ſynne alſo yf man caſe aduenture ſhote arowe caſte ſtone whych ſleeth man homicide al ſo womā negligēce ouerlieth child ſlepynge homicide deedly ſynne alſo man diſtourbleth conception chylde maketh woman eyther bareyne drynkynge venymous herbes thorough whyche ſhe maye conceyue ſletth chylde drynkes el putteth certayne materiall thynges ſecre place ſlee chylde el doth vnkyndly ſynne whyche man womā ſhedeth nature maner place chylde maye conceyued el yf ſo woman hathe conceyued hurteth ſelfe myſhap chylde ſlayne yet homicide ſaye thoſe woman murtheren chyldren bycauſe eſchewynge worldly ſhame certes horryble homicide homicide alſo yf man approche womā deſyre lecherye thorough whyche chylde peryſhed el ſmyteth woman wetyngly throughe whyche ſhe leſeth chylde theſe bene homicide horrible dedly ſynnes yet come yre mo ſynnes well worde thought dede arretteth vpon god blameth god thynge whych hym ſelfe gylty dyſpyſeth god hys halowes done curſed haſardours dyuers countreyes thys curſed ſynne done fele herte ful wyckedly god hys halowes alſo treate vnreuerentlye ſacrament aulter ſynne ſo great vnneth may releaſed mercy god paſſeth al hys werkes ſo greate ſo benygne commeth yre atterly anger whē man ſharpelye amoneſhed hys ſhryfte leaue hys ſynne woll angry anſwere hokerlye angerlye defende excuſe hys ſynne vnſtedfaſtneſſe hys fleſhe elles dydde holde companye wyth hys felowes elles ſayeth fende entyced hym elles dothe hys youth elles complexion ſo coragious maye forbeare elles hys deſtenye ſayeth vnto certayne age elles ſayeth commeth hym gē tylneſſe hys aūceſters ſemblable thynges theſe maner folke ſo wrappe hem ſynnes ne woll delyuer hym ſelfe ſothlye wyghte excuſeth hym ſelfe wylfullye hys ſynne maye delyuered hys ſynne tyl mekelye beknoweth hys ſynne thys commeth ſwearynge expreſſe agaynſte commaundemente god thys befalleth often angre yre god ſayeth thou ſhalte take name thy lorde god vayne ydell alſo oure lorde ieſu chriſte ſayeth worde ſaynte mathewe ne wyll ye ſweare maner neyther heauen goddes trone ne earth benche feete ne hieruſalem cytie greate kynge ne thyne heed thou mayſte make heere neyther whyte ne blacke ſay youre worde yea yea naye naye yuell thus ſayeth chriſte chriſtes ſake ſweare ſo ſynfullye dyſmembrynge chriſte ſoule herte bone bodye certes ſemeth ye thynke curſed iewes ne dyſmembred ynoughe preciyous perſone chriſte ye dyſmembre hym yf ſo lawe compell ſweare ruleth lawe god ſwearyng ſayeth ieremy fourth chapter thou ſhalte kepe thre condicions thou ſhalt ſwere trouth dome ryghtwyſeneſſe thys ſaye thou ſhalte ſweare ſothe euerye leſynge ayenſt chriſt chriſt verye trouth thynke well thys euerye great ſwearer compelled laufully ſwere plage ſhal depart fro houſe whyle vſeth ſuche vnlawfull ſwearynge thou ſhalte ſwere alſo dome thou arte conſtrayned thy dome man wytneſſe trouthe alſo thou ſhalt ſweare enuye neyther fauoure neyther mede rewarde onelye ryghteouſneſſe declarynge honoure worſhyppe god aydinge helpe thyne euen chriſten therfore euerye man taketh goddes name ydel falſelye ſweareth wyth hys mouthe el taketh hym name chriſte called chriſten man lyueth ayenſt chriſtes lyuynge hys teachynge take goddes name tremble heare named ſemeth men ſweare ſo horriblye hys bleſſed name dyſpyſe boldely curſed iewes el dyuell trembleth whē heareth hys name nowe certes ſyth ſwearyng yf lawfullye done ſo hyelye defended moche forſwearynge falſlye yet nedeleſſe ſay alſo hem delyte hem ſwearynge holde genterye māly dede ſweare great othes hem yt vſage ne ceaſe ſweare greate othes cauſe worthe ſtrawe certes thys horrible ſynne swerynge ſodeynly alſo great ſynne let v go horrible ſynne ſwearynge adiuration coniuration done theſe falſe enchaūtours nigromācers baſyns full water bryght ſwearde cercle fyre gnawynge rattes ſuche maner wretchedneſſe▪ certes al theſe thynges ben defended god holy church whyche bē accurſed tyl come amendemēt yt ſuch fylth ſet belyue charmes woū de maladye men beeſtes yf take effecte maye perauenture god ſuffreth folke ſhuld yeue fayth reuerence hys name nowe woll ſpeke leaſynges whych generally falſe ſygnifyaunce worde entent dyſceyue hys euen chriſten leſynge cometh none auaū tage wyght ſome leaſyng turneth profyte eaſe man damage man leaſynge ſaue hys lyfe hys catell whych commeth delyte lye delyte woll forge longe tale paynt wyth al circumſtaunces al tale ye groūd falſe leaſynge cometh woll ſuſteyne hys wordes leaſyng cometh retcheleſneſſe wythout auyſemēt ſemblable thynges lette v nowe touche vyce flaterye whyche ne cometh gladlye drede couetyſe flatterye generally wronful prayſynge flaterers bene dyuels nouryces noryſhe hys chyldren wyth mylke loſyngerye forſoth salomon ſayeth flatery worſe detraction ſomtyme detractiō maketh hauteyne man humble dredeth detraction certes flaterye maketh man tenhaunce hys herte countenaunce flaterers ye deuels enchaūtours make man wene hym ſelfe lyke lyke thoſe lyke iudas betraye man ſell hym hys enemy flaterers ben dyuels chapleyns yt euer ſinge placebo reken flatery vyces yre ofte tyme yf man wrothe wyth another woll flater ſome wyghte ſuſtayne hym hys quarell speake nowe ſuche curſynge cometh yrous herte malyſon generally maye ſayd euery maner power harme curſing bereueth man fro raygne god ſayeth ſaynt poule oft tyme ſuch curſyng wrongfully returneth ayen curſeth byrd turneth ayen hys owne neſte ouer thynge men ought eſhewe curſe chyldren yeue deuel engendrure farre forth hem certes great peryll great ſynne lette v ſpeake chydynge reproche whych ben full great woundes mās herte vnſowe ſemes frendſhyp man herte certes vnneth maye man playnly accorded wyth hym hym openly hath reuyled repreued dyſlaundred thys full gaſtly ſynne chriſte ſayeth goſpell take hede nowe repreueth hys neyghboure eyther repreueth hym ſome harme paine hath vppon hys body meſell croked harlot ſome ſynne doth yf repreue hym harme payne turneth •• efe ieſu chriſt payne ſende ryghtwyſe ſonde god hys ſuffraunce meſelry meyme maladye yf repreue vncharitably ſynne thou holour thou dronkelewe harlot ſo forth pertayneth reioyſynge deuell whyche euer hath ioye yt men done ſynne certes chydynge maye come vylaynous hert haboundaunce herte ſpeaketh ye mouth full ofte ye ſhal vnderſtande loke waye man ſhall chaſtyſe correct another beware frō chydyng repryuynge truely beware maye full lyghtlye quycken fyre angre wroth whych ſhulde quenche perauenture ſleeth whych myght chaſtyſe wyth benignite ſayeth salomō amiable tonge tree lyfe ſaye lyfe ſpirituell ſothlye diſſolute tonge ſleeth ſpirites hym repreueth alſo hym whych repreued lo ſayeth ſaynt auguſtyne nothynge ſo lyke dyuels chylde whych ofte chydeth ſeruaunt god behoueth chyde thoughe chydynge vyllainous thynge betwyxte maner folke yet certis mooſt vncouenable bytwene man hys wyfe neuer reſte therfore ſayeth salomon houſe vncouered droppynge chydynge wyfe ben lyke man whych droppynge houſe many place though eſchewe droppynge one place droppeth hym place fareth chydynge wyfe yf ſhe chyde hym one place ſhe woll chyde hym another therfore better greatly pleſaunt morſell lytell gobet bread wyth ioye houſe fylled full delyces wyth chydynge guerrynge ſayeth salomon saynt poule ſayeth ye woman beth ye ſubiecte youre huſbandes behoueth ought god ye mē loueth wyues ad coloſſenſes iij afterwarde ſpeke ſcornyng whych wycked ſynne namely ſcorneth man hys good werkes certes ſuche ſcorners fare lyke foule tode maye endure ſmell ye ſwete ſauoure vyne whē flouryſheth theſe ſcorners bene partynge felowes wyth dyuell haue ioye whē dyuell wynneth ſorowe yf leſeth ben aduerſaryes ieſu chriſt hate loueth ſaye ſaluation ſoule speake nowe wycked counſayle ye whych traytoure dyſceyueth hym truſteth hym vt achitofel ad salomonem natheleſſe yet hys wycked counſayle fyrſt ayenſt hym ſelfe ſayeth wyſe man euery falſe lyuynge hath properte hym ſelfe wol anoye another man anoyeth fyrſt hym ſelfe men ſhall vnderſtande man ſhall take hys counſayle falſe folke ne angrye folke greuous folke ne folke loue ſpecially moche worldly folke namely counſaylynge ſoules nowe cometh ſynne hem ſowe make dyſcorde amonge folke whyche ſynne chriſt hateth vtterly wonder deyde make concorde ſhame chriſte dyd hym crucifyed god loueth better frendſhip amonges folke dyd hys owne body gaue vnite therfore ben lykened dyuell euer aboute make dyſcorde nowe commeth ſynne double tōge ſuch ſpeke fayre folke wyckedly behynde el make ſemblaūt though ſpak good entencion el game playe yet ſpeake wycked entent nowe cometh hewrayenge counſayle whych man dyffamed certes vnneth maye reſtore domage nowe cometh menace open folye ofte menaceth threateth maye performe full ofte tyme nowe commeth ydell wordes wythout profyte hym ſpeaketh wordes alſo hym herkeneth wordes el ydel wordes ben thoſe ben nedeleſſe wyth entent naturall profyte ydell wordes ſomtyme venyall ſynne yet ſhulde men doute hem ſhall yeue rekenynge hem god cometh ianglynge maye wythout ſynne ſayeth salomon ſygne perte folye therfore philoſopher ſayde men aſked hym howe ſhulde pleaſe people anſwerde many good workes ſpeake vanity cometh ſynne iaperies ben ye deuels ape make folke laughe iaperye folke gaudes ape whych iapes defendeth ſaynt paule loke howe vertuous wordes holy comforte hem trauayle ſeruyce chriſt ryght ſo comforteth villaynous wordes knackes iapers hem trauayle ſeruyce deuell theſe bene ſynnes tonge come yre ſynnes remedy ayenſt ire remedy ayenſt ire vertue men cal manſuetude debonairie alſo another vertue men clepe pacience ſufferaunce debonayrte wythdraweth refrayneth ſtee rynges mouynges mannes corage herte ſuche maner ne ſkyppe anger ne yre sufferaunce ſuffereth ſwetely anoyaunces wronges ye men done man outwarde saynt ierome ſayeth thys debonairte yt doth harme wyght ne ſayeth ne harme men ne ſaye ne chafeth ayenſt reaſon thys vertue ſomtyme cometh nature ſayeth philoſopher man quycke thynge nature debonayre tretable goodneſſe debonairte enformed grace worth pacience another remedye ayenſt ire vertue ſuffreth ſwetely euery mannes goodneſſe wroth harme done hym philoſopher ſayeth pacience vertue ſuffreth debonairly outrage aduerſite euerye wycked worde thys vertue maketh man lyke god maketh hym goddes owne chylde ſayeth chriſt thys vertue dyſcomfyteth thyne enemye therfore ſayeth wyſe man yf thou wolde vanquyſhe thyne enemye learne ſuffre thou ſhalte vnderſtande man ſuffreth foure maner greuaunces outward thynges ayenſt whyche foure muſte haue foure maner paciences fyrſt greuaunce wycked wordes whyche ſuffred ieſu chriſte wythout grutchynge full paciently iewes dyſpyſed hym full ofte suffre thou therfore paciently wyſe man ſayeth yf thou ſtryue foole though ye foole wroth though laugh alwaye thou ſhalte haue reſte greuaunce outwarde haue domage thy catell ayenſt ſuffred chriſt full paciently whē • ſpoyled al thys lyfe hys clothes thyrde greuaunce man haue harme hys body ſuffred chriſt full paciently neuer chriſtened cōmended vſed vertue paciēce philoſopher vpon tyme wolde haue beate dyſciple hys great treſpace whych moued brought rodde beate chylde chyld ſawe rodde ſayd hys mayſter thynke ye woll beate ſayd mayſter thy correction forſoth ſayd childe ye ought fyrſt correct ſelfe haue loſt al pacience offence chylde forſoth ſayd mayſter wepynge thou ſayeſt ſoth haue thou rodde dere chylde goodneſſe bene ſo greuouſe weyghtye ſuffre dare vndertake workes goodneſſe ſayeth ſaynt gregorye nowe cometh wanhope dyſpayre mercye god cometh ſomtyme moch outragious ſorow ſomtyme moch drede ala mā bethynke hym goſpel ſaint luke xv chriſt ſayeth well ſhall ioye heauen vpon ſynfull man doth penitence vpon foure ſcore nynetene ryghtful mē nede penitence loke ferther ſame goſpell ioye ye thy reygne forſoth ſayd chriſt ſaye daye ſhalte thou paradyſe certes none ſo horrible ſynne man ne maye hys lyfe dyſtroyed penitence thorough vertue paſſyon death chriſte ala nede men dyſpayred ſyth man dredeth god ſpareth ought loueth god woll dylygēce pleaſe god hys werkes abādone hym ſelfe wyth al hys myght wel thē cometh ydelneſſe yate harmes ydell man lyke place hath walles ye dyuell maye entre euerye ſyde ſhote hym dyſcouert temptation euery ſyde thys ydelneſſe thorruke wycked vylayne thoughtes al ordure certes heauen yeue hem wyll laboure ydell folke alſo dauid ſayeth ne laboure men ne ſhall whypped wyth men certes ſemeth ſhall turmented wyth dyuels hell yf penaunce cometh ſynne mē cal tarditas man ſo latered tarienge woll tourne god certes great foly lyke hym falleth dyche woll aryſe thys vyce cometh falſe hope thynketh ſhall lyue longe hope fayleth full ofte cometh lacheſſe whē begynneth good worke anone wol leaue ſtynte done haue perſone gouerne ne take hede anone fynde contrary anoye theſe ben newe ſheperdes let theyr ſhepe wyttyngly go renue ye wolfe breres force owne gouernaunce thys cometh pouerte deſtruction bothe ſpirituall temporell thynges cometh maner handes good worke ny hym vnſauery al apalled wareth ſlowe ſlombry ſone wol wroth ſone enclyned hate enuy cometh ſynne worldly ſorowe ſuch called triſtitia ſleeth man ſayeth ſaynt poule certes ſuche horryble ſynne accidie braunches ſame ther vertue called fortitudo ſtrēgth affection throughe whiche man diſpyſeth anoycus thynges vertue ſo mighty ſo rygorous dare withſtonde mightily wiſely kepe whyche ben ſtreyned tyllages cuſtomes cariages duetye reaſon elles take bondman amercyamentes whyche myght reſonablye called extortion mercyamentes whiche amerciamentes raunſomynge bondman ſome lordes wete hem haue lordſhyp ſhall ſuche chryſt ſuffred woundes fyue ſuche falſhed wyll foule fall ¶chryſt ſayd qui gladio percutit ſwerde ſhall dye bad preeſtes peace gryth bade hem drede dye bad ſymple ſlye carke cattall truſteth god ſytteth hye falſe ſhull foule fall ¶theſe wollen make men ſwere ayenſt chryſtes cōmaundement chryſtes membres tere roode wer newe yrent suche lawes make cōmen aſſent echeon choweth ball thus poore fully ſhent euer falſhed foule befall ¶they vſen ſymonye ſellen church prioryes ne vſen enuye curſen hem contraryes hyreth men dayes yeres ſtrength holde hem ſtall culleth aduerſaryes therfore falſhed foule thou fall ¶with purſe purchaſe perſonage purſe paynen hem plede men warre woll wage brynge enemyes dede lordes lyues woll lede moche take gyue ſmall ſo get ſhall ſhede make ſuche falſe ryght foule fal ¶they halowe nothyng hyre churche font ne veſtement make order euery ſhyre preeſtes paye parchement ryatours taken rent therwith ſmere ſhyppes ſkall many church ben ofte ſuſpent ſuche falſhed yet foule fall lyueth nat lecherye haunten wench widdowes wyues punyſheth poore putrye ſelfe vſeth theyr lyues man ſhryues heuen come neuer ſhall ſhalbe curſed caytyues hell ſayne ſhall fall ¶there mercy maximyen nero neuer good nowe ſome whan hath furred hoode folowe chriſt ſhedde blode heuen buckette wall suche wreches ben worſe wode ſuche faytours foule hem fall ¶they gyue almeſſe ryche maynteynours men lawe lordes woll lyche harlottes ſonne nat worthe hawe sothfaſtneſſe ſuche han ſlawe kembe crokettes chriſtall drede god haue downe drawe ſuche faytours foule hem fall ¶they maken parſons penny canon cardynals vnnethes amongeſt hem ne hath gloſed goſpell fals chriſt made neuer cathedral ne wyth hym cardynall wyth redde hatte vſyn mynſtrals falſhed foule mote befall ¶theyr tythyng offryng clemeth poſſeſſyon therof nyll none forgo robben men raunſome tythyng turpe lucrum theſe maiſters meynall tythyng bribry larſon wyll make falſhed full foule fall ¶they taken ferme ſompnours harme people may pardoner falſe faytours sell ſeales dare well ſay holden great array multiply hem metall drede full lytell dome day whan ſuche ſhall foule fall ¶suche harlottes ſhull men dyſclaunder ſhullen make gree ben proude alexaunder ſayne poore wo ye yere eche preeſte ſhall paye hys fee encreaſe hys lemmans call suche heerdes ſhull well yuell ſuche falſe ſhull foule fall ¶and yf man falſely famed wolde make purgacioun woll offycers agramed aſſigne hym fro towne towne nede muſt paye raunſome though clene chriſtall haue abſolutioun ſuche falſe ſhull foule fall ¶though gyltie dede maye money pay whyle purſe woll blede maye vſe fro day day theſe byſhoppes offycers gone full gay thys game vſen ouer poore pyll theyr pray ſuche falſe ſhull foule fall ¶alas god ordayned neuer ſuche lawe ne ſuche crafte couetyſe forbade hys ſawe suche gouernours mowen god agryſe rule ryghtwyſe theſe newe poyntes ben pure papall goddes lawe diſpyce ſuche faytours ſhul foule fall ¶they ſayne peter key heuyn hell haue holde trowe peter toke money ſynnes ſolde suche ſucceſſours ben bolde wynnyng theyr wytte wrall conſcience waxen colde ſuche faytours foule hem fall ¶peter neuer ſo great fole leaue hys key ſuche lorell take ſuche curſed ſuche tole aduyſed nothyng well trowe haue key hell theyr maiſter place marſhall dreſſen hem dwell falſe lucifere fall ¶they ben proude lucifarre angry enuyous good faythe ben full farre couetyſe ben curyous catche catell couytous hoūde hungre woll yall vngoodly vngratious nedely ſuche falſhed ſhal foule fall ¶the pope peter heyre thynke erreth caſe whan choyſe byſhoppes diſpeyre choſen hem dyuers place lorde ſhall write hym grace hys clerke anone pray ſhall ſhall ſpede hys purchaſe ſuche falſe foule hem fall ¶though good lordes prayer ſhalbe ſpedde though wylde wyll wood nat vnderſtandyng men han redde leude boſter god forbede good byſhoppe horſe ball suche pope foule ſtedde laſt woll foule fall ¶he maketh byſhoppes erthly thanke nothyng chriſtes ſake suche ben full fatte ranke ſoule heale none hede take al well done euer make ſhal anſwere one fors worldes thanke ſuche worch wake ſuche falſe ſhall foule fall ¶suche canne nat crede wyth prayer ſhull made prelate nother canne goſpell rede suche ſhull nowe welde hye eſtates hye goodes frendſhyp hem make toteth ſomme totall suche bere keyes hell yates ſuche falſe ſhall foule fall ¶they forſake chriſtes loue traueyle hungre thurſt colde ben ordred euer aboue youthe tyl ben olde dore go nat folde helpe theyr ſhepe nought trauall hyred men ſuche holde ſuche falſe foule hem fall ¶for chryſt kyng woll forſake knowe hym nought hys pouerte chriſtes loue woll wake drynke pyement ale aparte god ſeme nothyng ferde luſty lyueth dyd lamuall dryuen ſhepe deſerte ſuche faytours ſhull foule fall ¶chriſt hath xij apoſtels nowe ſay may one may nat erre manere leueth nat ben loſt echone peter erred ſo dyde nat iohn cleped principall chriſt cleped hym peter ſelf ye ſtone falſe faytours foule hem fall ¶why curſen croyſery chriſtes chriſten creature bytwene hem nowe enuy enhaunſed honour chriſten lyuers labour fyr leuyn man mortall dethe diſhonours ſuche falſe foule hem fall ¶what knoweth tyllour plowe pope name hate hys crede ſuffyſeth hym ynowe knoweth cardynall hys hatte rough poore vnrightly latte knoweth chriſt hys god royall suche mater nat worth gnatte ſuche falſe faytours foule hem fall ¶a kyng ſhall knele kyſſe hys ſhowe chryſt ſuffred ſynfull kyſſe fete thynketh holdeth hym hye ynowe lucifer dyd hye ſette suche one thynketh hym ſelfe foryete eyther trouth nat call chryſt ſuffred woundes wete shall make ſuche falſhed foule fall ¶they layeth large nettes take ſyluer golde fyllen coffer ſackes fettes ſoules catche ſholde ſeruauntes vnholde doublyn theyr rentall bygge hem caſtels bygge hem holde ſuche falſe foule hem fall ¶here endeth fyrſt parte thys tale herafter foloweth ſeconde parte accorde worde fal engliſh fynde shewe another nowe ſhall haue moche ſaye behynde howe preeſtes han people pynde curteys chriſt hath kende putte thys matter mynde make thys maner men amende ¶shortly ſhende hem ſhewe nowe howe wrongfully worche walke hye god nothyng tell ne howe goddes worde telleth many balke hernes holde hem halke prechyn tythes offrende vntruely goſpell talke hys mercy god amende ¶what antichriſt ſaye euyn chriſtes aduerſary suche hathe nowe ben many day chriſtes byddyng full contrary trouthe clene varry waye ben wende chriſtes people vntruely cary god hys pytie amende ¶that lyuen contrary chriſtes lyfe hye pride agaynſt mekeneſſe agaynſt ſufferaunce vſen ſtryfe angre ayenſt ſobreneſſe agaynſt wyſedome wylfulneſſe chriſtes tale lytell tende agaynſt meaſure outragyouſneſſe whan god woll maye amende ¶lordly lyfe ayenſt lowlyneſſe demyn without mercy couetyſe ayenſt largeſſe agaynſt trewth trechery agaynſt almeſſe enuy agaynſt chriſt comprehende chaſtyte maynteyne lechery god hys grace thys amende ¶ayenſt penaunce vſe delyghtes ayenſt ſuffraunce ſtronge defence ayenſt god vſen yuel rightes agaynſte pytie puniſhementes open yuell ayenſt contynence wycked wynnyng worſe diſpende sobreneſſe ſette diſpence god hys goodneſſe amende ¶why cleymen holy hys powere wranglen ayenſt hys heſtes hys lyuyng folowen nothyng lyuen worſe wytleſſe beeſtes fyſhe fleſhe louen feeſtes lordes ben brode ykende goddes poore haten geſtes god hys mercy thys amende ¶with dyuers ſuche ſhall haue dome ſayne chriſtes frendes nothyng ſhulde done ſuche ben falſer ben fendes people ley ſuche bendes god erthe han offende surour ſuche chriſt nowe ſende v hys mercy thys amende ¶a token antichriſt hys careckes ben nowe wyde yknowe receyued preche ſhall man wythout token hym trowe eche chriſten preeſt prechyn owe god aboue ben ſende goddes worde folke ſhowe synfull man amende ¶chriſt ſente poore preche royall ryche dyd nat ſo nowe dare poore people teche antichriſt ouer foe amonge people mote go hath bydden ſuche ſuſpende hath hente thynketh yet mo thys god may well amende ¶all tho han worlde forſake lyuen loly god badde priſon ſhullen take betyn bounden forthe ladde herof rede man dradde chriſt ſayd hys ſhulde ſhende eche man ought herof gladde god full well woll amende ¶they take hem royall powere ſaye haue ſwerdes two one curſe hell one flee men hys takyng chriſt mo yet peter one tho chriſt peter ſmyte gan defende ſheth badde putte tho ſuche myſcheues god amende ¶chriſt badde peter kepe ſhepe ſwerde forbade hym ſmyte swerde tole ſhepe kepe ſheperdes ſhepe woll byte thynketh ſuche ſheperdes ben wyte ayen ſhepe ſwerde contende driue ſhepe great diſpyte thys god may well amende ¶so ſucceſſours peter nought chriſt made chefe paſtoure aſwerde ſheperde vſen ought wold ſlee bochoure ſo peter ſucceſſour shulde bere hys ſhepe tyll hys backe bende ſhadowe hem euery ſhoure thys god maye wel amende ¶succeſſours peter ben theſe peter chriſt forſoke leuer loue god leſe ſheperde leſe hoke culleth ſhepe dothe coke hem taken woll vntrende falſely gloſe goſpell boke god mercy amende ¶after chriſt take peter kay chryſt ſayd muſte dye man peter chriſt gan withſay chriſt badde hym go behynde sathan suche coūſaylours many theſe men han worldes wele god offende peter ſucceſſours ben ſuche god may well amende ¶for sathan ſay contrary chriſt thys lerne peter lore ſewen hym whan dyd myſſe folowe peter forſothe thys al chriſt wolde peter reprehende nat longeth heuyn blyſſe god hys mercy hem amende ¶some apoſtels ſewen caſe ought vnderſtonde hym betrayed chriſt iudas bare purſe euery londe al myght ſette honde hydde ſtale myſpende rule theſe traytours han honde almighty god hem amende ¶and laſt hys lorde gan tray curſedly hys falſe couetyſe wolde theſe trayen hym money wyſten wyſe ſeker ſelfe enſyſe ſothneſſe ben frende couetyſe chaungen queyneyſe almighty god ſuche amende ¶were chriſt erthe efte ſone theſe wolde dampne hym dye hys heſtes han fordone ſayne ſawes ben hereſy ayenſt commaundementes crye dampne hys brende lyketh nat hem ſuche loſengery god almighty hem amende ¶theſe han moremyght englande hert hath kynge hys lawe han purchaſed hem ſuche powere taken hem lyſte nat knawe ſay hereſy ſawe ſo pryſone woll hem ſende nat ſo elder dawe god hys mercy amende ¶the kynges lawe wol man deme angerlyche withouten anſwere yf man theſe myſqueme ſhalbe bayghted bere yet wel worſe woll hym tere pryſone woll hem pende gyues gere whan god woll maye mende ¶the kyng taxeth nat hys men aſſente commynalte theſe eche yere woll raunſom hem mayſterfully doth ſeales yere better kynges extende offycers han gretter fee thys miſchefe god amende ¶for ſo woll proue teſtament natt worthe tenne pounde ſhall paye parchement thyrde parte money rounde thus people raunſounde ſaye ſuche parte hem ſhulde apende grypen gothe grounde god hys mercy amende ¶a ſymple fornycatioun twenty ſhyllynges ſhall paye haue abſolution yere vſen forthe maye thus letten hem go ſtray recke nat though ſoule brende theſe kepyn yuell peter key ſuche ſheperdes god amende ¶wonder parlyament lordes thys londe taken ſo lytell entent helpe people honde ben harder theyr bonde worſe beate bytter brende kyng vnderſtande god hym helpe thys amende ¶what byſſhoppes relygions han thys lande moche laye fee lorſhyppes poſſeſſyons lordes ſemeth maketh hem leſe charyte mowe nat god attende erthe haue ſo hyghe degree god hys mercy amende ¶the emperour yaf pope ſomtyme hyghe lordſhyp hym aboute laſte ſely kyme proude pope putte hym thys realme doute lordes ware defende nowe theſe folke wonder ſtoute kynge lordes nowe thys amende ¶thus endeth ſeconde parte tale foloweth thyrde moyſes lawe forbode tho preeſtes ſhulde lordſhyppes welde chriſtes goſpel byddeth alſo ſhulde lordſhyppe helde ne chriſtes apoſtels neuer ſo bolde ſuche lordeſhyppes enbrace ſmeren ſhepe kepe folde god amende hem hys grace ¶for ne ben countrefete men may knowe hem fruite gretneſſe maketh hem god foryete take hys mekeneſſe diſpyte poore lyte nolde nat demen face noryſhe ſhepe hem nat byte god amende hem hys grace ¶gyfon ¶what canſt thou preche ayenſt chanons men clepen ſeculere pely ben curate many town erthe haue great powere han great prebendes dere two thre ſome mo perſonage ben playeng fere yet ſerue kynge alſo ¶and lette ferme fare woll moſt gyue therfore woll ſpende ſome woll ſpa • ſome woll laye vp ſtore cure ſoule care nat fore mowe money take whether ſoules wonne lore profytes woll nat forſake ¶they haue gederyng procuratour poore people enplede robben hem rauynour hys lorde money lede catche quicke eke dede riche • hym hys lorde eke robbe poore gyue good rede olde yonge hole ſyke ¶therwith purchaſe hem lay fee londe hem lyketh beſt buylde alſo brode cyte bothe eſt eke weſt purchaſe thus ben ful preſt poore woll nought ſpende ne good gyue goddes geſt ne ſende hym ſome hath ſende ¶by ſeruyce ſuche woll lyue truſſe treaſour though paryſhe dye vnſhriue woll nat gyue roſe floure lyfe ſhulde myrrour bothe lered leude alſo teche people lele labour suche myſter men ben myſgo ¶some hem ben harde nygges ſome hem ben proude gay ſpende good vpon gygges fynden hem great aray ala thynke theſe men ſay thus diſpenden goddis good dredefull dome daye suche wretch ſhulbe worſe wood ¶some churces neuer ne ſye ne neuer peny thyder ne ſende though poore pariſhens hungre dye peny hem wyl nat ſpende haue receyuynge rente recke neuer remenant ala deuyll hath clene hem blent suche one sathanas ſoiournant ¶and vſen horedome harlotry couetyſe pomp • pride slouthe wrathe eke enuy ſewen ſynne euery ſyde ala thynke ſuche tabyde howe woll accomptes yelde hye god mowe hem nat hyde suche wyllers wytte nat worth nelde ¶they ben ſo roted richeſſe chriſtes pouert foryet serued wyth ſo many meſſe hem thynketh manna mete good mowe gete wene lyue euermore whan god dome ſette suche treaſour feble ſtore ¶vnneth mote matyns ſaye countyng court holdynge yet iangleth iaye vnderſtont hym ſelfe nothynge woll ſerue bothe erle kynge hys fyndyng hys fee hyde hys tythynge hys offrynge feble charite ¶other ben proude coueytous ben harde hungry ben lyberall lecherous el medlers wyth marchandry maynteyners men wyth maiſtry ſtewardes countours pledours ſerue god hypocriſy preeſtes ben chriſtes falſe traytours ¶they ben falſe ben vengeable begylen men chriſtes name ben vnſtedfaſt vnſtable tray lorde hem thynketh ſhame ſerue god ben full lame goddes theues falſly ſtele falſely goddes worde defame wynnyng worldes wele ¶antichryſt theſe ſeruen pray may ſay nay wyth antichryſt ſuche ſhull fall folowen hym dede fay ſeruyn hym ryche array ſerue chryſt ſuche falſely fayne dredeful dome day shull folowe hym payne ¶that knowen hem ſelfe done yll ayenſt chriſtes commaundement amende hem neuer ne wyll ſerue sathan one aſſent ſayth ſothe ſhalbe ſhent ſpeketh ayenſt falſe lyuyng ſo well lyueth ſhalbe brent ſuche ben gretter kyng ¶pope byſhoppes cardynals chanons perſons vycaire goddes ſeruyce trowe ben falſe ſacramentes ſellen ben proude lucifere eche man loke whether lye ſo ſpeketh ayenſt powere ſhall holden hereſy ¶loke howe many order take onely chriſte hys ſeruyce worldes goodes forſake ſo taketh order wyſe trowe ſhall ſore agryſe gloſe conne ſewen thys aſſyſe yuell tyme thus begonne ¶loke howe many amonge hem holden thys hye waye wyth antichriſt ſhullen fall wolden god betraye god amende hem beſt maye many men maken ſhende weten well ſothe ſaye dyuell hath foule hem blende ¶some church dwell apparaylled poorely proude porte ſeuen ſacramentes done ſell cattel catchynge comforte eche matter wollen mell done hem wronge dyſporte afray people ben fell holde hem lower doth lorde ¶for tythynge ducke apple aye make men ſweare vpon boke thus foulen chriſtes ſay suche bearen yuell heauen kay mowen aſſoyle mowe ſhryue wyth mennes wyues ſtrongly play wyth true tyllers ſturte ſtryue ¶at wreſtlynge wake chefe chauntours nale markette beater medlynge make hoppen houten wyth heue hale fayre freſhe wyne ſtale dyne drynke make debate ſeuen ſacramentes ſet ſayle howe kepe ſuche kayes heuen gate ¶mennes wyues wollen holde though ben ryght ſory ſpeake ſhull ſo bolde ſompnynge conſyſtory make hem ſaye mouth lye though ſawe wyth eye hys lemman holden openly man ſo hardy axe ¶he woll haue tythynge offrynge maugre ſo euer gruche twyſe daye woll ſynge goddes preſtes nere none ſuche mote huntyng wyth dogge byche blowen hys horne cryen hey ſorcery vſen wytche suche kepen yuell peter key ¶yet mote haue ſome ſtocke ſtone gayly paynted proudly dyght maken men lyuen vpon ſaye full myght aboute ſuche men ſette vp great lyght ſuche ſtockes ſhull ſtande therby darke mydnyght maye make maſtry ¶that leude people ſe mowe thou mary thou worcheſt wōder thynges aboute men offren nowe hongen broches ouches rynges preeſt purchaſeth offrynges nyll offre none ymage wo ſoule ſynges precheth ſuche pylgrimage ¶to men woman ben poore ben chriſtes owne lykeneſſe men ſhullen offre dore ſuffren honger dyſtreſſe ſuche ymages offre leſſe mowe fele thurſt ne colde poore ſprete gan chriſte bleſſe therfore offreth feble olde ¶buckelers brode ſweardes longe baudryke wyth baſelardes kene suche tole necke honge wyth antichriſt ſuche preeſtes bene vpon dedes well ſene whome ſeruen whome honoren antichriſtes bene clene goddes goodes faſly deuouren ¶of ſcarlet grene gay gownes mote ſhape newe clyppen kyſſen counten townes damoſeles daunce ſewe cutted clothes ſewe hewe wyth longe pykes ſhone goddes goſpell trewe eyther ſeruen dyuell none ¶nowe ben preſtes poke ſo wyde men muſt enlarge veſtement holy goſpell done hyde contraryen rayment suche preeſtes lucifer ben ſent lyke conquetours ben arayde proude pendauntes ar ypent falſely truthe han betrayde ¶shryfte ſyluer ſuche wollen aſke woll men crepe crouche none ſacramentes ſaue aſkes wythout mede ſhall man touche byſhoppe theyr warant vouche lawe decre wyth mede money thus mouche thus ſayne charite ¶in myddes maſſe nyll haue man hyre full ſhortly let forth paſſe suche ſhull men fynde eche ſhyre perſonages profyte deſyre lyue lykynge luſtes dare ſayne sans oſe ieo dyre ſuche ben antichriſtes preeſtes ¶or yeſ byſhoppes mote ben hys ſeruyce holden forth harlotry suche prelate ben feble empryſe goddes grame ſuche men agryſe ſuche matter taken mede howe excuſe hem wyſe thynketh ought greatly drede ¶they ſayne man longeth reproue though erre falſely goddes goodeſſe fongeth therwyth maynteyne wo werre dedes ſhulde bryght ſterre lyuynge leude mannes lyght ſaye pope maye erre nede muſte paſſe mannes myght ¶though preſt lye wt leman al nyght tellen hys felowe hym goth maſſe anone ryght ſayeth ſyngeth ſynne hys byrde abydeth hym hys ynne dyghteth hys dyner meane whyle ſyngeth hys maſſe wolde wynne ſo weneth god begyle ¶hem thynketh longe tyll mette vſen forth yere amonge folke ſette holdeth man halfe hys pere byſhoppe hath powere ſoyle men el ben lore hys abſolution maye make ſkere wo ſoule ſyngeth fore ¶the gryffon began threte ſayd monkes canſt thou ought pellycan ſayd ben full grete thys world moch wo hath wrought saynt benet order brought ne made hem neuer ſuche manere trowe came neuer hys thought ſhulde vſe ſo great power ¶that man ſhulde monke lorde cal ne ſerue knee kynge proude prynce pall meate drynke thynge wearen myter rynge wyth double worſted well ydyght wyth royall meate ryche drynke rydeth courſer knyght ¶wyth hauke wyth houndes eke wyth broches ouches hys hode ſaye maſſe weke deynties moſte foode wyth lordſhyppes wyth bondman thys royall religion saynt benet made neuer none hem haue lordſhyppe man ne towne ¶nowe ben queynte curious wyth fyne clothe cladde ſerued clene proude angry enuyous malyce moche meane catchynge crafty couetous lordly lyuen great lykynge thys lyuynge religious accordynge benette hys lyuynge ¶they ben clerkes courtes ouer ſe poore tenaunce fully ſlyte hyre man amerced gladlyer woll wryte thys farre chriſtes pouerte wyth couetyſe endyte poore haue pyte ne neuer hem cheryſhe euer hem byte ¶and cōmenly ſuche ben comen poore people hem begete thys perfection han ynomen father ryden fete trauaylen ſore ete pouert lyueth yonge olde father ſuffreth drought wete many hongry meles thurſt colde ¶and thys monkes han forſake chriſtes loue ſaynt benette pryde eaſe haue hem take thys religion yuell beſette ben religioun muſt haue honged plowe threſhynge dykynge fro towne towne wyth ſory mete halfe ynowe ¶therfore han thys forſake taken ryches pryde eaſe full fewe god woll monkes hem make lytell ſuche order prayſe saynt benet ordayned ſo badde hem cherelyche churlyche maner lyue go boyſtous earth lor • lych ¶they dyſclaunder ſaynt benette therfore haue hys holy curſe saynt benet wyth hem neuer mette yf thought robbe hys purſe herof tell ben lyke tho clene ſerue dyuell hell ben hys treaſoure hys ſtore ¶and ſuche counterfaytours chanons canon ſuche dyſgyſed ben goddes enemyes traytours hys true religion han foule dyſpyſed freres haue tolde makynge crede yet coulde tell worſe men wolde weryen rede ¶as goddes goodneſſe man tell myght wryte ne ſpeake ne thynke thought falſhed vnryght may man tell euer god wrought gryffon ſayd thou canſt good thou came neuer gentyll kynde trowe thou waxeſt wood el thou haſt loſte thy mynde ¶shulde holy churche haue heed ſhulde gouernayle ſhulde rule ſhulde reed ſhulde forthren ſhulde auayle eche man ſhall lyue hys trauayle beſt doth ſhall haue moſte mede wyth ſtrength yf men churche aſſayle wyth ſtrength men muſt defende nede ¶and pope purely poore nedy nothynge ne hadde ſhulde dryuen dore dore wycked hym nolde dradde ſuche heed men wolde ſadde ſynfully lyuen hem luſt wyth ſtrength amendes ſuche made wyth wepen wolues ſhepe wuſt ¶yf pope prelate wolde begge bydde bowe borowe holy churche ſhulde ſtande full colde ſeruauntes ſytte ſoupe ſorowe noughty foule horowe worſhyppe god men wolde wlate bothe euen morowe suche harlotry men wolde hate ¶therfore men holy churche shulde ben honeſt thynge worſhypfully goddes workes werche ſemeth ſerue chriſt kynge honeſt clene clothynge wyth veſſels golde clothes ryche god honeſtly make offrynge hys lordſhypppe none lyche ¶the pellican caſte houge crye ſayd ala ſayeſt thou ſo chriſt heed ſytteth hye heddes ne ought haue mo ben hys membres alſo father taught v cal hym al mayſters called defended tho mayſters ben wycked fals ¶that taketh mayſtry hys name gooſtly earthly good kynges lordes ſhulde lordſhyp hane rule people wyth mylde mode chriſt v ſhedde hys blode badde hys preeſtes mayſterſhyp haue ne carke nat cloth ne fode euery myſchefe wyll hem ſaue ¶her ryche clothynge ſhalbe ryghtwyſneſſe treaſoure trewe lyfe ſhalbe charite ſhalbe rycheſſe lordſhyppe ſhalbe vnite hope god honeſte veſſell clene conſcience poore ſpirite humilite shalbe holy church defence ¶what ſayd gryffon may greue folkes faren wele haſte thou done wyth lyue thy falſheed eche man may fele thou canſt catell gete lyueſt londe lorell wyth gloſynge getteſt thou thy mete fareth deuell wonneth hell ¶he wolde eche mā ſhulde dwell lyueth clene enuye wyth tale thou doeſt tell thou woldeſt people dyſtry wyth gloſe hereſy ye lyue better lyfe clene hypocriſy bryngeſt wo ſtryfe ¶and therwyth haue done ye ne haue cure ye ſerue dyuell neyther god ne man ſhall paye hyre ye woll fare well feeſtes warme clothed colde therfore ye gloſe goddes heſtes begyle people yonge olde ¶and ſeuen ſacramentes ye ſpeake ayenſt ye ſlye ayenſt tythynges offringes wt entētes lordes body falſly lye thys ye done lyue caſe ſayeth ben none ſuche ſayne pope worth peaſe make people ayen hym gruche ¶and thys cōmeth fendes brynge chriſten dyſtaunce wolde man frendes leaue thy chattrynge wyth myſchaunce yf thou lyue well wylt thou let men lyue hem lyſt spende good kepe ſtore mennes conſcience neuer thou nyſt ¶ye han cure anſwere fore meddell ye han done let men lyue han done yore thou ſhalte anſwere man pellican ſayd syr nay diſpyſed pope ne ſacramente ſoth ſay ſpeake charite good hope ¶but dyſpyſe hye pryde rycheſſe ſhulde poore ſpirite wyckedneſſe knowe ſo wyde ſerue god falſe habyte turnen mekeneſſe pryde lowlyneſſe hye degre goddes wordes turne hyde moued charite ¶to lette men lyue ſo wyth connynge al myght warne men wo tell hem trouth ryght ſacramentes ſoule hele yf ben vſed good vſe ayenſt ſpeake neuer dele nothynge wyſe ¶but vſen hem myſſe manere ſette hem vp ſale trowe ſhall abye hem dere thys reaſon thys tale ſo taketh hem vnryghtfullyche ayenſt ten cōmaundementes gloſe wreched lyche selleth ſacramentes ¶i trowe deuell homage weten wronge therto dare well wage ſeruen satan al ſonge tythen offren holſome lyfe done dewe manere man houſelyn ſhryue weddynge fere ¶so nother ſolde ne bought ne take ne gyue couetyſe ſo taken nought ſelleth hem ſo maye ſore agryſe lordes body lye ſaye ſoth thorowe trewe rede hys fleſhe blode hys myſtrye forme brede ¶howe nedeth ſtryue whether ſubgette accydent chriſt lyue verament yf pope cardynall lyue good lyue chriſt commaunded hys goſpell ayenſt woll ſtryue thynketh lyue well ¶for yf pope lyued god bede pryde hyghneſſe ſhulde dyſpyſe rycheſſe couetyſe crowne hede mekeneſſe pouerte ſhulde vſe gryffon ſayd ſhulde abye thou ſhalbe brent balefull fyre thy ſecte ſhall dyſtrye ye ſhalbe hanged ſwyre ¶ye ſhullen hanged drawe gyueth leaue preache ſpeake agaynſt goddes lawe people thus falſely teache thou ſhalt curſed wyth boke bell dyſſeuered holy churche clene ydampned hell otherwyſe ye woll worche ¶the pellycan ſayd ne drede curſynge lytell value god hope haue mede falſhede ye ſhewe ye ben charite wylneth vengeaunce dyd nero ſuffren woll redy drede thou canſt ¶chriſt badde one ſuffre hys loue ſo taught hys ſeruauntes thou amende hys ſake aboue drede thy mayntenaunce yf drede worldes hate thynketh lytell prayſe drede nothynge hye eſtate ne drede dyſeaſe ¶wolde ye turne leaue pryde hye porte rycheſſe curſynge ſhulde go ſo wyde god brynge ryghtwyſneſſe drede tyranny nothynge ye done ſuffre redy syker recke neuer howe ſoone ¶the gryffon grynned wode loked louely owle ſwore cockes herte bloode wolde hym tere euery doule holy churche thou dyſclaundreſt foule thy reaſons woll race make thy fleſhe rote moule loſell thou ſhalte haue harde grace ¶the gryffon flewe forth hys waye pellycane dyd ſytte wepe hym ſelfe gan ſaye god wolde chriſtes ſhepe herde yeake kepe eche worde ſayd wolde wrytte well kepe god wolde hys grace plowman ¶i anſwerde ſayd wolde yf trauayle man wolde pay pelycā ſayd yes theſe yt god han ſolde han ſtore money plowmā ſayd tell thou may telleſt thou mennes treſpace pelycan ſaid amēde hem good fay yf god woll gyue grace ¶for chriſt hym ſelfe lykened hys people dyed rode fare ryght ſo fareth fedeth hys byrdes wyth hys blode theſe done yuell ayenſt gode ben hys fone vnder frendes face tolde hem howe lyuynge ſtode god amende hem hys grace plowmā ayleth ye gryffon tell holdeth ſyde two ben lykely wyth kyndes robben wyde pellicā foule betokeneth pryde lucifer hygh flewe ſyth dyd hym euell hyde agylted goddes grace ¶as byrde flyeth vp ayre lyueth byrdes ben meke theſe flowe vp dyſpayre ſhenden ſely ſoules eke ſoules ben ſynnes ſeke culleth hem knele therfore ala brybry goddes forbode breke god amende hys grace ¶the hynder parte lyoun robber rauynere robbeth people earth downe erth holdeth none hys pere fareth thys foule ferre nere wyth tēporel ſtrength people chaſe lyon proude earth god amende hem hys grace pellican ¶he ſlewe forth wyth hys wynges twayne droupynge daſed dull ſoone gryffon came agayne hys foules earth full pellican caſt pull great nombre neuer ſene maner foules tellen woll yf god woll gyue hys grace ¶wyth gryffon comen foules fele rauyns rokes crowes pye grayfoules agadred wele igurde aboue wolde hye gledes boſardes hem whyte molle puttockes token place lapwynges well cōneth lye thys felowſhyp han gerde grace ¶longe pellican laſte cometh agayne brought wyth hym phenix ſtoute gryffon wolde haue flowe ful faynt hys foules flewen thycke rayne phenix tho began hem chace flye hym vayne dyd vengeaunce grace ¶he ſlewe hem downe wythout mercy aſtarte neyther free ne thrall hym caſt rufull crye gryffon downe fall bete hem ſlewe hem whyther hem droue man may trace vnder erthe thought yall ala feble grace ¶the pellican axed ryght wrytynge yf haue blame woll fyght flyght ſhall ſhelde ſhame mayde dame lambe ſlayne shall ſhelde goſtly blame erthely harme goddes grace ¶therfore praye euery man wrytynge haue excuſed thys wrytynge wryteth pellican thus theſe people hath dyſpyſed freſhe fully aduyſed nyll maynteyne hys manace deuell often dyſguyſed brynge man yuell grace ¶wyteth pellican herof nyl auowe hye ne lowe ne degre fable take ye mowe holy churche wyll bowe eche man amende hym chriſt ſende ſpace wrytynge alowe almyghty hys grace finis ¶thus endeth boke caunterbury tale foloweth romaunt roſe ¶the romaūt roſe manye man ſayen ſweuenynges ny fable leſynges men may ſome ſweuen ſene hardlye falſe ne bene aftewarde ben apparaunt maye drawe warraunt author hyght macrobes halte nat dreames falſe ne lee vndoth v auyſyoun whylom mette kyng cipioun whoſo ſayth weneth • ape el nycetie wene dremes fall lette whoſo lyſt foole call trowe ſaye dremes ſignifiaunce good harme many wightes dremen ſlepe nyghtes full many thynges couertly fallen openly within twenty yere age whan loue taketh corage yonge folke went ſoone bed wont done faſt ſlept ſlepyng met ſuche ſwenyng lyke wonder wele ſweue neuer dele ny afterwarde befal rygh dreame wol tell v dreme wol ryme aryght make hertes gaye lyght loue prayeth alſo cōmaundeth ſo yf aſke whether ſhe boke shall hate rede romaunce roſe arte loue gloſe ¶the matter fayre make god graunt gre ſhe take whome begone ſhe hath ywys mokel pryſe therto ſhe worthy beloued ſhe well ought pryſe ryght cleped roſe euery wyght may thought tho fyue yere ago may thus dremed tyme loue iolitie thyng gynneth waxen gay neyther buſke haye may nyl ſhrouded bene newe leues wrene theſe woddes eke recoueren grene drye wynter ben ſene erth wexeth proude withall ſwote dewes fall pore eſtate forgette wynter ſette becometh ground ſo proude woll haue newe ſhroude maketh ſo queynt robe fayre hewes hundred payre graſſe floures ynde pers many hewes full dyuers robe mene ywys grounde prayſen byrdes han lefft ſonge whyle han ſuffred colde full ſtronge wether grylle derke ſyght ben may ſunne bryght glad ſhewe ſyngyng herte ſuche lykyng mote ſyngen ben lyght doth nyghtyngale myght maken noyſe ſyngen blythe blyſfull many ſythe chelaundre popyngay yonge folke entenden aye ben gay amarous tyme ſo ſauorious harde hert loueth nought may whan al myrth wrought whan may theſe braunches ſmall byrbes ſyngen clere blyſfull ſwete ſwete ſonge pitions ſeſon delytious whan loue affirmeth thynge thougt one nyght ſlepyng ryght bedde full redely morowe erly vp roſe gan clothe anon wyſh myne hondes ſyluer nedle forth drowe aguyler queynt ynowe gan nedle threde anon towne lyſt gone ſowne bryddes heare theſe buſkes ſyngen cleare ſwete ſeaſon lefe threde baſtyng ſleues alone went playing ſmall foules ſonge herkenyng payned hem full many payre ſynge bowes bloſſomed fayre iolyfe gaye full gladneſſe towarde ryuer gan dreſſe herde renne faſt fayrer playing none ſawe playen ryuere hyll ſtode nere come downe ſtreme full ſtyffe bolde clere water colde well ſoth ſayne ſomdele laſſe sayne ſtrayter wele awaye neuer ſaugh er daye water ſo wele lyked wonder gladde ſe luſty place ryuere water ran ſo clere face wyſh tho ſawe wele botome ypaued euery dele grauell full ſtones ſhene medowes ſofte ſote grene beet ryght water ſyde ful clere morowe tyde full attempre drede tho gan walken thorowe mede downwarde aye playing ryuers ſyde cooſtyng whyle ygone ſawe garden ryght anon full longe brode euery dele encloſed walled wele hye walles enbatayled portrayed without wel entayled many ryche portreytures ymages peyntures gan beholde beſely woll tell redely thilke ymages ſemblaunce ferre haue remembraunce mydde ſawe hate ſtonde wrath yre onde semed mynoreſſe angry chydereſſe full gyle fell corage ſemblaunt ylke ymage ſhe nothyng wele arayed lyke wode woman afrayed yfrounced foule vyſage grynnyng diſputous rage noſe ſnorted vp tene full hydous ſhe ſene ful foule ruſty ſhe heed ywryththen ywys full grymly great towayle ¶an ymage entayle lyſte halfe faſt name aboue heed ſawe ſhe called felony ¶an ymage vyllany ycleped ſawe fonde vpon wall right honde vyllany lyke ſomdele ymage truſteth wele ſemed wicked creature countenaunce portreture ſemed full diſpytous eke full proude outragious wel coulde paynt vndertake ſuche ymage coulde make full foule chorlyſh ſemed ſhe eke vyllanous lytle coulde norture worſhyppe creature ¶and next paynted couetyſe eggeth folke many gyſe take yeue ryght nought agayne great treaſures vp layne ſhe vſure leueth many creature laſſe wynnyng couetous brennyng ſhe penne feele teacheth robbe ſteele theſe theues theſe ſmall harlotes routh throtes full many one hongeth laſt maketh folke compaſſe caſt taken folkes thynge robbery myſcouetyng ſhe maketh trechours ſhe maketh falſe pledours termes dome done maydens chyldren eke gromes herytage forgo full croked hondes two couetyſe euer wode grypen folkes good couetyſe wynnyng full lefe hath men thyng ¶an ymage ſette ſaugh next couetiſe faſt ſhe cleped auaryce ful foule payntyng vyce full ſad caytyfe ſhe eke alſo grene leke euyll hewed coloure ſemed haue lyued langour lyke thyng hungre deed lad lyfe onely breed kneden eyſell ſtronge egre therto ſhe leane megre ſhe clad full poorely torne courtpy ſhe al dogges torne behynde eke beforne clouted ſhe beggarly mantell honge faſt vpon benche weke ſmall burnyt cote honge withall furred menyuere furre rough heere lambe ſkynnes heuy blake ful olde vndertake auarice cloth wele ne haſteth neuer adele certaynly lothe wearren oft ylke clothe yf forweared ſhe wolde haue full great nycetie clothyng er ſhe bought newe bad woll hewe auarice helde hande purſe honge bande ſhe hydde bonde ſo ſtronge men muſt abyde wonder longe purſe come ought ne cōmeth thought certayne entent fro purſe peny went ymage nygh ynough paynted enuy neuer lough neuer wel herte ferde yf ſhe eyther ſawe herde great myſchannce great diſeſe nothyng may ſo moche pleſe myſchefe myſaduenture whan ſhe ſeeth diſcomfyture vpon worthy man fall lyketh well withall full glad corage yf ſhe ſe great lynage brought nought ſhameful wyſe yf man honour ryſe wyt proweſſe hath ſhe great heuyneſſe truſteth well ſhe goth nye wood whan chaunce happeth good enuye ſuche crueltie fayth ne trouth holdeth ſhe frende ne felowe badde good ne ſhe hath kynne none blood ſhe ny full enemy nolde dare ſayne hardely owne father fared wele ſore abydeth ſhe euery dele malyce male talent ſhe ſo great turment hate ſuche folke doth good nygh ſhe melteth pure wood herte kerueth ſo breaketh god people well awreketh enuy ywys ſhall neuer let blame vpon folke ſet trowe yf enuy ywys knewe beſt man ſyde beyonde ſee yet ſomwhat lacken hym wolde ſhe yf ſo hende wyſe ſhe ne myght al abate pryſe yet wolde ſhe blame worthyneſſe wordes make leſſe ſawe enuy payntyng wonderfull lokyng ſhe ne loked awry ouetwharte baggyngly ſhe foule vſage myght loke vyſage man ne woman forth ryght playne ſhu • te one eye diſdayne enuy brenned ſhe whan ſhe myght man ſe fayre worthy wyſe el ſtode folkes pryſe ¶sorowe paynted next enuy vpon wall maſourye well ſene colour ſhe lyued langour ſemed haue iaundice halfe ſo pale auaryce ne nothynge lyke leaneſſe ſorowe thought great diſtreſſe ſhe ſuffred daye nyght made yelowe nothyng bryght ful fade pale megre alſo neuer wight yet halfe ſo wo ſemed ſo fulfylled yre ſhe trowe wyght myght pleſe thyng myght eſe ſhe ne wolde ſorowe ſlake comfort none vnto take depe wo begon eke hert angre ronne ſorowfull thyng wel ſemed ſhe ſhe nothyng ſlowe cratchen face rent many place clothes tere ſwyre ſhe fulfylled yre torne laye eke heere ſhulders ſhe rent angre male talent eke tell certaynly ſhe wept full tenderly worlde ny wyght ſo harde hert ſene ſorowes ſmerte nolde haue pytye wo begonne thynge ſhe al daſht ſelfe wo ſmote togyther hondes two ſorowe ſhe full intentyfe wofull recheleſſe caytyfe rought lytle playing clyppynge kyſſynge whoſo ſorowful herte hym luſt playe ne ſterte ne dauncen ne ſynge ne may hert tempre brynge make ioye euen morowe ioye contrary vnto ſorowe elde paynted ſhorter fote iwys ſhe wont yonghede vnneth ſelfe ſhe myght fede feble eke ſo olde ſhe faded beautye ful ſalowe waxen colour heed hore whyte floure iwys great qualme ne none ne ſynne although lyfe gone woxen body vnwelde drye dwyned al elde foule forwelked thynge ſhe whylom rounde ſoft eares ſhoken faſt withall heed wolde fall face frounced forpyned hondes lorne forwyned olde ſhe ſhe ne went fote potent tyme paſſeth nyght daye reſtleſſe trauayleth aye ſteleth v ſo priuely v ſemeth ſekerly one poynt dwelleth euer certes ne reſteth neuer goth ſo faſt paſſeth aye ny man thynke may tyme nowe preſent aſketh theſe clerkes men thynke redely thre tymes bene paſſed tyme maye ſoiourne goth may neuer returne water downe renneth aye neuer droppe returne maye maye nothynge tyme endure metall erthly creature thyng frette ſhall tyme eke chaungeth doth waxe foſtred thynge deſtroyeth tyme eldeth aunceſtours eldeth kynges emperours v ſhall ouercōmen er deth v ſhal haue nōmen tyme hath welde elden folke made elde inly wetyng myght helpe ſelfe nothyng turned ayen vnto chyldheed nothyng ſelfe lede ne wytte ne pythe holde chylde two yere olde natheleſſe trowe ſhe fayre ſometyme freſh ſe whan ſhe ryght full age ſhe paſt paſſage doted thyng becōmen furred cappe ſhe nummen well ſhe clad ſelfe warme colde myght el done harme theſe olde folke haue alwaye colde kynde ſuche ben olde ¶another thynge done writ ſemed lyke ipocryt cleped pope holy ylke ſhe priuely ne ſpareth neuer wycked dede whan men take none hede maketh outwarde precious wyth pale vyſage pytous ſemeth ſimple creature ny miſauenture ſhe ne thynketh corage ful
