great bounte gate garden vndyd let paſſen daunced geſſe ſhe fulfylled luſtyneſſe na yet xij yere age wyth herte wylde thought volage nyce ſhe ſhe ne mente none harme ne ſleyght entente onely luſt iolyte yonge folke well weten ye haue lytell thought playe lemman beſyde alwaye ſuche gyſe kyſte tymes hym lyſte daunce myght ſe make force preuyte ſo ſpake hem yuell wele aſhamed neuer dele men myght ſene hem kyſſe two yonge douues yonge thylke bachelere beaute wote none hys pere ryght ſuche age youth hys lefe ſuche corage luſty folke daunced alſo wyth hem meyne full hende folke wyſe free folke fayre porte truely comenly ſene countenaunces hem ladden thus theſe daunces wyll gone ſe garden ſo lyked loken theſe fayre laurelles pyne tree cedres olmeres daunces ended many hem daunced wyth loues went away vnder tree haue playe lorde lyued luſtely great foole ſekerly nolde hys thākes ſuch lyfe lede thys dare ſayne drede ſo myght ſo well fare better lyfe durſt hym care ny ſo good paradyſe haue loue hys deuyſe place went tho gardyn gan go playenge alonge full merely god loue full haſtely vnto hym swete lokynge clepte lenger wolde ſhe kepte hys bowe golde ſhone ſo bryght hem bent anone ryght full ſone ſette ende brayde gan bende toke hym hys arowes fyue full ſharpe ready dryue nowe god ſytteth maieſte fro deedly woundes kepe yf ſo ſhete yf wyth hys arowe mete greued ſore ywys nothynge wyſt thys went vp downe full many waye folowed faſt alwaye wolde reſle tyll garden garden meaſurynge ryght euen ſquare compaſynge longe large fruyte euery tre hys charge hydous tree whych two thre wote full wele pome garnettes full great dele frute full well lyke namely folke ſyke tree great foyſon baren nuttes ſeaſon suche men nutmygges call ſwote ſauour ben wythall almandres great plente fygges many date tre yf men nede gardyn length brede eke werynge many ſpyce clowe gylofre lycorice gyngere greyne de parys canell ſetewale pry many ſpyce delytable eaten men ryſe fro table many homely tree ther peches coynes apple bere medlers plommes peeres cheſteynis cheryſe whych many one fayne note aleys bola ſene ſolas wyth many hygh laurer pyne renged clene gardyne wyth cypre wyth olyueris whych nygh plenty elmes great ſtronge maple aſhe oke aſpe plant longe fyne ewe popler lyndes fayre tree full many payre ſhulde tell ſo many tree yet ſhulde encombred er rekened euery tree theſe tree ſette deuyſe one another aſſyſe fyue fadome ſyxe trowe ſo hye great alſo kepe well ſonne croppes ſo thycke yronne euery braunche knytte full grene leues ſytte ſonne myght none dyſcende leſt tender graſſes ſhende myght men roe yſe ſquyrels full great plente bowe bowe alwaye lepynge connes alſo playenge comyn clapers ſondry colour maners maden many tourneynge vpon freſhe graſſe ſpryngynge place ſawe welles whych frogges fayre ſhadowe euery well ne nombre tell ſtremys ſmall deuyſe myrthe done come condyſe whych water rennynge gan make noyſe full lykynge aboute brynkes theſe welles ſtremes ouer elles sprange vp graſſe thycke yſet ſofte veluet whych men myght hys lemman ley fetherbed pley erthe full ſoft ſwete moyſture well wete spronge vp ſote grene gras fayre thycke myſter moche amended place therth ſuche grace floures hath plente ſomer wynter ſprange vyolet al newe freſhe peruynke ryche hewe floures yelowe whyte rede suche plente grewe neuer mede full gaye grounde queynt poudred men peynt wyth many freſhe ſondrye floure caſten vp full good ſauoure woll longe holde fable thys garden delectable mote tonge ſtynten nede ne maye wythouten drede naught tellen beaute ne halfe bounte wyth went ryght hande lefte aboute place lefte tyll garden bene efters men myght ſene thus whyle wente playe god loue folowed aye ryght hunter abyde beeſt tyll ſeeth hys tyde ſhoten goodmeſſe dere hym nedeth go nere ſo befyll reſted beſydes well vnder tree whych tree fraunce men call pyne ſyth tyme kynge pepyne ne grewe tree mannes ſyght fayre ne ſo well woxe hyght yarde ſo hygh none ſpryngynge marble ſtone nature ſet ſoth tell vnder pyne tree well border wythout wrytten ſtone letter ſmall ſayden thus ſtarfe fayre narciſus narciſus bachelere loue caught hys daungere hys nette gan hym ſo ſtrayne dyd hym ſo wepe playne nede hym muſte hys lyfe forgo fayre lady hyght echo hym loued ouer creature gan hym ſuche payne endure tyme ſhe hym tolde yf louen nolde behoued nedes dye laye none remedye natheleſſe hys beaute fyers daungerous nolde graunten aſkynge wepynge ne fayre prayenge ſhe herde hym werne ſo herte ſo great wo toke ſo great dyſpyte ſhe wythout reſpyte deed anone ere ſhe deyde full pytouſly god ſhe prayde proude herte narciſus loue ſo daungerous myght daye ben hampred ſo loue bene ſo hote wo neuer myght ioye attayne ſhulde fele euery vayne ſorowe true louers maken ben ſo vyllaynouſly forſaken thys prayer reaſonable therfore god held ferme ſtable narciſus ſhortly tell auenture came ye well reſt hym ſhadowynge daye come huntinge thys narciſus ſuffred paynes rennynge daye playnes thurſt great dyſtreſſe herte hys weryneſſe hys breth almoſt nomen wel ycomen ſhadowed braunches grene thought thylke water ſhene drynke freſhe hym well wythall downe knee gan fall forth hys necke heed ſtraught drynke well draught water anone ſene hys noſe hys mouth hys eyen ſhene therof abaſhed hys owne ſhadowe hym betraſſhed well wende forme ſe chylde great beaute well couth loue hym wreke tho daunger pryde alſo narciſus ſomtyme hym bere quyte hym well hys guerdon muſed ſo well ſhortly ſoth tell loued hys owne ſhadowe ſo laſte ſtarfe wo ſawe hys wyll myght maner waye fulfyll ſo faſte caught hym couth comforte naught loſt hys wytte ryght place deyde wythin lytell ſpace thus hys waryſon toke lady forſoke ladyes praye enſample taketh ye ayenſt loue myſtaketh yf death wyte god full well wyle quyte yt thys lettre whych tel taught yt ye welle narciſus hys beaute gan anon wythdrawe fell remembraunce hym betyde ſuche myſchaunce laſt thought ſcathleſſe full ſekerly myght vnto welle go wherof ſhulde abaſhen ſo vnto welle went downe louted ſe clere water ſtone eke grauell whych ſhone downe botome▪ ſyluer fyne welle thys fyne worlde none ſo clere hewe water euer freſhe newe welmeth vp wyth wawes bryght mountenaunce two fynger hyght aboute graſſe ſpryngynge moyſte ſo thycke well lykynge ne maye wynter dye maye ſee drye downe botome ſet ſawe two criſtall ſtones craftely thylke freſhe fayre well thynge ſothly dare tell ye woll holde great maruayle tolde wythouten fayle ſunne clere ſyght caſte welle hys bemes bryght heete dyſcended taketh criſtall ſtone ywys agayne ſonne hundred hewes blewe yelowe reed freſh new yet hath meruaylous criſtall suche ſtrength place ouer foule tree leues grene yerde ſene done vnderſtonde make enſample woll fonde ryght myrrour openly sheweth thynge ſtandeth therby well coloure fygure wythouten couerture ryght ſo criſtall ſtone ſhynynge wythouten dyſceyuynge entree yerde accuſeth hym water muſeth euer whych halfe ye ye maye well halfe gardyne ſe yf turne maye ryght wele sene remnaunt euery dele none ſo lytell thynge hydde ne cloſed wyth ſhyttynge ne ſene though paynted criſtall thys myrrour perillus whych proude narciſus sey hys fayre face bryght made hym ſyth lye vpryght ſo loketh myrrour may nothynge hys ſocour ne ſhall ſe ſomthynge ſhall hym lede laughynge full many worthy man hath yblent folke greateſt wyt ben ſoone caught wayted wythouten reſpyte ben beyted cometh folke newe rage chaungeth many wyght corage lyeth rede ne wytte therto venus ſonne dan cupido hath ſowen loue ſede helpe ne lyeth none ne rede cercleth welle aboute hys gynne hath ſet withoute right catche hys panters theſe damoſels bachelers loue wyll none byrde catche though ſet eyther nette latche ſede ſowen thys welle cleped well knowen welle loue ryght whyche hath full many wyght spoken bokes dyuerſely ſhull neuer ſo verily diſcripcion welle ne eke ſothe thys matere ye ſhull whan haue vndo crafte belongeth al way lyked dwell ſene chriſtall well ſhewed full openly thouſande thynges faſte may ſay ſory houre stode loken powre ſythen ſore ſyghed myrrour hath nowe entriked fyrſt knowen wyt vertue ſtrengthes nolde haue muſed bette ben el ſnare fell anone bytreſhed many one thylke myrrour ſawe tho amonge thouſande thynges mo roſer charged full roſis hedge aboute encloſis tho ſuche luſte enuye parys ne pauye nolde haue lefte gone ſe greateſt heape roſes whan thys rage hente caught hath many man ſhente towarde roſer gan go whan ferre therfro ſauour roſes ſwote ſmote right herte rote enbaumed yf ne endouted haue ben hated aſſayled thankes woll haue fayled pull roſe route bere myne honde aboute ſmellen went euer dredde repent leſte greued forthought lorde thylke gardyn wrought roſes great wone fayre ware neuer rone knoppes cloſe ſome ſawe ſome well better woxen ſome ben moyſon drowe nygh ſeaſon ſpedde hem faſte ſprede loue well ſuche roſes rede brode roſes open alſo ben paſſed day two knoppes wyll freſhe two dayes leeſt el thre knoppes greatly lyked fayrer may man ſe ſo myght haue one ought hym ben full lefe withall myght garlonde hem geten rycheſſe wolde leten amonges knoppes chefe one fayre remenaunt none ne preyſe halfe ſo well whan auyſe wyt ſo well enlumyned wyth colour reed wel fyned nature couthe make fayre hath leaues wel foure payre kynde hath ſet hys knowynge aboute redde roſes ſpringyng ſtalke ryſhe ryght theron ſtode knoppe vpright ye bowed vpon ſyde ſwote ſmel ſpronge ſo wyde dyed place aboute whan ſmelled ſauour ſwote wyll fro thence yet go ſomdele nere went tho take myne honde drede ne durſte roſe bede thyſtels ſharpe many maners netles thornes hoked brier moche diſtourbled ſore dradde harmed god loue bowe bent day ſet hys talent purſue ſpyen ſtondyng fygge tree whan ſawe choſen ſo ententifly bothum vnto paye ſay toke arowe ful ſharply whette hys bowe whan ſette ſtreight vp hys eere drough ſtronge bowe ſo tough ſhotte ſo wonder ſmerte myn eye vnto myn herte takel ſmote depe wente therwithal ſuch colde hente vnder clothes warme ſofte sythen day haue chyuered ofte whan hurte thus ſtounde fell downe platte vnto grounde myne hert fayled faynted aye longe tyme ſwoune laye whan came ſwounyng wytte felyng al mate wende full wele bloode haue lorne full great dele certes arowe ſtoode ne drewe droppe bloode founde woundes al drey toke myn hondes twey arowe full faſte ought plyght pullyng ſore ſyght laſte ſhafte tree drough fethers thre yet hoked heed ywis whiche beaute called gan ſo depe myne herte pace myght arace myn hert ſtyll ſtoode bledde droppe bloode bothe anguyſhous trouble peryll ſawe double nyſte ſay ne get leche woundes neyther graſſe ne rote ne helpe hope ne bote bothum euer mo myn herte drewe wo thought none thyng ben kepyng wolde haue brought lyfe agayne certes euenly dare wel ſayne ſyght onely ſauoure alegged moche langoure gan drawe towarde bothom fayre ſe loue get hym throwe another arowe hys bowe ſhote gan hym dreſſe arowes name sympleſſe whan loue gan nygh nere drowe vp withouten ſhotte wyth al hys myght thys arowe anon ryght throughout eygh founde myn herte hath made wounde anon dyd crafte drawen ſhafte therwithall ſyghed efte myn herte heed lefte whyche aye encreſed deſyre vnto bothom drowe nere euermo wo deſyre go vnto roſer grewe freſhe bothom ſo bright hewe better haue letten behoued nede ryght myne herte badde euer body muſte ladde herte wele wo force togyther muſte go neuer archer wolde fyne ſhote wyth hys pyne make hym mete thyrde arowe gan ſhete whan beſt hys tyme myght eſpye whiche named curteſye myne herte dyd auale ſwoune fell bothe deed pale longe tyme lay ſtyrred nought tyll abrayde thought faſte auyſed drawe ſhafte tree euer heed lefte behynde aught couthe pull wynde ſore ſtycked whan hytte crafte myght flytte anguyſhous full thought lefte ſuche wo wounde aye wrought ſomoned alway go towarde roſe pleſed ſo ne durſte manere bycauſe archer ſo nere euermore gladly rede brent chylde fyre hath moche drede certes yet al peyne though ſyght yet arowes reyne grounde quarels ſharpe ſteele ne payne might fele yet myght ſelfe holde fayre roſer beholde loue yaue ſuche hardyment fulfyll hys commaundement vpon fete roſe vp feble wounded man forthe gon might ſette archer nolde lette towarde roſer faſte drowe thornes ſharpe mo ynowe alſo thyſtels thicke breres brymme pricke ne myght get grace roughe thornes pace ſene freſhe roſes hewe muſte abyde thought rewe hedge ſo thycke cloſed roſes compas thyng lyked right wele ſo nyghe myght fele bothom ſwote odoure alſo ſe freſhe coloure right greatly lyked ſo nere might ſe suche ioye anon therof forgate maladye ſene ſuche delyte ſorowe angre quyte woundes thore thyng lyken myght dwellen roſer aye thence neuer paſſe awaye whan whyle thare god loue whyche ſhare myne herte wyth hys arowes kene caſteth hym yeue woundes grene ſhotte full haſtely arowe named company whyche takell full able make theſe ladyes merciable anon gan chaungen hewe greuaunce wounde newe agayne fel ſwounyng ſyghed ſore complaynyng sore complayned ſore gan greuen non hope allegeaunce nygh drowe diſperaunce rought dethe ne lyfe whether loue wolde dryfe martyr wolde make might hys power forſake whyle anger thus woke god loue arowe toke ful ſharpe pugnaunt called fayre ſemblaunt whiche wyſe wol conſent louer hym repente ſerue hys loue herte peryll may befall though thys arowe kene grounde raſour founde cutte kerue poynte god loue anoynte wyth precious oyntment somdele yeue alegement vpon woundes hade body herte made helpe ſores cure may bette endure yet thys arowe without made myne herte large ſore full great payne abode aye oyntement went abrode throughout woundes large wyde ſpredde aboute euery ſyde whoſe vertue whoſe myght myne herte ioyfull lyght ben deed ſhent precious oyntment ſhafte drowe arowe rokyng wo right wonder narowe heed whiche made ſmerte lefte behynde myne herte wyth foure dare wel ſay neuer woll take away oyntment halpe wele yet ſuche ſorowe dyd fele al day chaunged hewe woundes freſhe newe men might ſe vyſage arowes ſo ful rage varyaunt diuerſyte men • n eueryche myght ſe bothe great anoye eke ſwetneſſe ioye meynt bytterneſſe nowe eaſy wood hem felte bothe harme good nowe ſore without aleggement nowe ſoftyng wyth oyntment ſoftned pricketh thus eaſe anger togyther god loue delyuerly come lepande haſtely ſayd great iape yelde thou may eſcape may defence auayle therfore rede make daungere thou wolte yelde haſtely thou ſhalt rather haue mercy foole ſykerneſſe wyth daunger ſtoutneſſe rebelleth ſhulde pleſe ſuche folye lytell eſe meke thou muſte nedes bowe ſtryue ayen nought thy prowe come atones haue ydo woll ſo yelde debonairly anſwered full humbly gladly ſir byddyng wol yelde thyng ſeruyce woll take god defende ſhulde make ayen byddyng reſyſtence woll ſo great offence yf dyd ſkyll ye may wyth ye wyll saue ſpyll alſo ſlo fro wyſe may go lyfe dethe honde may laſte bonde playne lyſte yelde hopyng herte ſomtyme ye comforte eſe ſhull ſende el ſhortly ende withouten helthe mote aye dure yf ye take cure comforte helthe howe ſhulde haue sythe ye hurte ye ſaue helthe loue mote founde token fyrſt wounde yf ye lyſt make priſoner woll take herte wyll fully gre holy playne yelde wythout feynyng feyntyſe gouerned empryſe ſo moche price woll ben hole deuyce fulfyll lykyng repente nothyng hopyng haue yet ſome tyde mercy abyde wyth couenaunt yelde anone downe knelyng vpon kne proferyng kyſſe hys fete nothyng wolde lete ſaid loue bothe preiſe sen thyn anſwer doth eſe thou anſwered ſo curteſly wote wel vtterly thou arte gentyll thy ſpeche though man ferre wolde ſeche ſhulde fynden certayne ſuche anſwere vilayne ſuche worde ne myght nought iſſe vilayns thought thou ſhalt leſen thy ſpeche thy helpyng woll eche eke encreſen maye fyrſt woll thou obaye fully thyne auauntage anon homage ſythe kyſſe thou ſhalte mouthe whiche vilayne neuer couthe aproche ne touche ſaufe cherles ne vouche ſhall neuer neyght nere curteys fayre manere well taught full gentylnyſſe muſte ben ſhall kyſſe alſo full hygh fraunchyſe ſhall atteyne empreſe fyrſt thyng warne payne great aduerſyte mote endure eke trauayle ſhall ſerue without fayle agaynſt comforte wyth thy ſeruyce diſporte thou mayſt full glad ioyfull good mayſter haue lorde ſo hygh renoun beare loue gonfenoun curteſy banere ſelfe manere gentyll curteys meke fre euer ententyfe honoure doute ſerue alſo hym obſerue fro treſpace fro vilanye hym gouerne curteſye wyth wyll wyth entencion whan fyrſt priſon caught muſte vtterly fro thence forthe full beſyly caſte hym gentyll deſyre helpe anon without delay withouten daunger affray become hys man anone gaue hym thankes many one kneled downe wyth hondes ioynt made porte ful queynt ioye went hert rote whan kyſſed hys mouthe ſo ſwote ſuche myrthe ſuche lykyng cured languyſhyng aſked hoſtages ha • te ſayd taken fele homage one haue bene diſteyned ofte withouten wene theſe felon ful falſyte haue many ſythes begyled falſhede luſte acheued wherof repent agreued hem get daungere falſhede ſhull bye full dere loue ſay playne woll certayne ſo ſore woll nowe bynde thou away ne ſhalt wynde denyen couenaunt done auenaunt thou falſe great ruthe sythe thou ſemeſt ſo full truthe sir yf lyſt vnderſtande meruayle aſkyng thys demande wherfore ſhulde ye hoſtages borowes aſke ſykerneſſe sythe ye wot ſothfaſtneſſe ye haue ſuſpriſed ſo hole myne herte taken fro woll nothyng yf byddyng myne herte myn right nought behoueth dede thought redy worche wyll whether ſo turne good yll ſore luſteth pleſe man therof may diſeſe ye haue theron ſette ſuche iuſtyſe werreyed many wyſe yf ye doute nolde obey ye may therof make key holde wyth hoſtage nowe certes thys none outrage quod loue fully accorde body full lorde hath herte hys treſore outrage aſken aumener drough lytell key fetyſe ynough gold poliſhed cler ſaid wt key thyn hert nowe woll ſhette iowell loke knette bynde vnder lytell key wight maye cary awey key full great poſte wyth whyche anon touched vnder ſyde full ſoftely myne herte ſodaynly wythout anoye hadde ſpeered yet right nought hath deered whan hadde done wyll putte hem doute syr ſayd haue right great wyll luſte pleaſure fulfyll loke ye ſeruyce take gree thylke faythe ye owe ſaye nought recreaundyſe nought doute ſeruyce ſeruaunt traueyleth vayne ſeruen dothe hys payne vnto lorde whyche wyſe conne hym thanke hys ſeruyce loue ſayd diſmay nought syth thou ſocour haſte ſought thāke thy ſeruice wol take high degree woll make wyckedneſſe ne hynder hoope ſhall nought worſhyppe wyght auenture maye come yf payne endure abyde ſuffre thy diſtreſſe hurteth nowe ſhall leſſe wotte ſelfe maye ſaue medicyne thou woldeſt haue yf thy trouthe thou kepe ſhall vnto thyne helpyng eke cure thy woundes make hem clene ſo olde grene thou ſhalte holpen wordes fewe certaynly thou ſhalte well ſhewe thou ſerueſt good wyll accomplyſhen fulfyll commaundementes daye nyght whyche louers yeue right ah ſyr goddes loue ſayd er ye paſſe hen ententyfely commaundemētes ye ſay ſhall kepe hem yf may hem kepen thought yf ſo wote hem nought maye vnwyttingly wherfore praye entierly wyth myne herte lere treſpace manere god loue charged anone ye ſhall ſe worde worde right empryſe romaunt ſhall deuyſe maiſter leſeth hys tyme lere whan diſciple woll nat vayne hym ſwynke hys lernynge woll nat thynke ſo luſte loue lette hym entende nowe romance begynneth amēde nowe good faye canne ſaye poynt reaſon sette gate ywis ſhall nat well thyng brought good vnderſtondyng reder poynteth yll good ſentence maye ofte ſpyl boke good endyng made newe luſty thyng ſo woll endyng crafte loue ſhall nowe lere woll ſo longe abyde tyll thys romance maye vahyde vndo ſygnyfiaunce thys dreme romaunce ſothfaſtneſſe nowe hydde without couerture ſhall kydde whan vndone haue thys dremyng wherin worde leaſyng villany begynnyng woll ſaye loue ouer thyng thou leaue yf thou wolte falſe treſpace ayenſt curſe blame generally hem louen villany villany maketh villeyne hys dedes chorle ſeyne theſe villayns arne without pyte frendſhyp loue bounte nyll receyue vnto ſeruyce hem ben villayns empriſe vnderſtonde thyne entent thys myne entendement clepe wight age onely gentyll hys lynages ſo vertuous hys porte outragyous whan ſuche one thou ſeeſt beforne though gentyll borne thou mayſte well ſeyne thys ſothe gentyll bycauſe dothe longeth gentylman hem none deme certaynly withouten drede chorle demed hys dede hye lowe ye may ſe kynrede ne ſay nought none yuell wyll thyng holden ſtyll worſhyp miſſey thou mayſte enſample take key ſomtyme miſſayeng hated bothe olde yonge ferre gaw • yn worthy preyſed hys curteſye kaye hated fell worde diſpytous cruell wherfore wyſe aqueyntable goodly worde reſonable bothe leſſe eke mare whan thou comeſt men loke thou haue cuſtome aye fyrſt ſalue hem yf thou maye yf fall hem ſomme salue fyrſt domme quyte hem curteſly anon wythout abydyng er gon nothyng eke thy tonge applye ſpeke wordes rybaudrye villayne ſpeche degre late neuer thy lyppe vnbounden nought holde hym good faythe curteys foule wordes ſaythe woman ſerue preyſe thy power honour reyſe yf miſſayere diſpiſe woman thou mayſt blame byde hym holde ſtyll ſette thy myght thy wyll woman ladyes pleaſe thynge may hem eaſe euer ſpeke good ſo thou mayſt beſt prayſed loke fro pride thou kepe wele thou mayſt perceyue fele pride bothe foly ſynne pryde hath wythin ne may hys herte wyſe meken ne ſouplen ſeruyce pride founde euery parte contrarye vnto loues arte loueth trewly shulde hym conteyne iolyly wythout pride ſondrie wyſe hym diſgyſen queyntyſe queynte aray wythout drede nothyng proude taketh hede freſhe aray men may ſe wythout pride may ofte mayntayne thy ſelfe thy rent robe eke garment many ſyth fayre clothyng man amendeth much thyng loke alwaye ſhape garment thou ſhalte make hym beſte wythall parteyneth therto poyntes ſleues wel ſyttande ryght ſtreyght hande ſhone bootes newe fayre loke leeſt thou haue payre ſytte ſo fetouſly theſe rude may vtterly meruayle ſyth ſytte ſo playne howe come agayne weare ſtrayte gloues wyth aumere ſylke alway wyth good chere thou gyue yf thou haue rycheſſe yf thou haue naught ſpende leſſe alwaye mery yf thou may waſt thy good alway haue hatte floures freſhe may chapelet roſes whytſondaye ſuche araye ne coſtneth lyte thine handes waſhe thy teeth make white let fylth vpon thy nayles blacke yf thou mayſt ſe voyde awaye delyuerly kembe thyne heed ryght iolyly farce thy viſage wyſe loue thempryſe loue doth haten fynde beaute cometh nat kynde alwaye hert rede glad mery ioyfull thou loue hath ioye ſorowful man yuel ful curteſy knoweth hys malady euer loue ſyckneſſe meynte wyth ſwete bytterneſſe ſore loue maruaylous nowe louer ioyous nowe playne nowe grone nowe ſyngen nowe maken mone day playneth heuyneſſe morowe playneth iolyneſſe lyfe loue ful contrarye whyche ſtoundemeale ofte varye yf thou canſt myrthes make men gre wol gladly take goodly commaunde men ſhulde ſo euer thynge hem ſyttynge therof commeth good loo pris wherof thou vertuous ne ſtraunge ne daungerous yf thou good ryder prycke gladly men may ſe armes alſo yf thou come purſue tyl thou name haſte wonne yf thy voice fayre clere thou ſhalt maken greate daungere whan ſynge goodly pray thy worſhyp abey alſo longeth aye harpe gyterne daunce playe yf wel fote daunce maye hym greatly auaunce amonge eke thy lady ſake songes complayntes thou make wol meuen hete whan reden thy ſmerte loke man ſcarce holde may greue manyfolde reſon wol louer gyftes large fre chorles louyng therof thyng ſhal lefe aye yeue londes lore ſo wolde leue ſodayne ſyght kyſſyng anon ryght yaue hole herte wyl thought hym ſelfe kepeth right nought ſwyfte good reaſon yeue good abandon nowe woll reherce haue ſayde verce ſentence wordes fewe compendouſly thou mayſte better hem thynke whether ſo thou wake wynke wordes lytel greue man kepe whan breue ſo loue wol gon ryde mote curteyes voyde pryde mery full iolyte largeſſe loſed firſt ioyne penaunce euer without repentaunce thou ſet thy thought thy louyng laſt without repentyng thynke vpon thy myrthes ſwete ſhal folowe whan ye mete thou trew loue ſhalt wyl cōmaunde one place thou ſet al hole thyne hert wythout halfen dole trechery ſykerneſſe loued neuer doubleneſſe many hert wol depart eueryche ſhal haue lytel parte hym drede right nought one place ſetteth thought therfore place ſette lette neuer then flette thou yeueſt lenyng holde wreched thyng therfore yeue hole quyte thou ſhalt haue meryte lent ſoone bounte thanke done loue free yeuen thyng requireth great guerdonyng yeue yeft al quyte fully make thy gyfte debonairly men yefte holde dere yeuen wyth gladſome chere gyfte nought prayſen man yeueth maugre whan thou haſte yenen thyne hert haue ſayd openly auentures ſhall fall whych harde heuy bene wyth oft whan thou bethynkeſt thy louynge ſo thou folke thou muſt depart hye none perceyue thy malady hyde thyne harme thou muſt alone go forth ſole make thy mone thou ſhalt whyle ſtate whylom colde whylom hate nowe reed roſe yelowe fade ſorowe trowe thou neuer hade cotidien ne quarteyne nat ſo full peyne often tymes ſhall fall loue amonge thy paynes thou thy ſelfe al holy foryeten ſhalt ſo vtterly many tymes thou ſhalt styl ymage tree dome ſtone wythout ſteryng fote hande wythout ſpekyng ſone al thy payne memorye ſhalt thou come agayne man abaſhed wonder ſore ſyghen wytte thou wele wythouten wene ſuch eſtate ful ofte haue bene haue yuel loue aſſayde wher thou arte ſo diſmayde thought ſhal take ſo thy loue ferre fro thou ſhalte ſaye god maye thys ne may lady ſe myne hert alone go abyde al ſole wo departed fro myne owne thought wyth myne eyen ſe ryght nought ala myne eyen ſene ne may carefull hert conuay myne hertes gyde prayſe nothyng euer ſe shulde abyde nay gone viſiten wythout delay myne herte deſyreth ſo certaynly yf go foole ſelfe may wel holde whan ne ſe myne hert wolde wherfore wol gone ſene eaſed ſhal neuer bene haue ſome tokenyng goſt thou forth wythout dwelling oft thou fayleſt thy deſyre er thou mayſt come nere waſteſt vayne thy paſſage falleſt thou newe rage want ſyght thou gynneſt mourne homewarde penſyfe thou doſt returne greate miſchefe ſhalt thou agayne ſhall come syghes playntes wyth newe wo itchynge prycketh ſo wote nought may go lere hem byen loue ſo dere thyng thyne herte appeſen maye ofte thou wolt gone aſſaye thou mayſt ſene auenture thy lyues ioye thyne hertes cure grace yf thou myght attayne haue ſyght ſhalt thou done none dede wyth ſyght thyne eyen fede fayre freſhe whan thou mayſt ſe thyne herte ſhal ſo rauyſhed neuer thou woldeſte thy thankes lete ne remoue ſe ſwete thou ſeeſt ſothfaſtneſſe thou couyteſt ſwetneſſe thyne hert brenneth fyre thyne hert deſyre conſydreth euerydele may lykened wonder wele payne loue vnto fere euermore thou neygheſt nere thought ſo ſoth tel hotter euer ſhalt thou brenne experience ſhal kenne ſo comeſt coſte next fyre brenneth moſte yet forſoth al thyne hete thoughe thou loue ſwelte ſwete ne thynge thou felen maye thou ſhalt wyllen paſſe awaye though thou go yet muſt nede thynke al day fayre hede thou behelde wyth ſo good wyll holde thy ſelfe begyled yll thou ne haddeſt none hardyment ſhewe ought thyne entent thyne hert full ſore thou wolte diſpiſe eke repreue cowardyſe thou ſo dull euery thyng dome drede wythout ſpekyng thou ſhalt eke thynke thou dydeſt folye thou ſo faſt bye durſt auntre ſay thyng er thou come away thou haddeſte wonne ſpeke whan thou begonne yet ſhe wolde thy ſake armes goodly haue take ſhuld haue bene worth treaſour great plente thus ſhalte thou mourne eke cōplayne get encheſon gone agayne vnto thy walke thy place thou behelde fleſhely face neuer falſe ſuſpection thou woldoſt fynde occaſion thou gone vnto houſe arte thou deſyrouſe ſyght haue thou thyne honour myghteſt ſaue erande myghteſt make thyder thy loues ſake ful fayne thou woldeſt drede thou goeſt leeſt men take hede wherfore rede thy goyng alſo thyne agayne commyng thou wel ware men ne wyt feyne cauſe go waye faſt bye heale wel folye yf ſo happe thou thy loue mayſt ſe ſeker wyſe thou ſalewe wherwyth thy colour wol tranſmewe eke thy bloude ſhall quake thy hewe eke chaungen ſake worde wytte wyth chere full pale shal wante tell thy tale yf thou mayſt ſo ferforth wynne thou reaſon durſt begynne woldeſt ſayne thre thynges mo thou ſhalt ful ſcarſly ſayne two though thou bethynke neuer ſo wele thou ſhalt foryete yet ſomdele bvt yf thou deale wyth trecherye falſe louers mowe folye saine luſt wtoutē drede ſo double falſhede herte thynke thynge ſayne another ſpekynge whan thy ſpeche ended ryght thus ſhall befall worde come mynde thou ſaye haſte lefte behynde thou ſhalt brenne great martyre thou ſhalt brenne fyre thys ſtryfe eke affraye batell laſteth aye thys bargayne ende maye neuer take yf ſhe thy peace wyll make whan nyght comen anon thouſande angres ſhall come apon bedde faſte thou wolte dyght thou ſhalt haue ſmall delyght whan thou weneſt ſlepe full payne ſhalte thou crepe sterte thy bedde aboute full wyde turne full often euery ſyde nowe downwarde groſſe nowe vpright walowe wo longe nyght thyn armes ſhalte thou ſprede brede man werre forwerede ſhall come remembraunce ſhappe ſemblaunce wherto none maye pere wete thou well wythout ſhall ſe ſomtyme nyght thou haſte ſo bryght naked betwene thyne armes ſothfaſtneſſe though thou ſhalte make caſtels spayne dreme ioye al vayne delyten ryght nought whyle thou ſo ſlombreſt thought ſo ſwete delytable whyche ſoth ny fable ne ſhall whyle laſte ſhalte thou ſyghe wepe faſte ſaye dere god thynge dreme turned amys whyche ful ſwete apparent nowe wake ſhent nowe yede thys mery thought away twenty tymes vpon day wolde thys thought wolde come agayne alegeth well payne maketh full ioyefull thought ſleeth laſteth nought ah lorde nyll ye ſocoure ioye trowe langoure deth wolde ſhulde ſlo whyle lye armes two myne harme harde wythouten wene great vneaſe full ofte mene bvt wolde loue ſo myght haue fully ioye ſo bryght payne quitte richly ala greate thynge aſke folye wronge wenyng aſke ſo outragious thyng ſo aſketh folyly mote warned haſtely ne wote maye ſay ſo ferre way wolde haue full great lykyng full greate ioye laſſe thyng wolde ſhe gentylneſſe withouten one keſſe greate guerdon relece al paſſion harde come therto foly hygh haue myne herte ſette maye comforte gette wote ſaye wel nought thys wote well thought thet better alone ſtynte wo mone loke caſt goodly haue vtterly hole play ah lorde ſhal byde day euer ſhe ſhal lady full cured maye ſe god whan ſhall dawnyng ſprynge lyggen thus angry thynge haue ioye thus lye whan loue bye man lyen hath great diſeſe whyche may ſlepe ne reſt eſe wolde dawed day nyght went away daye wolde vp ryſe ah ſlowe ſunne ſhewe thyne enpriſe spede ſprede thy beemes bryght chace derkeneſſe nyght put away ſtoundes ſtronge whych laſten al longe nyght ſhalte thou contynue ſo wythout reſt payne wo yf euer thou knewe loue diſtreſſe thou ſhall mowe lerne ſickeneſſe thus endurynge ſhalte thou lye ryſe morowe vp erly thy bedde harneys er euer dawnyng thou mayſt ſe al priuely ſhalte thou gone whyder thy ſelfe alone reyne hayle ſnowe ſlete thyder ſhe dwelleth ſo ſwete whiche may fall ſlepe thynketh lytle vpon ſhalte thou go ful foule aferde loke yf gate vnſperde wayte wythout wo payne ful yuel coulde wynde rayne ſhalt thou go dore thou mayſt fynde ſhore hole refte euer ſhalte thou ſtoupe laye eer • wythin ſlepe meane al ſaue thy lady free wakynge yf thou mayſt aſpye go put thy ſelfe inpardye aſke grace bymene ſhe may wete wythout wene thou nyght reſte haſte ſore thou beſtad woman well ought pytie take hem ſorowen ſake loke loue relyke thou thynke none lyke whan thou haſt ſo great annoy shal kyſſe er thou go awey holde ful great deynte man ſhal ſe houſe ne way loke thou begone agayne er day commyng ſuch goyng heuyneſſe ſuch walkyng maketh louers wythouten wene vnder clothes pale lene loue leaueth coloure ne cleerneſſe loueth trewe hath fatneſſe thou ſhalt well thy ſelfe ſe thou muſt nedes aſſayed men ſhape hem way falſely ladyes betray wonder though fatte wyth falſe othes loues gatte ofte ſe ſuche loſengeours fatter abottes priours yet wyth thynge charge ſaye thou large vnto mayde doth ſerue beſt thanke thou ſhalt deſerue yeue gyftes get grace ſo thou may thanke purchace ſhe worthy holde fre thy lady al may ſe alſo ſeruauntes worſhyp aye pleaſe much thou maye great good hem maye come bycauſe wyth bene priue ſhal tell howe fande curreys wyſe wel doande ſhe ſhal preyſe wel loke lande thou fore yf ſuch cauſe thou haue behoueth gone countre leaue hole thyne hert hoſtage tyl thou agayne make thy paſſage thynke longe ſe ſwete thyng hath thyne herte kepyng nowe haue tolde wyſe louer ſhal ſeruice yf thou wolte haue mede thou craue whan loue al thys boden ſayd hym ſir howe may louers may ſuch manere endure ye paine ye haue ſaid meruayle wonder faſte howe man may lyue laſte ſuch payne ſuch brennyng ſorowe thought ſuch ſyghyng aye vnreleſed wo make whether ſo ſlepe wake ſuch anoy continually helpe god meruayle howe man made ſtele myght lyue month ſuch paynes fele god loue ſayde frende fayth owe may man haue good bye man lyueth tenderlye thyng hath bought moſte dere wete thou well wythout thanke thinge taken whych man hath ſuffred ſore certes wo ne may attayne vnto ſore loues payne none yuell therto ne may amounte man counte droppes water drye wel greate ſee thou myghteſt harmes tell hem wyth loue dwell ſeruice peyne hem ſleeth eche man wolde flye deth trowe ſhulde neuer eſcape nere hope couthe hem make glad man priſon ſete may getten ete barlye breed water pure lyeth vermyn ordure wyth thys yet lyue good hope ſuch comforte hath hym yeue whiche maketh wene ſhall delyuered come liberte fortune full truſt though lye ſtrawe duſt hope hys ſuſtaynyng ſo louers wenyng loue hath ſhytte hys priſoun good hope ſaluatioun good hope howe ſore ſmerte yeueth hem wyll herte profer bodye martyre hope ſo ſore doth hem deſyre ſuffre eche harme men deuyſe ioye afterwarde ſhall aryſe hope deſyre catche victorye hope loue glorye hope ye loue maye yeue nere hope ſhulde lēger lyue bleſſed hope whych deſyre auaunceth louers ſuch manyre good hope curteyſe pleaſe kepe louers diſeaſe hope kepeth hys lande woll abyde peryll maye betyde hope louers mooſt chefe doth hem endure miſchefe hope helpe whan myſter ſhall yeue eke ywys thre thynges greate ſolace doth hem lace fyrſte good maye founde hem lace bounde ſwete thought recorde thynge wherwyth thou canſt accorde beſt thyne herte ſhe thynkyng abſence good whan louer doth complayne lyueth diſtreſſe payne ſwete thought ſhall come blyue awaye hys angre dryue maketh louers haue remembraunce comforte hygh pleaſaunce hope hathe hyght wynne thought anone ſhall begynne ferre god wotte fynde make myrrour hys mynde beholde wol lette perſon ſhall afore hym ſette laughyng eyen perſaunt clere ſhappe forme goodly chere mouth ſo gratious ſwete eke ſo ſauerous feyters ſhall take hede eyen wyth lymmes fede thus ſwete thynkynge ſhall aſwage paynes louers rage thy ioye ſhall double wythout geſſe whan thou thynkeſt ſymelyneſſe laughyng chere made thy lady dere thys comforte woll thou take yf nexte thou wolte forſake whiche leſſe ſauerous thou ſhuldeſt bene daungerous ſeconde ſhall ſwete ſpeche hathe manye leche brynge hem oute wo helpe manye bachelere many lady ſent ſuccour haue loued paramour ſpekynge whan myght louers hem ſo dere voydeth al ſmerte whiche cloſed herte herte maketh hem glad lyght speche whan mowe haue ſyght therfore cōmeth mynde olde dayes fynde clerkes wryten knewe ther lady freſh hewe loue made ſonge hym remembre amonge ſhe ſayd whan speken hym ſo dere voydeth ſmerte wy ſytteth ſo nere herte ſpeake hym eue morowe cureth ſorowe none ſo hygh pleaſaunce perſon dalyaunce wyſt ful wel ſwete ſpeakyng comforteth full moche thynge loue ſhe full well aſſayde hym ſhe full well apayde ſpeke hym ioye ſet therfore rede thou get felowe wel concele kepe thy counſayle wel hele whome go ſhewe holly thyne hert well wo ioye ſmerte get comfort hym thou go priuyly bytwene two ye ſhall ſpeake goodly thyng hath thyne hert kepynge beautie ſemblaunce goodly countenaunce al thy ſtate thou ſhalt hym ſay aſke hym counſayle thou maye thyng may pleſe ſhall great eſe may wete thou truſt hym ſo bothe thy wele thy wo yf het loue ſet company moche bet reſon wyll ſhewe vtterly priuitie ſhe loueth ſo playnly ſhall vndo without drede ſhame bothe tell renome name ſhall farther ferre nere namely thy lady dere ſyker wyſe yea euery shall helpen owne brother trouth without doubleneſſe kepen cloſe ſykerneſſe noble thynge fay haue man thou darſt ſay thy priuy counſayle euery dele wyll comfort ryght wele thou ſhalt holde wel apayed whan ſuche frende thou haſt aſſayed thyrde good greate comforte yeueth louers moſt diſporte commeth ſyght beholdynge cleped ſwete lokyng maye none eſe whan thou art ferre thy lady fro wherfore thou preſe alway place thou mayeſt ſe thyng mooſt amerous mooſt delytable fauerous aſwage man ſorowe ſene lady morowe full noble thynge whan thyne eyen haue metyng relyke precyous wherof ſo deſyrous daye ſoth haue drede faren amys dreden neyther wynde ne rayne ne non maner payne thyne eyen thus blyſſe yet curteſye ywys alone haue ioye hert conuoye parte blyſſe hym thou ſende harme make ende eye good meſſangere hert ſuche manere tydynges ſende hath ſene voyde hym paynes clene wherof hert reioyſeth ſo great partye wo voyded put awaye flyght ryght darkeneſſe nyght chaſed clereneſſe mone ryght ſo al wo full ſoone deuoyded clene whan ſyght beholden may freſh wyght herte deſyreth ſo darkneſſe ago hert eaſe whan ſene hem pleaſe haue declared thou drede dout haue tolde faythfully may curen vtterly louers wol faythfull full ſtabylitie good hope alway kepe thy ſyde ſwete thought make eke abyde swete lokyng ſwete ſpeche thyne harmes ſhalbe leche euery thou ſhalt haue great pleaſaunce yf thou canſt byde ſuffraunce ſerue well without fayntyſe thou ſhalt quyte thyne empryſe guerdoun yf thou lyue tyme yeue god loue whan al daye taught ye haue herde ſaye enfourmed compendouſly vanyſhed away ſodaynly alone left ſole full complaynt dole ſawe noman woundes greued wonderſly curen nothyng knewe saue bothom bryght hewe wheron ſet holly thought comfort knewe nought god loue knewe ele behoue myght eaſe comfort gete yf wolde hym entermete roſer withouten dout cloſed hedge without ye toforne haue herde ſayne faſt buſyed wolde fayne haue paſſed haye yf myght haue getten ſleyght vnto bothom ſo fayre ſe euer drad blamed men wolde haue ſuſpectioun wolde ententioun haue ſtole roſes therfore entre fere laſt bethought whether ſhulde paſſe nought ſawe come glad chere luſtye bachelere good ſtature good height bialacoil forſoth hight sonne curteſy graunted full gladly paſſage vtter hay ſayde ſyr ye maye paſſe yf wyll freſh roſer ſe ye ſwete ſauour fele warrans may ryght wele thou kepe fro foly shal man vylany yf may helpe ought ſhall fayne dredeth nought bounde ſeruyſe fully deuoyde feyntyſe vnto bialacoil ſayd thanke ſyr full hertely beheſt take gre ye ſo goodly proffer cōmeth great fraunchyſe ye profe ſeruyſe full delyuerly breers anon went whereof encombred haye well pleſed ſoth ſaye ſe bothom fayre ſwote freſh ſpronge rote bialacoil ſerued wele whan ſo nygh myght fele bothome ſwete odour ſo luſty hewed colour churle foule hym betyde beſyde roſes gan hym hyde kepe roſes roſere whome name daungere churle hyd greues couered graſſe leues ſpye take fonde vnto roſer put honde fole mo hym two wicked maners euyl fame one cleped name wycked tonge god yeue hym ſorowe neyther eue ne morowe man good ſpeake many iuſt man doth wreke woman eke hyght shame reken ryght treſpaſſe father name mother reaſon thus ſhame brought theſe ylke two yet treſpaſſe neuer ado reſon ne neuer laye ſo hydous ſo vgly meane treſpaſſe hyght reaſon conceyueth ſyght shame ſpake aforne whan ſhame borne ordayned chaſtitie shulde roſer lady bothoms la ſondrye folke aſſayled ſhe ne wyſt venus aſſayleth ſo nyght day ſhe ſtal bothoms roſes ouer reaſon prayeth chaſtitie venus hath flemed ouer ſee ſhe doughter wolde leue kepe roſer freſh grene anon reaſon chaſtitie fully aſſented graunted requeſt ſhame bycauſe ſhe honeſt shal keper roſer thus kepe thre none ſhulde hardy ne bolde yonge olde agayne wyll away bere bothoms ne roſes well ſped nat bene awayted theſe thre ſene bialacoil ſo fayre gratious debonayre quytte hym full curteſly pleaſe bad shulde drawe bothom nere preſe touche roſere bare roſes yafe leue graunt ne myght lytle greue ſawe lyked ryght nygh bothom pulled leafe al grene yaue full nygh bothom ſat made leafe ful queynt felte acquaynt bialacoil ſo pryue wende wyll wext hardy tell bialacoil befell loue toke wounded ſayd ſyr ſo mote maye ioye haue wyſe vpon ſyde ryſe ſyth yf ſhall feyne hert haue ſo great peyne great anoy ſuche affray ne wot ſhall ſaye drede wrath deſerue leuer knyues kerue body ſhulde peces ſmall wyſe ſhulde fall ye wrathed ſhulde ben saye boldly thy wyll quod nyl wroth yf maye nought thou ſhalt ſaye ſayde ſyr diſpleaſe knowen greate vneaſe whiche onelye loue hath brought paynes greate diſeſe thought fro day day doth drye suppoſeth ſyr lye fyue woundes dyd make ſore ſhall neuer ſlake ye bothom graunt mooſt paſſaunt beautie lyfe deth martyre treaſour mooſt deſyre bialacoil affrayed sayd ſyr may fall ye deſyre maye aryſe wolde ye ſhende wyſe mokel foole yf ſuffred away bere freſh bothom ſo fayre ſyght neyther ſkyll ne ryght roſer ye broke rynde take roſe aforne kynde ye curteys aſke let ſtyll roſer ſyt let growe tyl amended parfetly come beautie nolde pulled fro roſer bere ſo lefe dere anon ſtert daunger place hydde malyce chere kydde full great blacke hewe sturdy hydous whoſo hym knewe lyke ſharpe vrchons heer growe eye red ſparklyng fyre glowe noſe frounced full kyrked ſtode come cryande wood ſayd bialacoil tell thou bryngeſt hyther ſo boldly hym ſo nygh roſere thou worcheſt wronge manere thynketh diſhonour thou art well worthy haue maugre let hym roſere wytte ſerueth felon euyll quytte thou woldeſt haue done great bountie ſhame wolde quyte flye hence felowe rede go wanteth lytle wol ſlo bialacoil ne knewe nought whan ſerue ſet thought thou wolt ſhame hym yf thou myght agayne reaſon ryght woll nomore affye comeſt ſo ſlyghly teſpye proueth wonder wele thy ſleyght trayſon euery dele durſt nomore make abode churle ſo wode gan thret manace hay dyd chace feare hym trymbled quoke churlyſhly heed ſhoke ſayd yf eft myght take ſhulde hondes ſcape bialacoil fled mate ſole diſconſolate left alone payne thought ſhame death nygh brought thought hygh folly body vtterly yeue payne martyre therto hadde ſo great yre ne durſt hayes paſſe hope grace trowe neuer man wyſt payne laced loues chayne ne man ſoth yf loue angre loue holdeth heeſt ryght wele whan payne ſayd ſhulde fele hert may thynke ne tonge ſayne quarter wo payne myght angre laſt myne hert poynt braſt whan thought roſe ſo daunger caſt fro longe whyle ſtode ſtate tyll ſawe ſo mad mate lady hygh warde tower loked thytherwarde reaſon men clepe lady tower delyuerly come downe without ſhe neyther yonge ne hore ne hygh ne lowe ne fat ne lene beſt mene eyen two clere lyght candel brenneth bryght heed ſhe crowne ſemed well hygh perſon rounde enuyron crownet full ryche ſtones fret goodly ſemblaunt deuyſe trowe made paradyſe nature neuer ſuche grace forge werke ſuche compaſſe certeyne yf letter lye god hym ſelfe ſo hye made ymage yaue ſythe ſuche auauntage ſhe hath myght ſegnorie kepe men folly ſo woll trowe lore ne may offenden neuermore whyle ſtode darke pale reaſon began tale ſayde alhayle ſwete frende foly chyldhode wyll ſhende haue put great affraye thou haſt bought dere tyme maye made thyne herte mery euyll tyme thou wenteſt ſe garden wherof ydleneſſe bare keye maſtreſſe whan thou yedeſt daunce acquayntaunce acquayntaunce peryllous fyrſt ſoft noyous hath traſſhed without wene god loue nat ſene ne ydleneſſe conueyde verger myrth hym pleyde yf follye haue ſuppryſed ſo recouered welware take nomore counſayle greueth ſore wyſe wyll hym ſelfe chaſtyſe though yonge man wyſe treſpaſſe amonge folly let hym tary haſtely let hym amende whatſo mys eke counſayle ywis god loue holly foryet hath ſuche payne ſet hert turmented ſo ſene thou muſt go wayes garyſoun daunger ſo feloun felly purpoſeth werrey full cruell ſoth ſey yet daunger commeth blame rewarde doughter shame hath ye roſes ward ſhe maye muſarde wycked tonge theſe two ſuffreth man thyther go er thyng ſhal cometh ouer fourty place yf ſought say thing neuer ne wrought moche trayſon male falſneſſe ſayne tale thou deleſt angry folke ywys wherfore better theſe folke awaye fare wol make lyue care euyll loue call wherin foly loue folly euery dell loueth nowyſe maye well ne ſetteth though good werke ſchole leſeth yf clerke craft eke yf ſhall thryue therin loue ſhall haue paſſyoun monke hermyte chanoun payne herde meſure ioye maye eke whyle endure poſſeſſyoun moche tribulatioun ioye ſo ſhort laſtyng happe gettyng ſe many trauayle laſt foule fayle nothyng thy counſayler whan thou made homager god loue haſtely wyſdom folly thyne hert ioly ſage whan thou brought ſuche rage yelde ſo redely loue great mayſtry rede loue awaye dryue maketh retche thy lyue folly fro day day shall growe thou put awaye take thy teeth brydle faſt daunt thyne hert eke caſt yf thou mayeſt get defence redreſſe thy fyrſt offence whoſo hert alway wol leue shall fynde amonge ſhal hym greue whan herde thus chaſtyſe anſwered full angry wyſe prayed ceſſe ſpeche eyther chaſtyſe teche byd thought refreyne loue hath caught demeyne wene ye loue woll conſent aſſayleth bowe bent drawe myne hert honde ſo quyckly bonde ye counſayle may neuer fyrſt areſted toke myne hert ſo ſore hym tyll nothyng wyll thought ſo hym obey ſparred key praye let ſtyll ye may well yf ye wyll wordes waſte ydleneſſe vtterly wit houten geſſe al ye ſayne vayne leuer dye payne loue mewarde ſhulde arette falſhed treſon ſette wyll get pryſe blame loue true ſaue name chaſteſeth hym hate worde reſon went gate whan ſhe ſawe ſermonyng myght fro foly brynge diſmayed left ſole forwery forwandred fole ne knewe cheryſaunce fell remembraunce loue bade puruey felowe myght ſey counſel priuytie ſhulde moche auayle bethought felowe faſt true ſyker curteys hende called name frende trewer felowe non haſte hym went anon hym wo tolde hym ryght nought wold witholde tolde hym without made compleynt daungere nowe ſe hydous mewarde contrarious crueltie poynt haue meymed bialacoil whan heme ſey within garden walke pley fro made hym go beleſte alone wo durſt lenger hym ſpeke daunger ſayd wolde wreke whan ſawe howe went freſh bothom hent yf hardy come nere bytwene hay roſere frend wyſt thought diſcomforted ryght nought ſayd felow ſo mad ne ſo abaſhed beſtad ſelfe knowe full well daungere howe fers chere prime temp loue manace full oft haue bene caſe felon fyrſt though thou ſhalt hym ſouple ſe longe paſſed knewe hym wele vngoodly fyrſt though men hym fele woll meke bearynge ben ſeruyce obeyſynge ſhal tell thou ſhalt mekely rede thou go hym herte praye hym ſpecyally thy treſpace haue mercy hote hym well pleſe thou ſhalt neuer hym diſpleſe beſt ſerue flatery shall pleaſe daunger moſt vtterly frende hath ſayd ſo wele eaſed hath ſomdele eke alegged turment hym hardement agayne daunger go preue myght meke hym ſo daunger came aſſhamed whiche aforne blamed deſyrynge peaſe woo ouer hedge durſt go forbode paſſage founde hym cruell rage honde great burdowne hym kneled lowe adowne full meke porte ſymple chere ſayde ſyr comen onely aſke mercy greueth full greatly euer lyfe wrathed amenden come myght loude ſtyl done ryght owne wyll loue made haue treſpaſſed hytherto fro ne maye withdrawe myne herte yet ſhall neuer ioye ne ſmert ſo befall good yll offende agayne wyll leuer haue endure diſeaſe ſhulde diſpleaſe requyre pray ye haue mercy pytye ſtint yre greueth ſo wol ſwere euer mo redreſſed lykyng yf treſpaſſe thynge saue praye graunt thyng may warned maye loue onely none thynge aſke ſhall done well ywis yf grace ye graunt thys ye maye nat letten well wote ye loue free ſhall louen ſuche wyll euer lyke well yll yet ne wolde fraunce thynge diſpleſaunce daungere fyll hys entent foryeue hys male talent hys wrathe yet laſt hath releaſed prayde ſo faſt shortely ſayd thy requeſt nat mokell diſhoneſt ne woll nat werne yet nothynge engreueth though thou loue thus euermore neyther ſofte ne ſore loue lyſt retcheth ferre fro roſes truſt nat none aſſaye tyme paſſe haye thus hath graunted prayere went forthe withouten vnto frende tolde hym whyche right ioyfull tale ſayd nowe gothe well thyne affayre 〈◊〉 ſhall debonayre though aforne diſpitous ſhall herafter gratious touched ſome good veyne ſhulde yet rewen thy peyne suffer rede booſt make tyll thou good me mayſt hym take ſufferaunce wordes ſofte man maye ouercome ofte hym aforne drede bokes ſothely rede thus hath frende great comforte auaunced wyth hygh diſporte whyche wolde good moche anone full ſodainly toke leaue ſtreight went vnto haye great talent hadde ſene freſhe bothom wherin laye ſaluatioun daungere kepe yf kepe hym couenaunt trewly ſore dradde hys manaſyng durſte nat breke hys byddyng leſt hym ſhent brake nat hys commaundement purchaſe hys good wyll come tyll hys mercy ferre behynde kepte ne myght fynde complayned ſighed ſore languyſhed euermore durſt nat ouer go vnto roſe loued ſo throughout demyng vtterly knowlege certaynly loue ladde ſuche wyſe fentyſe falſheed ne trechery yet full villany diſdayne cruelte ne wolde haue pyte hys cruel wyll refrayne tho wepte alwaye complayne thys tourment come grace god ſent fraunchyſe pyte fulfylde bothom bounte go daungere anon ryght forther wyth myght helpe worde dede well ſawe nede fyrſt grace dame fraunchyſe hath taken thys empryſe ſayd daungere great wronge ye worche thys man ſo moche wo pynen hym ſo angerly great villany canne nat ſe ne hath treſpaſſed agayne saue loueth wherfore ye ſhulde cherete hym holde force loue maketh hym thys wolde hym blame dyd amys lefeth ye maye hys payne harde ye maye ſe lo loue wyſe wolde conſent ye haue power repent though quicke ye wolde hym ſlo fro loue hys herte may nat go nowe ſwete ſyr eaſe hym angre diſeaſe ala maye auaunce done hym ſo great greuaunce worſhyppe agayne hym take man werre make sithe ſo lowly euery wyſe redy ye luſte deuyſe loue haue caught hym hys lace bey euery caas ben ſubiecte wyll shulde ye therfore wyllen hym yll ye ſhulde hym ſpare hym bothe proude ſtout curteſy woll ye ſocure hem ben meke vnder cure hys hert harde woll nat meke whan men mekeneſſe hym beſeke thys certayne ſayd pyte ſe ofte humylyte bothe yre alſo felony venquyſheth alſo melancoly ſtonde forthe ſuche dureſſe thys cruelte wyckedneſſe wherfore pray ſir daungere mayntene lenger suche cruell werre agayne man holly euer ye worchen wo vpon thys caytife languyſheth ſo whyche woll treſpace put hym holly grace hys offence ne lyte god loue wyte thrall ſo greatly yf ye harme hym ye done amys hath full harde penaunce sythe ye reſte hym thaqueyntaunce bialacoil hys moſte ioye whyche hys paynes myght acoye anoyed ſore ye doubled hym well blyſſe hath ben full bare sythe bialacoil fro hym fare loue hath hym great diſtreſſe hath nede dureſſe voydeth hym yre rede ye may wynnen thys dede maketh bialacoil repayre agayne haueth pyte vpon hys payne franchyſe woll pyte mercyfull hym ye ſythe ſhe accorde haue vpon hym miſ •• icorde pray eke mou • ſte nought refuſen requeſte harde fell thought v two woll right nought daunger ne might endure meked hym vnto meſure wol wyſe ſaythe daungere deny ye haue aſked great vncurteſye woll ye haue companye bialacoil ye deuyſe woll hym let wyſe bialacoil went hye fraunchyſe ſayde full curteſlye ye haue longe deignous vnto thys louer daungerous fro hym withdrawe preſence whyche hath hym great offence ye wolde vpon hym ſe wherfore ſoroufull man shape ye paye hym pleaſe loue yf ye woll haue caſe fulfyll hys wyll ſythe ye knowe daunger daunted brought lowe helpe pyte dare aferde ſhall right ye wyll saythe bialacoil ſkyll sythe daunger woll ſo fraunchyſe hath hym ſent byalacoil begynnyng salued hys cōmyng ſtraūgeneſſe ſene thā ne wrathed bene fayre ſemblaunt ſhewed goodly aforne dyd honde without done wythin haye ryght ladde wyth right good chere enuyron vergere daunger hadde chaſed fro nowe haue leaue ouer go nowe rayſed deuyſe fro hell vnto paradyſe thus bialacoil gentylneſſe wyth hys payne beſyneſſe hathe ſhewed onely grace eftres ſwote place ſawe roſe whan nygh greatter woxen high freſſhe roddy fayre hewe coloure euer yliche newe whan hadde longe ſene ſawe leues grene roſe ſpredde ſpaunyſhinge ſene goodly thynge ne ſo ſprede brede men within myght knowe ſede couert cloſe bothe leues roſe ſtalke euen grene vpright theron goodly ſyght wel better without wene ſeed nat ſene ful fayre ſpradde god bleſſe ſuche another geſſe aforne ne ne vermayle abawed marueyle euer fayrer bounden loues laas longe abode ſothe ſaye tyl bialacoil ganne praye whan ſawe wyſe warnen ſeruyce wolde graunt thynge whiche remembre wel ſyttynge ſayne grace wolde yeue leyſar ſpace ſo deſyrous haue kyſſynge prectous goodly freſhe roſe ſo ſwetely ſmelleth noſe diſpleaſed nought wolde gladly haue ſought haue coſſe therof freely yeft certainly wol none haue leue lothe greue ſayd frende ſo god ſpede chaſtite haue ſuche drede thou ſhuldeſt nat warned dare nat chaſtyte agayne dare nat myſdo alwaye byddeth ſhe ſo yeue louer leaue kyſſe therto maye wynnen ywiſſe ſurplus praye lyfe hoope gette ſome daye ſo kyſſynge maye attayne loues payne hath ſothe ſayne beſt moſt auenaunt erneſt remenaunt hys anſwere ſighed ſore durſt aſſaye tho hadde ſuche drede greue hym aye mā ſhuld nat moche aſſaye chafe hys frende meaſure putte hys lyfe auenture man fyrſt ſtroke ne maye nat fel downe oke reyſyns haue wyne tyll grape rype well fyne ſore empreſſed enſure drawen preſſure forpeyned wonder ſtronge though abode right longe kyſſe payne wo sythe kyſſe deſyred ſo tyll rennynge diſtreſſe come venus goddeſſe whyche aye werryeth chaſtite came grace ſocour whoſe myght knowe ferre wyde ſhe mother cupyde god loue blynde ſtone helpeth louers manye one lady brought right honde brennynge fyre blaſyng bronde wherof flame hote fyre hath many lady deſyre loue brought ſore hette ſeruyce hert ſette thys lady good entayle right wonderfull apparayle atyre ſo bryght ſhene men myght perceyue well ſene nat relygioun nyll make mencioun robe treſour broche neyther riche attour ne gyrdell ſyde nyll nat longe abyde knoweth well certaynly arrayed richely deuoyde pride certayne ſhe bialacoil ſhe went paas hym ſhortely clauſe ſayd ſir cauſe ye ben porte ſo daungerous vnto thys louer daynous graunt hym nothyng kyſſe warne hym ye done amyſſe sythe well ye wotte howe loues ſeruaunt ye maye ſe hath beaute wherthrough worthy loue haue blys howe ſemely beholde ſe howe fayre howe free howe ſwote debonayre age yonge luſty fayre lady ſo hawtayne ducheſſe counteſſe ne chaſtelayne nolde holde vngoodly refuce hym vtterly hys brethe alſo good ſwete eke hys lyppes roddy mete onely playne kyſſe graunt hym kyſſe gentylnyſſe hys teth arne alſo whyte clene thynketh wronge withouten wene ye nowe warne hym truſteth graunt kyſſe haue laſſe ye helpe hym ye haſte tyme ſhull ye waſte whan flame bronde venus brought right honde hadde bialacoil hys hete ſmete anone badde withouten lete graunt roſe kyſſe payne ganne lyſſe roſe anone went kyſſed full faythfully nede man aſke yf blythe whan ſauour ſofte lythe stroke myne hert without allegged ſore full ioye blyſſe fayre ſuche floure kyſſe ſo ſwote ſauerous myght nat ſo anguyſſhous mote gladde ioly whan remembre yet euer amonge ſothly fayne ſuffre noye moche payne ſee may neuer ſo ſtyll wyth lytell wynde wyll ouerwhelme tourne alſo woode wawes go calme trouble ſonne mote folowe chaunge moone right ſo fareth loue ſelde one holdeth hys ancre ryght anone whan eaſe wene beſt lyue ben wyth tempeſt fordryue ſerueth loue cannt tel wo ſtoundmele ioye mote ouergo nowe hurteth nowe cureth ſelde poynte loue endureth nowe ryght procede howe shame gan medle take hede fel angres haue hade howe ſtronge wall made caſtell brede length god loue wan wyth hys ſtrength thys romaunce wyll ſette thyng ne wyll lette lykynge floure beaute ſhe maye beſt labour quyte loue ſhall endyte wycked tonge couyne euerye louer deuyne worſte addeth ſomdele wycked tonge ſaythe neuer wele mewarde bare ryght great hate eſpyenge erly late tyll hathe ſene great chere bialacoil yfere myght hys tonge wythſtonde worſe reporte fonde ſo full curſed rage ſatte hym wele hys lynage hym iriſhe woman bare hys tonge fyled ſharpe ſquare poignaunt ryght keruyng wonder bytter ſpekyng whan gan eſpye ſwore affyrmyng ſykerly bytwene bialacoil yuel aquayntaunce pryue ſpake therof ſo folilye awaked ielouſye whyche afrayde hys ryſyng whan herde ianglyng ran anone wode bialacoil ſtode whyche leuer thys caas haue ben reynes amyas foote hote hys felonye hym thus ſayd ielouſye haſte thou ben ſo neglygent kepen whan abſent thys verger left eyn thy warde thou haddeſt regarde truſte thy confuſyon hym thus ſuſpection haue ryght great nede well ſhewed dede great faute nowe haue founde god anone thou ſhalt bounde faſte locken toure without refuyte ſocoure shame longe hath fro ouer ſoone ſhe ago whan thou haſt loſt bothe drede fere ſemed well ſhe nat beſy wyſe kepe chaſtice helpen chaſtite kepe roſer thynketh boye knaue ſo boldly ne ſhulde nat haue hardy verge hadde ſuche game whyche nowe tourneth great ſhame bialacoil nyſt ſaye full fayne wolde haue fledde away frare haue hydde nere ſodaynly toke hym wyth whan ſawe ſo thys ielouſye take v two aſtoned knewe rede fledde away drede shame came fortheful ſymply ſhe wende haue treſpaced ful greatly hūble porte made ſymple wearyng vayle ſtede wymple nonnes done abbey bycauſe herte affray gan ſpeke wythin throwe ielouſye right wonder lowe fyrſt hys grace ſhe befought ſayd ſir ne leueth nought wycked tonge falſe eſpye whyche ſo glad fayne lye hath made flateryng bialacoil falſe leaſyng hys falſneſſe nowe newe longe hym knewe fyrſt daye wycked tonge hath cuſtome aye yonge folkes bewrye falſe leſynges hem lye yet neuertheleſſe ſe amonge loigne ſo longe bialacoil hertes lure loues ſeruyce endure drawyng ſuche folke hym hath nothynge wyth ſothneſſe trowe nought bialacoil euer thought treſpace vilanye hys mother curteſye hathe taught hym euer good aqueyntaunce pryue loueth none heuyneſſe myrthe play gladneſſe hateth trechours soleyne folke enuyous ye weten howe woll euer glade ioyfull honeſtly wyth folke pley haue neglygent good fey chaſtyſe hym therfore nowe herte crye mercy haue ben ſo recheles tamen hym wythouten lee foly repente nowe woll hole ſet myne entente kepe bothe lowe ſtyll bialacoyl youre wyll shame shame ſayde ielouſye bytraſſhed great drede haue lecherye hathe clombe ſo hye almoſte blered myne eye wonder yf drede haue ouer reygneth lechery whoſe myght groweth nyght dey bothe cloyſtre abbey chaſtyte werreyed ouer therfore woll wyth ſyker wall cloſe bothe roſes roſere haue longe thys manere lefte hem vncloſed wylfully wherfore right inwardly soroufull repente nowe ſhall lenger vncloſed yet drede ſore ſhall repent ferthermore game gothe amys counſayle muſt newe iwys haue longe truſted nowe ſhall lenger may beſte euery coſte diſceyue men truſten moſte ſe well nyghe ſhent yf ſhette full entent remedye puruey wherfore cloſe ſhall wey fro hem woll roſe eſpye come waite vilonye good faythe trouthe woll let ſlouthe lyue ſykerneſſe make anone fortreſſe cloſe roſes good ſauour myddes ſhall make tour put bialacoil priſon euer drede treſon trowe ſhall hym kepe ſo ſhall haue myght go aboute make companye hem thynke vilanye ne ſuche hath ben aforne founde hym good chere whyche han aſſayled hym ſhende wyth trowandyſe blende foole eyth begyle may lyue lytell whyle ſhall forthynke hys fayre ſemblaunt worde came drede auaunt whyche abaſhed great fere whan wyſte ielouſye drede ſuche affray worde durſte ſaye quakyng ſtode full ſtyll alone tyll ielouſye hys way gone saue shame hym forſoke bothe drede ſhe full ſore quoke laſte drede abrayde hys coſyn shame ſayde shame ſayd ſothfaſtneſſe great heuyneſſe noyſe ſo ferre go ſclaunder v two ſythe befall may agayne call whan one ſpronge fame many yere wythouten blame haue ben many day many aprill many may han paſſed ſhamed ❧ tyll ielouſye hath v blamed myſtruſt ſuſpection cauſeleſſe wythout encheſon go daunger haſtely let v ſhewe hym openly hath right wrought whan ſet hys thought kepe better purpriſe hys doyng wyſe hath v great wronge hath ſuffred nowe ſo longe bialacoil haue hys wyll hys luſtes fulfyll muſte amende vtterly el ſhall vilaynouſly exiled thys londe werre may wythſtonde ielouſye grefe sythe bialacoil miſchefe daunger shame drede anon right way ben gon chorle foūd hē aforne ligging vnder hawethorne vnder hys heed pylowe ſtede truſſe gras ſlombred nappe toke tyll shame pitouſly hym ſhoke great manace hym gan make ſlepeſt thou whan thou ſhuld wake quod shame thou doeſt v vilanye truſteth dothe folye kepe roſes bothoms whan ben fayre ſeſons thou arte woxe famyliere thou ſhulde ſtraunge chere stoute thy porte redy greue thou doeſt great folye leue bialacoil inne call yonder man ſhenden v though thou ſlepe maye ielouſye great noyſe arte thou nowe late ryſe vp hye ſtoppe ſone delyuerly gappes hay fauoure pray falleth nothynge thy name make fayre ſemblant thou mayſt blame bialacoil ſwete free dogged fell thou ſhuldeſt frowarde outragious ywys chorle chaūgeth curtyſe thys haue herde ofte ſayenge man may dauntynge make ſperhauke boſarde men woll holde muſarde debonayre haue founden ſytteth nought curteys men pleaſaunce ſeruyſe recreaundyſe let thy werkes ferre nere lyke thy name whych daungere abawed ſhewynge anone ſpake drede ryght thus ſayenge ſayd daungyr drede thou ne wolte beſy kepe thou haſt kepe thou ſhuldeſh wake thou arte ſlepe thou ſhalt greued certaynly yf aſpye ielouſye yf fynde blame hath daye aſſayled ſhame chaſed away wyth great manace bialacoil thys place ſwereth ſhortly ſhall encloſe hym ſturdy wall thy wyckedneſſe fayleth ſtraungeneſſe thyne herte trowe fayled thou ſhalt repent ſpeciall yf ielouſye ſothe knewe thou ſhalt forthynke ſore rewe wyth yt churle clubbe gan ſhake frownynge hys eyen gan make hydous chere man rage yre brent hys vyſage herde hym blamed ſo ſayd wytte go dyſcomfyte haue great wronge certes haue nowe lyued longe syth maye thys cloſer kepe quycke woll doluen depe yf man ſhall repayre thys gardyn foule fayre myne herte yre gothe fere lette enter haue folly nowe ſe nowe ſhall amended ſetteth fote truly ſhall repent ſore man thys place entre ſhall haue grace leuer wyth ſwerdes twayne throughout myne herte euery vayne perced wyth many wounde ſlouth ſhulde founde hence forth nyght daye ſhall defende yf maye wythouten excepcion eche maner condicion yf man graunt holdeth recreaunt daūger hys fete gan ſtande hente burden hande wroth hys yre ne left nought verger hath ſought yf myght fynde hole trace mote forth pace gappe dyd cloſe man myght touche roſe roſer aboute ſhytteth euery man wythout thus daye daye daunger wers wonderfull dyuers feller eke euer hym full ofte ſynge ala ne maye nought hys yre recouer moſte deſyre myne herte ala woll braſt two bialacoil wrathed ſo certaynly euery membre quake remembre bothom whych wolde full ofte daye ſene beholde thynke vpon kyſſe howe moche ioye blyſſe ſauour ſwete wante grone grete thynketh fele yet noſe ſwete ſauour roſe nowe wote mote go ferre freſhe floures fro full welcome dethe abſence therof ala ſlethe whylom wyth thys roſe ala touched noſe mouth face nowe death muſte abyde loue conſent tyde one touche maye kyſſe trowe payne ſhall neuer lyſſe theron couetyſe whych brent myne herte many wyſe nowe ſhall repayre agayne ſyghynge longe watche nyghtes ſlepynge thought wyſhynge turment wo wyth many turnynge fro halfe payne tell fallen hell paradyſe welth turment greueth anoyeth nowe bytterneſſe forne haue felte ſwetneſſe wycked tonge hys falſhede cauſeth wo drede leyeth pytous charge bycauſe hys tonge large nowe tyme ſhortly tell ſomthynge ielouſy great ſuſpection aboute hym ſelfe maſon ſtone coulde laye ne querrour hyred hem make tour fyrſt roſes kepe aboute hem made dyche depe ryght wonder large alſo brode vpon whych alſo ſtode ſquared ſtone ſturdy wall whych cragge founded ryght great thyckneſſe eke bare aboute founded ſquare hundred fadome euery ſyde lych longe wyde leſt tyme aſſayled full well batayled▪ rounde enuyron eke ſette full many ryche fayre tourette euery corner thys wall ſet toure full principall eueryche wythout fable portcolyſe defenſable kepe enemyes greue force wolde preue eke amydde thys purpryſe made toure great mayſtryſe fayrer ſaugh man wyth ſyght large wyde great myght drad none aſſaut gynne gonne ſkaffaut temprure mortere made lycoure wonder dere quycke lyme perſaunt egre whych tempred wyth vynegre ſtone harde adamant wherof made foundemant toure rounde made compas thys worlde rycher ne better ordayned wythall aboute toure made wal betwyxt toure roſes ſette ſwete ſauoure wyth many roſes bere eke wythin caſtell spryngoldes gonne bowes archer eke corner men ſeyne ouer wall ſtonde great engyns nere honde kernel arblaſters great plentye none armure myght ſtroke wythſtonde foly preace honde wythout dytche lyſtes made wyth wall batayled large brade men horſe ſhulde attayne nygh dyche ouer playne thus ielouſye hath enuyron sette aboute hys garnyſon wyth walles rounde dyche depe onely roſer kepe daunger erly late keyes kept vtter gate whych openeth towarde eeſt wyth hym leeſt thurty ſeruauntes eche one name gate kepte shame whych opened couthe towarde parte ſouthe sergeauntes aſſygned full many wyll drede bayllye kepynge coneſtablerye towarde north vnderſtonde opened vpon lyfte honde whych nothynge may ſure yf ſhe beſy cure erly morowe alſo late strongly ſhette barre gate euery thynge ſhe may ſe drede aferde ſo ſhe wyth puffe lytell wynde drede aſtonyed mynde therfore ſtealynge roſe rede yate vncloſe foules flyght woll make fle eke ſhadowe yf ſhe ſe wycked tonge ful enuye wyth ſoudyours normandye cauſeth bate keper fourth gate alſo tother thre went full ofte ſe hys lotte wake nyght hys inſtrumentes wolde dyght blowe make ſowne hath encheſoune walken ofte vpon wall corner wyckettes ouer full narowe ſerchen eſpye though nought fonde yet wolde lye dyſcordaunt euer fro armonye deſtoned melodye controue wolde foule fayle wyth hornepypes cornewayle floyres made dyſcordaunce hys muſyke wyth myſchaunce wolde ſeyne wyth note newe fonde woman trewe ne ſawe neuer hys lyfe vnto huſbonde trewe wyfe ne none ſo full honeſte ſhe nyll lauge mery ſhe hereth maye eſpye man ſpeaken lecherye eueryche hem hath ſome vyce one dyſhoneſt another nyce yf one full vyllanye another hath lykerous eye yf one full wantonneſſe another chydereſſe thus wycked tonge god yeue hym ſhame put hem euerychone blame wythout deſerte cauſeleſſe lyeth though ben gyltleſſe haue pyte ſene ſorowe walketh eue morowe innocentes doth ſuche greuaunce praye god yeue hym yuell chaunce euer ſo beſye woman ſeyne amys eke ielouſye god confounde hath made toure ſo rounde made aboute garyſon ſette bealacoil pryſon whych ſhette tour full longe holde ſoiour lyue penaunce hym greuaunce whyche hath ordeyned ielouſye olde vecke eſpye maner hys gouernaunce whych dyuell enfaunce lerned loues arte hys pleys toke parte except hys ſeruyſe knewe eche wrenche euery gyſe loue euery wyle harde begyle bealacoil ſhe toke aye hede euer lyueth wo drede kept hym koye eke pryne leeſt hym ſhe ſe foly countenaunce ſhe knewe olde daunce thys ielouſye bealacoil hys baillye ſhette hym vp ſo fre ſure hym wolde truſteth ſore hys caſtell ſtronge werke hym lyketh well dradde glotons sulde ſteale hys roſes bothoms roſes aſſured defenced wyth ſtronge wall nowe ielouſye full well maye drede deuoyde lyberte whether ſlepe wake hys roſes maye none take bvt ala nowe mourne ſhall bycauſe wythout wall full moche doole mone made wyſt wo hadde trowe wolde haue pete loue dere ſolde good hys loue went queyntly nowe doublynge payne ſe wolde ſell agayne newe bargayne lere whych dere ſolace haue lorne neuer aforne certayne full lyke dede hym caſt earth hys ſede hath ioye newe ſprynge greneth gynnynge alſo fayre freſhe floure luſty ſene ſwote odoure er ſheues ſhere maye fall wether ſhall dere make fade fall ſtalke greyne floures tyllers fordone hope ſone drede certayne ſo fare hope trauayle ſykerly ben byraſte wyth ſtorme floure nyll ſeden corne loue hath ſo auaunced began pryuyte bailacoil tell whome ne founde frowarde ne fell toke agree hole playe loue ſo harde aſſaye one reued wente beſt abouen haue loue fortune chaungeth ofte nyll contune whych whylom woll folke ſmyle glombe hem another whyle nowe frende nowe foe ſhalt fele twynclynge tourneth whele wrythe heed awaye thys concourſe playe areyſt doth mourne whirle adowne ouertourne ſytteth hygheſt luſt foole woll truſt come downe charge reuolutioun syth bialacoil fro twyne shette priſon yonde wythinne hys abſence myne herte fele ioye myne hele hym roſe woll whych hym doth cloſe open maye hym ſe loue woll cured paynes endure cruell auenture ah bialacoil myne owne dere though thou nowe priſonere kepe leeſt thyne herte ſuffre daunted ne let ielouſye hys rage putten thyne herte ſeruage though chaſtyce wythout make thy body vnto hym lout haue herte harde diamaunt stedfaſt naught plyaunt priſon though thy body large kepe thyne herte free trewe herte woll plye manace maye drye ieloſye doth payne quyte hym hys whyle thus agayne venge leeſt thought yf waye thou mayſt nought thys wyſe ſubtelly worche wynne mayſtry yet great affraye leſt thou ſaye drede thou canſt great maugre thou enpryſoned arte treſpas neuer dyſcouered yet thynge ought ſecret well annoye thys myſchaunce endure harde penaunce ſayne thynke ſorowe almoſt ſynke remembre wo full nyghe wytte go inwarde myne herte fele blede comfortleſſe death drede owe well haue dyſtreſſe falſe wyckedneſſe traytours arne enuyous noyen ſo coragious ah bialacoil full well ſe hem ſhape dyſceyue make buxome lawe wyth corde drawe ſo hem luſt ryght wyll drede haue brought tyll wythout comforte thought ſlethe thys game woll brynge dethe yf good wyll leſe deed maye cheſe yf thou foryete myne herte ſhall neuer lykynge elſwhere fynde ſolace yf put grace ſhall neuer ben hope ſhulde fall wanhope ala wanhope naye parde woll neuer dyſpeyred yf hope fayle vngratious vnworthy hope woll conforted loue betaught sayd hope ſo go shulde aye relees wo ſhe bale bete curteys ſwete nothynge full certayne louers ſhe put full great payne maketh hem wyth wo dele fayre beheſt dyſceyueth fele ſhe woll behote ſykerly faylen vtterly ah full noyous thynge many louer louynge hangeth vpon truſteth faſt whych leſe trauayle laſt thyng cōmen ſhe wote ryght nought therfore yf wyſely ſought counſayle foly take many tymes ſhe woll make full good ſylogyſme drede afterwarde ſhall dede folowe yuell concluſyoun put confuſioun many tymes haue ſene many haue begyled bene truſte haue ſet hope whych fell hem afterwarde ſlope bvt natheleſſe yet gladlye ſhe wolde woll hym wyth holde altymes purpoſe clere wythout dyſceyte ſhe deſyreth ſykerly blamed dyd foly auayleth good wyll ſhe ne may ſtaunche ſtounde yll helpeth lytell ſhe may outtake beheſt vnto wo heeſt certayne wyſe wythout yefte prayſe heeſt dede ſondre vary done great contrary thus poſſed vp downe wyth doole thought confuſyoun dyſeaſe nombre daungere ſhame encombre drede alſo ielouſye wycked tonge full enuye whych ſharpe cruel ire full ofte put great martyre haue ioye fully lette syth bialacoil haue beſhette fro pryſon wyckedly whome loue ſo entierly woll bane ſooner maye hym ſe yet ouer worſt ſet kepe foule befall rympled vecke ferre roune rage frownynge yelowe vyſage whych awayte lyeth daye nyght none hem maye haue ſyght nowe mote ſorow enforſed full ſoth loue yafe thre wonder yeftes hys grace whych haue lorne thys place syth ne may wythout drede helpen lytell taketh hede auayleth swete thought ſwete speche helpeth ryght nought thyrde called swete lokynge nowe lorne wythout leſynge yeftes fayre thy helpe ſymply bialacoil looſed gone large free hym lyfe lyeth doute yf come rather oute ala trowe woll bene howe ſhulde euermore hym ſene maye wronge bycauſe toure ſo ſtronge howe ſhulde whoſe proweſſe ſo ſtronge fortereſſe certayne nyll god wotte haue wytte therto well wote rage loue dyd homage cauſe ſothfaſtneſſe ſelfe dame idelneſſe whych conueyd fayre prayere entre fayre vergere blame leue whych nowe doth ſore greue fooles worde nought trowe ne worthe apple lowe menne ſhulde hym ſnybbe bytterly pryme temp hys foly foole ſhe leued ryght nought releued accomplyſhed wyll nowe greueth wonder yll reaſon ſayd ſhulde fall foole ſelfe maye well call loue aſyde layde trowed dame reaſon ſayde reaſon ſkyll ryght ſhe blamed wyth myght medle loue hath ſhent certayne nowe woll repent ſhulde repente naye parde falſe traytour ſhulde dyuels engyns wolde take yf loue wolde forſake bialacoil falſly betraye shulde myſchefe hate hym naye syth nowe hys curteſye pryſon ielouſye curteſye certayne dyd moche maye yolden hay paſſen lete kyſſe roſe fayre ſwete shulde therfore con hym maugre naye certaynly ſhall loue ſhall neuer yeue good wyll worde wyll offence complaynt leſſe neyther hope idelneſſe certes wronge hated hem curteſye el ſuffre thynke waken ſhulde wynke abyde hope tyll loue chaunce sende ſocour allegeaunce expectant aye tyll maye mete getten mercy ſwete whylom thynke howe loue sayd wolde take gre ſeruyce yf vnpacience cauſed done offence ſayd thanke ſhall take hygh mayſter eke make yf wyckedneſſe ne reue ſoue trowe ſhall theſe hys wordes ſemed loued truely nowe ſerue hym wele yf thynke hys thanke fele good myne harme lyeth hole loue maye defaute trewe loue ne fayled neuer man sothly faute mote nedes god forbyd founde cōmeth ſe nowe let gone maye go whether loue woll ſocoure ſlo may hole hys wyll ſo ſore bounde hym tyll hys ſeruyce maye • lene lyfe death wythouten wene hys hande maye cheſe maye wynne leſt ſyth ſo ſore doth greue yet yf luſte wolde acheue bialacoil goodly yeue force fell though dye mote nede praye loue hys goodlyhede bialacoil gentylneſſe whome lyue ſuche dyſtreſſe mote dyen penaunce fyrſt wythout repentaunce woll confeſſe good entent make haſt teſtament louers done felen ſmerte bialacoil leaue myne herte hole wythout departynge doubleneſſe repentynge ¶cōment raiſon vient lamant thus made paſſage complaynt cruell rage fynde leche couthe vnto myne helpynge eche sodaynly agayne comen doune tour ſawe reaſoun diſcrete wyſe full pleaſaunt port full auenaunt ryght waye ſhe toke ſtode great perplexitie poſſhed euery ſyde nyſt myght abyde tyll ſhe demurely ſad chere sayd ſhe came nere myne owne frende art thou greued quarel yet atcheued loues ſyde anon tell haſt thou yet loue thy fyll art thou nat wery thy ſeruyce hath ſuche wyſe ioye haſt thou thy louyng ſwete bytter thyng canſt thou yet cheſe let ſe beſt thy ſocour myght thou ſerueſt full noble lorde maketh thrall thy rewarde aye returneth thy turment foly ſo hath blent thou fell myſchefe thylke daye whan thou dyddeſt ſothe ſaye obeyſaunce eke homage thou wroughteſt nothyng ſage whan thou became liege man thou dyddeſt great foly thou wyſteſt nat fell therto lorde thou hadſt yf thou haddeſt hym well knowe thou hadſt nought brought ſo lowe yf thou wyſteſt thou woldeſt ſerue hym halfe yere nat weke halfe daye ne yet houre without delaye ne neuer loued thought depe grauen ſo tender myne hert render rede ouer communely ſelfe leudeſt bvt ſyth ye loue diſcryuen ſo lacke preiſe bothe two defyneth letter maye thynke better herde neuer defyned wylfully
