ryſe therfore ſet kynde therin delyte men therin ſhulde haue delyte dede erke oft ſythens haunt werke none wolde drawe therof draught ne delyte hath hym caught ſubtyl dame nature none goth ryght enſure ne hath entent hole ne perfyte deſyre delyte fortened creaſe eke playe loue oft ſeke thrall hem ſelfe ſo nyſe vnto prince euery vyce eche ſynne rote vnlefull luſt though ſote euyll racyne tullius determyne tyme full ſage boke made age prayſeth elde though croked vnwelde cōmendatioun youth deſcriptioun youth ſet man wyfe paryll ſoule lyfe parell men haue grace paryll youth pace without deth diſtreſſe ſo full wyldneſſe oft doth ſhame domage hym lynage ledeth man vp nowe downe mokell diſſolutioun maketh hym loue well company led lyfe diſrulely halte hym payde none eſtate within hym ſelfe ſuche debate chaungeth purpoſe entent yalte ſome couent lyuen empryſe leſeth fredom fraunchyſe nature hym ſette whiche agayne may gette yf make manſyon abyde profeſſyon though tyme hert abſent maye fayle ſhall repent eke abyde thylke daye leaue habyte gone waye leſeth worſhyp name dare come agayne ſhame lyfe doth ſo mourne bycauſe dare home retourne fredom kynde ſo loſt hath neuer may recured yf god hym graunt grace may hence pace conteyne vnder obedience vertue patience youth ſet man folye vnthryft rybaudrye lechery outrage oft chaungeth corage youth gynneth oft ſuche bargayne may ende without payne great paryll ſet youth hede delyte ſo doth brydell lede delyte hangeth drede nought man body thought onely youthes chambere done euyll cuſtomere naught el taketh hede onely folkes lede diſporte wyldeneſſe fro warde ſadneſſe elde draweth hem therfro wote may wel go mo hem nowe arne olde whylom youthe holde whiche yet remembreth tender age howe hem brought many arage many folly therin wrought yt elde hath hym ſought repent hem follye youth hem put ieopardye paryll moche wo made hem oft amyſſe ſewen euyll companye ryot auoutryce bvt elde agayne reſtrayne ſuche folly refrayne ſet men ordynaunce good rule gouernaunce euyll ſhe ſpendeth ſeruyſe noman woll loue neyther preyſe hated wote wele acquayntaunce wolde man fele ne han elde company men hate alye man wolde become olde ne dye whan yonge bolde elde maruayleth ryght greatly whan remembre hem inwardly many peryllous empryſe wrought ſondry wyſe euer myght without blame eſcape awaye without ſhame youth without domage reprefe lynage loſſe membre ſhedyng bloude parell deth loſſe good woſt thou youth abyt men ſo preyſen wyt delyte ſhe halte ſoiour dwellen tour longe youth ſeaſon dwell one manſyon delyte youth woll haue ſeruyce ſo woll deuyſe youth redy euermore obeye ſmerte ſore vnto delyte hym yeue ſeruyce whyle ſhe maye lyue elde habytte wol tell shortly whyle dwel thither behoueth yt go yf deth youth ſlo iourneye thou mayſt fayle labour trauayle lodged ben ſorowe wo neuer courte go payne diſtreſſe ſykneſſe yre melancoly angry ſyre bene paleys ſenatours gronyng grutchynge harbegeours daye nyght tourment cruell deth preſent tellen erlyche late deth ſtandeth armed gate brynge remembraunce folly dedes enfaunce cauſen mourne wo youth hath begyled ſo ſodaynly away haſted wepeth tyme ſhe hath waſted complaynyng preterytte preſent nat abytte olde vanitie aforne ſhe maye ſe future ſome ſocour leggen dolour graunt tyme repentaunce ſynnes penaunce laſt ſo gouerne wynne ioye eterne fro go bakwarde youth made vanitie drowne wade preſent tyme abydeth nought ſwyft thought lytle whyle doth endure ny compt ne meaſure euer game go lyſt loue ioy myrth alſo loue ſhe hye lowe frute ſhulde hem delyte parte may el quyte ſaue hem ſelfe honeſtie yet full many one ſe woman ſothly ſayne deſyre wolde fayne playe loue ſo wylde coueyte go chylde yf chylde perchaunce wol holde great miſchaunce ſo euer wo fele woll playne concele yf foole nyce whome ſhame hath iuſtyce delyte echone drawe haunt worke hye lawe saue ſuche arne worth right nought moneye woll bought suche loue prayſe wyſe whan gyuen couetyſe preyſe woman though ſo woode yeueth ſelfe good lytle ſhulde man tell wyl body ſell ſhe mayde ſhe wyfe quycke wyll ſell lyfe fayre chere euer ſhe make wretche vndertake loued ſuche one ſwete ſoure though ſhe hym called paramoure laugheth maketh feeſt certaynly ſuche beeſt loued worthy beare name drury non ſhulde pleaſe woode woll diſpoyle hym good yet natheleſſe woll ſaye ſhe ſolace playe maye iewell thyng take louers free yeuyng ſhe aſke wyſe drede ſhame couetyſe ſhe may hym certayne without ſlaunder yeuen agayne ioyne hertes togyther ſo loue take yeue alſo trowe woll hem twynne whan loue ſynne woll togyther go han ado curteys ſhulde debonayre loue beren hem fayre without vyce ſhe alwaye honeſtie fro folly loue kepe hem clere brenneth hertes fere loue wyſe deuoyde couetyſe good loue ſhulde engendred true hert iuſt ſecree ſuche ſet thought haue luſt el nought caught loues lace truly bodily ſolace fleſhly delyte ſo preſent ſet thyne entent without ſhuld gloſe get haue roſe maketh ſo mate wood thou deſyreſt none good thou art yuche nerere euer abydeſt ſorowe werre thy face ſene maketh pale lene thy myght thy vertue goth awaye ſory geſt good faye thou harboreſt thyne inne god loue whan thou let wherfore rede thou ſhet hym ſhall greue dout thy profyt wyll turne yf nomore ſoiourne great myſchefe ſorowe ſonken ben hertes loue arne dronken thou peraduenture knowen ſhall whan thou haſt loſt tyme ſpent thought ydleneſſe waſte wofull luſtyneſſe yf thou mayſt lyue tyme ſe loue delyuered thy tyme thou ſhalt bewepe ſore neuer thou mayeſt reſtore tyme loſt men may ſe nothyng may recouered yf thou ſcape yet laſt fro loue hath ſo faſt knytte bounden lace certayne holde grace many one ſeyne haue loſt ſpent alſo veyne ſeruyce without ſocour body ſoule good treaſour wytte ſtrength eke rycheſſe neuer redreſſe ¶lamant thus taught preached hath reaſon loue ſpylte ſermon ſo imped thought doctryne ſet nought yet ne ſayd ſhe neuer dele ne vnderſtode wele worde worde mater vnto loue ſo thral calleth ouer praye chaſeth ſo thought aye holdeth myne hert vnder ſeale truſty true ſtele deuocion ne ſermon dame reaſon ne rede toke ſoiour myne heed yede one ere ſhe dyd lere fully ſhe loſt lore ſpeche greued wonder ſore vnto yre ſayd angre dydde abrayde dame wyll algate loue hate men ye teche yf ſpeche syth ye ſayne loue good muſt nedes ſaye mode yf leue hatred aye lyuen voyde loue alwaye ſynfull wretche hated teche maye go none gate eyther muſt loue hate yf hate men newe loue woll rewe prechyng ſemeth loue nothyng ne prayſeth ye yeue good counſayle ſykerly precheth al day shulde loues lore alowe foole wolde trowe ſpeche alſo ye han taught another loue knowen nought herde repreue loue eche leue yf ye wolde diffyne wolde gladly ſe leſt yf may lere ſondry loues manere ¶raiſon certes frende fole art thou whan thou nothynge wolt alowe thy profyte ſaye yet woll ſaye ſaye redy leeſt acomplyſh thy requeſt woll aueyle vayne peraduenture ſhall traueyle loue ſondry wyſe ſhall deuyſe ſome loue lefull good mene nat yt maketh woode bryngeth many fytte rauyſheth fro thy wytte ſo marueylous queynt ſuche loue nomore acqueynt ¶cōment reaſon diffiniſt aunſete loue frenſhyppe alſo whych maketh man done amys wyl knytte betwyxte two wol breke wele ne wo whych longe lykely contune whan wyl goodes bene commune grounded goddes orddinaunce hoole wythout diſcordaunce wyth hem holdyng cōmunte al good charite none exceptioun chaungyng ententioun eche helpe nede wyſely hele worde dede trewe meanyng deuoyde ſlouth wytte nought wythout trouth tone dare al thought sayne frende ſpare nought ſelfe without dredyng diſcouered wreying glad coniunction whan none ſuſpection wolde proue trewe parfyte loue man may amiable yf ſo ferme ſtable fortune chaunge hym nat ne blynde hys frende alwaye fynde poore ryche ſtate yf hys frende gate wol complayne pouerte ſhulde nat byde ſo longe tyl hys helpyng hym requyre good dede done prayere ſolde bought dere ywys herte great valure hert fulfylled gentylneſſe yuel demeaue diſtreſſe man worthy name aſken often hath great ſhame good man brenneth thought ſhame whan aſketh ought hath great thought dredeth aye hys diſeaſe whan ſhal praye frende leſt warned tyl preue ſtabilite whan hath founden one truſtye trewe ſtone aſſayed al founde ſtedfaſt wal hys frenſhyp certayne ſhal ſhewe ioye payne al dare thynke ſaye wythout ſhame wel maye howe ſhulde ſhamed ſuch one tolde whan wotte hys ſecrete thought thyrde ſhal know therof ryght nought twey nombre bette thre euery counſayle ſecree repreue dredeth neuer dele beſette wordes wele euery wyſe man drede kepe hys tonge tyll ſe nede fooles nat holde tonge fooles belle ſone ronge yet ſhal trewe frende helpe felowe hys ſore ſuccour whan hath nede al may done dede gladder hym pleaſeth felowe eaſeth yf requeſt ſhal much moleſt hys felowe maye fulfyl hys volunte fully hath requyred hertes loue hath fyred ioye wo ſhal departe take euenly eche hys parte halfe anoye ſhall haue aye comfort maye thys blyſſe parte ſhal loue wol departed whylom thys vnite spake tulllius dyte ſhulde maken hys requeſt vnto frende honeſt goodly ſhulde fulfyl ſkyl otherwyſe graunt therto excepte cauſes two men frende dethe wolde dryue let hym beſy ſaue hys lyue alſo yf men wollen hym aſſayle hys worſhyp make hym fayle hyndren hym renoun let wyth ful ententioun deuer done eche degre hys frende ne ſhamed thys two caſe wyth hys myght takyng kepe ſkyl ryght ferre loue maye hym excuſe thys ought man refuſe thys loue haue tolde nothyng contrary thys wol thou folowe wele leaue tother euery dele thys loue vertue al entendeth tother fooles blent ſhendeth another loue alſo contrary vnto thys whych deſyre ſo conſtrayned wyl fayned awaye fro trouth doth ſo varye good loue contrarye maymeth many wyſe syke hertes wyth couetyſe al wynnynge profyte suche loue ſetteth delyte thys loue ſo hangeth balaunce yf leſe hys hope parchaunce luere ſet vpon wol fayle quenche anon man may amorous ne hys lyuyng vertuous loue moode men hem ſelfe goode loue profyte doth abyde falſe bydeth tyde loue cometh dame fortune lytle whyle wyl contune ſhall chaungen wonder ſoone take eclyps ryght moone whan v lette erth betwyxt ſette ſunne may fal partie al ſhadowe maketh bemes merke horne ſhewe derke parte ſhe hath loſt lyght phebus fully ſyght tyl whan ſhadowe ouerpaſt enlumyned agayne faſt bryghtneſſe ſūne bemes yeueth agayne lemes loue ryght ſuch nature nowe fayre nowe obſcure nowe bryght nowe clipſy manere whylom dymme whylom clere ſone pouerte gynneth take wyth mantel weedes blake hydeth loue lyght away nyght turneth day may ſe ryches ſhyne tyl blacke ſhadowes fyne whan rycheſſe ſhyneth bryght loue recouereth ayen lyght whan fayleth wol flyt ſhe greueth ſo greueth thys loue ſaye ryche men loued aye namely tho ſparande bene wol nat waſhe hertes clene fylth byce gredy brennyng auaryce ryche man ful fonde ywys weneth loued hys herte vnderſtode hys good may wel weten thought hys good loued ryght nought yf nygarde eke men wyl ſet hym leke haten hym thys ſoth lo profyte hys catel doth euery man may hym ſe getteth hym nough cumyte amende hym ſelfe vyce knowe hym ſelfe wyſe certes ſhulde aye frendly gette hym loue alſo bene fre el wyſe ne ſage gote ramage loueth dede proueth whan hys rycheſſe ſo wel loueth wol hyde aye ſpare hys poore frendes ſene forfare kepen aye hys purpoſe tyl drede hys eyen cloſe tyl wycked death hym take hym leuer ſondre ſhake let al hys lymmes ſondre ryue leaue rycheſſe lyue thynketh parte wyth man certayne loue howe ſhulde loue wythin hym whan hys hert pyte treſpaſeth wel wate eche man knoweth hys eſtate wel hym ought reproued loueth nought ne loued ſyth arne fortune comen hath ſermon nomen wonder wyl tel nowe thou hardeſt neuer ſuch one trowe thou leuen ſhal though ſothfaſtneſſe al writen ſoth vnto men profyte doth frowarde fortune contraire ſwote debonaire yf thynke doutable argument prouable debonayre ſofte falſeth begyleth ofte lyche mother ſhe cheryſhe mylken doth norice good hym deles yeueth part weles great rycheſſe degnite hem ſhe hoteth ſtabilyte ſtate ſtable chaungyng aye variable fedeth wyth glory vayne worldly blyſſe noncertayne whan ſhe hym ſetteth whele wene right wele ſo ſtable ſtate wythall neuer wene fall whan ſette ſo hygh wene haue certeynte hertly frendes great nombre nothynge myght ſtate encombre truſte hem ſo euery ſyde wenyng wyth hym wolde abyde euery parel miſchaunce wythout chaunge variaunce catel good alſo ſpende blood al membres ſpyll onely fulfyl wyll maken hole many wyſe hoten hem full ſeruyſe howe ſore hem ſmerte naked ſherte herte alſo hole gyue tyme may lyue wyth flatterye maken fooles glorifye wordes ſpekyng han chere reioyſyng trowe hem euangyle al falſheed gyle ſhal afterwarde ſe whan arne fallen pouerte bene good catel bare ſhul ſene frendes ware hundrede certaynly thouſande ful ſcarſly ne ſhal fynde vnnethes one whan pouerte comen vpon thus fortune tell wyth men whan luſt dwell maketh hem leſe conyſaunce noriſheth hem ignoraunce frowarde fortune peruerſe whan hygh eſtates ſhe doth reuerſe maketh hem tomble doune whele wyth ſodayne tourne rycheſſe doch hem flye plongeth hem pouerte ſtepmother enuyous layeth playſtre dolorous vnto hertes wounded egre whych tempred wyth vynegre wyth pouerte indigence ſhewe experience ſhe fortune verylye man ſhulde affye yeftes haue fyaunce ſo full varyaunce thus ſhe maken hye lowe whan rycheſſe arne throwe fully knowen without frende affecte frende chere whych loue trewe ſtable whych alſo varyable fortune goddeſſe pouerte eyther rycheſſe yeueth drede vnhappe bereueth dede fortune let one frendes whan fortune gone meane tho frendes wyll fle anone entreth pouerte yet woll leaue hem ſo eche place go cal hem wretche ſcorne blame miſhappe hem diffame namely ſuch rycheſſe pretendeth mooſt ſtableneſſe whan hey ſawe hym ſet lofte hym ſocoured ofte mooſt yholpe al nede nowe take maner hede ſeyne voyce flatery nowe appereth foly ouer al ſo fare ſynge go farewel feldefare al ſuch frendes beſhrewe trewe fewe ſothfaſt frendes ſo betyde euery fortune wollen abyde han hertes ſuch nobleſſe nyl loue rycheſſe fortune may hem ſende wollen hem ſocour defende chaunge ſofte ne ſore frende loueth euermore though men drewe ſwerde hys frend ſlo may hewe loue two caſe ſhal ſay pride ire leſe may reproue nycete diſcoueryng priuite wyth tonge woundyng felon venemous detraction frende thys caſe wol gon hys way nothyng greue ne may nought el wol fle loue ſtabylyte certayne wel begone amonge thouſande fyndeth one maye rycheſſe ayenſt frendſhyp worthyneſſe ne may ſo hygh attayne may valure ſoth ſayne hym loueth trewe wel frendſhyp catel frende courte aye better peny purſe certis fortune miſhappyng whan vpon men ſhe fablyng though miſturnyng chaunce caſt hem balaunce maketh aduerſite men ful clerely ſe hym frende exiſtence hym apparence fortune maketh anone knowe thy frendes fro thy fone experience ryght whych prayſe ywys much rycheſſe treſour depe profyte valour pouerte ſuch aduerſyte doth proſperite one yeueth conyſaunce tother ignoraunce thys pouerte dede troth declared fro falſhede faynt frendes wol declare trewe alſo wey fare whan hys rycheſſe theſe frendes ful doubleneſſe offred hym many wyſe herte body ſeruyce wold thā haue haue bought knowen openly thought nowe hath ſo clerely ſene laſſe begyled ſhulde haue bene perceyued rycheſſe nolde let hym wytte wel auantage doth hym syth maketh hym wyſe man great miſchefe perceyueth doth rycheſſe hym deceyueth rycheſſe riche ne maketh nought hym treſour ſette hys thought rycheſſe ſtoute ſuffyſaunce nothynge habundaunce ſuffyſaunce al onely maketh men lyue rychly hathe mytches tweyne ne value hys demayne lyueth eaſe ryche doth chiche hys berne hath ſoth ſayne hundrede mauys grayne though chapman marchaunt haue golde many beſaunt gettynge hath ſuch wo kepynge drede alſo ſette euermore hys beſyneſſe encreaſe leſſe augment multyplye thoughe heapes lye hym yet neuer ſhal make hys rycheſſe aſſeth vnto hys gredyneſſe poore recheth nought saue lyuelode hys thought whych getteth wyth hys traueyle dredeth naught ſhal feyle though haue lytle worldes goode meate drynke eaſy foode vpon hys traueyle lyuyng alſo ſuffyſaunt clothyng yf ſyckeneſſe fall loth meate drynke wythall though haue nat ••• bye ſhal bethynke hym haſt • ly put hym al daungere meate hath miſtere may wyth lytle eke befounden whyle ſeke men ſhul hym berne haſte lyue tyl hys ſyckeneſſe paſte ſome may ſondewe beſyde caſte nought ſhal hym betyde thynketh nought euer ſhal ſyckeneſſe fal though fal maye al tyme ſpare ſhal mokel ſhal hym ſuffyce • e ſycke wyſe doth wol content wyth pouerte wythout nede man much lytle haue apayed wyth hys fortune nyl importune vnto wyght ne onerous goodeſſe coueytous therfore ſpareth may wel bene hys pore eſtate ſuſtene yf hym luſte ſpare ſuffreth forthe ne ware laſte hapneth maye ryght vnto hys laſt daye take worlde wolde euer hert thynketh ſooner deth hym ſlo paradyſe ſooner go ſhall lyue blyſſe ſhal good myſſe thyder hopeth god ſhal ſende hys wretched lyues ende pythagoras hym ſelfe reherſes boke golden verſes cleped nobylite honorable dyte whan thou goſt thy body fro free heyre thou ſhalt vp go leauen al humanyte purely lyue deite foole wythouten troweth haue hys countrey erth countre may theſe clerkes ſeyne ſe boece conſolation maked mention countre playne eye techyng phyloſophye leude men mygh lere wyt ſo wolde tranſlaten ſuch well lyue hys rent maye hym yeue deſyreth haue may fro pouerte hym ſaue wyſe man ſayd may ſene man wretched wene kynge knyght rybaude many rybaude mery baude ſwynketh bereth day nyght many burthen great myght whych doth hym laſſe offence ſuffreth pacience laugh daunce tryppe ſynge lay nought vp lyuyng tauerne diſpendeth wynnyng god hem ſendeth goth fardel bere wyth good chere dyd ere ſwynke trauayle fayneth robben diſdayneth right anon hys ſwynke goeth tauerne drynke al theſe ryche abundaunce thus haue ſuffiſaunce wel vſurere god wel knoweth wythout vſurer ſo god ſe shal neuer rycheſſe ryche euermore poore indigent scare gredy hys entent ſoth diſpleſe may marchaunt lyue eſe hys herte ſuch ſet quycke brenneth get ne neuer ſhal though hath geten though hath golde garner yeten nedy dredeth ſore wherfore getten ſet hys hert hys deſyre hote brenneth fyre couetyſe maketh hym wood purchaſe mennes good vnderfongeth great payne vndertaketh drynke vp sayne drynketh aye leaueth ſoth ſaye thus thurſt falſe gettyng laſt euer coueytyng anguyſhe diſtreſſe wyth fyre gredyneſſe fyghteth hym aye ſtryueth herte aſonder ryueth suche gredyneſſe hym aſſayleth whan moſt hath moſte ſayleth phyſiciens aduocates gone ryght ſame yates ſel ſeyence wenyng haunt craft great gettyng wenyng ſuche ſwetneſſe yf man fall ſyckneſſe full glad encraſe wyl without leaſe eueryche man ſhulde ſeke though dye ſet l • ke whan golde haue take ful lytle care hem make wolde fourty ſycke one yea two hundred fleſhe bone yet two thouſande geſſe encreſen rycheſſe wol worchen wyſe luere couetyſe phyſycke gynneth fyrſt phy phiſycien alſo ſothly ſythen gothe fro fye fye truſt hem folye nyl maner gre ryght nought charite eke ſame ſect ſette al tho prechen gette worſhyps honour rycheſſe hertes arne great diſtreſſe folke lyue holyly abouen al ſpecially prechen veynglory towarde god haue memory forth ypocrites trace ſoules deth purchace outwarde ſhewyng holyneſſe though ful curſedneſſe nat lyche apoſtles twelue diſceyue hem ſelue begyled gyler preachyng curſed man thoughe may profyte hym ſelfe aueyleth amyte ofte good predicatioun cometh • el ententioun hym nat vayleth hys preachyng al helpe wyth hys teachyng good enſample take wyth vayn glorye ſhake lette v leuen theſe preachours ſpeke hem tour heape vp golde faſt ſhette ſore theran herte ſette neyther loue god ne drede kepe nede bagges ſore bynde ſunne wynde put vp nede ware whan ſene pore folke forfare hungre dye colde quake god wel vengeaunce therof take great miſcheues hem aſſayleth thus gadryng aye trauayleth wyth much payne wynne rycheſſe drede hem holdeth diſtreſſe kepe gather faſte wyth ſorowe leaue laſte wyth ſorowe dye lyue vnto rycheſſe hertes yeue defaute loue ſheweth ful wel ywis yf theſe gredy ſoth ſayne loueden loued agayne good loue reygned ouer al suche wyckedneſſe ne ſhulde fal ſhulde yeue mooſt good hem nede beſtade lyue wythout falſe vſure charyte ful clene pure hem yeue goodneſſe defendyng hem fro ydleneſſe al thys worlde poore none ſhude fynde trowe one chaunged thys worlde vnſtabale loue ouer al vendable ſe man loueth nowe wynnyng prowe loue thralled ſeruage whan ſolde auauntage yet woman woll bodyes ſell suche ſoules goeth dyuell hell loue tolde hem hys entent baronage coūſayle went many ſentences fyll dyuerſly ſayd wyll dyſcorde accorded acorde loue recorded syr ſayden ben atone euen accorde euerychone take rycheſſe onely ſworne hath full hauteynly ſhe caſtell nyll aſſayle n • ūn • te ſtroke thys batayle wyth darte ne mace ſpeare ne knyfe man ſpeaketh beareth lyfe blameth empryſe ywys hoſte departed leeſt waye thys plyte hath ſhe thys man dyſpyte ſhe ſayeth ne loued neuer therfore ſhe woll hate hym euer woll gather treaſore hath wrath euermore agylte neuer caas lo holy hys treſpas ſayeth well thys daye aſked leaue gone waye clypped moche yeuynge ſpake full fayre hys prayenge prayed poore therfore ſhe warned hym entre ne yet thryuen ſo hath getten peny two quytely hys owne holde thus hath rycheſſe v tolde rycheſſe v thys recorded wythouten ben accorded fynde accordaunce falſe semblant abſtinaunce wyth folke batayle shull hynder gate aſſayle wycked tonge hath kepynge wyth hys norman full ianglynge hem curteſy largeſſe ſhull ſhewe hardyneſſe olde wyfe kepte ſo harde fayre welcomynge wythin warde ſhall delyte well helynge fonde shame adowne brynge wyth hooſt early late ſhull aſſaylen ylke gate agaynſt drede ſhall hardyneſſe aſſayle alſo sykerneſſe wyth folke leadynge neuer wyſt fleynge fraunchyſe ſhall fyght eke pyte daūgere ful cruelte thus hooſt ordeyned wele ſhal ye caſtel euery dele yf eueryche hys entent venus preſent mother full veſſelage canne ynough ſuche vſage wythouten maye wyght ſpede thys werke neyther worde ne dede therfore good ye ſende maye thys worke amende lordynges mother goddeſſe lady mayſtreſſe ny al wyllyng ne doth al deſyryng yet canne ſhe ſomtyme done labour luſte ſocour nede atcheue nowe thynke nat greue mother ſhe chylde hede worſhyp eke drede dredeth ſyre ne dame shall abye body name natheleſſe yet conne sende yf nede ſhe nygh ſhe cōmen wolde trowe nothynge myght holde mother great proweſſe hath tane many fortereſſe coſt hath many poūd er na preſent ywys yet men ſayd dede come neuer ſtede ne ne lyketh ſo mote ſuche toures ben take wyth thynketh wyſe maye cleped marchaundyſe go bye courſer blacke whyte paye therfore arte yu quyte marchaūt oweth ye right noght ne thou hym thou bought woll ſellynge clepe yeuynge ſellynge aſketh guerdonynge lyeth thanke ne meryte one goeth quyte thys ſellynge ſemblable hys horſe ſtable maye ſelle agayne parde wynnen ſuche happe maye maye manne leſe ywys leeſt ſkynne hys el yf ſo betyde woll kepe hys horſe ryde yet lorde aye hys horſe thylke chaffare well worſe venus entremeteth ought ſo ſuche chaffare hath bought ſhall worchen ſo wyſely ne ſhall leſe vtterly hys money hys caffare ſeller ware pryſe profite haue ſhall certayne byer ſhall leſe ne ſo dere bye haue lordſhyppe full mayſtry ne haue power make lettynge neyther yefte ne preachynge hys chaffare maugre hys another ſhall haue moche ywys yf woll yeue moche h • countrey ſo ryght nought ſo happe maye yf flatter paye ben ſuche marchauntes wyſe fooles euery wyſe bye ſuche thynge wylfully leſe good folyly natheleſſe thys dare ſaye mother wonte paye ſhe neyther ſo foole ne nyce entremete ſuche vyce truſt well ſhall paye repent hys bargayne ſhall pouerte putte hym dyſtreſſe ſcholer rycheſſe great yernynge ſhe aſſenteth wyllynge bvt mother ſaynt venus father saturnus engendred hys lyfe vpon hys wedded wyfe yet woll vnto ſwere make thys thynge ſurere nowe fayth beaute owe brother free whych ny wyght vnder heuen father name neuen dyuers ſo many wyth mother haue pryue yet wolde ſwere ſyckerneſſe pole helle wytneſſe nowe drynke thys yere clarre yf lye forſworne goddes vſage ſo hym forſweareth amys shall yere drynke clarre nowe haue ſworne ynough parde yf forſwere lorne woll neuer forſworne syth rycheſſe hath ſayled ſhall abye treſpas full dere leeſtwaye arme wyth ſwerde ſparth gyſarme certes ſyth ſhe loueth fro thylke tyme ſhe maye ſe caſtell toure ſhake ſorye tyme ſhe ſhall awake yf maye grype ryche manne ſhall ſo pulle hym yf canne ſhall fewe ſtoundes leſe hys markes hys poundes ſhall hym make hys pen ſlynge hys garner ſprynge maydens ſhall eke plucke hym ſo hym ſhall neden fethers mo make hym ſell hys lande ſpende bette conne hym defende poore men han made lorde thoughe ſo myghtye maye fede delyte woll haue hem dyſpyte good man hateth hem geſſe chynche feloun rycheſſe ſo chaſe hem dyſpyſe hem defoule ſondrye wyſe louen ful bette ſo god ſpede dothe riche chynchy grede bene good faythe ſtable trewer ſeruyable therfore ſuffyſeth good herte beaute han ſette thought therfore foryet hem nought woll hem brynge great nobleſſe god rycheſſe god loue ſothely suche routh vpon playnt haue therfore muſte hys ſocour payneth hym ſeruen yf deyde loue thys ſemeth loue ther sir ſayd ſoth euery dele ye reherce wot wele thylke oth hold reſonable good couenable ye rych mē han ſworne ſyr thys wote well beforne yf ryche men done homage fooles done outrage ye ſhull forſworne ne let therfore drynke clarre pyment maked freſhe newe ladyes ſhull hem ſuche pepyr brewe yf fall laas wo mowe ſayne ala ladyes ſhullen euer ſo curteys ſhall quyte othe free ne ſeketh neuer vycayre ſhall ſpeake wyth hem ſo fayre ye ſhall holde ye payde full wele though ye medle neuer dele late ladyes worche wyth thynges ſhall hem tell ſo fele tydynges moue hem eke ſo many requeſtes ſlatery honeſt therto yeue hem ſuche tankynges wyth kyſſynge wyth thalkynges certes yf trowed shall neuer leaue hem londe ne fee nyll moeble fare whych fyrſt delyuered nowe maye ye tell v wyll heſtes ſhall fulfyll bvt falſe ſēblant dare drede ſyr medle hym thys dede ſayeth ye ben hys fo yf ye wol worche hym wo wherfore praye beauſyre ye forgyue hym nowe yre maye dwell man wyth abſtinence hys dere lemman thys acorde wyll nowe parfey ſayd loue graunt woll well holde hym man nowe let hym come forth ran falſe ſemblant ꝙ loue thys wyſe take ſeruyce thou frendes helpe alwaye hyndreth hem neyther nyght ne daye thy myght hem releue eke enemyes thou greue thyne thys myght graunt kynge harlotes ſhalte thou woll thou haue ſuche honour certayne thou arte falſe traytour eke thefe ſyth thou borne thouſande tymes thou arte forſworne natheleſſe herynge put folke doutynge bydde teche hem woſt thou howe ſome generall ſygne nowe place thou ſhalt founden yf men myſter howe men ſhall beſt eſpye knowe great mayſtrye tell place thyne hauntynge syr haue full dyuers wonnynge kepe reherſed ye wolde reſpyten yf tell ſothe maye haue harme ſhame bothe yf felowes wyſten tale ſhulden quyt certayne wolde hate yf euer knewe cruelte wolde ouer holde hem ſtyll trouth agayne wyll suche tale kepen myght eftſone bye full dere yf ſayd hem thynge ought dyſpleaſeth herynge worde hem prycke byteth worde none hem delyteth goſpell euangyle wolde reproue hem gyle cruell hautayne thys thynge wote well certayne yf ſpeake ought payre loo court ſhall ſo well cloos ne ſhall wyte laſt good men nought agaſt woll taken hem nothynge knowe meanynge woll hem take woll hym ſelfe ſuſpecious make hys lyfe let couertly gyle ipocriſy engendred yaue foſtrynge made full good engendrynge quod loue ſo ſothly tell engendred dyuell hell bvt nedely howe ſo euer quod loue wyll charge ye tel anon thy wōning place hearynge eche wyght thys place lyfe thou lyueſt alſo hyde lenger nowe wherto thou muſt dyſcouer thy worchynge howe thou ſerueſt thynge though yt thou ſhuldeſt thy ſoth ſawe ben beaten drawe yet arte thou wonte parde natheleſſe though thou beaten thou ſhalt fyrſt ſo hath ſothſawe ſuffred wo syr ſyth maye lyken thoughe ſhulde ſlayne ryght nowe ſhal done cōmaūdement therto haue great talent wythoutē wordes mo ryght falſe sēblant hys ſermō began ſayd hem thus audience baron take hede ſentēce ye wyght yt lyſt haue knowing falſe ſemblant full flateryng muſt worldly folke hym ſeke certes cloyſters eke wone hem twey lyke euen ſoth ſay shortly woll herberowe hope beſt hulſtred certaynly ſykereſt hydynge vnderneth humbleſt clothynge religious folke ben full couerte seculer folke ben apperte natheleſſe wyll blame religious folke ne hem dyffame habyte euer go religyon humble trewe alſo woll blame ne dyſpyſe nyll loue wyſe meane falſe religious ſtoute ben malicious wollen habyte go ſetten herte therto religious folke ben pytous thou ſhalt ſene one dyſpytous louen pryde ne ſtryfe humbly woll lede lyfe wyth whych folke woll neuer yf dwell fayne maye well habyte go leuer necke two lette purpoſe take couenaunt euer make dwell wyth hem proude full wyles ſubtelte worſhyp thys worlde coueyten great nede connen expleyten gone gadren great pitaunces purchace hem acqueyntaunces men myghty lyfe may leden fayne hem poore hem ſelfe feden wyth good morcels delicious drynken good wyne precious preche v pouert dyſtreſſe fyſhen hem ſelfe great rycheſſe wyth wyly nettes caſte woll come foule laſte ben fro clene religion went make worlde argument hath foule concluſyon haue robe religion religious thys argument roignous worth croked brere habyte ne maketh neyther monke ne frere clene lyfe deuocion maketh good men religion natheleſſe none anſwere howe hygh euer hys heed ſhere wyth raſour whetted neuer ſo kene gyle braunches cutte thurtene wyght dyſtyncte ſo dare ſaye worde therto herberowe euer take ſemblaunt euer make meane gyle folowe ryght gybbe cat awayteth myce rattes kyllen ne entende begylen ne wyght may clothynge wete wyth folke dwellynge ne wordes yet parde ſoft ſo pleaſaunt beholde dedes thou blynde thou oughteſt ſo varye wordes fro dede thynke gyle wythout drede maner clothynge eſtate euer bere leted leude lorde lady knyght ſquyer burgeys bayly ryght thus whyle falſe ſemblant lede wycked lyfe parfey ne therfore ſoules leſe hem worldly clothes cheſe certes great pyte menne maye ſeculer clothes ſe floryſhen holy religioun full many ſaynt felde towne wyth many virgyn glorious fayre chylde weared alwaye clothes ſeculere ſame dydden ſayntes ben alwaye ¶the xi thouſande maydens dere bearen heuen cierges clere whych men rede church ſynge take ſeculer clothynge receyued cruelte wolde hym folowe tho flye wolues ſuche hewe amonges theſe apoſtles newe thou holy church thou mayſt bewayled syth thy cyte aſſayled knyghtes thyne owne table god wote thy lordſhyp doutable yf enforſe wyn ſhulde defende fro wythin myght defence ayenſt hem make wythout ſtroke mote take trepeget mangonell wythout dyſplayenge penſell yf god nyll done ſocoure let renne thys coloure thou muſte thy heeſtes letten nought yelde yeue hem trybute doutles holde hem haue pee greater harme betyde mayſter well conne ſcorne wythall day ſtuffen wall nyght mynen naye thou planten muſte el thyne ympes yf thou wolt fruyte haue abyde thy ſelfe ſaue bvt peace turne agayne woll nomore thys thynge ſayne yf maye paſſen hereby myght maken wery woll heten alwaye helpe frendes maye wollen company ſhent vtterly yf ſo fall ofte wyth hem wyth eke lemman mote ſerue ſhull loue deſerue forſoth falſe traytour god iuged thefe trechour forſworne well nygh none wote gyle tyll done tthrough hath many one death chaunge euery ſhappe homely ſtraunge coude neuer ſuche gyle ne treaſoune come neuer towne myght knowen though men myght ſe full well clothes chaunge take one make another ſtraunge nowe knyght nowe chaſtelayne nowe prelate nowe chapelayne nowe preeſt nowe clerke nowe foſtere nowe mayſter nowe ſcholere nowe monke nowe chanon nowe bayly euer myſter man nowe prynce nowe page herte euery langage somtyme hoore olde nowe yonge ſtoute bolde nowe robert nowe robyn nowe frere mynor nowe iacobyn wyth foloweth loteby done ſolace company hyght dame abſtinence raygned many queynt arraye fayned ryght cometh lykynge fulfyll deſyrynge somtyme woman cloth take nowe mayde nowe lady somtyme religious nowe lyke anker hous somtyme prioreſſe nowe nonne nowe abbeſſe go regiouns sekynge religiouns order ſworne take ſtrawe beate corne ioly folke enhabyte aſke habyte woll ye euery wyſe ryght lyſt dyſgyſe well beare vnder wede vnlyke worde dede thus make trappes fall people priuyleges bene chriſtendome lyue maye aſſoyle maye ſhryue prelate maye let folke euer founde prelate maye done ſo onlye mo made thylke eſtablyſhynge nowe thys propre thynge ſleyghtes aperceyued wonte woſte thou dyd hem tregetry therof yeue lytell tale haue ſyluer male haue preached eke ſhryuen haue take ſo haue yeuen foly huſbande wyfe lede ryght ioly lyfe ſympleſſe prelacye knowe tregettrye bvt moche man wyfe shulde ſhewe peryſhe preeſt lyfe one yere ſaythe boke er wyght hys houſel toke haue priuyleges large maye moche thynge dyſcharge maye ſaye ryght thus parde syr preeſt ſhryfte tell whome ſhryuen hath aſſoyled yeuen penaunce ſothly ſyn whych fonde gylty ne ne haue neuer entencion make double confeſſyon ne reherce efte ſhryft ſhrift ryght ynough thys ought ſuffyſe wele ne rebell neuer dele certes though thou haddeſt ſworne wote preeſt ne prelate borne may ſhrift efte conſtrayne yf done woll playne wote playne wele thou ſhalt ſtreyne dele ne enforce ne trouble make confeſſyon double ne haue none affection haue double abſolution fyrſt right ynough thys latter aſſoylyng quyte vnbounde mayſt thou fynde ſynnes vnbynde myght hath hys honde ſynnes vnbonde yf thou wolte thus conſtrayne mote nedes playne ſhall iuge imperyall ne byſhop ne offyciall done iugement shall gone playne openly vnto ſhriftfather newe hyght frere wolfe vntrewe ſhall chuſe hym trowe hamper lorde wolde wrothe wythall men hym wolde frere wolfe call wolde haue pacience done cruell vengience wolde hys myght done leeſt nothyng ſpare goddes heeſt god ſo wyſe ſocour thou yeue ſauyour eeſter whan lyketh wythout preaſyng woll forthe hym gone ſhall houſell anon thy grutchyng kepe deale wyth nothyng thus may ſhryue hym forſaketh hys paryſhe preeſt taketh yf preeſt woll hym refuſe full redy hym accuſe hym puniſhe hamper ſo churche ſhall go bvt ſo hath hys felyng conſequence ſuch ſhryuyng shall ſene preeſt maye neuer haue myght knowe conſcience right hym vnder hys cure thys ayenſt holy ſcripture byddeth euery heerd honeſt haue knowyng hys beeſt poore folke gon ſtrete haue golde ne ſommes grete hem wolde let prelate let preeſtes knowe ſtates right nought yeue ne may ben ſo bare take kepe woll haue fatte ſhepe let paryſhe preeſtes haue lene yeue harme bene yf prelate grutche oughten woth wyt leſe fatte beeſtes ſo ſhall yeue hem ſtroke two ſhall leſen wyth force ye bothe mytre croce thus iape hem haue longe priuileges ben ſo ſtronge falſe semblaunt wolde haue ſtynted loue ne made hym ſuche chere werye hys ſawe make hym glad fawe ſayd • ſpecially howe tha • thou ſerueſt vntruely tell • orthe ſhame neuer dele • hyne h • oyt ſheweth wele thou ſerueſt holy heremyte sothe ypocryte thou goſt precheſt pouerte ye ſyr rycheſſe hath poſte thou precheſt abſtynence alſo syr woll fyllen ſo mote go paunche good meate wyne ſhulde maiſter diuyne thowe poore fayne yet poore folke diſdayne loue better acqueyntaunce ten tymes kyng fraunce poore mā mylde mode though hys ſoule alſo good whan ſe beggers quakyng naked myxins ſtynkyng hongre crye eke care entremet fare ben ſo poore full pyne myght one yeue dyne haue nothyng lyfe ſhulde yeue lycketh hys knyfe folly entremete ſeke houndes neſt fatte mete lette beare hem ſpyttle anone comforte gette none ryche ſycke vſurere wolde viſyte drawe nere hym woll comforte rehete hoope hys golde gete yf wycked dethe hym haue woll go wyth hym hys graue yf reproue lette poore woſt thou howe aſcape ſaye ſwere hym full rape riche menne han tetches ſynne han poore wretch hanne counſayle myſter therfore wolde drawe hem ner great hurte maye ſo hath ſoule right great pouerte ſoule great richeſſe forſothe al hurten bothe richeſſe mendicitees bene cleped two extremytees meane cleped suffyſaunce lyeth vertue aboundaunce salomon full well wote hys parable v wrote knowe many wyght hys thrittene chapiter ryght god thou kepe thy poſte fro rycheſſe mendycite yf ryche manne hym dreſſe thynke moche rycheſſe hys herte ſo ferre ſette hys creatour dothe foryette hym beggeth woll aye greue howe ſhulde hys worde hym leue vnneth ny mycher forſworne el goddes lyer thus ſaythe salomon ſawes ne fynde written lawes namely chriſten laye ſo ſaythe yea dare ſay naye chriſt ne hys apoſtels dere walked erthe neuer ſeen herbred beggyng nolden beggen nothyng right thus men wont teche thys wyſe wolde preche mayſters dyuinyte somtyme parys cyte yf men wold gayne appoſe naked texte lette gloſe myght ſoone aſſoyled menne may wel yt ſoth ſe pardie myght aſke thynge playnly forthe wythout beggynge goddes heerdes dere cure ſoules hadden nolde nothyng begge foode chryſt done rodde wyth theyr proper hondes wrought wyth traueyle el nought wonnen ſuſtenaunce lyueden forthe penaunce remenaunt yaf awaye poore folkes alwaye neyther bylden towre ne halle houſes ſmall wyth alle mighty man canne maye shulde wyth hys honde body alwaye wynne hym hys foode laboryng ne haue rent ſuche thyng though relygious god ſeruen curyous thus mote done treſpas yf certayne caas reherce yf myſter ryght well whan tyme iſe seke boke ſaynt auſtyne ī paper perchmyne writte theſe worchynges thou ſhalt ſene none excuſynges parfyte man ne ſhulde ſeke wordes ne dedes eke though religyous god ſeruen curyous ne ſhall ſo mote go wyth propre hondes body alſo get hys fode laboryng ne haue proprete thyng yet ſhulde fell hys ſubſtaunce hys ſwynke haue ſuſtenaunce parfyte bounte thus han bookes tolde woll gone ydelly vſeth aye beſyly haunten mennes table trechour full fable ne ne may good reaſon excuſe hym hys oriſon men behoueth ſome gyſe ben ſomtyme goddes ſeruyſe gone purchaſen nede men mote eaten drede ſlepe eke thyng longe may leaue prayeng may eke prayer blynne whyle werke meate wynne seynt auſtyn woll therto accorde thylke boke recorde iuſtinian eke made lawes hath thus forboden olde ſawes man vp payne deed mighty body begge hys breed may ſwynke gete men ſhuld hym rather mayme bete done hym aperte iuſtyce ſuffren hym ſuche malyce done well ſo mote go taken ſuche almeſſe ſo yf haue ſomme priuilege payne hem woll alege howe ſe yf prynce diſceyued ne ne wene ſykerly may haue ryghtfully woll determyne prince power ne defyne ne worde comprehende iwys ſo ferre may ſtretche thys woll intremete dele trowe boke ſaythe wele taketh almeſſes dewe folke men may ſe lame feble wery bare poore ſuche maner care conne wynne hem neuer mo haue power therto eateth hys owne dampnyng yf lye made thyng yf ye ſuche truaunt fynde chaſtyſe hym well yf ye kynde wolde hate parcaas ye fyllen laas wolde eftſones ſcatche might late rathe full pacient han worlde thus foule blent weteth well god bad good man ſell folowe hym poore yeue wolde therfore lyue ſeruen hym mendience neuer hys ſentence werken whan nede folowe hym good dedes saynt poule loued holy churche bade apoſtels wurche wynnen lyue lode wyſe hem defended truandyſe ſayd werketh wyth honden thus ſhulde thyng vnderſtonden nolde iwys haue byd hem beggyng ne ſellen goſpell ne prechyng leſt berafte wyth aſkyng folke catell thyng thys worlde many man yeueth hys good ne werne ſhame el wolde aſker delyuered hym encombreth ſo yeueth hym good let hym go hym thyng profyte leſe yefte meryte good folke poule preched profred hym ofte whan hem teched good charyte therfore right nothyng toke hys hondewerke wolde gete clothes wryne hym hys mete tell howe man may lyuen al good poore hath yeuen woll onely bydde hys bede neuer wyth hondes labour hys nedes maye ſo ye ſyr howe syr woll gladly tell seynt auſten ſaith man may houſes han properte templers hoſpytelers theſe chanons regulers whyte monkes theſe blake woll mo enſamples make take therof hys ſuſteynyng therin lythe beggyng otherwayes ywis yet auſtyn gabbeth thys yet full many monke laboureth god holy churche honoureth whan ſwynkyng agon rede ſynge churche anon hath ben great diſcorde manye wyght may beare recorde vpon eſtate mendicience woll ſhortly preſence tel howe man may begge nede hath wherwith hym fede maugre hys felowes iangelynges ſothfaſtneſſe woll none hydynges yet parcaſe may abey ſothly thus ſey lo caſe eſpeciall man ſo beſtyall crafte hath ſcience nought deſyreth ignorence thā may go begging yerne tyll ſome maner crafte lerne whyche wythout truandyng may trouthe haue hys lyuyng yf may done labour elde ſickneſſe langour hys tendre age alſo may yet beggyng go yf haue perauenture vſage hys noriture lyued ouer delyciouſly oughten good folke comenly han hys miſchefe ſome pyte ſuffren hym alſo may gon aboute begge hys breed honger deed yf haue crafte connyng ſtrength alſo deſyryng worchen fynde neyther thys ne may begge tyll haue getten hys neceſſyte yf hys wynnyng ſo lyte hys labour woll acquyte suffyciantly hys lyuyng yet may go hys breed beggyng fro doore doore may go trace tyll remenaunt may purchace yf man wolde vndertake empriſe make reſcous lay defenden may armes lettrure couenable cure ſo poore may begge tyll may fynde trouthe ſwynke get hym clothe meate drynke swynke wyth hys hondes corporell wyth hondes eſpyrituell caſe ſemblables ben mo reſonables may begge tell el manere willyam ſeynt amour wolde preche ofte wolde diſpute teche thys mater openly parys full ſolemply alſo god ſoule bleſſe thys ſtedfaſtneſſe accorde vniuerſyte people ſemeth good man ought refuſe ne ought hym therof excuſe wrothe blythe ſo woll ſpeke tel ſhulde dye put doun ſeynt poule derke priſoun exiled thys caas wyth wronge mayſter william mother hypocriſe banyſſhed great enuye mother flemed hym seynt amour thys noble dyd ſuche labour ſuſteyne euer loyalte moche agylte made boke let write wheryn hys lyfe dyd write wolde yche renyed beggyng lyued traueylyng ne rent ne good weneth wood labour might neuer pleſe haue wyll ben eſe haue well leuer ſothe ſaye people pattre pray wrye foxerye vnder cope papelardie qvod loue dyuell wordes telleſt yu ſir falſneſſe apert dredeſt thou god certis▪ ſelde great thyng ſhall ſpede worlde god woll drede folke hem vertue yeuen truely owne lyuen hem goodneſſe aye coutene hem confeſſour empreſſes ducheſſes theſe quenes eke counteſſes theſe abeſſes eke bygyns theſe great ladyes palaſyns theſe iolye knyghtes bayliues theſe nonnes theſe burgeys wyues ryche ben eke pleſyng company ſhrewes ben great whyche woll hyde holde pryuite tolde worde ſigne ywis ne woll make hem knowe wollen alſo tellen hele fro pryuite make hem perceyuen vſen folke thus diſceyuen woll ſayne withouten drede menne maye goſpell rede ſaynt mathue goſpelere ſaythe ſhall ſaye vpon chayre moyſes thus gloſed doutlees olde teſtament therby chayre ment sytte scribe pharyſen ſayne curſed men whyche hypocrite call dothe preche rede dothe nat done dele bene nat wery ſaye wele well wyll haue wolde bynde folke alwaye bene begyled able burdons ben importable folkes ſhulders thynges couchen nyll wyth fyngers touchen woll nat touche hem ne lyſte nat ſykerly ſadde burdons men taken make folkes ſhulders aken yf ought good folke ſhulde ſe burdons larger maken make hemmes wyde alwaye louen ſeates table fyrſte moſt honorable hanne fyrſte chayris ſynagogges hem full dere wyllen folke hem loute grete whan paſſen ſtrete wollen cleped mayſter alſo ne ſhulde nat wyllen ſo goſpell agaynſt geſſe ſheweth well wyckedneſſe another cuſtome vſe hem wol ayenſt v hate hī deedly euerichone wol werrey one hym ye one hateth hate al cōiecte done fal yf ſene hym wynne honour rycheſſe preyſe hys valour prouende rente dignyte full faſte ywis compaſſen ladder clomben ſo maken hym downe go trayſon woll hym defame done hym leſe hys good name thus hys ladder hym take thus hys frendes foe make worde ne wete ſhall noon tyll hys frendes bene hys foon yf dyd openly myght haue blame redily hadde wyſte malyce hadde hym kepte nyce another thys yf ſo fall ther one amōge v al doth good tourne drede ſayne alder dede ye ſikerly though famed hym lyſte hym dayned manne hym auaunced therof parceners tellen folke ſo go manne v ſprongen ſo haue menne preyſyng purchace flatterynge ryche menne great poſte letter wytneſſe bounte manne weneth maye v ſe vertue v alwaye poore v fayne howe ſo begge playne bene folke without leaſyng thynge haue wythout hauyng thus dradde people ywis gladly purpoſe thys ¶i deale wyth wyght haue golde treaſour great plente acqueyntaunce well loue thys moche deſyre ſhortely entremete brocages make peace mariages gladly executour many tymes procuratour ſomtyme meſſagere falſeth nat myſtere many tymes make enqueſte offyce nat honeſt deale mennes thynge great lykynge yf ye haue ought place repeyre ſhall ſpeden wyt ſoone ye haue tolde ye ſerue paye ſeruyce ſhalbe alwaye ſo wol chaſtyce anone loue loſt hath loue man gyſe wol repreue chaſtyce wolde al folke vndertake wyght teachyng take folke chaſty wol taught fro foly loue none hermytage al deſertes holtes hoore greate woodes euerychone let baptiſte iohn queth hym quyte hym releſſe egypte al wylderneſſe ferre al manſions fro al city good town paleys myne houſe make menne may renne openly ſaye worlde forſake al amydde bylde make houſe ſwymme playe therinne bette fyſhe doth wyth hys fynne antechriſtes menne whiche chriſte ſayeth openly haue habyte holyneſſe lyuen ſuch wyckedneſſe copye yf hym talent toke euangeliſtes boke ther myght ſe great trayſon ful many falſe compariſon moche though hys greate myght heate lyght ſunne ſurmounteth moone troubler chaungeth ſoone nutte kyrnel ſhelle ſkorne telle ryght ſo wythouten gyle surmounteth thys noble euangyle worde euangeliſt tytel token chriſt many ſuch comparyſoun whyche make mencioun myght men booke fynde ſo coulde hem haue mynde vniuerſyte tho ſlepe gan brayde taken kepe noyſe heed vp caſt ne neuer ſythen ſlepte faſt vp ſterte armes tooke ayenſt thys falſe horrible booke redy batayle make iuge boke take broughten boke hent anone away fere nolde ſhewe dele kepte kepen wele tyl ſuch tyme may ſe ſo ſtronge woxen wyght maye hem wel wythſtonde boke durſt nat ſtonde awaye gonne bere ne durſt nat anſwere expoſitioun gloſe clerkes wol appoſe ayenſt curſedneſſe ywys boke wrytten wotte nat ne nat ſe maner ende ſhall al thys hyde yet algate ſhal abyde tyl may bette defende thys trowe beſt woll ende thus antechriſt abyden bene al hys meyne man wol ſo ryght ſoone ſhal hys lyfe go outwarde lamben ſemen ful goodneſſe pyte inwarde wythouten fable bene gredy wolues rauyſable enuyroun lande ſee wyth al worlde werryen wol ordayne al thyng folkes good lyuyng caſtel citye wherin bougerons al though myllayne therof bene blamed yf wyght meaſure wolde leane golde take vſure ſo coueytous yf lecherous theſe haunten simonye prouoſt ful trechery prelate lyuyng iolyly preeſt halte hys queyn hym olde hoores hoſtylers baudes bordellers el blamed vyce whyche men ſhulden done iuſtyce al ſayntes prey defende wyth lamprey wyth luce wyth elys wyth ſamons wyth tendre gee capon wyth tartes wyth cheffes fatte wyth deyntye flaunes brode flatte wyth caleweys wyth pullayle wyth conynges fyne vytayle vnder clothes wyde maken golet glyde wol come haſte roe venyſon bake paſte whether ſo loure groyne ſhal haue corde loygne wyth whiche men ſhal hym bynde lede brenne hym hys ſynful dede men ſhulde hym crye rore myle waye aboute el ſhal priſon dye yf wol hys frendſhyp bye ſmerten hath hys gylte amounteth couth hys ſleyght make vp toure heyght nought rought wheder ſtone tre erth turnes though though vounde ſtone wrought wyth ſquyre ſcantilone toure ſtuffed wel wyth al rycheſſe temporel wolde vp dreſſe engyns leſſe caſt v euery ſyde bere hys good name wyde ſleyghtes ſhal neuen barels wyne ſyxe ſeuen golde ſackes greate plente ſhulde ſone delyuered yf haue ſuch pytences let hym ſtudy equipolences let lye fallaces wolde deſerue grace ſhal beare hym ſuch wytneſſe • • nne hys wretchedneſſe 〈◊〉 done hys loſe ſo wyde renne al quicke ſhulde hym brenne el yeue hym ſuch penaunce wel worſe pytaunce thou ſhalt neuer nothyng con knowen ryght clothyng traitours ful trecherye thou werkes aſpye ne good kepyng whylom vniuerſite kepeth key chriſtendome bene turmented al ſome bene ſtynkyng prophetis ny none hem good prophete wycked entention yere incarnation thouſande two hundred yere fyue fyfty ferther ne nere broughten boke wyth ſory grace yeue enſample comune place ſayd thus though fable thys goſpel pardurable fro holy ghoſt ſent wel worth bene brent entytled ſuch manere thys boke whyche tel na wyght al parys beforne lady parnys ne myght booke ſentence pleaſed hem well trewly wol ſtynte thys matere wonder longe ylke boke endured better eſtate enſured frendes haue yet parde han ſet great degre al thys worlde emperour gyle father trechour empreſſe mother maugre holy ghoſt ywys myghty lynage route reygneth euery reygne aboute wel worthy mayſtres al thys worlde gouerne folke ſo wel diſceyue none gyle perceyue though done dare ſay ſoth dare wyght bewray chriſtes wrath hym ledeth chriſt brethern dredeth ny ful good champion dredeth ſuch ſimilacion payne wol refuſen v correcte accuſen wol entremete ryght ne haue god hys eye ſyght therfore ſhal god hym punyce ne recketh vyce sythen men v louen comunably holden v ſo worthy may folke repreue echone nyl haue reprefe none ſhulden folke worſhypen ſo v ſtynten neuer mo patren whyle folke may v ſe though ſo behynde hem woode foly enhaunce chiualry loue noble men gaye ioly clothes alwaye ſuch folke ſemen clene men clothes demen wordes folowe dede great pyte drede wol none hypocritis hem thynketh great ſpyte loue hem ſyde beggers wyth theſe hoodes wyde wyth ſleygh pale face leane graye clothes nat ful cleane fretted ful tatarwagges hygh ſhoes knopped wyth dagges frouncen lyke quayle pype bootes ryuelyng gype ſuch folke deuyſe shulde prince theſe lordes wyſe take al landes thynges warre peace gouernynges ſuch folke ſhulde prince hym yeue wolde hys lyfe honour leue yf nat ſeme ſeruen thus worlde queme wolde dwelle diſceyue folke ſhal parceyue ne ſpeke ſuche wyſe men ſhulde humble habytte diſpyſe pride vnder man ſhulde hate thynketh poore man ſuch clothyng god ne preyſeth hym nothyng ſayeth hath worlde forſake hath worldly glory hym take wol ſuch delyces vſe maye begger wel excuſe papelarde hym yeldeth ſo wol worldly eaſe go ſayth worlde hath lefte gredyly grypeth efte hounde ſhame ſayne hys caſtyng goth agayne bvt vnto dare lye myght felen eſpye ye perceyued nothyng ye ſhulde haue ſtarke leaſyng ryght hande thus begynne nolde let ſynne god loughe wonder tho euery wyght ganne laughe alſo ſayd lo man aryght truſty euery wyght falſe ſemblant ꝙ loue ſaye sythe thus haue auaunced courte thy dwellyng rybaudes ſhalt kyng wolte thou wel holden forwardes yee ſir hence forwardes wol people vpon hym areyſe gyle done hym ceyſe hym ſharpe ſpeares ryue wayes brynge hym fro lyue yf wol folowe ywys boke written thus muche wol boke ſignyfye whyle peter hath maſtrye maye neuer iohn ſhewe wel hys myght nowe haue declared ryght meanyng barke rynde maketh ententions blynde nowe erſt wol gyn expowne pythe wythin ſeculers comprehende chriſtes lawe wol defende ſhulde kepen mayntenen ayenſt hem al ſuſteynen falſly people teachen iohan betoketh hem prechen ny lawe couenable thylke goſpell pardurable fro holy ghoſt ſent turne folke bene myſwent ſtrength iohan vnderſtonde grace whych ſay ſtonde doth ſynful folke conuerte hem ieſu chriſt reuerte ful many horriblete maye men booke ſe bene commaunded douteleſſe ayenſt lawe rome expreſſe al wyth antechriſt holden men may boke beholden commaunden ſleen al tho wyth peter ſhall neuer haue myght god forne ſtryfe fyght ne ſhal ynough fynde peter lawe ſhal haue mynde euer beholde ſo mayntene laſt ſhal ſene ſhall al come therto aught ſpeke thylke lawe ſhal ſtonde ihon haue vnderſtonde maugre hem ſhal doun hem brought confuſioun neuer father beforne seruaunt ſo trewe ſyth borne ayenſt al nature sir put auenture though ye borowes take ſykerer ſhal ye neuer hoſtages ne ſykerneſſe charter bere wytneſſe take ſelfe recorde men ne maye manere teren wolfe hys hyde tyl ſlayne backe ſyde though men hym beate al defyle wene ye wol begyle clothed mekely vnder al trechery myne hert chaungeth neuer mo none habyt whych go though haue chere ſimpleneſſe wery ſhreudneſſe lemman ſtrayned abſtenaunce hath miſter purueyaunce ful longe ago dede nere counſayle rede let alone loue anſwerde truſt wythout borowe woll none falſe ſemblaunt thefe anone ryght ylke ſame place treſon al face ryght blacke wythin whyte wythout thankyng hym gan hys knee lout nought euerye man nowe aſſaute ſaylen quod loue ful hardely armed hem comenly ſuch armoure hem fell whan armed fyers fel went hem forth al aroute ſet caſtel al aboute wyl away drede tyl ſo bene dede tyl haue caſtel take foure batels gan make partid hem foure anone toke way forth gone foure gate aſſayle whych kepers woll fayle bene neyther ſycke ne dede hardy folke ſtronge dede nowe wol ſayne countenaunce falſe ſemblaunt abſtinaunce bene wycked tonge went fyrſt helde parlyment whether done maken hem knowen el walken forth dyſgyſed laſte deuyſed wolde gone tapynage pylgrymage lyke good holy folke vnfeyned dame abſtinence ſtreyned toke robe camelyne gan gratche bygyne large couercheife threde wrapped al aboute hede ſhe forgate pſaltere payre beedes eke ſhe bere vpon lace al whyte threde whych ſhe beades bede ſhe ne bought hem neuer dele gyuen wote wele god wote ful holy frere ſayd father dere ſhe ofter went frere hys couent vyſited alſo many ſermon ſayd nolde let man lyue ne wolde ofte ſhryue wyth ſo great deuotion made confeſſion ofte none two heedes one hode one fayre ſhappe deuyſed pale face ſomtyme ſhe falſe traytoureſſe vntrewe lyke ſalowe horſe hewe apocalips ſhewed ſignyfyeth folke beſhrewed bene al ful trecherye pale hypocriſye horſe colour onely deed pale ywys ſuch colour enlangoured abſtinence ywys coloured eſtate ſhe repented vyſage repreſented burdowne al thefte gyle yeue hys yefte ſkryppe faynte diſtreſſe ful elengeneſſe forth ſhe walked ſobrely falſe ſemblaunt ſaynt ie vous die ſuch miſtere done cope frere wyth chere ſymple full pytous hys lokyng diſdeynous ne proude meke ful peſyble hys necke bare byble ſquierly forth gan gon reſt hys lymmes vpon treaſon potent feble hys way went hys ſleue gan thryng raſoure ſharpe wel bytyng forged forge whyche men clepen coupe gorge longe forth waye nomen tyl wycked tonge comen hys gate ſyttyng ſawe folke way paſſyng pylgrymes ſawe faſte beren hem ful mekely humbly wyth hym mette dame abſtinence fyrſt hym grette ſyth hym falſe ſemblant ſalued hem remeued ne dred hem dele whan ſawe face wele alwaye herte hym thought ſo ſhulde knowe hem two wele knewe dame abſtynaunce ne knewe conſtreynaunce ne knewe nat ſhe conſtreyned ne theues lyfe fayned wende ſhe come wyll al fre ſhe come another degre yf good wyl ſhe beganne wyl fayled thanne falſe ſemblant ſayne alſe knewe nat falſe yet falſe falſeneſſe ne coulde eſpye geſſe ſemblant ſo ſlye wrought falſeneſſe ne eſpyed nought haddeſt thou knowen hym beforne thou woldeſt boke haue ſworne whan thou hym ſaugh thylke araye whylome ſo gaye daunce ioly robyn tho become iacobyn ſothly ſo men hym call frere preachours bene good men order wyckedly beren minſtrels yf bene auguſtyns cordylers carmes eke ſacked freers al freres ſhodde bare though ſome hem bene great ſquare ful holy men hem deme eueryche hem wolde good man ſeme ſhalt thou neuer apparence sene conclude good conſequence none argument ywys exiſtence fayled men may fynde alwaye ſopheme conſequence eueneme ſo hath ſubtelte double ſentence ſe whan pylgrymes comen wycked tonge dwelled harneys nygh hem algate wycked tonge adowne ſate badde hem nere hym come tidynges telle hym ſome ſayde hem caſe maketh come place nowe sir ſayde strayned abſtinaunce drye penaunce hertes pytous deuoute cōmen pylgrimes gon aboute wel nyght fote alway go ful doughty ben heeles two thus bothe ben ſent throughoute worlde myſwent yeue enſample preche alſo fyſhen ſynfull menne go fyſhynge ne fyſhe ſyr charite wont herborowe craue lyfe amende chriſt ſaue ſo ſhulde nat diſpleaſe wolden yf caſe ſhorte ſermon vnto ſayne wicked tonge anſwered agayne houſe quod ſuch ye ſe shal warned say lyſt wol graunt mercy ſwete ſyr dere quod alder firſt dame abſtynence thus began ſhe ſentence sir fyrſt vertue certayne greateſt mooſt ſouerayne may founde man hauyng wytte hys tonge refrayne therto ought euery wyght hym payne better ſtyl ſpeken harme parde herkeneth gladly good man ſykerly ſir abouen al ſynne arte thou mooſt gylty inne thou ſpake iape longe ago ſir ryght yuel yonge man repayred neuer yet thys place apayred thou ſaydeſt awayted nothynge deceyue fayre welcomyng ye ſayd nothyng ſoth ſir ye lye tel plat ne cometh ne goth parde trowe ye ſhal hym nen •• ſe fayre welcomynge priſon ofte hath played wyth er thys fayreſt game coulde wythout fylth ſtyl loude nowe dare ſhe ſelfe ſolace ye han alſo man chace dare neyther come ne go meueth hate hym ſo properly wycked thought many falſe leaſyng hath thought meueth youre foole eloquence iangleth euer audience folke areyſeth blame doth hem • ſhonour ſhame thyng maye haue preuyng lykelyneſſe contryuyng dare ſayne reaſon demeth al ſoth thynge ſemeth ſynne controue thyng reproue thys wote ye wele ſyr therfore ye arne blame nathleſſe recketh lyte yeueth nat nowe therof myte yf thought harme parfaye wolde come gone al daye coulde ſelfe abſtene nowe cometh ſene ne taketh cure yf auenture laſſe folke algate thou watcheſt gate wyth ſpeare thyne areſt alwaye muſe muſarde al daye thou wakeſt nyght daye thought iwys thy traueyle nought ieloſy wythouten fayle shal neuer quyte thy trauayle ſkath fayre welcomyng wythout treſpaſſyng shal wrongfully priſon wepeth languyſheth though thou neuer yet ywys agylteſt man thys take grefe worthy put thys bayly afterwarde priſon lye fettre tyl thou dye thou ſhalt thys ſynne dwelle ryght dyuels arſe helle yf thou repent mafaye thou lyeſt falſely quod welcome miſchaunce haue therfore herbered ſaye ſhame eke reproue ſory hap behoue today harbegere go herber el han lyer called two tregeturs art thou myne houſe ſhame ſothe ſawe ye blame ſermon ye make deuyls take el god thou confounde er men dydden caſtell founde paſſeth ten dayes twelue tolde ryght ſelue ſayd ryght ſo tolde kyſt roſe priuyly thus ſayd haue ſayd yore dyd ſhulde men ſaye ſuch thynge yf ben gabbynge ryght ſo ſayd woll ſay yet trowe lyed bemes woll blowe neyghbours arowe hath cōmen gone tho ſpake falſe ſemblaunt ryght anon goſpell dout men ſayne towne laye deefe ere ſpeakyng ſwere ſyr gabbyng trowe ye wot well certaynly man loueth hym tenderly ſayth hym harme yf wote neuer ſo poore wyt ſothe alſo ſykerly knowe ye ſyr well louers gladly woll vyſiten place loues habyten man loueth eke honoureth man ſerue laboureth clepeth frende ſo dere man maketh good chere euery meteth ſalweth greteth preſeth ſo oft ye ought commyng encombred preſen folke full ofter doth nowe yf hert hym ſtrayned ſo vnder roſe go ye ſhulde hym ſene ſo oft nede ye ſhulde take hym dede coude commyng forbeare though hym thrilled ſpeare nere nat nowe truſteth well ſwere clene thought syr certes ne thynketh nought nomore ne doth fayre welcomyng ſore abyeth thynge yf one aſſent full ſoone roſe hent maugre wolde ſyr thyng herkeneth syth ye man loueth han ſayd ſuche harme ſhame wytteth well yf geſſed ye maye well demen wyt noulde nothynge loue ſo ne callen frende alſo nyght daye wol wake caſtel deſtroye take yf ſoth ye deuyſe ſome man ſome maner wyſe myght warne hym euery dele hym ſelf perceyue wele ſyth myght come gone whylom wont done myght ſoone wyte ſe nowe otherwyſe wot haue ſyr vtterly deſerued hell iolyly deth hell doutleſſe thrallen folke ſo gyltleſſe falſe ſemblaunte ſo proueth thynge canne none anſwerynge ſeeth alwaye ſuche apparaunce nygh fell repentaunce ſayd hym ſyr maye well semblaunt good man ſemen ye abſtinence full wyſe ye ſeme talent deme counſayle woll ye yeuen ryght anon thou ſhalt ſhryuen ſay thy ſynne without ſhalt thou repent ſore preſt haue poſte ſhryue folke mooſt dignitie ben wyde worlde may dure al worlde haue cure neuer yet perſoun ne vicarie maner toun god wot haue thouſande tymes pytye hath thy preſt parochial though thy frende ſpecyall haue auauntage wyſe prelate ben ſo wyſe ne halfe ſo lettred lycenced boldly diuinitie rede confeſſen drede yf ye woll nowe confeſſe leaue ſynnes leſſe without abode knele downe anon ſhall haue abſolucion finis ¶here endeth romaunt roſe foloweth boke troylous creſeyde ¶troylus creſeyde double ſorow troilus tellen kynge priamus ſonne troy louyng aduentures fellen woo wele ioye purpoſe er parte froye thou theſiphon thou helpe tendite theſe woful verſes wepen write clepe thou goddeſſe tourment thou cruel furye ſorowyng euer payne helpe ſorowful inſtrument helpeth louers complayue well ſyt ſoth ſayne woful wyght haue drerie fere ſorouful tale ſorye • god loues ſeruauntes ſerue ne dare loue myne vnlykelyneſſe prayen ſpede al ſhulde therfore ſterue farre fro helpe derkeneſſe natheleſſe maye done gladneſſe louer cauſe aueyle haue thāke myne trauyle ye louers bathen gladneſſe yf drope pytie remembreth paſſed heuyneſſe ye haue felte aduerſitie folke thynketh ye han felt loue durſt diſpleaſe ye han hym great eaſe prayeth hem ben caſe troylus ye maye heare hem brynge heuen ſolace eke prayeth god ſo dere haue might ſhew ſom manere payne wo loues folke endure troylus vnſely aduenture byddeth eke hem yt ben diſpeyred loue neuer wyl recouered eke hem falſely ben apeyred wycked tonges ſhe thus byddeth god benignitie ſo graūt hem ſone world pace ben diſpayred loues grace byddeth eke hem bene eaſe god hem graūt aye good perſeueraūce ſende hem grace loues pleaſe loue worſhyp pleaſaunce ſo hope ſelfe beſt auaunce praye hem yt loues ſeruauntes wryte wo lyue charitie haue hem compaſſyoun though owne brother dere herkeneth good ententioun wyll go ſtreyght matere ye maye double ſorowes troylus louyng creſeyde ſhe forſoke er yt ſhe dyed well wyſt grekes ſtronge armes thouſande ſhyppes went troye wardes cytie longe beſiegeden nygh ten yeres er ſtent dyuers wyſe one entent rauyſhyng wreke quene heleyne parys wroughtē al peyne fell ſo ye towne dwellyng lorde great authoritie great diuyne cleped calcas ſcience ſo expert knewe wel troye ſhulde deſtroyed anſwere god hyght thus dan phebus apollo delphicus whā calcas knewe calculing eke anſwere god apollo grekes ſhulde ſuch people bryng thorowe troye muſt fordo caſt anon towne go wel wyſt ſort troye ſholde deſtroyed yea wolde ſo nolde wherfore departen ſoftely toke purpoſe ful knowyng wyſe grekes hoſt full priuyly ſtale anon curteys wyſe dyd hym worſhyp ſeruyce truſt hath connyng hem rede euery peryll drede great rumour roſe whā fyrſt eſpyed towne openly ſpoken calcas traytour fled alyed hem grece caſt wroken hym falſly hath fayth broken ſayd kynne atones worthy brent fel bone calcas lefte miſchaūce vnwyſt falſe wycked dede doughter whiche great penaunce lyfe ſhe ful ſore drede wyſt neuer beſt rede wyddowe ſhe al alone nyſt whō ſhe myght make mone creſeyde ladyes name aryght dome al troyes cytie moſt fayreſt lady fer paſſynge euery wight angelyke ſhone natyle beautie mortall thyng ſemed ſhe therwith ſhe ſo parfyte creature ſhe made ſcornyng nature lady daye herde eare father ſhame falſhed trayſoun full nigh wit ſorowe feare widowes habite large ſamite brown hector knee ſhe fyl adowne mercy bad ſelfe excuſyng pitious voyce tenderly wepynge hector pytious nature ſawe ſhe ſorowful begone ſhe ſo fayre creature goodneſſe gladded anon ſayd let father trayſon gone forthwith miſchaūce ye ſelfe ioye dwelleth v whyle lyſt troye yt honour yt men may haue ferforth thogh father dwel • ſhull haue body ſhull men ſaue may ought enquyre ſhe thāked ful humble chere ofter wolde ben wyll toke leaue went home held ſtyll houſe ſhe abode wt ſuche meynye tyll honour nede holde whyle ſhe dwellyng cytie kept eſtate yonge olde full welbeloued well men tolde whether ſhe chyldren none rede nat therfore let gone ¶the thynges fellen done werre betwyxen hem troye grekes ofte ſom day boughtē troye derre eft grekes founden nothyng ſofte folke troye thus fortune alofte vnder eft gan hem whelmen courſe aye whyle wroth towne came diſtruction ne falleth purpoſe tell longe digreſſyon fro mater longe dwell troyan ieſtes fell omer dare dyte ſo yt may reden hem wryte though ye grekes hem troy ſhetten citye beſieged olde vſages nolde letten honouren goddes full deuoute aldermoſt honour dout relyke hyght palladion truſt abouen euerychon ſo befyll whan cōmen tyme april whan clothed mede newe grene luſty veer pryme ſwete ſmellyng floures whyte red ſondry wyſe ſhewed rede folke troy theyr obſeruaunces olde palladions feeſt went holde vnto temple theyr beſt wyſe generallye went many wyght herken palladions ſeruyce namely many iuſtye knyght many lady freſh mayden bright full wele arayed moſt leeſt ſeaſon hye feeſt amonge theſe folke creſeyda wydowes habyt blacke natheleſſe ryght fyrſt letter nowe beautie fyrſt ſo ſtode ſhe makeleſſe goodly lokyng gladded prees na neuer ſene thyng prayſed derre vnder cloude blacke ſo bryght ſterre creſeyd ſayden euerychone behelde blacke wede yet ſhe ſtode full lowe ſtyl alone behynde folke lytle brede nyt dore vnder ſhames drede symple attyre debonayre chere full aſſured lokyng • manere troylus wont guyde yonge knyghtes lad hem vp downe thylke large temple euery ſyde beholdyng aye ladyes towne deuocioun none reuen hym reſt ganne prayſe lacke hym leſt walke ful faſt gan wayten yf knyght ſquyre company gan ſyke let eyen bayten woman coude eſpye wolde ſmyle holde folye ſaye hem thus lord ſhe ſlepeth ſoft loue whan thou turneſt full ofte haue herde tel pardieux lyuynge ye louers eke leude obſeruaunces labour folke haue winnyng loue kepynge ſuche doutaunces whā pray loſt wo penaūces fooles blynde nyce ye one ware another ye worde gan caſt vp browe aſcaunces lo well yſpoken god loue gan loken rowe ryght deſpyte ſhope hym wroken kyd anon bowe nat broken ſodaynly hyt hym full yet proude peckoke gan pull blynde worlde blynde ententioun often falleth theffect contrayre ſurquedie foule preſumtioun caught proude caught debonair troylus clomben ſtayre lytel weneth mote diſcenden al day fayleth fooles wenden proude bayarde begynneth ſkyp waye ſo prycketh hym corne tyl laſh haue longe whyppe thā thinketh though praūce al beforn fyrſt tracie ful fat newe yſhorne yet horſe horſes lawe muſt endure feeres drawe fared fiers proud knight though worthy kynges ſonne wende nothynge ſuche myght ayenſt wyl ſhulde hert ſtere yet loke hert woxe fyre moſt pride aboue woxe ſodaynly moſt ſubiect vnto loue thy enſample taketh man ye wyſe proude worthy folkes ſcornen loue ſo ſone •• edom hertes hym thrall euer euer ſhall loue thyng may bynde man may fordo lawe kynde ſoth hath preued doth yet •• owe ye knowe ſome men reden nat folke han greater wyt thā yt han ben moſt loue ynome ſtrengeſt folke b • n therwith ouercome worthyeſt greateſt degre yet men ſhall ſe trulych ſytte well ſo alder wyſeſt han therwith ben pleſed han ben aldermoſt wo loue han ben comforted moſt eſed oft hath cruell hert apeſed worthy folke made worthyer name cauſeth mooſte dreaden vyce ſhame ſyth may goodly withſtonde thyng ſo vertuous kynde refuſeth nought loue ben bonde syth hym ſeluen lyſt may bynde yerde bet bowen woll wynde ye breſt therfore reed nowe foloweth hym ſo well lede tellen forth ſpecyall kynges ſon tolde leuen thyng collaterall hym thynke tale forth holde ioye care colde werke touchyng matere gan wol therto refere within tēple went forth playīg troylus euery wyght lady lokyng ſo ſhe towne without vpon caſe befell rout eye perced ſo depe went tyll creſeyde ſmote ſtent ſodaynly wonder wext aſtoned gan bet beholde thryfty wyſe god thouȝt wher haſt thou wōned art ſo fayre goodly deuyſe therwith hert gan ſprede ryſe ſoft ſyghed leſt men myght hym caught ayen fyrſt playing chere na nat moſt ſtature lymmes ſo wel anſwering womanhode creature neuer laſſe mannyſh ſemyng eke pure wyſe meanyng shewed wel men myght geſſe honour eſtate womanly nobleſſe tho troylus ryght wonder wel withall gan lyke meanynge chere ſomdele deignous ſhe let fal wolden greue take ye louers oft eſhewe el done good entention full ofte thy lady wol myſſe conſtrewe deme harme opynion yet yf ſhe encheſon wroth thā ſhalt thou haue groin anone lorde wel maye ben beddes fete hym ſette fyrſt gan ſyke efte grone thought aye ſo withouten lette ſatte woke ſpyrite mette ſaugh temple ye wyſe ryght loke gan newe auyſe thus gā make myrrour hys mynde whiche ſaugh al tymes day loſt hewe mochel day fro day hys thought luſte gan quicken increaſe eueryche charge ſet nought thy full ofte hys hotte fyre ceaſe ſene goodly loke gan preaſe therby ben eaſed well wende aye nere brende aye nere fyre hotter trowe knoweth companye ferre nere dare ſay thys nyght day wyſedom folye herte whyche breſtes eye aye fayrer ſene euer heleyne polixene eke day paſſed houre ſelfe thouſande tyme ſeyde god goodly ſerue laboure beſt nowe wolde god creſeyde ye wolden rewe er deyde dere herte ala myne heele hewe lyfe loſte ye woll rewe al dredes hym fledde bothe thaſſiege hys ſauacion ne deſyre non fownes bredde argumentes hys concluſyon ſhe hym wolde han compaſſyon ben man whyle may dure lo hys lyfe dethe cure ſharpe ſhoures fell armes preue hector hys bretherne dydden ne made hym therfore one meue yet washe ſo mē went rydden founde one ye beſte lengeſt tyme abyden peryl dyd eke ſuch trauayle armes thynke meruayle none hate grekes ne alſo reſcous toun ne made hym thus armes mad onely lo thys concluſyoun lyken bette hys renoun fro day day armes ſo ſpedde grekes dethe hym dredde fro forth reſte loue ſlepe made meate foe eke ſorow gan multiplye ſo toke kepe ſhewed hewe eue morow therfore tytle gan hym borowe ſickneſſe leſte men hym wende hotte fyre loue hym brende ſayd feuer fared amys certayne nat ſay hys lady vnderſtode nat thys fayned ſhe nyſte one twey well rede maner wey ne ſemed ſhe hym rought hys payne ſo euer thought felte troylus ſuche wo wel nigh wode aye drede ſhe ſome wyght loued ſo neuer hym ſhe wolde han takē hede thought felt hert blede ne hys wo ne durſt nought begynne tellen thys worlde wynne whan ſpace care thus hym ſelfe full ofte gan playne ſayd foole nowe arte thou ſnare whylom iapedeſt loues payne art yu hēt gnaw thyn chayn thou aye woned eche louer reprehēde thing fro thou canſt yt defende wol nowe euery louer ſayne wyſt▪ euer thyne abſence laughen ſcorne ſayne lo gothe man great ſapience helde v louers leſte reuerence thāked god may gon ye daūce hem loue lyſte febly auaunce thou wofull troylus god wolde syth thou muſt louen thy deſtyne thou beſet ſuche one yt ſholde knowe thy wo lacked pyte alſo colde loue towardes thy lady froſte wynter moone thou fordo ſnowe fyre ſoone god wolde aryued porte dethe whiche ſorowe wol lede ah lorde great comforte quyt languyſſyng drede hyd ſorowe yblowe brede ſhall beiaped ben thouſande tyme ye foole whoſe folye men ryme helpe god ye ſwete whō playne ycaught ye neuer wight ſo faſte mercy dere herte helpe dethe yt lyfe may laſte ſelfe wol loue laſte ſome frēdly loke gladeth ſwete though neuer thyng ye byhete ¶theſe wordes ful many mo ſpake called euer hys compleynte name tellen hys wo tyll nyghe ſalte teeres dreynte al naught ſhe herde pleynte whan bethought folye thouſande folde hys wo gan multiplye bewaylyng hys chambre thus alone frende hys called pandare came one vnware herde grone ſawe hys frende ſuche diſtreſſe care ala ꝙ cauſeth thys fare mercy god vnhap may mene han nowe thus ſone grekes made lene haſte thou ſome remorce cōſcience arte nowe fall ſome deuocioun wayleſt thy ſynne thyne offence haſt ferde caught contricioun god ſaue hem beſieged han toun ſo lay iolyte preſſe brynge luſty folke holyneſſe theſe wordes ſayd none wt ſuch thing miȝt angry makē anger ſorowe fal tyme hys corage awaken wel wyſte ferre tonges ſpaken na man gretter hardyneſſe ne deſyred worthyneſſe ¶what ca ꝙ troylus auenture hath gyded ſene languyſſyng refuſe euery creature loue god prayeng go hence away certes deyeng woll diſeſe mote nedes dey therfore go way ny ſey yf thou wene thus ſycke drede nat ſo therfore ſcorne nought thyng take hede well thā aught ye grekes hā yet wrouȝt cauſe deth ſorow thouȝt though nowe tell ne leſte thou wrothe hyde beſte pādare ye nygh molte wo routh ful often ſayd ala may nowe frende ꝙ yf euer loue trouthe hath ben er betwyxen ne thou neuer ſuche cruelte hyden fro thy frende ſo great care woſte thou nat well pandare woll parten thy payne ſo comforte frendes right ſothe ſayne enterparten wo glad diſporte haue ſhall trewe falſe reporte wronge right yloued al lyue hyde nat thy wo fro tell blyue gan ſoroufull troylus ſyke ſaid thus god leue beſt tellen ſythe may lyke yet wol tell though herte breſt well wote thou mayſte reſt leſte thou deme truſte nat nowe herke frend thus ſtant loue ayenſt whych ſo defendeth hym ſeluen moſte hym alder leeſt auayleth diſpeyre ſo ſoroufully offendeth ſtreight vnto ye deth myne hert ſayleth therto deſyre ſo brennyngly aſſayleth ben ſlayne greater ioye kyng grece troye suffyſeth full frende pandare haue ſaid woſt thou wo loue god colde care hyde well tolde neuer mo harmes myghten folowen mo two wyſt thou gladneſſe let ſterue vnknowe diſtreſſe howe haſt thou thus vnkyndly ¶yea troylus herke ꝙ pandare though nyce happeth often ſo one ax dothe full yuell fare good coūſayle kepe frende therfro haue ſelfe ſeyne blynde man go fell coude loken wyde foole may eke wyſe man ofte gyde whetſtone keruyng inſtrument yet maketh ſharpe keruyng tolis ther yu woſt haue aught miſwent eſchue thou ſuche thyng ſchole often wyſe men ben ware foolis thou ſo thy wyt well bywared contrarye euery thyng declared might euer ſwetneſſe haue know hym neuer taſted bytterneſſe ne man wote gladneſſe trow neuer ſorowe ſome diſtreſſe eke white blacke ſhāe eke worthineſſe eche ſet ſemeth men may ſene ſo wyſe demeth sythe thus two contrary lore haue loue ſo ofte aſſayed greuaunces ought connen well counſaylen thou arte diſmayed eke ne ought nat ben yuell apayed though deſyre wyth bere thyne heuy charge ſhall laſſe dere wote well fared thus thy brother parys hierdeſſe whyche cleped oenone wrote complaynte heuyneſſe ye ſawe letter ſhe wrote geſſ • nay neuer yet iwys ꝙ troylus nowe ꝙ pandare herkeneth thus phebus fyrſt fonde arte medicyne quod ſhe coude euery wightes care remedy rede hertes knewe fyne yet hym ſelfe hys connyng ful bare loue hym ſo bounden ſnare al doughter kyng admete hys craft ne coude hys ſorowe bete right ſo fare vnhappy loue one beſt ſmerteth ſore yet parauenture reden nat ſelfe repreue haue cauſe wot well ſore dothe hauke lyſteth play thyne helpe yet ſomwhat ſay thyng right ſyker mayſt thou certayne dyen payne ſhall neuer mo diſcouer ne trouhe kepe reſtreyne fro thy loue though heleyne thy brother wyfe yf yche wyſte ſhe loue lyſt therfore frendfullyche aſſure tell platte thyn encheſon fynall cauſe wo ye endure douteth nothyng myne entencion na nat reprehenſyon ſpeke nowe wight may byreue man loue tyll hym lyſt leue weteth wel two ben hath none helpe ryſe ſythe thou haſte felowe tell thy mone thys ny nought certayne next wyſe wynnen loue techen v wyſe walowe wepe niobe quene whoſe teeres yet marble ben yſene let thy wepyng thy good comforte thou certaynly fyrſt poynt thys noble corage well ordayne man haue peace wyth hym ſelfe ywys oughteſt thou nought good louen well worthy place ought clepe happe grace alſo thynke therwyth glad ſyth thy lady vertuous foloweth ſome pyte amonges theſe generall ſe thou ſpeciall requyre nought ayen name vertue ſtretcheth hym ſelfe ſhame well euer borne thou beſet arte ſo good place troth ī loue durſt haue ſworne thou ſhuld neuer haue tyde ſo fayre grace woſt yu why▪ yu wont chace loue ſcorne dyſpyte hem call saynt idiote lorde theſe foles often haſt thou made thy nyce iapes breſt ſay god loue thy grace lorde nowe repent yf myſpake nowe ſelfe loue thus ſaye wt thyne herte good entent quod troylus ah lorde conſent pray iapes thou foryeue ſhal neuer whyle lyue thou ſayſt
