nyght glad morowe alſo ioye next fyne ſorowe nowe loke attempre thy brydelle beſt aye ſuffre tyde el labour ydell haſteth well wyſely abyde dyligent trewe aye well hyd luſty free perſeuer thy ſeruyſe well yf thou werke thys wyſe departed euery place hole writen clerkes wyſe wonder ſuche one haue grace eke woſt thou fareth ſome ſeruyſe plante tre herbe ſondrie wyſe morowe pull vp blyue wonder though may neuer thriue ſyth ye god loue hath beſtowed place digne vnto thy worthyneſſe stonde faſt good porte haſt yu rowed thy ſelfe heueneſſe hope alwaye well yf dreryneſſe ouerhaſt labour ſhende hope thys maken good ende woſt yu laſſe afered thys mater wyth nece trete thys haue herde ſaye wyſe lered neuer man woman yet beyete vnapte ſuffre loues hete celeſtiall el loue kynde ſome grace hope fynde ſpeake ſpeciall beauty bethynken youth ſyt nought ben celeſtiall yet though lyſt kouth truely ſyt well ryght nouth worthy knyght louen cheryce ſhe holde vyce wherfore woll ben aye redy payne thys ſeruyce pleaſe thys hope ye ben wyſe conne counſayle kepe ſuche wyſe man ſhall wyſer ſo maye ben gladed thre trouth haue ryght nowe good conceyt wytte geſſe woll nowe thou ſe thynke ſyth loue hys goodneſſe hath conuerted wyckedneſſe thou ſhalt ben beſt poſt leue hys laye moſte hys foe greue enſample ſe theſe great clerkes erren aldermoſt ayen lawe ben conuerted wycked werkes grace god yt leſt hem wtdraw arne folke yt han moſt god awe ſtrengeſt faythed ben vnderſtande conne errour alderbeſt wythſtonde whē troylus herde pandare aſſented ben hys helpe louynge creſeyde wext hys wo ſayeth vnturmēted hotter wext hys loue ſayd wyth ſobre chere though hys hert playde nowe blyſful venus helpe er ſterue ye pandare mowe ſome thāke deſerue dere frende howe ſhal wo leſſe tyll thys done good eke tel thys wylt thou ſayne dyſtreſe leſt wrothe thys drede moſt ywys woll heren howe thys drede eke manere eme ſhe nyll ſuche thynge quod pandarus yu haſt full great care leſt chorle maye fall moone lorde hate nyce fare entremete thou haſt doone goddes loue bydde boone let alone ſhalbe thy beſte frende ꝙ done ryght ye leſte herke pandare worde nolde thou wendeſt ſo great foly lady deſyren ſhulde toucheth harme vylany dredleſſe leuer dye ſhe ought el vnderſtood myght ſownen good tho lough pādarus anon anſwerde thy borow fye wyght doth ſo raught though ſhe ſtode herde howe yt thou ſayeſt fare well woll go dieu glad god ſpede v two yeue thys labour thys buſyneſſe ſpede thyne ſwetneſſe tho troylus gan downe knee fal pandare hys armes hente faſte ſayd nowe fye grekes yet parde god ſhall helpen laſte dredleſſe yf lyfe maye laſte god forne lo ſome hem ſhall ſmerte yet athinketh yt auaūt maſterte nowe pandare ſay thou wyſe thou woſt thou mayſt yu art lyfe death hole thyne hōde lay help ꝙ yes trouth ſhal god yelde frende thys ſpecyall quod troylus thou recōmaunde maye death cōmaunde ¶thys pandarus tho deſyrous ſerue hys full frende ſayd thys manere farewell thynke wol yt thāke deſerue haue trouth thou ſhalt went way thynking matere beſt might beſechen grace fynde tyme therto place euery wight hath houſe foūde renneth worke begynne wyth rakel hande woll byde ſtoōde ſende hys hertes lyne fro wythin alderfyrſt hys purpoſe wynne thys pandare hys herte thought caſt werke ful wiſely er wrought troylus lay tho lenger downe anone vpon hys ſtede baye felde played lyoun wo ye greke yt wyth hym met daye towne maner tho forth aye goodly gat hym ſo grace eche hym loued loked hys face bycame frendlyeſt wyght gentyleſt eke moſte fre thryftyeſt one beſt knyght hys tyme myght deed hys iapes hys cruelte hys hygh porte hys maner ſtraunge eche hem gan vertue chaunge nowe let v ſtynte troylus ſtounde fareth lyke man hurte ſore ſomedele akynge hys wounde yleſſed well healed dele eaſy pacient lore abyte hym goeth aboute hys cure thus dryueth forth hys auenture ¶explicit liber primus ovt theſe black wawes ſayle wynde weder gynneth clere thys ſee bote hath ſuche trauayle connynge vnneth ſtere thys ſee clepe tempeſtous matere dyſpayre troylus nowe hope kalendes begyn lady myne called arte cleo thou ſpede fro thys forth muſe ryme well thys boke tyll haue nedeth none arte vſe euery louer excuſe ſentement thys endyte latyn tonge wryte wherfore nyl haue neither thāke ne blame thys worke pray mekely dyſblameth yf worde lame myne auctour ſayd ſo ſay eke though ſpake loue vnfelyngly wonder thynge newe blynde man iugen well hewis knowe yt forme ſpeche chaunge wythin thouſande yere wordes tho haddē pryſe wōder nyce ſtrāge thynketh hem yet ſpake hem ſo ſpedde well loue men nowe eke wynnen loue ſondrye age ſondrye londes ſondrye ben vſages thy yf happe wyſe louer thys place herkeneth ſtory woll deuyſe howe troylus came hys ladyes grace thynketh ſo nolde loue purchace wondreth hys ſpeche hys doynge wondrynge euery wight rome went halte path ne alwaye manere eke ſome lande gamen ſhent yf men farde loue men done thus open doynge chere vyſityng forme ſayd ſawes thy mē ſayne ech coūtre hath lawes eke ſcarſely ben thys place thre haue loue ſayd lyke done thys purpoſe thys maye lyken ryght nought yet done ſhall eke ſome mē graue tre ſome ſtone wall betyde ſyth haue begonne myne authour ſhal folowe konne ¶explicit prohemium may mother monthes glade freſhe floures blewe whyte rede ben quycke ayen wynter deed made full baume fletynge euery mede whē phebus doth bryght beames ſprede ryght whyte bole ſo betydde ſhal ſynge mayes daye thrydde pandarus hys wyſe ſpeche felte eke hys parte loues ſhottes kene coude neuer ſo wel louyng preche made hys hewe daye full ofte grene ſhope hym fyll daye tene loue whych wo bedde wente made er daye full many wente ſwalowe proigne ſorowful lay whē morow come gan make waimēting ſhe forſhapen euery lay pandare bedde halfe ſlomberyng tyl ſhe ſo nygh hym made waymētyng howe thereus gan forth ſuſter take wyth noyſe gan wake call dreſſe hym vp ryſe remēbrynge hym hys arande done troylus eke hys great empryſe caſt knewe good plyte ye mone done voyage toke hys way full ſone vnto hys neces paleys beſyde nowe ianus god entre thou hym gyde come vnto hys neces place lady folke quod tolde forth gan pace founde two ladyes ſyt ſhe wythin paued parlour thre herden mayden hem reden geſte ſiege thebe whyle hem leſte quod pandarus madame god ſe wyth boke companye eygh vncle myne welcome ywys quod ſhe vp ſhe roſe honde hye toke hym faſte ſayd thys nyght thrye good mote turne mette wt word ſhe bēch ſet yea nece ye ſhul faren well bet yf god woll thys yere quod pandarus ſory haue let herken boke ye prayſen thus goddes loue ſayeth tel v loue ſome good ye lere vncle ꝙ ſhe mayſtreſſe wyth yu gonnen laugh tho ſhe ſeyde thys romaunce thebe rede haue herd ye kyng layus deyde edippus hys ſonne al deede ſtynten theſe letter reede howe byſhop boke tell amphiorax fyl grounde hell quod pādarus al thys knowe ſelue thaſſiege thebe care herof ben maked bokes twelue let thys tell howe ye fare way barbe ſhewe face bare way boke ryſe vp let v daunce let v done may ſome obſeruaunce eygh god forbyd ꝙ ſhe ye mad wydowes lyfe ſo god ſaue god ye maken ryght ſore adrad ye ben ſo wylde ſemeth ye raue ſate well bet aye caue byde rede holy ſayntes lyues let maydens gone daūce yonge wyues euer thryue quod thys pandarus yet coulde tell thynge done playe nowe vncle dere quod ſhe tell v goddes loue thaſſiege aweye grekes ferde ſo deye nay nay ꝙ euer mote thryue thynge well bet ſuche lyue yea holy god ꝙ ſhe thynge bet ſuche fyue eygh nay ywys al thys worlde ne reden ſhulde ben ſome iape trowe ſeluen tell v wyt arede leene helpe god ye meene borowe ne neuer ſhall ꝙ thing told mote thryue vncle myne ſo ꝙ ſhe god ꝙ woll tell blyue prouder woman none lyue ye wyſte al towne troye iape ſo euer haue ioye tho gan ſhe wondren thouſande folde downe eyen caſte neuer ſyth tyme ſhe bore knowen thynge deſyred ſhe ſo faſte wyth ſyke ſhe ſayd hym laſte nowe vncle myne nyll dyſpleſe aſken may dyſeſe thys wyth many wordes glade frendly tale wyth mery chere thys ſpeake gonnen wade many vnkouth glad depe matere frendes done bethe yfere tyll ſhe gan aſken hym howe hector ferde townes wall grekes yerde ful wel thanke god ſayd pandarus saue hys arme hath lytel wounde eke hys freſhe brother troylus wyſe worthy hector ſeconde whome euery vertue lyſt habounde trouth gentylneſſe wyſedome honoure fredom worthyneſſe good fayth eme ꝙ ſhe lyketh faren well god ſaue hem two truelych holde great deynte kynges ſonne armes well good condicions therto great power morall vertue ſelde yſene one perſone yfere good fayth ſoth ꝙ pandarus trouth ye kinge hath ſonnes twey meane hector troylus certaynly though ſhulde dey ben voyde vyces dare ſey men lyuen vnder ſonne might wide yknow cōne hector nedeth nomore tell worlde ny better knight worthynes well well vertue hath myght thys knoweth many wiſe worthy kniȝt ſame pryſe troylus ſey god helpe ſo knowe ſuche twey god ꝙ ſhe hector ſoth troylus ſame thynge trowe dredeleſſe men telleth doth armes daye daye ſo worthely beareth hym home ſo gentilly euery wyght pryſe hath hem leueſt prayſed ye ſay ryght ſoth ywys ꝙ pandarus yeſterday ſo wyth hym ben myght haue wondred vpon troylus neuer yet ſo thycke ſwarme ne flewe grekes fro hym gan fleen feld euery wyghtes eere crye troylus hunted hem ſo faſt na grekes blode troylus nowe hem hurte hym al downe caſt aye went arayed thus dethe ſhelde lyfe v yt day durſt none wtſtōde whyle yt helde hys blody ſwerde honde vherto frendlyeſt man great eſtate euer ſawe lyue hym lyſt beſt felowſhyp ran ſuche hym thynketh able thryue wyth ye worde tho pandarus blyue toke hys leaue ſayd woll gon hen nay blame haue vncle ꝙ ſhe ayleth thus wery ſoone namelyche woman woll ye ſo naye ſytteth downe god haue done wyth ſpeake wyſedome er ye go euery wyght hem tho herde gan ferre awaye ſtonde whyle two al hem lyſt hōde yt tale al brought ende eſtate gouernaunce quod pandarus tyme yt wende yet ſay aryſeth let v daunce caſt wydowes habyt miſchaūce lyſt thus ſelfe dyſfygure syth tydde ſo glad aduenture well bethought loue god ꝙ ſhe shall weten ye meane thys thys thyng aſketh leyſer tho ꝙ eke wolde moche greue ywys yf tolde ye toke amys yet bet tonge holde ſtyll ſaye ſoth yt ayenſt wyll nece goddeſſe mynerue iupiter maketh thōder rynge blyſfull venus ſerue ye ben woman thys worlde lyuynge wythouten paramour wetynge beſt loue lotheſt greue ye weten well ſelfe leue iwys myne vncle quod ſhe graūt mercy frendſhyp haue founden euer yet man holden truely moche haue ſo lytell quyt wyth grace god emforth wyt gylte ſhall neuer offende yf haue er thys woll amende loue god beſeche ye loue moſte tryſte let fremed maner ſpeche ſaye nece ye lyſte wyth yt worde vncle anone kyſt ſayd gladly leue nece dere take good ſhall ſaye wyth ſhe gan eyen downe caſt pandarus cough gan lyte ſayd nece alwaye lo laſte howe ſo ſome men hem delyte wyth ſubtel arte tale tendyte yet entencioun tale ſome concluſioun ſyth thende euery tale ſtrength thys mater ſo behouely ſhulde paynt drawen length ben frende ſo faythfully word gan ryght inwardly beholden loken face ſayd ſuche myrrour good grace thought thus yf tale endyte aught harde make proceſſe whyle ſhall ſauour haue therin lyte trowe wolde wyll begyle tendre wyttes wenen wyle playnlych vnderſtōde thy wyt ſeruen woll fonde loked beſy wyſe ſhe ware behelde ſo ah lorde ꝙ ſhe ſo faſt ye auyſe sawe ye neuer er ſay ye yes yes ꝙ bet woll er go trouth thought nowe yf ye fortunate nowe men ſhall ſe euery wyght ſome goodly auenture somtyme ſhape yf receyuen yf nyll take cure cometh wilfully weyuen lo neyther caſe fortune hym deceyuen ryght hys owne ſlouth wretchydneſſe ſuch wyght blame geſſe good auenture belle nece haue ye full lyghtly founden ye conne take loue god eke catche anone leſt auenture flake ſhulde lenger proceſſe make yeue hōde world none yf lyſt wyght ſo well begone ſyth ſpeake good ententioun haue tolde well beforne loue well honour renoun creature worlde yborne othes haue ſworne ye wroth therfore wene lye ne ſhall neuer ſene efte wyth eye beth agaſt ne quaketh wherto ne chaungeth feare ſo hewe hardely worſt thys though tale newe yet truſt alwaye ye ſhall fynde trewe thynge yt thought vnſyttyng wolde ſuche tale bryng nowe good eme goddes loue pray quod ſhe come tell agaſt ye woll ſay eke longeth wete ywys whether well amys say let thys feare dwell woll done nowe herkeneth ſhal tel nowe nece myne kynges dere ſonne good wyſe worthy freſhe free whych alwaye done wel wonne noble troylus ſo loueth ye helpe woll hys barte lo ſhulde ſey doth lyſt make lyue dey yf ye let hym dye woll ſteruen haue trouth nece nyl lyen al ſhuld thys knyfe throte keruē wyth teeres burſt hys eyen ſayd yf ye done v dyen thus gyltleſſe haue ye fyſhed fayre mende ye though yt apayre ala lorde ſo dere true man noble gentle knyght nought deſyreth frendlye chere ſe dyen goth vpright haſteth hym al full myght ben ſlayne yf hys fortune aſſent ala god ſuche beautye ſent yf ſo ye ſo cruell deth lyſteth nought rech ſo true worthy ſe nomore iaper wretche yf ye ſuche beautie may ſtretch make mendes ſo cruell dede auyſement good nede wo worth fayre geme vertuleſſe wo worth herbe alſo doth bote wo worth beautie routhleſſe wo worth ye wyght yt trede eche vnder fote ye ben beautye crop rotte yf therwithall ne routh harme ye lyuen trouth alſo thynke wel gaude leuer thou wer hāged ſhuld baude hygh men myght v yſe thyne eme ſhame well yf ſhulde aſſent thrugh myne abet thyne honoure ſhent vnderſtōd nought requyre bynde hym beheſt saue ye make hym better chere ye han done er feeſt lyfe ſaued leeſt ſome playnly entent god helpe ſo neuer ment lo requeſt nought ſkyll iwys ne dout reſon parde none ſet worſt ye dreden men wold wōdre ſene hym come gone therayenſt anſwer anon euery wight foole kynde wol deme loue frēdſhip mynde woll demen though ſe man temple gon ymages eeteth thynke eke howe wel wyſely yt gouerne hym ſelfe yt nothinge foryeteth cōmeth pris thōk hī getteth eke therto ſhal com ſo ſeld force though towne helde loue frendes reigneth al toun wrye mantell euermo god ſo wy ſauacion haue ſayd beſt ſo good nece alway ſtynt wo let daunger ſugred ben alyte death ye nat wyte ¶creſeyde yt herd hym wyſe thought ſhal felē meneth iwis eme ꝙ ſhe wolde ye deuyſe rede ſhulde done well ſayd ꝙ certayne beſt ye hym loue ayen louyng loue loue ſkylfull guerdonynge thynke eke elde waſteth euery houre eche parte beautye therfore er age deuoure go loue olde woll wyght ye let prouerbe lore vnto late yware ꝙ bautie whan paſt elde counteth daunger laſt kynges foole wont crye loude whā yt thinketh womā bereth hye longe mote ye loue proude tyll crowes foot growe vnder eye ſend myrrour prye yt ye maye ſe face morowe nece byd wyſh nomore ſorowe ſtynt caſt downe heed ſhe began breſt wepe anon ſayd ala wo nere deed worlde fayth agone ala ſhulden ſtraunge done whan beſt frende wende rate laue ſhulde defende ala wolde haue truſted doutleſſe yf thrugh diſaduenture loued eyther hym achilles hector maner creature ye nolde haue mercy ne meaſure alwaye repreue falſe worlde ala may leue ioye feeſt rede blyſful caas mede beheſt paynted proceſſe ſayd ala ryght fyne lady myne pallas thou dredefull caſe purueye ſo aſtonyed dye ſhe gan full ſorowfully ſyke ne may bet quod pandarus god ſhal nomore come weke god toforne myſtruſted thus ſe well nowe ye ſetten lyght v death ala wofull wretche myght yet lyue nought retche cruell god diſpytous marte ſuries thre hell crye let neuer houſe departe yf ment harme vyllanye ſyth ſe lorde mote nedes dye hym ſhryue ſey wyckedly ye done v dey ſyth lyketh deed neptunus god ſee fro forth ſhall neuer eten breed tyll myne owne hert bloude maye ſe certayne woll dye ſone vp ſtert waye raught tyll ſhe agayne hym lappe caught creſeyde ye welnygh ſtarfe feare ſhe fearfulleſt wyght might herde eke care ſawe ſorowful erneſt knight prayer ſawe eke none vnryght harme eke might fall gan rewe dred wonder ſore thought vnhappes fallen thycke day loue ſuche maner caas men ben cruell hem ſelfe wicke yf man ſlee hym ſelfe alaas preſence nyl ſolace men wolde deme nat ſaye nedeth ful ſlyghly playe ſorowfull ſygh ſhe ſayd thrye ah lorde tyd ſory chaunce myne aſtate lyeth ieopardye eke myne emes lyfe lyeth balaunce natheleſſe god gouernaunce ſhall ſo done myne honour ſhal kepe eke lyfe ſtynt wepe harmes two leſſe cheſe yet leuer maken hym good chere honour myne emes lyfe leſe ye ſayne ye nothyng el requere wy ꝙ myne owne nece dere wel ꝙ ſhe wyll payne ſhal myne hert ayen luſt conſtrayne yt nyll nat holden hym honde ne loue man nought ne maye ayenſt wyll el wol fonde myn honor ſaue pleſē day today therto nolde nat one haue ſayde naye dred fantaſye ceſſe cauſe aye ceſſeth maladye make proteſtation proceſſe yf ye deper go certaynly ſauacion though ye ſteruen two though worlde day ſo ne ſhall neuer hym haue routh graūt wel ꝙ pandare trouth maye truſt wel quod thyng yt ye han hyght ye woll holde truly vnto yea doutleſſe quod ſhe myne vncle dere ne ſhal haue cauſe matere quod playne ofter preche parde nedeth ſpeche tho fyll tale glade tyll laſt good eme quod ſhe tho loue god v made tell fyrſt ye wyſten wo wot none ye ſayd wel ſpeke loue ꝙ ſhe prey tel bet ſhal puruey tho pandarus lyte gan ſmyle ſayd trouth ſhall tell daye nat gone full longe whyle within paleyes garden well gan well halfe daye dwell ryght ſpeken ordinaunce grekes mitghten diſauaunce soone gone lepe caſten dartes two fro tyll laſt ſayd wolde ſlepe graſſe adowne layd tho gan roman fro tyll herde walked alone began full wofully grone tho gan ſtalke hym ſoftly behynde ſekerly ſoth ſayne clepe ayen mynde right thus loue gan hym playn ſayde lorde haue routh vpon payne haue ben rebell myne entent nowe men culpa lorde repent god thy diſpoſition ledeſt fyne iuſt purueyaunce euery wyght lowe confeſſion accept gree ſende ſuche penaunce lyketh diſeſperaunce may gooſt depart alway fro thou ſhylde thy benignitie certes lord ſo ſore hath ſhe woūded ſtode black lokyng eyē hertes botom yfounded thrugh wot yt mot nedes dyen ye worſt dar nought bewreyē well hoter ben gledes red men hem wren wt aſhen pale deed ſmot heed adowne anon gan muttre nat truly gan ſtyll away gone let thereof nothyng wyſt came agayne anon ſtode hym ſayd awake ye ſlepen longe ſemeth nought yt loue doth wronge ſlepen ſo nomā may awake whoſey euer ſo dull man ye frende quod ye heedes ake loue let lyuen lord wo pale wan yet made tho freſh countenaunce though ſhuld haue led new daūce paſſed forth tyll daye fell come runnyng alone chāber founde yt laye vpon bed man ſo ſore grone ne herde neuer mone ne wyſt nought cōmynge al ſodaynly left complaynyng toke ſomwhat ſuſpectioun nere come founde hym wepe ſore god ſo wyſe ſauatioun neuer thyng routh neyther wyth engyn ne lore vnnethes myght fro deth hym kepe yet fele myne hert hym wepe god wot neuer ſyth borne ſo buſy noman preche ne neuer wyght ſo depe ſworne er tolde myght ben leche reherſen ſpech al wofull wordes ſowne ne bid nouȝt ye woll ſe ſwon ſaue lyfe el nought non harm thus driuen ye loue god v hath wrouȝt chere doth may liuē haue plat myne hert ſhryuē ſyth ye wot myne entent clene take hede therof none euyll mene riȝt good thrift pray god haue ye han ſuch one ycaught withouten net ye wyſe ye fayre ſe wel rynge ruby ſet neuer two ſo well ymet whan ye ben hole ther mighty god yet graūt v ſe hour nay therof ſpake nat aha quod ſhe helpe god ye ſhenden euery dele mercy dere nece anon quod whatſo ſpake ment nought wele mar god helmed ſtele beth wroth blod nece dere nowe well quod ſhe foryeuen toke leue home wēt yea lord glad wel bygon creſeyde aroſe lenger ſhe ne ſtent ſtreyght cloſet went anon ſet downe ſtyll ſtone euery worde gan vp wynde ſayd came mynde woxe ſomdele aſtoned thought ryght newe caſe whan yt ſhe ful auyſed tho founde ſhe ryght nouȝt peryll ſhe ought aferde man maye loue poſſibilitie woman ſo hert may breſt ſhe nat loue ayen leſte ſhe ſate alone thought thus thaſcrye aroſe ſcarmoche al without men cryed ſtrete ſe troylus hath right put flyght yu grekes rout gonne al meyne ſhoute go ſe caſt vp yates wyde ſtrete mot palys ryde waye fro yates none dardanus open cheyne come al folke anone eaſy pace rydyng route tweyne right happy day ſothe ſeyne whiche men ſayth may nat diſturbed ſhal betyde neceſſyte troylus ſate baye ſtede al armed ſaue heed ful ry •• ely wounded horſe gan blede whiche rode pace ful ſoftely ſuche knyghtly ſyght trewly nat withouten fayle loke mar god batayle lyke man armes knyght ſene fulfylled hygh proweſſe bothe body myght thyng wel hardyneſſe eke ſene geare dreſſe freſhe ſo yonge ſo weldy ſemed heuen vpon ſe helme hewen twenty place tyſſue honge backe behynde ſhelde daſſhed wt ſwerdes wt mace whiche men myght many arowe fynd thyrled horne nerfe rynde aye people cried cometh ioy next brother holder vp troye whiche wext lytel reed ſhame whan ſo herd people vpon cryen holde noble game ſobrelych caſt adowne eyen creſceyde anon gan chere eſpyen let ſo ſofte hert ſynke ſelfe ſhe ſayde yaue drynke al owne thought ſhe wore red remembryng ryght thus lo yt myne vncle ſwereth mot deed hym haue mercy pytie yt thought pure aſhamed ſhe gan heed pull faſt whyle people forth paſt gan caſt rollen vp downe within thought excellent proweſſe eſtate alſo renowne wyt ſhap eke gentylleſſe moſt fauour diſtreſſe al thought routh ſleen ſuche one yf ment trouthe ¶now myght ſome enuyous iangle thus ſodayn loue might ſhe ſo lyghtly loued troylus ryght fyrſt ſyght yea parde whoſo ſayd ſo mote neuer euery thynge gynnyng hath nede er al wrought withouten drede ſaye nat ſhe ſo ſodaynly yafe hym loue ſhe gan enclyne lyken hym tho haue tolde manhod pyne made loue within gan myne proceſſe good ſeruyce wan loue ſodayne wyſe alſo blyſfull venus wele arayed sat ſeuenth houſe heuen tho diſpoſed wele aſpectes payed helpe ſely troylus wo ſoth ſayne ſhe na nat al fo troylus natiuitie god wote wele ſooner ſped let v ſtynt troylus throwe rydeth forth let v turne faſt vnto creſeyde yt henge heed full lowe ſhe ſat alone gan caſt wheron ſhe wolde apoynt laſt ſo eme ne wolde ceſſe troylus vpon preſſe lorde ſo ſhe gan thought argue matter haue tolde beſt wer eſchue plyted ſhe full oft many ſolde hert warme cold ſhe thought ſōwhat ſhal write myne autor lyſteth tendyte thought fyrſt troylus perſone knewe ſyght eke gentelneſſe thus ſhe ſayd al wer nought graūt loue yet worthynes wer honour play gladneſſe honeſtie ſuche lorde dele myne eſtate alſo heale eke wel wot kynges ſonne ſyth hath ſe ſuche delyte yf wolde vtterlyche ſyght flye peraduenture might haue deſpite miȝt ſtōd worſe plyte wyſe bate purchace without nede may ſtonde grace euery thyng wot lyeth meſure though man forbyd dronkeneſſe nought forbyddeth euery creature •• nleſſe alwaye geſſe eke ſyth wot diſtreſſe ne ought nat thyng hym deſpyſe syth ſo meaneth good wyſe eke knowe longe tyme agone thewes good ny nat nyce vauntour ſayne men certayn non wyſe done ſo great vyce ne al nyl hym neuer ſo cherice ſhall make auaunt iuſt cauſe ſhall neuer bynde ſuche clauſe ſet caſe hardeſt iwys men myght demen loueth diſhonour vnto may iche let nay parde knowe alſo alwaye ſe men louen woman al towne werſe▪ nay without dout thynke eke worthy haue al noble towne thryftyeſt woman yf ſhe honour ſaue worthyeſt saue onely hector beſt yet lyfe lyeth al nowe cure ſuche loue eke myne auenture ne loue wondre nought well wot ſelfe ſo god ſpede woll none wyſt thought one fayreſt drede goodlyeſt whoſo taketh hede ſo men ſayne al towne troye wōder though haue ioye myne owne woman well eaſe thanke god myne eſtate right yonge ſtond vntyed luſty leſe withouten ielouſye ſuche debate shal huſbond ſayne checke mate eyther ben full ielouſye maſterfull louen nouelry ſhal fyne lyue thus shal nat loue caſe yf leſt pardieux religious though myne hert ſet reſt vpon knyght worthyeſt kepe alway myne honour name ryght may ſhame right whan ſon ſhyneth bright marche yt chaungeth oft tyme face cloude put wt wynde flight ouerſprat ſonne ſpace cloudy thought gā ſoul pace ouerſprad bryght thoughtes feare almooſt ſhe gan fall thouȝt ala ſyth fre sulde loue put ieopardye ſykerneſſe thrallen lybertye ala durſt thynken follye may well folke aſpye dredful ioy conſtreynt payne loueth non ſhe ne hath waye playne loue yet moſt ſtormy lyfe ryght hym ſelfe euer begon euer ſome myſtruſt nyce ſtryfe loue ſome cloude ouer ſun therto wretched womē nothing cō whan v wo wepe ſyt thynke wrech owne wo drynke alſo wycked tonges bene ſo preſt ſpeke v harme eke men ſo vntrue ryght anon ceſſed leſt ceſſeth loue forth loue anewe harme ydo done whoſo rewe thouȝ theſe mē loue hem firſt rēde full ſharpe begynnyng breketh oft ende ofte tyme maye men rede ſene treſon woman hath fyne ſuche loue ſene becommeth whan go wyght wote trowe ſo wher becōmeth lo wiȝt ſporneth erſt nothynge nought tourneth beſy yf loue eke muſt pleſen hem iangle loue demen coyen hem ſay harm though ther cauſe yet hem ſemen al harme yt folke frendes quemen may ſtoppen euery wycked tonge ſowne bel whyle yt ben ronge thought gan clere ſayd yt nothyng vndertaketh nothyng acheueth hym loth dere wt though hert quaketh thā ſlepeth hope drede awaketh hote cold thus betwixē twey ryſle vp went pley adowne ſtayre anonryght tho ſhe went gardyn neces thre vp downe madē many went flexippe ſhe tarbe antigone playen ioye ſe woman great route folowed garden yerd large rayled aleyes ſhaddowed wel wt bloſomy bowes grene benched newe ſōded al wayes ſhe walketh arm arme betwene tyll laſt antigone ſhene gan troyan ſonge ſyngen clere heuen voyce heare ſaid loue haue ſhall ben humble ſubiect trewe myne entent beſt lorde yeue yche euermore hertes luſt rent neuer yet thy grace wyght ſent blyſfull cauſe lyfe lede al ioye ſuretie drede blyſful god hath ſo wel beſet loue iwys bereth lyfe ymagynen ne coulde bet lorde withouten ielouſye ſtryfe loue one mooſt ententyfe ſeruen wel vntweryly vnfayned euer leſt harme diſtayned well worthyneſſe trouth ground myrrour godlyheed wyt apollo ſtone ſykerneſſe vertue roote luſt fynder heed ſorowe fro deed ywys loue hym beſt ſo doth good thrift haue wherſoeuer ſhulde thāken god loue blyſſe bath gynne thanked ye lorde loue ryght lyfe flemen al maner vyce ſynne doth ſo vertue entende daye day wyll amende ſayth ye loue vyce thraldome though felt diſtreſſe eyther enuyous ryght nyce vnmyghty ſhreudneſſe louen ſuche maner folke geſſe diffamen loue nothyng knowe ſpeken bent neuer bowe ſonne worſe kynde ryght though yt man febleneſſe eyen may nat endure ſe bryght loue worſe wretch cryen wele worth yt may ſorowe dryen thy hath heed verre fro caſt ſtones ware hym werre al myne hert al ꝙ creſeyde made ſong wt ſo good entent antygone anſwerde anone ſayde madame ywys goodlyeſt mayde great eſtate al towne troye led lyfe mooſt honour ioye ſoth ſo ſemeth ſonge quod tho creſeyde gan therwtih ſike ſaid lorde ſuch blyſſe amonge theſe louers fayre endite yea wyſſe quod freſhe antygone whyte al folke haue bene lyue ne conne wel blyſſe loue diſcryue wene ye euery wretche wote parfyte blyſſe loue nay ywys wenen al loue yf one hote way way wote nothing menne mote aſken ſayntes yf ought faire heuē tell aſke fendes yf foule hell creſeide vnto purpoſe naught anſwerde ſayd ywys wol nyght faſte euery word ſhe herde gan printen herte faſte aye gan loue laſſe agaſte dyd erſt ſynken herte ſhe waxe ſomwhat able conuerte dayes honour heuens eye night foe al thys clepe ſunne gan weſtren faſt downwarde wrie hys dayes courſe yrunne whyte thinges woxen dymme donne lacke lyght ſterres apere ſhe al folke went yfere whan lyked gone reſte voyded voyden oughte ſayd ſlepen well leſte woman ſone tyl bed broughte whā al huſt thā lay ſhe ſtyl thoughte al thys thynge maner wyſe reherce nedeth nat ye bene wyſe nyghtyngale vpon cedre grene vnder chamber wal ſhe lay ful loude ſonge ayen mone ſhene parauenture hys byrdes wyſe lay loue made herte freſhe gaye herkened ſhe ſo longe good entente tyl laſt deed ſlepe hente ſhe ſlept anon ryght tho mette howe egle fethered white bone vnder breſt hys longe clawes ſette hert rent anone dyd hert breſt gone ſhe nought agroſe ne nothīg ſmert forthe flyeth hert lefte herte nowe let ſlepe tale holde troylus paleys rydden fro ſcarmyſhe whych tolde hys chambre ſate hath abydden tyl two thre meſſangers yeden pandarus ſoughten ful faſt tyl found brought ye laſt thys pandarus came leapyng one ſayd thus hath bene wel ybete daye wyth ſwerdes ſlonge ſtones troylus hath caught hete gan iape ſayd lorde ye ſweete ryſe let v ſoupe go reſte anſwerde leſte wyth al haſt goodly myght ſpedde hem fro ſouper bedde euery wyght dore dyght whyder lyſt vpō way ſped troylus thought herte bledde wo tyl herde ſome tydynge ſayd frende ſhall wepe ſynge quod pandarus ſtyll let ſlepe thyne hoode thy nedes ſpedde cheſe yf thou wolt ſyng daunce lepe ſhort wordes thou ſhalte trowe sir nece wol done wel loue beſte god trouthe lacke purſute make thy ſlouthe thus forforth haue thy werke begon fro day daye tyl day morowe loue frendſhyp haue therfore hath ſhe laid faith borow algate foote hameled thy ſorowe ſhulde lenger ſermon holde ye haue herde al tolde right floures colde night cloſed ſtoupen ſtalkes low redreſſen hem ayen ſunne bryght ſpreden kynde courſe rowe ryght ſo gan tho eyen vp throwe thys troylus ſayd venus dere thy myght thy grace yheryed pādarus helde vp hōdes ſayd lorde al thyne haue hole broſten ben bondes thouſande troyes ſo yaue eche god ſo wy ſaue ne might ſo gladen lo myne herte ſpredeth ſo ioye wol ſterte lord ſhall ſhal lyuen whan ſhal next dere herte ſe howe ſhal longe time away dryuen tyl thou ayen fro thou mayſt anſwere abyde abyde hangeth necke ſoth ſayne great diſeaſe abydeth payne al eaſely nowe loue marte ꝙ pādarus euery thynge hath tyme longe abyde tyll nyght departe al ſo ſyker thou lyeſt god forne wol prime thy werke ſomwhat ſhal ſaye ſome wyght thys charge laye parde god wot haue euer yet ben redy ſerue night haue nat fayned emforth wyt done al thy luſt ſhal al might nowe ſhal ſayne fare aryght yf thou nylt wyte al thy ſelfe thy care naught alonge thyne yuel fare wote wel thou wyſer art thouſande folde yf thou god helpe ſo wolde vtterly right myne owne hande write nowe lettre whiche wolde tellen howe farde amyſſe beſeche routh nowe helpe thy ſelfe leaue ſlouth ſelfe ſhal therwyth gon whā thou woſte yt worth thou vp courſer ryght anon yee hardely ryght thy beſte gere ride forth yt place naught ne thou ſhalt fynde v may ſyttyng ſome wyndowe ſtrete lokyng lyſt mayſt thou v ſalue vpon make thou thy countenaunce thy lyfe beware faſte eſchue taryen ought god ſhyld v fro miſchaūce ride forth thy waye holde thy gouernaūce ſhall ſpeke ſomwhat trowe whan thou art gone thyn cere glowe touchyng thy lettre thou arte wyſe ynough wot thou nylte deignelyche endyte maketh theſe argumentes tough ne ſcryueynyſhe craftely thou write bebiotte thy teeres eke alyte thou write goodly worde al • ofte though good reherce ofte though beſt harpour vpon lyue wolde beſte ſowned ioly harpe euer wyth al hys fyngers fyue touch aye ſtrynge aye warble harpe hys nayles poynted neuer ſo ſharpe ſhulde make euery wyght dull gle ſtrokes full ne iombre eke diſcordans thing • e • ſterue al euer may deſerue refuſe nat ꝙ hente faſt boſom ye letter dwone tharſte ſayd nowe caſte away anon folke may tene gaurne v twey quod ſhe abyde tyl gon gan ſmyle ſayd eme pray suche anſwere made ſo laugh folye ſhe laughter wende dye whan ſhe comen hall nowe eme ꝙ ſhe wol go dyne anon gan ſome woman call ſtreyght chambre gan ſhe gone beſyneſſes one amonges thynges drede ful priuely lettre payne write ye cōſtrayne toke hym thanked ſayd god wote thyng ful often loth begonne cometh ende good nece mine creſeyde ye harde nowe bene ywonne ought glad god yonder ſonne men ſayth impreſſions lyght full lyghtly ben aye redy flyght ye han played tyraunt al longe harde herte graue nowe ſtynt ye lenger honge al wolden ye forme daunger ſaue haſteth done hym ioye haue truſteth wel longe ydone hardneſſe cauſeth diſpyte ful often diſtreſſe ryght declared thys matere lo troylus right ſtretes ende came rydyng wyth tenthe ſōme yfere al ſoftely thyderwarde gan bende ther ſat way wend paleys ward pandare aſpide ſayd nece ſe cometh ryde flye nat ſethe v ſuppoſe leſte maye thynken ye hym eſchue nay nay ꝙ ſhe woxe redde roſe wyth gan humbly ſalue wyth dredful chere oft hys hewes mue vp hys loke debonairly caſte becked pandare forthe paſte god wot yf ſate horſe aryght goodly beſene ylke daye god wot wher lyke māly knyght ſhulde dretche tell aray creſeyde theſe thynges ſay tel ſhorte lyked al yfere hys perſon hys aray loke chere goodly maner gentylleſſe wel neuer ſyth ſhe borne ne ſhe ſuch routh diſtreſſe ſo ſhe hath hard ben beforne god hope ſhe hath caught thorn ſhal pul next wyke god ſende mo ſuch thornes pyke pandare whyche ſtode faſte felte yron hotte beganne ſmyte ſayd nece pray hertely tel ſhal aſken alyte woman hys deth whyte withoutē gift lacke routh wel done ꝙ ſhe nay trouth god help ſo ꝙ ye ſay ſoth ye felen wel ſelfe naught lye lo yonder rydeth ꝙ ſhe ye ſo doth wel ꝙ pandare haue tolde thrie let nyee ſhame folye ſpeke eyſyng herte let nycete ſmerte theron heauen done conſydryng althyng may nat ſhame eke ſone graunten ſo great liberte playnly entent ſayd ſhe loue hym vnwyſt yf ſhe myght guerdon wt nothīg ſyght pandare thought ſhall ſo may thys nyce opinyon shal ben holden fully yeres two ſhuld make thys long ſermon muſte aſſent concluſion tyme whan eue al wel roſe toke hys leue way faſte homwarde ſped ryght ioye felt herte daunce troylus founde alone abed lay done theſe louers traunce betwixen hope derke diſeſperaunce pandare ryght hys comyng ſong ſaith lo ſomwhat bring ſayd bed ſo ſone yburyed thus frende ꝙ troylus nay helpe ſo moone ꝙ pandarus thou ſhalt vp ryſe ſe charme ſent ryght nowe healen thyne axeſſe thou forthwith al thy beſyneſſe ye myght god ꝙ troylus pandarrus gan lettre take ſayde parde god hath holpen v haue lyght loke al theſe blake ofte gan hert glade quake troylus whyle gan rede wordes yaue hope drede finally toke al beſte ſhe wrote ſomwhat beheld thought might hys hert reſt al couered ſhe wordes vnder ſhelde thus worthy parte helde hope pādarus beheſte great wo foryede leſte may al day ſeluen ſe wood coole fyre ryght ſo encreaſe hoope therwyth full ofte encreaſeth eke deſyre oke cometh lytle ſpyre ſo lettre whiche yt ſhe ſent encreaſen gan deſyre brent wherfore ſay alway day nyght troylus gan deſyren dyd erſte hoope myght preaſō pādarus lore writen ſorowes ſore fro day day lete nought refreyde pādare ſomwhat wrote ſeid dyd alſo obſeruaunces tyll louer longeth thys caas dyce turned chaunces eyther glad ſayd ala helde hys geſtes aye paas ſuch anſwers dayes ſory eyther glad pādare alwaye recours pytouſly gan aye playne beſought rede ſome ſocours pādarus ſaw wode payne wert wel nygh deed routh ſoth ſayne beſyly al herte caſte wo ſleen faſte ſayd lorde frende brother dere god wote thy diſeaſe doth wo wylt thou ſtynten al woful chere trouth er dayes two god forne yet ſhal ſhape ſo thou ſhalt come certayne place ther yu maiſt thy ſelfe prayen grace certaynly yf thou woſte bene experte loue ſay one thynges forthereth moſte man haue leyſer pray ſyker place wo bewray good hert mote ſome routh impreſſe ſe gyltleſſe diſtreſſe parauēture thinkeſt thou though ſo kinde wolde done begynne haue maner routh vpon wo sayth daūger nay yu ſhalt neuer winne ruleth hertes goſte within though ſhe bende yet ſhe ſtont rote effecte thys vnto bote thinke ayen whan ſturdy oke men hacketh ofte none receyued hath happy fallyng ſtroke great ſweyght doth come one done theſe rockes theſe mylne ſtones ſwyfter courſe cometh thīg yt wight whan diſcendeth done thinges light rede boweth euery blaſt ful lyghtly ceſſe wynde wol aryſe ſo nyl oke whan caſt nedeth nought longe forbyſe men ſhal reioyſen great empryſe atcheued wel ſtant withouten dout al haue men ben lenger troylus nowe tell yf leſt thyng ſhal aſken thy brother thou loueſt beſt▪ thy hertes preuyte wy brother diephebus tho ꝙ ꝙ pādare er houres twyſe twelue ſhal caſe vnwyſt ſelue nowe let alone worken maye quod deiphebus went tho lord great frende bene aye saue troylus man loued ſo tel ſhorte without wordes mo quod pandarus pray ye frende cauſe toucheth yes parde ꝙ deiphebus wel thou woſt al euer may god fore al nere man loue moſte brother troylus ſay wherfore ſyth day bore na ne neuer mo bene thynke ayenſt thyng myght forthynke pādare gan thanke ſeyd lo ſir haue lady thys towne nece called creſeyd ſome men wolde done oppreſſioun wrongfully haue poſſeſſioun wherfore lordſhyp beſeche bene frende withouten ſpeche deiphebus hym anſwerde thys thou ſpeakeſt thus ſtraūgely creſeyde frende ſayd hym yes nedeth ꝙ deiphebus hardely nomore ſpeke truſteth wel yt woll champion wyth ſpore yerde ne rought though al foe herde tel howe thou woſt thys matere myght beſt auaylen nowe let ſe quod pandarus yf ye lorde ſo dere wolden • thys honour prayen morowe lo ſhe came vnto playntes deuyſe aduerſaryes wolde agryſe yf durſt praye nowe chargen haue ſo great trauayle haue ſome brethrē myghten cauſe bet auayle wote well ſhe myght neuer fayle ben holpen inſtaunce wyth frendes gouernaunce deiphebus whych yt comen kynde honoure bounte conſente anſwerde ſhalbe done fynde yet greater helpe thys myne entent woldeſt yu ſayne yf heleyne ſent ſpeake thys trowe beſt ſhe maye leden parys leſt hector whych yt lorde brother nedeth praye hym frende haue herde hym tyme eke speken creſeyde ſuch honour may • ayne bet ſuch hap hym hath ſhe nedeth hys helpes craue ſhalbe ſuche ryght wol hym haue speake thou thy ſelfe alſo troylus behalfe pray hym v dyne syr thys ſhalbe done ꝙ pandarus toke hys leaue neuer gan fyne hys neces houſe ſtreyght lyne came founde fro meate aryſe ſet hī downe ſpake ryght wyſe ſayd god ſo haue ronne lo nece myne ſe ye howe ſwete ye thanke conne ye ware howe falſe poliphete nowe aboute eftſones plete brynge aduocacies newe ꝙ ſhe chaunged al hewe dretche done wronge ſhal ala yet hym ſelfe nothynge wolde retche nere antenor eneas ben hys frendes ſuch maner caas loue god myne vncle dere force let hym haue yfere wythouten haue ynough v nay ꝙ pandare ſhall nothynge ſo haue ben ryght nowe deiphebus hector myne lordes mo ſhortly maked eche hem hys foe thryfte ſhall neuer wynne ought ſo begynne caſten beſt done deiphebus hys owne curteſye came praye hys propre perſone holde hym morowe companye dyner whych ſhe nolde denye goodly gan hys prayer obey thanked wente vpon hys wey thys done thys pādare anone tell ſhorte forth gan wende troylus ſtyll ſtone al thys thyng tolde word ende howe deiphebus gan blende ſayd hym nowe tyme yf yt ye conne beare well morowe al wonne ſpeke pray pitouſly cōplain let nyce ſhame drede ſlouthe somtyme man mote tell hys owne payne beleue ſhe woll haue routhe thou ſhalt ben ſaued thy fayth trouth well wote thou nowe arte drede lay arede thou thinkeſt ſhuld al cheres muſten folke aſpye loue fare amys yet leuer vnwyſt ſorowe dye nowe thynke ſo thou doeſt gret foly ryght nowe haue founden manere ſleyght coueren thy chere thou ſhalt gone ouernight bylyue vnto deiphebus houſe play thy maladye away bet dryue whych thou ſemeſt ſycke ſoth ſaye sone thy bedde laye ſaye thou mayſt lenger vp endure lye ryght byde thyne auēture say thy feuer wōte take ſame tyme laſte tyl morowe let ſe nowe wel thou ranſt make parde ſycke ſorowe go farewell venus borowe hope thou thys purpoſe holde ferme thy grace ſhe ſhall fully conferme quod troylus ywys thou nedeleſſe counſayleſt ſycklyche fayne ſycke erneſt doutleſſe well nygh ſterue payne ꝙ pandarus thou ſhalte better playne haſte leſſe nede counterfete hym demeth mē hote yt ſeeth hem ſwete lo holde thy tryſte cloſe shall well deere vnto thy bowe dryue therwyth toke hys leaue al ſoftely troylus paleys went blyue glad ne neuer hys lyue pandarus rede gan aſſente deiphebus houſe nyght wente nedeth tellen chere deiphebus vnto hys brother made hys axis hys ſycklyche manere howe men gon hym clothes lade whē layd mē wold glade al nought held forth aye wyſe ye han herde pandare er thys deuyſe certayne er troylus hym leyde deiphebus prayde hym ouernyght ben frende helpynge creſeyde god wote graunted anone ryght ben full frende wyth hys myght ſuch nede pray hym thenne bydde woode man renne morow came neyghen gan ye tyme meal • yde fayre quene heleyne shope houre pryme wyth deiphebus ſhe nolde fayne hys ſuſter homely ſoth ſayne came dyner playne entente god pādare wyſt al mente came eke creſeyde innocent thys antygone nece tarbe alſo ſlye nowe prolixite beſt loue god let v faſt go ryght theffecte wythouten tale mo thys folke aſſembled thys place let v ſaluynges pace great honour dyd hem deiphebus certayne fedde hem wel wyth al myght lyke euermo ala hys refrayne good brother troylus ſyke lyth yet therwythall gan ſyke payned hym glade hem myght chere good made complayned eke heleyne hys ſyckneſſe faythfully pyte euery wyght gan wexen ax leche anone ſayd thys manere men curen folke thys charme woll ye lere ſate one lyſte teche thought yet beſt could ben leche cōplaynt hym gonnē prayſe folk yet whē ſome wyght hath begō prayſe mā wyth prayſe hym rayſe thouſande folde yet hygher thē ſon fewe lordes kon pandarus wolde afferme nought forgat prayſynge conferme herde al thys thyng creſeyd wel ynough euery worde gan notifye whych wyth ſobre chere herte lough ne wolde glorifye mowen ſuche knyght done lyue dye paſſe leſt ye longe dwell fyne euer tell tyme came fro dyner ryſe hem ought aryſen euerychone gone whyle thys deuyſe pandarus brake thys ſpeche anone ſayd deiphebus woll ye gone yf wyll prayde ſpeake nedes creſeyde heleyne whych ye honde helde toke fyrſt tale ſayd go blyue goodly creſeyde ſhe behelde ſayd ioues let hym neuer thryue doth harme ryue hym ſone lyue ye ſorowe ſhall rue yf maye folke true tel thou thy neces caſe quod deiphebus pandarus thou canſt beſt tell lordes ladyes ſtante thus ſhulde lenger ꝙ dwell ronge hem proces lyke bell vpon foe hyght poliphete heynous men myght ſpete anſwerd eche worſe hem thē poliphete gonnen thus waryen honged ſuche one brother ſo ſhall ne maye nought varien ſhulde lenger thys tale taryen p • aynlyche one hyghten ben frēde yt euer myghten spake heleyne ſayd pandarus wote aught lord brother thys mater meane hector wote troylus ſayd yea woll ye nowe thinketh thus ſyth troilus good yf ye wolde aſſent tolde hym ſelfe thys er ſhe went woll haue grefe herte bycauſe lo ſhe lady wyl woll ryght ſterte wete anone ywys yf ſlepe woll ought thys lepte ſayd hym hys eere god haue thy ſoule brought haue thy bere ſmylen thys gan tho troylus pandarus wythouten rekenynge went anone heleyne deiphebus ſayd hem ſo taryenge ne preaſe woll well ye brynge creſeyde lady maye enduren wol well ye wote chambre lyte fewe folke may lyghtly make warme nowe loketh ye woll haue wyte bryng preaſe yt might harme hym dyſeaſen better arme yet bet ſhe bydde tyll eftſoonis nowe loke ye knowen done ſaye beſt knowe wyght ne wende ye twey throwe reherce caſe vnlyke ſhe ſey thys ſhe maye one hym prey ben good lorde ſhorte take leue thys maye mokell hys eaſe hym reue eke ſhe ſtraūge woll forbere hys eaſe whych hym dare eke thynge toucheth woll tell wote well ryght nowe ſecrete townes prowe knewe nothyng hys entent wythout troylus went heleyne goodly ſofte wyſe gan hym ſalue womanly playe ſayd ywys ye mote algate aryſe nowe fayre brother hole praye gan arme ryght ouer ſholder lay hym wyth wyt recomforte ſhe beſt coulde ſhe gan hym dyſporte thys ꝙ ſhe beſeke dere brother deiphebus loue god ſo doth pandare eke ben good lorde frende ryght hertely vnto creſeyde whych certaynly receiueth wrōge wote wel pādare caſe well bet declare pādarus gan new tonge affyle caſe reherce anone ſayd ſone whyle quod troylus ſone may gone wol ryght fayne al might bē one haue god trouth cauſe ſuſtene good thryft haue ye ꝙ heleyne quene quod pandarus wyll ſhe maye take leaue er ſhe go el god forbyd tho ꝙ yf ſhe vouchſafe ſo wyth worde ꝙ troylus ye two deiphebus ſyſter lefe dere haue ſpeake matere ben aduyſed rede better founde hap beddes heed copye treatyſe lettre hector hym ſent aſken reed yf ſuche man worthy ben deed wote nought gryſly wyſe prayde hem anone auyſe deiphebus gan thys lettre vnfolde erneſt great ſo dyd heleyne quene romynge outward faſt gone beholde downewarde ſteyre herber grene thys ylke thynge redden hem bytwene largely mountenaūce houre gonne reden pore nowe let hem rede turne anone pandarus gan full ſofte prye well gan gone great chambre hye ſayd god ſaue thys companye come nece myne lady quene heleyne abydeth eke lordes tweyne ryſe take wyth nece • igone whome lyſt force hardely laſſe preaſe yt bet come forth wyth loke ye thanken humbly hem thre ye maye goodly tyme yſe taketh hem leue leſt longe hys reſtes hym byreue innocent pandarus entente quod tho creſeyde go vncle dere arme arme inwarde wt ſhe wēte auyſynge well wordes chere pandarus erneſtfull manere sayd folke goddes loue praye stynteth ryght ſoftely playe auyſeth folke bene wythin plyte one god hym amende inwarde thus full ſoftely begyn nece coniure hyghly defende hys halfe whych ſoule v al ſende vertue corownes twayne slee thys mā yt hath payne fye deuell thynke whych one plyte lyeth come anone thynke ſuche taryed tyde loſt ny woll ye ſayne ye ben one secondly yet deuyneth none vpon two come nowe yf ye conne whyle folke blent lo tyme wōne tyterynge purſute delayes folke deuyne waggynge tree though ye wolde han mery dayes dare ye ſhe ſhe spake ſuche worde thus loked leſt tyme loſt dare wyth dele come therfore bryngeth hym hele nowe ye louers ben troylus cankedorte lay might ye whyſpryng hem thought lorde ryght rēneth ſorte fully dye haue anone comforte fyrſt tyme ſhulde pray loue myghty god ſhall ſaye ¶explicit liber ſecundus blyſfull lyght bemes clere adorneth thyrde heuen fayre ſonnes leſe ioues doughter dere pleaſaunce loue goodly debonayre gentyll hertes aye redy repayre cauſe heale gladneſſe yheryed thy myght thy goodneſſe heauen hell erthe ſalte ſee felte thy myght yf well dyſcerne man beeſt fyſhe herbe grene tree fele tymes wyth vapour eterne god loueth loue woll naught werne thys worlde lyues creature wythouten loue worth maye endure ye ioues fyrſt thylke affectes glade whych thynges lyuen al cōmenden amorous hem made mortall thynge lyſt aye ye yeue hem loue eaſe aduerſyte thouſand formes downe hym ſente loue erth lyſte hente ye fyrce marce apeaſen hys yre lyſt ye maken hertes dygne algates hem ye woll ſet afyre dreden ſhame vyces reſygne ye done hem curteys freſhe benigne hye lowe wyght entendeth ioyes yt hath myght ſendeth ye holden reygne houſe vnite ye ſoth faſt cauſe frendſhyp ben alſo ye knewen thylke couered qualyte thynges whych folke wondren ſo conſtrue howe may go loueth hym loueth fyſhe cometh ye folke lawe haue ſet vniuerſe thys knowe hem louers ſo ſtryueth wt hath ye werſe nowe lady bryght thy benignite reuerence hem ſeruen whoſe clerke ſo techeth deuyſe ioye felt thy ſeruyce yea naked herte ſentement hylde ſhewe thy ſwetneſſe cal • ope thy voyce nowe preſent •• nede ſeeſt thou dyſtreſſe howe mote tell anone ryght gladneſſe troylus venus heriynge whych nede hath god hym brynge ¶incipit liber tertius lay thys meane whyle troylus recordynge hys leſſon thys manere mafey thought thus wol ſay thus thus woll playne vnto lady dere worde good thys ſhalbe chere thys nyll foryeten wyſe god lene hym werken deuyſe lorde ſo hys herte gan quappe herynge come ſhorte ſyke pandarus ledde lappe came nere gan curteyn pyke ſayd god bote ſyke se comen vyſyte lo ſhe death wyte therwyth ſemed wepte almoſte quod troylus ſo routhfully wo myghty god thou woſte ſe truly syr ꝙ creſeyde pandare ye ſwete herte ala maye ryſe knele honoure ſome wyſe dreſſed hym vpwarde ſhe ryght tho gan hondes ſofte vpon hym ley loue god ye ſo quod ſhe ey thys ſey syr comen cauſes twey fyrſt thanke lordſhyp eke continuaunce wolde beſeke thys troylus herde hys lady praye lordſhip woxe neither quicke ne deed ne myght worde ſhame ſaye though men ſhulden ſmyten hys heed lorde ſo woxe ſodeynlyche reed ſyr hys leſſon wende conne prayen hys wyt yronne creſeyde thys aſpyed well ynough ſhe wyſe loued hym neuer yt laſſe nere aperte made tough bolde ſynge foole maſſe hys ſhame gan ſomwhat paſſe hys reſons may rymes holde woll tell techen bokes olde chaūged voyce ryght hys drede whych voyce eke quoke therto hys manere goodly abaſht nowe hys hewes rede nowe pale vnto creſeyde hys lady dere wyth loke downe caſt humble iyoldē chere lo alderfyrſt worde hym twyſe mercy mercy ſwete herte ſtynt whē might bring next worde god wote haue faythfully haue konnynge ben god ſo ſoule ſaue ſhal tyl wofull wyght graue though dare ne vnto playne iwys ſuffre laſſe payne thus moch nowe ah womālyche wyfe maye brynge yf thys dyſpleſe ſhall wreke vpon myne owne lyfe ryght ſone trowe hert eſe yf wyth death herte maye apeſe ſens ye han herde ſomwhat ſey nowe retche neuer howe ſone dey therwyth hys manly ſorowe beholde myght haue made hert ſtone rew pandare wept water wolde poked euer hys nece newe new ſayd wo begon ben hertes trewe loue god make thys thinge ende ſlee v one er ye wende ꝙ ſhe god trouth nat ye wylne ſey ey ꝙ ye haue hym routh goddes loue doth hym dey nowe thus ꝙ ſhe wolde hym prey tell fyne hys entente yet wyſt neuer well mente meane ſwete herte dere quod troylus goodly freſhe free wyth ſtremes eyen clere ye wolden ſomtyme frendly ſe agreen may ben wythouten braunche vyce wyſe trouth alwaye ſeruyſe lady ryght chefe reſorte wyth wytte diligence haue ryght lyſt comforte vnder yerde egall myne offence death yf breake defence ye deygne ſo moche honour cōmaunden aught hour ben humble trewe secrete paynes pacient euer deſyren freſhly newe ſeruen ben aye ylike dilygent good herte al holy talent receyuen wel howe ſore ſmerte lo meane myne owne ſwete hert quod pandarus lo hard requeſt reaſonable lady warne nowe nece myne natall ioues feeſte god ye ſhulde ſterue yerne heren wel man wol nothyng yern honour ſene almoſt ſterue ben ſo lothe ſuffre ſerue wyth ſhe gan eyen caſt full eaſely full debonairly auyſyng hyed faſt wyth neuer worde ſayd hym ſoftely myn honour ſafe wolde wel truly ſuch forme deuyſe receyuen fully ſeruice beſechyng hym goddes loue wolde honour trouthe gentelleſſe wel meane eke meanen wel myn honour wit beſyneſſe aye kepe maye done gladneſſe hence forthe iwys nyl nat fayne nowe bethe al hole lenger ye ne playne natheleſſe warne ꝙ ſhe kynges ſonne although ye ywis ye ſhal haue ſoueraynte loue right caſe ne nyl forbeare ye done amys wrathe whyle ye ſerue cheryſſhen right ye deſerue ſhortly dere hert al knyght beth glad draweth luſtyneſſe ſhal trewly al ful myght bytter turnen al ſweteneſſe ſhe may gladneſſe euery wo ye ſhal recouer blyſſe armes toke gan kyſſe fyl pandarus knee vp eyen heuen threw helde hondes hye immortal god ꝙ mayſt nat dyen cupide meane mayſte glorifye venus thou mayſte maken melodye withouten honde ſemeth towne myracle yche eche bell ſowne ho nowe matere folke wol comen vp anone haue lettre redde lo hem coniure creſeyde one two thou troylus whā yu mayſt gone myn houſe ye ben warnyng ful wel ſhal ſhapen cōmyng eaſeth hertes right ynough let ſe whiche ſhal beare bel ſpeke loue aright therwith lough haue leyſer tell quod troylus howe long ſhal dwell er ben done ꝙ whē thou maiſt ryſe thyng ſhal right liſt deuyſe heleyne alſo deiphebus tho comen vpward right ye ſtayres ende lorde ſo tho gan gronen troylus brother ſyſter blende ꝙ pandarus tyme wende take nece myn leaue al thre let hem ſpeake cometh forth toke leaue hem ful thryftely ſhe wel coulde reuerence vnto ful dydden hardely wonder wel ſpeaken abſence prayſyng excellence gouernaunce wyt hyr manere comendeden ioye nowe let wende vnto owne place turne troylus agayne gan ful lightly lettre pace deiphebus gardyn ſeyne heleyne hem wolde feyne deleuered ben ſayd hem leſte ſlepe tale haue reſte heleyne kyſte toke leue blyue deiphebus eke home wente euery wight pandarus faſte may driue troylus tho came lyne ryght paillet al gladde nyght troylus lay mery chere tale wel hem yfere whē euery wight voyded two al dores faſte yſhette tel ſhorte without wordes mo pandarus without lette vp roſe beddes ſyde ſette gan ſpeaken ſobre wyſe troylus ſhal deuyſe myn alderleueſt lorde brother dere god wot thou ſate ſo ſore whan ſawe ſo languyſſhyng loue thy wo woxe alway al might al lore haue euer ſythen done beſyneſſe bringe ioye diſtreſſe haue brouȝt ſuch plyte yu woſte yt thou ſtondeſt way faren wel ſay boſte woſte thou ſhame ſay haue begon gamen play whiche neuer done ſhal efte al tho thouſande folde brother ſay becomen betwyxen game erneſt ſuche mene maken woman vnto men comen al ſay nat thou woſte well mene haue nece vyces clene fully made thy gentylleſſe tryſt ſhal ben ryght thy ſelfe lyſte god yt al wotteth take wytneſſe neuer thys couetyſe wrought onely abredge diſtreſſe wel nye thou dydeſt thouȝt good brother nowe ought goddes loue kepe blame sen thou art wyſe ſaue alway name wel thou woſt name yet amōges ye people ſayd halowed man vnbore dare wel ſwere euer wyſte ſhe dyd amys wo cauſe al thys may thynken ſhe nece dere eme traytour eke yfere wyſte yt myn engyn myne nece yput fantaſye done thy luſt holly thyn al worlde wolde vpon crye ſay worſte trecherye dyd thys caſe euer begonne ſhe fordone thou right naught ywōne wherfore er wol ferther gone paas yet efte beſeche fully ſay priuyte go v thys caas ſayne thou v neuer wray nat wrothe though ofte pray holden ſecre ſuche hygh matere ſkylfull thou woſte well prayere thinke wo ther hath betyd er makyng auauntes men rede myſchaunce worlde yet fro day day right wycked dede whiche theſe wyſe clerkes ben dede haue euer thys prouerbed v yonge fyrſt vertue kepe tonge nere wylne abredge diffuſyon ſpeche coulde almoſt thouſande olde ſtories aledge woman loſte falſe fooles boſte prouerbes canſte thy ſelfe ynowe woſte ayenſt vyce ben blabbe al ſayd men ſothe often gabbe tonge ala ſo often beforne haſte thou made many lady bright hewe sayd welaway day borne many maydens ſorowe newe parte al vntrewe mē yelpe brought preue kynde none auauntour leue auauntour lyer al one thus poſe woman graunt loue ſayth woll ſhe none ſworne holden ſecre tel two thre iwys auauntour leeſt lyer eke breke beheeſt loke thā nat blame suche maner folke ſhall clepe hem hem auaunte woman name yet behyght hem neuer ne ne knowe hem myne olde hat wonder ſo god ſende heele though womē dreden v men deele ſay nat thys miſtruſt ne wyſe men fooles nyce harme ye worlde nowe wel folye ofte malyce wel wote wyſe folke vyce woman dredeth yf ſhe well auyſed wyſe ben fooles harme chaſtyſed nowe purpoſe leue brother dere haue thyng yt haue ſayd mynde kepe cloſe good chere thy dayes thou ſhalt trewe fynde ſhall thy proceſſe ſet ſuche kynde god toforne ſhall ſuffyſe ſhall right thou wolte deuyſe wel wote thou meaneſt well parde therfore dare fully vndertake thou woſte eke thy lady graunted day ſet chartres make haue good night may lēger wake byd ſyth thou arte blyſſe god ſende dethe ſoone lyſſe might tellen halfe ioye feeſt whych ſoule troylus tho felte heryng theffect pandarus beheeſt olde wo made herte ſwelte gan tho ioye waſten melte richeſſe ſyghes ſore one fledde felte hem right ſo theſe holtes theſe hayis han wynter deed ben drie reueſten hem grene whan may whan euery luſty lyſteth play right ſelfe wyſe ſothe ſay woxe ſodainly herte full ioye gladder neuer mā troye gan loke pandarus vp caſte ful ſoberly frendly ſe ſayd frende april laſte well thou woſte yf remembre howe nyghe yt dethe wo thou founde howe thou dyddeſt thy beſyneſſe knowe cauſe diſtreſſe thou woſte longe forbare ſay arte man beſt tryſt peryll none bewray wyſt well tel yf lyſte sythe ſo loth thy ſelfe wyſte howe durſte mo tellen matere quake nowe wight may v natheleſſe god ſwere lyſt may al world gouerne yf lye achylles wyth ſpere myne herte cleaue al lyfe eterne mortal yf late yerne wolde bewray durſt ſhulde conne al good god made vnder ſonne rather dye wolde determyne thynketh nowe ſtocked priſon wretchydneſſe fylthe vermyne captyfe cruell kyng agamenon temple towne vpon goddes woll ſwere morowe day yf lyketh thou haſte ſo moche ydon ne may neuer deſerue know well might thouſande tymes morowe ſterue woll ſerue ryght thy ſlaue whyther ſo thou wende euer vnto lyues ende al myn herte beſeche neuer thou deme ſuche folye ſhall ſayne thought thy ſpeche whiche thou doeſt cōpanye ſhulde wene baudrye nat woode yf leude nat ſo wot well parde gothe golde rycheſſe ſuche meſſages call ye lyſte thou doeſt call gentylneſſe compaſſyon felawſhyp tryſte departe ſo wyde wyſte howe dyuerſyte required betwixen thynges lyke haue lered yt thou knowe thynke nat ne wene thys ſeruyce ſhame iape haue fayre ſuſter polixene caſſandre heleyne frape ſhe neuer ſo fayre well yſhape tel whiche thou wylte euerychone haue thyne let alone buth ſyth yt thou haſt done ſeruyce lyfe ſaue non hope mede loue god great empriſe parfourme nowe moſte nede hygh lowe withouten drede wol alway thyne heſtes al kepe haue nowe good nyght let v bothe ſlepe thus helde hem eche well apayde worlde ne might bet amende morowed whā arayde eche hys owne nedes gan entende troylus though fyre brende ſharpe deſyre hope pleaſaunce nat forgate good gouernaunce ſelfe wt māhode gan reſtreyne eche rakel dede eche vnbridled chere lyuen ſothe ſayne ne ſhulde haue wyſt word manere mente touching matere euery wyght ferre cloude ſo wyſe wel diſſymulen coulde al ye whyle deuyſe thys hys lyfe full myght day martes hyghe ſeruyce ſayne armes knyght parte longe nyght lay thought might ſerue lady beſt thanke deſerue nyll nat ſweare though lay ſofte thought na ſomwhat diſeſed ne turned pillowes ofte wolde miſſed haue ben eaſed ſuche caſe men nat alwaye pleaſed naught wot deme poſſibylyte certayne purpoſe go whyle written geſte ſawe lady ſomtyme alſo wyth ſpake whā yt ſhe durſt leſte bothe auyſe beſte apoynteden ful warely nede durſte howe wold procede ſpoken ſo ſhorte wyſe ſuche awayte alway ſuche fere leſte wight deuynen deuyſe wolde hem two lay eere worlde ſo lefe hem ne cupyde wolde hem grace ſende maken ſpeche right ende thylke lytel ſpake wrought hys wyſe goſte toke aye ſuche hede ſemed wyſte ſhe thought withouten worde ſo nede bydde hym aught dō aught forbede ſhe thought yt loue al come late al ioye opened yate ſhortly thys proceſſe pace wel werke wordes beſette ſo ful ſtode lady grace twenty thouſande tymes er ſhe lette tonked god ſhe euer hym mette coulde hym gouerne ſuche ſeruyce al worlde ne might bet deuyſe ſhe founde ſo diſcrete ſecrete ſuche obeyſaunce well ſhe felte wall ſteele ſhelde euery diſpleſaunce ben hys good gouernaunce wyſe ſhe nomore afered meane ferre ought ben required pandarus quicke alway fyre euer ylyke preſt dyligent eaſe frende ſet al hys deſyre ſhone aye fro ſent letter bare whan troylus abſent neuer man hys frendes nede ne bare hym bet withouten drede parauēture ſom mā waytē wold euery worde ſonde loke chere troylus rehercen ſhulde whyle vnto hys lady dere trowe longe thyng wight yt ſtante ſuche diſioynte wordes al euery loke poynte ſothe haue nat herde done er ſtorye none ne man wene though wolde coulde nat ywys ſome epyſtel hem betwene wold ſaith myn auctour wel cōtene nye half boke hī lyſt nat write howe ſhulde lyue endyte great effecte ſay thus ſtondyng concorde quyete thys ylke two creſeyde troylus haue tolde tyme ſwete saue onely often might nat mete ne leyſer haue ſpeches fulfell befyl ryght ſhall tel pandarus euer dyd might right fyne ſhall ſpeke bryngen houſe ſome nyght fayre nece troylus yfere leyſer al thys hygh matere touchyng loue ye ful vp bounde doute tyme founde great delyberation euery thyng therto might auayle forne caſte put execution neyther lefte coſte ne trauayle come yf hem lyſte hem ſhuld nothyng fayle ben aught aſpyed wyſte wel inpoſſyble dredeleſſe clere wynde euery pye euery let game nowe wel al worlde blynde mater bothe fremed tame tymber al redy vp frame v lacketh naught weten wolde certayne houre ſhe comen ſhulde troylus purueyaunce knewe full wayted aye vpon eke made great ordynaunce founde hys cauſe therwith aray myſſed nyght day whyle aboute ſeruyce gone done hys ſacrifyce muſte ſuche temple alone wake anſwered apollo fyrſt ſene holy laurer quake er apollo ſpake tree tell hym next whan grekes ſhulde flye thy let hym man god forbede pray apollo helpe thys nede nowe lytell done pandare vp ſhortly ſayne right ſone vpon chaungyng ye moone whā lightleſſe ye world night twayne welken ſhope hym rayne ſtreyght morowe vnto hys nece wente ye haue well herde fyne hys entente whā comē gan anon playe wonte hym ſelfe iape fynally ſwore gan ſay ſhe ſhulde hym nat eſcape lenger done hym cape certaynly ſhe muſte leue come ſoupen hys houſe wyth hym eue ſhe lough gan fyrſt excuſe ſayd rayneth lo howe ſhulde gone let ꝙ ne ſtonde nat thus muſe mote done ye ſhal come anone laſte herof fell one el faſte ſwore eere nolde neuer comen ſhe sone ſhe hym gan rowne aſked hym yf troylus ſwore nay towne ſayd nece poſe durſte neuer haue feere rather men might hym aſpye leuer thouſande fold dye naught lyſt myne auctour fully declare ſhe thought whan ſayd ſo troylus towne yfare yf ſayd therof ſothe wythouten awayte go graūted ſyth beſought hys nece obeyed ought natheleſſe yet gan ſhe hym beſeche though wt gone feere beware gofyſhe people ſpeche dreme thynges neuer well auyſe brought ſayd eme ſens muſte tryſt loke al wel nowe lyſt ſwore ſtockes ſtones goddes heuen dwell el leauer ſoule bone wyth pluto kyng depe ben hell tantalus ſhulde tell whan al well roſe toke leue ſhe ſouper came whan eue wyth certayne owne men fayre nece antigone woman nyne ten glad nowe trowe ye troylus ſtode myght ſe throughout lytel wyndowe ſtewe hebeſhet ſith midnight mewe vnwyſt euery wight pandare poynt nowe whan yt ſhe cōe wyth ioye frendes fare eme anone armes hath nome ſupper ſome whan tyme ful ſofte hem ſette god wote deynte ferre fette ſupper gannen ryſe eaſe well hert freſhe glade wel coude beſt deuyſe lyken laughen made ſonge ſhe playde tolde tale wade laſte euery thyng hath ende toke leaue nedes wolde wende fortune executrice wyerdes influentes theſe heuens hye sothe vnder god ye ben hierdes though v beeſtes ben cauſes wrie mene ſhe gā homward hye execute al beſyde leue goddes wil ſhe muſte bleue bente moone horne pale saturnus ioue cāc • ioyned ſuche rayne heuen gan auale euery maner woman ſmoky rayne feere whiche pandare tho lough ſayd thenne nowe tyme lady gon henne good nece yf might euer pleaſe thyng pray ꝙ myne herte nowe ſo great eaſe dwell al nyght wyth owne houſe parde trouhe ſay nat game wende nowe ſhame creſeyde could moche good halfe worlde toke hede hys prayere ſens rayned al flode thouȝt good chepe may dwel graunt gladly frendes chere haue thonke grutche abyde home gone may nat wel betyde woll ꝙ ſhe myne vncle liefe dere sen lyſt ſkyll ſo ryght glad dwellen ſayd againe wolde go wy graunt mercy nece ꝙ tho game ſothe tell glad ſens lyſte dwel thus al wel tho began aright newe ioye feeſt agayne pandarus yf goodly myght wolde haue hyed bedde fayne ſayd lorde huge rayne thys wether ſlepen rede v ſoone begyn nece wote ye wol lay ſhul nat lyggen ferre ſonder ye neyther ſhullen dare ſay noyſe rayne ne thonder god ryght cloſet yonder wol vtter houſe alone ben wardayne woman euerychone myddel chambre ye ſe shall woman ſlepen wel ſofte ſayd ſhall ſeluen yf ye lyggen well nyght come ofte careth nat wether loſte wyne anon whan ſo leſte go ſlepe trowe beſte ny herafter ſone voyde dronke trauers drawe anon gan euery wyght naught done place chambre gon euermore ſo ſternelyche rone blewe therwyth ſo wonderlyche loude wel nyghe man heren coulde tho pādarus eme right ought woman ſuche moſt aboute ful glad vnto beddes ſyde brought toke leaue gan full lowe loute ſayd cloſet dore wythout right ouertwarte woman lyggen lyſt hem ye may ſone cal whan ſhe cloſet layde woman forth ordynaunce bedde haue ſayde na ſkippē praunce boden go bedde miſchaunce wyght ſterynge let hem ſlepen bedde pandarus yt wel couthe eche adele olde daunce euery poynte therin whan ſawe thyng wele thought wolde vpon werke begyn gan ſtewe dore al ſofte vnpyn ſtyl ſtone without lenger lette troylus adown right ſette ſhortly poynte right gon al thys werke tolde worde ende ſayd make redy right anon thou ſhalt heuen blyſſe wende blyſful venus thou grace ſende ꝙ troylus neuer yet dede er nowe ne halfendele drede ꝙ pandarus ne drede neuer adele ſhal right thou wolte deſyre thriue night ſhal make wele caſten al gruel fyre yet bliſfull venus nyght yu enſpyre ꝙ troylus wy ſerue euer bet bet ſhal tyll ſterue yf venus full myrthe aſpectes badde mar saturne thou combuſte let byrthe thy father pray al thylke harme diſturne grace glad ayen may turne loue hym thou louedeſt ſhawe meane adon ye bore ſ • awe ioue eke loue fayre europe forme bulle away thou ſet helpe mar thou wt thy blody cope loue cipria thou naught ne let phebus thīke whā daphne ſelue ſ •• vnder barke laucer woxe drede yet loue helpe nowe thys nede mercurye loue eke pallas wt aglauros wrothe nowe helpe eke dyane beſeke thys vyage nat lothe fatall ſuſtren whyche clothe ſhapen deſtyne ſponne helpeth thys werke begon ꝙ pādarus thou wretched mouces herte arte thou agaſt ſo ſhe wol byte furred cloke vpon thy ſherte folowe wol haue wyte byde let gon alyte wyth gan vndone trappe troylus brought lappe ſterne wynde ſo loude gan route wight noyſe might layen dore without ful ſykerly ſlepten al yfere pandarus ful ſobre chere gothe dore anon withouten lette laye ſoftely ſhette came ayenwarde priuely hys nece awoke aſketh goth dere nece quod • ne wondreth nat ne haue feere nere came ſayd eere worde loue god beſeche let wyght aryſe heren ſpeche way ye comen benedicite quod ſhe howe vnwyſt hem al ſecrete trappe dore ꝙ quod tho creſcide let ſome wight cal eygh god forbyde ſhulde ſo fal ꝙ pandarus ye ſuch foly wrought might deme thing neuer er thouȝt nat good ſlepyng hounde wake ne yeue wyght cauſe deuyne woman ſlepyng al vndertake yt hem houſe men myght myne ſlepen wollen tyl ſunne ſhyne whan tale brought ende vnwyſt right came ſo woll wende nowe nece myne ye ſhul wel vnderſtande ꝙ ſo ye woman demen al holde loue man honde hym lefe dere herte call maken hym howue aboue call mene loue mene doth ſelfe ſhame agyle nowe wherby tel al thys ye wote ſelfe wel wyght howe loue al fully graunted troylus worthyeſt wyght one worlde therto trouth yplyght alonge ye nolde neuer falſen whyle ye lyuen ſholde nowe ſtonte thus yt ſyth fro went thys troylus ryght platly ſeyne gutter priuy went chambre come al thys reyne vnwyſte euery maner wyght certeyne saue ſelfe wyſely haue ioye fayth iowe priam troye come ſuch payne diſtreſſe al fully woode thys ſodaynly mote fal woodneſſe yf god helpe cauſe thys ſayth tolde frende hys yt ye ſhuld louē one hyght horaſt ſorow niȝt ſhal laſt creſeyde al thys wonder herde g • ul ſodaynly aboute herte colde ſyghe ſhe ſoroufully anſwerde ala wende ſo tale tolde dere herte wolde nat holde lyghtly falſe ala conceytes wronge harme done nowe lyue lōge horaſte ala falſen troylus knowe hym god helpe ſo ꝙ ſhe ala wycked ſpyrite tolde hym thus nowe certes eme morowe ſe ſhal therof fully excuſed euer dyd woman yf lyke worde ſhe gan ful ſore ſyke god ꝙ ſhe ſo wordley ſelyneſſe whych clerkes callen falſe felicite ymedled many bytterneſſe full anguyſhous god wot ꝙ ſhe condicion veyne proſperyte eyther ioyes comen nat yfere el wyght hath hem alway brotyl wele mannes ioye vnſtable wyght ſo howe yu play eyther wot ioye arte muable wote mote bene one tway yf wote nat howe may ſay hath ioye ſelyneſſe ignoraunce aye derkeneſſe nowe yf wote ioye tranſitorye euery ioy worldly thyng mote flye euery tyme hath memorye dred leſyng maketh may parfyte ſykerneſſe yf leſe ioye ſet myte thā ſemeth ioye worth ful lyte wherfore wolde deffine thys matere treuly aught eſpye wele thys worlde thou wycked ſerpent ielouſye thou miſbeleued enuyous folye haſt thou troylus made vntriſt neuer yet agylte wyſt quod pādarus thus fallen thys caas vncle myn ꝙ ſhe tolde hym thys doth dere hert thus ala ye wote ye nece myne ꝙ hope al ſhal wel amys ye may quench al thys leſte doth ryght ſo holde beſte ſhal morowe ywys ꝙ ſhe god forne ſo ſhal ſuffyſe morowe ala fayre ꝙ nay nay may nat ſtonden wyſe nece myne writen clerkes wyſe peryl wyth dretchyng drawe nay ſoch abode nat worth hawe nece al thynge hath tyme dare auowe whan chambre fyre hal wel nede ſodaynly reſcowe deſputen aſken amonges al howe candel ſtrawe fal ah benedicite al amonge fare harme done farwell feldefare nece myne ne take nat greſe ye ſuffre hym al nyght thys wo god helpe ſo ye neuer lefe dare ſaine ther two wel wote ye wol nat ſo ye bene wyſe done ſo great folye put hys lyfe al nyght ieopardye hym neuer lefe▪ god wene ye neuer thyng ſo lefe quod ſhe nowe thryfte ꝙ yt ſhal ſene ſyth ye make thys enſample iche al nyght wolde ſorowe ſe al treaſour towne troy bydde god neuer mote haue ioye nowe loke yf ye bene hys loue shulde put hys lyfe al nyght ieopardy thyng nought ye god aboue nat onely thys delay cometh foly malice yf ſhulde nat lye platly ye ſuffre hym diſtreſſe ye neyther bounte done ne gentylleſſe quod tho creſeyde wol ye done thyng ye therwyth ſhal ſtynte al diſeaſe haue bere hym blewe ryng nothing might better pleſe saue ſelfe ne herte apeſe ſaye dere herte ſorowe cauſeleſſe ſhal ſene morowe rynge ꝙ ye haſelwodes ſhaken ye nece myne ye ryng muſt haue ſtone myght deed men alyue maken ſuch ryng trowe ye haue none diſcrecion heed gone fele nowe ꝙ routh time yloſt wel maiſt thou curſen ſlouth wote ye wel noble hye courag • ne ſoroweth ne ſtynteth eke lyte yf fole ielous rage nolde ſetten hys ſorowe amyte feſſe hym fewe wordes whyte day whā might fynde thys thyng ſtant al another kynde thys ſo gentyl ſo tender hert wt deth wol hys ſorowes wreke truſt wel howe ſore ſmert wol ialous wordes ſpeke thy nece er herte breke ſpeke ſelfe hym matere wyth worde ye may hys hert ſtere nowe haue tolde peryl hys comyng vnwyſt euery wight ne parde harme may none ne ſyn wolde ſelfe wyth al night ye knowe eke howe owne knyght ryght ye muſt vpon hym f • yſte al preſt fetche hym whā lyſte accident ſo pytous eke ſo lyke ſoth prime face troylus knyght ſo dere priue cōmyng ſyker place though ſhe dyd grace conſydred al thynges ſtode wonder ſens dyd al goode creſeyde anſwerde wyſelye god reſte ſoule bryng wo eme ywys fayne wolde done beſt grace ſo whether ye dwell hym go tyl god bettre mynde ſende dulcarnon ryght wyttes ende quod pandarus yea nece wol ye dulcarnon called flemyng wretch ſemeth hard wretch woll nauȝt lere ſlouth wylful • etches ſayd hem yt nat worth two fetch ye ben wiſe yt ye han honde ny neyther hard ne ſkylful withſtonde thā eme ꝙ ſhe doth lyſt er come wol vp fyrſt aryſe loue god ſens al tryſt two ye bethe bothe wyſe werketh nowe ſo diſcret wyſe honour may haue pleſaunce al gouernaunce wel ſayd ꝙ nece dere good thryfte wyſe gētyl hert lyggeth ſtyl taketh hym ryght nedeth ferther hym ſtert ech eaſeth ſorowes ſmert loue god venus herye ſone hope ſhal ben merye troylus ful ſone knee ſette ful ſobrely ryght beddes heed beſt wyſe hys lady grette lorde ſhe wore ſodaynlyche reed ne thoughe men ſhulde ſmyten heed colde worde aright brynge ſodaynly hys ſodayne comyng pandarus ſo wele coulde fele euery thyng play anon began ſaid nece ſe lorde knele nowe trouth ſe thys gentyll man word quyſhen ran ſaid kneleth whyle leſte god hertes brynge ſone reſte naught ſayn ſhe bad nat riſe ſorowe put remembraunce el ſhe toke wyſe duetie obſeruaunce wel fynde ſhe hym pleſaūce ſhe hym kyſt al though ſhe ſyked ſore bade ſytte adowne withoutē quod pandarus wol ye well begyn nowe doth ſytte good nece dere vpon beddes ſyde al therwythin eche bet may wt worde drew fyere toke light fonde countenaunce loke vpon olde romaunce creſeyde troylus ladye ryght clere ſtode grounde ſykerneſſe al thought ſhe ſeruaunt knyght ne ſhulde non vntrouth geſſe nathleſſe conſydred hys diſtreſſe loue cauſe ſuch foly thus ſpake ſhe hym ialouſy lo hert myne wolde excellence loue ayenſt man may ne ought eke goodly maken reſiſtence eke bycauſe felte wel ſay great trouth ſeruyce euery day yt hert al myn ſoth ſayne droue rew vpon payne goodnes haue foūdē alway yet dere hert knyght thanke ferre haue wyt al moche ryght emforth cōnyng myght haue aye ſhal howe ſore ſmert ben trewe hole wythall myne hert dredeleſſe ſhal founden preue herte myne al thys ſayne shal wel told ſo yt ye nought greue though right ſelf cōplain wyth meane finally payne halte hert mine heuyneſſe fully ſlayne euery wronge redreſſe good myne ne howe ielouſy ala wycked wyuere thus cauſeleſſe cropen harme wold faine deliuere ala al hole ſlyuere shulde haue hys refute ſo digne place ioue ſone hert race thou auctour nature thys honour thy dignyte folke vngylty ſuffre iniure gylty al quyte goth leful playne vndeſerued ſuffreſt ialouſy wolde vpon playne crye eke al wo folke nowe vſen ſayne ryght thus yee ialouſy loue wolde buſhel venym al excuſen whā graine loue ſhoue wote hygh ioue ſytte aboue lyker loue hate grame ought beare hys name certayne ſome maner ialouſye excuſable ſome ywys whan cauſe ſome ſuch fantaſye wyth pyte ſo wel expreſſed vnneth doth ſayth amys goodly drynketh vp al hys diſtreſſe excuſe gentylleſſe ſome ſo full furye diſpyte ſurmounteth hys repreſſion hert myne ye nat plyte thonke god paſſion wyl cal illuſion habundaunce loue beſy cure doth herte diſeſe endure ſory wroth deuoure hertes reſ • ſo lyſt ordal othe ſorte wyſe ſo leſte loue god let preue beſt yf gylty dey ala myght done ſey wyth fewe bryght teeres newe eyen fel thus ſhe ſeyde god yu woſt thouȝht ne dede vntrew troylus neuer yet creſeyde yt heed downe bed ſhe leyde ſhete wrigh ſyghed ſore held peace nat word ſpake ſhe help god quench ſorow hope ſhal beſt may haue ſene ful miſty morowe folowen ful ofte mery ſommers day wynter foloweth grene may • men ſene alday reden eke ſtories ſharpe ſhoures bene victory thys troylus whan wordes herde haue ye care lyſte ſlepe thought hym ſtrokes yerde ſe creſeyde hys lady wepe wel felte aboute hys herte crepe euery teare whych creſeyde ſtert crāpe dethe ſtrayne ye hert hys mynde gan tyme acurſe came borne nowe wycke turned worſe al labour hath done beforne wend loſt thought na lorne pandarus thought ala thy wyle serueth naught ſo welaway whyle withal hynge adown heed fel knee ſorowfully ſyght might ſaine felt na deed wroth ſhe yt ſhuld ſorowes liȝt natheleſſe whan ſpeken myght thā ſaide thus god wot yt game whan al wyſt blame therwyth ſorowe hert ſhette hys eyen fyl nat teere euery ſpyrit vygour knette aſtonyed oppreſſed felyng ſorowe hys feere aught el fledde towne adowne fyl al ſodaynly ſwoune thys lytle ſorowe ſe al huſhte pandarus vp faſte nece peace loſt ꝙ bethe agaſte certayne laſte thys bedde hym caſte ſayd thefe mannes herte rent al bare ſherte ſayd nece ye helpe v nowe ala owne troylus lorne iwys ſo wolde wyſte howe ful fayne ꝙ ſhe ala borne yee nece wol ye pullen thorne ſtycketh herte ꝙ pandare say al foryeue ſtynt al thys fare yea quod ſhe ful leuer al good ſunne aboute goth wythal ſhe ſwore hys eere iwys dere herte wrothe haue trouth many othe nowe ſpeke creſeyde naught yet might nat abreyde therwt ponce paumes handes gan frote wete tēples twayn deliuer hym fro bytter bandes ofte hym kyſte ſhortly ſayne rewaken ſhe dyd al payne laſt gan breth drawe ſwoune ſone adawe gan bet mynde reaſon hym take wonder ſore abaſhed ywys ſygh whan gan bet awake ſaid mercy god thing ye wyth ſeluen thus amys quod tho creſeyde man game troylus woll ye thus ſhame therwtal arme ouer hym ſhe ſayde al foryaue oft tyme keſte thonked ſpake ſayde fyl purpoſe hertes reſte ſhe anſwerde hym leſte goodly wordes hym diſporte gan ofte hys ſorowes comfort quod pandarus aught eſpyen light ne ſeruen naught lyght good ſycke folkes eyen loue god ſens ye ben brought wt thus good plyte let non heuy thouȝt ben hangyng herts twey bare candel chymeney soone though nede whan ſhe ſuche othes lyſte deuyſe take thought tho feere ne cauſe eke none byd hym thence ryſe yet leſſe thyng othes may ſuffyſe many caſe euery wyght geſſe loueth wel meaneth gentylleſſe effecte ſhe wolde wete anon man eke ialous ſens cauſe non eke ſigne toke bade tel beſyly el certayne ſhe bare hym honde thys done malyce fonde wythouten ſhortly ſayne muſt obey vnto thys ladyes heeſt laſſe harme muſt fayne ſayd whan ſhe ſuch feeſt myght haue loked leeſt nat al dere ynough ryſhe nedes muſt cauſe fyſhe ſhe anſwerde ſwete al ſo harme yt ſens non yuell meane god bought v two al thynge myne entent cleene argumentes ne worth beene wol ye chyldyſhe ialous counterfete nowe worthy ye ybete tho troylus gan ſoroufully ſyke leſt ſhe wroth hym thouȝt hys hert deyde ſayde ala vpon ſorowes ſyke haue mercy ſwete herte myne creſeyde yf tho wordes ſeyde wronge wol treſpace doth lyſt al grace ſhe anſwerde gylte myſericorde ſayne foryeue al thys euermore thys nyght recorde bethe wel ware ye nomore amys nay dere herte myne ꝙ ywys ꝙ ſhe haue ſmerte yeue myne owne ſwete herte troylus bliſſe ſuppriſed put al goddes hande mente nothyng wel ſodaynly auyſed armes faſte hym hente pandarus ful good entente layde ſlepe ſayde yf ye wyſe sweueneth leſt mo folke aryſe might may ſely larke ſay whan ſperhauke hath fote theſe ylke tway thys tale ſugre ſote though tarye yere ſomtyme mote myne auctour tellen gladneſſe wel haue tolde heuyneſſe creſeyde felte thus ytake writen clerkes bokes olde ryght aſpen leefe ſhe gan quake whan ſhe hym felte hys armes folde troylus al hole care colde gan thanken tho blyſful goddes ſeuen ſōdry paine bring folke heuē troylus armes gan ſtraine ſayd ſwete euer mote gone ye caught twayne nowe yeldeth boote none creſeyde anſwerde thus anone ne er nowe ſwete herte dere ben yolde ywys nowe nat ſoth ſayd healed feuer great ſickneſſe men muſt drynken ofte ſe ful bytter drynke haue gladneſſe men drynken oft payne great diſtreſſe meane thys auenture paine hath foūde al cure nowe ſwetneſſe ſemeth ſwete bytterneſſe aſſayed byforne wo blyſſe nowe flete none ſuch felten ſens borne nowe thys bet two lorne loue god take euery woman hede werken thus yf come nede creſeyde al quite euery drede tene ſhe iuſt cauſe tryſte made ſuch feeſt ioye ſene whan ſhe trouth cleue entent wyſt tre wyth many twyſte bytrent writhe ſwete wodbynde eche hem armes wynde newe abaſhed nyghtyngale ſtynteth fyrſt whā ſhe beginnneth ſing whan ſhe hereth heerdes tale hedge wyght ſteryng ſyker doth voice ryng ryght ſo creſeyde whan drede ſtent opened hert tolde entent right yt ſeeth hys deth yſhapen dyen mote aught may geſſe ſodaynly reſcous doth eſcapen deth brought ſykerneſſe al worlde ſuch preſent gladneſſe troylus hath lady ſwete wyth worſe happe god let v neuer mete armes ſmal ſtreyght backe ſoft ſydes longe fleſhly ſmoth whyte gan ſtroke good thrifte bade full oft ſnowyſſe throte breſtes round lite thus thys heuen gan delyte therwithal thouſande tymes kyſt done ioye vnneth wyſt ſayd thus loue charite thy mother eke citheria ſwete thy ſelfe next heryed ſhe venus meane wel wylly planete next meneus grete neuer man goddes holde ye haue brought fro care cold benigne loue thou holy bonde thynges ſo wol grace lyſte nat honouren lo thys deſyre wol flye wythouten wyngē noldeſt thou bountie hem ſocouren ſeruen beſt moſt alway labouren yet al loſte yt dare well ſayne certes yf thy grace paſſed deſertes thou ye leſte thōke coulde deſerue hem nombred ben vnto thy grace haſt holpen ther lykely ſterue beſtowed ſo hygh place thylke boundes may blyſſe pace laude reuerence thy bounte thyne excellence therwithal creſeyde anone kyſt certayne ſhe felte diſeaſe thus ſayd nowe wolde god wyſt myne hert ſwete howe might pleaſe man ꝙ euer thus eaſe fayreſt beſt euer ſey deyneth reſt may men ſene mercy paſſeth right experience felte vnworthy ſo ſwete wyght herte myne benignite thynke though vnworthy yet mote nede amenden ſome wyſe ryght
