ye vertue hye ſeruice loue god lady dere ſyth hath wrouȝt ſhall ſerue thus meane woll ye ſeere lyue yf lyſt ſterue teacheth howe may deſerue thōke ſo yt thrugh myne ignoraūce ne nothyng diſpleaſaunce certes freſh womanlyche wyfe dar ſaye trouth diligence ſhall ye fynden lyfe ne woll nat certayn breken defence yf preſent abſence loue god let ſlee dede yf lyke vnto womanhede wy ꝙ ſhe myne owne hertes luſt grounde eaſe myne hert dere graunt mercy truſt let v fal awaye fro matere ſuffyſeth ſayd worde withouten repentaunce welcome knyght peace ſuffyſaunce delyte ioyes one leeſt impoſſyble wyt ſaye iudgeth ye haue ben feeſt ſuch gladneſſe yf hem lyſt playe nomore thus theſe ylke tway nigh betwixen drede ſykerneſſe fe • ten loue great worthyneſſe blyſful nyght hem ſo longe yſought blyth vnto hem two thou wer ne ſuch feeſt wt ſoul yboght yea leeſt ioye away thou foule daūger thou feere let hem heuen blyſſe dwell ſo hygh ne tell ſoth though tellen myne auctour excellence yet haue ſayd god forne ſhall euery thyng holly ſentence yf loues reuerence haue worde eched beſt doth therwithal ryght ſeluen leſt wordes euery parte ſpeke hem vnder correction felyng haue loues arte put diſcrettion entreate make diminition langage beſeche purpoſe rather ſpeche theſe ylke two beth armes laſt loth hem ſonder gon eche wenden ben byraft el lo mooſt feere thing nyce dreames wer ful oft eche hem ſayd ſwete clyppe thus el mete lorde ſo gan goodly ſe neuer loke ne bleynt frō face ſayde dere hert maye ſoth ye ben place yea hert myne god thanke grace ꝙ tho creſeyde therwithal hym kyſt ſpyrite ioye ſhe nyſt troylus full oft eyen two gan kyſſe ſayd eyen clere ye wrought ſuche wo ye humble nettes lady dere though ther mercy writtē chere god wot text full harde fynde coude ye withouten bonde bynde therwith gan faſt armes take well hundred tymes gan ſyke nat ſuch ſorowfull ſyghes men make wo el whan folke ſyke eaſy ſyghes ſuche ben lyke ſhewed affection within ſuche ſyghes coulde nat blyu sone ſpake ſondry thinges fyll purpoſe auenture playing enterchaungeden rynges tellen ſcripture well wot broche golde aſure ruby ſet lyke herte creſeyde yaue ſtacke ſherte lorde trowe ye couetous wretche blam • th loue halte deſpyte tho pen yt muckre ketche euer yet yeue ſuche delyte loue poynt ſome plyte nay doutleſſe alſo god ſaue parfyte ioye may nygarde haue woll ſay yes lorde ſo lye tho buſy wretch ful wo drede callen loue woodneſſe follye ſhall fall hem ſhall rede ſhall forgon whyte eke rede lyue wo ther god yeue hem myſchaūce euery louer trouth auaūce wolde god tho wretch diſpyſe seruyce loue eares alſo longe mida full couetyſe therto dronken hote ſtronge creſus dyd affectes wronge teachen hem ben vyce louers nat although holde hem nyſe theſe ylke two yt ſay whan hertes wel aſſured tho gonnen ſpeake playe eke reherſen whan knewe fyrſt euery wo fere paſſed ſuche heuyneſſe thonke god turned gladneſſe euer whan hem fyll ſpeke thyng ſuche tyme agon kyſſyng tale ſhulde breke fallen newe ioye anon dyddē al myght ſyns wer one recoueren blyſſe ben eaſe payſed wo ioye countrepeyſe reaſon woll ſpeake ſlepe accordeth matere god wot toke full lytle kepe leſt night hem ſo dere ne ſhulde vayne eſcape manere beſet ioye beſyneſſe ſowneth gentylneſſe whan cocke cōmune aſtrologer gan breeſt beate crowe lucifer dayes meſſaunger gan ryſe beames throw eſtward roſe coulde knowe fortuna maior thā anon creſeyde hert ſore troylus thus ſeyde myne hertes lyfe truſt pleſaūce borne ala wo day v mote make diſceueraunce tyme ryſe hence go el loſt euer mo nyght ala wilt thou ouer v houe longe whan alemena laye ioue blacke nyght folke bookes rede ſhapen art god world hyde certayne tymes thy darke wede vnder men myght reſt abyde wel oughtē beeſtes playn folk chyde ther day wt labour wold v breſt thou thus flyeſt deyneſt v nat reſt thou doeſt ala ſhortly thyne offyce tho rakle night ther god maker kynde thyne haſte thyne vnkynde vyce faſt aye himiſpery bynde neuermore vnder yu groūd thou wind thou ſo hyeſt troye haue forgone thus haſtly ioye troylus tho wordes felte thought hym tho pitous diſtreſſe blody teares hert melt yet neuer ſuche heuyneſſe aſſayed ſo great gladneſſe gan therwithall creſeyde lady dere armes ſtrayne holde louely manere cruell daye accuſer ioye night loue haue ſtole faſt ywryen accurſed thy cōmyng troye euery bore hath one thy bryght eyen enuyous day lyſt ſo ſpyen haſt thou loſt ſekeſt thou place god thy light ſo quēche grace ala haue theſe louers agylt diſpytous day thyne payne hell many louer haſt thou ſlayne wylt thy poring wol nowhere let hem dwell profreſt thou thy lyght herefor ſel go ſell hem ſmal ſeales graue woll v nedeth daye haue eke ſunne tytan gan chyde ſayd foole well may mē deſpiſe haſt al night dawning thy ſide ſuffreſt ſo ſoone vp fro ryſe diſeaſe v louers wyſe hold bed ther thou thy morow byd god ſo yeue ſorowe therwith ful ſore ſyghed thus ſeyd lady ryght wele wo well roote goodly myne creſeyde ſhall ryſe ala ſhall ſo fele hert mote two ſhulde lyfe houre ſaue syns lyfe haue ſhall done certes ne whan ala ſhall tyme ſe plyte may ben eft wt lyfe god wote ſhall syns deſyre ryght nowe ſo byteth deed anon retourne ſhuld long ala fro ſoiourne natheleſſe myne owne lady bryght ſo wyſt vtterly humble ſeruaunt knight hert yſet ſo fermely ye myne truly leuer theſe worldes twayne yet ſhulde bet enduren payne creſeyde anſwered ryght anon ſygh ſhe ſayd hert dere game ywys ſo ferforth gone fyrſt ſhall phebus fallen fro ſpere eueryche egle ben doues fere euery rocke place ſterte er troylus go creſeydes hert ye ben ſo depe within hert graue tho wold turne thouȝt wyſely god ſoule ſaue dyen payne coulde nought ye loue god yt v hath wrought let brayne none fantaſy crepe cauſe dye ye wolde haue faſt mind haue wolde beſeche yf wyſt ſothly fynde god myght apoynt ioyes eche hert myne withouten ſpeche beth true el routh thyne god trouth beth glad thy lyue ſykerneſſe thus ſayd neuer er ne ſhall mo yf great gladneſſe turne ayen ſone ye go fayne wolde ye ſo wyſely god myne hert bryng reſt hym armes toke oft keſt ayenſt wyll ſyth muſt nedes troylus vp roſe faſt hym cledde armes toke lady free hundred tymes waye ſped ſuche wordes hert bledde ſayd farewell dere hert ſwete god v graūt ſounde ſone mete worde ſorow ſhe anſwerd ſore gan partyng diſtrayne troylus vnto palleys ferde wo begon ſhe ſoth ſayne hard wrōg ſharpe deſire ye payn ben efte pleaſaunce may neuer remēbraunce returned royal palleys ſone ſoft vnto bed gan ſlynke ſlepe longe wont done al nouȝt may wel lyg wynke ſlepe may ther non hert ſynke thinking ſhe whō deſire brēd folde worth wend thouȝt gan vp winde wordes al euery countenaunce fermely impreſſen mynde leſt poynt pleſaunce verely thylke remembraunce deſyre al newe brende luſt brede gan erſt yet toke non hede creſeyde alſo ryght ſame wyſe troylus gan hert ſhette worthyneſſe luſt dedes wyſe gentleneſſe ſhe met thonkyng loue ſo well beſet deſyryng oft haue hert dere ſuch place ſhe durſt make chere pandare morow cōmen vnto nece gan fayre grete ſayd nyght ſo rayned ala al drede ye nece ſwete haue lytle leyſer ſlepe mete al night ꝙ hath rainſo wake ſome v trowe heedes ake nere came ſayd ſtant mery morowe nece ye fare creſeyde anſwered neuer bet foxe ye ben god yeue hart care god helpe ſo ye cauſed fare trow ꝙ ſhe al wordes whyte ſo ſeeth knoweth ful lyte ſhe gan face wry ſhete woxe ſhame al reed pandarus gan vnder prye ſayd yf ſhall ben deed haue ſworde ſmyt heed arme ſodaynly thryſt vnder necke laſt kyſt paſſe al ye chargeth nought ſaye god foryaue deth ſhe alſo foryaue vncle gan play cauſe none ſo thyng ryght theffect go whā tyme home houſe ſhe went pandare hath fully entent turne ayen troylus reſtleſſe full longe bedde laye pryuily ſent pandarus hym come haſte may came anon one ſayd nay troylus full ſobrely gret downe vpon beddes ſyde hym ſet troylus thaffectioun frendly loue hert maye deuyſe pandarus knee fyll adowne er wolde place aryſe gan hym thanken beſt wyſe hundred tyme gan tyme bleſſe borne bring diſtreſſe ſayd frende frendes alderbeſt euer ſoth tell thou haſt heuē wrought ſoule reſt fro phlegeton fyrye floud hell though might thouſād tymes ſel vpon daye lyfe thy ſeruyſe myght mote ſuffyſe ſun worlde may ſe sawe neuer yet lyfe dare leye ioly fayre goodly ſhe whoſe ſhall tyll dye thus dare ſeye thanked hygh worthyneſſe loue eke thy kynde beſyneſſe thus haſt thou lytle thyng iyeue obleged aye lyfe thrugh thyn help liue el deed ben ago many day wt worde downe bed lay pandarus full ſoberly hym herde tyll ſayd hym anſwerd dere frende haue done caſe god wot lefe glad man maye god helpe ſo take nowe nat agrefe ſhall ſayn beware miſchefe ther brought art thy blyſſe thou thy ſelfe ne cauſe nat myſſe fortune ſharpe aduerſitie worſt kynde infortune man haue ben proſperitie remembre whan paſſed thou art wyſe ynouȝ thy nat amys nat rakel though thou ſyt warme yf thou certayne woll harme thou art eſe holde well therin alſo ſure red euery fyre great craft kepe well wynne brydle alway well thy ſpeche thy deſyre wordly ioye holdeth nat wyre preueth well breſt alday ſo oft thy nede werken ſoft quod troylus hope god toforne dere frende ſhall ſo bere gilt ſhal nothing ben lorn ne nyll nat rakle greuen nedeth nat mater oft tere wiſteſt thou myne hert wel pandare god wot thou woldeſt lyte care tho gan tell hym glad nyght wherof fyrſt hert drad ſayd frende true knyght fayth owe god neuer halfe ſo hote aye deſyre byteth loue beſt delyteth nat ſelfe nat wyſely fele newe qualitie yea dyd pandare anſwered ſayd thus one may heuen blyſſe feleth wayes dare laye thilke tyme firſt herde ſaye worde troylus neuer full ſpeke matere prayſen vnto pandarus bountie ryght lady dere pandarus thank maken chere tale aye ſpan newe begyn tyll nyght departed hem atwyn sone fortune wolde comen blyſfull tyme ſwete troylus warned yt ſholde ther erſt creſeyde lady mete felte hert ioye flete faythfully gan al goddes hery let ſe yf mery holden forme gyſe cōmyng alſo erſt nedeth nought deuiſe playnly theffect ryght go ioye ſuretie pandarus hem two abed brought whan hem leſt thus ben quyet reſt naught nedeth ſyth ben met aſke yf blythe erſt well tho bet thouſand folde nedeth enquere ago euery ſorowe euery fere ywys ſo wend moche ioye hert maye comprehende ny lytle thynge ſey paſſeth euery wyt deuyſe eche hem gan luſtes obey felicitie theſe clerkes wyſe cōmenden ſo ne may nat ſuffyſe ioye may wrytten ynke paſſeth hert may bethynke cruel day ſo welaway ſtounde gan aproch ſignes knewe hem thought felen dethes woūd wo hem yt chaungen gan hew day gonnen deſpyſe newe calling traytour enuyous worſe bytterly dayes lyght curſe quod troylus ala ware pyrous tho ſwyft ſtedes thre drawen forth ſonnes chare han gon ſome bypath deſpyte maketh ſo ſoone daye ſunne hym haſteth thus ryſe ne ſhall neuer hym ſacrifyce nedes day depart hem muſt ſone whan ſpeche chere twyn anon wer wont ſetten tyme metyng eft yfere many night wrouȝt manere thus fortune tyme lad ioye creſeyde eke kynges ſon troye ſuffyſaunce blyſſe ſyngynges troylus gan al lyfe lede ſpendeth iuſteth maketh feeſtynges yeueth frely oft chaungeth wede helde hym alway drede world folke com well kynde freſheſt beſt coulde fynde ſuche voyce ſteuen throughout yu worlde honour largeſſe vp ronge vnto yate heuen loue ſuche gladneſſe hert demed geſſe ni louer worlde eaſe wel thus gan loue pleſe goodlyhed beautie yt kynde lady yſette nat ye moūtenaunce gnat vnbynde hert creſeydes nette ſo narowe ymaſked yknette vndon maner ſyde nyll nat ben ought yt maye betyde honde full oft wolde take pandarus garden lede ſuche feaſte ſuch proceſſe make hym creſeyde womanheed beautie withouten drede heuen wordes wolde ſynge manere loue erth ſee hath gouernaūce loue heeſtes hath heuen hye loue holeſome alyaunce halt people ioyned hym lyſt hem gye loue knytteth lawe company couple doth vertue dwell bynde accorde yt haue tolde tell yt world wt faith yt ſtable dyuerſeth ſo ſtoundes accordyng elementes beth ſo diſcordable holden abonde perpetually duryng phebus mote roſy day forth brīg yt mone hath lordſhip ouer ye niȝtes al doth loueaye heried mightes yt ſee gredy flowen conſtrayneth certayne ende ſo floudes ſo ferſly ne growen drenchen erth euermo yf loue ought let brydle go loueth aſondre ſhulde lepe loſt wer al yt loue halt nowe hepe wolde god authour kynde bonde loue vertu lyſt ſerchen hertes al faſt bynde frō bōd wight ye wey wyſt hertes colde hem wold yt hem twyſt make hem loue hem lyſt aye rew hertes ſore kepe hem ben trewe nedes townes werre aye fyrſt armes dyght certaynly yf bokes erre haue hector mooſt ydradde wyght encreaſe hardyneſſe myght com hym loue ladyes thank wyn altered ſpyrite ſo within tyme truce hauking wolde ryde el hunt bore beare lyoun ſmall beeſtes let gon beſyde whan yt come rydyng ye towne full oft lady window downe freſh faucon comen mue full redy hym goodly ſalue mooſt loue vertue ſpeche deſpyte al wretchedneſſe doutleſſe nede hym beſeche honouren hem worthyneſſe eaſen hem diſtreſſe glad yf wight wel ferde louer whan wyſt herde ſoth ſayne loſte held euery wiȝt yf loues hygh ſeruyce meane folke ought ben ryght ouer ſo wel coulde deuyſe ſentement ſo vncouth wyſe aray euery louer thought well ſo ſayde wrought though come bloud royal hym lyſt pryde wyght chace benigne eche generall gat thāke euery place thus wolde loue yhered grace pryde yre enuy auaryce gan flye euery vyce thou lady bright doughter diane thy blynde winged ſon eke dan cupide ye ſuſtren nyne eke helic • ne hyl pernaſo lyſten fyr abyde ye thus ferre han deyned gyde nomore ſyns ye woll wende ye heryed ben aye withouten ende haue ſayd fully ſōge theffect ioye troylus ſeruyce ſome diſeaſe amonge myne auctour lyſteth deuyſe thyrde boke nowe ende wyſe troylus luſt quyete creſeyde owne hert ſwete ¶explicit liber tertius bvt lytle welaway whyle laſteth ſuche ioy ythonked fortune ſemeth treweſt whan ſhe woll begyle fooles ſo ſonge entune ſhe hem hent ye blēt traytour cōmune whā wight frō whele ythrow thā laugheth ſhe maketh hym mow troylus ſhe gan bryght face away wryth toke hym none hede caſt hym clene ladyes grace whele ſhe ſet vp diomede myn hert riȝt gyueth blede pen ala wt wryte quaketh drede muſte endyte creſeyde troylus forſoke leſte howe ſhe vnkynde mote hence forthe ben mater boke writē folke mynde ala ſhulde euer cauſe fynde ſpeke harme yf lye iwys hem ſelfe ſhulde haue vilanye ye herynes nyghtes doughters thre endleſſe complayne euer payne megera alle • eke teſiphonee thou cruell mar eke father quiryne ylke fourth boke helpe fyne loo loue lyfe yfere troylus fully ſhewed ¶incipit liber quartus ligging hoſt haue ſayd er grekes ſtrōg aboute troy toun byfell whan phebus ſhynyng vpon breſt hercules lyon hector many bolde baron caſte day grekes fyght wont greue hē might longe ſhorte bytwene purpoſe day fyghtē mente day wel armed bright ſhene hector many worthy knight wente ſpeare hond bygge bowes bente berde withouten lenger lette fomen felde anon hem mette longe day wt ſpeares ſharpe ygroūde arowes dartes ſwerdes mace fell fight bringen horſe man groūde ax braynes quell laſte ſhoure ſothe tell folke troye hem ſeluen ſo miſledden ye worſe night hom fleddē wyche day taken anthenor maugre polymydas moneſteo xantyppe sarpedon paleſtynor polyte eke troyan dan rupheo laſſe folke phebuſeo harme ye day folke troye dredden leſe great parte ioye priamus yeue grekes requeſte tyme truce tho gonnen trete priſoners chaungen moſte leſte ſurplus yeuen ſommes grete thyng anon couthe euery ſtrete thaſſege towne euery fyrſt came calkas eere whan calkas knew tretyſe ſhulde hold conſyſtorie amonge grekes ſone gan thring forthe lordes olde ſet hym wonte done chaunged face hem bade aboue loue god done reuerence ſtynten noyſe yeue audyence ſayd thus lo lordes myne troyan knowen drede yf remembre calkas alderfyrſt yaue comforte nede tolde wel howe ye ſhulde ſpede dredeleſſe ſhal ſtounde ben troy ybrent beaten groūde forme maner wyſe town ſhende al luſte tacheue ye haue er wel herde deuyſe knowe ye lordes leue grekes ſo leue came ſelfe propre perſone teche beſt done hauyng vnto treaſour ne rent right regarde reſpecte eaſe thus al good lefte went wenyng lordes pleaſe loſſe ne dothe diſeaſe vouchſafe wiſely haue ioye leſe haue troye saue doughter lefte ala slepyng home whan troy ſtert ſterne cruell father might haue ſo harde hert ala ne brought ſhert ſorow wol nat liue morow yf ye lordes rewe vpon ſorowe bycauſe ſawe tyme er nowe delyuer iche holden haue pee nowe neuer yf lyke may haue right ſoone doutlees helpe grace among al prees rewe olde caytyfe dyſtreſſe sith haue al heuyneſſe ye haue nowe caught fettred priſon troyans ynow yf wylles chylde one maye haue redemption nowe loue god bounte one ſo fele ala ſo yefe hym nede prayer werne sith ye ſhul haue folke town yern peryll lyfe ſhall nat lye apollo hath tolde full faytfully haue eke founde aſtronomy ſorte augury trewly dare wel ſaye tyme faſt fyre ſlambe ye town ſhal ſprede thus ſhall troy turne aſhen dede certayne phebus neptunus bothe makeden walles toun ben wt folke troye alway ſo wrothe wol bring confuſyoun right deſpyte kyng lamedoun cauſe nolde payen hem hyre towne troye ſhall ben ſet fyre tellyng tale alway olde grey humble ſpeche lokyng eke ſalte teeres eyen twey full faſte ronnen downe eyther cheke longe gan ſocoure hem beſeke heale hys ſorowes ſore gaue antenor withouten glad ynough calcas tho thyng full ſone nedes leyde hem ſhulden tretyſe go hem antenor ful ofte preyde bringen home kynge thoas creſeyde whan priam ſafegarde ſente thembaſſadours troy ſtreight wēt cauſe tolde cōmyng olde priam kyng full ſone generall let vpon parlyment holde whiche theffecte rehercen ſhall thembaſſadours ben anſwerde fynal eſchaunge priſoners al nede hem lyketh wel forthe procede troylus preſent place whan aſked antenor creſeyde whiche full ſone chaungen gan hys face yt tho wordes well nyghe deyde natheleſſe worde ſeyde leſte men ſhulde affection eſpye wyth mannes herte gan ſorowes drie full anguyſhe griſly drede abode lordes wolde ſey yf wolde graunt god forbede theſchaūge thā thouȝt thīges twey firſt ſaue honour wey might beſt theſchaunge withſtonde ful faſte caſte howe al might ſtonde loue made al preſt done byde rather dyen ſhe ſhulde go reaſon ſayde ſyde withouten aſſent nat ſo leſte thy werke ſhe wolde thy foe ſayn yt thorugh thy medling yblowe bother loue erſt vnknowe whyche gan delyberen beſt though lordes wolde ſhe went wolde lete hem graunt hem leſt tel lady fyrſt ment whan ſhe ſayd entent therafter wolde worken alſo blyue tho al worlde ayen wolde ſtryue hector whiche well grekes herde antenor wold haue creſeyde gan wythſtonde ſoberly anſwerde syrs ſhe ny priſoner ſeyde charge leyde parte ye may eftſones hem tel vſen woman ſel noyſe people vp ſterte atones brymme blaſe ſtrawe yſet fyre fortune wolde none ſhulden confuſyon deſyre hector ꝙ goſt may enſpyre woman thus ſhild done v leſe dan antenor wronge waye ye cheſe ſo wyſe eke ſo bolde baroun haue nede folke men may ſe one gretteſt thys towne hector lette thy fantaſies kyng priam ꝙ thus ſegge voice forgone creſeyde delyuer antenore preyde iuuenall lorde trewe thy ſentence lytell wenen folke yerne ne fynden deſyre offence cloude errour lete hem diſcerue beſt lo enſample yerne theſe folke deſyren nowe delyueraunce antenore brought hem miſchaūce traytour toun troye ala quytte rathe nyce worlde lo thy diſcrecion creſeyde whiche neuer dyd hem ſcathe shall nowe lenger blyſſe bathe antenor ſhal come home towne ſhe ſhall thus ſaid heere howne whiche delybered parlyment antenor yelden creſeyde pronounced preſydent though hector nay full ofte prayde fynally wight withſayde naught muſte ben ſholde ſubſtaunce parlyment wolde departed parlyment echone troylus wythout wordes mo vnto chambre ſpedde hym faſte alone yf man hys two bade fa • te go bycauſe wolde ſlepen ſayde haſtely vpon bedde layde wynter leaues ben byrafte eche tyll tree bare ny barke braūche ylafte lythe troylus byrafte eche welfare bounden blacke barke care diſpoſed woode wytte breyde ſore ſate chaungyng creſeyde ryſt vp euery doore ſhette wyndowe eke tho ſoroufull man vpon beddes ſyde downe ſette full lyke deed ymage pale wan breſte heaped wo began bueſte worken wyſe woodneſſe ſhall deuyſe right ye wylde bulle begynneth ſpring nowe nowe ydarted herte dethe roreth complaynyng right ſo gan aboute chambre ſterte smyting breſt aye fyſtes ſmert heed wal body grounde full ofte ſwapte ſeluen confounde eyen two pyte hys herte ſtremeden ſwyfte welles twey highe ſobbes ſorowes ſmerte ſpeche refte vnnethes myght ſey dethe ala nylte thou dey acurſed daye whiche nature shope ben lyues creature whan fury rage whiche hert twyſle faſt threſt length tyme ſomwhat gan aſwage vpon bedde layde downe reſt tho begon teares breſt wonder body maye ſuffyſe halfe wo deuyſe ſayd thus fortune ala ye whyle haue done haue agylte howe myghteſt thou routhe begyle grace ſhal thus ſpylt shal thus creſeyde awaye yt thou wylte ala mighteſt thou thyn herte fynde ben thus cruell vnkynde haue nat honoured lyue thou wel woreſt aboue goddes wylte thou fro ioye thus depriue troylus may men nowe call wretche wretch honour fall myſery wol bewayle creſeyde ala tyll brethe fayle ala fortune yf lyfe ioye diſpleaſed vnto thy foule enuye ne haddeſt thou father king troy berafte lyfe done brethern dye ſlayne ſelfe yt thus complayne crye combre worlde may nothyng ſerue euer dye neuer fully ſterue creſeyde alone lafte naught raught whyder thou woldeſt ſtere ala thā haſt thou byraft euermore lo thy manere reue wight moſte dere preue thy gierful vyolence thus loſte helpeth defence lorde loue god ala knoweſt beſt myn hert al thouȝt ſhal ſorouful lyfe done caas forgo ſo dere haue bought sen ye creſeyde haue fully brought grace hertes ſealed howe may ye ſuffre ala repealed may done ſhal whyle may dure lyue turment cruel payne infortune diſauenture alone borne woll complayne ne neuer wol ſene ſhyne rayne ende wol edippe derkneſſe ſorouful lyfe dyen diſtreſſe wery goſte erreſt fro nylt thou ſtyen wofulleſt body euer might grounde go ſoule lurkyng thys woful neſte flye forthout myn herte breſte folowe alway creſeyde thy lady dere thy right place nowe lenger wofull eyen two ſens diſporte al ſene creſeydes eyen bright ſhal ye done diſcomforte stondē naught wepen ſyght sen ſhe queynt yt wōt light veyne forth haue eyen twey formed ſens vertue awey creſeyde lady ſouerayne wofull ſoule thus cryeth ſhal nowe yeuen comforte thy payne ala wight whan myne herte dyeth ſpyrite whiche ſo vnto hyeth receyue gree ſhall aye ſerue thy force though body ſterue ye louers hygh vpon whele ben ſette fortune good auenture god lene ye fynden aye loue ſtele longe mote lyfe ioye endure whan ye comen ſepulture remembreth felowe reſteth loued eke though vnworthy olde vnholſome miſlyued man calkas meane ala eyled ben greke ſens thou art borne troyan calcas whiche wolte bane curſed tyme waſte thou borne wolde blyſful ioue ioye wolde troye thouſande ſyghes hotter glede breſt eche went medled playnte newe wo fede whiche woful teeres neuer ſlente ſhortly ſo hys ſorowes hym rente woxe ſo mate ioye penaunce feleth none lyeth traunce pandare whiche parlyment herde euery lorde burgeys ſeyde howe full graunted one aſſent antenor yelden creyſeyde gan wel nigh wode wyt breyde wo nyſte mente race troylus wente certayne knight tyme kepte chambre doore vndyd hym anon pandare full tenderly wepte derke chambre ſtyll ſtone towarde bedde gan ſoftely gone confuſe nyſte ſay wo wytte nyghe away chere lokyng al torne ſorowe armes folden ſtode woful troylus beforne hys pytous face gan beholden ſo ofte gan hys herte colden seyng frende wo whoſe heuyneſſe herte ſlough thought diſtreſſe woful wight troylus felte frende pandare ycomen ſe gan ſnowe ayenſt ſonne melte whiche woful pandare pyte gan wepe tenderly ſpecheleſſe thus ben theſe ylke twey neyther might ſorowe worde ſey laſte wofull troylus nygh deed ſmert gan breſten rore forouful noyſe ſayd thus amonges ſobbes ſyghes ſore lo pandare deed withouten haſte thou nat herde parlyment ſeyde antenor howe loſte creſeyde pandare ful deed pale hewe ful pitouſly anſwerde ſayd yes wyſely falſe trewe haue herde wote al howe mercy god wolde haue trowed thys wold haue wēde yt ſo lytell throwe fortune ioye wolde haue ouerthrowe worlde creature dome euer ſawe ruyne straūger thā caſe auēture may al eſchue al deuyne suche worlde thy thus defyne ne truſt wight fynde fortune aye propretie yeftes ben cōmune tel thou art ſo mad ſorowē thus lyeſt thou wyſe sen thy deſyre al holly haſte thou right ought ynough ſuffyſe neuer felte ſeruyce frendly chere lokyng eye let thus wepe waylen tyl dye ouer al thou wel woſt thy ſelue towne full ladyes al aboute dome fayrer ſuche twelue euer ſhe ſhall fyndē ſome route yea one twey withouten doute thy glad myn owne dere brother ſhe loſte ſhall recouer god forbyd alway yt eche pleſaunce thyng non wight one ſynge another well daunce goodly ſhe glad light fayre good aright eche vertue holden dere bothe heroner faucon ryuere eke writ zanſis ful wyſe newe loue chaſeth ofte olde vpon newe caſe lythe newe auyſe thynke eke thy ſelfe ſauen art thou holde suche fyre proceſſe ſhall kynde colde ſens caſuell pleſaunce caſe ſhall put remembraunce alſo ſure day cometh nyght newe loue labour wo el ſelde ſeynge wight done olde affection al ouer go thy parte thou ſhalte haue one tho abredge thy bytter paynes ſmerte abſence ſhal driue herte theſe wordes ſayd none helpe frende leſte ſorow deyde doutleſſe wo fall raught vnthrift ſeyde troylus nygh ſorowe deyde toke lytel hede al euer mente one eere herde went laſte anſwerde ſaid frende lechcrafte healed thus wel ſyttyng yf fende trayen wight trewe vnto pray god let counſayle neuer ythe rather ſterue anon right er thus done thou woldeſt lere ſerue ywis ſo thou ſeye myn herte enhabyt right shall haue holly tyll deye pandarus ſens haue trouth hight wol nat ben vntrewe wight man woll aye lyue ſterue neuer none creature ſerue ther thou ſayeſt yu ſhalt fayre fynde ſhe let make comparyſon creature yformed kynde leue pandare concluſyon wol nat ben thyne opinyon touchyng al thys whiche beſeche hold thy pece thou ſleeſt wt thy ſpech thou byddeſt ſhulde loue another freſhly newe let creſeyde go lythe nat power leue brother though might yet wol nat ſo canſte thou playen raket fro netle docke ye pādare nowe foule fall thy wo care thou fareſt eke pandarus whan wight wo bygon cometh pace ſaith right thus thynke nat ſmerte thou ſhalt fele none thou mayſte fyrſt tranſmewē ſtone reue paſſyons thou ſo lightly wo fall dethe may wel breſt departe lyfe ſo longe may ſorowe myne fro ſoule ſhall creſeydes darte neuermore proſerpyne whan deed wol wonne pyne woll eternally complayne wo twynned twayne thou haſt made argumēt forfyne howe ſhulde laſſe payne creſeyde forgon ſhe myne lyued • aſe felycite gabbeſt thou ſaydeſt vnto worſe fro wele ythrowe erſt none wele knowe tel ſens yt thinketh ſo light chaungen ſo loue aye fro haſte thou nat done beſily thy might chaungen dothe al thy wo nylte thou let fro thyne herte go nylte thou loue another lady ſwete may thyne herte ſetten quyete thou haſte loue aye yet miſchaūce canſte nat thyne herte dryue lyued luſt pleſaunce moche creature lyue howe ſhulde foryet ſo blyue haſt thou ben hyd ſo long mewe canſte ſo wel formelyche argewe nay godwote naught worth al thy rede whiche euer may befall withouten wordes mo wol ben deed dethe ender arte ſorowes come nowe ſens ſo ofte call ſely dethe ſothe ſayne ofte ycleped cometh endeth payne wel wote whyle lyfe quiete er thou ſlewe wolde haue yeuen hyre nowe thy commyng ſo ſwete worlde nothyng ſo deſyre dethe ſens thys ſorowe fyre thou eyther anon teeres drenche thy colde ſtroke myne herte quenche sen thou ſleeſt ſo fele ſondrie wyſe ayenſt wyl vnprayed day nyght requeſt thys ſeruyce delyuer nowe world ſo doſte thou right wofulleſt wight euer tyme ſterue sēs world right nauȝt ſerue troylus teeres gan diſtyll lycoure allambyke ful faſte pandarus gan holde tonge ſtyll grounde hys eyen downe caſte natheleſſe thus thought laſte parde rather felawe dey yet ſhal ſomwhat vnto ſey ſaid frende ſens thou haſt ſuch diſtreſſe ſens lyſt myne argumentes blame nylt thy ſeluen helpe redreſſe thy manhode letten thys game go rauiſh ne canſt thou nat ſhame eyther let towne fare holde ſtyll leaue thy nyce fare arte thou troye haſte non hardymēt take wight whiche loueth wolde ſeluen ben thyne aſſent nowe nat thys nyce vanyte ryſe vp anon let wepyng ſythe thou arte man hour woll ben deed ſhe ſhall ben anſwerde hym troylus ful ſofte ſayd iwys leue brother dere al haue ſelfe yet thought full ofte thyng thou deuyſeſt thing laft yu ſhalt wel whan thou haſte yeuen audyence therafter mayſt thou tell thy ſentence firſt ſyn yu woſt toun hath al werre rauyſhyng woman ſo might ſhulde nat ben ſuffred erre ſtonte nowe ne done ſo great vnright ſhulde haue alſo blame euery wight father graunt yf ſo withſtode sen ſhe chaunged townes gode haue eke thought ſo aſſent aſke father hys grace thynke thys accuſement sen well wote may purchace ſens father ſo hygh place parlyment hath eſchaunge enſealed nyll hys lettre repealed yet drede moſte herte perturbe wyth violence yf ſuche game yf wolde openly dyſturbe muſte dyſclaundre name leuer dye defame nolde god ſhulde haue honour leuer lyfe ſaue thus loſte aught ſe certayne knyght muſte honour leuer haue euery caſe louer ought ryght thus deſyre reaſon twyght deſyre dyſtourben redeth reaſon nyll ſo myne herte dredeth thus wepynge could neuer ceaſe ſayd ala ſhall wretch fare well fele alwaye loue encreaſe hope laſſe laſſe pandare encreaſen eke cauſes care welawaye nyll myne herte breſte loue lytell reſte pandare anſwerd frende thou mayſt done lyſt ſo hote thyne eſtate ſhe ſhulde go wyth tho al towne cryed thys thynge note nolde ſet al noyſe grote whē mē haue cryed thē woll ronne eke wōder laſt ix dayes neuer tonne deuyne reaſon aye ſo depe ne curteſly helpe thy ſelfe anone bet thy ſeluen wepe namely ſens ye two ben one ryſe vp myne heed ſhe ſhall gone rather blame lytell yfounde thē ſterue gnat withoutē woūde ſhame vnto ne vyce wyth holden ye loueth moſte parauenture ſhe myght holde nyce letten go thus vnto grekes hoſte thinke eke fortune wel thy ſeluen woſte helpeth hardy man vnto hys empryſe weyueth wretch cowardyſe though thy lady wolde alyte greue thou ſhalt thy ſelfe thy peace herafter make certayne leue ſhe wolde nowe yuell take ſhulde feare thyne herte quake thynke howe paris hath yt thy brother loue ſhalt thou haue another troylus thynge dare ſwere yf creſeyde whych thy lefe nowe loueth well thou doſte god helpe ſo ſhe nyll take grefe though yu boote anone myſchefe yf ſhe wylneth fro paſſe ſhe falſe ſo loue well laſſe thy take hert thynke ryght knight loue broken aldaye euery lawe kyth ſomwhat thy corage thy myght haue mercy thy ſelfe awe let wretched wo thyne hert gnawe manly ſet worlde ſyxe ſeuen yf thou dye marter go heuen wol ſelfe ben wyth thys dede though kyn vpon ſtounde shulde ſtrete dogges lyggen deede gyrte wyth many bloody woūde euery caſe woll frende founde yf lyſteth ſteruen wretche adieu deuell ſpede hym retche thys troylus gan wt tho wordes quicken ſayd frende graunt mercy aſſent certaynly thou mayſt ſo prycken ne payne none ne may ſo turment caſe myne entent ſhort wordes though dyen ſholde rauyſhen yf ſelfe wolde ſo meane ꝙ pādarus al day tel haſt thou well aſſayde ſoroweſt thus anſwerde nay wherof arte thou ꝙ pādare thē dyſmayde noſt ſhe woll ben euel apayde rauyſhē ſens thou haſt ben yf ioue tolde thyne eere thy ryſe vp nought ne anone waſhe thy face ye kynge thou wēde may wondren whyther thou art gone thou muſt wt wyſedome hym blede vpon caſe may ſende thou beware ſhortly brother dere glad let werke thys matere ſhall ſhape ſo ſekerly thou ſhalt night ſōtime ſome maner come ſpeken wyth thy lady priuely wordes eke chere thou ſhalt full ſone aperceyue wel entent thys caſe beſte fare nowe wel poynt reſte ſwyfte fame whych yt falſe thinges equall reporteth lyke thynges trewe throughout troy iſled wt preſtwinges fro man man made hys tale al newe calcas doughter bright hew parlyment wythout wordes graunted chaunge antenore whych tale anone ryght creſeyde herde ſhe whych yt father rought thys caſe right nauȝt ne whē deyd ful buſely iupiter beſought yeue hem myſchaūce yt thys tretys brought ſhortly leſte theſe tale ſoth durſte wyght aſken fere ſhe herte al mynde troylus yſet ſo wonder faſte al world ne miȝt loue vnbynd ne troylus herte caſte wold bē hys whyle yt lyfe may laſt ſhe thus brenneth loue drede ſhe nyſt beſt rede men ſene towne aboute woman vſen frendes viſyte creſeyde woman came route pitous ioye wenden delyte wyth tale dere ynough myte theſe woman whych cyte dwell ſet hem downe ſayd ſhall tell quod fyrſt one glad trewly bycauſe ſhall father ſe another ſayd ywys ſo lytle hath ſhe wyth v quod tho thyrd hope ywys ſhe shall bryngen v peace euery ſyde whē ſhe goeth almyghty god gyde tho wordes tho womannyſhe thynges herd hē ryght though ſhe thēce god wote hert thynge although body ſat amonge hem aduertence alwaye el troylus full faſte ſoule ſought wythoutē worde hym alway ſhe thought theſe woman thus wendē pleſe naught gonne tale ſpende suche vanite ne done none eſe ſhe thys meane whyle brende paſſyon wende ſhe felte almoſte herte dye fo wo wery companye whych myght ſhe lenger reſtrayne teryes gan ſo vp well gaue ſygnes bytter payne whych ſpirite muſt dwell remēbrynge frō heuen vnto whych hell fallen ſens ſhe forgo ſyght troylus ſorowfully ſhe ſyght thylke fooles ſyttynge aboute wende ſhe wepte ſyghed ſore bycauſe ſhe ſhulde route departen neuer playe wyth hem knowen yore se ſo wepe thought kyndneſſe eche hem wepte eke dyſtreſſe beſely gonnen comforten one thīg god wot ſhe lytel thouȝt wyth tale wenden dyſporten glad oft beſought ſuch eaſe therwith wrought ryght man eaſed fele ache heed clawen hym hys hele thys nyce vanyte toke leue home wentē creſeyde full ſorowfull pyte chambre vp wente hall bedde ſhe gan deed fall purpoſe neuer thence ryſe thus ſhe wrought ſhal deuyſe ownded heer yt ſonnyſhe hewe rent eke fyngers longe ſmale wronge ful ofte bad god rewe wyth death bote bale hewe whylom bright tho pale bare wytneſſe wo conſtraynte thus ſhe ſpake ſobbyng cōplaynt ¶alas quod ſhe thys regioun wofull wretch infortuned wyght borne curſed conſtellatioun mote gone thus departen fro knyght wo worth ala ylke dayes lyght ſawe fyrſt wt eyen twayne cauſeth hym thys payne therwyth teeres eyen two downe fell ſhoure apryll ſwythe whyte breſt ſhe bette wo death ſhe cryed thouſande ſyth sen wonte wo lyth mote forgone whych dyſauenture helde ſelfe forloft creature ſayd howe ſhall done alſo howe ſhuld lyue yf yt twynne dere herte eke loue ſo ſhall ye ſorowe ſlene ye ben inne calkas father thyne thys ſynne mother myne cleaped argyue wo worth yt daye thou bare lyue fyne ſhuld lyue ſorowen thus howe ſhuld fyſhe wythouten water dure creſeyde worth troylus howe ſhulde plante lyues creature lyue wythouten hys kynde noriture whych full ofte worde ſey roteleſſe mote grene ſone dey ſhal thus ſens neither ſword ne darte dare none handle cruelte ylke daye fro departe yf ſorowe nyl bane ſhall meate ne drynke come tyll ſoule breſt vnſhethe thus ſeluen woll done dethe troylus clothes euerychone shul blacke ben tokenynge herte ſwete thys worlde agone wonte ſet quyete myne ordre aye tyll death mete obſeruaunce euer abſence shal ſorowe ben complaynt abſtynence myne herte eke wofull goſt therin byqueth wyth ſpirite complayne eternally ſhall neuer twyn though erth twynned twayne yet felde pyte payne hyght elyſos ſhall ben yfere orpheus erudice hys fere thus herte myne antenor ala ſone ſhalbe chaunged wene howe ſhull ye done thys ſorowful ca howe ſhall tendre herte thys ſuſtene herte myne foryet thys ſorowe tene alſo ſothly ſey ye welfare retche dey howe myght euer redde ben yſonge playnt ſhe made dyſtreſſe lytell tonge yf dyſcryuen wolde heuyneſſe ſhulde make ſorowe ſeme leſſe chyldyſhly deface hye complaynt therfore pace pandare whych ſent troylus vnto creſeyde ye haue herde deuyſe beſt acorded thus full glad done hym ſeruyſe vnto creſeyde full ſecrete wyſe ſhe lay turment rage came tell al holy hys maſſage fonde ſhe ſeluen gan trete full petouſly wyth ſalte teeres breſt face ybathed full wete myghty treſſes ſonnyſh heeres vnbroyden hangen aboute eeres whych yaue hym ſygne matere death whych herte gan deſyre ſhe hym ſawe ſhe gan ſorowe anon tery face atwyxte armes hyde whych thys pandare ſo wo bygon houſe myght vnneth abyde felte ſorowe euery ſyde yf creſeyde erſt complayned ſore tho gan ſhe playne thouſand tymes aſpre playnte thus ſhe ſeyde pandare fyrſt ioyes mo two cauſynge vnto creſeyde nowe tranſmued ben cruell wo whether ſhall ſaye welcome alderfyrſt brought vnto ſeruyſe loue ala endeth ſuche wyſe endeth loue wo ye men lyeth worldly blyſſe thynketh ende blyſſe aye ſorowe occupyeth troweth ſo let hym vpon wofull wretch ſe ſelfe hate aye byrth curſe felynge alwaye fro wycke go worſe ſome ſeeth ſeeth ſorowe al atonis payne turment playnte wo dyſtreſſe wofull body harme none langour anguyſhe cruell bytterneſſe annoye ſmerte drede furye eke ſyckneſſe trowe ywys heuen teeres rayne pyte aſpre cruell payne thou ſyſter full dyſcomforte quod pādarus thinkeſt thou ne haſt thou thy ſeluen ſome reſport wylt thou thus ala thy ſelfe fordo leaue al thys werke take nowe hede ſhall ſayne herken good entent meſſage yt troylus ſente turned tho creſeyde wo makynge great death ſe ala ꝙ ſhe wordes maye ye brynge woll dere herte ſayne whych drede neuer ſe woll haue playnte teeres er wende haue ynough yf therafter ſende ryght ſuch ſene viſage wyght men bere bynde face lyke paradys ymage ychaunged another kynde play ye laughter mē wont fynd eke ioyes euerychone ben fledde thus lyeth creſeyde alone aboute eyen two purpre rynge bytrent ſothfaſt tokenynge payne beholde deedly thynge whych pandare myght reſtrayne teeres hys eyen rayne natheleſſe beſt myght ſeyde troylus theſe wordes creſeyde lo nece trowe ye han herde al howe kynge wyth lordes beſte hath made eſchaunge antenor cauſe thys ſorowe thys vnreſt howe thys caſe doth troylus moleſte thys may none earthly mannes tonge ſay wo hys wytte away whych haue ſo ſorowed lytell v ſlawe counſayle thys daye fynaly ſomwhat fro wepynge wythdrawe ſemeth deſyreth fawe wyth ben nyght deuyſe remedye thys yf wyſe ſhorte playne theffect meſſage ferforth wytte comprehende ye ben turment ſuche rage may longe prologe nowe entende hervpon ye maye anſwere hym ſende loue god nece dere leaue thys wo troylus great wo ꝙ ſhe ſyghed ſore ſhe feleth deedly ſharpe dyſtreſſe yet hys ſorowe mokell loue hym bet hym ſelfe geſſe ala hath ſuch heuyneſſe ſo pytouſly complayne iwys thys ſorowe doubleth al payne greuous god wot twynne quod ſhe yet harder ſene ſorowe whych inne well wote wol bane dye wol certayne tho quod ſhe byd hī come er deth yt thus threteth driue yt goſt whych myne hert beteth theſe wordes ſayd ſhe armes two fyll gruffe gan wepen pytouſly quod pandarus ala ye ſo sen ye well wote tyme faſt ſhall come aryſe vp haſtely bewopen thus ne fynde ye wol haue wode minde wyſt ye farde thys manere wolde hym ſelfe flee yf wende haue thys fare ſhulde come good priam maye dyſpende fyne wolde anone pretende knowe well thy yet ſey leaue ſorowe plainly wol dey ſhapeth hys ſorowe abredge encreaſe lefe nece ſwete beth rather hym cauſe plat edge wt ſome wyſedom ye hys ſorowes bete helpeth wepen full ſtrete though ye ſalte teeres dreynte bet tyme cure aye pleynte meane thus whē hym hether brynge sen ye wyſe one aſſent ſhapeth howe diſtourbe goynge come ayen ſone ye went woman ben wyſe ſhort auyſement let ſene howe wyt ſhall auayle may helpe ſhal fayle go quod creſeyde vncle truely ſhall done myght reſtrayne wepynge hys ſyght beſely hym glad ſhall done payne herte ſeken euery vayne yf thys ſore maye ben founden ſalue ſhall lacke certayne myne halue goth pandarus troylus ſought tyll temple founde hym al alone hys lyfe lenger rought pytouſe goddes euerychone full tendrely prayed made hys mone done hym ſone thys world pace wel thought ther non grace ſhortly ſoth ſeye ſo fallen dyſpayre day vtterly ſhope deye ryght thus hys argument alway ſayd na lorne welaway cometh cometh neceſſite thus lorne deſtyne certaynly thys wote well ſayd forſyght diuyne purueyaunce ſene alwaye forgone creſeyde sen god ſeeth euery thing doutaūce hem dyſpoſeth hys ordynaūce hys merytes ſothly ſhull comen predeſtyne natheleſſe ala ſhall leue ben great clerkes many one deſtynie argumentes preue ſome ſayne nedely none free choyce yeuen v euerychone welawaye ſo ſlygh arne clerkes olde whoſe opinion maye holde ſome men ſayne ye god ſeeth al byforne ne god maye dyſceyued ben parde thā mote fallen though mē ſworne purueiaunce hath ſene beforne wherfore ſaye eterne yf hath wyſt beforn thouȝt eke dede haue fre choyce theſe clerkes rede thought dede alſo myght neuer ben ſuche purueyaunce whych maye ben dyſceyued neuer mo hath feled byforne wythouten ignoraunce yf myght ben variaunce wrythen fro goddes purueynge nere preſcience thynge cōmynge rather opinion vncertayne ſtedfaſt foreſeyng certes abuſyon god ſhuld haue parfite clere weting men yt haue doutous wening ſuch errour vpon god geſſe falſe foule wycked curſedneſſe eke thys opinion ſome haue top ful hygh ſmoth yſhore ſayn right thus yt thing come preſcience hath ſene ſhall come ſayne yt therfore ſhall come therfore purueyaunce wote beforne wythouten ignoraunce thys maner thys neceſſyte returneth hys parte contrary agayne nedefully behoueth thylke thynges fallen certayne bē purueyed nedfully ſayn behoueth thynges whych fall certayne ben puruayed meane though laboured enquyre thīge cauſe thīg whether preſciēce god certayne cauſe neceſſite thynges comen pardy neceſſite thynge comynge becauſe certayne purueyeng ne enforce ſhewyng ye ordre ye cauſes ſtāt wel wote behoueth befallyng thynges wyſt certaynly neceſſary ſeme therby preſcience put fallynge neceſſayre thynge come fall foule fayre yf ſyt man yonde ſee neceſſite behoueth certes thyne opinion ſoth weneſt coniecteſt ſyt ouer nowe ayenwarde yet lo ryght ſo parte contrarye thus nowe herken woll tarye ſaye yf opinion ſoth ſyt ſaye thys mote ſytten neceſſyte thus neceſſyte eyther hym nede ſyttynge ywys nede ſoth thus forſoth mote neceſſite ben thou mayſt ſayne ye mā ſyt therfore thyne opinion hys ſyttynge ſoth rather man ſat therfore thyne opinion ſoth ywys ſaye though cauſe ſoth thys cometh hys ſyttynge yet neceſſite entrechaunged hem thus ſame wyſe dontaunce maye well maken ſemeth reaſonynge goddes purueyaunce thynges comen whych reaſon men may well yſe thylke thynges erth fall neceſſite comen al though forthing ſhal come ywys therfore purueyd certaynly cometh purueyed yet natheleſſe behoueth nedefully thynge come purueyed truely el thinges purueyed betyden neceſſyte ſuffyſeth ryght ynough certayne deſtroye free choyce euerydel nowe thys abuſyon ſayne fallynge thynges temporel cauſe goddes preſcience eternell nowe truely falſe ſentence thing come ſhuld cauſe preſciēce might wene ſuch thought god purueyeth thynge yt come come el nought might wene thinges al ſome whylom ben byfal ouercome ben cauſe thylke ſouerayne purueyaunce forewote wythouten ignoraunce oueral thys yet ſay therto right whē wote thinge iwys thynge mote nedefully ſo eke ryght ſo wote thing comyng mote come thus befallynge thynges ben wyſt tyde mowe ben eſchewed ſyde thē ſayd thus almyghty ioue trone woteſt al thys thyng ye ſothfaſtneſſe rewe ſorowe dyen ſone brynge creſeyde fro thys dyſtreſſe whyle thys heuyneſſe dyſputynge wyth hym ſelfe thys matere came pandare ſayd ye may myghty god ꝙ pandarus trone eygh ſawe euer wyſe man faren ſo troylus thynkeſt thou done haſt thou ſuche luſte ben thyne owne foe parde yet creſeyde ago lyſt ſo thy ſelfe fordone drede thyne heed thyne eyen ſemen dede haſt thou lyued many yere beforne wythouten farde full well ateaſe arte thou none borne hath kynde ye wrought pleaſe let thynke ryght thus thy dyſeaſe ye dyce right fallē chaūces ryght ſo loue come go pleſaūces yet wonder mooſt thou thus ſoroweſt ſith thou wuſt nat yet touching going yt ſhal fall ne yf ſhe ſelfe diſtourben thou haſt nat yet aſſayed wyt man maye al betyme necke bede whan ſhall ſorowen nede thy take hede ſhal ſay haue yſpoke longe ybe accorded betwyxt v twey euermo thynketh thus ſhe hath ſomwhat hertes priuitie wherwith ſhe yf ſhall aryght rede diſturbe al thou art drede counſayl whan night thou go make ende blyſful iuno gret myght shal hope grace vnto v ſende myne hert ſeeth certayne ſhe ſhal nat wend thy put thy hert whyle reſt holde thy purpoſe beſt troylus anſwerde ſyghed ſore thou ſayeſt ryght wel wil ryght ſo liſt ſayd vnto whan tyme go full priuely hym ſelfe withouten mo vnto came wont done wrought ſhal tell ſone soth whan gone firſt mete gan payne hertes twyſt neyther hem myght grete hem armes toke kyſt laſſe wofull hem nyſt wher yt ne might word bring ſayd erſt wo ſobbyng wofull teares letten fal bytter teres kynde payne lignealoes gall bytter teeres wept nat fynde woful myrra ye bark rynd world ther ni ſo hard hert nold haue rewed paine ſmert whan woful wery goſtes twayne returned ben hem ought dwell ſomwhat weaken gan ye payne length playnt ebben gan wel teares hert vnſwell wt brokē voyce al horſe ſhright creſeyde troylus theſe ylke wordes ſayde ioue dye mercy beſeche helpe troylus therwith face vpon breſt ſhe layde loſt ſpeche woful ſpyrit propre place ryght wt worde away poynt pace thus ſhe lyth wt hewes pale grene whylom freſh fayreſt ſene troylus gan beholde cleping name ſhe lay deed wtouten anſwer felt lymmes colde eyen throwen vpwarde heed ſorouful mā nowe non rede oft tyme colde mouth kyſt wher wo god ſelfe wyſt riſeth vp long ſtreight layd ſigne lyfe ought may none fynde nothing creſeyde ſonge ful oft welaway whan ſawe ſpecheleſſe ſhe laye wt ſoroufull voyce herte blyſſe bare ſayd ſhe fro world yfare longe cōplayned hōdes wronge ſayd ſeye wt teeres ſalte breſt berayned gan tho teeres wypen full dreye pytouſly gan ſoule preye ſayd lorde ſet art thy trone rewe eke ſhal folowe ſone colde without ſentement ought wot breth felt ne none thus preignant argument ſhe forth world agon whā ſawe ther non gan lymmes dreſſe ſuche manere men hem yt ſhall ben layen bere ſterne cruel herte ſwerde anon ſheth twight ſelf ſleen howe ſore ſmerte ſoule ſoule folowē myght ther dome mynos wold dight syth loue cruell fortune ne wolde worlde lenger lyuen ſhold ſayd thus fulfyld high diſdayn cruel ioue thou fortune aduerſe al ſome falſely haue ye ſlayne creſeyde ſyth ye may werſe fye myght workes ſo dyuerſe thus cowardly ye ſhal neuer wyn ſhall deth fro lady twyn world ſith ye haue ſlayn thus wol let folowe ſpyrite lowe hye shall neuer louer ſayne troylus dare nat feare lady dye certayne woll beare company ſyth ye wol nat ſuffre v lyuen yet ſuffreth ſoules ben yfere thou cytie lyue wo thou priam brother al yfere thou mother farewel go attropoſe make redy thou bere thou creſeyde ſwete hert dere receyue ſpyrite wolde ſey ſwerde herte redy deye god wolde ſwough ſhe abrayde gan ſygh troylus ſhe cryde anſwerd lady myne creſeyde lyue ye yet let ſwerde downe glyde yea hert myne thanked cupyde quod ſhe therwithal ſhe ſore ſyght began glad myght toke armes two kyſt ofte glad dyd entent gooſt yt flyckered aye loft woful hert ayen went laſt eye glent aſyde anon ſhe gan ſworde aſpye laye bare gan feare crye aſked hym drawe troylus anon cauſe tolde hī ſelf therwt wold haue ſlawe creſeyd vpon hym gan beholde gan hym armes faſt folde ſayde mercy god lo dede ala nygh deed yf nad ſpoken grace ye wolde haue ſlayne ſelf anon ꝙ ſhe yea doutleſſe ſhe anſwerde ala ylke lorde made nolde forlonge way lyue haue deth haue ben trowned quene al ye londe ſunne ſhyneth ſhene ſelue ſwerd yt ſelfe wolde haue ſlayne ꝙ ſhe tho ho haue ryght ynough let v ryſe ſtreyght bed go let v ſpeken wo marter ſe brene knowe ful well day nat ferre hen whan bed armes folde nought lyke tho niȝtes beforn pytouſly eche gan beholde hadden blyſſe ylorne bewaylyng aye ye day wer borne til ye laſt ſorowful wyght creſeyd troylus theſe ylke wordes ſeyde lo hert myne wel wot ye quod ſhe yf wight alway wo complayne ſeketh nat holpen ny folye encreaſe payne ſyns yt aſſembled twayne fynde bote wo ben tyme ſoone begyn woman full well ye wot aduyſed ſodaynly woll tell whyle whote thynketh thus neyther ye ought halfe wo maken ſkylfully arte ynough redreſſe yet myſſe ſleen heuyneſſe soth wo ben ought wot nothyng el cauſe ſhulde twyn conſydred al ny nomore amys remedy vnto ſhape v ſoone mete ſome dere hert ſwete ſhal well bryngen come ayen ſone go therof maner thyng dout dredeleſſe within weke two ſhal ben mayebe ſo ryght wordes fewe ſhall well heape wayes ſhewe wol make longe ſermon tyme yloſt may recouered wol go concluſyon beſt ought ſe loue god foryeue yf ſpeke ought ayenſt hertes reſt truly ſpeke beſt makyng alway proteſtacion theſe wordes ſhal ſaye ny ſhewen mocion fynde vnto helpe beſt waye taketh none otherwyſe pray effect ſo ye cōmaunde wol demaunde herkeneth ye haue wel vnderſtōd going graunted parlyment ferforth yt may ben withſtonde worlde iudgement ſyth ther helpeth non aduyſement letten let paſſe mynde let v ſhape better way fynde ſoth twynnyng v twayne wol v diſeaſe cruelly anoye behoueth ſomtyme haue payne ſerueth loue yf wol haue ioye ſyth ſhal ferther troye thā may ryde ayen halfe morowe ought laſſe cauſen v ſorowe ſhal ſo ben hyd mewe day day myne owne hert dere syns well wot nowe trewe ye ſhall ful well myne eſtate er truce ſhal ben haue ye antenor ywon alſo beth glad yf ye con think right thus creſeyd agon ſhe ſhal come haſtely ayen whan ala god ſo right anon er dayes ten dare ſafely ſayne erſt ſhall ſo fayne ſhall togythers euer dwell world ne might blyſſe tel ſe oft tyme ben nowe beſt counſayl hyde ye ſpeake fourtenyght ne ſe ye go ne ryde may ye nat ten dayes abyde myne honour ſuche auenture iwys ye mowe el lyte endure ye knowe eke howe al kyn father eke myne thynges al yfere namely dere herte ye nolde leauen ſe al world wide hath ſpace el ſe neuer ioues face trowe ye father wyſe coueyteth ſo ſe drede leſt towne folkes diſpyſe bycauſe vnhappy dede wote father lyfe lede wyſte troye howe wel fare v neded wendyng nat care yea euery day eke men treate peace ſuppoſed men quene heleyne ſhal reſtore grekes v reſtore mys though nere cōfort none men purpoſen peace euery ſyde ye may better eaſe hert abyde yf peace myne hert dere nature peace mote nedes dryue men muſt entercōmune yfere fro eke ryde gone blyue al day thycke ſlyen frō hyue euery wyght haue lybertie bleue lyſt bet withouten leue though ſo ye peace ther may none yet hither though ther neuer peace ne muſt come whyder ſhulde gone miſchaunce ſhulde dwel amonge tho men armes euer feare wyſely god ſoule rede nat ſene wherof ye ſhulde drede haue another way yf ſo al thing ne may nat ſuffyſe father ye knowen well parde olde eke ful couetyſe right haue founden gyſe withouten net wherwith ſhal hym hente herkeneth yf ye wyl aſſent lo troylus men ſayne ful harde wolfe ful weder hole haue ſayne men ful oft iwys mote ſpenden part ye remnaunt ſaue aye gold men may hert graue hym ſet vpon couetyſe meane ſhal deuyſe mouable yt haue toun vnto father ſhall take ſay ryght truſt ſaluatioun ſent frende tway frendes feruently praye ſende hye whyle yt town ſtant thus ieopardy ſhalbe golde huge quantitie thus ſhal ſayne leſt folke eſpyde may ſent wyght ſhal eke ſhewen hym yf peace betyde frendes haue euery ſyde towarde court wrath pace priamus hym ſtonde grace thyng ſwete ſhall enchaunten ſawes right heuē ſoul ſhal mete apollo clerkes lawes calculyng auayleth nat thre hawes deſyre golde ſhall ſo ſoule blende lyſt ſhall well make ende yf wolde ought ſorte preue lye certayne ſhal fonde diſtourben plucke ſleue makyng ſorte bearen hym honde hath nat well goddes vnderſtonde goddes ſpeke amphibology ſoth tellen twenty lye eke drede fonde firſt goddes ſuppoſe thus ſhall ſayne coward hert made hym amyſſe goddes text gloſe whan ferde delphos ſtert make hym ſone conuert rede within day twey woll oblege deye truly wrytten well fynde al thing ſayd good entēt hert true kynde towardes ſpake ryght ſhe ment yt ſhe ſtarfefor wo nigh whan ſhe went purpoſe euer trewe thus wryten yt werkes knewe troylus hert eares ſprad herde thyng deuyſed two fro verily ſemed ſelue wyt yet let go hert myſyaue hym euermo fynally gan hert wreſt truſten toke beſt great fury penaunce queynt wt hope therwt hem bytwene began ioye amorous daunce ye byrdes whan ſun ſhene delyten ſonge leues grene ryght ſo wordes ſpake yfere delyten hem make hem hertes clere nathelſſe wendyng creſeyde al world may mynd ful oft pytouſly preyde heeſt might true fynde ſayd certes yf ye kynde ye come day ſet troye ne ſhal neuer haue heale honour ne ioye ſo ſoth ſunne vpryſt morowe god ſo wyſely thou woful wretche reſt bryng cruell ſorowe woll ſeluen ſlee yf ye dretche deth though lytle retche yet er ye cauſen ſo ſmert dwell rather myne owne ſwete herte truly myne owne lady dere ſleyghtes yet yt haue herde ſtere full ſhapely ben fallen yfere thus men ſayth yt one thynketh ye bere al another thynketh ledere ſire wyſe ſayd drede men may wyſe ren rede full harde halten vneſpyed creple crafte father ſleyght argus eyed al mouable byraft olde ſleyght yet ſo hym lafte ye ſhall nat blende hym womāhed ne ſayne aryght al drede yf peace ſhall euermo betyde peace erneſt ne game wot ſyth calcas grekes ſyde hath one ben loſt ſo foule name dar nomore come agayne ſhame ought eſpy truſten ny fantaſye ye ſhal eke ſene father ſhal gloſe ben wyfe wel preche ſhal ſome greke ſo preyſe wel aloſe rauyſhen ſhal ſpeche force ſhall teache troylus ye nyll haue routh shall cauſeleſſe ſo ſteruen trouth ouer father ſhal deſpyſe v al ſayn citie lorne thaſſege neuer ſhal aryſe grekes haue ſworne tyl bē ſlayne walles torne thus ſhal wordes fere aye drede ye wol bleuen ye ſhall eke ſene ſo many luſtye knyght amonge grekes full worthyneſſe eche hem hert wyt myght pleſen beſyneſſe ye ſhull dullen rudyneſſe ſely troyans yf routh remorde vertue trouth ſo greuous thynke fro breſt woll ſoule rende ne dredleſſe may ſynke good opinyon yf ye wende father ſleyght woll v ſhēd yf ye gone haue tolde yore think nam deed withouten humble true pitous hert thouſande tymes mercy praye reweth myne aſpre paynes ſmert doth ſomwhat ſhall ſay let v ſteale away betwyxt v tway thinke yt foly whā man maye cheſe accident ſubſtaunce leſe meane thus ſyns nowe day well ſteale awaye ben togyther ſo wyt putten aſſaye caſe ye ſhulden father go ye myghten come ayen thus meane great folly put ſykerneſſe ieopardy vulgarly ſpeken ſubſtaunce treaſour may v lede ynough lyue honour pleaſaunce tyl vnto tyme ſhal ben deed thus may eſchewen al drede euery waye ye recorde myne hert ywys may therwith nat accorde hardely ne dredeth pouertie haue kyn frendes el though comen bare ſherte v ſhulde neyther lacke golde ne gere ben honoured whyle dwelten go anon myne intent beſt yf ye woll aſſent creſeyde ſygh ryght wyſe anſwerde ywys dere herte true maye wel ſteale away ye deuyſe fynden ſuche vnthryftye wayes newe afterwarde full ſore woll v rewe helpe god ſo mooſt nede cauſeleſſe ye ſuffren drede thylke day cheryſſhyng drede father wyght eſtate delyte weddyng falſe troylus knyght saturnus doughter iuno migh wode achamāt dwel eternally ſtyx pyt hell ad euery god celeſtiall ſweare eke eche goddeſſe euery nymphe deitie infernall satiry fauny leſſe halfe goddes ben wylderneſſe attrapos threde lyfe breſt falſe trowe yf ye leſt thou synoys arowe clere thrugh troy rēneſt aye dounward ye ſe wytneſſe worde yt ſayd ylke daye vntrue troylus myne owne hert free thou returne bakwarde thy well body ſoule ſynke hell ye ſpeke away thus go leten al frendes god forbede woman ye ſhulden ſo namly ſyns troy hath ſuch nede helpe eke thyng taketh hede yf wiſt lyfe laye balaunce honour god ſhylde v myſchaunce yf ſo peace herafter betake daye heppeth angre game lorde ye ſorowe wo ye wolden make ye ne durſt come ayen ſhame er ye ieoparden ſo name beth nat haſty hote fare haſty man ne wanteth neuer care trowe ye people eke al wolde ſay ful lyght arede wolden ſay ſwere dout loue ne draue nat dede luſt voluptuous cowarde drede thus loſt iwys myne hert dere honour yt ſhyneth clere alſo thynketh myne honeſtie floureth yet foul ſhuld ſhēd fylth ſpotted ſhulde forme ſhoulde wende ne though lyued vnto worldes ende name ſhulde neuer ayenwarde wyn thus wer loſt yt routh ſynne thy ſlee reaſon al hete men ſayne ſuffraunt ouercōmeth parde eke ſo wol haue lefe lefe mote lete thus maketh vertue neceſſitie pacience thynke lorde fortune aye yt nought wol retche ſhe ne daūteth wight wretche truſteth certes hert ſwete phebus ſuſter lucina ſhene lyon paſſe ariete wol ben withouten wene mene helpe iuno heuens quene tenth day death aſſayle woll ſene withouten fayle ſo thus ſoth quod troylus ſhall well ſuffre vnto tenth daye syns ſe nedes mote thus loue god yf maye let v ſtelen priuely away euer one lyuen reſt myne hert ſayth woll beſt mercy god lyfe ꝙ ſhe ala ye ſlee thus tene ſe well ye myſtruſten wordes well yſene loue scithia ſhene miſtruſt nat thus cauſeleſſe routh si tru haue plight trouth thynketh wel ſōtyme wyt ſpende tyme tyme wyn ne parde lorne nat fro yet though ben daye two twyn driue tho fantaſyes within truſteth leaueth eke ſorowe trouth wyl nat lyue tyll morowe ye wyſt ſore doth ſmerte ye wold ceſſe god thou woſt pure ſpyrit wepeth myne herte ſene wepen yt loue mooſt mote gon vnto grekes hoſt yea nere wyſt remedye come ayen ryght wolde dye certes ſo nyce wyght ne ymagynen away come ayen daye haue hyght may holden thyng yt wol awaye father nought queynt playe thrift wendyng troy daye ſhall turne v ioye thy myne hert beſeke yf lyſt done ought prayer ye loue loue eke er departe fro ſo good comfort chere may ſene ye may bring reſt myne herte poynt breſt ouer praye ꝙ ſhe tho myne owne hertes ſothfaſt ſuffyſaunce syth thyne hole withouten mo whyle abſent pleſaūce fro remembraunce euer agaſt men rede loue thyng aye ful beſy drede thys worlde leueth lady none vntrewe god defende ſo betrayed wo begone al trouth entende doutleſſe yf iche wende deed er ye cauſe fynde goddes loue ſo beth naught vnkind anſwered troylus ſeyde god whō ny cauſe ywrie glade wy neuer vnto creſeyde sith thylke day ſaw fyrſt wyth eye falſe ne neuer ſhal tyl dye ſhorte wordes wel ye may leue ſhal founde preue graūt mercy good hert myn ywis ꝙ ſhe blyſful venus let neuer ſterue er may ſtonde pleaſaunce degre quyte wel ſo wel deſerue whyle yt god wyt wyl conſerue ſhal ſo done ſo trewe haue founde aye honour ward ſhall rebound truſteth wel eſtate royal ne veyne delyte onely worthyneſſe werre turuay marcial ne pompe array nobley eke rycheſſe ne made rewe diſtreſſe moral vertue grounded vpon trouth ye cauſe firſt routh eke gentyl hert manhede ye ye thought diſpyte euery thyng ſowned bad rudeneſſe peoplyſhe appetyte reaſon bridled deiyte made abouen euery creature yt ſhal may endure thys may lengthe yeres nat fordo ne remnable fortune deface iupitter myght may ſorouful glad ſo yeue v grace er nyghtes ten meten place may hert myn ſuffyſe fareth wel time ye ryſe longe yplayned ofte ykyſt ſtrayte armes folde day gan ryſe troylus clad rufully lady gan beholde felte dethes care colde grace gan hym recōmaunde wo holde demaūd mannes heed ymaginen ne ne entendement conſyder ne tonge tel cruel paynes ſorouful man paſſen euery torment downe hel whan ſawe ſhe ne might dwel ſoule herte rent withoutē chambre went ¶explicit liiiii et incipit liv aprochen gan fatall deſtyne ioues hathe diſpoſytioun angrye parcas ſuſtren thre committeth done execuſioun creſeyde muſt toun troylus ſhal dwel forth pyne tyl lacheſis threde lenger twyne golde treſſed phebus hyghe loſte thriſe al beames clere ſnowes molt zephyrus ofte ybrought ayen tender leaues grene sen ſonne eccuba quene began loue firſt whō ſorowe al ſhe departe ſhulde morowe ful redy prime diomede creſeyde vnto grekes hooſt leed ſorowe ſhe felte hert blede ſhe nyſte beſt reed trewly men bookes reed men wyſt neuer woman haue care ne ſo lothe towne fare thys troylus wythouten rede lore man hath ioyes eke forlore waytyng hys lady euer ſhe ſothfaſt croppe al luſt ioyes tofore troylus fare wel al thy ioye ſhalte thou neuer ſene efte troye sothe yt whyle bade manere gan wo ful manly hyde wel vnneth ſene chere yate ſhe ſhulde ryde certayne folke houed abyde wo begon al wolde playne hys horſe vnneth ſate payne ire quoke ſo herte gnawe whan diomede horſe gan dyght ſayd vnto ſelfe thys ylke ſawe ala ꝙ thus foule wretchydneſſe ſuffre nyl redreſſe nat bet atones dye euermore langour thus crye nyl make one ryche poore haue ynough done er ſhe go nyl brynge al troye vpon roore nyl •• een thys diomede alſo nyl rather wyth man two steale away wol endure nyl helpen myne owne cure nolde done ſo fel dede ſhal ſayne hym lyſte ſpare herte alway maner drede leſte creſeyde rumour thys fare shulde haue ben ſlayn lo hys care el certayne ſayd yore done withouten wordes creſeyde whan ſhe redy ryde ful ſoroufully ſhe ſyghed ſayd ala forth ſhe mote aught yt may betyde forth ſhe rydeth ful ſoroufully paas none remedye caas wat wonder though ſore ſmerte whan ſhe forgoth owne ſwete herte thys troylus gyſe curteſye wyth hauke hande huge route knyghtes rode dyd companye paſſyng al valey ferre wythout ferther wold haue rydden doute ful fayne wo hym gon ſo ſone turne muſt eke done ryght wyth antenor ycome grekes hoſte euery wyght hym glad ſayd welcome troylus al nere hys herte lyght payned hym wyth al hys ful myght hym wythholde wepyng leſte antenor kyſte made feſte therwythal muſt leaue take caſt eye vpon pytouſly nere rode hys cauſe make take honde al ſobrely lorde ſo ſhe gan wepen tenderly ful ſofte ſlyghly gan ſey holde day dey hys courſer turned aboute wyth face pale vnto diomede worde ſpake ne none al route ſonne tydeus toke hede kouth crede ſuch crafte rayne hente troylus troye homwardes went diomede ladde bridel whan ſaw folke troye away thought al labour ſhal ben ydel may ſomwhat ſhal ſay worſte ſhorte may way haue herde ſay eke tymes twyſe twelue foole wol foryete hym ſelue nathleſſe thys thought wel ynough certaynly nought ſpeke loue make thought douteleſſe yf ſhe haue thought geſſe may ben ybrought ſone away ſhal fynde meane ſhe ſhal yet wete meane thus diomede coulde gode whā gan fallē forth ſpeche aſke ſhe ſtode ſuch diſeaſe gan eke beſeche yf encreaſen myght eche wyth thyng eaſe ſhe ſholde cōmaund ſayd done wolde trewly ſwore knyght yt ther na thyng wt myȝt pleſe nolde hys payne al myȝt done herte eſe prayde ſhe wolde ſorowe apeſe ſayd ywys grekes haue ioye honouren well folke troy ſaid eke thus wote thīketh ſtraūg wonder newe thacqueyntaūce theſe troyans chaūg folke grece ye neuer knewe wolde neuer god yf trewe greke ye ſhuld amonge v al fynde troyan eke kynde bycauſe ſwore ryght nowe ben frende helply might acqueintaunce eke haue another ſtraunger wight fro forth pray daye nyght cōmaūdeth howe ſore ſmerte done al may lyke vnto herte ye wold brother treat taketth nat frendſhpyp diſpyte though ſorowes ben thinges gret nat reſpyte myn hert hath amend great delyte yf may harmes nat redreſſe ryght ſory heuyneſſe though ye troyans wt v grekes wroth haue many day ben alway yet parde god loue ſoth ſeruen loue god lady free whō ſo ye hate beth wroth wyth trewly wyght ſerue halfe ſo loth wrath wolde deſerue nere ben ſo nere tent calcas ſene v may wolde thys tel al myne entent thys enſealed tyl another day yeue hande ſhal aye god helpe ſo yt life may endure owne abouen euery creature thus ſaide neuer er womā borne god myne herte wyſely glade ſo loued neuer woman beforne paramour ne neuer ſhal mo loue god foe al nat lady dere complayne aryght yet lere wōdreth nouȝt myn owne lady bryght though yt ſpeke loue thus bliue haue herde thys many wyght hath loued thynge neuer ſawe lyue eke power ſtryue ayenſt god loue hym obey wol alway mercy prey beth ſo worthy knyghtes place ye ſo fayre eueryche hem al wol payne hym ſtonden grace myght ſo fayre grace fal ye ſeruaunte wolde cal lowly ne ſo trewly ſerue nyl none hem ſhal tyl ſterne creſeyde vnto purpoſe lyte anſwerde ſhe wyth ſorowe oppreſſed effecte ſhe naught tale herde nowe worde two thought ſorouful hert braſt two whan ſhe gan father ferre eſpye wel nyghe downe horſe ſhe gan ſye nathleſſe ſhe thonketh diomede al trauayle good chere lyſt frendſhyp bede ſhe accepteth good manere wol fayne lefe dere truſteth hym ſhe wold wel ſhe might ſayd ſhe horſe ſhe alyght father hath armes nōme twēty time kyſt doughter ſwete ſayd dere doughtee mine welcome ſayd eke ſhe fayne wt mete ſtode forth muet mylde manſuete leaue wyth father dwell forth wol troylus tell troye come woful troylus ſorowe abouen al ſorowes ſmerte felon loke face diſpytous tho ſodaynly downe frō horſe ſterte paleys ſwolne herte chābre went nothyng toke hede ne non dare ſpeke worde drede ſorowes ſpared yaue iſſue large dethe cryde throwes frenetyke mad curſeth iuno apollo eke cupide curſeth bachus cere cipride byrth ſelfe fate eke nature ſaue lady euery creature bed goth weyleth turneth furye doth ixion hell wyſe nygh tyl day ſoiourneth tho began herte alyte vnſwel teeres ye gonnen vp wel pytouſly cryed vpon creſeyde hym ſelfe thus ſpake ſeyde myne owne lady lefe dere white breſt ben armes eyen clere yeſterdaye tyme nowe may wepe alone many teere graſpe aboute may place saue pylowe fynde naught embrace ſhal whā ſhal ſhe come agayne ala let go wolde god tho ſlayne hert myne ceſeyde ſwete fo lady myne loue mo euer myne hert dowe se howe dye ye nyll reſcowe ſeeth nowe ryght lode ſterre ſytteth ryght nowe preſence comforten hertes werre gon yeue ye audience ſpeketh ryght nowe abſence ala wyght al care wel wote yuell ye fare howe ſhulde thus ten dayes ful endure whan fyrſt nyght haue al thys tene howe ſhal ſhe eke ſorouful creature tenderneſſe howe ſhall ſhe thys ſuſtene suche wo pytous pale grene shal ben freſhe womanly face langour er ye turne vnto thys place whan fyl ſlombrynges anon begyne ſhulde grone dreamen dredfulleſt thynges myght ben mete alone place horrible makyng aye hys mone meten amonges al hys enemyes handes fal therwithal hys body ſhulde ſterte wyth ſterte al ſodaynly awake ſuch tremour fele herte feare hys body ſhulde quake therwythal ſhulde noyſe make ſeme though ſhulde fal depe hygh alofte wolde wepe rewen hym ſelfe ſo pytouſly wonder hys fantaſye another tyme ſhulde myghtely comforte hym ſelfe ſayne folye cauſeleſſe ſuche drede drie efte begyn aſpre ſorowes newe euery man might paine rewe coulde tel al fully diſcryue wo playnt hys langour pyne nat al men han ben lyue thou reder mayſt thy ſelfe ful wel deuyne ſuch wo wyt defyne ydel write ſhulde ſwynke whan wyt wery thynke heuen yet ſterres ſene although full pale ywoxen moone whyten gan orizonte ſhene al eeſtwarde wonte doone phebus wyth hys roſy carte ſoone gan dreſſe vp fare whan troylus hath ſent pandare pandare al day beforne ne might hym comen thys troylus ſe although hys heed ſworne kyng priam alday laye nat lyberte wher gon ye morowe went troylus whan hym ſent hys herte coulde wel deuyne troylus al nyght ſorowe woke wolde tel hym hys pyne thys knew well ynough wythout boke chābre ſtreyght ye way toke troylus tho ſobrely grette bed ful ſone gan hym ſette pandarus ꝙ troylus ſorowe drie may longe endure trowe ſhal lyuen tyl morowe wolde alwayes auenture deuyſen ſepulture forme mouable thou diſpone ryght ſemeth beſt done fyre flambe funerall body brennen ſhall glede feeſt playes paleſtrall vygyle pray take good hede wel offre mar ſtede ſworde myn helme leue brother dere ſheld pallas yeue ſhyneth clere poudre ī min hert ibrēde ſhal turn pray thou take conſerue veſſel men clepeth vrne golde lady ſerue loue thus pytouſly ſterue yeue thys pleſaunce prayen kepe remembraūce wel fele maladye dreames nowe yore ago al certaynly mote nedes dye oule eke hyght aſcaphylo hath ſhryght al theſe nyghtes two god mercury wofull wretche ſoule gyde whan lyſte fetche pandare anſwerde ſayd troylus dere frende haue tolde yore folye ſorowen thus cauſeleſſe ſo wol nat trowen rede ne lore ſene hym remedye let hym worchen fantaſye troylus pray tel nowe thou trowe er thys wyght hath loued paramour wel thou ye god wote fro many worthy knyght hath hys ladye gone fourtenyght nat yet made haluendele fare nede maken al thys care sen day day thou mayſt thy ſeluen ſe loue el hys wyfe man mote twynnen neceſſyte yee though loue owne lyfe yet nyl wyth ſelfe thus maken ſtryfe wel thou woſt leue brother dere alway frendes may ben yfere thys folke yt ſene loues wedded frendes myght betydeth ful ofte ſene hem ſpouſes bed ybedded god wote take wyſely fayre ſofte good hope halt vp herte alofte tyme ſorowe endure tyme hem hurteth time doth hem cure ſhuldeſt thou endure letten ſlyde tyme fonde ben gald lyght ten dayes ny ſo longe abyde ſens ſhe comen hath behyght nyl heſte breken wyght drede ſhe nyl fynde way come ayen lyfe durſt laye thy ſweueneſſe eke al ſuch fantaſye dryue let hem faren miſchaunce procede thy melancolye doth fele ſlepe al thys penaunce ſtrawe al ſweuenes ſignifyaunce god helpe ſo counte hem nat abeene ther wot mā aright dremes meene preeſtes temple tellen thys dreames bene reuelations goddes al wel tel ywys bene infernales illuſyons lech ſayne complections proceden faſte glotonye wot ſoth thus ſignyfye eke ſayne impreſſions yf wyght hath faſte thinge mynde therof cometh ſuch auiſions ſayne bokes fynde tymes yere kynde mē dreme theffect goth mone leue dreame done well worth dremes aye theſe olde wyues trewly eke augurye theſe foules feare mē wemen leſe liues rauēs qualm ſchriching theſe oules trowen falſe foule ala ala ſo noble creature man ſhulde drede ſuch ordure al myne herte beſeche vnto thy ſelfe al thys thou foryeue ryſe nowe vp withouten ſpeche let v caſt forth may beſt dryuē time eke freſhly may lyuen whā ſhe cometh yu ſhall right ſone god helpe ſo beſt thus done ryſe let v ſpeke luſtye lyfe troye haue lad forth time dryue eke tyme comyng v reioye bryngen ſhal blyſſe ſo blyue langour theſe twyſe dayes fyue ſhal therwyth ſo foryete oppreſſe well vnneth done ſhal v dureſſe thys towne ful lordes al aboute truce laſten thys meane whyle go playen v ſome luſty route sarpedon hence myle thus thou ſhalt tyme wel begyle driue forth vnto blyſful morow thou ſe cauſe thy ſorow nowe ryſe dere brother troylus certes non honoure wepe thy bedde rouken thus trewly thyng truſt thou thus lygge daye two thre folke woll wene yt thou cowardyſe fayneſt ſicke thou darſt ryſe troylus anſwerde brother dere thys knowē folke haue yſuffred paine though wepe make ſorouful chere feleth harme ſmert euery vaine wonder though euer playne alway wepe nothyng blame sen yt haue loſte ye cauſe al game ſens fyne force mote aryſe ſhal aryſe ſone euer may god myne hert ſacrifyſe ſende v haſtely tenthe daye neuer foule ſo fayne may ſhal ben whan yt ſhe cometh troye cauſe turment ioye whyder thy rede ꝙ troylus may playe v beſte al thys toun god counſayle quod pandarus ryde playe v wyth king sarpedoun longe ſpeken vp doun tyl troylus gan laſte aſſent ryſe forth sarpedon went thys sarpedon honourable euer lyue ful hye proweſſe wythal myght yſerued bene table deyntie al coſt great rycheſſe fed hem day day ſuche nobleſſe ſayden mooſt eke leeſt neuer er daye wyſt feeſt worlde ther none inſtrument delicious wynd touch corde ferre wyght hath euer ywent tonge tell herte maye recorde feeſt na wel herde recorde ne ladyes eke ſo fayre companye daūce er tho neuer yſene eye auayleth thys troylus ſorowe nothyng rought ruer one hert pytous ful beſily creſeyde lady ſought al euer hert thought thys nowe ſo faſt ymaginyng glad ywys feſtyng theſe ladyes eke thys feeſt ben sen ſawe lady wey ſorowe vpon hem ſeen inſtrumentes pley ſhe hys herte hath key abſent lo thys fantaſye wyght ſhulde make melodye na houre al day nyght whā ther mā myght ne ſayd loueſom lady bryght howe haue ye faren ſens ye welcome ywys myne owne lady dere welaway al na maſe fortune houe entended bet glaſe letter eke ſhe olde tyme hym yſent wolde alone rede hundred ſythe atwixte noone prime refiguryng ſhappe womanhede wythin hert euery worde dede paſſed thus droue ende fourth day ſayd wol wende ſayd leue brother pandarus intendeſt thou ſhal bleue tyl sarpedon woll forthe conueyen v yet fayrer toke leue goddes loue let v nowe ſone eue leaue take homwarde let v turne trewly nyl thus ſoiourne pandare anſwerde comen hyther fetchen fyre rennen home agayne god helpe ſo tellen whyther myght gone yf ſhall ſothly ſayne wyght v fayne sarpedon yf hence hye thus ſodeynly holde vylanye ſayden wolde bleue wyth hym weke nowe thus ſodaynly fourth daye take hym leue wolde wondren truely let v holden forth purpoſe fermely ſens ye behyghten hym abyde holde forewarde nowe let v ryde thys pandarus wyth pyne wo made hym dwell wekes ende sarpedon toke leaue tho way ſpedden hem wende quod troylus lorde grace ſende may fynde myne home cōmynge creſeyde comen therwyth gan ſynge ye haſelwode thought thys pandare hym ſelfe full ſoftely ſeyde god wote refroyden may thys hotte fare er calkas ſende troylus creſeyde natheles iaped thus ſeyde ſwore ywys hys hert wel behyght wold come ſone euer ſhe myght vnto palays ycomen troylus downe horſe alyght ye chābre way haue nōmen vnto tyme gan nyght ſpeken creſeyde lady bryght thys hem leſte ſpedde hem fro ſupper vnto reſte morowe ſone daye began clere thys troylus gan hys ſlepe abreyde pandarus hys owne brother dere loue god full pytouſly ſeyde go ſene paleys creſeyde ſens yet may haue feeſt let v ſene paleys leeſt therwythall hys meyne blende cauſe fonde towne go creſeydes houſe gone wende lorde thys ſely troylus wo hym thought ſorowful hert braſt two ſawe dores ſperred wel nyg ſorowe adowne gan fall therwith whē ware gan beholde howe ſhet euery wyndowe place froſt hym thought hys herte gan colde whych wyth chaunged deedly pale face wythouten worde forth gan pace god welde gan ſo faſte ryde wyght hys countenaunce aſpyde ſayd thus paleys deſolate houſe houſes whylom beſt yhyght paleys empty dyſconſolate thou lanterne whych queynt ye light paleys whylom daye yt nowe art nyght well oughteſt thou fall dye sen ſhe went wont v gye paleys whylom crowne houſes enlumyned wyth ſunne blyſſe rynge whych rubie fall cauſe wo cauſe haſte ben blyſſe yet ſens maye bet fayne wolde kyſſe thy colde doores durſt thys route farwel ſhryne ſaynt therwyth caſt pandarus hys eye wyth chaunged face pytous beholde myght hys tyme aryght aſpye aye rode pandarus tolde hys newe ſorowe eke hys ioyes olde pytouſly wyth ſo deed hewe euerywight might ſorow rewe fro thence forth rydeth vp downe euery thynge came remēbraunce rode forth place towne whych whylom hys pleſaunce lo yonder ſawe myne owne lady daunce temple wyth eyen clere kaught fyrſt ryght lady dere yonder haue herde full luſtely dere herte laugh yonder play sawe ownes eke full blyſfully yonder one gan ſhe ſaye nowe good ſwete loue well praye yonde ſo goodly gan ſhe beholde death myne herte holde corner yonder houſe herde myne alderleueſt lady dere womanly wyth voyce melodyouſe syngen ſo well ſo goodly ſo clere ſoule yet thynketh blyſfull ſowne yonder place lady fyrſt toke vnto grace thē thought thus blyſful lorde cupide proceſſe haue memorye howe thou haſte weryed euery ſyde men myght boke make lyke ſtorye nede ſeke vyctorye sen thyne holy thy wyll ioye haſt thou thyn owne folke ſpyl wel haſt thou lord ywroke thyn yre thou myghty god dredfull greue nowe mercy lorde thou woſte wel deſyre thy grace moſte luſtes leue lyue dye woll thy beleue whych ne aſke guerdon boone thou creſeyde ayen ſende ſoone dyſtrayne herte faſt returne thou doeſt myne longen ſe wote wel ſhe nyll ſoiourne nowe blyſfull lorde ſo cruell thou ne vnto bloode troye praye iuno vnto bloode thebane ye folk thebe caught bane thys yates wente creſeyde rode ful good paas vp downe made many wēte hym ſelfe ful ofte ſayd ala fro hence rode blyſſe ſolas wolde blyſfull god nowe hys ioye myght ſene ayen come troye yonder hyll gan gyde ala toke leue yonde ſawe father ryde ſorowe myne hert ſhall cleue hyther home come eue dwell caſt al ioye ſhall tyll maye ſene efte troye hym ſelfe ymagined ofte ben defeyted pale woxen leſſe wont men ſayden ſofte maye ſoth geſſe troylus hath thys heuyneſſe thys na hys melancolye hym ſelfe ſuche fantaſye another tyme ymagynen wolde euery wyght went wey hym routh ſayne ſholde ryght ſory troylus woll dey thus droue day yet forth tweye ye haue herde ſuche lyfe gan lede ſtode bytwixen hope drede whych hym lyked hys ſonges ſhewe thencheſon hys wo beſt myght made ſonge wordes fewe somwhat hys wofull herte lyght euery mānes ſyght wyth ſofte voyce hys lady dere abſent gan ſynge ye may ſterre whych loſt haue al light wyth herte ſore well ought bewayle euer derke turment nyght nyght towarde deth wt wynde ſtere ſayle whych tenth nyght yf fayle gydyng thy beames bryght houre ſhyp carybdes woll deuoure thys ſonge whē thus ſongē ſoone fyll ayen hys ſyghes olde euery nyght wont doone ſtode bryght moone beholde hys ſorowe moone tolde ſayd ywys whē thou arte horned newe ſhall glad yf worlde trewe ſawe thyne horne old eke morowe hence rode ryght lady dere cauſe turment ſorowe whych bryght lucina clere loue god ren faſt aboute thy ſpere thyne horne new gynnē ſprynge ſhall ſhe come yt may blyſſe brynge daye lenger euery night ben wōte hym thought tho ſonne went hys courſe vnryght lenger waye wonte go ſayd ywys drede euer mo sonnes ſonne pheton lyue hys father carte amyſſe dryue vpon walles faſt eke wolde walke grekes hoſte wolde ſe hym ſelfe ryght thus wolde talke lo yonder myne owne lady free el yonder tentes thence cometh thys ayre ſo ſoote ſoule fele dothe boote hardly thys wynde thus ſtoundemele encreaſeth face ladyes depe ſyghes ſore preue thus none ſpace thys towne ſaue thys place fele winde ſowneth ſo lyke payne ſayeth ala twynned twayne thys lōge tyme dryueth forth ryght thus tyll fully paſſed nynth nyght aye beſyde hym thys pandarus beſyly dyd hys full myght hym comforte make hys herte lyght yeuynge hope alway ye tenth morowe ſhe ſhal comen ſtynten al ſorowe vpon ſyde eke creſeyde wyth woman fewe amonge ye grekes ſtrōge whych full ofte day ala ſhe ſeyde borne wel may myn herte lōge death nowe lyue longe ala ne maye amende nowe worſe euer yet wende father nyll nothynge grace gone ayen ought hym queme yf ſo terme pace troylus ſhall hys herte deme falſe ſo maye well ſeme thus ſhall haue vnthanke euery ſyde borne ſo welawaye tyde yf put ieopardye ſteale awaye nyght fall caught ſhalbe holde ſpye el lo thys drede moſte yf handes ſome wretche fall nam buſt loſte bemyn herte trewe mighty god thou ſorowe rewe full pale ywoxen bryght face lymmes leane ſhe daye stode ſhe durſt loked place ſhe borne dwelt aye nyght wepynge ala ſhe laye thus dyſpayred al cure ladde lyfe thys wofull creature full ofte day ſhe ſyghed eke dyſtreſſe ſelfe ſhe went aye purtrayeng troylus great worthyneſſe hys goodly wordes recordyng sen fyrſt day loue begā ſpryng thus ſhe ſette wofull herte fyre remembraunce yt ſhe gan deſyre thys world ny ſo cruel herte herde cōplaynen ſorowe nold haue weptē paynes ſmert tenderly ſhe wepte eue morowe neded teeres borowe thys yet worſt payne wyȝt whō ſhe durſt playne full rewfully ſhe loked vpon troye behelde toures hygh eke hallis ala ꝙ ſhe pleaſaunce ioye whych nowe al turned gall haue ofte wythin yonder wallis troylus doeſt thou nowe ſhe ſeyde lord whether thou yet thinke vpō creſeyde ala ne ytrowed lore went wyth ye redde er thys nowe ſyghed halfe ſo ſore myght haue ſayd yt done amys ſteale awaye wyth ſuche one late cometh lectuary men corſe vnto graue carye late nowe ſpeke matere prudence ala one thyne eyen thre lacked alwaye er came tyme paſſed well remembred preſent tyme eke coulde well ſe future tyme er ſnare coulde ſene cauſeth care
