natheleſſe betyde betyde ſhall morowe nyght eeſt weſt thys hooſt ſteale ſome ſyde gone wyth troylus hem leſt purpoſe wol holde ye beſt force wycked tonges ianglerye euer loue haue wretch enuy ſo wol euery worde take hede rulen hym euery wyghtes wyt ne ſhall neuer thryuen drede ſome men blamen euer yet lo maner folke comenden ſuche variaunce felicite clepe ſuffyſaunce whych wythout wordes mo troy woll concluſioun god wote er fully monethes two full ferre fro entencioun troylus troye toun shall knotleſſe throughout herte ſlyde ſhe woll take purpoſe abyde thys diomede whome tell goeth nowe wythin hym ſelfe aye arguyng wyth ſleyght euer howe maye beſt wyth ſhorteſt taryeng hys nette creſeydes herte brynge thys entente couth neuer fyne fyſhen layde hoke lyne natheleſſe well hys herte thought ſhe na wythout loue troye neuer ſythen then brought ne couth ſene laugh maken ioye nyſt howe beſt herte tacoye taſſey ſayd naught ne greueth naught aſſayeth nauȝt atcheueth yet ſayd hym ſelfe vpon nyght nowe fole wote wel howe wo loue another wyght hervpon gon aſſaye nowe maye well wete nyll ben prowe wyſe folke bokes expreſſe men ſhall wowe wyght heuyneſſe ſo myght wynnen ſuche floure fro whō ſhe mourneth night daye myght ſayne conquerour ryght anone bolde aye thought hert happe happe may ſhulde dye woll herte ſeche ſhall leſen ſpeche thys diomede bokes v declare hys nedes preſt coragious wyth ſterne voyce mighty lymmes ſquare hardy teſtyfe ſtronge cheualrous dedes lyke hys father tydeus ſome men ſayne tonge large heyre calcidony arge creſeyde meane ſtature therto ſhappe face eke chere myght ben fayrer creature ofte tyme thys manere gone ytreſſed wyth herres clere downe colere backe behynde threde golde ſhe wold bynde ſaue browes ioyneden yfere na lacke aught eſpyen ſpeken eyen clere lo trewly wrytten ſeyen paradys ſtode formed eyen wyth ryche beaute euermore ſtroue loue ay hē ſobre eke ſymple wyſe withal beſte ynoryſhed eke myght goodly ſpeche generall charitable eſtately luſty fre ne neuer ne lacked pyte tendre herted ſlydynge corage truely tell age troylus well woxen hyght complete formed proporcioun wel kynde naught amēden might yonge freſhe ſtronge hardy lyoun trewe ſtele eche condicioun one beſte entetched creature ſhal whyle yt world may dure certaynly ſtory fonde troylus neuer vnto wyght hys tyme dregre ſeconde darynge longeth knyght al myght gyaunt paſſen hym myght hys herte aye wyth fyrſt wyth ye beſt stode peregall dare done hym leſte tellen forth diomede fyll tenthe daye sen creſeyde cyte yede thys diomede freſh braūche may came tente calkas lay fayned hym wt calcas haue doone mente ſhal tellen ſoone creſeyde ſhorte wordes tell welcomed hym downe hym ſette eth ynough maken dwell thys wythouten longe lette ſpyces wyne mē forth hem fette forth ſpeke thys yfere frendes done whych ſome ſhal ye gan fyrſt fallen werre ſpeche betwyxen hem folke troye toun thaſſiege gan eke beſeche tellen hym opinioun fro demaunde ſo dyſcendeth doun aſken yf ſtraunge thought grekes gyſe werkes yt wrought father taryeth ſo longe wedden vnto ſome worthy wyght creſeyde paynes ſtronge loue troylus owne knyght ferforth ſhe connynge myght anſwerde hym tho hys entente ſemed ſhe wyſte mente natheleſſe thys ylke diomede gan hym ſelfe aſſure thus ſeyde yf aryght haue taken hede thynketh thus lady myne creſeyde ſens fyrſt hōde brydel leyde ye came troye morowe ne myght neuer ſene ſorowe ſayne may cauſe yf loue ſome troyan whych ryght ſore wolde athynken ye wyght dwelleth shulden ſpyll quarter teere pytouſly ſeluen ſo begyle dredeleſſe worth whyle folke troye ſayth al ſome pryſon ben ye ſeluen ſe fro thence ſhall one lyue come golde atwyxen ſunne ſee truſteth well vnderſtandeth ſhall one mercy gone lyue lorde worldes twyſe fyue wrech hem fetchyng heleyne ſhall take er hence wende maunes ye goddes bē peyne shal ben agaſt grekes wol hem ſhende men ſhall drede vnto worldes ende hence forth rauyſhen quene cruell ſhall wreche hem ſene yf calcas lede v wyth ambage ſayne wyth double wordes ſlye mē clepen worde wt two viſages ye ſhall well knowen ne lye thys thinge ryght ſene wt eye yt anone ye nyll trowe howe ſoone nowe taketh hede doone wene ye wyſe father wolde haue yeuen antenor anone yf ne wyſt cytie ſhulde dyſtroyed ben nay ſo mote gone knewe full well ſhal ſcapen one troyan great feere durſt ye dwelte lenger woll ye loueſom lady dere let troye troyans fro herte pace dryue yt bytter hope make good chere clepe ayen beaute face ye wyth ſalte teeres ſo deface troye brought ſuche ieopardye ſaue nowe remedye thynketh wel ye ſhal grekes fynde parfyte loue er nyght troyan kynde bet ſeruen woll done hys myght yf ye vouchſafe lady bryght woll ben ſeruen ſelue yea leauer lorde greces twelue wyth yt worde gan waxen reed hys ſpeche lytel whyle quoke caſt aſyde lytell wyth hys heed ſtynte whyle afterwarde woke ſobrely threwe hys loke ſayd al ioye gentyll man wyght troye yf father tydeus ſeyde ilyued ben er thys calcidony arge kynge creſeyde ſo hope ſhalbe ywys ſlayne ala harme vnhappely thebe rathe polymyte many man ſcathe herte myne ſythe mā ben fyrſt whome ſeche grace ſerue hertely euer ſhall whyle lyue haue ſpace er departe thys place ye woll graunt maye morowe better leyſer tell ſorowe ſhulde tell hys wordes yt ſeyd ſpake ynough daye meſt preueth well ſpake ſo creſeyde graunted morowe hys requeſt ſpeake wyth hym leeſt nolde ſpeake ſuche matere thus ſhe hym ſayd ye mowe ſhe herte troylus faſt maye none arace ſtraungely ſhe ſpake ſayd thus diomede loue ylke place borne ioues thy grace delyuer ſoone doth care god thy myght ſo leue well fare grekes wold wrath troy wrek yf myght knowe wel ywys ſhall naught befallen ye ſpeke god forne farther ouer thys wote father wyſe redy hath bought ye tolde dere vnto hym holde grekes ben hygh condition wote eke wel certayne men ſhal fynde worthy folke wythin troy toun connyng parfyte kynde ben betwyxtr orcades inde ye coude well lady ſerue trowe eke well thanke deſerue ſpeke loue ywys ſhe ſeyde lorde whome wedded whoſe myne herte tyll deyde loue helpe nowe pallas myne herte ny ne neuer ye ben noble hygh kynrede haue well herde tellen drede doth haue ſo great wonder ye woll ſcorne woman ſo eke god wote loue ben fer aſonder dyſpoſed bet ſo mote go vnto death playne make wo ſhall done ſay trewly yet lyſt play myne herte nowe tribulatioun ye armes beſy daye daye herafter ye wonnen haue toun perauenture ſo happen may ſe neuer ere ſay woll werke yt neuer ere wrought thys worde ynoughe ſuffyſen ought morow eke wol ſpekē wyth fayne ye touchen naught thys matere lyſt ye may come againe er ye gone thus moche ſaye helpe pallas wyth heeres clere yf ſhulde greke haue routhe ſhulde ſeluen trouthe ſaye therfore wol loue ne ſay nay concluſioun meane well god ſyt aboue therwythall ſhe caſte eyen doun gā ſigh ſaid troilus troy toun yet bydde god quyete reſte maye ſene myne herte breſte effecte ſhortly ſaye thys diomede freſhly newe agayne gan preaſen faſte mercy praye thys ſoth ſayne gloue toke ful fayne fynally woxen eue well roſe toke hys leue bryght venus folowed aye taught way brode phebus downe alight cythera chare horſe ouer raught whyrle lyon yf ſhe myght signifer hys candels ſheweth bryght creſeyde vnto bedde wente wythin father fayre bryght tente retournyng ſoule aye vp downe wordes thys ſodayne diomede hys great eſtate peryl towne ſhe alone nede frendes helpe thus gan brede cauſe ſoth tell toke fully purpoſe dwell morow came gooſtly ſpeke diomede come vnto creſeyde ſhortly leſte ye tale breke wel hym ſelfe ſpake ſeyde ſyghes ſore downe leyde fynally ſothe ſayne lefte great payne ſtorye telleth v ſhe yaue fayre baye ſtede whiche ſhe one wan troylus eke broche lytel nede troylus ſhe yaue diomede eke bet ſorowe releue made weare pencell ſleue fynde eke ſtories el whan body hurte diomede troylus tho wepte ſhe many teere whā ſhe ſawe wyde woundes blede ſhe toke kepen good hede healen ſmerte men ſayn ſhe yaue herte trewly ſtorie telleth v made neuer woman wo ſhe whan ſhe falſed troylus ſayd ala nowe clene ago name trouthe loue euermo haue falſed one gentylleſt euer one worthyeſt ala vnto worldes ende shal neyther ben ywritten yſonge good word theſe bokes wol ſhēde irolled ſhall ben many tonge throughout ye worlde bel ſhal ronge woman moſte woll hate ala ſuche caas ſhulde fall wol ſayne moche haue hem done diſhonour welaway albe nat fyrſt dyd amys helpeth blame away ſens ſe better way late nowe rewe diomede woll algate trewe troylus ſens better may ſens thus departen ye yet pray god ſo yeue right good day gentylleſt knyght trewly euer ſawe ſeruen faythfully beſt aye ladyes honour kepe ye worde ſhe braſte anone wepe certes ne haten ſhall neuer frendes loue ſhal ye haue good worde ſhulde lyuen euer trewly wolde right ſorie ſene aduerſyte gyltleſſe wote wel leue ſhall paſſe thus take leue trewly howe longe bytwene ſhe forſoke diomede none auctour telleth wene take euery man nowe bokes hede ſhall terme fynden drede though began wow ſoone er wan yet done ne ne lyſte ſely woman chyde ferther ſtorie woll deuyſe name ala publyſhed ſo wyde gylte ought ynough ſuffyſe yf might excuſe wyſe ſhe ſo ſory vntrouthe iwys wolde excuſe yet routhe troylus haue tolde thus driueth forth wel hath might ofte herte hote colde namely ylke nynthe nyght whiche morowe ſhe behyght come ayen god wote fall lytel reſte night nothyng ſlepe leſte laurer crowned phebus heate gan courſe aye vpwarde wente warmen eeſt ſee waues weate cyrces doughter ſonge freſh entēt whan troylus pandare ſente walles towne pleyde loke yf ſene aught creſeyde tyll noone ſtoden ſe ther came euery maner wight came fro ferre ſayden ſhe tyll colden knowen aright nowe herte dull light thus beiaped ſtoden ſtare aboute naught troylus pandare pandarus troylus tho ſeyde aught wotte noone ſykerly town ne cometh nat creſeyde hath ynough done hardely wynnen father ſo trowe olde father wol yet make dyne er ſhe go god yeue herte pyne pādarus anſwerd may well ben certayne thy let v dyne beſeche noon thā mayſt thou come agayn go without ſpeche comen ayen longe may ſeche er fynde gape fortune hem bothe thynketh iape quod troylus ſe well nowe ſhe taryed olde father ſo er ſhe come woll nygh euen come forthe woll vnto yate go theſe porter ben vnkonnyng euermo woll done hem holden vp yate naught ne though ſhe come late day gothe faſte came eue yet came nat troylus creſeyde loketh forthe hedge tree greue ferre heed ouer wall leyde laſte turned ſeyde god wote meanyng pandare almoſte ywis al newe care nowe douteleſſe thys lady goode wote ſhe cometh rydyng priuely commende wyſedom myne hode woll nat maken people nycely gaure whan yt ſhe cometh ſoftly nyght town ſhe thynketh ryde dere brother thynke nat longe abyde haue naught el ywis pandarus wylte thou trowen haue trouthe ſe yonde ſhe heaue vp thyne eyen man mayſt thou nat ſe pandare anſwerde nay ſo mote al wrōg god ſayſt yu mā wher arte ſe yonde ny farre carte ala thou ſayeſt right ſothe ꝙ troylus hardely nat al nought myne herte nowe reioyce thus ayenſt ſome good haue thought nat howe ſens yt wrought ne felte ſuche comfort dare ſay cometh night lyfe yt durſt lay pādarus anſwerd may wel ynough helde al euer ſayde herte thought ſofte lough ſelfe full ſoberly ſayde frome haſelwodde ioly robyn pleyde shall come thou abydeſt yea farwell ſnowe ferne yere wardeyn yates gan call folke without yt yates bade hem driuen beeſtes night muſte bleuen ferre within night many tere troylus gan homwarde ryde wel ſeeth helpeth nat abyde natheleſſe gladded thought myſcounted hys dey ſayd vnderſtonde haue al amys thylke night laſte creſeyde ſey ſayd ſhall ben yf may er moone dere herte ſwete lyon paſſe aryete ſhe may yet hold al • eſte morowe vnto yate wente vp downe weſt eke eſte vpon walles made many wente al naught hope alway blent whiche night ſorowe ſyghes ſore wente hym home withouten hope clene hys herte fledde ne hath wheron nowe lenger honge yt payne thouȝt herte bledde throwes ſharpe wōder ſtrōg whan ſawe ſhe abode ſo longe nyſte iudgen myght sen ſhe hath broken ſhe hym behyght thyrde fourthe fyfthe ſyxte day tho dayes ten whiche tolde betwyxen hope drede herte lay yet ſomwhat truſtyng heſtes olde whan ſaw ſhe nolde terme holde nowe ſene none remedye ſhape ſone dye therwith wicked ſpiryt god v bleſſe men clepen woode ialouſye gan crepe al heuyneſſe whyche bycauſe wolde ſone dye ne ete ne dronke hys melancolye eke euery companye fledde lyfe al tyme ledde ſo defayte maner man vnneth might knowen wente leane therto pale wan feble walketh potente ire thus ſelfe ſhente ſo aſked wherof hym ſmerte ſayd harme al aboute herte priam full ofte eke mother dere bretherne ſuſtren gan frayne ſo ſoroufull chere thyng ye cauſe al payne al naught nolde hys cauſe playne ſayd felte greuous maladye aboute herte fayne wolde dye day laye downe ſlepe ſo byfell ſlepe thought foreſt faſte walked wepe loue yt theſe paynes wrought vp downe foreſt ſought mette ſawe bore tuſkes greate ſlept ayenſt bright ſonnes heate bore faſte armes folde lay kyſſyng aye lady bright creſeyde ſorow whan gan beholde diſpyte ſlepe breyde loude cryed pandarus ſeyde pandarus nowe knowe croppe roote nam deed ny non boote lady bright creſeyde hath betrayde truſted moſte wight el hath nowe herte apayde blyfful goddes gret might haue dreame yſhewed full right thus dreme creſeyde haue behold thyng pandarus tolde creſeyde ala ſubtylte newe luſt beaute ſcience wrathe iuſte cauſe haue ye gylte fel experience hath rafte ala thyne aduertence truſt faythe depe aſſuraunce hath rafte creſeyde pleſaūce ala let hence go wel nigh wyt breyde ſhall nowe trowe othes mo god wote wende lady bright creſeyde euery worde goſpel ye ſeyde may bet begyle yf hym lyſte men wenen beſt tryſte ſhall done pandarus ala fele nowe ſo ſharpe newe payne sen remedye caas bet myn hōdes twayn ſeluen ſlowe alway thus playn throgh ye deth wo ſhuld haue end ther euery day lyfe ſelfe ſhende pandare anſwerde ſayd ala whyle borne haue nat ſayd er thys dreames many maner man begyle folke expounden hem amys howe darſte thou ſayne falſe thy lady dreame right thyn owne drede let thought yu canſt dremes rede parauēture thou dreameſt bore may ſo may ſignifye father whiche olde eke hore ayen ſonne lythe poynte dye ſhe ſorowe gynneth wepe crye kyſſeth lythe ye grounde thus ſhuldeſt yu thy dreme aright expounde howe might done ꝙ troylus knowe yea neuer ſo lyte ſayeſt thou wiſely ꝙ pandarus rede ſens thou canſt wel endyte haſtely letter thou write yu ſhalt well bringen knowe ſothe thou arte doute ſe nowe dare wel ſayne yf ſo ſhe vntrewe nat trowen ſhe wol write agayne yf ſhe write thou ſhalt ful ſone yſe whether ſhe hath lyberte come ayen el ſome clauſe ſhe let ſhe woll aſſygne cauſe thou haſt nat writtē ſens yt ſhe went ſhe durſte lay may ſuche cauſe ben entente hardely thou wolt thy ſeluen ſay abode beſt tway nowe write thou ſhalt fele ſone ſothe done acorded ben concluſyoun anon theſe ylke lordes two haſtely ſate troylus adoun rolleth herte fro howe may beſt diſcryuen wo creſeyde owne lady dere wrote right thus ſayd ye may ¶the copy letter right freſhe floure whoſe haue ben ſhall withoutē parte el ſeruyce wyth herte body lyfe luſte thought wofull wight euery humble wyſe tonge tel herte may deuyſe ofte mater occupyeth place recommaunde vnto noble grace lyketh weten ſwete herte ye wel knowe howe longe tyme agon ye left aſpre paynes ſmerte whan ye went whiche yet bote non haue non had▪ euer worſe bygon fro day day ſo mote dwell whyle lyſt wele wo well dredeful hert trewe write ſorowe driueth write wo euery houre encreaſeth newe complaynyng dare endyte defaced may ye wyte teares frō myne eyen rayne wolden ſpeke yf yt durſte playne fyrſt beſeche eyen clere toke defouled ye nat holde ouer al ye nat lady dere wol vouchſafe letter beholde cauſe eke 〈◊〉 colde ſleeth wyt yf aught amys ſterte foryeue myne owne ſwete herte ſeruaunt durſt ought ryght vpon lady pitouſly complayne wene ought wyght cōſydred ye theſe monthes twayn haue taryed ye ſayden ſothe ſayn ten dayes ye nolde hoſte ſoiourne two monthes yet ye nat retourne moche mote nedes lyke lyſt dare nat playne humbly ſoroufull ſyghes ſyke write myne vnreſty ſorowes ſore fro day day deſyryng euer knowen fully yf wyll howe ye haue fared ye whoſe welfare heale eke god encreaſe honour ſuche vpwarde degree growe alway ſo neuer ceaſe right herte aye lady free deuyſe pray god ſo mote graunt ye ſoone vpon rewe wiſely trewe yf lyketh knowen fare whoſe wo ther may wiȝt diſcryue cheſt euery care writyng letter lyue al redy wofull goſt dryue whiche delay holde yet honde vpon ſyght mater ſonde myne eyen two vayn ſe ſoroufull teares ſalte arn woxen wellis ſonge playnt myne aduerſyte good harm myn eaſe eke woxē hell ioye wo ſey nowe nought elli turned whiche lyfe wary euery ioye preaſe contrary wt cōmyng home ayē troy ye may redreſſe thouſande ſythe euer encreſſen ioy neuer herte yet ſo blythe haue lyfe ſhall ben ſwythe ſe though maner routhe meuen yet thinketh trouthe yf ſo gylte hath dethe deſerued yf lyſt vpon ſe guerdon yet haue ſerued beſeche myn owne lady fre vpon ye wolden write loue god right lode ſterre deth may make ende al werre cauſe aught doth dwel letter ye may recomforte though abſence hell wyth pacience woll wo comforte lettre hope wol diſporte writeth ſwete let thus nat playn hope dethe delyuereth fro payne iwys myne owne dere herte trewe wote whan ye next vpon ſe loſte haue myn heale eke myn hewe creſeyde ſhall nat conne knowen iwys myne hertes day lady fre thurſteth aye myne herte beholde beaute vnneth lyfe holde ſay haue ſey wel tell may whether ye lyue dey yet pray god ſo yeue right good day fareth wel goodly fayre freſh may ye lyfe dethe may commaunde youre trouthe aye recōmaunde wyth heale ſuche ye yeuen ſame heale ſhal none heale haue lythe whan lyſt ſo day clothen ſhal graue lyfe might ſaue fro diſeaſe paynes ſmerte fare nowe well myne owne ſwete herte le voſtre lettre forth ſent vnto creſeyde whiche anſwere affecte thys full pitouſly ſhe wrote ayen ſeyde alſo ſone ſhe myght ywis wold come mende al amys fynally ſhe wrote ſayd wolde come ye ſhe nyſte letter made ſhe ſuche feeſtes wōder ſwore ſhe loued beſt founde botomleſſe byheſtes troylus thou mayſt nowe eeſt weſt pype iuy leefe yf leſt thus gothe worlde god ſhylde v fro miſchaunce euery wight meneth trouth auaūce encreaſen gan wo fro day nyght troylus taryeng creſeyde leſſen gan hope eke myght al bedde leyd ne ete dronke ne ſlept ne worde ſeyde imagynyng aye ſhe vnkynde wel nigh wext mind dreme told haue eke beforn may neuer come remembraunce thought aye well lady lorne ioues hys purueyaunce hym ſhewed ſlepe ſignyfiaunce vntrouth diſauenture bore ſhewed fygure whiche sybille ſuſter ſente called caſſandre eke aboute dreame tolde er ſtente beſought aſſoylen doute ſtronge boore tuſkes ſtoute fynally within lytell ſtounde caſſandre gan thus hys dreme expoūde gan firſt ſmyle ſayd brother dere thou ſoth deſyreſt knowe thou muſte fewe olde ſtories purpoſe howe fortune ouerthrowe hath lordes old wtin throw thou ſhalt bore know kynde comen men bookes fynde diane wroth yre grekes nolde done ſacrifyce ne encens vpon aulter ſette fyre grekes gonne ſo diſpyſe wrake wonder cruel wyſe bore great oxe ſtall made vp frete corne vynes ſlee bore al ye countrey reyſed amonge whiche came bore ſe mayd one worlde beſt yprayſed meleager lorde countre loued ſo freſhe mayden fre manhode er wolde ſtente bore ſlough ye heed ſente whiche olde bokes tellen v roſe conteke great enuye lorde diſcended tideus lygne el olde bokes lye howe meleager gan dye mother woll nat tell longe dwell tolde eke howe tideus er ſhe ſtente vnto ſtronge cyte thebe claymen kyngdom cyte went felawe dan polimites whiche brother dan ethiocles ful wrongfully thebe helde ye ſtrentgh tolde ſhe proceſſe length tolde eke howe hemonydes aſterte whan tydeus ſlough fyfty knightes ſtoute tolde eke propheſies herte howe ſeuen kynges route beſiegeden cyte aboute holy ſerpent well furyes al ſhe gan hym tell aſſociat profugum tydeus primo polimidem tidea legatum docet inſidiaſ que ſecundis tertius hermodien canit et vates latitantes mors furie leuine quinto narrantur et angues quartus habet reges ineuntes prelia ſeptem archynon buſtum ſexto ludi que leguntur dat graios thebe vatem ſeptimis vmbris octauo cecidit tibeus ſpes vita pelagis ipomedon nono moritur cum parthonepeo fulmine percuſſo decimo canapus ſuperatur vndecimo leſe perimunt per vulnera fratres argiuam flentem narrant duodenis et ignem archinories buryeng playes amphiorax fyll ye groūde howe tideus ſlayne lorde argeyes howe hypomedon lytell ſtounde dreynte deed parthonepe wounde alſo howe campaneus proude wyth thōder dynte ſlayne ye cryed loude gā eke tel eyther brother ethiocles polimites alſo ſcarmyſhe eche hem ſlough argynes wepyng mo ye town brent ſhe told eke tho tho diſcended downe ieſtes olde diomede thus ſhe ſpake tolde ylke bore betokeneth diomede tideus ſonne downe diſcended fro meleager made bore blede thy lady ſo ſhe ywis diomede herte hath ſhe hys wepe yf thou wolte leaue doute diomede thou arte oute thou ſayeſt nat ſoth ꝙ thou ſorcereſſe wyth thy falſe goſte prophecie thou weneſt ben great deuynereſſe nowe ſeeſt thou nat foole fantaſye paynen ladyes lye away ꝙ ioues yeue ſorowe thou ſhalt fals parauēture yet morow wel thou mighteſt lyen good alceſte creature men lye euer kyndeſt beſte whan huſbonde ieopardye dye ſelfe yf ſhe wolde dye cheſe dye gon hell ſtarfe anon v bokes tell caſſandre gothe wyth cruell herte foryate wo angre ſpeche bedde ſodaynly ſterte though al hole hym ymade leche day day gan enquire ſeche ſothe wyth hys full cure thus dryueth forth auenture fortune whiche permutacion thynges hath commytted purueyaunce diſpoſycion hygh ioue reygnes ſhall ben flytted fro folke ī folk whā ſhal ben ſmytted gan pull away fethers bright troye fro day day tyl ben bare ioye amonge fyne ieoperdy hector gan approchen wonder blyue fate wolde ſoule ſhulde vnbodye ſhapen meane driue ayenſt whych fate helpeth nat ſtryue day fyghten gan wende whiche ala caught lyues ende thynketh euery maner wyght haunteth armes ought bewayle dethe ſo noble knight drough kyng thauentayle vnware achilles mayle body gan hym ryue thus ye worthy knight refte lyue olde bookes tellen v made ſuch wo ye tonge may tell namely ſorowe troylus next worthyneſſe wel wo gan thoylus dwell ſorow loue vnreſte ful ofte daye bade herte breſte nathleſſe though gan diſpayre dredde aye lady vntrewe yet aye herte gan repayre theſe louers ſought aye new get ayen creſeyde bryght hewe hert went excuſyng calcas cauſed al taryeng ofte time purpoſe greate hym ſeluen lyke pylgrym diſgyſe ſene may countrefeate ben vnknowen folke wiſe ne fynde excuſe aryght may ſuffyſe amonge grekes knowen wepte ful ofte many teere wrote yet ofte tyme al newe ful pytouſly lefte ſlouth beſechyng ſens trewe ſhe wol come ayen holde trouth creſeyde vpon day routh take ſo touchynge al thys matere wrote ayen ſayd ye may cupides ſonne enſample godlyhede ſworde knighthode ſours gētilneſſe myght wight turment drede healeleſſe ſende yet gladneſſe hertleſſe ſycke diſtreſſe sen ye wt wyth may deale neyther ſende herte may heale letter ful paper al yplaynted conceyued hath myne hertes pyte haue eke ſene wyth teares al depaynted letter howe ye requyren come ayen yet ne may nat leſte letter foūden mencion ne make nowe feere greuous god wote vnreſt haſte goddes ordinaunce ſemeth ye take beſte thyng ny remembraūce thynketh onely pleſaunce beth nat wroth beſeche tary al wycked ſpeche haue herde wel wende touchyng v two thinges haue yſtōde whych ſhal wyth diſſimulyng amende beth wroth haue eke vnderſtonde howe ye ne holden honde force geſſe al trouth al gentylneſſe come wol yet ſuch diſioynte ſtōde nowe yt yere daye ſhal apoynte effecte pray maye good worde frendſhip aye trewely whyle lyfe may dure frende ye may aſſure yet praye yuel ye ne take ſhort whych write dare wel letter make ne neuer yet ne coulde wel endyte eke great effecte men write place lyte thentent al letter ſpace fareth well god haue hys grace la voſtre c troylus thouȝt letter al ſtraūge whan ſawe ſoroufully ſyght thought lyke kalendes eſchaung finally ful ne trowen myght ſhe ne wolde holdē ſhe hight ful yuel wyl lyſt hym leue yt loueth well ſuch caſe though greue nathleſſe men ſayne laſte thynge men ſhal ſoth ſe ſuche caſe betydde faſte troylus wel vnderſtode ſhe na nat ſo kynde ought finally wote nowe doute al loſt hath ben aboute stode day hys melancolye thys troylus ſuſpectioun wende dye ſo befyl throughout troy toun gyſe yborne vp doun manere cote armure ſayth ſtorye beforne deiphebe ſigne victorye whyche cote telleth lollius diephebe rent fro diomede ſame daye whan thys troylus ſawe gan taken hede auyſyng length brede al werke gan beholde ful ſodaynly hys herte gan colde coler fonde wythin broche creſeyde yaue morowe ſhe troye muſt nedes twyn remembraunce ſorow ſhe layde ayen fayth borow kepe aye nowe full wel wyſt hys lady na lenger tryſt goth hym home gan ful ſone ſende pandarus al thys newe chaunce broch tolde worde ende complaynyng hertes variaunce longe loue hys trouth penaūce deth without wordes ful faſte cryed reſte reſtore ſpake thus lady mine creſeyde wher ſayth beheſt loue trouth ſeyd diomede haue ye al feeſt ala wolde haue trowed leeſt ſens ye nolde trouth ſtonde ye thus nolde haue holden hōde ſhal nowe trowen othes mo ala neuer wolde haue wende er thys ye creſeide coulde haue chaunched ſo ne agylte done amys cruel wende herte ywys ſlee thus ala name trouthe nowe fordon al routhe none broche lyſte lete feffe wyth newe loue quod thylke broche wyth teeres wete yaue remembraunce none cauſe ala ne ye diſpyte eke ye mente al vtterly ſhewen entent ſe clene minde ye haue caſt ne may al worlde within mine herte fynde vnlonen quarter daye curſed tyme borne welaway done al thys wo endure yet loue beſt creature nowe god ꝙ ſende yet grace may meten diomede trewly yf haue myght ſpace yet ſhal make hope ſydes blede nowe god ꝙ oughteſt taken hede forthren trouth wronges punice nylt thou vengeaūce thys vice pandarus dremes tryſt blamed haſt wont arte ofte vpbreyde mayſt thou ſene thy ſelfe yf ye lyſt trew thy nece bryght creſeyde ſondry formes god wote ſeyde goddes ſhewen ioye tene ſlepe dreame nowe ſene certaynly withouten ſpeche hence forth ferforth may myne owne deth armes wol ſeche retche nat howe ſoone daye trewly creſeyde ſwete maye haue al might yſerued ye thus done haue deſerued pādarus al theſe thynges herde wyſte wel ſayd ſoth worde ayen hym anſwerde ſory frendes ſorowe ſhamed nece hath done amys ſtante aſtonyed theſe cauſes tway ſtyl ſtone worde ne coulde ſay laſte thus ſpake ſeyde brother dere may ſhuld ſayne hate ywys creſeyde god wote wol hate euermore thou beſoughteſt done yore hauyng vnto myne honour ne reſte ryght regarde dyd al leſte dyd aught myght lyken lefe treaſon nowe god wote ſorowe dredeleſſe hertes eaſe ryght fayne wold amend wyſt fro worlde almyghty god pray delyuer ſoone ſay great ſorow playnt troylus forthe courſe fortune aye gan holde creſeyde loueth ſonne tydeus troylus mote wepe care colde worlde ſo beholde eche eſtate lytle hertes reſte god leue v take beſte many cruel batayle drede troylus thys ylke noble knyght men may theſe olde bokes rede ſene hys knygthod great might dredeleſſe hys yre day nyght ful cruelly grekes aye abought alway moſt diomede ſought ofte tyme fynde mette bloody ſtrokes wordes greate aſſayeng howe ſpeares whette god wote wyth many cruel heate gan troylus vpon helme beate nathleſſe fortune nought ne wolde outher hande eyther dyen ſhulde yf ytaken write armes ylke worthy man wolde battaylles endyte writen fyrſt began hys loue haue ſayd hys worthy dedes ſo hem lyſte rede dare tel hem al yfere beſechyng euery lady bryght hewe euery gentle woman ſhe al creſeyde vntrewe gylt ye nat wroth ye may gylt bokes ſe gladder wol write yf leſt penelope trouth good alceſt ne ſay thys al theſe men moſte woman betrayed throuȝ falſe folke god yeue hē ſorow amē wyth great wyt ſubtylte betrayen thys meneth ſpeke effecte al pray beth ware men herkeneth ſay go lytle boke go lytel tragedy god thy maker yet er dye ſende might make ſome comedye lytle boke make thou none enuye ſubiecte ben vnto al poeſye kyſſe ſteppes wher yu ſeeſt pace vergil ouide homer lucan stace ſo great diuyrſite englyſhe writyng tonge pray god none miſwrite ne myſſe metre defaute tonge redde ſo thou el ſonge thou vnderſtonde god beſeche yet purpoſe rather ſpeche wrath began ſey troylus grekes boughten dere thouſandes hys handes maden dey wothouten pere saue hys tyme hector welaway ſaue onely goddes wyl diſpytouſly ſlough feirſe achyl whā ſlaine manere lyght goſte ful bliſfully went vp holowneſſe ſeuenth ſpere hys place letyng eueryche element ſawe wyth ful auyſement arratykes ſterres herkenyng armonye wyth ſownes ful heuenyſſe melodye downe thence faſte gan auyſe lytle ſpotte erth wyth ſee enbraced fully gan diſpiſe thys wretched worlde helde al vanite reſpecte playne felicite heuen aboue laſt ther ſlayn loking caſt ſelfe lough ryght wo hem wepten hys • erh ſo faſt dampned al werkes yt foloweth ſo blynde luſt whych maye nat laſt ſhulden al herte heuen caſt forth went ſhortly tel mercurie ſorted dwel fyne hathe lo troylus loue fyne hath al greate worthyneſſe fyne hath hys eſtate royal aboue ſuch fine luſt ſuch fyne hath nobleſſe fyne hath falſe worldes brotelneſſe thus began louyng creſeyde haue tolde thys wyſe deyde yonge freſhe folkes ſhe ye loue vp groweth age repayreth home worldly vanite hertes vp caſteth viſage thylke god ymage made thynketh ny fayre world yt paſſeth ſone floures fayre loueth yt right loue vpon croſſe ſoules bey fyrſt ſtarfe roſe ſyt heuen aboue nyl falſen wyght dare ſey wol herte al holy ley ſens beſt loue moſte meke nedeth fayned loues ſeke lo paynems curſed olde rytes lo al goddes may auayle lo thys wretched worldes appetytes lo fyne guerdon trauayle ioue apollo mar ſuch raſkayle lo forme olde clerkes ſpeche poetrye yf ye bokes ſeche moral gower thys boke directe philoſophical strode vouchſafe nede correcte benignityes zeles goode ſothfaſt chriſt yt ſtarfe roode wythal myne herte mercy euer pray lorde aright thus ſpeake ſay thou one two thre eterne lyue raigneſt aye thre two one vncircumſcript mayſt circumſcryue v viſible inuiſible fone defende thy mercy euerychone make v ieſus thy mercy digne loue mayde mother thyne benigne ¶thus endeth fyfth boke laſt troylus foloweth pyteful dolorous teſtament fayre creſeyde teſtament creſeyde adolye ſeaſonne tyll careful dyte shulde coreſponde equiuolent right ſo whā began write thys tragedy yt weder ryght feruent whan aries myddes lent ſhowres hayle fro north deſcende ſcantly fro colde miȝt defende yet neuertheles wythin myne orature ſtode whā titan beames bright withdrawen downe ſcyled vnder cure fayre venus beautye nyght vprayſe ſet vnto weſt ful ryght golden face oppoſitiowne god phebus directe diſcendinge downe throuȝout ye glaſſe bemes braſt ſo fayre might ſe euery ſyde northern wynde purifyed ayre ſhedde myſty cloudes fro ſkye froſte freſed blaſtes bytterly fro pole artike come whiſking loud ſhyll cauſed remoue ayenſt wyll truſted venus loues quene ſomtyme hyght obedience ſaded hert loue ſhe wold make grene therupon humble reuerence thought pray hye magnifycence great colde letted chambre fyre pa though loue hote yet man age kyndleth nat ſo ſoone youtheed blode flowyng rage olde corage dul deed fyre outward beeſt remeed helpe phiſyke ye nature fayled experte haue aſſayed made fyre beaked toke drinke ſpirites conforte armed wel fro colde therout cut wynter night make ſhorte toke queare lefte al ſporte written worthy chaucer glorious fayre creſeyde luſty troylus founde diomede receyued lady bryght hewe troylus nere wytte abrede wepte ſore wyth viſage pale hewe wanhope teares gan renewe whyle eſperous reioyſed agayne thus ioy liued paine beheſt great comfortynge truſting troy yt ſhe wolde make retour deſyred moſt al erthly thynge ſhe onely paramoure whan ſaw paſſed day hour gayncome ſorowe oppreſſe woful herte care heuyneſſe diſtreſſe nedeth reherſe worthy chaucer ſame boke goodly termes ioly verſe compyled hath care wyl loke breake ſlepe another queare toke whych founde fatal deſteny fayre creſeyde ended wretchedly wote al chaucer wrote trew wotte yf narration authoryzed forged newe ſome poete hys inuention made reporte lamentation woful ende thys luſty creſeyde diſtreſſe ſhe ſhe deyde whan diomede al appetyte fulfylled thys fayre lady vpon another ſette al delyte ſende lybel repudy excluded fro company deſolate ſhe walked vp downe ſome men ſaine courte comune fayre creſeyde floure per ſe troy grece thou fortunate chaunge fylth al thy femynite fleſhly luſte ſo maculate go among grekes early late giglotlyke taking thy ſoule pleaſaunce haue pyte ſhulde fal ſuch miſchaunce yet neuertheleſſe euer mē deme ſay ſcornful langage thy brutelneſſe ſhal excuſe ferforth may thy womanheed thy wiſedome fayrneſſe fortune hath put ſuch diſtreſſe pleaſed nothing gylte wicked langage ſpilte thys fayre lady thys wiſe deſtitute al comforte conſolation right priuely wythout felowſhyp refute diſheuelde paſſed town myle two vnto manſioun bylded ful gay father calcas thā amōge grekes dwelling whan ſawe cauſe enquyre cōmyng ſhe ſayd ſyghyng ful ſore fro diomede goten deſyre wore wery wolde ꝙ calcas doughter wepe thou therfore parauenture al cometh beſt welcome thou arte ful dere geſt thys olde calcas lawe tho keper temple preeſt venus ſonne cupido honoured hys chambre neſt creſeyde wt bale enewed breſt vſed paſſe prayer ſay whyle laſt vpon ſolempne day cuſtome people ferre nere noone vnto temple went ſacrifyce deuoute theyr manere ſtyl creſeyde heuy entent church wolde ſelfe preſent gyuyng people demyng expulſe fro diomede kyng paſſed aſecrete oratore ſhe myght wepe woful deſteny behynde backe ſhe cloſed faſt dore knee bare fel downe hye vpon venus cupide angerly cryed ſayd thys wyſe ala euer made ſacrifyce ye gaue one diuyne reſponſayle ſhulde floure loue troy made vnworthy outwayle al care tranſlated ioye ſhal gyde ſhal cōuoy syth fro diomede noble troylus clene excluded abiecte odious falſe cupyde none wyte thou thy mother loue blynd goddace ye cauſed vnderſtande alway trow ſeede loue ſowem face aye grewe grene throuȝ ſouple grace nowe ala yt ſeed wyth froſt ſlayne fro louers lefte al forlayne whan thys ſayd downe extaſy rauyſhed ſprite dreame ſhe fel apparaunce herde ſhe dyd lye cupide kyng tynkyng ſyluer bel men myght fro heuen hel whoſe ſounde cupide aperes ſeuē planet diſcendyng fro ſperes hath power thyng generable rule ſtere great influence weder wynde courſe variable fyrſte al saturne gaue hys ſentence gaue cupide lytle reuerence boyſtous churle hys manere came crabbedly wyth auſtryne loke chere face frounced lere lyke ye leed hys teth chattred ſheuered wyth chyn eyen drouped hole ſonken hys heed noſe myldrop faſt gan ryn lyppes blo chekes leaue thyn yſe yekels yt fro hys heer downe honge wonder great ſpeare longe attour hys belte lyarte locke lay feltred vnfayre ouerfret wyth froſtes hore garment gate fal gay gray widdred wede fro hī ye winde wore bouſtous bow within hande bore vnder gyrdel faſhe felone flayns feddred yſe heeded wyth holſtayns iupiter ryght fayre amiable god ſterres fyrmament norice al thyng generable fro hys father saturne farre different burly face browes bryght brent vpon hys heed garlonde wonder gaye floures fayre ben maye voice clere chriſtal eien golddē wier ſo glettring heare garmente gyte ful gay grene wyth golden lyſtes gylte euery geare burly brande aboute myddle beare ryght hande groundē ſpere hys father wrath fro v bere next came mar god yre ſtryfe debate diſcentioun chyde fyght feirſe fyre harde harneſſe hewmōde habergioun haunch rouſty fel fauchoun hande rouſty ſworde writhyng face many angry worde shaking brande befor cupide come reed viſage griſely glowyng eyen mouth blubber ſtode fome lyke boore whettinge tuſkes keyn right tulſure lyke temperaunce tene horne blew wt many bouſtous bragge al world wt warre hath made wagge thā fayre phebus lanterne lāpe lyght man beeſt frute floriſhyng tender norice banyſher nyght worlde cauſyng mouyng influence lyfe al erthly thyng without cōforte force nought muſt go dye yt al world hath wrought kyng royal rode vpon chare phiton ſōtyme gyded vnright bryghtneſſe hys face whā bare non might beholde perſing ſight golden carte firy beames bright foure yoked ſtedes ful different hewe bayt tyring ſperes drew firſt ſord wt mane reed roſe called eoye orient ſeconde ſtede name hight ethyoſe whitely pale ſome dele aſcendent thyrde peroſe right hote eke feruent fourth blacke called phelologee rolleth phebus downe ſee venus preſent goddes gay ſonnes quarel defende make owne complaynt cladde nyce aray one halfe grene thother halfe ſable blake white heer golde kembet ſhed bake face ſemed great variaunce whyle parfite trouth whyles incōſtaunce vnder ſmylyng ſhe diſſimulate prouocatyue blynkes amorous ſodaynly chaunged alterate angry ſerpent venomous ryght pungityue wordes odious thus variaūt ſhe lyſt take kepe one eye laugh ye wepe tokenyng al fleſſhly paramour venus hath rule gouernaunce ſomtyme ſwete ſomtyme bytter ſour ryght vnſtable full variaunce mynged careful ioy falſe pleaſaūce hote colde blythe full wo grene lefe widred ago boke hand come mercurious ryght eloquent full rethorye polyte termes delicious penne ynke report readye settyng ſonges ſyngen merely hode red hecled attour crown lyke tyll poete olde faſſyoun bore bare fyne electuares ſugred ſyropes digeſtion spyces belongyng potiquares many holſome ſwete confectioun doctor phiſyke cled ſcarlet gowne furred wele ſuch one ought honeſt good nat worde couth lye next come lady synthia laſt al ſwyfteſt ſpere colour blacke buſked horne twa nyght ſhe lyſteth beſt tapere hawe leed colour nothyng clere al light ſhe boroweth brother tytan ſelf ſhe hath none gyte gray full ſpottes blak breeſt churle paynted full euen bearyng buſh thornes backe theft miȝt clime ner ye heuē thus whā gadred wer ye goddes ſeuē mercurius choſed one aſſent foreſpeker parlyment ben lykyng facondetonge termes exquiſyte rethorike practyke myght lere brefe ſermon preignaūt ſentence write cupide valyng cappe alyte sper cauſe vacatioun anon ſhewed ententioun lo ꝙ cupide wol blaſpheme ye name owne god eyther worde dede goddes doth loſſe ſhame ſhulde haue bytter paynes mede ſay yonder wretche creſeyde thrugh ſōtyme flour loue mother ſhe ſtatelye gan reproue saying great infelicitie cauſe mother venus called blynde goddes myght nat ſe ſclaunder defame iniurious thus lyuyng vnclene lecherous wolde retort mother whō ſhewed grace aboue al ſyth ye al ſeuen delicate participant deuyne ſapience great iniure done hye eſtate thīk wt payn ſhulde make recōpence neuer goddes done ſuch violence well ſelfe ſaye therfore go helpe reuenge praye mercurius cupide gaue anſwere ſayd ſyr kyng coūſayle ye referre hyeſt planet take loweſt degree payne creſeyde modefye god saturne hym take synthia cōtent ꝙ take twa thus proceded saturne moone whan matter rypely degeſt deſpyte cupid ſhe done venus open manifeſt al lyfe payne oppreſt turmēt ſore ſykneſſe incurable louers abhominable doleful ſentēce saturne toke hand paſſed wher careful creſeyd lay heed layde froſty wande lawfully wyſe ſay thy great fayrneſſe thy beauty gay thy wanton blood eke thy golden exclude fro euermeere chaunge thy myrth melancoly mother penſyueneſſe thy moyſter thy hete colde drye thy inſolence thy play thy wantōneſſe great diſeaſe thy pompe thy rycheſſe mortal nede great penuritie thou ſuffre ſhalt beggar dye cruell saturne frowarde angrye harde thy dome malicyous fayr creſeyd haſt thou mercye ſo ſwete gentle amorous withdrawe thy ſentence gracyous thou wer neuer ſo ſheweth thy dede wrekeful ſentence gyuen creſeyd thā synthia whan saturne paſt away ſeate diſcended downe belyue red byll creſeyde ſhe lay conteynyng ſentence diffynityue fro heale body depryue thy ſykneſſe ſhalbe recure dolour thy dayes endure thy chriſtal eyen menged wt blood make thy voyce ſo clere vnpleſaunt heer hace thy luſty lere ouerſpred wt ſpottes blake lumpes hawe apering thy face wher thou comeſt eche man ſhal flye ye place thus ſhalt thou go beggyng fro houſe houſe cup clapper lyke lazarous dooly dreame vgly viſioun brought tyll ende creſeyd fro awoke court conuocatioun vanyſhed away roſe ſhe vp toke poliſhed glaſſe ſhadowe couth loke whā ſhe ſawe vyſage ſo deformate ſhe hert wo ne wyt god wate wepyng full ſore lo ꝙ ſhe frowarde langage moue ſtere crabbed goddes ſo ſene blaſphemyng haue bought full dere erthly ioye myrth ſet arere ala day ala woful tyde whan began goddes chyde ſayd childe came fro hal warne creſeyde ſupper redy fyrſt knocked dore eft couth cal madam father byddeth com ī hy hath maruayl ſo longe groufe ye lye ſayth beedes beth longe ſōdele goddes wote al entent ful wele quod ſhe fayr chylde go father dere pray hym come ſpeke anon ſo dyd ſayd doughter chere ala ꝙ ſhe father myrth gone ſo ꝙ ſhe al expone haue told vengeaūce weake treſpaſſe cupide couth take loked vgly leper face white lely floute wryngyng handes ofttymes ſayd ala hee lyued ſe woful houre knewe wel ther ſucour ſykneſſe yu doubled payne thus ther care ynowe betwyxe hem twayne whā togyther mourned full lange ꝙ creſeyde father wolde kende therfore ſecrete wyſe ye let gange hoſpitall townes ende thyder ſom meat charitie ſende lyue vpon al myrth earth fro gone ſuche wicked werth whan mantell beuer hat cuppe clapper wonder priuely opened ſecrete gate thereat conueyde man ſhulde eſpye vylage halfe myle therby delyuered ſpyttel houſe dayly ſende parte almous knewe wel ſom knowlege bicauſe ſhe ſo deforma • e byles blake ouerſpred viſage fayre colour faded alterate yet preſumed hye regrate ſtyll mournyng ſhe noble kyn better wyll toke inne day paſſed phebus wēt vnto reſt cloudes blacke euery ſyde al ſky god wote yf creſede ſorowfull geſt seing vncouth fare herbory meate drynke ſhe dreſſed lye darke corner houſe alone wyſe wepynge ſhe made mone ¶here foloweth complaynt creſeyde sop ſorowe ſonken care caytife creſeyd euermare gone thy ioye al thy myrth erth blytheneſſe nowe art thou blacke bare ſalue may helpe thy ſare fell thy fortune wycked thy werth thy blyſſe banyſſhed thy bale vnberde vnder great god yf grauen ware men grece ne yet troye myght herde thy chambre wantonly beſene burly bed banker brouded bene spyces wyne thy collatioun cuppes al golde ſyluer ſhene thy ſwete meates ſerued plate clene ſauery ſauce good facioun thy gay garmētes wt many goodly goune thy pleſaūt laune pynned wt golden pene al arere thy great royall renoune thy gardeyne thy greces gay freſhe floures yu quene floraye paynted pleſauntly euery pane thou wont ful merily may walke take dewe day merie mauyſe many one ladyes fayre carollyng gone ſe royall renkes raye leper loge take thy goodly bour thy bed take nowe bonche ſtro wayled wyne meetes thou tho take mouled breed pyrat ſyder ſoure cuppe clapper al ago clere voyce courtly carollynge ranke roke ful hidous heer hace deformed fygure face loke people hath lykyng soſped ſyght ſay ſore ſyghinge lying amonge leper folke ala ladyes fayre troy grece attende freyle fortune myne infelicitie great myſchef nomā amend mynde myrrour make peraduenture ye al might may come ye ſame end el worſe yf worſe may beware therfore aproches nere ende nouȝt fayrneſſe fading floure nouȝt famous laude hye honour wynde inflate men eares roſyng red rotyng ſhal retour example make memore ſuch thīges woful witnes beares welth erth wynd away weares beware therfore aprocheth nere hour thus chydyng drery deſtiny wepyng ſhe woke ye nyght fro ende ende vayne dole careful crye miȝt remedy ne yet mourning mēd leper lady roſe wende ſayd ſpurneſt thou agayne ye wal ſlee thy ſelfe mend nothynge sith thy weping doubleth thy wo counſayle make vertue nede go lerne clap thy clapper fro lerne lawe leper lede ther bote forth wt thā ſhe yede fro place place whyle colde hūgre ſore compelled ranke beggore ſame tyme troy garnyſoun cheftayne worthye troylus thrugh ieopardy war ſtrykē knyghtes grece nōbre maruaylous great triumph laude victorious agayne troy ryght royally rode way wher creſeyde wt leper ſtode seing company come ſteuē gaue crye ſhoke cup good ſpede worthy lordes goddes loue heauen v leper parte almeſſe dede crye noble troylus toke hede hauyng pytie nere place gan paſſe wher creſeyd ſat nat wetīg ſhe vpon hym ſhe keſt vp eyen wt blynke come intyl thought ſometyme face ſeyn ſhe ſuch plite knew hernouȝt yet loke mynde brouȝt ſwete vyſage amorous blenkynge fayre creſeyd ſōtyme owne derling wonder ſuppoſe mynde toke fygure ſo ſoone lo ydoll thynge caſe may depe emprynted fantaſy defendeth wyttes outwardly ſo appereth forme lyke eſtate within mynde figurate ſpark loue tyl hert couth ſprīg kyndeled body fyre hote feuer ſwet trymblynge toke whyle redy expyre beare ſhylde breeſt begon tyre within whyle chaunged manye hewe neuertheleſſe nat one another knewe knyghtly pytie memoriel fayr creſeyd gyrdle gan take purſe golde many gay iewel ye ſkyrt creſeyd downe ſhake thā rode awaye nat worde ſpake penſife hert whyle came ye towne great care oftſith almoſt fel downe lepre folke creſeyde couth drawe ſe equall diſtributioun ye almous whan golde ſaw eche one priuely rowne ſayd lorde hath affectioun euer vnto lazarous v knowe almous lorde ꝙ ſhe haue ye fele doth v ſo great humanitie yes ꝙ lepre man knowe wele syr troylus knyght gentle free whan creſeyde vnderſtode styffer thā ſtele ſtert bytter ſtound thrughout hert fyl ye groūd whan ſhe ouercom ſyghyng ſore ſad many carefull crye colde atone breſt ſtormy ſtoūdes ſtad wrapped wo wretch fulwyl one fel ſwoun ful oft ſhe wolde f • ne euer ſwouning cryed ſhe chus falſe creſeyd true knyght troylus thy loue thy laude thy gentylneſſe compted ſmal proſperitie effated wantonneſſe clambe vpon fykel whele ſo hye fayth loue promoted thy ſelfe fekle furyous falſe creſeyde true knyght troylus loue thou kept countenaunce honeſt chaſte conuerſatioun woman protectour defence thou helped theyr opynioun mynde fleſhly foule affectioun enclyned luſtes lecherous fye falſe creſeyde true knyght troylus louers beware take good hede yt ye loue whan ye ſuffre payne let wyt ther right fewe thrughout whō ye may truſt haue true loue agayne proue whā ye wol labour vayne therfore rede ye take ye fynde ſad wethercock wynd bycauſe knowe great vnſtableneſſe bryttell glaſſe vnto ſelfe ſay truſtyng great brutelneſſe inconſtaunt vntrue faye thouȝ ſom true wot riȝt fewe ar fyndeth truthe let hym lady •• ſe none ſelfe woll accuſe whan ſayd wt paper ſhe ſat doun maner made teſtament bequeth corſe caryoun wormes toodes rent cup clapper myne ornament al gold theſe leper folke ſhal haue whan deed bury graue royal rynge ſet rubye red troylus dowry ſende hym agayne leaue whā deed make careful deth vnto kende thus conclude ſhortly make ende ſprit leue diane ſhe dwels walke wt waſte wodes welles diomede thou haſt broche belt troylus gaue tokenyng true loue wt word ſhe ſwelt ſoone leper man toke rynge buryed withouten tarying troylus forth rynge bare creſeyde deth declare whan herde great infirmitie legacy lamentatioun ſhe ended ſuche pouertie ſwelt wo fell downe ſwoun ſorowe hert braſt boun syghyng full ſadly ſayde nomore vntrue wo therfore som ſaith made tomb marble gray wrote name ſuperſcription layde graue ſhe laye golden letter cōtaynynge reaſoun lo fayre ladyes creſeyde troy ye toune somtyme cōpted floure womanhed vnder ſtone late leper lyeth deed worthy woman balade ſhort made worſhyp inſtruction charitie monyſh exhorte mynge nat loue falſe diſception beare mynde ſore concluſion fayre creſeyde haue ſayde syth ſhe deed ſpeke nomore ¶thus endeth piteful dolorous teſtament fayre creſeyde hereafter foloweth legende good woman ¶the legende good woman thouſande tymes haue herde men tel ioye heuen payne hel accorde wel ſo natheleſſe yet wot wele alſo ny none dwelling countrie eyther hath heuen hel ybe ne may none wayes wytten herde ſayd founde wrytten aſſaye maye man preue god forbede men ſhulde leue well thynge han ſene wt eye men ſhall nat wenen euery thynge lye yf hym ſelfe ſeeth el doth god wot thyng neuer leſſe ſoth though euery wyght ne maye nat yſe bernarde monke ne ſaugh al parde mote bokes fynde thrugh ye old thinges ben minde doctryne theſe olde wyſe yeue credence euery ſkylfull wyſe tellen theſe olde appreued ſtories holyneſſe reygnes victory loue hate ſondry thynges may nat make reherſynges yf olde bokes awaye ylorne remembraunce kay wel ought v honouren beleue theſe bokes han non preue though yt lyte bokes rede delyte hem yeue fayth ful credence myne hert haue ben reuerence hertely game none fro bokes maketh gone ſeldom holy day saue certaynly whā yt moneth may comen yt foules ſynge floures gynnen ſprynge farewell boke deuotioun haue eke conditioun floures mede loue moſt theſe floures white red yt men callen dayeſies toune hem haue ſo great affectioun ſayd erſt whan comen may bed daweth day nam vp walkyng mede ſeen floure ayenſt ſunne ſprede whan vp ryſeth early morowe blyſful ſyght ſoftneth al ſorowe glad whan haue preſence done reuerence ſhe floures floure fulfylled al vertue honour euer ylyke fayre freſh hewe euer loue euer ylke newe euer ſhal tyl myne hert dye ſwere nat wol nat lye loued wyght hoter lyue whan eue renne blythe aſſoone euer ſunne gynneth weſt ſene flour woll go reſt feare nyght ſo hateth ſhe darkneſſe chere plainly ſpred brightneſſe ſunne woll vncloſe ala ne englyſhe ryme proſe suffiſaunt floure preyſe aryght helpeth ye han connynge myght ye louers make ſentement caſe ought ye diligent forthren ſomwhat labour whether ye ben wt leſe floure wel wot ye han beforne makyng ropen lad away corne come glenyng ful glad yf may fynde ere goodly worde ye han lefte though happen reherſen efte ye han freſh ſonges ſayde forbereth beth nat euyll apayde syth ye ſe honoure loue eke ſeruyce floure yt ſerue haue wyt myght clereneſſe lyght darke world wint ledeth hert within ſorowful breſt dredeth loueth ſo ſore yt ye ben verely maſtres wyt nothyng word workes knytte ſo bond harpe obeyeth ye hond make ſowne fyngerynge ryght ſo mowe ye hert brynge voyce ryght lyſt laugh payn ye guyde lady ſouerayne myne erthly god call thys werke ſorowes wherfore ſpake yeue credence olde ſtoryes done hem reuerence men muſten thynge beleue men may ſene eye el preue ſhall ſeyne ſe tyme maye one ſpeake ryme beſy gooſt thurſteth alway newe ſene hys floure ſo yōge ſo freſh hewe conſtrayned wyth ſo gredy deſyre myne herte fele yet fyre made ryſe er daye thys nowe ye fyrſt morow may wyth dredfull herte glad deuocion ben reſurrection floure ſhulde vncloſe agayne ſunne roſe reed roſe breſt beeſt daye angenores doughter ladde away downe knee anone ryght ſet coulde thys freſhe floure gret knelynge alwaye tyll vncloſed vpon ſmall ſofte ſwete gras wt floures ſwete embrouded ſuche ſwetneſſe ſuche adour ouer ſpeke gūme herbe tre comparyſon may none ymaked ſurmounteth playnly odoures ryche beautye floures forgotten earth hys poore eſtate wynter hym naked made mate wyth hys ſworde cold ſo ſore greued nowe hath atēpre ſunne releued naked clad newe agayne ſmale foules ceaſon fayne panter nette ben ſeaped vpon fouler hem made awhaped wynter deſtroyed brood diſpite hem thought dyd hem good ſynge hym ſonge dyſpyſe foule chorle hys couetyſe hem betrayed wyth hys ſophiſtrye thys ſonge fouler defye hys crafte ſome ſongen clere layes loue ioye worſhyppyng prayſynge make newe blyſfull ſomers ſake vpon braunches full bloſmes ſofte delyte turned hem full ofte ſongen bleſſed ſaynt valentyne hys daye cheſe myne wythouten repentynge myne herte ſwete therwythall beckes gonnen mete yeldynge honoure humble obeyſaunce loue dydden obſeruaunce longeth vnto loue nature conſtrewe lyſt cure tho done vnkyndneſſe doth tidyfe newe fangelneſſe beſought mercy treſpaſynge humbly ſonge repentynge ſworen bloſomes trewe make wolde vpon hem rewe laſt maden accorde al foūde daūger tyme lorde yet pyte hys ſtrōge gentyl myght forgaue made mercy paſſen ryght innocence ruled curteſye ne cleape innocence folye ne falſe pyte vertue meane etycke ſayeth ſuche maner meane thus theſe foules voyde malyce acordeden loue laften vyce hate ſonge one accorde welcome ſommer gouernour lorde zephirus flora gentelly yaue floures ſofte tenderly ſwote brethe made hem ſprede god goddeſſe floury mede whych thought myght day day dwellen alway ioly monthe may wythouten ſlepe wythoutē meate drynke adowne full ſoftly gan ſynke leanynge elbowe ſyde longe day ſhope abyde nothynge el ſhall lye loke vpon deyſye well reaſon men call maye dayeſy el eye daye empryce floure floures praye god fayre mote ſhe fall louen floures ſake natheleſſe ne wene make prayſynge floure agayne leefe nomore corne agayne ſheefe ny leuer none ne lother nam wyth holden yet wyth neuer nother ne ſerueth leefe ne ye floure well brouken ſeruyce laboure thys thynge another tonne olde ſtorye er ſuch thynge begonne yt ſunne ſouth gan weſt thys floure gan cloſe gan reſt derknes ye nyght ye whiche ſhe dredde home myn houſe ful ſwyftly ſpedde gon reſte erly ryſe ſene flour ſprede deuyſe lytell herber haue benched turues freſhe ygraue bade men ſhulde couche make deyntie newe ſommers ſake bade hem ſtrawen floures bedde whan layde myn eyen hedde fell ſlepe ſlepte houre two mette howe lay medowe tho ſene floure loue ſo drede ferre came walkyng mede god loue hys hande quene ſhe cladde royall habyte grene fret golde ſhe next heere vpon whyte crowne ſhe beere wyth florouns ſmall ſhall nat lye worlde ryght dayeſye ycrowned wyth whyte leaues lyte florouns corown whyte perle fyne orientall whyte corowne ymaked white corowne aboue ye grene made lyke dayeſye ſeme conſydred eke fret golde aboue iclothed mighty god loue ſylke embrouded full grene greues whiche fret reed roſe leues freſheſt ſens ye worlde fyrſt begōne gylte heere corowned ſonne ſtede golde heuyneſſe weight therwith thouȝt face ſhone ſo bright well vnnethes might beholde hāde thouȝt ſaw holde two firy dartes gledes rede angelyke wynges ſawe ſprede men ſayne blynde algate thought myght ſe ſternely gan beholde lokyng dothe myn herte colde hande helde noble quene crowned wyth whyte clothed al grene womanly ſo benygne ſo meke world though yt men wold ſeke halfe beautie ſhulde nat fynde creature formed kynde therfore may ſayne thynketh ſonge prayſyng lady fre hyde abſolon thy gylte treſſes clere heſter lay thou thy mekeneſſe al adoun hyde ionathas al thy frendely manere penelopee marcia catoun make wyfehode comparyſoun hyde ye beauty ſoude heleyne lady cometh al may diſtayne thy fayre body let nat apere lauyne thou lucrece rome toun polixene boughten loue ſo dere cleopatra thy paſſyoun hyde ye trouthe loue renoun thou tiſbe haſt loue ſuch payne lady cometh may diſtayne hero dido laodomia yfere phillis hangyng demophoun canace eſpyed thy chere hipſyphile betrayed iaſoun maketh trouth neytherboſte ne ſoun hypermiſtre ariadne ye twayne lady cometh thys may diſtayne ¶this balade may full well yſongen haue ſayd erſt lady fre certaynly theſe mowe nat ſuffyſe apperen wyth lady wyſe ſunne woll fyre diſtayne paſſeth lady ſouerayne ſo good ſo fayre ſo debonayre pray god euer fall fayre nad comforte ben preſence ben deed wythouten defence drede loues wordes chere whan tyme herafter ye ſhall behynde god loue vpon grene ſawe comyng ladyes nynetene royall habyt full eaſy pace hem came woman ſuche trace ſens god adam made erthe thyrde parte mankynde ferthe ne wende nat poſſibylyte euer thys wyde worlde ybe trewe loue theſe woman echon whether yt wōder thing non right anon gonne eſpye floure whych clepe dayeſye full ſodaynly ſtynten one kneled downe none ſongen voyce heale honour trouthe womanhede flour beareth alder priſe fyguryng whyte corowne beareth wytneſſyng worde acompas enuyroun ſytten hem full ſoftely adown firſt ſate god loue ſythe hys quene whyte corowne clad greue ſythen remenaunt eſtate full curteſly ne nat worde ſpoken place moūtenaūce furlong way ſpace knelyng floure good entente abode knowen people mente ſtyll ſtone tyll laſte god loue eyen caſte ſaid kneleth anſwerde vnto hys aſkyng whan herde ſayd ſyr come hym nere ſalued hym▪ ꝙ doeſt thou nygh myne owne floure ſo boldely better worthy trewly worme nighen nere floure thā thou ſir ꝙ lyke thou ꝙ arte therto nothyng able relyke digne delytable thou foe folke werreyeſt myne olde ſeruauntes thou miſſayeſt hyndreſt hem wyth thy tranſlation letteſt folke deuocion ſerue holdeſt folye ſerue loue thou mayeſt nat denye playne text wythouten nede gloſe thou haſt tranſlated romaūt ye roſe hereſye ayenſt lawe makeſt wyſe folke fro withdrawe creſeyde thou haſt ſayd lyſte maketh men woman leſſe tryſte ben trewe euer ſtele thyn anſwere auyſe ryght wele though thou renyed haſte lay wretch haue done many day ſeynt venus mother thou lyue thou ſhalt repenten cruelly ſhall wel ſene tho ſpake lady clothed al grene ſayd god ryght curteſye ye mote herken yf replye agaynſt thys ye haue meued god ne ſhulde nat thus agreued hys deyte ſhall ſtable therto gracious merciable yf ye nere god knowen might tellen ſhall thys man may falſely ben accuſed ryght hym ought ben excuſed court many loſengeour many queynt toteler accuſour tabouren eares many ſoun ryght ymaginatioun haue daliaunce enuy theſe ben cauſes ſhall lye enuy lauender court alwaye ſhe ne parteth neyther nyght ne daye houſe ceſar thus ſayeth dant ſo goeth algate ſhe wol want eke perauenter thys man nyce myght done geſſynge malyce vſeth thynges make recketh nought mater take hym boden make thylke twey ſome perſone durſt wythſey hym repenteth vtterly thys ne hath done ſo greuouſly amys tranſlaten olde clerkes wrytten though malyce wold endytten dyſpyte loue hym ſelfe wrought ſhuld riȝtwiſe lord haue ī thought lyke tyrauntes lombardy haue rewarde tyranny kynge lorde naturell hym ought tyraunt ne cruell fermour done harme muſt thynke hys liege man hys treaſour hys golde cofre thys ſentence philoſophre kynge kepe hys liege iuſtyce wythouten doute hys offyce wol kepe hys lordes degre ryght ſkyll enhaunced honoured moſte dere ben half goddes world yet mote done ryght pore ryche eſtate ylyche haue poore folke compaſſyon lo gentell kynde lyon flye offendeth hym byteth wyth hys tayle awaye flye ſmyteth eaſely hys gentrye hym deyneth wreke hym flye doth curre el another beeſt noble corage ought ben areeſt wayen euery thynge equite euer haue regarde vnto owne degre ſyr mayſtrye lorde dampne mā without anſwere word lorde full foule vſe ſo may nat excuſe aſketh mercy dredefull herte profereth hym right hys bare ſherte ben ryght owne iugement ought god ſhorte auyſement conſydre owne honour treſpace ſythe cauſe dethe lyeth thys cace ought ben lightlyer mercyable leteth ire bethe ſomwhat tretable man hath ſerued hys connynges forthred wel law makinges nat well endyte yet hath made leude folke delyte ſerue preyſyng name made boke yt hight houſe fame eke dethe blaunche ducheſſe parlyment foules geſſe loue palamon arcyte thebe though ſtorie knowē lyte many hympne holydaies hyghten balades roundel virelayes ſpeke holyneſſe hath proſe tranſlated boece made lyfe alſo ſaynt cecyle made alſo gone great whyle origenes vpon maudelayne hym ought nowe haue leſſe payne hath made many ley many thyng nowe ye god eke kyng alceſte whylom quene trace aſke man right grace ye hym neuer hurte hys lyue ſhall ſwearen blyue ſhall neuer agylten thys wyſe ſhall maken ye woll deuyſe woman trewe louyng lyfe ſo ye woll mayden wyfe forthren moche miſſeyde roſe el creſeyde god loue anſwerd thus anon madame ꝙ ſo longe agon knewe ſo charitable trew neuer yet ſens worlde new ne founde better none ye woll ſaue degree may wol nat werne requeſt lyth dothe wyth hym leſt foryeue withouten lenger ſpace ſo yeueth yefte dothe grace tyme hys thanke ſhall demeth ye ſhall therfore go thanke nowe lady ꝙ roſe ſette kne ſayd thus madame god aboue yelde god loue haue maked hys wrathe foryeue grace ſo longe lyue may knowe ſothly ye haue holpen put degre trewly wende caas nought haue agylte ne done loue treſpas trewe man withouten drede hath nat parten wyth theues dede ne trewe louer ought nat blame though ſpeke falſe louer ſōe ſhame ought rather holde creſeyde wrote tolde roſe ſo myne authour ment al gate god wotte myne entent forthren trouth loue cheryce ben ware fro falſneſſe fro vyce whiche enſample menyng ſhe anſwerd let thyne arguyng loue ne woll nat countrepleted right ne wronge lerne thou haſte thy grace holde ye right therto wol ſayn penaunce yu ſhalt thy treſpace vnderſtonde thou ſhalt yt thou lyueſt yereby yere moſte partie thy tyme ſpende makyng gloriouſe legende good woman maydens wyues trewe louyng lyues tell falſe men hem betrayen lyfe ne nat aſſayen howe many woman may done ſhame worlde hold game though lyke nat louer speke wel loue penaunce yeue god loue ſhall ſo praye ſhal charge ſeruātes way fortheren well thy labour quyte go nowe thy way penaunce lyte whā boke made yeue ye quene behalfe eltham shene god loue gan ſmyle ſayd woſt thou ꝙ wher wyfe mayde quene counteſſe degre hath ſo lytell penaunce yeuen haſte deſerued ſore ſmerte pyte renneth ſone gentyll herte mayſt yu ſene ſhe kytheth ſhe anſwerde nay ſyr ſo haue blys ſe well ſhe good trewe tale myne hoode ꝙ loue thou knoweſt well parde ſo thou auyſe haſte thou nat booke thy cheſte great goodneſſe quene alceſte turned dayeſye huſbonde cheſe dye eke gone hell rather hercules reſcued parde brought hell agayne blys anſwerde agayne ſayd yes nowe knowe thys good alceſte dayeſye myne owne hertes reſte nowe fele wel goodneſſe wyfe bothe dethe lyfe great bountie doubleth renoun well hath ſhe quyt myne affectioun haue floure dayeſye wonder though ioue ſtellyfye telleth agaton great goodneſſe whyte corowne beareth wytneſſe alſo many vertues ſhe ſmall florouns corowne remembraunce honour cibylla made dayeſy flour crowned wyth white men may ſe mar yaue corown reed parde ſtede ruby ſet amonge white therwith quene wox red ſhāe lyte whan ſhe prayſed ſo preſence ſayd loue full great neglygence ylke tyme thou made hyde abſolon thy treſſes balade thou forgete thy ſonge ſette sythe thou arte ſo greatly dette woſt well kalender ſhe woman wol louer ſhe taught crafte trewe louyng namely wyfehode lyueng boundes ſhe ought kepe thy lytell wytte thylke tyme ſlepe nowe charge vpon thy lyfe thy legend thou make wyfe whan thou haſte ſmale ymade fare nowe well charge er go thus moche wol tell ne ſhall trewe louer come hell theſe ladyes ſyttynge rowe ben balade yf thou conſt hem knowe thy bokes thou ſhalt hem fynde haue hem nowe thy legende mynde meane hem ben thy knowyng ben twenty thouſande mo ſyttyng thou knoweſt good woman trewe loue aught may befall make metre hem leſt mote gon home ſunne draweth weſt paradys wyth companye ſerue alway freſhe dayeſye cleopatra woll thou begynne ſo forthe loue ſo ſhalt thou wynne let ſe nowe man louer wol done ſo ſtronge payne loue ſhe wote wel thou mayſte nat al ryme ſuche louers dyd tyme longe reden suffyſeth thou make thys manere thou reherce lyfe great theſe olde authours lyſten treate ſo ſhall ſo many ſtorye tel sey ſhortely ſhall longe dwel worde bokes gan take ryght thus legende gan make ¶thus endeth prologue ¶here begynneth legende cleopatra quene egypt dethe ptholome kyng al egipt gouernyng reigned hys quene cleopatra tyl tyme byfell ſuche caas rome ſent ſenatour conqueren realmes honour vnto towne rome vſaunce haue worlde obeyſaunce ſothe ſay antonius name fyl fortune hym ought ſhame whan fallen proſperyte rebell vnto towne rome ouer thys ſuſter ceſare lefte falſly er ſhe ware wolde algates han another wyfe toke rome ceſar ſtryfe natheleſſe ſothe ylke ſenatour ful worthy gentyll werryour hys dethe full great domage loue brought mā ſuch rage ſo narowe bounden hys laas loue cleopatra worlde ſette value hym thouȝt ther nothyng ſo due cleopatra loue ſerue hym thought armes ſterue defence right noble quene eke loued ſo knight deſerte chyualrye certaynly yf bookes lye perſon gentylneſſe diſcretion hardyneſſe worthy wight lyuen may ſhe fayre roſe may maken ſhorte beſte woxe wyfe leſte weddyng feeſt deuyſe haue ytake ſuche empriſe ſo many ſtorye make longe leſte ſhulde ſlake thyng beareth effecte charge men may ouerlade ſhyp barge thy effecte woll ſkyppe remenaunt woll let ſlyppe octauian woode dede shope hooſte antony lede vtterly hys diſtruction wyth ſtoute romaynes cruell lyon ſhyp went thus let hem ſayle antonius ware woll nat fayle meten theſe romaynes yf may toke eke hys rede bothe vpon day hys wyfe hoſte forth wente ſhyp anon lenger ne ſtente ſee happed hem mete vp goth trumpe ſhoute ſhete paynen hem ſette ſonne wyth griſly ſowne goth great gonne hertely hurtlen al one fro ye toppe cometh ye gret ſtones gothe grapenell ſo full crokes amonge rope ran ſheryng hokes wyth polaxe preaſeth behynde maſte begynneth flye agayne driueth hem ouer borde ſtycketh hym vpon hys ſpeares orde rente ſayle hokes lyke ſythe bringeth ye cuppe byddeth hem blyth poureth peeſen vpon hatch ſlyder wyth pottes full lyme gone gyder thus longe day fyght ſpende tyll laſte euery thyng hath ende antony ſhent put hym flyght folke go beſt go myght fleeth eke quene withal purpre ſayle ſtrokes yt went thicke hayle wonder ſhe might nat endure whan antony ſawe ye auenture ala ꝙ day borne worſhyp thys day thus haue lorne diſpayre hys wytte ſterte xofe hym ſelfe anon throughout ye herte er ferther went place wyfe coulde ceſar haue grace egypte fled drede diſtreſſe herkeneth ye ſpeken kyndeneſſe ye men falſly ſwearen many othe ye wol dye yf loue wroth may ye ſene woman ſuche trouth woful cleopatre hath made ſuch routh ny tonge none may tell morowe ſhe wol lenger dwel made ſubtyll werkmē make ſhrine rubyes ſtones fyne egypte ſhe coulde eſpye put ful ſhrine ſpycerie let ye corſe enbaume forthe ſhe fette deed corſe ſhrine ſhette next ſhrine pyt doth ſhe graue ſerpentes ſhe might haue put hem graue thus ſhe ſeyde loue whō ſorouful hert obeyde ferforthly fro blyſfull houre ſwore ben frely meane antonius knyght neuer wakyng day nyght ye nere myn hertes remembraunce well wo carole daunce ſelfe couenaunt made tho ryght ſuche ye felten wele wo ferforthe power laye vnreprouable vnto wyfehod aye ſame wolde felen lyfe dethe thilke couenaūt whyle laſteth breth woll fulfyl ſhall well ſene neuer vnto loue trewer quene ye word naked ful good herte amonge ſerpentes pytte ſhe ſterte ſhe cheſe haue buryeng anon nedders gonne ſtynge ſhe dethe receyueth good chere loue antony ſo dere ſtoryall ſothe fable er fynde mā thus trewe ſtable woll loue hys death ſo frely take praye god let heades neuer ake ¶here endeth legende cleopatra foloweth legende tiſbe babilon babylon whylom fell thus whych towne quene simyramus let dytchen aboute walles make full hye harde tyles well ybake dwellynge thys noble towne two lordes yt great renown woneden ſo nygh vpon grene ther na ſtone wal hem betwene ofte great townes wonne ſoth ſayne yt one man ſonne lande one luſtyeſt doughter fayreſt eaſtward ye world tho dwellīg name eueryche gan ſpryng woman neyghbours aboute countrey yet wythouten doute maydens ben ykept ielouſye full ſtreyte leſte dydden ſome folye thys yonge man cleped piramus tyſbe hyght mayde naſo ſayeth thus thus reporte name yſhoue woxe age ſo woxe loue certayne reaſon age might haue ben bitwixt hem mariage father nolde aſſente loue ylyke ſore brente none frendes myght lette priuely ſomtyme yet mette ſleyght ſpaken ſome deſyre wrye glede hotter fyre forbyd loue ten tymes ſo wode wal yt betwixt hem ſtode clouen two right fro toppe adoun olde tyme hys foundacion yet clyfte ſo narowe lyte ſene dere ynough myte loue eſpye ye louers two yf ſhall lye ye founden fyrſt thys lytell narowe clyfte wyth ſounde ſofte ſhryfte let wordes clyfte pace tolden whyle yt ſtoden place complaynt loue wo euery tyme durſt ſo one ſyde wall ſtode ſyde ſtode tyſbe ſwete ſowne receyue thus wardeyns wold dyſceyue euery daye thys wall wolde threte wyſhe god downe ybete thus wold ſayne ala yu wycked wall thyne enuye thou v letteſt nyit thou cleaue fallen two leeſt thou woldeſt ſo yet woldeſt thou one let v mete one myght kyſſen ſwete cured care colde natheleſſe yet holde moche thou ſuffreſt gone wordes thrugh thy lime eke thy ſtone yet ought wyth ben well apayde theſe ydell wordes ſayd colde wall wollen kyſſe ſtone take leaue forth woldē gone thys gladly euentyde wonder early leſt men eſpyde lōge tyme wrought manere tyl daye phebus gan clere aurora wyth ſtremes hete dryed vp dewe herbes wete vnto thys clyfte wonte come piramus come tiſbe plyghten trouth fully fay ylke ſame nyght ſteale away begyle wardeyns euerychone forth cytie gone feldes ben ſo brode wyde mete place tyde ſet markes metynges ſhulde kynge ninus grauē vnder tre olde paynems ydolles heryed vſeden tho feldes ben buryed faſt thys graue well ſhortly thys tale tell thys couenaunt affyrmed wonder faſt longe hem thought ſunne laſt nere gone vnder ſee adoun thys tiſbe hath ſo great affectioun ſo great lykynge piramus ſe ſhe ſawe tyme myght nyght ſhe ſtale awaye full priuely wyth face ywympled ſubtelly frendes ſaue trouth hath forſake ala routhe euer woman wolde ſo trewe truſten man ſhe bet hym knewe tree ſhe goeth full good pace loue made ſo hardy thys caſe well adowne ſhe gan dreſſe ala cometh wylde lyoneſſe wodde wythouten areeſt wyth bloody mouth ſtranglyng beeſt drynken well ſhe ſat tiſby eſpyed ryſt vp wyth full drery herte caue wyth dredfull foote ſhe ſterte moone ſhe ſawe well wythall ſhe ran wymple let ſhe fall toke hede ſo ſore ſhe whaped eke ſo glad ſhe eſcaped thus ſhe ſate lurketh wonder ſtyll thys lyoneſſe hath dronke fyll aboute well gan ſhe wynde ryght anone wymple gan ſhe fynde wyth blody mouth rente thys done lenger ſhe ne ſtente ye wodde way thē hath ſhe nome laſt thys piramus come longe ala home moone ſhone men myght well yſe hys way come full faſte hys eyen grounde adowne caſte ſonde behelde adoun ſawe ſteppes brode lyoun hys herte ſodeynly agroſe pale wexte therwyth hys herte aroſe nere came foūde wymple torne ala quod daye borne thys nyght wyll v louers ſlee howe ſhulde aſken mercy tiſbee haue ſlayne ala byddynge hath ſlayne thys caas ala bydde woman gone nyght place peryll fallen myght ſo ſlowe ala ne thys place furlonge way crye nowe lyoun thys foreſte body mote rente beſte wylde gnawen mote myne herte worde ye wymple ſterte kyſt ofte wept full ſore ſayd wymple ala ny nomore thou ſhalt fele well bloode thou haſte felte bledynge tiſbe wyth yt worde ſmote hym ye herte bloode woūde brode ſterte water conduyt broken nowe tiſbe whych wyſt thys ſyttynge drede ſhe thought thus yf ſo fall piramus comen hether may yfynde may holden falſe eke vnkynde ſhe cometh hym gan eſpyen wyth herte wyth eyen thought woll hym tellen drede lyoneſſe dede laſte loue hath ſhe foūde beatynge wyth hys heeles groūde blody therwythall abacke ſhe ſterte lyke wawes quappe gan herte pale boxe ſhe woxe throwe auyſed gan hym well knowe piramus herte dere coulde wryte whych deedly chere hath tiſbe nowe heere ſhe rente howe ſhe gan ſelfe turmente ſhe lyeth ſwouneth ye groūde ſhe wept teeres full woūde medleth ſhe bloode wt cōplaint wt bloode ſeluen gan ſhe paynt howe clyppeth ſhe deed corſe ala howe doth thys wofull tiſbe thys caas howe kyſſeth ſhe hys froſty mouthe ſo colde hath hath ben ſo bold ſleen lefe ſpeake piramus thy tiſbe calleth thus therwythall ſhe lyfteth vp hys heed thys wofull mā fully deed herde name tiſbe cryen caſt hys heuy deedly eyen downe agayne yeldeth vp gooſt tiſbe ryſt vp wythout noyſe booſt ſawe wymple hys empty ſheth eke hys ſwerde yt hym hath deth ſpake ſhe thus thy woful hāde ꝙ ſhe ſtronge ynough ſuch werke loue ſhall yeue ſtrength hardyneſſe make wounde large ynough geſſe woll folowen deed woll felowe cauſe eke thy dethe ꝙ ſhe though yt nothynge ſaue deth myght fro departe truely thou ſhalt departe nowe fro fro deth woll go wyth nowe ye wretched ielouſe father whylom chyldren prayen wythouten enuye graue moten lye sen loue hath brought v pitous end ryghtwyſe god euery louer ſend loueth truly proſperite euer piramus tiſbe let gentyll woman aſſure putten ſuche auenture god forbyd woman ben trewe louynge man parte ſhall anone kyth wyth ye word ſwerd ſhe toke ſwyth warme loues blode hote herte ſhe ſeluen ſmote thus tiſbe piramus ygo trewe men fynde fewe mo bokes ſaue thys piramus therfore haue ſpoken hym thus deynte v men fynde man loue trewe kynde maye ye ſene louer ſo woman dare well ¶here endeth legende tyſbe babilon foloweth legende dido quene cartage glorie honoure virgyle mantuan thy name ſhall folowe thy lanterne thou goeſt byforne howe eneas dido forſworne thyne eneyde naſo woll take tenour great effectes make troye brought dyſtruction grekes ſleyght namely synon faynynge horſe offred vnto minerue yt many troyā muſt ſterue hector hys death apered fyre ſo wode myght ben ſtered noble toure ilion cytie chefe dongeon countre ſo lowe ybrought priamus kynge fordone nought eneas charged venus flyen awaye toke aſcanius ſon right hāde fledde hys backe bare wyth hym ledde olde father cleped anchyſes way hys wyfe creuſa lee mokell ſorowe hys mynde er coulde felawſhyp fynde laſte whan hem founde made hym redy certayne ſtounde ſee ful faſte gan hym hye ſayleth forthe hys companye towarde itayle wolde deſtynee auentures ſee ny nat purpoſe ſpeke acordeth nat matere ſayd hym dido shall tale tyll haue longe ſayled ſalte ſee tyll libye vnneth arryued wyth tempeſt ſhake whan hauen ytake knight called achatees hym hys felawſhyp thees gone wyth hym countrey teſpye toke wyth hym nomore companye forth gone lefte ſhyppes ryde feere wythouten gyde longe walketh wylderneſſe tyll laſte mette huntereſſe bowe honde arowes ſhe clothes cutted vnto knee ſhe yet fayreſt creature euer yformed nature eneas achates ſhe grette thus ſhe hem ſpake whā ſhe hē mette sawe ye ꝙ ſhe ye han walked wyde ſuſtren walke beſyde wyth wylde bore beeſt haue hunted foreſt tucked vp wyth arowes caas nay ſothly lady ꝙ eneas thy beautie thynketh thou myghteſt neuer erthely woman phebus ſuſter art thou geſſe yf ſo thou goddeſſe haue mercy labour wo nam goddeſſe ſothly ꝙ ſhe tho maydens walken countre wyth arowes bowe manere realme libye ye bene whiche dido lady quene ſhortly tolde occaſyon dido came regyon whyche nowe lyſteth nat ryme nedeth nere loſſe tyme thys ſome venus hys owne mother yt ſpake wyth hym thus cartage ſhe bad ſhulde dyght vanyſhed anone hys ſyght coulde folowe worde worde vergyle wolde laſten longe whyle thys noble quene clypped dido whylom wyfe sitheo fayrer bryght ſonne noble towne cartage hath begonne whych ſhe raygneth ſo great honour ſhe holde quenes flour gentylleſſe fredome beautee well hym myght one ſee kynges lordes ſo deſyred ye worlde beauty yfyred ſtode ſo well euery wyghtes grace eneas come vnto place vnto mayſter temple toun dido deuocioun full priuely hys waye hath nome large temple come ſayne yf poſſyble venus hym maked inuiſible thus ſayeth boke wythouten lee thys eneas achates hadden thys temple ben ouer founde depaynted wall howe troye al lāde dyſtroyed ala borne quod eneas ye world ſhame kyd ſo wyde nowe paynted euery ſyde proſperite ben nowe dyſclaundred ſuche degre lenger lyuen ne kepe wyth yt worde braſt wepe tenderly routhe ſene thys freſhe lady cyte quene stode temple eſtate royall rychely eke ſo fayre wyth yonge ſo luſty wyth eyen glade yf god heuen earth made wolde haue loue beauty goodneſſe womanheed troth ſemelyneſſe ſhulde louen thys lady ſwete ny woman hym halfe ſo mete fortune hath world gouernaūce hath ſodaynly brought ſo newe chaunce neuer yet ſo frened caas company eneas whych wende haue lorne ſee armed nought ferre fro cyte whych greateſt hys lordes ſome auenture ben cyte come vnto ſame temple ſeke quene ſocour beſeke ſuch renōe ther ſprōge goodneſſe tolde dyſtreſſe tempeſt harde caas vnto quene appered eneas openly beknewe ioye thys meyne haddē foūde lorde gouernour quene ſawe dyd ſuch honour herden ofte eneas er tho herte routh wo euer ſuche noble man shall ben dyſherited ſuche degre ſawe ye man yt lyke knyght ſuffyſaunt perſone myght lyke ben gentylman well hys wordes beſette noble vyſage none formed well brawne bone venus ſuche fayrneſſe mā myght halfe ſo fayre geſſe well lorde hym ſemed ſtraunger ſomwhat ſhe lyked hym bette god boote ſome folke often newe thynge ſwote anone herte hath pyte hys wo wyth pyte loue came alſo thus pyte gentylneſſe refreſhed muſt ben hys dyſtreſſe ſayde certes ſhe ſory hath ſuch peryl ſuch caas frendly ſpeche thys manere hym ſpake ſayd ye may ye venus ſonne anchyſes good fayth worſhyp encrees maye goodly done ye ſhall haue ſhyppes meyne ſhall ſaue many gentyll worde ſhe ſpake hym commaunded meſſangers go ſame daye wythouten fayle hys ſhyppes ſeke hem vytayle full many beeſt ſhe ſhyppes ſent wyth wyne ſhe gan hem preſent royall paleys ſhe ſpedde eneas alwaye wyth ſhe ledde nedeth feeſtes dyſcryue neuer better eaſe hys lyue full feeſt deynties rycheſſe inſtrumentes ſonge gladneſſe many amorous lokynge deuyſe thys eneas come paradyſe ſwolowe hell thus ioye remembreth hym hys eſtate troye dauncynge chābres ful paramentes ryche beddes pauementes thys eneas ledde meete wyth quene ſeete ſpyces parted wyne agone vnto hys chambre ladde anone take hys eaſe haue hys reſte wyth hys folke done ſo hem leſte na courſer well ybrydled none ne ſtede iuſtynge well gone ne large palfrey eaſy none ne iowell fret full ryche ſtones ne ſackes full golde large wyght ne ruby none ſhyneth nyght ne gentyll hauten faukon heronere ne hounde herte wylde bore deere ne cuppe golde wyth floreyns newe ybet lande libye may ben gette dido ne hath eneas yſent payed hath ſpent thus cā honorable quene geſtes cal ſhe fredome paſſen al eneas ſothely eke wythout lee hath ſent hys ſhyppe achates hys ſonne ryche thynges ſceptre clothes broches eke rynges weare ſome preſente al theſe noble thinges ſent bad ſonne howe ſhuld make preſentynge quene take repayred thys achates agayne eneas full blyſfull fayne ſene hys yonge ſonne aſcanyus hym reported thus cupido god loue prayer hys mother hye aboue lykeneſſe chylde ytake thys noble quene enamoured make eneas ſcripture maye make cure ſoth thys ye quene hath made ſuche chere vnto child wōder preſente hys father ſent thanked hym ofte good entent thus thys quene pleaſaunce ioye wyth theſe newe luſty folke troye dedes hath ſhe enquyred eneas ſtorye lered troye longe day twey entendeden ſpeke pley whych gan breden ſuche fyre ſely dido hath nowe ſuche deſyre wyth eneas newe geſte deale ſhe loſte hewe eke heale nowe theffecte nowe frute haue tolde thys ſtorye tellē ſhall thus begynne fell vpon nyght moone vpreyſed lyght thys noble quene vnto reſte wente ſygheth ſore gon ſelfe turmente waketh waloweth made many braid done theſe louers haue herde ſayd laſte vnto ſuſter anne made mone riȝt thus ſpak ſhe thā nowe dere ſuſter myne may agaſteth dreme quod ſhe thys ylke newe troyan ſo thought thynketh ſo wel ywrought eke ſo lykely ben man therwyth ſo mykell good al loue lyfe lyeth hys cure haue ye herde hym tell hys auenture nowe certes anne yf ye rede woll fayne hym ywedded thys ye effecte ſhulde ſeyne hym lyeth lyue deyne ſuſter anne ſhe yt coulde good said thought ſomdele withſtode ſo longe ſermonynge longe make reherſynge fynally maye wythſtonde loue woll loue wyght wol wonde dawnynge vp ryſt ſee thys amerous quene chargeth meyne nettes dreſſe ſpeares brode kene huntynge woll thys luſty freſhe quene prycketh thys newe ioly wo horſe luſty folke ygo vnto court houndes ben ybrought vp courſer ſwyfte thought yonge knyghtes heuen aboute woman eke huge route vpon thycke palfraye paper whyte wyth ſadell reed enbrouded wyth delyte golde barres vp enboſſed hygh sate dido golde perrey wrygh ſhe fayre bryght morowe healeth ſycke
