folkes nyghtes ſorow vpon courſer ſtartlynge fyre men myght turne hym wyth lytell wyre eneas lyke phebus deuyſe freſhe arayed hys wyſe fomy brydell wyth bytte golde gouerneth ryght hym ſelf hath wolde forth thys noble quene thys lady ryde huntynge wyth thys troyan ſyde heerde harte founden anone hey gobet prycke thou let gon let gone nyll lyon comen beare might one metē wt ſpeare thus ſayne yonge folke vp kyll wylde harte haue hem wyll amonge al thys romblen gan heuen thonder rored wyth gryſly ſteuen downe come ye rayne wt hayle ſlet ſo faſte wyth heuens fyre made ſo ſore agaſte thys noble quene alſo meyne eche hem glad awaye flye ſhortly fro tempeſt ſaue fled ſelfe lytell caue wyth went thys eneas alſo wyth hem yf went mo auctoure maketh mencion began depe affection bytwixt hem two ye fyrſt morowe gladneſſe gynnyng ſorowe hath eneas ykneled ſo tolde hys hurte hys wo ſworne ſo depe trewe well wo chaunge newe falſe louer ſo well playne ſely dido rewed hys payne toke huſbōde became wife euer whyle hem laſte lyfe thys yt tempeſt ſtente myrth came home wēt wycked fame vp roſe anone howe eneas hath wyth quene ygone caue demed hem leſte ye kyng yt yarbas hyght wyſt loued euer hys lyfe wowed haue hys wyſe ſorow hath maked ſuche chere ruthe pyte loue aldaye happeth ſo one ſhall laughen anothers wo nowe laugheth eneas ioye richeſſe euer troye ſely woman full innocence full pyte truthe contynence maked men truſten ſo haue ye ſuch routh vpon fayned wo haue ſuche olde enſamples beforne se ye howe ben forſworne ſe ye one ne hath lafte lefe ben vnkynde done ſome myſchefe pylled boſted hys dede ye maye well ſene ye may rede take hede nowe thys great gentylman thys troyan ſo well pleaſe fayneth hym ſo trewe obeyſynge gentyll ſo preuy hys doynge ſo well done hys obeyſaunce feeſtes daunce whē ſhe goeth temple home ageine faſten tyll hath hys lady ſeyne bearen hys deuyſes ſake ſonges wolde make iuſten done armes many thynges sende letter token broches rynges herkneth ſhal lady ſerue peryll ſterue honger myſchefe ſee deſolate fledde fro hys countree hys folke wyth tempeſt al dryuen hath body eke realme yeuen hys honde ſhe myght haue bene lande cartage quene lyued ī ioy ynough wold ye thys eneas hath thus depe yſwore wery hys crafte wythin throwe hote erneſt ouerblowe priuely doth hys ſhyppes dyght ſhapeth hym ſteale awaye nyght thys dido hath ſuſpection thys thought well amys hys bedde lyeth nyght ſyketh aſketh anone miſlyketh dere herte whych loue moſte certes ꝙ thys nyght father goſt hath ſlepe ſo ſore turmented eke marcury meſſage hath preſented nedes conqueſt itayle deſtyne ſoone ſayle thinketh broſtē myne herte therwyth hys falſe teeres ſterte taketh wythin hys armes two erneſt ꝙ ſhe woll ye ſo haue ye ſworne wyfe take ala woman woll ye make gentyl woman quene ye woll fro wyfe thus foule flene borne ala ſhall tellen ſhort noble quene dido ſeketh halowes doth ſacrifyce kneleth cryeth yt routhe deuyſe coniureth hym proffreth hym thral ſeruaūt beſt degree falleth hym foote ſwouneth diſcheuyle bryght gylt heer ſayth haue mercy let wt ryde theſe lordes ye wonnen beſyde woll deſtroyen ſake ye woll wyf take ye haue ſworn thā wol yeue leue ſleen wt ſwerd ſone eue yet ſhall dyen wyfe chylde yeue chylde lyfe mercy lorde haue pytie thought al thing auayleth ryght nouȝt traytour forth gan ſayle towarde large countre itayle thus hath left dido wo pyne wedded lady hyght rauyne cloth laft eke ſwerde ſtōdynge whan fro dido ſtale ſlepyng ryght beddes heed ſo gan hye whan ſtale awaye nauye cloth whā ſely dido gan awake hath kyſt full oft ſake ſayd ſwete cloth iupiter leſt take ſoule vnbynde vnreſt haue fulfylled fortune courſe thus ala withouten ſocourſe twenty tyme yf wouned hath ſhe whan ſhe vnto ſuſter anne cōplayned may wryte great routh haue endyte bad norice ſuſtren gon fetchen fyre thynges anon ſayd ſhe wolde ſacrifye whan ſhe myght tyme wel aſpy vpon fyre ſacrifyce ſhe ſterte wt ſwerde ſhe rofe hert myn auctor ſayth yet thus ſhe ſeyd ſhe hurt beforne ſhe deyed wrote letter anon tus began ryght ſo ꝙ ſhe whyte ſwan ayenſt deth begynneth ſynge ryght ſo make cōplaynyng trowe getten agayne wel wot vayne syns yt goddes ben cōtrarions ſyn name loſt thrugh ꝙ ſhe may well leſe worde letter ſhalbe neuer better thilke wynde yt blew ſhyp away ſame winde hath blowaway fay whoſo wol al letter haue minde rede ouyde hym ſhal fynde ¶here endeth legende dido quene cartage foloweth legend hypſiphile medea thou rote falſe louers duke iaſon thou ſleer deuourer confuſion gentle woman gentle creature thou madeſt thy reclaymyng thy lure ladyes thy ſcathlyche apparaunce thy wordes farſed pleaſaunce thy fayned trouth thy manere thyne obeyſaunce humble chere wt thy counterfayted payne wo falſen one thou falſed two oft ſwore thou thou woldeſt dye loue whan thou ne felteſt malady saue foule delyte whiche thou calleſt loue yf lyue thy name ſhalbe ſhoue englyſh thy diſceyte ſhalbe knowe haue iaſon thyne honoure blowe certes routh wo loue falſe louers worketh ſo ſhal haue well better loue chere hath bought loue ful dere armes many blody boxe euer tender capon eateth foxe though falſe hath ye foule betrayde ſhall good man yt therfore payde although haue ye capon ſkil right falſe foxe wol haue parte nyght iaſon example wel yſene hypſiphyle medea quene theſſalye ouyde telleth v knyght hyght pelleus brother hyght eſō whā age myght vnethes gon yaue pelleus gouernyng al reygne made hym lord kynge eſon iaſon getten tyme al ye land na ſuche famous knyght gentleneſſe fredome ſtrength luſtyneſſe father death bare hym ſo none lyſt ben ſo dyd hym al honour company pelleus hath great enuy imaginyng iaſon myght enhaunced ſo put ſuche degree loue lordes regyoun frō reigne may put adoun wyt nyght compaſſed iaſon myght beſt deſtroyed withouten ſclaunder compaſment laſt toke aduyſement ſendē ſome ferre countrie iaſon may deſtroyed wyt al made iaſon great chere loke affectioun drede leſt lordes eſpyde fyll fame ronneth wyde ther ſuche tydyng ouer al ſuch loo yle called colcos beyonde troy eſtwarde ſee ther ram men myght ſe flees golde yt ſhone ſo bryght ther ſuch another ſyght kept alwaye drogoun many maruayles vp doune two bulles maked al bra ſpyttē fyre moche thyng eke tale nathelees whoſo wolde wynnen thilke flees muſt wynne myght bulles dragon fyght kynge otes lorde yle pelleus bethought vpon wyle neuewe iaſon wolde exhort ſaylen londe diſport ſayd neuewe yf myght ſuche worſhyp myght fal thou famous treſure might win bringe region within great pleſaunce honour holde quyte thy labour coſtes woll ſelfe make choſe folke thou wolt wt thetake let ſe darſt thou taken voyage iaſon yonge luſty corage vndertoke done ylke empriſe anon argus ſhyppes deuyſe iaſon went ſtronge hercules many hym ches whoſo aſketh hym gone let hym rede argonautycon woll tell tale longe ynough philoctetes anon ſayle vp drough whan wynde good gan hye countrie called theſſalye longe ſayled ſalt ſee tyll yle lemnon arryued al reherſed guydo yet ſayth ouyde epyſtles ſo yle lady quene fayre yonge hypſiphile ſhene whylom thoas doughter kyng hypſiphile gone playing romyng cleuys ſee vnder banke anon eſpyed ſhe lay ſhyp iaſon gan aryue goodneſſe adowne ſhe ſendeth blyue weten yf ſtraunge wyght tempeſt thyder wer yblowe anyght hym ſucour vſaunce furthren euery wyght pleſaunce bountie curteſye meſſenger adowne hym gan hye founde iaſon hercules alſo cogge londe ygo hein refreſhen take ayre mornyng attempre fayre way meſſenger hem met ful cōnyngly theſe lordes two gret dyd meſſage aſkyng hem anon yf yt broken ought wo begon nede lodeſmen vytayle ſocour ſhulde nothyng fayle vtterly quenes wyl iaſon anſwered mekely ſtyll lady ꝙ thanke hertely goodneſſe v nedeth truly nothyng wery come playe ſee tyl wynde better way lady rometh clyffe play meyne endlonge ſtronde fyndeth iaſon ſtond ſpekyng thyng tolde hercules iaſon gan beholde yt quene fayre gret anon ryght lady met ſhe toke hede knewe manere arraye wordes chere gentleman great degree caſtel ledeth ſhe theſe ſtraūge folk doth hem great honor aſketh hem trauayle laboure haue ſuffred ſalte ſee within daye two thre knewe folke yt ſhyppes iaſon full ronomee hercules great loo ſoughten auentures colcos dyd hem honour hem dealed euer longer ben worthy folke wtouten lee namely mooſt ſhe ſpake wt hercules hym hert bare ſhulde sad wyſe true wordes auyſee withouten affection loue ymagynacion hercules hath iaſon prayſed ſun hath vp rayſed half ſo true man na loue vnder cope heuen aboue wyſe hardy ſecret ryche theſe iii pointes ther na non lyche fredome paſſed luſtyhede tho lyuen ben deed therto ſo great gentleman theſſalye lykely kynge na let agaſt loue ſpeake ſhamefaſt hym leuer ſelfe murdre dye men ſhulde louer hym eſpye wolde god iyeue blood fleſh ſo yt myght lyue yu none yt ought wyfe eſtate ſuche luſty lyfe ſhulden lede luſty knyght al cōpaſſed nyght betwixt iaſon hercules theſe two ſhrende lee come houſe vpon innocent bedote quene entent iaſon coye mayde loketh pytouſly nought ſayd frely yaue counſaylers yeftes great offycers wolde god leyſer tyme proceſſe woing ryme houſe yf falſe louer right ſelf doth right ſo faynyng wt euery ſubtyl dede ye get nomore ye wol rede thoriginall telleth caas ſoth yt iaſon wedded vnto quene toke ſubſtaunce whatſo lyſt vnto purueyaunce vpon begat chyldren two drough ſayle ſaw neuer mo letter ſent ſhe hym certayne longe wryten ſayne hym reproueth great vntrouth prayeth hym haue ſom routh chyldren two ſhe ſayd lyke thyng ywys iaſon ſaue couth nat begyle prayed god longe whyle ſhe hert yreft fro muſt fynden hym vntrue alſo ſhe muſt chyldren ſpyll tho ſuffreth hym wyll true iaſon ſhe al lyfe euer kept chaſte wyfe ne neuer ſhe ioy hert dyed loue ſorowes ſmerte colcos come duke iaſon loue deuourer dragon matyre appeteth forme alway forme forme paſſen maye well botomleſſe ryght ſo iaſon haue pee deſyren appetyte done gentyl woman delyte luſt felicitie iaſon roomed forth cytie whylom cleped iaſonicos maſter towne al colcos hath ytolde ye cauſe comyng vnto otes countrey kynge praying yt muſt done aſſaye get fleeſe golde yf may kynge aſſenteth boone doth hym honour doone ferforth yt doughter heyre medea ſo wyſe fayre fayrer ſaugh neuer man wt eye made done iaſon company meate ſyt hym hall nowe iaſon ſemely man withall lyke lorde great renoun hi loke royall lyoun goodly ſpeche familiere coude loue al craft arte plenere withouten boke wt eueryche obſeruaunce fortune ought foul miſchaūce woxe enamored vpon man iaſon ꝙ ſhe ough ſe thyng ye ye ben yea ſelfe put moche dout whoſo woll auenture atcheue may nat wele aſterten leue withouten deth helpe natheleſſe wyll ꝙ ſhe forthren ſo ye ſhall nat dye tournen ſound home theſſaly ryght lady ꝙ iaſon tho ye haue deth wo regarde done honour wote wel myght ne labour may nat deſerue lyues daye god thanke ne ne may man lowly beſeche ben helpe withouten ſpeche certes deth ſhall nat ſpare tho gan medea hym declare peril caſe fro poynt poynt battayle diſioynt mote ſtande creature saue ſhe ne myght lyfe aſſure ſhortly ryght poynt go ben accorded fully betwixe hem two iaſon ſhal wed true knyght terme yſet come ſoone nyght vnto chambre make othe vpon goddes lefe loth ne ſhulde neuer falſen nyght ne day ben huſbond whyle lyue may ſhe deth hym ſaued herevpon nyght met yfere doth oth goth bed morowe vpwarde hym ſped ſhe hath tauȝt ſhal fayl fleeſe wyn ſtynten battayle ſaued hym lyfe honour gat hym name conquerour right thrugh ſleight enchaūtmēt hath iaſō fleeſe home wēt medea treaſoures ful great vnwyſt father ſhe gone theſſaly duke iaſon lefe afterward hath brouȝt miſchef traytour go left yonge chyldren two falſely hath betrayed ala euer loue chefe traytour wedded yet thyrde wyfe anon doughter kynge creon mede louynge guerdon medea receyued duke iaſon right trouth kyndneſſe loued hym better thā ſelf geſſe left father heritage iaſon vaſſalage dayes na neuer none yfounde falſe louer going grounde therfore letter thus ſhe ſayde firſt whā ſhe falſeneſſe hym vnbraid lyked thy yelowe heer ſe boundes myne honeſtie lyked thy youth thy fayrneſſe thy tonge ye infinite graciouſneſſe haddeſt thou thy conqueſt deed ybe ful mykel vntrouth dyed wt wel ouyde letter verſe endyte longe wryte ¶here endeth legende hipſyphile medea foloweth legende lucreſſe rome mote ſayne thexilyng kynges rome horrible doinges laſt king tarquinivs ſayth ouyde tytus liuius cauſe tell nat ſtory prayſen drawen memory wyfe lucreſſe wyfehode ſtedfaſtneſſe nat theſe paynyms cōmende cleped legende great auſtyn hath compaſſioun lucrece ſtarfe rome toun wyſe wol ſhortly treat thyng touche great whan ardea beſieged romaynes ye full ſterne ſtout full longe lay ſiege lytle wroughten yt wer half ydle hem thoughtē play tarquinius yonge gan iape lyght tonge ſayd ydle lyfe noman dyd wyfe let v ſpeake wyues beſt prayſe euery man owne leſt ſpeche let v eaſe hert knyght hyght colatyn vp ſtert ſayd thus nay ſyr nede trowen worde dede haue wyfe ꝙ trowe holden good euer knowe go rome nyght ſhul ſe tarquinius anſwerd lyketh rome come faſt hem dight colatyns houſe downe lyght tarquinius eke colatyne huſbond knewe ye efters well fyne full priuely houſe gone gate porter none chambre dore abyde noble wyfe ſat beddes ſyde diſcheueled malyce ſhe ne thought ſoft woll ſayth liui ſhe wrought kepen fro ſlouth ydleneſſe bad ſeruaūtes done beſyneſſe aſketh hem tydynges heren ye ſayth men ſiege ſhal god wold walles fallen adowne myn huſbōd longe towne drede doth ſo ſmerte ryght ſwerd ſtyngeth myne hert whan thynke place god ſaue lord pray grace therwithall ful tenderly ſhe gan wepe werke ſhe toke nomore kepe mekely ſhe let eyen fall thylke ſemblaunt ſate wel withall eke teares ful heuyneſſe embeleſed wyfelye chaſtneſſe countenaunce herte digne accordeden dede ſigne worde huſbōd colatin ſhe hym ware came ſtertlyng ſayd drede nat ſhe anon vproſe blyſful chere kyſſed hym wyues tarquinius proude kynges ſonne conceyued hath beautye chere yelewe heer bountie manere hewe wordes yt ſhe hath cōplayned craft beauty nat fayned caught lady ſuche deſyre hert brent fyre woodly wyt al forgoten wel thought ſhe ſhulde nat goten aye diſpayre coueyteth thought fayre blynde luſt couetyng morowe whā byrde began ſynge vnto ſiege cōmeth full priuely hym ſelfe walketh ſobrely ymage recordyng alway newe thus lay heer thus freſh hew thus ſate thus ſpan chere thus fayr ſhe manere conceyte herte hath newe ytake ſee tempeſt al ſhake whan ſtorme al ago yet wol water quap day two right ſo though yt forme abſent pleſaunce forme preſent natheleſſe nat pleſaunce delyte vnryghtfull talent deſpyte maugre ſhe ſhal lemman hap helpeth hardy man alway ꝙ ende make ſhalbe ſo gyrt hym wt ſwerde gan go forth ryght tyl rome come al alone way hath nome vnto houſe colatyne ful ryght ye ſun day hath loſt light come vnto priuy halke nyght full theuelye ſtalke whan euery wight reſt brought ne wight treaſō ſuche thought whether windowe bo gyn ſwerde ydrawe ſhortly cōmeth ſhe lay noble wife lucreſſe ſhe woke bed ſhe felt preſſe beeſt ꝙ ſhe wayeth thus kynges ſonne tarquinius ꝙ thou crye noyſe make yf thou creature awake thilke god formed man lyue ſwerd thyne hert ſhal riue therwithall vnto throte ſterte ſet ſworde ſharpe hert word ſhe ſpake ſhe hath myght therto ſhal ſhe ſayne wyt al ago ryght wolfe yt fayneth lambe alone ſhall ſhe cōplayne make mone ſhal ſhe fyght hardy knyght wele wot men woman hath myght ſhal ſhe crye ſhal ſhe atterte hath ye throte wt ſwerde hert aſketh grace ſayd al yt ſhe wolt thou nat ꝙ cruel man wyſely iupiter ſoule ſaue ſhall ſtable ſlee thy knaue laye hym thy bed loude crye fande ſuche auoutry thus thou ſhalt deed alſo leſe thy name thou ſhalt nat cheſe romaynes wyues louedē ſo name thilke tyme dredden ſo ſhame fere ſlaūder dred deth loſt one wyt breth ſwough ſhe ſay woxe ſo deed men myghten ſmyte arme heed feleth nothing neither foule ne fayre tarquinius art kynges heyre ſhuldeſt lynage ryght done lorde knyght haſt thou done deſpyte cheualrye haſt thou done thy lady vylanye ala ye vylaynous dede ye purpoſe ſtory rede whan gone miſchaūce fall lady ſent frendes father mother huſbond yfere diſcheueled heer clere habyt ſuche woman vſed tho vnto burying frendes go ſat hall ſorowfull ſyght frendes aſken aylen myght deed ſhe ſat aye wepynge word ſhame ne may ſhe forth brīg ne vpon hem ſhe durſt nat beholde laſt tarquiny ſhe hem tolde ruful caſe al thyng horryble wo tel impoſſible ſhe frendes make one folkes hertes ben ſtones myght haue maked hem vpon rewe hert ſo wyſely ſo trewe ſayd gilt ne blame huſbād ſhuld haue ſoule name wolde ſhe nat ſuffren waye anſwerde vnto faye foryaue ryght gylt laye myght ſayden ſamples many one nought thus ſhe ſayde anon may ꝙ ſhe forgyuyng wyll haue forgyft nothynge priuely ſhe caught forth knyfe therwithall ſhe raft ſelfe lyfe ſhe fell adowe ſhe caſt loke clothes yet hede ſhe toke fallyng yet ſhe care leſt fete ſuche thynges lay bare wel ſhe loued clenneſſe eke trouth towne rome routh brutus hath chaſt bloud ſwore tarquin ſhuld ybaniſhed therfore kyn let people call openly tale tolde hem openly let cary bere al town yt men maye ſe horryble dede oppreſſioun ne neuer ther kyng rome towne syns thilke day ſhe holden ſaynt euer day yhalowed dere lawe thus endeth lucreſſe noble wyſe tytus bereth wytneſſe tell ſhe loue ſo trewe ne wyl ſhe chaunged newe ſtable hert ſad kynde theſe woman men may al day fynd caſt hert ther dwelleth wel wot chryſt ſelf telleth iſrael wyde londe ſo great fayth al ye londe ne fond woman lye men loke ye ſuche tyrannye done day aſſay whoſo lyſt treweſt full brotell tryſt ¶here endeth legende lucrece rome foloweth legende ariadne athene ivdge infernall mynes crete kynge cōmeth thy lot thou comeſt rynge nat thy ſake onlye wrytten ſtorye cleape ayen vnto memorye theſius great vntrouth loue goddes heuen aboue ben wroth wrath hath take thy ſyn red ſhame thy lyfe begyn mynos yt myghty kyng crete hundred cyties ſtrong great ſchole hath ſent ſon androgeus athene happed thus ſlayne lerning philoſophye ryght citie nat enuye great mynos ſpeke ſonnes deth come wreke alcathoe beſieged harde longe natheleſſe walles ſo ſtronge niſus kynge cytie chyualrous lytel dredeth mynos hoſte toke cure tyl daye befel auenture niſus doughter ſtode vpon wall ſiege ſawe maner happed ſcarmiſhyng caſt herte vpon mynos kinge beautie chiualrye ſore ſhe wende dye ſhortly thys proceſſe pace made mynos wynnen thylke place cite al wyll ſauen hym lyſte el ſpyll wyekedly quyt kyndneſſe let drenche ſorowe diſteſſe nere goddes pyte tale longe athene wan thys kyng mynos alſo alcathoe townes mo effecte ye mynos hath ſo driuē hem athene mote hym yeuen fro yere yere owne chyldren dere ſlayne ye ſhal mynos hath mōſter wicked beeſt ſo cruel wythout areeſt whā yt mā brought preſence nolde eate helpeth defence euery thyrde yere wythouten doute caſten lotte came aboute ryche poore muſt ſonne take hys chylde muſt preſent make mynos ſaue hym ſpyll let beeſte deuoure wyll hath mynos done right diſpyte wreke ſonne ſet al hys delyte make hem athene hys thral fro yere yere whyle lyuen ſhal whō ſayleth whan toun wycked cuſtome ſo longe yronne tyl athene kyng egeus mote ſenden hys owne ſonne theſeus sen lotte fallen vpon ben deuoured grace non forth ladde woful yonge knight vnto coūtre king mynos ful might priſon fettred faſt tyl tyme ſhulde yfreten wel maiſt thou wepe woful theſeus art kynges ſonne dampned thus thynketh thou art depe yhold ſaued fro care colde nowe yf woman helpe wel oughteſt thou ſeruaunt ben trewe louer yere yere nowe come ayen matere toure theſeus throwe downe bottome derke wonder low ioynyng wal foreyne longyng vnto doughtren tweyne mynos chambres grete dwelten aboue mayſtre ſtrete towne ioye ſolas nat howe happed par caas theſeus complayned hym nyght kynges doughter ariadne hyght eke ſuſter phedra herden al hys complaynte ſtode wal loked vpon bryght moone hem lyſte go bedde ſo ſoone hys wo compaſſion kynges ſonne ſuch priſon ben deuoured thought hem great pyte ariadne ſpake ſuſter fre ſayd phedra leue ſuſter dere woful lordes ſonne may ye pitouſly complayneth hys kynne eke hys poore eſtate inne gyltleſſe certayne nowe routh yf ye wol aſſent trouth ſhal ben holpen howe ſo phedra anſwerde ywys wo hym euer man hys helpe beſte rede done gayler priuely come ſpeake wyth v haſtely thys woful mā wyth hym come yf may monſter ouercome thā quyte ther non boote let v wel taſte hym hys herte roote yf ſo weapen haue lyfe dare kepe ſaue fyghten wyth thys fende hym defende priſon ſhal diſcende ye wote wel beeſt place derke hath rōme eke ſpace welde axe ſwerde ſtaffe knyfe thynketh ſhulde ſaue life man ſhal ſo ſhal make hym balles eke alſo wexe towe whan gapeth faſte beeſtes throte ſhal hem caſte ſleke honger encomber teth ryght anon whan theſeus ſeth beeſt acheked ſhall hym leepe ſleen comen heepe thys weapen ſhal gayler tyde ful priuely within priſon hyde houſe crencled fro hath ſo queynte wayes go ſhapen maſe wrought therto haue remedye thought clewe twyne hath gone ſame way may returne anone folowyng alway ye threde hath come whan thys beeſt ouercome may flyen away ſtede eke gayler may wyth lede hym auaunce home hys countre sen ſo great lordes ſonne thys rede yf ye dare take ſhulde lenger ſermon make gayler cometh theſeus whan theſe thynges ben accorded thus downe ſate theſeus vpon hys kne ryght lady lyfe ꝙ ſorouful man ydampned deth fro whyles laſteth breth wol twynne thys auenture ſeruyce thus wol endure wretch vnknow woll ſerue euermore tyl myne herte ſterue forſake wol home myne heritage ſayd bene courte page ye vouchſafe thys place ye graunt haue ſuch grace may haue nat meate drinke ſuſtynaunce yet wol ſwinke right lyſte yt mynos ne wyght sen ſaw neuer euen ſight ne man el ſhal eſpye ſlyly ſo wel ſhal gye ſo wel diſfygure ſo lowe worlde ſhal man know haue lyfe haue preſence none thys excellence father ſhal ſende thys worthy man gaylere hym ſo guerdon ſhal wel one greateſt men countre yf durſt ſayne lady bryght kynges ſonne eke knyght wolde god yf myght ye countre al thre wyth beare companye ſhulde ye ſene yf therof lye yf profer lowe manere ben page ſeruen ryght ſerue lowly place praye mar yeue ſuch grace ſhames deth mote fal dethe pouerte frendes al ſpirite nyght mote go deth walke fro mote traytoure haue name ſpirite mote go ſhame yf clayme euer degre ye vouchſafe yeue haue ſayde ſhames death dey mercy lady naught el ſey ſemly knyght thys theſeus ſe yonge twenty yere thre ſo yſene hys countenaunce wold haue wept routh penaūce ariadne thys manere anſwerde hys profer hys chere kynges ſonne eke knyght ꝙ ſhe bene ſeruaunt ſo lowe degree god ſhylde ſhame woman al lene neuer ſuch caſe befal ſende grace ſleyght herte alſo defende knyghtly ſleen foe leene may fynde ſuſter ſo kynde ne repente nat yeue lyfe yet better wyfe syth ye ben gentyl borne haue realme nat faſte yt ſuffred youre gentylleſſe ſterue let page ſterue profyte vnto kyurede yt mā woll nat drede ſuſter ſyth ſo ſhe mote gone yf go el ſuffre dethe well ye vnto ſonne trewely done wedded home coming thys final ende al thys thyng ye ſwere vpō al may ſworne ye lady myne ꝙ el torne mote wt mynotaur morow haueth myn hert blod borow ye wol yf knyfe ſpeare wolde letten theron ſweare erſte wotte ye wolde leue mar chefe beleue myght lyuen nat fayle morowe taken batayle nolde neuer fro thys place flye tyl ye ſhulde profe ſe nowe yf ſoth ſhal ſay haue loued ful many day though ye ne wyſt countre aldermoſte deſyred ſe erthly lyuynge creature vpon trouth ſweare aſſure thys ſeuen yere haue ſeruaunt nowe haue alſo haue ye dere herte athene ducheſſe thys lady ſmyleth hys ſtedfaſtneſſe hys hertely wordes chere ſuſter ſayd thys manere ſothly ſuſter myne quod ſhe nowe ducheſſes ye ſykerde regals athene hereafter lykely quenes ſaued fro hys deth kynges ſonne euer gentyl woman wonne ſaue gentyl man enforth myght honeſt cauſe namely right thīketh wyght ought v herof blame ne bearen v therfore yuel name ſhortly thys mater make thys theſeus hath leaue ytake euery poynte perfourmed dede ye haue couenaunt herde rede wepē clew thing yt haue ſayd gayler houſe ylayd ther mynotaur hath dwellyng ryght faſte dore hys entryng theſeus ladde vnto hys deth forth vnto thys mynota • geth teachyng adriane ouercame thys beeſt hys bane cometh clewe agayne ful priuely whan thys beeſt hath ſlayne gayler gotten hath barge hys wyues treaſure gan charge toke hys wyfe eke ſuſter fre gayler wyth hem al thre ſtole away lande nyght countre enupye hym dyght frende hys knowyng feeſten daūſen ſing hys armes hath thys adriane ye beeſt hath kepte fro bane get hym noble barge anone hys countrey folke ful great wone taketh leaue homward ſayleth yle amydde wylde ſee dwelte creature none saue wylde beeſtes ful many one made hys ſhyppe londe ſette yle halfe daye lette ſayd lande muſt reſt maryners haue done ryght leſte tel ſhortly thys caſe whan ariadne hys wyfe ſlepe ſuſter fayrer ſhe taketh hand forth goth ſhyppe traytour ſtale away whyle thys ariadne ſlepe lay hys countreywarde ſayleth blyue twenty dyuelway wynde hym dryue founde hys father drenched ſee lyſt ſpeake hym parde theſe falſe louers poyſon bane wol turne agayne adriane wyth ſlepe weryneſſe ytake ful ſoroufully herte may awake ala myne herte hath pyte ryght dawnyng awaketh ſhe gropeth bed fonde ryght nouȝt ala ꝙ ſhe euer wrought betrayed heere rente ſtronde bare fote faſt ſhe went cryed theſeus myne herte ſwete ye may mete myght thus wyth beeſtes bene yſlayne holow rockes anſwerde agayne man ſhe ſawe yet ſhone moone hye vpon rocke ſhe went ſoone ſawe barge ſaylyng ſee colde woxe herte ryght thus ſayd ſhe meker ye fynde beeſtes wyld hath nat ſynne thus begylde ſhe cryed turne agayne routh ſynne thy barge hath al hys meyne inne kerchefe pole ſtycked ſhe aſcaunce ſhulde wele yſe remembre ſhe behynde turne agayne ſtronde finde al naught way gone downe ſhe fel ſwowne ſtone vp ſhe ryſt kyſſed al care ſteppes fete hath fare bedde ryght thus ſhe ſpeketh tho thou bedde ꝙ ſhe yt haſt receyued two thou ſhalt anſwere two one greater parte away gone ala wher ſhal wretched wight become though ſo bote none come home countrey dare drede ſelfe thys caſe nat rede ſhulde tel cōplaynyng ſo longe▪ heauy thyng epiſtle naſo telleth ſhortly ende tell ſhall goddes haue holpen pyte ſigne taurus men may ſe ſtones crowne ſhyne clere wyl ſpeake matere thus thys falſe louer begyle trew loue dyuel quyte wyle ¶here endeth legende ariadne foloweth legende phylomene thou yeuer formes haſt wrought fayre world bare thy thought eternallye er thou thy werke began madeſt thou vnto ſlaunder man al thy doyng fende make ſuch thyng ſuffredeſt yu tereus bore loue ſo falſe ſo forſwore fro worlde vp fyrſte heuen corrumpeth whan ye folke name neuen ſo griſlye hys dede whan thys foule ſtorye rede myne eyen wexen foule ſore alſo yet laſteth venyme ſo longe ago infecteth hym wolde beholde ſtorye tereus whyche tolde trace lorde kynne marte cruel god ſtante wyth blody darte wedded wyth blyſful chere kynge pandyonis fayre doughter dere hyght progue floure countre though iuno lyſte nat feeſt ne hymeneus god weddyng feeſt redy bene ywys fury thre al mortal bronde oule al night aboute balkes wonde prophete wo miſchaunce thys reuel ful ſonge ful daunce laſte fourtenyght lytel laſſe ſhortly thys ſtorye paſſe wery hym tel fyue yere hys wyfe togyther dwel tyl day ſhe gan ſo ſore longe ſene ſuſter ſhe ſawe longe deſyre ſhe nyſt ſay huſbonde gan ſhe pray goddes loue ſhe mote one gone ſuſter ſene come ayen anone el ſhe mote wende prayed hym yt wold ſende thys day day al prayere wyth al hūbleſſe wiſehode worde chere tereus let make hys ſhyppes yare grece hym ſelfe forth yfare vnto hys father law gan praye vouchſafe moneth twaye phylomene hys wyues ſuſter myght progne wife one haue ſight ſhe ſhal come agayne anone ſelfe wyl come gone hertes lyfe wyl kepe olde pandion king gan wepe tenderneſſe herte leue doughter gon yeue leue al thys worlde loued nothyng ſo laſte leaue hath ſhe go phylomene wyth ſalte teares eke gan father grace beſeke ſene ſuſter longeth ſo enbraceth wyth armes two al ſo yonge fayre ſhe whan tereus ſawe beaute array none lyche yet beaute ſhe ſo ryche caſt • iry herte vpon ſo wolde haue howe ſo go wyth hys wyles kneled ſo prayde tyl laſt pandion thus ſayde nowe ſonne ꝙ art ſo dere betake yonge doughter dere beareth key al myne hertes lyfe grete wel doughter thy wyfe yeue leaue ſomtyme pley ſhe maye ſe one dey ſothly hath made hym ryche feeſt hys folke moſte eke leeſt came yafe giftes grete hym cōueyeth yt maiſter ſtrete athene ſee hym brought turneth home malyce ne thought ore pulleth forth veſſell faſte trace arryueth laſte vp foreſt ledde caue priuely hym ſpedde thys derke caue yf lyſte nought badde reſt herte agroſe ſayde thus ſuſter brother tereus wythal ſhe wepte tenderly quoke feare pale pytouſly ryght lābe wolfe bittē culuer yt egle ſmytten hys clawes eſcaped yet ferde waped leſte hente eftſones ſo ſate ſhe vtterly may none force hath thys traytour done dede hath refte maydenhede maugre heed ſtrength myȝt lo dede men ryght cryed ſuſter wyth ful loude ſteuen father dere helpe god heuen al helpeth yet thys falſe thefe hath done thys lady yet miſchefe feare leſte ſhe ſhulde hys ſhame crye done hym openly vyllany wyth hys ſwerde tonge kerfe caſtel made ful priuely priſon euermore kept hys vſage hys ſtore ſhe ne myght neuer aſtarte ſely phylomene wo thyne herte huge bene thy ſorowes wonder ſmert god wreke ſende thy bone nowe tyme make ende ſone thys tereus hys wyfe ycome hys armes hath wyfe ynome pytouſly wepte ſhoke hys heed ſwore foūde ſyſter deed thys ſely progne hath ſuch wo nygh ſorouful hert brake two thus teeres lette progne dwell ſuſter forth woll tell thys woful lady ylerned youth ſhe worken enbrauden couth weauen ſtole radeuore woman hath woued yore ſothly ſayne ſhe hath fyl mete drynke clothyng wyl couth eke rede wel ynough endyte wyth penne ſhe coulde nat write letter ſhe weaue fro yere al go wouen ſtames large ſhe brouȝt fro athene barge caue howe ſhe brought thynge ye tereus hath wrought waue well wrote ſtorye aboue howe ſhe ſerued ſuſters loue man rynge ſhe yaue anone prayed hym ſignes gone vnto quene bearen cloth ſigne ſwore many othe ſholde yeue ſhe getten myȝt man anone vnto quene dight toke al maner tolde whā yt progne hath thing beholde word ſhe ſpake ſorow eke rage fayned gone pylgrymage baccus temple lytle ſtounde dombe ſuſter ſyttyng hath ſhe founde wepyng caſtel ſelfe alone ala wo conſtraynte mone progne vpō dombe ſuſter maketh armes eueryche hem taketh thus let hem ſorowe dwell remenaunt charge tel thys al ſome thus ſhe ſerued neuer agylte ne deſerued vnto thys crewel man ſhe wyſte ye may beware men yf lyſte al wolde ſhame done tereus leſe hys name ne ſerue murtherer knaue ful lytle whyle ſhul ye trewe hym haue wol ſayn al brother yt ſo may haue another ¶here endeth legende phylomene foloweth legende phillis proue wel auctorite wycked fruite commeth wycked tre may ye finde lyketh thys ende ſpeke thys nowe tel falſe demophon loue falſer herde neuer non hys father theſeus god hys grace fro ſuch one kepe v thus theſe woman prayen nowe effecte turne matere dyſtroyed troye cite thys demophon came ſaylyng ſee towarde athene hys paleys large came many ſhip many barge ful folke whych ful many one wounded ſore ſicke wo begone haue ſeige longe ylayne behynde came wynd eke raine ſhofe ſo ſore hys ſayle myght nat ſtōde leuer al worlde alonde hunteth hym tempeſt fro derke coulde go wyth waue bruſten hys ſtere hys ſhip rente ſo lowe ſuch manere carpenter coulde amende ſee nyght torche brende woode poſſeth hym vp downe tyl neptune hath compaſſioun thetis chorus tryton al maden hym vp londe fal wherof phillis lady quene lycurgus doughter fayrer vnto ſene floure agayne bright ſonne vnneth demophon londe ywonne weake eke wery hys folke forpyned weryneſſe alſo enfamyned deth almoſt ydryuen wyſe folke counſayle haue yeuen ſeken helpe ſocour quene loken hys grace myght bene maken lande ſome cheueſaunce kepen hym fro wo fro miſchaunce ſycke almoſt dethe vnneth myght ſpeke drawe brethe lythe rodopeya reſt whā may walke hym thouȝt beſt vnto countre ſeken ſocour men knewe hym well dyd honour athene duke lorde theſeus hys father hath ybe hys tyme great renoun man ſo great al hys regioun lyke hys father face ſtature falſe loue came hym nature doth foxe renarde fox ſonne kynd coulde olde father wonne wythout lore drake ſwymme whan caught caryed brymme honorable quene phillis doth chere lyketh wel hys ſporte hys manere agroted beforne write hem yt loue bene forſworne eke haſt legende performe god grace ſende therfore paſſe ſhortly thys wyſe ye haue wel herde theſeus gyſe betrayeng fayre adriane pyte kept hym fro hys bane ſhorte wordes ryght ſo demophon ſame way ſame pathe hath gone dyd hys falſe father theſeus vnto phillis hath ſworne thus wedden hys trouth plyght pyked al good myght whā hole ſounde reſt doth wyth phillis ſo yt hym leſt wel coulde yf lyſt ſo tellen al hys doyng fro ſayd hys countrey mote ſayle wolde weddyng apparayle fyl honoure hys alſo openly toke hys leaue tho ſwore wolde ſoiourne moneth agayne wolde retourne lande let make hys ordynaunce lorde toke obeyſaunce wel humbly hys ſhyppes dyght home goth next way myght vnto philles yet came nought hath ſhe ſo hard ſore ybought ala ſtorye doth v recorde owne deth wyth corde whan ſhe ſawe demophon trayed fyrſt wrote ſhe faſt prayed wolde come delyuer payne reherce ſhal worde twayne lyſt nat vouchſafe hym ſwynke diſpenden hym penne ful ynke falſe loue ryght ſyre dyuel ſette ſoules fyre letter phylles wol write word twayne althouȝ lyte thyn hoſteſſe ꝙ ſhe demophon thy phillis ſo wo begon rhodopeye vpon mote complayne ouer terme ſette betwyxt v twayne ye ne holden forwarde ye ſayde ancre whych ye hauen layde hyght v ye wolde comen dout moone one went tymes foure ye mone hath hyde face sen thylke daye ye wente fro thys place foure tymes lyght worlde agayne yet ſhall ſothly ſayne yet hath ſtreme scython brought athene ſhyp yet came nought yf ye terme reken wolde trewe louers ſholde playne god wote beforne day letter wrytten ne may order charge letter ryght longe therto large ryme haue layde thought ſhe hath wel ſayd ſayd ſayles cometh agayne ne worde ny fey certayne wote ye come quod ſhe loue ſo fre goddes ye haue ſwore vengeaunce fall therfore ye ſuffyſaunt beare payne moche truſted well may ſayne vpon lynage fayre tonge teeres falſly wronge howe coude ye wepe ſo crafte quod ſhe maye ſuche teeres fayned nowe certes yf ye wold haue memorie ought lytell glorie ta haue ſely mayde thus betrayde god ꝙ ſhe pray ofte haue prayde nowe greateſt pryce moſte honour euer ſhal befall thyne olde aunceters paynted whych men may worthyneſſe ſe praye god thou paynted alſo folke may reden forth go lo thys wyth hys flatterye betrayed hath done villanye hys trew loue thought dede ſothly poynt yet maye rede ye ben lyke father thys begyled ariadne ywys wyth ſuch arte ſuche ſubtelte thou thy ſeluen haſte begyled poynt though feyre thou foloweſt certayne arte heyre ſens thus ſynfulfy ye begyle body mote ye ſene wythin whyle ryght hauen athene fletynge wythouten ſepulture buryenge though ye ben harder ſtone whē thys letter forth ſent anone knewe brotel falſe dyſpayre fordyd ſelfe ala ſorowe hath ſhe ſhe beſet ſo beware ye woman ſubtyll foe sen yet thys daye men maye enſample ſe truſteth nowe loue man endeth legende phillis foloweth legende hipermeſter grece whylom brother two whych one called danao many ſonne hath hys body wonne ſuch fals louers oft cō amonge hys ſonnes one aldermoſte loued euerychone whē chyld borne danao shope hym name called hym lyno brother called egiſte loue falſe euer hym lyſte many doughter got hys lyfe whych got vpon hys ryght wyfe doughter dere dyd call hypermeſtra yongeſt hem whych chylde natiuite good thewes borne ſhe lyked goddes ſhe borne ſhefe ſhe ſhulde corne werdes clepen deſtyne hath ſhapen ſhe muſte nedes pytous ſadde wyſe trewe ſtele thys woman accordeth wele though yt venus yaue great beaute wyth iupiter compowned ſo ſhe conſcience trouth drede ſhame wyfehode kepe name thys thought felicyte reed mar tyme yere feble hys malyce hym rafte repreſſed hath venus hys crafte wyth venus oppreſſion houſes mar hys venym hypermeſter dare handle knyfe malyce though ſhe ſhulde leſe lyfe natheleſſe heuen gan tho turne two badde aſpectes hath ſhe saturne made dye pryſon ſhall make mencion danao egyſtes alſo though ſo yt brother two thylke tyme na ſpared lynage lyked hem maken mariage betwyxte hypermeſtre hym lino caſten ſuche daye ſhalbe ſo full accorded vtterly aray wrought tyme faſt thus lyno hath hys father brother doghter wedded ech hē hath torch brennen lampes bryght ſacrifyce ben full redy dyght thenſence fyre reketh ſoote floure leefe rent vp roote maken garlandes crownes hye full place ſounde mynſtralcye ſonges amourous mariage thylke tyme playne vſage thys paleys egyſte ī houſe lord right lyſt thus daye dryuen ende frendes taken leue home wende nyght comen ye bryd ſhal go bedde egyſte hys chambre faſt hym ſpedde pryuely let hys doughter call yt houſe voyded hem loketh hys doughter glad chere ſpake ye ſhall ryght doughter treſour myne herte sen fyrſt yt day ſhapē ſherte fatall ſuſter dome nye myne herte neuer thynge ne come thou hypermeſtre doughter dere take hede thy father ſayeth werke wyſer euermo alderfyrſt doughter loue ſo worlde ny halfe ſo lefe ne nolde rede thy myſchefe good vnder colde moone mene ſhalbe ſayd right ſoone wyth proteſtacion ſayne theſe wyſe thou ſhall deuyſe thou ſhalt deed yt al hath wrouȝt ſhort wordes thou ne ſcapeſt nought paleys thou deed thou conſent werke reed take thys fearfull concluſyon thys hypermiſter caſte eyen doun quoke doth leefe aſpe grene deed wext hewe lyke aſſhen ſene ſayd lorde father wyll myght god wote ſhall fulfyll confuſyon nyll quod haue none excepcion caught knyfe raſour kene hyde thys ꝙ yſene thyne huſbande bedde go whyle ſlepeth cutte hys throte two dremes warned howe neuewe ſhall bane whych wherfore woll ſyker yf thou ſay nay two ſhall haue byker haue ſayd haue ſworne hipermiſter hath nigh wyt forlorn paſſen harmleſſe yt place graūted hī ther none grace wythal coſtrel taketh tho ſayd herof draught two yeue hym drynke goeth reſte ſhall ſlepe longe euer leſte narcottikes pie ben ſo ſtronge go thy way leſt yt hym thynke longe cometh ye bryd ful ſobre chere maydens ofte manere chābre brought reuel ſonge ſhortly leſt thys tale longe thys lino ſhe beth brought bedde euery wyght dore ſpedde nyght waſted fell ſlept full tenderly begynneth ſhe wepe ryſt vp dredfully ſhe quaketh doth braūche zephirus ſhaketh huſhte argone cyte colde froſt nowe wexeth ſhe pyte herte ſtrayned ſo drede deth doth ſo moche wo thryſe downe ſhe fyll ſuche ryſte vp ſtakereth handes faſt loketh ſhe ala ſhall myne handes bloody mayde nature ſemblaunt veſture myne handes ben ſhapen knyfe reue man fro hys lyfe dyuell haue wyth knyfe ſhall haue throte corue two ſhall blede ala ſhende nedes thys thynge mote haue ende mote nedes leſe lyfe nowe certes quod ſhe ſens hys wyfe hath fayth yet bette deed wyſely honeſte traytour lyuynge ſhame may erneſt game ſhall awake ryſe go hys way thys gutter er day wept full tenderly vpon hys face armes gan hym embrace hym ſhe roggeth awaketh ſofte wyndowe lepe fro lofte whē ſhe hath warned hym hym boote thys lino ſwyfte lyght foote ran full good paas thys ſely woman ſo weake ala helpeleſſe ſo er ſhe ferre wente cruell father dyd hente ala lyno arte thou ſo vnkynde ne haſte thou remembred thy mynde taken ledde forth wyth ſhe ſawe gone away ſhe myght ſo faſte go ne folowen hym ſhe ſate downe ryght tho tyll ſhe caught fettred priſon thys tale ſayd thys concluſyon ¶thus ende legendes good woman ¶a goodly balade chaucer mother norture beſt loued freſheſt floure whō good thrift god ſēde chylde yf luſt ſo call vnable ſelfe ſo pretende dyſcrecion recomende myne herte wyth euery circūſtaūce hooly vnder gouernaunce moſte deſyre haue euer ſhall thing might herts eaſe amēde haue excuſed power ſmall natheleſſe ryght ye ought cōmende good wyll whych fayne wolde entende ſeruyce ſuffyſaunce holy vnder gouernaunce meulx vn herte whych neuer ſhall apall aye freſhe newe ryght glad dyſpende tyme ſeruyce ſo befal beſechynge excellence defende ſympleneſſe yf ignoraunce offende wyſe ſyth myne affyaunce holy ben vnder gouernaunce dayſy lyght grounde comforte sunnes doughter ye hyght rede whē weſtreth farwel dyſporte nature anone ryght pure drede ye rude nyght yt wyth boyſtous wede darkeneſſe ſhadoweth emyſpere cloſen ye lyues lady dere dawynge daye hys kynde reſorte phebꝰ father wt ſtremes rede adorneth morowe conſumynge ſorte myſty cloudes wolden ouerlede trewe humble hertes wyth myſtyhede nere comforte dayes eyen clere dyſcloſe ſprede lyues lady dere ie vouldray great god dyſpoſeth maketh caſuell hys prouidence suche thinge mās frele wytte purpoſeth beſt yf conſcience grutche humble pacience receyue god ſayeth wythout fable faythfull herte euer acceptable cautels ſo vſeth gladly gloſeth eſchewe ſuche ryght hygh prudence ye ſayd one herte oppoſeth wrytynge iapes abſence pleaſed moche better preſence yet ye excuſable faythfull herte euer acceptable quaketh penne ſpyrit ſuppoſeth writing ye fynd wol ſome offēce myn hert welkneth thus ſone anon riſeth hotte colde efte feruence myſſe cauſed negligence malyce therfore beth mercyable faythfull herte euer acceptable ¶lenuoye ¶forth cōplaynt forth lackynge eloquence forth lytell lettre endytynge lame haue beſought ladyes ſapience thy behalfe accepte game thyne inabilite thou ſame abyde haue yet ie ſerue ioueſſe forth cloſe holy venus name ſhall vncloſe hertes gouernereſſe ¶finis ¶thus endeth thys balade foloweth boke boecius de conſolatione philoſophie ¶boetius de conſolatione philoſophie fyrſt boke boecius carmina qui quondam ſtudio florente peregi flebilis heu meſtos cogor inire modos ala wepynge conſtrayned begyn vers ſoroufull mater whylom flouriſſhynge ſtudye made delitable dytees lo rendynge muſes poetes endyten thynges written drery teeres laſt drede ne myght ouercome tho muſes ne felowes folouden way ſay whan exiled youthe whylom weleful grene comforten nowe ſoroufull wyerdes olde man elde comen vnwarely vpon haſted ye harmes haue ſorowe hath cōmaunded hys age heeres hore arne ſhadde ouertymelyche vpon heed▪ ſlacke ſkynne trembleth myn empted body thylke dethe men weleful ne cometh nat yeres beſwete cometh wretch often ycleped ala ala howe deefe eere dethe cruel turneth awaye fro wretch nayeth cloſe wepynge eyen whyle fortune vnfaythfull fauoured wyth lyght goodes ſoroufull houre ſaye dethe almoſte dreynt myn heed nowe fortune cloudy hathe chaunged deceyuable chere mewarde myne vnpytous lyfe draweth alonge vnagreable dwellynges ye frendes wherto auaunted ye ben welefull hath fallen ſtode ſtedfaſt degre hec dum mecum tacitus ipſe reputarem queremoniam que lachrimabilem ſtili officio deſignarem aſtitiſſe mihi ſupra verticem viſa eſt mulier reuerendi admodum vultus oculis ardentibus vltra communem c meane whyle ſtyl recorded theſe thynges ſelfe marked wepely complaynt wyth offyce poyntell ſaugh ſtondynge abouen hyght myne heed woman full great reuerence ſemblaunte eyen brennynge clere ſeyng ouer commen myght men wyth lyuely colour wyth ſuche vigour ſtrength ne myght nat ben nempned ſo ſhe full ſo great age men ne wolden nat trowē maner ſhe elde ſtature doutous iugemēt ſomtyme ſhe conſtrayned ſhronke ſeluen lyke commen meſure men ſomtyme ſemed ſhe touched heuen wyth height heed whā ſhe houe heed hyer ſhe perced ſelfe heuen ſo ſyght men lokynge ydell clothes maked ryght delye thredes ſubtyll crafte perdurable matiere whiche clothes ſhe wouen wyth owne handes knewe well ſelfe declaryng ſhewyng beaute clothes derkneſſe forleten diſpyſed elde duſked derked wonte derke ſmoked ymages ye nethereſt hēme bordure theſe clothes men redde ywouen therin grekiſhe ſignifieth lyfe actyue aboue letter hyeſt bordoure grekyſſhe c ſignyfyeth lyfe contemplatyfe bytwene theſe two letter ſene degree nobly wrought maner ladder degree men might clymben nethereſt lettre vppereſt natheleſſe handes ſome men hadden kerue clothe violence ſtrength euerych man hem borne awaye ſuche peces myght geten forſothe thys foreſayde woman bare ſmale bookes right hande lyfte hande ſhe bare ſceptre whan ſhe ſawe theſe poetycall muſes approchyng aboute bed enditynge wordes wepynges ſhe lytell amoued glowed wyth cruell eyen ꝙ ſhe hath ſuffred approchen thys ſycke man theſe comen trompettes whych place men callen theatre whiche onelye ne aſwagen nat hys ſorowes remedy wold feden nouriſhe hym wyth ſwete venym forſothe ben tho thornes prickynges talētes affection ben nothing fructuous profytable diſtroyen corne plentuous fruites reaſon holden hertes men vſage ne delyuer folke fro maladye yf muſes wythdrawen fro wyth youre flatteryes anye vnconnynge vnprofytable man ben wonte fynde comenly among people wolde well ſuffre laſſe greuouſly ſuche vnprofytable man myne entente nothyng endamaged ye wythdrawen fro man hathe ben nouryſſhed ſtudyes ſcholes eleaticis achademicis grece goth nowe rather awaye ye mermaydens whyche ben ſwete tyll laſte ſuffreth thys man cured heled muſes ſaye notefull ſciences thus thys companye muſes yblamed taſten wrothly chere downwarde erthe ſhewynge reedneſſe ſhame paſſed • n ſoroufully threſſholde whome ſyght plounged teeres derked ſo ne might nat knowe woman ſo imperyall auctorite woxe abaſſhed ſtonyed caſt ſyght downe erthe began ſtyll abyde ſhe wolde done afterwarde came ſhe nere ſet downe vpon vttereſt corner bedde ſhe beholdynge chere caſte erthe heauy greuous wepyng cōplayned wyth theſe wordes ſhall ſayne perturbacion thought heu quam precipiti merſa profundo men hebet propria luce relicta tendit ad externas ire tenebras terrenis quoties flatibus acta creſcit immenſum noxia cura hic quondam celo liber aperto c ala thought man dreynt ouerthrowyng depneſſe dulleth forletteth propre clereneſſe mynting gone forayne derkeneſſe ofte hys anoyous buſynes wexeth without meſure driuen wyth worldely wyndes man whylom free heuen open knowen wonte gone heuenly pathes ſawe lightneſſe reed ſunne behelde ſterres colde moone whiche ſterre heauen vſeth wandrynge recourſes yflytte dyuers ſpheres thys man ouercomer comprehended thynge nombre acomptyng aſtronomye ouer wont ſeken cauſes whence ye ſownyng wyndes mouen beſyen ſmothe water ſee ſpyrite tourneth ſtable heuen ſterre ryſeth reed eſte fallen weſtren wawes attempreth luſty houres fyrſt ſommer ceaſon hyghteth apparayleth erth wyth roſy floures maketh plentuous autumpne full yeres fleten wyth heuy grape eke thys man wonte tell dyuers cauſes nature hydde ala howe lightly empted lyght hys thought hys necke preſſed wyth heuy cheynes beareth hys chere enclyned downe great weight conſtrayned loken fole erthe sed magi medicine inquit tempus eſt quam querele boe tū vero totis intenta luminibus philo tune ille e • qui noſtro quondam lacte nutritus noſtriseducaius alimē ti ī virilis animi robur cuaſeras▪ c bvt tyme nowe medicine ꝙ ſhe thā complaynte forſothe ſhe entendyng warde wyth lokyng eyen ſayde ar • e thou ꝙ ſhe whylom nouriſhed mylke foſtred wyth mete eſcaped comen corage parfayte man certes yaue ſuche armures yf thou thy ſelfe ne haddeſt fyrſte caſte hem awaye ſhulden haue defended ſykerneſſe may nat ouercomen knoweſt thou art thou ſtil ſhame aſtonyeng leuer ſhame ſemeth aſtonyenge hathe oppreſſed whan ſhe ſawe onely ſtyll rather wythout offyce tonge dombe ſhe layde hande ſoftely vpon breſte ſayde peryll ꝙ ſhe fallen lytarge whiche comune ſyckneſſe hertes ben diſceyued hath lytell foryeten ſelfe certes ſhall lightly remembren hym ſelfe yf ſo hath knowen nowe maye doone ſo wyll wype hys eyen lytell derked cloude mortall thynges theſe wordes ſayd ſhe wyth lappe garnemē • yplited froūce ſhe dried myne eyen full wawes wepynges tunc diſcuſſa liquerunt nocte tenebre luminibuſ que prior redit vigor vt cum precipiti glomerantur ſidera choro nimboſiſ que polus ſtetit imbribus sol latet ac non dum celo venientibus aſtris c thus whan nyght diſcuſſed away derkeneſſe lete myne eyen repayred agayn firſt ſtrēgth right enſample ſonne hydde whan ſterres ben couerde cloudes ſwyfte wynde hyght chorus firmament ſtante derked wete plungy cloudes ſterres aperen vpon heuen ſo nyght ſemeth ſprad vpon erthe wynde hight boreas yſent caue coūtrey trace beateth thys nyght ſayne chaſeth awaye diſcouereth cloſed daye ſhyneth phebus yſhaken ſodayne lyght ſmyteth hys beames marueylyng eyen haud aliter triſticie nebulis diſſolutis hauſi celum ad cognoſcendā medicantis faciem mentem recepi ita que vbi eā deduxi oculos intuitum que defixi reſpicio nutricem meam • cuius ab adoleſcentia c right ſo wyſe ye cloudes ſorowe diſſolued done away toke heuen receyued mynde knowen face phiſycien ſo ſette myne comen thou arte made coulpable wyth falſe blame quod ſhe norice ſhulde forſake nowe ſhulde parten comen trauayle ye charge thou haſte ſuffred enuy name certes lefull ne ſyttyng philoſophie leten wythout company way yt innocent shuld redoute blame agriſe though befallen new thyng troweſt thou philoſophie nowe alder fyrſte aſſayled peryls folke wycked maner haue ſtryuen wyth full great ſtryfe ne ſufficeth onely loken thyng preſent eyen man wiſdome loketh meaſureth thende thynges ſame chaungynge one another ſayne aduerſyte proſperyte makethe manaces fortune ne bene dreden ne flateryng deſyred thus laſt behouethe ſuffren wyth euen wyll pacience al done wythin floure fortune ſay worlde ſyth thou haſt one put thy necke vnder ye yoke thou wolt writen lawe wending dwellyng fortune whyche thou haſte choſen frely bene thy lady art thou wrongfull makeſte fortune wrothe aſper thyne impacience yet thou mayſt chaungen thou cōmytteſt takeſte thy ſayles wynde thou ſhalte ſhouen nat thyder thou woldeſte whyder wynde ſhoueth thou caſteſte thy ſeedes feldes thou ſhouldeſte haue mynd yt eares ben amonges otherwhile plenteous otherwhile bareyn thou haſt betaken thy ſelfe gouernaunce fortune thy behoueth ben abeyſaunt maners thy lady enforceſte thou areſten wyth holdē ſwyftneſſe ſweygh turning whele thou fole mortall fooles yf fortune began dwell ſtable ſhe ceſſed ben fortune hec cum ſuperba verterit vice dextra exeſtuantis fertur euripi dudū tremendos ſe • proterit reges humilem que victi ſubleuat fallax vultū nō illa dura meſiros audit haud curat fletus c whā fortune wyth proud ryght hande turned chaunging ſtoundes ſhe fareth lyke maners boylynge eurype gloſa euripe arme ſee ye ebbeth ſloweth ſomtyme ſtreme ſyde ſomtyme text crewel fortune caſteth adoun kinges whylom weeren ydrad ſhe diſceiuable enhaunceth vp humble cheer hym diſcomfyted ne ſhe nether hereth ne recketh wretched wepynges ſhe ſo harde ſhe laugheth ſcorneth wepyng hem ſhe hath maked wepe frewil thus ſhe playeth thus ſhe proueth ſtrēgthes ſheweth great wonder al ſeruaūtes yf wyghte ſeen welefull ouerthrowe hour vellem autem pauca tecum fortune ipſius verbis agitare tu igitur ius poſtulet animaduerte p quid tu homo ream agis quotidianis querelis c certes wolde pleden wyth fewe thynges vſyng wordes fortune take hede thy ſelfe yf ſhe aſke ryght thou man wherfore makeſte thou gyltye thine euerye dayes playnynges wronge haue done goodes haue beraft yt thyne striue pleate wyth iudge yu wylt poſſeſſion rycheſſes dignites yf thou mayſt ſhewen euer mortall man hathe receyued anye tho thynges bene hys proper wyll graunt frely thylke thynges thyn whyche thou aſkeſt whan nature brought forth thy mother wōbe receyued naked nedye thynges nouriſhed al rycheſſes redye ententyfe thorowe fauoure ſuſtayne maketh nowe impacient ayenſt enuyronned wyth habondaunce ſhynyng al goodes bene right lyketh wythdrawe myn honde thou haſt grace hathe vſed forayne goodes thou haſte ryghte playne though thou haddeſte vtterly forlorne al thy thinges playneſte thou thā haue done wronge richeſſes honour ſuch thinges ben right ſeruauntes knowen lady come wyth departed whan wende dare wel afferme hardely yt yf tho thinges whiche thou playneſte thou haſt forlorne ben thyne thou ne haddeſt lorn hem shal thā defended vſe right certes leful ye heuen make clere day ouercome tho ſame dayes wyth derke nyghtes yere hath eke leaue apparayle vyſage ye erth wt floures nowe frute cōfounde hem ſomtyme raynes wyth colde ſee hath eke right bene ſomtyme calme blandyſhynge ſmoth water ſomtyme horrible wyth wawes wyth tempeſtes couetyſe men maye ſtaunched ſhall bynde ſtedfaſte ſythen ſtedfaſtneſſe vncouthe maners ſtrength ſuch play play comenly turne whirlyng whele wyth tournyng cerkle glad chaungen loweſte hyeſt hyeſt loweſt worthe vp yf thou wolte ſo thys lawe thou ne holde wronge thoughe thou diſcende adowne whan reaſonne playe aſketh wiſt thou nat creſus king lidiens kynge cyrus ful ſore agaſt lytle beforene creſus caught cyrus led fyre brent rayne diſcended heauen reſcowed minde paulus conſull rome whan taken kynge perciens weped pytouſly captiuitie ſelfe kynge thynge bewaylen cryinge tragedyes onely dedes fortune wt aukewarde ſtroke ouertourneth realmes great nobley gloſe tragedye ſayne ditee proſperite tyme endeth wretchedneſſe learnedſt thou grece whan thou yonge entrie ſeller iupiter ben couched two tonne one full good ful harme ryght haſte thou playne yf thou haſt taken plēteouſly good ſyde ſayne rycheſſe proſperitie eke yf al departed eke thy mutable yeueth ye right full cauſe hope haue yet better thynges natheleſſe diſmaye thy thought thou art put cōmune realm ne deſyre lyuen thyne owne propre ryght si quātas rapidis flatibus incitus pontus verſat arena aut quot ſtelliferis edita noctibus celo ſydera fulgent tantas fundat opes nec retrahat manum pleno copia cornu humanum miſeras ideo genus ceſſet ſlere querelas ce thoughe plentye goddeſſe rycheſſe hylde downe ful horne withdrawe hande many rycheſſe ſee turneth vpwarde ſandes whan moued rauyſhyng blaſtes el many rycheſſes ſhynen bryght ſterres heuen ſterry nyghtes yet ye mankynde wold ceſſe wepe wretched playntes al ſo god receyued prayer yeueth hem foole large moche golde apparayleth coueytous folk noble clere honour yet ſemeth hym haue gotten nothing alway cruel rauyne deuouryng haue gottē ſheweth gapynges ſay gapen deſyren yet rycheſſes brydles myght witholden certayne ende diſordinate couetyſe men whan euer rather fleeth large yeftes brenneth hem luſt hauyng certes quakyng dredfull weneth hym ſelfe nedy ne lyueth neuermore ryche igitur ſi pro ſe tecū verbis tuna loqueretur quod profecto cōtra hiſceres non haberes ſi quid eſt quo querelam tuam iure tuearis proferas oportet c therfore yf fortune ſpake wt ſelfe maner ſothe thou ne haddeſte thou myghteſt anſwere yf thou haſt thing wherwith thou mayſt ryghtfully defenden thy cōplaynte behoueth ſhewen wol yeuen ye ſpace tellen boece certaynly quod theſe ben fayr thynges anoynted hony ſwetneſſe rethoryke muſycke whyle hearde ſowne eares ben delicious wretch deper felyng harme ſayne wretch felen harme ſuffre greuouſly remedyes ye delytes theſe wordes may gladden cō fort hem whan theſe thynges ſtinten ſowne eares ye ſorow ſet greueth thought p right ſo doth ꝙ ſhe theſe ne ben yet remedyes maladye bene maner noryſſhyng thy ſorowes rebell ayenſt thy curacion whan tyme ſhall moue aiuſt ſuch thinges percen hem ful depe natheleſſe thou ſhalt wylne leeten thy ſelfe wretche haſte thou foryeten nombre maner thy welfulneſſe ſpeake nat yt ſoueraigne men cytie toke cure keping whan thou orpheſyn father mother choſen affinitie prince cytie thou begā rather belefe dere thā neyghbour thyng mooſte precyous kynde propinquite alyaunce may bē ne ſayd tho thou ne wer ryght welefull ſo great nobley thy father lawe chaſtite thy wyfe thoportunitie nobleſſe thy maſculyne chyldren ſayne thy ſonnes ouer lyſt paſſen comē thynges thou hadſt thy youth dignityes warned olde men deliteth comen ſynguler vpheapyng thy welefulneſſe yf frute mortall thynges maye haue wyght pryce welefulneſſe myghteſt thou euer foryeten anye charge harme myght befall remembraūce thylke daye thou ſawe thy two ſonnes made counſaylours lad togyther thy houſe vnder ſo greate aſſemble ſenatours vnder blytheneſſe people▪ whan thou ſawe hem ſet courte hye chayres dignity thou rethorien pronouncer kynges prayſynges deſeruedſt glory wyt eloquēce whan thou ſyttynge betwene thy two ſonnes counſaylours place hyghte cyrco fulfylleddeſt byddyng multitude people ſprad aboute ſo large prayſynge laude men ſynge vyctoryes tho yaue thou fortune trowe ſaye tho feodeſt thou fortune glorious deceyueddeſt whan ſhe acoyed noryſſhed owne delyces thou bare awaye fortune yeft ſaye ſuche guerdon ſhe neuer yafe priuate man wylte thou therfore laye rekenynge wyth fortune hath nowe fyrſt twinked vpō wycked eye yf thou conſydre nombre maner thy blyſſes thy ſorowes thou mayeſt nat forſaken narte yet blyſfull yf therfore thou weneſt thy ſelfe welefull thou thynges ſemeden ioyfull bene paſſed ny yu ſhuldeſt ſeme thy ſelfe wretche thynges ſeme ſory paſſed alſo art thou nowe comen ſodayne geſte ſhadow tabernacle lyfe troweſt thou ſtedfaſtneſſe man thynges whan oft ſwyft houre diſſolueth ſame man ſaye whan ſoul departed body although ſelde fayth fortunous thinges wolde dwellen yet natheleſſe laſte day man life maner deth fortune alſo thilke hath dwelt therfore weneſt thou darre recke yf thou forlette dyinge el ſhe fortune forlette flyinge awaye cum polo phebus roſeis quadrigis lucem ſpergere ceperit pallet albentes hebetata vultus flaminis ſtella prementibus c whan phebus ſunne begynneth ſpred clereneſſe roſen charyottes ſterre dymmed paleth whyte cheres flambes ſunne ouercommeth ſterre lyghte ſayne whan ſunne ryſen daye ſterre wexeth pale leſeth lyght great lyghtneſſe ſunne whan wodde wexeth rodye roſen floures fyrſt ſomer ſeaſon breth wynde zepherus wexerh warme cloudye wynde auſter blowe fellyche goth awaye fayreneſſe thornes ofte ſee cleare calme mouynge floudes ofte horryble wynde aquilon moueth boylynge tempeſtes ouerwhelueth ſee yf fourme worlde ſo ſelde ſtable yf turneth ſo many entrechaunges wylte thou truſten tomblynge fortune men wylt thou trowen flyttyng goodes certayne eſtablyſſhed lawe perdurable nothynge engendred ſtedfaſte ne ſtable tum ego vera quam cōmemoras virtutum omnium nutrix nec inficiari poſſum proſperitatis mec veliſſimum curſum sed hoc eſt quid c ſaid thus norice al vertues thou ſayſt ful ſoth ne may forſake ye right ſwift courſe proſperite ſayne proſperitye ne comen wondre ſwyftlye ſoone thynge greatly ſmerteth whan remēbreth aduerſites fortune moſt vnſely kynd contraryous fortune haue ben weleful p thou abyeſt thus ꝙ ſhe ye turment thy falſe opinion yt mayſt thou rightfully blamen ne aretten thynges ſayth thou haſt yet many haboudaunces thynges textus al ſo ydle name auēturous welfulneſſe moueth yt nowe leful thou reken many thynges thou haſt yet plē tie therfore yf thylke thynge thou haddeſt precious thy rycheſſe fortune kepte yet grace god vnwēmed vndefouled mayſt thou playne ryghtfully vpon myſchefe fortune ſythē thou haſt yet thy beſt thynges certes yet lyueth good poynte thilke precious honour mankynde symachus thy wyues father man made ſapience vertue mā thou woldeſt bye yt price thyne owne lyfe bewayleth wrōges men doone ſelfe lyueth ſykerneſſe anye ſentence put ayenſte hym yet lyueth thy wyfe attempre wyt paſſynge woman clenneſſe chaſtitie wolde cloſen ſhortelye bountyes ſhe like father tel ſhe lyueth loth lyfe kepeth goſt al mate ouercomen wepynge ſorowe deſyre whiche thyng mot graūten thy wil fulneſſe amenuſed ſhall ſayne eke thy two ſonnes counſailours child age ſhyneth lykeneſſe wytte father elde father ſythen ſouerayne cure mortall folke ſauen owne lyues yf thou knowe thy ſelfe thy goodes make welful yet bene thynges dwelled warde noman douteth ne bē dereworth thā thyne owne life thy drye thy teeres yet euery fortune hateful thewarde ne ouer great tempeſt ne hath yet fallen vpō whan thyne ancres cleuen faſt neither wol ſuffren cōfort tyme preſent ne hope tyme commyng paſſen ne faylen b praye ꝙ faſte mote holden whyles holden howſoeuer thynges ben ſhal wel fleten forth eſcapē thou mayeſt well ſene great apparayles araye lacketh paſſed awaye p haue ſomwhat auaunced farthered quod ſhe yf thou anoye forthynke thy fortune ſayth haue ſomwhat comforted ſo thou tempteſt thus thy fortune ſythen thou haſte yet thy beſte thynges may ſuffren thy delices playneſt ſo wepyng anguyſhous lacketh ſomwhat thy welfulneſſe man ſo ſad greate perfyte welefulneſſe ne ſtryueth playneth ſome halfe ayen qualitie eſtate ful anguiſhious thing condicion man goodes eyther cōmeth al togyther wyght el ne laſteth perpetuell ſome man hath greate rycheſſe aſſhamed vngentyll lynage ſome man renomed nobleſſe kynred encloſed ſo greate anguyſſhe nede thynges leauer vnknowe ſome man aboundeth rycheſſe nobleſſe yet bewayleth chaſte lyfe ne hath wyfe ſome man ſelily maryed hath chyldren nomiſheth rycheſſes ſtraunge folke ſome man gladded child wepeth ful ſore treſpaſſe ſonne hys doughter ne accordeth wyght lyghtly condicion h • fortune alwaye euerye man ſomwhat vnaſſayed ne wote nouȝt el dredeth hath aſſayed adde alſo euery weleful man hath full delycate felyng ſo yf thynges fallen owne wyll impacient vſed haue none aduerſitie anon throwen downe euerye lytell thynge full lytle thynges ben tho withdrawen ſumme perfection blyſfulneſſe fro hem ben mooſt fortunate howe many men troweſt thou wolde demen hem ſelfe almooſte heuen yf myghten attayne leeſt partie ye rēnaunt thy fortune ſame place thou clepeſt exyle countreye hem enhabyten thy nothyng wretched whā thou weneſt ſayth thou thy ſelf ne wyght el ni wretche whā weneth hym ſelfe wretche reputacyon corage ayenwarde al fortune blyſful man agreabylitie egallitie hym ſuffreth man ſo welefull nolde chaungen eſtate whā hath loſt patience ſwetneſſe man welefulneſſes ſpraynt many bitterneſſes whiche welefulneſſe although ſeme ſwete ioyfull hym vſeth yet maye ben witholden ne goeth awaye whan woll well ſene howe wretched blyſfulneſſe mortall thynges neither dureth perpetuel hem euerye fortune receyuen agreablye egally ne delyteth nat bene anguyſſhyous ye mortall folke ſeke ye blyſfulneſſe owne ſelfe whyche put ſelfe erroure follye confoundeth ſhall ſhewe ſhortlye poynt ſoueraygne blyſfulneſſe thyng precyous thy lyfe thou wylt anſwer naye yf ſo thou arte myghtye ouer thy ſelfe ſayne tranquyllitie thy ſoule haſte thou thynge thy power thou noldeſt neuer leſē ne fortune maye bynemme thou mayeſt know blyſfulneſſe ne may ſtande thynges fortunous temporel vnderſtande gather togyther thus yf blyſfulneſſe ſoueraygne good nature lyueth reaſon ne thylke thynge ſoueraynge good maye taken awaye wyſe worthye thynge digne thylke thynge maye take away ſheweth well vnſtableneſſe fortune maye attayne receue blyſfulneſſe yet moreouer man tomblynge welefulneſſe leadeth eyther wote chargeable el wote yf wot blyſfull fortune maye blyndeneſſe ignoraunce yf wot chaūgeable mote alwaye bene adradde ne leſe thynge ne doubteth maye leſen ſayeth mote alwaye agaſt leaſt leſe woteth ryght wel may leſe continuell drede hath ne ſuffreth hym welefull el leſe weneth deſpyſed forleten certes eke full lytle good borne euen herte whan loſte ſayne men doo force loſſe hauynge moch yu thy ſelf art whō hath ſhewed preued full manye demonſtrations wote well ſoules menne ne mowen dyen wyſe eke ſyns clere certayne fortunous welefulneſſe endeth deth body may doubted yf death maye take awaye blyſfulneſſe kynde mortall thyng ne diſcendeth wretchedneſſe ende deth ſythen knowe well manye man hath ſought frute blyſfulneſſe onely ſuffrynge death eke ſuffrynge paynes tourmentes myght preſent lyfe make men bliſfull ſyns thylke ſelfe lyfe ended ne maketh folk wretch qviſquis volet perennem cautus pouere ſedem stabiliſ que nec ſonori sterni flatibus euri et fluctibus minantem curat ſpernere pontum montis cacumen alti bibulas vitet arena c maner folke ware ſtable wyll founden hem perdurable ſeate ne wyl caſte downe wyth loude blaſtes wynde eurus wil diſpyſe ſee menaſyng floudes lette hym eſchewe buylden coppe moūtaygne moyſt ſandes yf fell wynde auſter tourmenteth coppe mountaygnes wt ſtrengthes loſe ſandes refuſen beare heauy weyghtes thy yf thou wylt flyen peryllous auenture ſaye worlde haue mynde certaynlye ſet thyne houſe mery ſeate lowe ſtone although wynde troublynge ſee thondre ouerthrowyng thou arte putte quyete welefull ſtrength thy paleys ſhalt leade cleare age ſcornynge woodneſſe yres ayre sed quoniam rationum iam te mearum fomenta deſcendunt paulo validioribus vtendum puto age enim si iam caduca ac momentaria fortune c bvt moche nouryſſhynges reaſon deſcenden nowe trowe wer tyme vſen lytle ſtrenger medicens vnderſtand ſo ye yeftes fortune ne brytle ne tranſytorye hem maye thyne tyme el ne foule yf loked conſydred perfectlye rycheſſes ben precyous nature ſelfe elles nature mooſte worth rycheſſe golde myght moneye aſſembled certes golde money ſhyneth yeueth better renoume hem diſpenden thylke folke mokeren auaryce maketh alwaye muckerers ben hated largeſſe maketh folke cleare renoume ſyth ſuche thynges ben tranſferred one man ne maye dwell manne certes moneye precyous whan tranſlated folke ſtynten hadde vſage large yeuynge hym hath yeuen alſo yf al money ouer worlde gathered towarde one man ſhoulde make al men neadye certes voyce hole ſayne without amenuſyng fulfylleth together hearynge moche folke whan bene apaſſed nedes maken hem poore forgone tho rycheſſes ſtrayte nedye clepe theſe rycheſſes ſyns many folke ne maye haue ne ne comen one man pouertie folke ſhynynge gemmes call precyous ſtones draweth eyen folke hem warde ſayne beautye certes yf beautie bountie ſhynynge ſtones thylke clereneſſe ſtones hem ſelfe men wonder greatly men maruailen ſuche thynges thyng yf wanteth mouynge ioynture ſoule body ryght might ſemen fayre creature hym hathe ſoule reaſon ſo gemmes drawen hem ſelfe lytle laſte beautie worlde thorowe entente creatoure diſtinction hem ſelfe yet mykel ben put vnder excellencie ne haue deſerued way ye ſhulde maruelen hem beauty feldes delyteth nat mikell vnto b ſhulde delyten v ſith ryght fayre porcion right fayre werke ſayne world ryght ſo ben gladed ſomtyme face ſee whan clere alſo marueylen heauen ſterres ſonne moone phi aperteyneth ꝙ ſhe thylke thynges dareſt thou glorifye ſhynyng ſuche thynges art thou diſtyngued embelyſed ſpryngynge floures fyrſt ſommer ſeaſon ſwelleth thy plentye frutes ſommer arte thou rauyſhed ydell ioyes embraceſt thou ſtraunge goodes thyne fortune ne ſhall neuer make ſuch thinges ben thyne nature thynges hath maked forayne sothe withouten doute frutes erth owē noryſſhynge beeſtes yf thou wylt fulfyll thy nede ſuffiſeth nature nede thou ſeke ſuperfluitye fortune full fewe thynges full lytle thynges nature hathe apayed yf thou wolt achoken fulfyllyng nature ſuperfluityes certes thylke thynges thou wolt threſten pouren nature ſhullen vnioyful vnto el anoyous weneſt thou eke fayre thynge ſhyne dyuers clothynges whiche clothynge yf beautye agreable loken vpon woll maruaylen nature mater thylke clothes el workeman wrought hem doth alſo longe route meynye make blyſfull man ſeruauntes yf ben vycious condicions great charge diſtruction houſe great enemye lorde hym ſelfe yf ben good men ſhall ſtraunge forayne goodneſſe put nombre thy rycheſſes theſe forſayde thynges clerely ſhewed neuer one thylke thinges thou accomptedſt thy goodes na thy good thynges ther beautye deſyred ſhouldeſte thou ſory loſe ſhouldeſte thou reioyſe holden hem yf ben fayre theyr owne kynde appertayneth alſo well ſhoulden haue fayre hem ſelfe thoughe departed thy rycheſſes fayre ne precyous comen amonge thy rycheſſes ſemed fayr precyous therfore thou haddeſt leuer reken hem amōgeſt thy rycheſſes deſyreſt thou fortune ſo greate afare trowe thou ſekeſt dryue away nede abundaunce thynges certes tourneth contrarye certes neadeth full many helpynges kepen dyuerſities precious hoſtilementes ſothe many thynges haue nede many thynges haue ayenwarde lytle thynge nedeth hym meaſureth fyll nede kynde thoutrage couetiſe ſo ye men haue propre good ſette ſuche ye moten ſeke outwarde forayne ſubiect thynges condicion thynges turned vp ſo downe man deuyne beeſt meryte reaſon thynketh hym ſelfe ny neither fayre ne noble yf poſſeſſiō hoſtilimētes ne han ſoules certes thynges ben apayed owne beauty ye men ſemblable god reaſonable thought deſyren apparaylen excellent kynde ye loweſte thynges ne ye vnderſtonden greate wronge done creatoure wolde mankynde moſt worthy noble erthly thing • ye threſten downe youre dignityes benethen loweſt thynges yf good euerye thynge precyous thylke thynge whoſe good ſyth ye demen fouleſt thynges ben youre goodes ſubmytten ye put ſeluē vnder fouleſt thynges eſtimation certes betydeth without youre deſerte certes ſuche condition man kynde onelye whan hath knowynge ſelfe paſſeth nobleſſe thynges whan forletteth knowinge ſelfe broughte benethen beeſtes lyuynge beeſtes han kynde knowen nat hem ſelfe whan men letten knowynge hem ſelfe commeth hem vyce brode ſheweth erroure follye men wenen thynge maye ben apparayled ſtraunge apparelmentes▪ forſoth maye done yf wyght ſhyneth thynges ben put hym thus yf thylke thynges ſhynen whiche man apparelled certes thylke thynges commended prayſed whiche apparelled natheleſſe thynge couered wrapped vnder dwelleth fylth denye thylke thyng good anoyeth hym hath gab thou wolt ſaye naye certes ryches haue anoyed full oft hem han tho rycheſſe ſytht euerye wycked ſhrewe wyckedneſſe gredye folkes rycheſſes whereſoeuer place golde precious ſtones weneth onlye moſt worthy hath hem thou thā ſo beſy dredreſt ſwerde ſpeare yf thou haddeſt entred pathe lyfe auoyde wayfaryng man woldeſt thou ſyng beforne thefe ſaith poore man beareth rycheſſe waye may boldly ſyng beforne theues hath nat wherof robbed precyous ryght clere blyſfulneſſe mortall richeſſe whan thou haſt goten haſt thou lorne thy ſekerneſſe felix nimium prioretas contenta fidelibꝰ arui nec inerti perdita luxu facili que ſera ſolebat ieiunia ſoluete glande nec bacchia munera norat liquido confundere melle nec lucida vellera ſerum c blyſfull fyrſte age men helden hem apayde wyth mete ye trewe feldes broughten forth ne deſtroyed diſceyued nat hem ſelfe wyth outrage wonte lyghtlye ſlaken hunger euyn wyth •• rhornes okes ne coude nat medel yu yefte bacchus clere hony ſayne coulde make piement clarre ne coude nat medell bryght fleece countre seryens wyth venym tiry thys ſayn coude nat dyen whyte fle • e syrien coūtre blode maner ſhelfyſſh men fynden tyrie wyth blode men dyen purple ſlepten holſome ſlepes vpon graſſe dronken rennyng water lyen vnder ſhadowes hye pyne tree ne geſte ſtraunger ne carfe yet hye ſee wyth oores wyth ſhyppes ne ne hadden ſeyn yet newe ſtrondes leden marchaundyſe dyuers countrees tho cruel claryons full huſt full ſtyl ne blode yſhad egre hate ne deyed yet armures whiche woodneſſe enemyes wolde fyrſt mouen armes whan ſawen cruell woundes ne none meedes blode yſhad wolde oure tymes ſhulde turne ayen tholde maners anguiſhous loue hauyng folke burneth cruellye mountayn ethna ay brēneth ala firſt dalfe vp gobbettes weyghtes golde couered vnder erthe precious ſtones wolden haue hydde dalfe vp precious peryls ſayne hem fyrſt vp dalfe dalfe vp precious peryll preciouſneſſe ſuche thyng hath many man ben peryll quid autem de dignitatibus potentia que diſſeram quas vos vere dignitatis ac poteſtatis inſcii celo exequatis que ſi improbiſſimum quem que ceciderint c bvt ſhall ſaye dignytees power whiche ye men neyther knowen dignyte ne power areyſen hem hyghe heuen▪ whyche dignytes power yf comen wycked mā done great domages diſtructions dothe flambe mountayne ethna whā flambe waloweth vp ne deluuy ne dothe ſo cruell harmes certes ye remembre wel trow thylke dignyte men cleape imperye counſaylours whyche whylom begynnyng fredom elder coueyted haue done away dignyte pryde counſaylours ryght ſame youre elder tyme done awaye cyte rome kynges name ſayne nolde haue lenger kynge nowe yf ſo dignytees power ben yeuen good men whyche thyng full ſelde agreable thynges tho dignytees power onely goodneſſe folke vſen hem therfore thus honour cometh vertue bycauſe dignyte ayenwarde honoure cometh dygnyte cauſe vertue whiche thylke dereworth power ſo clere ſo requyrable ye erthlye beeſtes conſyder ye ouer whyche thynge ſemeth ye haue power nowe yf thou ſawe mouſe amonge myce chalenged hym ſelfwarde right power ouer myce howe greate ſcorne woldeſt thou haue gloſa fareth men bodye hathe power ouer body yf thou loke well vpon body wight thyng ſhalt thou fynd freel mankynde whyche men ful ofte ſlayne bytyng flyes el wyth entryng crepyng wormes priuytees mannes bodye ſhall men fynden man may exerciſen haunten ryght vpon man onely hys bodye el vpon thynges ben lower body whiche clepe fortune poſſeſſyons mayſte thou haue euer commaundemēt ouer free corage mayſte thou remeue fro eſtate hys propre reſte thought cleuynge togyder hym ſelfe ſtedfaſt reſon whylom tyraūt wened confounde free man corage wende conſtrayn hym tourmentes maken hym diſcoueren accuſen folke wyſten coniuracyon whyche cleape confederacye caſte ayenſt thys tyraunt thys freman bote hys owne tonge caſte vyſage thylke woode tyraunt turmentes wood tyraūt wende haue made mater cruelte thys wyſe mā made mater vertue thynge man maye man ne maye receyuen ſame thyng folke hym ſelfe thus maye man folke folke ne maye doone hym ſame haue herde tolde buſirides wonte ſleen hys geſtes herbroden hys houſe ſlayne hym ſelfe hercules hys geſte regulus taken batayle manye men affryke caſte hem fetter ſone muſte yeuen hys handes bounde wyth cheynes hem whylom ouercomen weneſt thou myghty hath power doone thyng ne maye done hym hathe yet ouer yf ſo theſe dignytes power hadden propre naturel goodnes hem neuer nolde comen ſhrewes contraryous thynges ne ben wont ben yfelouſhypped togythers nature refuſeth contraryous thynges ben ioyned ſo certayne wicked folke haue dignytees ofte tyme thā ſheweth wel dignytees power ne ben good kynde ſens ſuffren hem ſelfe cleauen ioynen hem ſelf ſhrewes certayne ſame thyng may moſte dignely iugen ſayne yeftes fortune moſte plenteouſly comen ſhrewes whiche yeftes trow ought conſydred mā douteth ſtronge whome ſeeth ſtrength ſwyftneſſe ſothe ſwifte alſo muſyke maketh muſyciens phyſike maketh phyſiciens rethoryke eke rethoriciens nature euery thynge maketh hys propertye ne entremedled wyth theffecte cō traryous thynges certes rycheſſes may reſtrayne auarice vnſtanched ne power ne maketh nat man mighty ouer hym ſelfe vicious luſtes holden diſtrayned wyth chaynes ne mowē vnbounden dignitees yeuen ſhreude folke ne maketh hem digne ſheweth rather openly ben vnworthy indigne thus certes ye haue ioye cleape thynges falſe name bearen hem al countraye name ben ful ofte reproued effecte ſame thynges theſe ylke rycheſſes ne oughtē right cleped rycheſſes ne ſuche power ne ought cleped power ne ſuche dignyte ne ought cleaped dignyte laſte may cō clude ſame thynge yeftes fortune whyche ny nothyng deſyred ne hath ſelfe naturel bountye well yſene neyther ioynē hem alwaye good men ne maken hem alwaye good ben ioyned nouimus quantas dederit ruinas vrbe flammata patribuſ que ceſis fratre qui quondā ferus interempto matris effuſo maduit cruore corpus viſu gelidum pererrans os non tinxit lachrymis ſed eſſe cenſor extincti potuit decoris c haue wel knowen howe many great harmes diſtructions doone themperour nero lete brennen cyte rome made ſlee ſenatours cruell whylō ſlough brother made moyſte wyth bloode hys mother ſaye let ſleen ſlytten wombe hys mother ſene conceyued loked euery halue deed colde body ne teere wette hys face ſo herd herted might dome man iuge deed beautye natheleſſe yet gouerned thys nero ſceptre people phebus maye ſene commyng fro vttreſt aryſyng tyl hyde hys beames vnder ye wawes ſayne gouerned people ſceptre imperyall ſonne gothe aboute fro eeſt weſt eke thys nero gouerned ſceptre people vnder colde ſterris hyghten septentrions ſayne gouerned al people vnder partye northe eke nero gouerned ye people ye violent wynde nothus ſkorelyth baketh brennyng ſandes hys drie heate ſaye people southe yet ne might hys power tourne woodneſſe thys wycked nero ala greuous fortune ofte wycked ſwerde ioyned cruel venim ſay venemous cruelte lordſhyppe tum ego scis quam ipſa minimū nobis ambicionem mortalium rerum fuiſſe dominatam sed materiam gerendis rebus optauimus quo ne virtu tacita conſeneſceret p et ilium atqui hoc vnum eſt c thā ſayd thus thou woteſt wel thy ſelfe couetyſe mortall thynges ne hadden neuer lordſhype haue wel deſyred mater thī ge doone ſayth deſyre haue mater gouernaunces ouer comynaltees vertue ſtyll ſhulde elden ſayn leſte er wext olde hys vertue laye ſtyll ne ſhuld peryſſhe vnexercyſed gouernaunce commune whyche men myght ſpeken writen hys good gouernement p forſothe ꝙ ſhe thynge may drawen gouernaunce ſuche hertes ben worthy noble nature natheleſſe maye drawen tellen ſuche hertes ben ybrought full perfection vertue ſayne couetyſe glorye renome haue wel adminiſtred cō mune thynges doone good deſertes profyte cōmune ſe nowe ſome men iuge worthy prayſing folke iugē worthy tourment herof cometh though man delyteth hym prayſynge hys renome maye wyſe bryngen forth ne ſpreden hys name manye maner people therfore euerye man ought apayde hys glorye publyſhed among hys owne neyghbours thylke noble renome ſhall reſtrayned wythin boundes tho maner folke howe many man ful noble tyme hath wretch nedy foryetyng wryters put mynde done away ſo certes thylke thynges profyten lytell whyche thynges writynges longe derke elde away bothe hem eke auctours ye men ſemen getten pardurabylite whan ye thynkē tyme comynge fyoure ame ſhall laſten natheleſſe yf thou wylte make comparyſon endleſſe ſpaces eternyte thyng haſte thou whyche thou mayſt reioyſen longe laſtinge thy name yf made comparyſon abydyng moment ten thouſande wynter moche bothe tho ſpaces ben ended yet hathe momente ſome porcion though lytell natheleſſe thylke ſelfe nombre yeres eke many yeres therto may multyplyed ne may certes cōparyſoned perdurabylite endeleſſe thynges haue ende may made comparyſon thynges whiche ben withouten ende thinges haue ende may maked comparyſon thy yt though renome longe tyme euer lyſte thynkē thought regarde eternyte vnſtauncheable infynite ne ſhulde ſeme lytell playnly ryght nought ye ſemen certes ye nothyng ryght yf audyence people ydle rumour ye forſaken great worthyneſſe conſcience vertue ye ſeken guerdones philoſophre toke pacience lytell whyle whan receyued windes outrage ſtryuynge ayen reioyſynge hym ſelfe ſayde laſte thus vnderſtandeſt thou philoſophre man anſwerd agayne betyngly ſayd well vnderſtande yf thou haddeſt holden thy tonge ſtyll theſe noble worthy men certes ſuche folke ſpeke ſeken glorye wyth vertue ꝙ ſhe atteyneth fame ſuche folke whan body reſolued dethe laſt yf ſo men werkes vnbounden frome pryſon therthe wendeth frely heuen diſpyſeth erthlye occupacyon beynge heuen reioyſeth exempt erthly thynges ſayth recketh ſoul neuer glorie renome thys worlde quicun que ſolam
