nihil bene mereatur tum ſciliret cum ſe aperit c bvt moch thou ſhalt wenē ꝙ ſhe beare vntretable batayle ayenſt fortune yet ſomtyme befalleth ſhe deceyuable deſerueth haue ryght good thanke men whan ſhe ſelfe openeth whan ſhe diſcouereth frōte ſheweth maners perauenture yet vnderſtandeſt thou ſhall ſaye wondre deſyre tel therfore vnneth maye vnplyten ſentence wyth wordes deme contraryous fortune profyteth men fortune debonayre alwaye whan fortune ſemeth debonayre ſhe lyeth falſly byhetyng hope welfulneſſe forſothe contraryous fortune alway ſothfaſte whā ſhe ſheweth ſelfe vnſtable chaungyng amiable fortune diſceyueth folke contrarye fortune teacheth thamyable fortune blyndeth ye beautie falſe goodes hertes folkes vſen hem contrary fortune vnbyndeth hem knowynge freele welefulneſſe thamyable fortune mayſt thou ſene alway wyndy flowynge euer myſknowynge ſelfe contrary fortune attempre reſtrayned wyſe thorowe exerciſe aduerſyte laſte amyable fortune wyth flatterynges draweth myſwandrynge men fro ſouerayne good contraryous fortune leadeth ofte folke ayen ſothefaſte goodes haleth hem ayen wyth hoke weneſt thou thou oughteſt leten lytell thyng aſpre horryble fortune hathe dyſcouered thoughtes thy trewe frendes thys ylke fortune hathe departed vncouered bothe certayne vyſages eke doutous viſages thy felowes whan ſhe departed away fro ſhe toke away frendes laft thy frendes whan thou ryche weleful ſemed wyth howe mykel woldeſt thou haue bought full knowynge ſayne knowynge thy verye frendes nowe playne rycheſſe lorne ſyth thou haſte founde moſte precyous kynde rycheſſe ſayne thy frendes quod mundus ſtabili fide concordes variat vice quod pugnācia ſemina fedus perpetuum tenent c world ſtable fayth varyeth accordable chaungynges contraryous qualitees elementes holdē amonge hem ſelfe alyaunce perdurable phebus ſonne wyth hys golden charyot bryngeth forth roſy day moone hath commaundement ouer nyghtes whych nyghtes eſperus euen ſterre hath yu ſee gredy flowen conſtrayneth wyth certayne ende hys floodes ſo lefull ſtretche hys brode termes boundes vpon erthe al ordynaunce thynges bounden wyth loue gouerneth erthe ſee alſo hath cōmaundement heuen yf thys loue ſlaked bridels thinges nowe louen hem togythers wolden make batayle cōtinuelly ſtryuen fordone facion world whyche nowe leden accordable faith fayre mouynges loue holdeth togyder people ioyned wyth holye bonde knytteth ſacrament mariage chaſte loues loue endeth lawes true felawes welefull mankynde yf thylke loue gouerneth heuē gouerned corages ¶here endeth ſeconde boke thou haſt remounted noriſſhed weight thy ſentences wyth delyte ſyngyng ſo trowe vnperegal ſtrokes fortune ſaythe dare well nowe ſuffren thaſſautes fortune well defende tho remedy thou ſaydeſt beforn prius fruticibus fal erubos filicem que reſecat c ſo wol ſowe felde plenteous let hym fyrſte delyueren thornes kerue ſonder wyth hys hoke buſhes ferne ſo corne may comē heuy eres greyues hony ye mayſt thou ſurmounten theſe olyfauntes greatneſſe weyght body mayſt thou ſtrē ger bull mayeſt thou ſwyfter tygre beholde ſpaces ſtableneſſe ye ſwyfte courſe heauen ſtynt ſomtime wondren foule thinges heauen certes ni rather theſe thynges wondred vpon reaſon gouerned ſhynyng thy fourme ſayne beautye thy bodye howe ſwyftly paſſing howe tranſitorie certes flyttynge mutabylitie floures ſommer ſeaſon ſo ariſtotel telleth yf men hadde eyen beaſte hyght lynx ſo lokynge folke myght peercen thorowe tho thynges withſtonden ſo loked trayles body alcibiades full fabre ſuperfycie without ſhuld ſeme ryght foule thy yf thou ſemeſt fayre thy nature ne maketh diſceiuaūce febleneſſe eyen looken prayſe goodes body moche euer ye lyſt ſo yt thou knowe algates yt ſo ſayne goodes bodye whyche thou wondreſte vpon maye bene deſtroyed el diſſolued heate feuer thre dayes ſayd thinges may reducen ſhortly ſumme theſe wordly goodes yt ne mowen yeuen yt behighten ne ben parfyte congregation goodes ne wayes ne pathes yt bryngen men blyſfulneſſe ne maken men blyſfull heu heu q̄ miſeros tramite deuios abducit ignorantia non aurum viridi queritis arbore c ala follye whiche ignoraunce myſleadeth wandryng wretch path good certes ye ſeken gold grene tree ne ye gadren precyous ſtones vynes ne ye ne hyden gynne hye mountaynes catchen fyſh ye maye maken ryche feeſtes yf ye lyke hunt roe ye ne go foordes water hyght thyrene ouer men know wel crekes cauernes ſee yhid ye ſloudes knowen eke water moſt plenteous white perles knowen water aboundeth moſt red purpure ſayne maner ſhelfyſh men dyen purpure knowen ſtrō de abounden mooſt tendre fyſſhes ſharpe fyſſhes hyght echynes folke ſuffren hem ſelfe ben ſo blynde hem ne retchen knowe thylke goodes ben yhid whiche coueten plungen hem earth ſeken thylke good ſurmounteth heauen beareth ſterres prayer maye maken digne nyce thoughtes men praye coueyten rycheſſe honoures ſo whan haue gotten tho falſe goodes wyth greate trauayle therby mowen knowen goodes hactenus mendacis formam felici tati oſtendiſſe ſufficerit ꝙ ſi perſpicaciter intuearis ordo eſt deinceps c ſuffyſeth haue ſayde hytherto fourme falſe welefulneſſe ſo yt yf thou loke clerely ordre graūt ſoth p demeſt thou ꝙ ſhe darke thyng noble ſuffyſaūt reuerent myghty el ryght noble ryght clere celebrat renoume cōſydre thā ꝙ ſhe haue graunted beforne ne hath nede nothyng mooſt myghtye cleareneſſe renoume foloweth forſayde thynges hath readye hys ſuffyſaunce b may quod denye mot graunten thynge ryght celebrable clereneſſe renoume nobleſſe phil foloweth quod ſhe adden clereneſſe renoume foreſayde thynges ſo amonges hem dyfferencee boece conſequence ꝙ philoſo thinge ꝙ ſhe ne hath nede forayne thynge maye doo thynge hys ſtrengthes noble honourable mery thyng ioyfull boece whence quod anye ſorowe myghte come thynge ſuche certes maye thynke philoſop mote graunten ꝙ ſhe thynge full gladneſſe yf forſayde thynges ſothe certes alſo mote graunten ſuffiſaunce power nobleſſe reuerēce gladneſſe onelye dyuers name ſubſtaunce hath diuerſitie boece mote nedelye ſo quod philoſophia thylke thynge quod ſhe one ſymple hys nature wyckedneſſe men departeth deuydeth whan enforcen hem getten partye thynge ne hath part ne getten hem neyther thylke partye ny none ne thynge whole deſyre boece whiche manere quod philoſphia thilke man quod ſhe ſe • heth rycheſſe flyen pouertie ne trauayleth hym get power hath leauer darke vyle eke draweth hym ſelfe manye naturell delytes nolde leeſe moneye hath aſſēbled certes maner ne getteth hym ſuffyſaunce yt power letteth moleſtie prycketh fylthe maketh outcaſte darkeneſſe hydeth certes deſyreth onelye power waſteth ſcattreth rycheſſe deſpyſeth delyces eke honour wt power ne ne prayſeth glory nothyng certes thus ſeeſt thou wel many thinges faylen hym hath ſomtyme default many neceſſities many anguiſſhes byten hym whan may tho defautes away forleteth mightye thyng moſt deſyreth ryght thus maye make ſemblable reaſons honour glory delytes ſo euerye theſe forſayde thynges ſame theſe thynges bene ſayne one thynge whoſoeuer ſeketh getten one theſe yt ne getteth deſyreth b ſayeſt thou yf man couete getten theſe thynges togyther p certes ꝙ ſhe wolde ſaye wolde get hym ſouerayne blyſfulneſſe ſhal fynde tho thynges haue ſhewed mowe yeuen beheten b certes ꝙ philo quod ſhe ne ſhullen men way ſeken blyſfulnes ſuche thylk bliſfulneſſe parfyte perfytely maketh man ſuffyſaunt myghty honourable noble full gladneſſe thou ſhalt well knowe haue wel vnderſtanden theſe thynges within hert know wel thylke blyſfulneſſe men verelye yeuen one forſayde thynges ſyns bene one knowe doutleſſe thylke thynge ful blyſfulneſſe p norice quod ſhe opynyon ſay thou arte blyſfull yf thou put therto ſhall ſayne b quod phy troweſt thou anye thynge erthly mortall tomblyng thynges maye bryngen eſtate bo certes quod trowe thou haſt ſhewed well ouer thylke good ther ni nothing ben deſyred p theſe thynges thā quod ſhe ſayne erthly ſuffyſaūce power ſuche thynges erthlye ſemen likeneſſe good el ſemeth yeuen mortall folke maner goodneſſe ne parfyte thylke good parfyt may yeuen b accorde well ꝙ phi ꝙ ſhe moch thou haſt knowen thilke verye blyſfulneſſe eke thylke thynges ben lyen falſlye blyſfulneſſe ſaye diſceyte ſemen goodes nowe behoueth know whence thou mow ſeke thylke blyſfulneſſe b certes ꝙ deſyre greatly haue abydē certes ꝙ deme ſhullen clepe father al godges withouten hym ny nothyng founded aryght p thou ſayeſt aryght ꝙ ſhe began anon ſyngen ryght thus qui perpetua mundum ratione gubernas terrarum celi que ſator qui tempus ab euo ire iubes ſtabliſ que manens da cuncta moueri quem non externe pepulerunt fingere cauſe c thou father ſoueraygne creatour heuen erthes gouerneſt worlde perdurable reaſon commaundeſt tymes gone ſyth age begynnynge thou dwelleſt thy ſelfe aye ſtedfaſt ſtable yeueſt thynges meued ne foreyne cauſes ne ceſſeden yt neuer compoun werke flottring mater forme ſoueraygne good yſet within withoute enuye meued frely thou art alderfayreſt bearynge fayre worlde thy thought formedeſt world thy lykeneſſe ſemblable fayre worlde thy thought thou draweſt thynge thy ſoueraygn enampler commaundeſt worlde perfetlyche ymaked haue frely abſolute perfyte partyes thou byndeſt elementes nō bres proporcionables colde thynges mowen accorden wyth hoote thynges drye thynges moyſte fyre pureſt ne fle ouerhye ne heuyneſſe ne drawe notte adowne ouerlow erthes plonged water thou knytteſt togyther meane ſoule treble kynde mouyng al thinges deuideſt membres acccording whan thus deuyded hath aſſembledde amouynge roundes goeth turne agayne hym ſelfe enuyroneth full depe thought turneth heauen ſemblable ymage thou euen lyke cauſes enhaunceſt ſoules leſſe lyues hablynge hem heyght lyght wayne carte thou ſoweſt hem heuen erth whan conuerted thy benigne lawe thou makeſt hem retourne ayen ayen leding fyre father yeue thou thought ſtyen vp thy ſtrayte ſete graūt enuyronne well good ye lyght yſounde graunt hym fyxen clere ſyghtes corage ſcatre thou breake weyghtes cloudes erthly heuyneſſe ſhyne thou thy brightneſſe thou clerenſſe art thou arte peſyble reſt debonayre folke thou thy ſelfe art begynnynge bearer leader path terme loke ende quoniam igitur q̄ ſit imperfecti que etiam perfecti boni forma vidiſti nunc demonſtrandum reor c moche thou haſt ſene fourm good ny parfyt forme good parfyte nowe trowe good ſhewe perfection blyſfulneſſe ſet thynge trowe ſhall fyrſt enquyre weten yf ſuche maner good thylke good thou haſt • fynyſhed lytle beforne ſayn ſoueraygne good may founden nature thinges vayne ymaginacion thought ne diſceiue v put v ſothfaſtneſſe thilke thynge ſubmytted v maye denyed thylke ne ryght well goodes al thyng cleped imparfyte proued imparfyte amenuſynge perfection thynge parfyte herof cōmeth euerye thyng generall yf men ſene thyng vnparfyte certes thilke thyng generall mote ſome thynge perfyte yf ſo perfection done awaye menne maye thynke ne ſaye whence thylke thynge cleped imperfyte nature ne toke nother beginnyng thynges amenuſed imperfyte procedeth thynges ben al hole abſolute diſcendeth ſo downe vttreſt thynges thynges empty without frute haue ſhewed lytell beforne yf blyſfulneſſe freyle vayne imparfyte maye man dout ni ſomblyſfulneſſe ſadde ſtedfaſt parfyte b concluded ꝙ fermely ſothfaſtly p conſydre alſo ꝙ ſhe whome bliſfulneſſe inhabyteth cōmune accorde conceyte courage men proueth graunteth ye god prince thynges good ſo nothynge may • houȝt better good may douted nothing ni better thā ni good certes reaſon ſheweth god ſo good proueth force parfyte good hym yf god ni ſuche ne maye ben prince thyng certes ſomthyng poſſeſſynge ſelfe parfyte good ſhulde worthy god ſhulde ſemen thilk thynge fyrſt older god haue ſhewed apertly thynges yt bene parfyte ben fyrſt thinges bene imparfyte thy moch reaſon proceſſe ne goo awaye without ende owē graunten ſouerayne good ryghtfull ſouerayn parfyte good haue beknowe confeſſe ryght dignly god right worthy aboue al thinges yf ſo yt good nature dyuers hym wenynge reaſon ſyns ſpeken god prynce thynges fayne ſo fayne maye conioyned theſe thynges togyther eke thou haſt ſayd ryghtfully quod philoſo haue graūted quod ſhe ſouerayne good blyſfulneſſe boece ſoth quod philoſophye quod ſhe moten nedes graunten confeſſen thilke ſame ſouerayne good god boece certes quod ne maye denye ne withſtande reaſons purpoſed ſe well foloweth ſtrength premiſſes phylo loke nowe quod ſhe yf proued yet fermely thus ne mowē ben ſouerayne goodes bene dyuers amonge hem ſelfe certes goodes ben dyuers amonge hem ſelfe one ne mowen neither hem parfyte ſo eyther hem lacketh ny parfyte men maye ſene apertly ny ſouerayne thynges ben ſoueraynly good ne mowen waye dyuers haue well concluded blyſfulneſſe god bene ſouerayne good whyche mote neades bene ſouerayne blyſfulneſſe ſouerayne dignitie boce nothynge quod ſothefaſt ne ferme reaſon ne worthye thynge god may concluded philoſophy vpon theſe thinges quod ſhe ryght theſe geometriciēs whan haue ſhewed theyr propoſitions ben wonte bryngen thynges clepen porriſmes declaracions forſaid thynges ryght ſo woll yeue corallarye mede crowne moche gettynge blyſfulneſſe men bene maked blyſfull blyſfulneſſe dignitie manifeſt open gettynge dignitie men bē maked blyſfull ryght gettynge iuſtyce gettyng ſapyence maked wyſe ryghte ſo nedes ſemblable reaſon whan haue gotten dyuinitie made goddes euerye blyſfull man god certes nature ny one god participacion diuynitie ne letteth ne dyſtourbeth nothynge ne manye goddes boece quod fayre thynge precious clepe thou wilt corollarye porriſme mede crowne declarynge philoſophy certes quod ſhe nothynge ny fayrer thynge reaſon ſhoulde added theſe forſayde thynges boece thyng quod phyloſoph quod ſhe ſemeth blyſfulneſſe contayneth manye thynges weten whether theſe thynges maken conioynen maner bodye blyſfulneſſe diuerſite partyes membres el yf anye theſe thynges ſuche accomplyſſhe hym ſelfe ſubſtaunce blyſfulneſſe theſe thinges ben referred brought blyſfulneſſe ſay chefe hem boece wolde quod thou madeſt clerely vnderſtande thou ſayeſt thou recordeſte forſayde thynge philoſophye haue iudged quod ſhe blyſfulneſſe good boece yes forſoth quod ſoueraigne good philoſo adde quod ſhe thylke good made blyſfulneſſe forſayde thynges thylke ſame blyſfulneſſe demed ſoueraygne ſuffyſaunce thylke ſelfe ſouerayne power ſouerayne reuerence ſouerayne clereneſſe nobleſſe ſouerayne delyte ſayeſt thou al theſe thynges ſay ſuffyſaunce power theſe thynges ben membres blyſfulneſſe ben referred brought ſouerayne good ryght al thynges ben brought chefe hem boece vnderſtonde well quod thou purpoſeſte ſeke deſyre herken thou ſhewe philoſo take thus diſcretion queſtion quod ſhe yf theſe thynges quod ſhe membres felicitie dyuers one ſuche nature partyes membres dyuers membres compownen bodye boece certes ꝙ hath well ſhewed beforne theſe thynges ben one thinge philo ben mo membres quod ſhe el ſhulde ſeme bliſfulneſſe conioyned membre aloone thynge maye done boece thyng quod •• doutous abyde hearken remnaunt thy queſtyon philo open clere ꝙ ſhe thynges ben referred brought good therfore ſuffyſaūce requyred demed good thy power requyred men trowen alſo good ſame thynge mowen thynken coniecten reuerence nobleſſe delyte ſouerayne good ſumme cauſe ought ben deſyred thylke thyng withholdeth good ſell ne ſemblaunce good ne maye well maner deſyred ne requyred contrarye though thynges nature ne ben good algates yf men wenen ben good yet ben deſyred though verelye good therefore ſayde men ought wene ryght bountie bene ſouerayne fyne cauſe thynges bene requyren certes thilke cauſe mē requiren thing ſemeth thilke ſame thyng moſt deſyred thus yf wyghte wolde ryden cauſe heale ne deſyreth ſo moch ye mouinge ryden effecte heale nowe ſyns al thynges ben requyred grace good ben deſyred al folke ſame good haue graunted blyſfulneſſe ſame thynge whyche theſe thynges bene deſyred thus certes blyſfulneſſe required deſyred whych thynge ſheweth clerelye good blyſfulneſſe one ſame ſubſtaunce boece ſe quod wherfore men myghte diſcorden thys philoſoph haue ſhewed god blyſfulneſſe one thynge boe ſoth ꝙ phi mowe conclude ſykerly ſubſtaunce god ſet thylke ſame good none place huc oēs pariter venite capti quos fallar ligat improbis catenis terrenas habitans libido mentes hic erit vobis requies laborum c cometh togyther nowe ye bene ycaughte bounde wyth wicked chaynes deceyuable delyte earthlye thynges inhabytinge thought ſhall reſt youre laboure hauen ſtable quyet peſyble alone open refute wretch • ſayne ye combred deceyued wyth worldly affectious cometh nowe thys ſouerayn good god refute hem wyllen comen hym thynges ryuer tagus yeueth wyth hys golden grauels el thynges riuer hennus yeueth wyth hys reed brynke ye indus yeueth nexte hote partye worlde medleth grene ſtones wyth whyte ne ſhulde cleren loking thought hyden rather blynd corage within derkeneſſe lyketh excyteth moueth thoughtes earth hath noryſhed within lowe caues ye ſhynyng heuen gouerned whence ſtrength eſcheweth derke ouerthrowyng ye ſoule ſo euer may knowen thylke lyghte blyſfulneſſe wyll ſayne whyte beames ſūne ne clere aſſentior iu quam cūcta enim firmiſſi mi nexa rationibus cōſtant tū illa quanti inquit tu eſtima bi ſi bonum ipſum quid ſit agnoueris▪ c boece aſſente quod al thinges ben ſtrō gly bounden wyth ryght ferme reaſons philoſo howe muche wylte thou prayſen ꝙ ſhe yf thou knowe thylke good boece wol prayſe quod price wythout ende yf ſhall betyde knowe alſo togyther god good phi certes ꝙ ſhe ſhal reaſon thoſe thinges haue cōcluded lytle beforne dwellē onelye graūtyng b dwellen graūted ꝙ yt ſayne ſayth graunt thy forſayd concluſyons philoſo haue ſhewed ꝙ ſhe thinges ben required many folke ne bene goodes ne perfite bene diuers one frō ye ſo eche hem lacking ne haue power brynge good full abſolute erſte bene good whā naturelly forleteth talent apetyte beynge deſyreth come deathe corruption boece conſyder quod beaſtes haue anye maner nature wyllyng nyllyng ne fynde beeſt yf conſtrayned fro wythout forthe forleteth draw breath ſlepyng weten whyle ſlepen certes beeſtes loue lyuynges ne beynges ne cometh wylnynges ſoule begynnynges nature certes thoroughe conſtraynynge cauſes wyll deſyreth embraſeth ful oft tymes deth nature dredeth ſayn thus man maye conſtrayned ſo ſome cauſe wyl deſyreth taketh deathe whyche nature hateth dredeth full ſore ſome tyme ſene contrary thus yt wyll wyght diſturbeth conſtrayneth nature alwaye deſyreth requyreth ſay yt werkes generacion generacion onely dwelleth ſuſteyned longe durabylite mortall thynges thus thys charite loue euery thynge hathe hym ſelfe ne cometh mouynge nullis elle deuiis falli iu ſe reuoluat intimi lucem viſus c ſo ſekethe ſothe depe thought coueteth bene diſceyued miſwayes let hym rollen treaten wyth hym ſelfe lyght hys inwarde ſyght let hym thus wōder thou beheteſt ſo great thinges ne ne doute thou ne mayſt well performe thou beheteſt praye thys thou ne tarye tel thylke thynges thou haſt moued ph fyrſt ꝙ ſhe thou muſte nedes knowe good folke ben alway ſtrōge myghtye ſhrewes ben feble deſerte naked ſtrengthes theſe thynges certes eueryche hem declared ſhewed good euell ben two contrary yf ſo good ſted faſte ſheweth febleſſe openly yf thou knowe clerely frelneſſe yuel ſtedfaſtneſſe good knowen moche fayth ſentence ſhal ferme haboundaunt woll gone one way woll conferme thynges ben purpoſed nowe thys ſyde nowe ſyde two thynges ben whyche effecte dedes mankynde ſtandeth ſayne wyll power yf one theſe two fayleth ny nothynge maye done yf wyll lacketh ny wyghte vndertaketh wol done yf power fayleth wyll ny ydle ſtante naught therof cometh yf thou ſe wight wolde getten maye getten thou mayſt doute power ne fayleth hym hauen wolde boece thys open clere quod ne ne maye bene denyed maner philo yf thou ſe wyght quod ſhe hath done wolde done thou nyll doute ne hath power done bo quod p euerye wyght maye mē holden hem mighty done thinge ſo moche man myghtye done thynge ſo moche men holde hym myghty ne maye men demen hem feble boece confeſſe well quod phi remembre quod ſhe 〈◊〉 haue gathered ſhewed forſayde reaſons entencion wyll mankynde whyche ladde dyuers ſtudyes haſteth comen blyſfulneſſe boece remembreth wel quod hath bene ſhewed philoſo recordeth nought quod ſhe blyſfulneſſe thylke ſame good men requyren ſo blyſfulneſſe requyred boece recordeth quod haue alwaye memorie fyxed phi folke quod ſhe good eke badde enforcen hem wythout dyfference entencion comen good boece thys conſequence quod philoſo certayne quod ſhe gettynge good men maked good boece certayne quod philo getten good men deſyren boece ſemeth quod p wycked folke quod ſhe yf getten good deſyren ne mowen wycked boece quod p ſo one quod ſhe deſyren good good folke getten good wycked folke doute good folke ne myghty wycked folke feble boece ſo euer douteth thys ne maye cō ſyder nature thynges ne cōſequēce reaſons philoſo ouer thys quod ſhe yf ben two thynges haue one ſam purpoſe kynde one hem purſueth perfourmeth ſame thynge naturell offyce ne may •• thylke offyce naturell foloweth maner thē couenable nature accomplyſheth hys purpoſe kyndly yet ne accomplyſheth hys owne purpoſe whether theſe two demeſt thou meghtye boece yf coniecte quod thou woldeſt ſaye algates deſyre yet herken playnlye p • iloſo thou nyl • e thē denye quod ſhe 〈◊〉 mouement goynge ny men kynde boece forſoth quod philo ne thou douteſt quod ſhe thylke naturell offyce goynge ne offyce offere▪ boece ne doute quod philoſo quod ſhe yf wyghte • e myghtye moue goeth vppon hys • ete another whome thylke naturel offyce fete lacketh enforſeth hym go crepy • ge hys hande whyche theſe two oughte holden myghtye ryght boece knytte forth quod remnaunt philoſophia wyght ne douteth▪ may gone naturel offyce • ete ne myghtye ne maye ſouerayne good quod ſhe • euen lyke purpoſed good badde good folke ſeken naturell offyce vertues ſhrewes enforcen hem getten dyuers couetyſes earthly thynges whyche ny naturell offyce getten thylke ſouerayne good troweſt thou otherwyſe boece naye quod conſequence open ſhewynge thynges haue graū ted nedes good folke moten ben myghtye ſhrewes moten bene feble vnmyghtye philoſophia thou renneſt aryght beforne quod ſhe thys iudgemente ſayne iuge ryghte theſe lech bene wonte hopen ſycke folke apperceyuen nature redreſſed wythſtandeth maladye ſe nowe redy wythſtandynge ſhal ſhewe thylke continuell reaſons loke howe greatlye ſheweth febleneſſe infyrmite wycked folke ne mowen comen naturell entencion leadeth hem yet almoſte thylke naturell entencion conſtrayneth hem demen ſhrewes yf thylke naturell helpe forlettē hem whyche naturell helpe entencion goeth alwaye beforne hem ſo greate vnneth maye ouercomen conſyder howe great defaute power howe greate febleſſe wycked felonous folke ſayeth ye greater thynge coueyted deſyre accomplyſhed laſſe myght coueyteth maye accomplyſhe thy philoſophie ſayeth thus ſouerayne good ne ſhrewes ne requyren lyght medes ne vayne game whych ne maye folowen ne holdē faylen thylke ſūme heyght thynges ſayne ſouerayne good ne theſe wretch ne comen theffecte ſouerayne good enforcen hem onely getten nyghtes dayes gettynge whych good ſtrēgth good folke ful wel yſent ryght thou myghteſt demen hym myghty goynge yt goeth hys fete tyll myght comen thylke place fro whyche place ne laye waye gone ryghte ſo muſte thou nedes demen hym ryght myghty whych getteth attayneth ende thynges whyche bene deſyren beyonde whyche ende ny nothynge deſyre whych power good folke men maye cōclude wycked men ſemen barayne naked ſtrength forletten vertues folowen vyces ny ne knowen goodes thynge feble caytyfe blyndneſſe ignoraunce el knowē wel whych thynges oughtē folowen lechery couetyſe ouerthroweth hem myſturned certes ſo dothe dyſtemperaunce feble men mowe wraſt len ayen theſe vice ne knowe wel forletten good wylfullye tournen hem wylfully vyces thys wyſe ne forletē onely myghty forleten al vtterly wyſe ben forletē comune fyne thynges ben forleten alſo therwythall ben perauenture ſhuld ſemen ſome folke thys maruayle ſayne ſhrewes whych conteynen partes men ne bene ne haue beynge natheles ſo thus ſtante thys thinge ſhrewes denye ſhrewes denye ſymply playnly ne ne haue beynge ryght thou myghteſt fayne carayne man deed man ſo graunt wel forſoth vicious folke ben wycked ne may abſolutely ſymplye graunt ben thylke thynge holdeth ordre kepeth nature thylke thynge hath beynge thynge fayleth ſaye forleteth naturel order forleteth thylke beynge ſet hys nature thou wolt ſayne yt ſhrewes mowen certes ne denye certes power ne dyſcendeth ſtrength febleneſſe mowen done wyckedneſſe whyche ne myght yf myghten dwellen forme doynge good people thylke power ſheweth euydently yt mowē ryght naught ſo haue gadred proued lytell beforn euyll ſo ſhrewes may ſhreudneſſe thys concluſyon al clere ſhrewes ne mowe ryght naught ne haue power moch thou vnderſtandeſt whych ſtrength power haue defynyſhed lytel beforne thynge ny ſo myghty ſouerayne good boece ſoth ꝙ p thylke ſouerayne good maye done none euell boece certes ꝙ philo wyght thē ꝙ ſhe weneth men mowen done al thynges boe man ꝙ yf hys wyt phi certes ſhrewes mowen yuels quod ſhe boece yea wolde god quod ne myghten done none phi quod ſhe ſo myghty done onely good thinges maye done thynges bene myghtye done yuell thynges ne mowen thynges open thynge manyfeſt mowen done yuell ben laſſe power yet proue cōcluſyon helpeth thys haue ſhewed beforne power nombred amonge thinges men oughten requyre haue ſhewed thynges oughten bene deſyred referred god ryghte maner heyght nature mowen done yuell felonye ne maye ben referred god yuell nombre thynges oughten bene deſyred requyred open clere power ne mouynge ſhrewes ny power theſe thynges ſheweth well go • folke ben certaynly myghty ſhrewes doutleſſe vnmyghty clere opē thylke ſentence plato ſoth ſayeth onely wyſemen maye • deſyren ſhrewes mowen h ••• ten hem lyketh deſyre • ſayne come ſouerayne good ne haue power accomplyſhe ſhrewes done hem lyſte b • tho thynges whych delyten wenen attayne thylke good deſyren ne getten ne attayne thert • vyces ne comen blyſfulneſſe quos vides ſedere celſos sol • culmine regis purpura claro intente c ſo couertures • vayne apparaylles myght ſtrypen theſe proude kynges tho • ſeeſt ſytten hygh chayres glytterynge ſhynynge purpure enuyronned wyth ſorowfull armures manaſſynge wyth cruell mouth blowynge woodneſſe herte ſhulde ſene thylke lordes • ren wythin corages full ſtrayte chaynes letherye tourmenteth hem one ſyde wyth gredye venymes troublable yre arayſeth hem floode troublynges tourmenteth ſyde thoughte ſorowe halte hem wery ycaught ſlydynge dyſceyuynge hope tourmenteth hem therfore ſythe thou ſeeſt one heed ſayne one tyraunt bearen ſo many tyrannyes ne dothe thylke tyraunt deſyreth ſyth caſte downe wyth ſo many wycked lordes ſayne ſo many vyces haue ſo wyckedly lordſhyps ouer hym vides ne igitur quādo ceno probra voluantur que probitas luce reſplendeat quo perſpicuum eſt nun quam bonis premia c seeſt thou thē greate fylthe theſe ſhrewes ben ywrapped wyth whyche clereneſſe theſe good folke ſhynen ſheweth well good folk ne lacked neuer mo medes ne ſhrewes •• en neuer tourmentes al thinges done thylke thynge whyche •• thynge done ſemeth ryghte thylke thynge ye mede thus yf man renneth ſtadye forlonge crowne lyeth mede crowne whych rēneth haue • hewed blyſfulneſſe thylke ſame good whych thynges ben done thē thylke ſame good purpoſed werkes mankynde ryght cōmune mede whych mede ne maye dyſceuered good folke wyght ryght thenſforth hym lacketh goodneſſe ne ſhall cleped good whyche thynge folke good maners medes ne forſake hem neuer mo • al ſo ſhrewes waxen woode hem lyſt ayenſt good folke yet neuertheleſſe crowne wyſemen ne ſhall fallen ne fadē fro forayne ſhreudneſſe ne benym men fro ye corage good people pro •• honour yf wyght reioyſed hym goodneſſe taken fro wythout ſayeth yf man hys goodneſſe mā hym ſelfe certes yt • aue hym thylke goodneſſe el ſome wyght myghte bynome hym moche euery wyght hys propre bounte • eueth hym hys mede erſt ſhal fayken mede forleteth good laſt ſo al medes ben requyred mē wenen yt good • olde deme ryght myghtye good parteleſſe mede mede ſhal reguerdoned certes ofright fayre mede ryght great abouen medes remembre thilke noble corallarie yt yaue lytell beforne gather togyther thys maner god hym ſelfe blyſfulneſſe clere certayne good people ben maked blyſfull ben good thylke people ben blyſful accordeth couenable goddes ye mede people ſuche day ne ſhall enpayren ne wyckedneſſe ſhall dryken ne power wyght ne ſhall amenuſe ſayne bene maked goddes ſyth thus good mē ne faylen neuer mede certes mā ne may doute vndepartable payne ſhrewes ſayne yt payne ſhrewes departeth hem ſelfe neuer mo ſo good euell payne medes contrarye mote nedes ryght ſe betyden guerdone good alſo mote payne yuel anſwere cō trarye partyes ſhrewes nowe ſo bountye prowes ben mede good folke alſo ſhreudneſſe ſelfe tourmēt ſhrewes ſo euer enteched defouled wyth payne ne douteth enteched defouled wyth euell yf ſhrewes wollen prayſen hem ſelfe may ſemen hem ben wythoutē party tourment ſyth ben ſuche vttreſt wickedneſſe yt ſaye wycked thewes whych vttreſt worſt kynde ſhreudneſſe ne defouleth ne entecheth hem enfecteth enuenymeth greatly alſo loke ſhrewes ben contrarye partye good men howe great payne felouſhyppeth fouleth hem thou haſt lerned lytel beforne thynge hath beynge one thylke ſame one good thys ye conſequence yt ſemeth well thynge yt hath beynge good yt ſayne ſayeth beyng vnite goodneſſe al one thys maner foloweth yt al thynge fayleth good ſtynteth haue anye maner beyng wherfore yt ſhrewes ſtynten yt thylke forme mākinde ſayne yt fourme body wythout ſheweth theſe ſhrewes whylom men wherfore bene peruerted tourned malyce certes thē haue forlorne nature mankynde ſo bountye proweſſe maye enhaūſen euery man ouer men mote nedes ſhrewes whyche ſhreudeneſſe hath caſte oute condycyon mankynde bene put vnder meryte deſerte men betydeth yf thou ſeeſt wyghte whyche tranſfourmed vyces thou mayeſt wene man yf ardaunt auaryce rauenour vyolence forayne rycheſſe thou ſhalte ſayne lyke wolfe yf felonous wythouten reſte exercyſe hys tonge chydynges thou ſhalte lyken hym hounde yf pryuy awaytour hydde reioyſeth hym rauyſh wyles thou ſhalte ſayne hym lyke foxe whelpes yf diſtempred quaketh yre men ſhall wenen beareth corage lyon yf dredful flyenge dredeth thynges whych ne oughten dredde men ſhal hold hym lyke harte yf ſlowe aſtonyed lache men ſhall holde hym lyke aſſe yf lyghte vnſtedfaſte corage chaungeth aye ſtudyes mē ſhall holde hym lyke byrdes yf plonged foule vncleane luxuryes wythholden foule delyces foule ſowe foloweth yt forleteth bounte proweſſe forleteth man ſyth ne maye paſſen condicion god turned beeſt vela naricii ducis et vagas pelago rate eurus appulit inſule pulchra qua reſidens dea solis edita ſemine c evrus wynde aryued ſayles vlixes duke coūtre narice hys wrandrynge ſhyppes ſee ye yle ther circe ye fayre goddes doughter ſunne dwelleth medleth newe geſtes drynkes ben touched maked wyth enchaūtemētes hyr hande myghty ouer herbes chaū ged hyr geſtes dyuers maners one hem couered hys face wyth forme boor chaunged lyon countre marmorike hys nayles hys tethe wexen hem newlyche chaunged wolfe howleth wolde wepe goeth debonayrly houſe tygre inde ſo godheed mercury cleped byrde archady hath mercy duke vlixes beſeged wyth dyuers yuelles hath vnbounden hem fro peſtilence hys hoſteſſe algates rower maryners hadden thys ydrawen hyr mouthes dronken wycked drynkes woxen ſwyne hadden thys ychaunged hyr meate bread eaten akorne ookes none hir lymmes ne dwelleth wyth hem hoole haue loſt voyce body thought dwelleth wyth hem ſtable wepeth bewayleth monſtruous chaungynge ſuffren ouer lyght hande ſayeth feble lyght hande circe enchauntereſſe chaūgeth bodyes folke beeſtes regarde comparyſon mutacyon maked vyces herbes circe ne myghty al ſo may chaungen lymmes body algate yet may chaunge hertes wythin yhyd ſtrength vygoure mē ſecretour hyr hertes ſayne ſtrength reaſon thylke venymes vyces drawē mā hem myghtely ye venym cuces vyces bene ſo cruell perſen thorowe paſſen courage wythin though ne anoye body yet vyces wooden deſtroyen men wounde thought tu ego fateor quam nec iniuria dici video vicioſos tam et ſi humani corporis ſpeciem ſeruent c ſayd thus confeſſe aknowe ꝙ ne ne ſe men maye ſaye ryght ſhrewes ben chaunged beeſtes qualite ſoules ſo kepen yet forme bodye mankynde wolde ſhrewes whych thought cruell woode woodeth alwaye deſtruccion good men lefull hem done certes quod ſhe ne lefull hem ſhall wel ſhewe couenable place natheleſſe yf ſo thilke men wene ben leful ſhrewes bynommed hē ſo ne myght anoyen done harme good men certes great partye payne ſhrewes ſhulde ben alleged releued ſo ne ſeme credyble thynge perauenture ſome folke mote nedes yt ſhrewes ben wretch ſely whan may full doone parfourme coueyten yf myght accomplyſte coueyten yf ſo wretchydneſſe wylnē yuel wretchedneſſe mowē done yuell without mowyng wretched wyl ſhulde languyſhe without effecte ſythe euerye theſe thynges hath wretchydneſſe ſayne wyl done yuell mowyng doone yuell mote nedes ſhrewes conſtrayned vnſelyneſſes wolen mowen parfourmen felonyes ſhreudneſſes boece acorde ꝙ deſyre greatly ſhrewes loſten ſoone thylke vnſelyneſſe ſayn ſhrewes great hope hye compaſſynges ſhreudneſſe ofte deſtroyed ſodeyn ende ware thyng eſtablyſhed ſhrewes ende ſhreudneſſe ſhreudneſſe maketh wretch muſt nedes moſt wretche longeſt ſhrewe whyche wciked ſhrewes wolde demyn aldermooſt caytyfes vnſely yf ſhrewdneſſe ne fynyſſhed leeſt way vttereſt dethe yf haue concluded ſothe vnſelyneſſe ſhrewdnes ſheweth plainly thilke wretchednes wythouten ende whych certayn perdurable boece certes ꝙ thys concluſyon harde wonderfull graūte knowe well accordeth moche thynges haue graunted beforne philo thou haſte ꝙ ſhe ryght eſtymacyon thys ſo euer wene harde thynge accorde hym concluſyon ryght ſhewe ſomme yt premiſſes ben falſe el mote ſhewe collacyon propoſycyons ny ſpedeful neceſſarye concluſyon yf ne ſo yt premyſſes ben ygraunted ny ſhulde blame argument thys thynge ſhall tell nowe ne ſhall ſeme laſſe wonderfull thynges ben taken alſo neceſſarye ſaythe foloweth purpoſed beforne boe ꝙ phi certes ꝙ ſhe yt theſe wycked ſhrewes blyſfull el laſſe wretch abyen ye tourmentes haue deſerued yf payne iuſtyce ne chaſtyſed hem ne thys ne ſaye nowe mā might thynke maners ſhrewes ben coryged chaſtyſed vengeaunce brought ryght waye drede tourment ne yeuen folkes enſample ſtyen fro vyces vnderſtande yet another maner ſhrewes ben vnſely whan ne punyſhed ſo ne reaſon law correction ne none enſample lokynge boece maner ſhall ben ꝙ hathe tolde beforne phi haue graunted ꝙ ſhe good folke ben blyſfull ſhrewes ben wretch boece yes ꝙ philo ꝙ ſhe yf anye good added wretchedneſſe wyght ny weleful ne hathe medlyng good hys ſolitarye wretchednes boece ſemyth ꝙ philo ſayeſt thou ꝙ ſhe thylke wretche lacketh al goodes ſo good ny medled wretchedneſſe yet ouer hys wyckedneſſe whyche wretche yet another yuell anexed knyt hym ſhall men demen hym vnſely thylke wretche whyche vnſelyneſſe releued participacyon ſome good boece ſholde ꝙ phi certes ꝙ ſhe han ſhrewes whan ben punyſſhed ſomwhat good anexed hyr ſhrewdneſſe ſayne ſame payne ſuffrē good yt reaſon iuſtice whā thilke ſame ſhrewes eſcapen without tourmēt thā haue ſomwhat yuel yet ouer wyckedneſſe han done ſayn defaute paynes whiche defaute payne thou haſte graunted yuell deſerte felonye boece ne maye denye ꝙ phi moche ꝙ ſhe ben ſhrewes vnſelye whan ben wrongfully delyuered fro payne whā ben puniſhed rightfull vengeaunce thys open thynge clere ryght ſhrewes ben punyſhed wyckedneſſe wronge eſcapen vnpunyſhed boece might denye ꝙ philo ꝙ ſhe may anye man denye ryght ne good alſo contrarye wronge wycked boece certes ꝙ theſe thynges ben clere ynough haue concluded lytell beforne pray thou tel yf thou accordeſt letten tourment ſoules body ended deth ſayn vnderſtandeſt thou aught ſoules haue anye tourment dethe bodye phi certes ꝙ ſhe yea ryght great whyche ſoules ꝙ ſhe trowe ſome ben tourmented aſpreneſſe payne ſome ſoules trowe ben exercyſed pourgynge mekeneſſe counſayle ny nat determyne thys paynes haue trauayled tolde yet hyderto thou ſhuldeſt knowe mowynge ſhrewes whyche mowynge ſemeth vnworthy ny mowynge eke ſhrewes whyche thou playnedeſt ne nat punyſhed thou woldeſt ſe ne neuer mo withouten tourmentes wyckedneſſe lycence mowynge done yuell thou praydeſt myght ſone ended thou woldeſt fayne lernen ne ſhulde nat longe endure ſhrewes ben vnſely yf lenger durynge mooſt vnſely yf perdurable thys haue ſhewed vnſely ben ſhrewes whan eſcapen without ryghtfull payne whan bene punyſhed ryghtfull vengeaunce thys ſentence foloweth ben ſhrewes conſtrayned laſte mooſt greuous tourment whā men wene ne nat punyſhed▪ boece whan conſyder thy reaſons ꝙ ne trowe nat men ſayn yborne amonges theſe thynges ſytteth hyghe maker king lorde wele begynnyng law wyſe iuge done equyte gouerneth enclyneth brydles thinges tho thinges ſtereth gone mouynge wythdraweth areſteth affermeth mouable wandrynge thynges yf ne called ayen ryght goynge thinges ne cōſtreyned hem nat eftſones roundneſſes enclyned thynges yt bene nowe cōtynued ſtable ordynaunce ſhulde departen frō wele ſayne begynnynge fallen ſayne tournen naught cōmune loue al thynges thynges aſken bene holden fyne good el ne myghten laſten yf ne come efteſones ayen loue retourned cauſe hath yeue hem beyng ſayne god iāne igitur vides quid hec omnia q̄ diximus cōſequantur quid nam inquit omnem inquit c seeſt thou thing foloweth al thinges haue ſayd boece thynge quod p certes quod ſhe vtterly fortune good boe howe maye ꝙ nowe vnderſtande ꝙ ſhe al fortune wheder ſo ioyful fortune aſpre fortune yeuē eyther bycauſe guerdonyng el exerciſyng good folkes el bycauſe punyſhen el chaſtiſen ſhrewes fortune good whyche fortune certayn eyther ryghtful el profytable boe forſoth ful reaſon ꝙ yf conſyder pourueyaunce deſtyne thou taughteſte alytle beforne thys ſentence ſuſtayned ſtedfaſte reaſons yf lyke vnto let v nombren hem among thylke thynges thou ſaydeſt litle beforne ne able bene wened people p ſo ꝙ ſhe b cō mune worde men ꝙ miſuſeth maner ſpeach fortune ſayne ofte tymes fortune ſome wyght wicked philoſo wylte thou quod ſhe approche lytle wordes people ſo ſeme hem ouer much departed fro vſage mākinde boece thou wolte quod philo weneſt thou quod ſhe thynge profiteth good boece yes quod phi certes thynge exerceth corrigeth profyteth boece confeſſe wel quod philoſo good quod ſhe boece quod philoſo thys fortune quod ſhe hem eyther put vertue bataylen ayenſt aſpre thynges el hem enclynen declinen fro vyces taken waye vertue boece thys ne may denye quod philo ſayeſt thou merye fortune yeuen good people guerdon demeth ought people wycked b naye forſoth quod demen ſothe ryght good philo ſayeſt thou fortune ꝙ ſhe thoughe aſpre reſtrayneth ſhrewes ryghtfull tourment weneth aught people good boe nay ꝙ people demeth mooſte wretched thynges yt maye thought philoſo ware loke wel quod ſhe leſte folowyng opinion people haue confeſſed cōcluded thing vnable bene wened people boece quod philoſo certes quod ſhe foloweth cometh thinges bene graūted al fortune ſo euer hem bene eyther poſſeſſion vertue encreaſe vertue elles purchaſynge vertue ylke fortune good fortune right wicked hem dwellen ſhrewedneſſe ſayeth thus weneth people boece ſothe ꝙ albe ſo man dare confeſſe ne knowe philoſo ſo quod ſhe ryght ſtronge man ne ſemeth baſhen diſdaynē oftime heareth noyſe baytayle ne alſo ſemeth wyſe man bearen greuouſlye oft ledde ſtryfe fortune bothe one man eke thylke dyffyculte matter one manne encreaſe gloryouſe renome man conſerue hys ſapyence ſaye aſpreneſſe hys eſtate therfore called vertue ſuſtayneth enforceth hys ſtrengthes ſo ny ouercomen aduerſyties ne certes thou art put encreaſe heyghte vertue ne haſte comen fleten wyth delyces walken bodyly luſte thou ſoweſt planteſt full eygre batayle thy corage ayenſt euerye fortune ſoroufull fortune cōfound ne mery fortune ne corrūpe occupye meane ſtedfaſt ſtrēgthes euer vnder meane al ouerpaſſeth meane dyſpyceth welefulneſſe ſayeth vicious ne hath mede hys trauayle ſet hande ſayth lyeth power fortune leueſt ſaye good yuel al fortune ſemeth ſharpe aſpre ne exerciſe ye good folke ne chaſtyſe wycked folke punyſheth bella bi binis operatus annis vltor atrides phrigierumis c werker atrides ſayne agamemnon ye wroȝt contynued batayle ten yeare recouerd purged wrekynge diſtruction troye loſt chābres maryage hys brother ſaye agamemnon wan ayen heleyne menelaus wyfe hys brother meane whyle thilke agamemnon deſired yeuen ſayles grekes nauy broughte ayen wyndes bloude vnclothed hym pyte father ſorye preeſt yeueth ſacrifyeng wretched cuttynge throte doughter ſay agamēnon let cutte throte hys doughter preeſt maken aliaunce wyth goddes haue wynd wyth whiche myght wenden troye itacus ſaye vlixes bewepte hys felowes ylorne felowes feirs poliphemus lyggynge hys greate caue fretten dreynt empty wombe nathleſſe poliphemus woode hys blynde vyſage yelde vlixes ioye hys ſorouful teeres ſaye vlixes ſmote eye poilphemus ſtode forheed whyche vlixes ioye whan ſawe poliphemus wepynge blynde hercules celebrable hys harde traueyle daunted proude ceutaurus halfe horſe halfe man berafte dyſpoylyng fro cruel lyon yt ſay ſlough ye lyon berafte hym hys ſkynne ſmote byrdes yt hgiht arpyes certaine arowes rauyſhed apple fro wakyng dragon hande heauy golden metal drough cerberus hounde hell triple chaynes ouercomer ſaid hath put vnmeke lorde fodder cruel horſe ſay hercules ſlough dyomedes made hys horſe freten hercules ſlough dra ſerpente brente venym achileus floud defouled forheed dreynt ſhamfaſt vyſage ſtrondes ſay achileus coulde tranſfigure hym ſelfe dyuers lykeneſſe faught hercules laſt turned bull hercules brake one horne ſhame hyd riuer ouer hercules caſt adowne antheus gyaunte ſtrondes lybi • cacus appeyſed wrathes euander ſay hercules ſlought monſtre cacus appeyſed death wrath euander briſtled bore marked vomes ſhulders hercules ſholders hye cercle heuē ſhulde thriſt ye laſt labour yt ſuſteyned heauen vpon necke vnbowed deſerued eftſones heuē laſt ende trauayle goth nowe ye ſtronge men great enſample • edeth nyce mē make ye backes ſaith ye ſlowe delicate • ſe ye aduerſities ne fyght ayenſt hem vertue wynnē ye mede heuē • • mede ouercomē yeueth ye ſterres yt ſayne whan erthly luſt ouercomen man maked worthye heuen ¶here endeth fourth boke boece foloweth fyfth ¶dixierat orationiſ que curſum ad alia quedam tractanda que expedien da vertebat b tum ego rectum quidem quam c ſayd turned courſe reaſon ſome thinges treated ſped b thā ſayd certes rightfull thine amoneſting ful digne auctorite thou ſaideſt whylō queſtion diuyne purueyaūce enlaced wyth manye queſtions vnderſtande well proue ſame thyng aſke yf thou weneſt hap thynge anye wayes yf thou weneſt hap thyng p ꝙ ſhe haſte yelden aſſoylen det beheſt ſhewē open way way thou mayſt come ayen thy countrey al ſo yt thinges whych thou aſkeſt bene ryght profytable knowe yet bene dyuers ſomwhat fro path purpoſe dout thou ne maked werye myſſe wayes ſo thou ne mayſte ſuffyſe meaſure ryght way b ne dout ther nothyng quod knowen thylke thynges togyther whiche thynges delyte greatly yt ſhall bene ſtede reſt ſyth ny douten thynges folowynge whan euerye thynge thy deſputacyon ſhall haue bene ſtedfaſte vndoutous fayth phi ſayde ſhe maner wol done began ſpeaken ryght thus certes ꝙ ſhe yf anye wyght definyſhe hap thys maner ſayn hap betiding ybrought forth folyſh mouynge knyttyng cauſes conferme hap ny ryght naught wyſe deme vtterly hap ny ne dwelleth voyce ſayeth ydell worde wythout ſignification thynge cōmytted voyce place myght bene lefte dwellyng folye diſordinaunce ſyth god leadeth conſtrayneth al thynges ordre ſentence ſoth nothynge hath beyng naught ſentence none theſe olde folke ne wythſayde neuer al ſo ne vnderſtande god prince begynner workynge caſten maner foundemente ſubiecte material ſayne nature reaſon yf thynge waxen comē cauſes thā ſhal ſeme yt thylke thing comen woxen naught yf thys ne maye done nat poſſible hap ſuch thing haue definyſhed lytle beforne boece ſhal ꝙ ny thyng ryght may bene cleped eyther hap el aduenture fortune ought albeit ſo hyd fro people thinge theſe wordes bene couenable phi myne ariſtotle ꝙ ſhe boke hys phiſyke definyſheth thys thynge ſhort reaſon nigh ſoth b maner ꝙ p ofte ꝙ ſhe men done thynge grace thynge another thynge thylke thyng men entenden done betideth ſome cauſes ycleped hap right man dalfe erth bycauſe tyllynge felde founde gobet golde bedoluen wenē folke befal fortunous betydyng forſoth ny nought hath propre cauſes whych cauſes ye courſe vnforeſeen vnware ſemeth haue maken hap tyller felde ne dolue erth yf hyder golde ne hyd golde place golde ne bene founde theſe bene cauſes abredgynge fortuit hap whiche abredgyng fortuit hap cometh cauſes encountrynge flowyng togyther hem ſelfe entencion doer neyther hyder golde ne deluer felde ne vnderſtoden golde ſhulde haue bene founde ſayd betyde rāne togyther dalfe yt hydde gold nowe may thus definiſh hap hap vnware betydynge cauſes aſſembled thynges ben done ſome thing thilke order procedinge vneſchuable betiding togider ye deſcendeth frō wel purueyaunce yt ordeyneth al thinges place tymes maketh cauſes rennen aſſemblen togither rupis achemence ſcopulis vbi verſa ſequentum pectoribus fugit ſpicula c tigris eufrates reſoluē ſpringē well ye cragges roch coūtrey achemenee fleynge batayls fixen dartes returning ye breſtes hem yt folowē ſone ſame ryuers tigris eufrates vnioynē departen water yf comen togyther ben aſſembled cleped togyther courſe thā motē thilk thinges fleten togyther ye water entrechaungyng flood bryngeth ſhippes ſtockes araced floud motē aſſēblen water ymedled wrappethe implyeth manye fortunell happes maners whyche wandrynge happes natheleſſe thylke declinynge lowneſſe earth flowynge ordre ſlydyng water gouerneth ryght ſo fortune ſemeth fleteth wyth ſlaked vngouerned brydels ſuffreth brydles yt ſayne bene gouerned paſſeth thylke law ſayne dyuine ordinaunce animaduerto iu quam id que vti tu dicis ita eſſe conſencio sed hac hereutium c thys vnderſtāde wel quod accorde ryghte yu ſayſt aſke yf ther lyberte fre wyl thys ordre cauſes cleuen thus togyther hem ſelfe el wolde wyten yf deſtinal cheyne cōſtrayneth mouynge courage men philo yes ꝙ ſhe lyberte frewyll ne neuer nature reaſon ne lyberte frewyll euery thinge may naturally vſē reaſon hath dome decerneth demeth euery thyng knoweth ſelfe thinges ben flyen thynges bene deſiren thilke thynge wyght demeth bene deſyred aſkethe deſyreth flyeth ylke thynge troweth flyen wherfore thynges reaſon hym alſo lyberte wyllynge nylling ne ordeyne nat ſayeth ne graunt nat liberte euen lyke al thynges ſoueraynes deuynes ſubſtaunces ſayne ſpirites iugement clere wyll corrumpe myghtye redye ſpeden thynges bene deſyred ſoules men moten nedes ben fre whan loken hem ſpeculacyon lokynge dyuyne thought laſſe fre whan ſlyden bodyes yet laſſe fre whan bene gathered togyther cōprehended erthly membres laſte ſeruage whan bene yeuen vice haue yfal poſſeſſion proper reaſon haue caſt awaye eyen fro lyghte ſouerayne ſothfaſtneſſe lowe thinges darke anone darken cloude ignoraunce troubled felonous talentes talentes whan approchen aſſenten heapen encreaſen ſeruage whyche haue ioyned hem ſelfe maner ben caytiues fro proper lyberte whych thyng nathleſſe lokyng diuyne pourueyaūce ſeeth al thynges beholdeth ſeeth fro eterne ordeyneth hem euerych merytes ben predeſtinate ſayd greke al thinges ſeeth al thynges heareth puro clarum lumine phebum melli •• ui canit oris homerus c homer wyth honye mouthe yt ſayn homer ſwete dities ſyngeth ſunne clere pure lyght natheles yet ne maye ye infirme lyght hys beames breken percen inward entrayles earth el ſee ne ſeeth god maker great worlde loketh al thynges high ne vnderſtandeth nothinges heuyneſſe erth ne ye nyght ne withſtandeth nat blacke cloudes thylke god ſeeth ſtroke thought thynges bene ſhul come thylke god loketh ſeeth al thinges alone thou mayſt ſame ſunne tum ego en quam difficiliore rurſus ambiguitate confundor c ſayde thus nowe cōfounded harde doute was▪ philoſo doute quod ſhe certes coniecte ſuche thinges thou art troubled b ſemeth quod repugnen contrarye greatlye god knoweth beforne thynges fredom lyberte yf ſo god loketh al thynges beforne ne god ne may bene deceyued maner thā mote nedes yt thynges purueyaunce god hath ſene beforne come whych god knoweth toforne onely yt werkes men alſo counſayles wylles ne ſhall ther libertie arbytre ne certes ne maye none dede ne wyll thylke whiche diuyne purueyaunce ne may diſceyued hath ſealed beforne yf myghten wrythen away maner thā ben purueyed ne ſhoulde ſtedfaſte preſcience thynge comen rather vncertaine opinion thyng trowen god deme felonye vnlefull ne ne proue nat thylke ſame reaſon ſayeth ne alowe ne prayſe thylke ſame reaſon whiche yt ſome men wenen mowe aſſoylen vnknytten knotte queſtyon certes ſeyn thyng ni comen purueyaūce god hath ſeen beforne comen rather ye contrary thynges comen therfore ne maye ben hyd purueyaunce god maner neceſſitie ſlideth ayē contrarye partye ne ne behoueth nedes thinges betyden bene ypurueyed behoueth nedes thynges bene comen ben ypurueyed ytrauayled ſayth ye thilk anſwer procedeth ryght though men trauayleden buſye enquyren thyng cauſe thinges whether preſcience cauſe neceſſitie thynges comen el ye neceſſitie thynges comen cauſe purueyaunce ne enforce ſhewen yt betyding thinges ywiſt beforne neceſſary ſo maner ordre cauſes hath ſelfe although ne ſeme preſciēce bryng neceſſitie betydynge thynges comen certes yf wyght ſytteth behoueth neceſſitie opiniō ſoth coniecteth ſytteth ayen warde alſo cōtrary yf opynyō ſoth wyght ſytteth behoueth neceſſiitie ſyt neceſſitie one one neceſſitie ſyttynge certes neceſſitye ſoth therfore ne ſytteth wyght opynyon ſyttynge ſoth opynion rather ſothe wyght ſytteth beforne thus although cauſe ſothe cōmeth ſyde ſayeth although cauſe ſoth commeth ſyttynge true opynion algates yet commune neceſſitie one thus ſeweth may make ſē blable ſkylles purueyaunce god thynges comen although thynges bene comen therfore bene purueyed certes bene purueyed therfore ne betyde natheleſſe behoueth neceſſitie eyther thynges comen bene ypurueyed god el thynges bene purueyed god betyden thynges onely ſuffyſeth ynough deſtroien fredome arbytre ſaye fre wyll certes nowe ſheweth well howe ferre fro ſoth vp ſodowne thing ſene betydyng temporal thynges cauſe eterne preſcience wenen god purueyeth thynges comen thynge wene thylke thynges betyde whylom ben cauſes thylke ſouerain purueyaunce yt god hereto adde yet thynges ryght whan yt wote thyng behoueth neceſſitie thylke ſelfe thyng eke whan haue knowen thyng ſhal betydē ſo behoueth neceſſitie thylke ſame thynges betyde foloweth betydyng thynges wyſt beforne ne may eſchued laſt wyght wene thyng ben otherwyſe ny vnſcience diſceyuable opynyon full dyuers farre fro ſoth ſcience wherfore yf thing ſo comen betydyng ne certayne ne neceſſarye may weten beforne thylke thynge comen ryght ſcience ne may medled falſeneſſe fayeth yf wote thyng ne may falſe ne wote ryght ſo thylke thynge conceyued ſcyence ne maye none otherwyſe conceyued cauſe ſcience wanteth leſynge ſayth wetyng ne receyueth leſynge wote behoueth neceſſitie euery thyng ryght ſcience comprehendeth ſhall ſayne whiche maner knoweth god beforne al ye thynges comē yf ne certayne yf yt deame ben comen vneſchuably ſo maye poſſyble yt ne ſhullen comen god diſceyued trowen yt god diſceyued ſpeake mouth felonous ſynne god wot ryght ſo thynges ben comen ſo ſhullē comē ſo wot egally ſayth indifferently thī ge maye done el ydone thylke preſcience ne comprehendeth certayne thyng ne ſtable el dyfference betwene preſciēce thylk iape worthy deuyning tireſie deuynour ſayd ſaye quod eyther ſhalbe el ne ſhall elles howe moche worthe deuyne preſciene opynion mankynde yf ſo demeth thynges vncertayne men done dome men betyding ni certayne yf ſo non vncertayne thynges ne may ben ryght certayne well thynges betydyng certayne thylke thynges hath wyſt forne fyrmely comen whiche foloweth fredome counſayles werkes mankynde ny none ſyth thouȝt god ſeeth althinges without errour falſeneſſe byndeth conſtrayneth hem betydyng neceſſitie yf thīg one ygraunted receyued ſayne yt ny fre wyl ſheweth well great deſtructiō great domages folowen thynges mankynde ydle ben purpoſed behyght meedes good folke paynes bad folke ſyth mouyng free corage voluntarye ne hath deſerued hem ſayne neither mede ne payne ſhulde ſeme thylke thynge alderworſt whiche demed aldermooſt iuſt moſt rightful ſayn ſhrewes ben punyſhed el good folke yguerdoned folkes ſene propre wyl ne ſent hem one ne ſayne neyther good ne harme cōſtreyneth hem certayne neceſſitie thynges comen thā ne ſhullen neuer bene ne neuer vyce ne vertue ſhullen rather confuſyon deſertes medled without diſcretion yet foloweth inconuenience whyche ne maye thought nomore felonous ne wycked thus ſo ordre thinges ydle cōmeth ye purueyaunce god ne nothyng ny lefull counſayles mankynde ſayth mē haue power nothyng ne wyll nothynge foloweth vyces ben referred maker good ſayth foloweth god ought haue blame vyces ſyth cōſtrayneth v neceſſitie done vyces thā ny ther reaſon hopen god ne prayen god ſhulde wight hopen god ſhuld prayē god ſith ordynaunce deſteny ye ne maye ben enclyned knytteth ſtreyneth thynges men may deſyren thā ſhulde done away thylke onelye alyaunce bytwene god man ſayne hopen prayen pryce ryghtouſneſſe mekeneſſe deſeruen guerdon diuyne grace whiche yt ineſtimable ſay ſo gret ne may ben ful prayſed maner ſaye hope prayer ſemeth mē woll ſpeke god reaſon ſupplication bē conioyned thylke clereneſſe ny approchen rather men ſekē impetren yf men ne wene ye hope ne prayer ne haue ſtrengthes neceſſitie thynges comen receyued thing mowen bē conioyned cleauen thylke ſouerayne prince thynges behoueth neceſſitie lignage mankynde thou ſonge litle beforne departed vnioyned hys well faylen begynnynge ſayne god que nam diſcors fe dera rerum cauſa reſoluit quis tanta deus dyſcordable cauſe hathe rent vnioyned byndyng alyaunce thinges ſayne coniunctions god man god hath eſtablyſhed ſo great batayl betwene theſe two ſothfaſt thinges ſayne betwene purueyaunce god free wyl ben ſyngular deuyded ne ne wollen ben medled ne coupled togyther ny diſcorde thynges cleuen away certayn hem ſelf ye thouȝt man confounded ouerthrowē darke membres body ne maye fyre darked lokynge ſayne vigour inſyght whyle ye ſoule bodye knowen thyn ſubtel knyttynges thinges wherfore eſchaufeth ſo ſo great loue fynden thylke note ſoth ycouered ſayne wherfore eſchaufeth thought man ſo greate deſyre knowe thylke notification ben yhid vnder couertures ſoth wote ought thylke thynhes anguyſhous deſyreth knowe ſath naye noman ne trauayleth weten thynges wot therfore ye text ſayth thus trauayleth weten thynges yknowe yf ne knoweth hem ſeketh thylke blynde thought deſyreth thynges whyche wot ryght nought ſayeth ſo deſyrech thinges nedes ſomwhat knoweth el ne coude deſyren maye folowe thynges yt ne bene ywyſte though yt ſeke thynges ſhal fynde hem wyght vnconnyng ignoraunt may know forme yfounde whan ſoule beholdeth ſeeth hye thought yt ſayn god thā knoweth togyther ſum ſinguralities ſayne principle euerych hem ſelfe ſoule hid cloude darkeneſſe mē bres bodye ne hath foryeten ſelfe wtholdeth ſum thynges leſeth ſingularities ſo ye ſeketh ſotheneſſe ny neyther nother habyte wote ne ne hath nat foryeten yet hym remembreth ye ſum thinges withholdeth aſketh counſayle retreateth deplyche thynges yſene beforne ſayne greate ſumme mynde ſo mowe adoē partes hathe foryeten thylke partyes hath withholden tum illa vetus inquit hec eſt de prouidētia q̄rela marco que tullio c ſayd ſhe ꝙ ſhe olde queſtion purueyaūce god marcus tullius whan deuyded deuynacyons ſayne hys bokes wrote deuynacions moued greatly queſtyon thou thy ſelf haſt yſought moche vtterly lōge yet ne hath bene determyned ne eſpyed fermely diligently cauſe darkeneſſe thys difficultie mouyng reaſon mankynde ne may mouen ſayne applien ioynen ſimplicitie deuyne preſcience ſimplicitie deuyne preſcience yf mē mighten thynkē maner ſayn yf men myghten thynke comprehē den thynges yt god ſeeth hym ſelfe dwelled vtterly dout reſon cauſe difficulty ſhal aſſay laſt ſhewe ſpeden whan haue fyrſt yſpenden anſwered thy reaſons whiche thou art moued aſke thou weneſt thylk reaſons hem aſſoylen queſtion ne nat ſpedefull ynough ne ſufficiēt ſolucyō reaſō yt demeth preſcience neceſſitie thynges come ſayth way thā thus thylke thynges preſcience wot beforne ne maye vnbetyden ſayne moten betyde yf preſcience ne putteth neceſſitie thī ge comen thou thy ſelfe haſte confeſſed knowe lytle beforn cauſe ſayth ther may cauſe endes voluntary thynges myghten conſtrayned certayne betydyng grace poſition ſo thou may better vnderſtāde foloweth ſuppoſe ne preſcience aſke ꝙ ſhe moche apperteyneth ſhulden thynges comen free wyll conſtrayned betyding neceſſitie boece nay ꝙ phi ayenwarde ꝙ ſhe ſuppoſe yt preſcience ne putteth neceſſitie thinges trow thilk ſame fredome wyll ſhall dwellen hole abſolute vnboundē thou wilt ſayne al ſo preſcience ni cauſe neceſſitie betyding thinges comen algates yet ſigne thynges bene betyden neceſſitie maner althoughe preſcience neuer yet algates leſt way certayne thyng endes betydynges thynges comen ſhulden neceſſarye euery thynge ſheweth ſignifyeth onely thinge ne maketh thyng ſignifyeth behoueth fyrſte ſhewe nothynge ne betydeth ne betydeth neceſſitie ſo maye appere preſcience ſygne neceſſitie el yf nere neceſſitye certes thylke preſcyence ne myght ſigne thynge ny certes certayne proue yſuſteyned ſtedfaſt reaſon ne ſhall bene lad ne proued ſygnes ne argumentes taken fro without cauſes couenable neceſſarye thou mayſt ſayne maye thynges ne betyden bene purueyed comen certes ryght trowē thynges purueyaunce wot beforne comē ne betyden ne ſhulde demen rather although ſhal betyden yet ne haue neceſſitye kynde betiden mayſt thou lightly apperceiuen ſhal ſayn ſene manye thynges whan ben beforne eyen ryght men ſene carter workynge tournyng attempryng adreſſing carte chariot maner ſayeth mayeſt thou vnderſtande al workemen thā neceſſitie ſayth lokynge conſtrayneth compelleth thylke thynges done ſo boece nay quod ydle vayne effect crafte yf al thynges moued conſtraynynge eyen ſyght philoſoph thynges quod ſhe whan men done hem ne haue neceſſitie men done hem eke tho ſame thynges fyrſt done ben comen withoute neceſſitye ſome thynges betyden endes betydinges hem ben abſolute quyte neceſſitie certes ne trowe anye man wolde ſayne thynges men done nowe ne betyden fyrſte yer doone thylke ſame thynges although men hadden wyſt hem beforne yet haue free betydynges ryght ſcience thinges preſent ne bryngeth neceſſitie thynges men done ryght ſo preſcience thynges commen ne bryngeth neceſſitie thynges betiden thou mayeſt ſayne thylke ſame douted whether thylke thinges ne haue non iſſues betydinges neceſſaryes therof may ben preſ ••• te certes ſemen diſcorden thou weneſt yf thynges bene ſene neceſſitie foloweth hem yf neceſſitie fayleth hem ne myght bē wyſt nothyng maye comprehended ſcience certayne yf tho thynges ne haue certayne betydynges purueyed certayne ſhoulde darkeneſſe opynyon ſothfaſtneſſe ſcyence thou weneſt dyuers holeneſſe ſcience manne ſhulde deme thynge otherwyſe ſelfe cauſe erroure thynges euerye wyghte hath knowe wene tho thynges bē knowe onylye ſtrength nature thynges ben wyſt knowe contrarye euer knowe rather cōprehended knowe ſtrengthe nature facultye ſayne power nature hem knowen thyng ſhulde nowe ſhewe ſhort enſample roundneſſe body otherwyſe ſyght eye knoweth otherwyſe touchynge lokynge caſtynge beames wayreth ſeeth ferre al bodye togyther withoute mouynge ſelfe touchynge cleueth rounde bodye moueth aboute enuyronnynge comprehendeth partyes roundeneſſe man ſelfe otherwyſe beholdeth hym otherwayes ymagynacyon otherwyſe reaſon otherwiſe inteligēce wyt comprehendeth withoutforthe fygure body man vnſtablyſhed matter ſubiect ymaginacion comprehendeth onely figure wt mater reaſon ſurmounteth ymaginacion comprehendeth vniuerſal lokyng cōmune ſpeche eye intelligence hygher ſurmounteth enuyronyng vniuerſite loketh ouer pure ſubtiltie thought thylke ſame ſymple fourme man perdurable diuine thought whiche thys ought greatly conſidred hyeſt ſtrength comprehenden thynges embraceth contayneth lower ſtrength ye lower ſtrēgth ne aryſeth maner hyer ſtrength wyt ne may cō prehende nothyng mater ne imaginacyon ne loketh vniuerſal ſpeces ne reaſon ne taketh ſymple fourme ſo intelligence taketh intelligence loketh abouen whan hath comprehended fourme knoweth demeth thynges ben vnder fourme ſhe knoweth hem thylke maner comprehendeth thylk ſame ſimple forme yt ne may neuer ben knowē none yt ſay non thre forſayd ſtrengthes ſoule knoweth vniuerſitie reaſon fygure ymaginacion ſenſyble material cō ceyued wyt ne vſeth ne reaſon ne ymaginacion ne wyt withoutforth beholdeth al thynges ſo ſhal ſay ſtroke thought fermely without diſcours collacion certes reaſon whan loketh thyng vniuerſall ne vſeth ymaginacyon ne wyt algates yet cō prehendeth thynges ymaginable ſē ſyble reaſon ſhe diffinyſſheth vniuerſall conceyte ryght thus man reaſonable two foted beeſt ſo knowing vniuerſal yet ni ther wyght ne wot well man thynge ymaginable ſenſyble thys ſame conſydreth well reaſon ny ymaginacion wytte loketh reaſonable conception alſo ymaginacyon ſo taketh wytte begynnyng ſene fourmen fygures algates although wyt ne preſent yet enuyroneth comprehē deth thynges ſenſyble reaſon ſenſyble demyng reaſon ymaginatife seeſt thou al thynges knowyng vſen facultie power done facultie power thynges ben knowen ne wronge ſo euery iudgement dede hym demeth behoueth euerye wyght perfourme hys werke hys intention forayne power propre power quondam porticus tulit obſcuros minium ſenes c porche ſaye gate towne athnes philoſophers hadden congregacion diſpute thilk porche brought ſomtyme olde men full darke ſentences ſay philoſophers hyghten ſtoiciens ye wende ymages ſenſibylities ſay ſenſyble ymaginacions el ymagynacyons ſenſible thynges wer emprinted ſoules fro bodyes withoutforth ſayth thylke ſtoiciens wenden ſoule naked hym ſelfe myrrour clene perchemyne ſo al fygures muſten fyrſt comen fro thynges fro wt ſoules ben emprinted ſoules ryght ben wonte ſometyme ſwyft poyntell fyxen letter emprinted ſmothneſſe playneſſe table waxe parchemyne hath fygure ne note gloſe nowe argueth boece agaynſt opynion ſayth thus yf thryuynge ſoule ne implyteth nothyng▪ ſayne ne doth thyng propre mouynge ſuffreth lyeth ſubiecte fygures note bodyes withoutforth yeldeth ymages ydel euyl vayne maner myrrour whence thryueth whence commeth thilke knowynge ſoule ye diſcerneth beholdeth thynges whēce thilke ſtrēgth beholdeth ſynguler thinges el whēce ſtrength dyuydeth thynges yknowe thylke ſtrength gathered togyther thynges deuyded ſtrēgth choſeth entrechaunged waye ſomtyme heaueth heed ſay heaueth vp ententiō ryght hyghe thynges
