voyce ſowne hourleth eares cōmoueth hem hearken ſtrength thought moued excyted cleapeth forthe ſemblable mouynges ſpeces halte within ſelfe addeth ſpeces note thynges withoutforth meddleth ymages thynges withoutforth thinges hyd hym ſelfe quod ſi corporibus ſenciēdis quā ni efficiant inſtrumenta ſenſuum c bvt bodyes ſeled ſay takyng knowing bodyly thynges ſo yt quality bodyes obiect fro withoutforth mouen entalenten inſtrumentes wyttes ſo paſſyon body ſayne wyt ſuffraunce goeth beforne ſtrength worchynge corage paſſyon ſuffraūce clepeth forth dede thought ſelfe moueth excyteth meane whyle fourmes reſten withinforth inſenſyble bodyes haue ſayde corages ni taught emprynted paſſyon knowe theſe thynges demeth knoweth owne ſtrēgth paſſion ſuffraunce ſubiect body moche thā tho thynges ben abſolute quyte fro talentes affection bodyes god aungels ne folowen decernynge thynges obiect fro wtoutforth accō plyſſhē ſpeden dedes thought reaſon comen many maner knowynges dyuers differrynge ſubſtaunces wyt body wyt naked diſpoyled knowynge thylke wyt cōmeth beeſtes whiche ne mowen mouen hem ſelfe oyſters muſkels ſuche ſhelfyſh ſee cleuē ben noryſſhed rockes ye ymaginacion cōmeth remuable beeſtes ſemen haue talent flyen deſirē thing reaſon alonelye lynage mankynde ryght intelligence alonly diuine nature foloweth thilk knowynge worthe eyther ſyns knoweth propre nature onelye ſubiecte ſayth ne kneweth alonely appertayneth properly knowyng knoweth ſubiectes al knowynges ſhal yf wyt ymaginacion ſtryuen ayen reaſonynge ſayne thylke vniuerſall thynge reaſon weneth ſene yt ni ryght nought wyt ymaginacion ſayne ſenſyble ymagynable ne maye ben vniuerſall either iugement reaſon ſothe ne ny thynge ſenſyble el reaſon wote well many thynges ſubiecte wyt ymaginacyon conceptiō reaſon vaine falſe loketh comprehendeth ſenſyble ſynguler vniuerſall yf reaſon wolde anſwer ayenſt theſe two ſaye wyt ymaginacion ſaye ſothly ſhe ſelfe ſayne reaſon loketh comprehendeth reaſon vniuerſalitie ſenſible ymaginable thylke two yt ſayne wyt ymaginacion ne mowen ſtretchen hem ſelfe knowing vniuerſalitie knowynge hem ne maye exceaden ne ſurmounten bodyly fygures certes knowyng thynges men oughten rather yeuen credence ſtedfaſt ye perfyte iudgement maner ſtryuyng haue ſtrēgth reaſoning ymagynacion wytte ſay reaſon ymaginacion wolde rather prayſe cauſe reaſon ſayth cauſe wytte ymagynacion semblable thyng reſon mā kynde ne weneth diuyne intellygēce beholdeth knoweth thynges come right reaſon mākynde knoweth hem thou arguyſt thus yf ne ſeme men ſome thynges haue certayne betydinges ne maye wyſte certaynly betyden preſcience thylke thynges yf trow preſcience theſe thynges nothing betydeth neceſſyte yf myght haue iugement diuyne thought ben parteners reſon right ſo haue demed behoueth ymagynacion wytte beneth reaſon ryght ſo wolde demen rightfull thing man reaſon ought ſubmyt ſelfe beneth diuyne thought whyche yf may ſayth yf may counſayle enhaunce v heyght thylke ſouerayne intellygence ſhal reaſon wel ſene ne may behold ſelfe certes thus maner preſcience god ſeeth al thynges diffynyſheth though haue certayne betydynges ne none opynyon rather ſymplicite ſouerayne ſcience ſhette wythin maner boundes quam variis terras animalia per meant • iguris nam que alia extento ſunt corpore c beeſtes paſſen ye erthes ful diuers figure ſome hē haue bodyes ſtrauȝt crepen duſte drawen hem trace forough contynued ſaye nedders ſnayles beeſtes wandrynge lyghtneſſe wynges beaten wyndes ouer ſwymmen ſpaces longe ayre moſt flyeng beeſtes gladen hem ſelfe dyggen trace ſteppes crthe wyth goynge wyth fete gone eyther grene feldes el walken vnder woodes ſo thou ſeeſt diſcorden dyuers fourmes algates face enclyned heauyeth dull wyttes onely lynage man heaueth higheſt hys hye heed ſtandeth lyght wyth hys vpryght bodye beholdeth erthes vnder hym yf thou erthly man waxeſt yuell thy wytte thys fygure amoneſteth aſkeſt heuen thy right vyſage haſt areyſed thy forheed bearen vp hygh thy corage ſo thy thouȝt ne heuyed ne put lowe vnder fote ſyth thy body ſo hygh areyſed quoniam igitur vti paulo ante monſtratum eſt omne quod ſcitur c therfore haue ſhewed lytell beforn yt thing yt wyſt ny knowen thys nature propre ye nature hē yt cōprehenden let v loken nowe moch lefull v ſaith let v loken nowe may eſtate diuyne ſubſtaunce ſo may well knowe eke ſcience commune iugement creature reaſonables god eterne let v conſydre eternyte certes ſhall ſhewen v togyder diuyne nature diuyne ſcience eternyte perfyte poſſeſſyon togyder lyfe intermynable ſheweth clerely cōparyſon collacyon temporall thynges thyng lyueth tyme preſent procedeth fro preterytees future ſayne tyme paſſed tyme comynge ne ny nothynge eſtablyſſhed tyme maye enbracen togyther ſpace thys lyfe certes yet ne hathe taken tyme morowe hath loſt yeſterday certes lyfe thys daye ye ne lyuē nomore ryght thys mouable tranſytorye moment thylke thynge ſuffreth temporall condycion al though neuer began ne though neuer ceaſe aryſtoteles demed worlde although life ſtretched wyth infynite tyme yet algates ny ſuche thynge men might trowen right eterne thought comprehende enbrace ſpace lyfe infynite yet algates ne embraſeth ye ſpace lyfe togyther ne hath future yet ne ne hathe lenger preteritees bē paſſed thylke thyng hath comprehendeth togyder al plentie lyfe intermynable whome ne fayleth naught future ny naught preterite eſcaped paſſed thylke ſame ywitneſſed proued right ben etern behoueth neceſſyte thylke thynge alway preſent ſelfe cō petent ſaythe alway preſent hym ſelfe ſo mighty ryght hys pleaſaunce haue preſent infynyte ye mouable tyme wherfore ſome men trowen wrongfully whan heren ſemed plato thys worlde neuer begynnynge tyme neuer ſhall haue faylyng wene thylke maner worlde maked eterne wyth hys maker ſaith wene worlde god maked togyther eterne wrongfull wenynge thyng ladde lyfe interminable plato graunted worlde thyng embrace togyther al ye preſence lyfe intermynable thynge clere manyfeſt diuyne thought ne ne ſhulde ſeme v god elder thynges ben maked quantyte tyme rather ye proſperyte hys ſymple nature thys ylke infynyte mouynges temporall thynges foloweth preſentary eſtate life immouable ſo ne may countrefayten ne fayne ne euenlyke ye immobilyte ſay eternyte god fayleth falleth mouyng fro ſymplicite preſence god diſencreaſeth ye infynite quantyte future preterite ſo maye haue togyther al plentie lyfe algates yet moch ceaſeth neuer ben ſome maner yet ſemeth ſomdele v foloweth reſembleth thylke thing ne may attayne ne fulfyllen byndeth ſelfe ſome maner preſence lytel moment preſence lytel ſwift moment beareth maner ymage lykeneſſe aye dwellyng god graunteth ſuch maner thynges betydeth ſemeth hem theſe thinges haue ben ben preſence ſuch lytell moment ne may dwell therfore rauyſhed toke thinfynite way tyme ſay ſucceſſyon maner done ſhulde cōtinue lyfe goyng yt lyfe ne myght enbrace plentye dwellyng thy wollen put worthy name thynges folowen plato let v ſaye ſothlye god eterne worlde perpetuell ſyth euery iugemēt knoweth comprehendeth hys nature thynges ben ſubiect vnto hym god alwayes eterne preſentarye eſtate ſcyence hym ouerpaſſeth temporall moment dwelleth ſymplycite hys preſence enbraſeth conſydereth infynyte ſpaces tymes preterytes tymes future loketh hys ſymple knowyng thynges preterite right werē ydon preſentlye ryght nowe thou wylte thynken aduyſe preſcyence knoweth thynges thou ne ſhalt demen preſcience thynges comen thou ſhalt demen ryghtfully ſcyence preſence inſtaunce neuer ne fayleth whyche ny ycleped preuidence ſhulde rather ben cleaped purneyaunce whyche eſtablyſhed ful ferre fro ryght lowe thynges beholdeth frome ferre thynges right fro hye heyght thynges aſkeſt thou dyſputeſt thou thā thylke thynges ben done neceſſyte whyche ben yſene yknowen deuyne ſyght ſythe forſoth men ne maken nat thylke thynges neceſſarye whyche ſene ben ydone ſyght addeth thy beholdynge neceſſyte thylke thynges thou beholdeſt preſent boe naye ꝙ philo certes ꝙ ſhe yf men myghten maken anye digne cōparyſon collacyon preſence dyuyne preſence mankynde right ſo ye ſene ſome thynges temporall preſence ryght ſo ſeeth god thynge eterne preſence wherfore diuyne preſcience ne chaungeth nature propertie thinges beholdeth ſuch thinges preſent ward ſhulden betyden warde tyme comen ne ne confoundeth iugementes thynges one ſyght hys thought knoweth thynges comen well neceſſary neceſſary right ſo whan ye ſene togyther man walke erth ye ſunne aryſen heuen ſo ye ſene togyther one yet neuertheleſſe ye demen diſcernen one voltūary neceſſary ryght ſo diuyne lokyng beholding al thinges vnder hym ne troubleth nat qualyte thynges ben certaynly preſent warde condycyon tyme forſoth ben future whiche foloweth ny none opinyon rather ſted faſt knowynge yſtrengthed ſothneſſe whan god knoweth thynge ne vnwote nat thilke thyng wanteth neceſſyte thys ſayne whan god knoweth thynge betyde wote well yt ne hathe neceſſyte betyde yf thou ſeyſt thylke thynge god ſ • eth betyde ne maye vnbetyde ſayth mote betyde thilke thynge ne may nat vnbetyde mote betyden neceſſyte thou ſtreyn name neceſſyte certes wyll well confeſſen knowen thyng full ſad trouth vnneth ſhall wyght mowe ſene come therto yf beholder deuyne thought wyll anſwere thus thylke thyng future whē referred deuyne knowyng neceſſary certes whan vnderſtandē hys kynde men ſene vtterly fre abſolute fro al neceſſyte certes ben two maners neceſſytees one neceſſyte ſymple thus behoueth neceſſyte men ben mortall deedly another neceſſyte condicyonel thus thou woſt man walketh behoueth neceſſyte walke thylke thyng wight hath yknowe ne maye nat none otherwyſe knoweth condicion ne draweth nat thilk neceſſyte ſimple certes neceſſite condicionall ye propre nature ne maketh nat adiection condycyon maketh neceſſyte ne conſtrayneth mā gone goth propre wyll al ſo whan goth neceſſary gothe right ſame maner yf purueyaunce god ſeeth thyng preſent thā mote thylke thynge ben neceſſyte although ne haue neceſſyte owne nature certes future betyden fredom arbytrie god ſeeth hem al togyder preſent theſe thynges thā ben referred deuyne ſyght ben maked neceſſary condicyon deuyne knowyng certes yf thylke thynges ben conſydered hem ſelfe ben abſolute neceſſyte ne forleten ne ceſſen nat lyberte nature thā certes wythout doute thynges ſhullen ben whyche god woot beforne ben comen betyden free arbytrie frewyll al ſo betyden yet algates ne leſe propre nature beynge whyche fyrſt done hadden power haue betyde boe thys ſayne ꝙ thynges ne neceſſarye propre nature ſo comen maners lykeneſſe neceſſyte condicyō diuyne ſcience philo difference ꝙ ſhe tho thynges whyche purpoſed lytell beforne ſayn ſonne aryſyng man walkyng therwhyles thylke thynges ben done ne myght ben vndone natheleſſe one hem done behoueth neceſſyte doone ryght ſo thynges whych god hath preſent withouten doute ſhullen ben ſome hem dyſcendeth nature thynges ye ſunne aryſynge ſome diſcendeth power doer man walkynge boece ſayde wrong yf theſe thynges referred diuyne knowyng ben neceſſarye yf ben conſydred hem ſelfe ben abſolute fro bonde neceſſyte ryght ſo thynges apereth ſheweth wyttes yf thou referre hem reaſon vnyuerſal yf thou loke refer ſelfe ſynguler nowe yf thou ſayeſt thus yf power chaungen purpoſe ſhall voyden pourueyaunce god whan perauenture ſhall haue chaunged thynges whyche knoweth beforne phi ſhall anſweren thus certes thou mayſt wel chaūge thy purpoſe moche preſent ſothneſſe diuyne purueyaunce beholdeth thou mayſte chaunge thy purpoſe whether thou chaunge derwarde thou tourne thou ne mayſte eſchue diuyne preſcience right ſo thou ne mayſte flye ſyght preſent eye though thou tourne thy ſelfe thy fre wyll dyuers actiōs thou mayſt ſayne ayen thys thus howe ſhall ſhall diuyne ſcience ben chaunged dyſpoſycion whan wyll one thyng nowe nowe another thyng thylke preſcience ne ſemeth entrechaunge ſtoundes knowing ſaith ne ſhall ſemen v dyuyne preſcience entrechaungeth hys dyuers ſtoū de knowynge ſo knowe ſomtyme one thynge ſomtyme knoweth contrarye thynge philo forſothe ꝙ ſhe diuyne ſyght renneth beforne ſeeth al future clepeth hem ayen retourneth hem propre preſcience hys propre knowynge ne entrechaungeth ſo thou weneſt ſtoundes hys foreknowynge nowe nowe dwellyng aye cometh beforne enbraſeth ſtroke mutacions preſcience compreheden ſene thynges god ne hath takē betydinges thynges comen hys propre ſymplicite hereby aſſoyled thylke thynges thou putteſt lytell beforne ſayn vnworthy thyng ſayne yt future yeuen cauſe preſciēce god certes ſtrength diuyne ſcience whyche enbraſeth thynges preſentarie knowynge eſtablyſſheth maner thynges ne oweth latter thynges ſythe yt theſe thynges ben thus ſayne neceſſyte thynges diuyne preſcience fredom arbytrie dwelleth hole vnwemmed mortal mē ne lawes ne purpoſen wycked medes paynes wyllynges men ben vnboundē quyte neceſſyte god beholder foreweter al thinges dwelleth aboue preſente eternyte ſyght renneth alwaye wyth dyuers qualyte dedes diſpenſynge ordeynyng medes good men tourmentes wycked mē ne ydell ne vayne ne ben put god hope prayer ne mowen ben vnſpedefull ne wythout effecte whan ben ryghtfull withſtande eſchew thou vice worſhyppe loue thou vertues areyſe thy corage rightful hope yelde thou humble prayer hyghe great neceſſyte proweſſe vertue encharged commaūded yf ye nyll diſſimulen ſyth ye worchen doone ſayne dedes werkes beforn eyen iuge ſeeth alſo demeth al thynges deo gracias ¶thus endeth boke boecius conſolacion philoſophie herafter foloweth dreame chaucer ✚ dreame chaucer haue gret wōder thys lyght howe lyue daye ne nyght maye ſlepe welnye nought haue ſo many ydle thought purely defaute ſlepe trouthe take kepe nothyng howe cometh gothe ne ny nothyng lefe lothe ilyche good ioye ſorowe ſo haue felyng thyng maſed thyng al day poynte fall adoun ſorowfull ymagynacyoun alway holy mynde well ye wote agaynſt kynde lyuen thys wyſe nature wolde ſuffyſe none erthly creature longe tyme endure without ſlepe ſorowe ne maye ne nyght ne morowe slepe melancolye drede haue dye defaute ſlepe heuyneſſe hath ſlayne ſpyrite quickneſſe haue loſte luſtyheed suche fantaſyes ben myne heed beſte men myght aſke ſo may ſlepe natheleſſe aſke thys leſeth hys aſkyng trewly ſeluen tell ſothe trewly geſſe holde ſyckneſſe haue ſuffred thys eyght yere yet boote neuer nere phiſycien one may heale done paſſe ouer vntyll efte wyll mote nede lefte fyrſt mater good kepe whan ſawe myght ſlepe tyll nowe late thys nyght vpon bedde ſate vpryght bade one reche booke romaunce toke rede dryue nyght away thought better play play eyther cheſſe table thys boke written fable clerkes olde tyme poetes put ryme rede mynde whyle men loued lawe kynde thys boke ne ſpake ſuche thynges quenes lyues kynges many thynges ſmale amonge thys fonde tale thought awonder thyng tale kyng hyght seys wyfe beſte myght beare lyfe thys quene hyght alcyone befyll therafter ſone thys kyng woll wenden ouer ſee tellen ſhortly whan ſee thus thys wyſe suche tempeſt gan ryſe brake maſte made fall clefte ſhyp dreynt hem neuer founde telles borde ne man ne nothyng elles right thus thys kyng seys loſte hys lyfe nowe ſpeke alcyone hys wyfe lady lefte home hath wonder kyng ne come home longe terme anon herte began yerne thought euer mo wele thought ſo longed ſo kyng certes pytous thyng tell hertely ſoroufull lyfe ſhe thys noble wyfe hym ala ſhe loued alderbeſt anone ſhe ſent bothe eeſt weſt ſeke hym founde nought ala ꝙ ſhe wrought wher lorde loue deed certes nyll neuer eate breed make vowe god mowe lorde suche ſorowe thys lady toke trewly made thys boke ſuche pyte ſuche routhe rede ſorowe trouthe farde worſe morowe thynken ſorowe whan thys lady coude worde man myght fynde lorde full ofte ſhe ſwowned ſayd ala ſorowe full nyghe woode ſhe ne ſhe coude rede one downe knee ſhe ſate anone wepte pyte mercy ſwete lady dere ꝙ ſhe iuno goddeſſe helpe thys diſtreſſe yeue grace lorde ſe soone wete ſo howe fareth whyſe ſhall make ſacrifyſe holy become ſhall wyth good wyll body herte thou wolte lady ſwete sende grace ſlepe mete ſlepe ſome certayne ſweuen may knowe euen whether lorde quicke deed word ſhe hynge heed fell ſwoune colde ſtone woman caught vp anone brought bed naked ſhe forweped forwaked wery thus deed ſlepe fell ſhe toke kepe iuno herde boone made ſlepe ſoone ſhe prayde ryght ſo done dede iuno ryght anone called thus meſſangere erande come nere whan come ſhe bad hym thus gobet ꝙ iuno morpheus thou knoweſt hym well god ſlepe nowe vnderſtande well take kepe saye thus halfe go faſt great ſee byd hym thynge take vp seys body kynge lyeth full pale nothynge rody byd hym crepe body gone alcyone quene ſhe lyeth alone ſhewe ſhortly nay howe dreynt thys day body ſpeke ryght ſo right wonned whyles alyue go nowe faſt hye blyue meſſanger toke leue wente vpon hys way neuer ſtente tyll came darke valey ſtante bytwene rockes twey neuer yet grewe corne ne gras ne tree ne naught ought beeſt ne man ne nought elles saue fewe welles came rennynge fro clyffes adowne made deedly ſlepynge ſowne rennen downe ryght caue vnder rocke ygraue amyd valey wonder depe theſe goddes lay aſlepe morpheus eclympaſteyre god ſlepes heyre ſlepte dyd none werke thys caue alſo derke hell pytte ouer aboute good leyſer route vye might ſlepe beſt hynge chynne vpon breſt ſlepte vpryght heed yhed ſome lay naked bed ſlepte whyles theyr dayes laſt thys meſſangere come rennyng faſt cryed ho ho awake anone nought herde hym none awake ꝙ lyeth blewe hys horne ryght eere cryed awaketh wonder hye thys god ſlepe wyth hys one eye caſt vp aſked clepeth ꝙ thys meſſangere iuno bade thou ſhuldeſt gone tolde hym ſhulde done haue tolde nede reherſe wente hys waye whan ſayde anone thys god ſlepe abrayde hys ſlepe gan go dyd bydde hym toke vp dede body ſoone bare forthe alcione wyfe quene ſhe lay right euen quarter day ſtode ryght beddes fete called ryght ſhe hete name ſayd ſwete wyfe awake let ſorowfull lyfe ſorowe lyeth rede certes ſwete loue dede ye ſhall neuer lyue yſe good ſwete herte ye bury body ſuche tyde ye mowe fynde ſee beſyde farewell ſwete worldes blyſſe praye god ſorowe lyſſe lytell whyle blyſſe laſteth wyth eyen vp ſhe caſteth ſawe naught ala quod ſhe ſorowe dyed wythin thyrde morowe ſhe ſayd ſwowe maye tell nowe longe dwell fyrſt matere wyll tell wherfore haue tolde thys thynge alcione seys kynge thus moche dare ſaye well doluen euerydel deed ryght defaute ſlepe yf ne red take kepe thys tale nexte wyll tell wherfore ne myght bote ne bale slepe redde thys tale thys dreynte seys kynge goddes ſlepynge red thys tale wele ouerloked euerydele thought wonder yf ſo neuer herde ſpeake tho goddes coude make men ſlepe ne wake ne knewe neuer god one game ſayd anone yet lyſt ryght euell pley rather ſhulde dey defaute ſlepynge thus wolde gyue thylke morpheus goddes dame iuno ſome wyght el ne rought make ſlepe haue ſome reſt wyll gyue hym alther beſt yeft euer abode hys lyue onwarde ryght nowe blyue yf woll make ſlepe lyte downe pure downes whyte woll gyue hym fether bed rayed wyth golde ryght well cled fyne blacke sattyn doutremere many pylowe euery bere cloth raynes ſlepe ſofte hym thare nede tourne ofte woll yeue hym falles hys chambre hys halle woll paynte wyth pure golde tapyte hem full many folde one ſute thys ſhall haue yf wyſt hys caue yf make ſlepe ſone dyd goddeſſe quene alcione thus thys ylke god morpheus maye wynne mo fee thus euer wanne iuno hys goddeſſe ſhall ſo trowe ſhe ſhall holde payde vnneth worde yſayde ryght thus haue tolde ſodeynly nyſt howe suche luſt anone toke ſlepe ryght vpon boke fell aſlepe therwyth euen mette ſo inly ſuche ſweuen wonderfull neuer yet trowe man wyt coone well ſweuen rede nought ioſeph wythout drede egypte rad ſo kynges metynge pharao coude leſt v ne nat ſcarſly macrobeus wrote auyſyon met kynge scipion noble man affrican suche meruayles fortuned trowe rede dremes euen lo thus thys ſweuen thought thus maye dawnynge laye met thus bed naked loked forth waked wyth ſmale foules great hepe afrayed ſlepe noyſe ſwetneſſe ſonge met ſate amonge vpon chambre rofe wythout vpon tyles ouer eueryche ſonge hys wyſe moſte ſolempne ſeruyſe note euer man trowe herde ſome hem ſonge lowe hygh one accorde tell ſhortly worde neuer herde ſo ſwete ſteuen thynge heuen mery ſowne ſo ſwete entunes certes towne tewnes nolde herde hem ſynge chambre gan rynge ſyngynge ermony inſtrument melody herde yet halfe ſo ſwete accorde halfe ſo mete none hem fayned ſynge eche hem hym payned fynde many crafty note ne ſpared throtes ſoth ſayne chambre full well depaynted wyth glas wyndowes well yglaſed full clere hole ycraſed beholde great ioy holly ſtorye troy glaſynge ywrought thus hector kynge priamus achylles kynge laomedon eke medea iaſon parys heleyne lauyne walles wyth colour fyne paynte texte gloſe romaunce roſe wyndowes ſhyt echone glaſſe ſunne ſhone vpon bedde wyth bryght bemes wyth many glad gyldy ſtremes eke welkyn ſo fayre blewe bryght clere ayre full atempre forſoth neyther colde ne hote na ne welkyn clowde lay thus wonder lowde thought herde hunte blowe taſſay hys great horne knowe whether clere horſe ſowne herde goynge vp downe men horſe houndes thynge men ſpeake huntynge howe wolde ſlee herte ſtrēgth howe herte vpon length moche enboſed nowe anone ryght herde howe wolde huntynge gone ryght glad vp anone toke horſe forth wente chambre neuer ſtente tyll come felde wythout ouer toke great route hunter eke foreſters many relayes lymers hyed hem foreſt faſt wyth hem ſo laſt aſked one ladde lymere say felowe ſhall hunte quod anſwered ayen syr emperour octauien quod faſt goddes halfe good tyme quod go faſt gan ryde come foreſt ſyde euery man dyd ryght ſone huntynge fell doue mayſter hunte anone fote hote wyth horne blewe thre mote vncouplynge hys houndes wythin whyle herte founde ihalowed rechaſed faſt longe tyme ſo laſt thys herte rouſed ſtale awaye fro houndes preuy waye houndes ouerſhot hym vpon defaulte yfall therwyth hunte wonder faſte blewe forloyne laſte go walked fro tre wente came whelpe fawned ſtoode yfolowed coude good came crepte lowe ryght yknowe helde downe hys heede ioyned eeres layde ſmoth downe hys heeres wolde haue caught anone fledde fro gone hym folowed forth wente downe floury grene wente full thycke graſſe full ſofte ſwete wyth floures fele fayre vnder fete lytell vſed ſemed thus flora zepherus two make floures growe made dwellynge trowe beholde though erthe enuye wolde gayer heuen haue mo floures ſuche ſeuen welken ſterres forget pouerte wynter hys colde morowes made ſuffre hys ſorowes foryeten ſene woode woxen grene swetneſſe dewe made waxe nede eke axe many grene greues thycke tree ſo full leues euery tree ſtode hym ſelue fro well ten foote twelue great tree ſo huge ſtrength fourty fyfty fedome length cleane wythout bowe ſtycke wyth croppes brode eke thycke ynche ſonder ſhadde ouer vnder many harte many hynde behynde fawnes ſowers buckes full wodde many roe many ſquyrels ſete full hygh vpon tree ete maner made feeſtes shortly ſo full beeſtes though argus noble countour sat reken hys countour reken wyth hys fygures ten tho fygures newe al ken yf crafty reken nombre tell euery thynge nombre yet ſhulde fayle reken euen wonder met ſweuen forth romed ryght wonder faſte donwe wodde ſo laſte ware man blacke ſate yturned hys backe ooke huge tree lorde thought maye eyleth hym ſytten anone ryght went nere founde ſytte euen vpryght wonder welfarynge knyght maner thought ſo good mokell ryght yonge therto age foure twenty yere vpon hys berde lytell heere clothed blacke ſtalked euen vnto hys backe ſtode ſtyll ought ſothe ſay ſawe nought hynge heed adowne deedly ſorouful ſowne made ryme ten verſes twelue complaynt ſelue moſte pyte moſte routhe euer herde trouthe great wonder nature myght ſuffre creature haue ſuche ſorowe deed ful pytous pale nothyng reed ſayd laye maner ſonge without note without ſonge ful wel reherſe right thus began haue ſorowe ſo great wone ioye gette neuer none nowe ſe lady bright whiche haue loued withal myght fro deed agone thus ſorowe lefte alone ala deth ayleth thou noldeſt haue taken thou toke lady ſwete goodneſſe ſhe none mete ſo fayre ſo freſhe ſo fre good men maye well ſe made thus hys complaynte hys ſorowfull herte gan faſt faynte hys ſpirites wexen dede bloode fledde pure drede downe hys herte maken hym warme well feled herte harme wete eke adradde kynde make gladde membre principall body made hys hewe chaunge wexe grene pale bloode ſene maner lymme hys anone therwyth ſawe thys farde thus yuell ſete wente ſtode ryght hys fete grette hym ſpake nought argued wyth hys owne thought hys wytte dyſputed faſte howe hys lyfe myght laſte hym thought hys ſorowes ſo ſmerte lay ſo colde vpon hys herte hys ſorowe holy thought made hym herde nought welnye loſte hys mynde though pan mē clepeth god kynde hys ſorowes neuer ſo wrothe laſt ſayne ryght ſothe ware howe ſtoode hym dyd hoode ygret hym beſt coude debonayrly nothynge loude ſayd praye wrothe herde ſayne ſothe ne ſawe ſyr truely ah good ſyr force quod ryght ſory yf haue ought dyſtroubled thought foryeue yf haue myſſe take yes thamendes lyght make quod lyeth none therto nothynge myſſayde lo howe goodly ſpake thys knyght another wyght made neyther tough ne queynt ſawe gan aqueynt wyth hym founde hym ſo tretable ryght wonder ſkylfull reſonable thought hys bale anone ryght gan fynde tale hym loke myght ought haue knowlegynge hys thought syr quod thys game done holde thys herte gone theſe huntes hym ſe force therof quod thought theron neuer dele lorde quod trowe wele ryght ſo thynketh chere ſyr thynge woll ye thynketh great ſorowe ſe certes ſyr yf ye wolde ought dyſcure wo wolde wyſe god helpe ſo amende yf may ye mowe proue aſſay trouth make hole woll power hole telleth ſorowes ſmerte parauenter maye eaſe herte ſemeth full ſycke vnder ſyde wyth loked ſyde ſayeth nay wyll graunt mercy good frende quod thanke thou woldeſt ſo maye neuer rather man may ſorowe glade maketh hewe fall fade hath myne vnderſtandynge lorne wo borne may nought make ſorowes ſlyde remedyes ouide ne orpheus god melodye ne dedalus wyth hys playes ſlye ne heale may phiſicien naught ipocras ne galien wo lyue houres twelue ſo woll aſſaye hym ſelue whether hys herte haue pyte ſorowe let hym ſe wretch death hath made naked blyſſe euer maked wroth werſte wyghtes hate dayes nyghtes lyfe luſtes lothe fare wrothe pure death ſo full ſo wolde dye wyll ſo folowe wyll flye wolde haue hym nyl nat thys payne wythout reed alwaye dyenge deed teſyphus lyeth hell maye ſorowe tell ſo wyſte trouthe ſorowe routhe pyte ſorowes ſmerte man hath fendly herte ſo ſeeth fyrſt morowe maye ſayne hath mette wyth ſorowe ſorowe ſorowe ala wyll tell ſorowe turned playnynge laughter wepynge glad thoughtes heuyneſſe trauayle myne ydleneſſe eke reſte wele wo good harme euer wo wrath turned playnyng delyte ſorowyng myne heale turned ſickneſſe drede al ſykerneſſe derke turned al lyght witte foly day nyght loue hate ſlepe wakyng myrthe melis faſtyng countenaunce nycete al abawed ſo peace pleadynge werre ala howe myght fare werre boldneſſe turned ſhame falſe fortune hath played game cheſſe wyth ala whyle traytereſſe falfe full gyle behoteth nothynge halte goeth vpryght yet ſhe halte baggeth foule loketh fayre dyſpytous debonayre ſcorneth many creature ydole falſe purtrayture ſhe ſhe woll ſone wryen monſtres heed ywryen fylthe ouer yſtrowed wyth floures moſte worſhyp floures lyen nature wythout fayth lawe meſure falſe euer laughynge wyth one eye wepynge brought vp ſhe ſet downe lyken scorpiowne falſe flatterynge beeſt wyth hys heed maketh feeſt amyd hys flaterynge wyth hys tayle wyll ſtynge enuenym ſo wyll ſhe ❧ enuyous charite aye falſe ſemeth wele turneth ſhe falſe whele aboute nothynge ſtable nowe fyre nowe table ful many one hath ſhe thus yblent playe enchauntement ſemeth one ſo falſe thefe hath ſhe troweſt thou lorde wyll ſay cheſſe wyth ſhe gan play wyth falſe draughtes full dyuers ſtale toke feers ſawe feers away ala couth lenger play ſayd farewell ſwete ywys farewell euer therwyth fortune ſayd checke mate mydde poynt checkere wyth paune errant • full craftyer playe ſhe athalus made game fyrſt cheſſe ſo hys name god wolde ons twyſe iconde knowe ieoperdyſe coude greke pithagores ſhulde haue playde bet ches kepte feers bet therby though wherto truely holde wyſhe worth ſtre neuer bet fortune ſo many wyle fewe begyle eke ſhe laſſe blame ſelfe wolde haue ſame god ben ſhe ought excuſed thys ſay yet therto god myght haue wyll ſhe feers caught wolde haue drawe ſame draught alſo wyſe god yeue reſt dare well ſwere ſhe toke beſt draught haue lorne blyſſe ala borne euermore trowe truely wyll luſt holy tourned ye done lorde dye ſone nothynge leaue nought lyue dye ryght thys thought ny planet fyrmament ne ayre ne earth none element ne yeue yefte echone wepynge alone aduyſe wele bethynke euery dele howe lyeth rekenynge ſorowe nothynge howe lyueth gladneſſe may glad dyſtreſſe howe haue loſt ſuffyſaunce therto haue pleaſaunce maye ſaye haue ryght nought thys falleth thought ala ouercome done come haue ſorowe tantale herde hym tell thys tale thus pytouſly tell vnneth myght lenger dwell dyd myne herte ſo moche wo good ſyr quod ſay ſo haue ſome pyte nature formed creature remembreth socrates ne counteth thre ſtrees nought fortune coude quod ſo ſo good ſyr yes perde quod ne ſaye ſo truly though ye loſt feerſes twelue ye ſorowe murdred ſelue ye ſhulde dampned thys eaſe good ryght medea ſlough chyldren iaſon phyllis alſo demophon hynge ſelfe ſo welaway broke hys terme day come another rage dido quene eke cartage ſlough ſelfe eneas falſe whych foole ſhe ecquo dyed narciſus nolde loue ryght thus hath many another foly done dalida dyed sampſon ſlough hym ſelfe wyth pylere man alyue wolde feers make thys wo ſo quod ſo thou woteſt full lytell thou meneſt haue loſt thou weneſt howe maye quod good ſyr tell holy wyſe howe wherfore ye haue thus blyſſe lore blythely quod come ſyt doun tell vpon condicioun thou ſhalt holly wyth thy wyt thyne entente herken yes ſyr swere thy trouth therto gladly holde ſhall ryght blythly ſo god ſaue holly wyth wyt haue well goddes halfe quod began syr quod ſyth fyrſt couthe haue maner wyt fro youth kyndely vnderſtandynge comprehende thynge loue myne owne wyt dredeleſſe haue euer yet trybutary yeue rente loue holly wyth good entente pleaſaunce become hys thrall wyth good wyll body herte thys put hys ſeruage lorde dyd homage full deuoutly prayde hym ſhulde beſet myne herte ſo pleaſaunce hym worſhyp lady dere thys longe many yere er myne herte ſet dyd thus nyſte trowe came kyndely paraunter therto moſte able whyte wall table redy ketche take men wyll therin make whether ſo men woll portrey paynte werkes neuer ſo quaynte thylke tyme fared ryght ſo able haue lerned tho haue conde well better paraunter eyther arte letter loue came fyrſt thought therfore forgate nought chees loue fyrſt crafte therfore wyth lafte toke ſo yonge age malyce corage tyme turned thynge mokell knowlegynge tyme youth mayſtreſſe gouerned ydelneſſe fyrſt youthe tho full lytell good couthe al werkes flyttyng tyme al though varyeng al ilyche goode knewe tho thus ſtode happed came day place ſey trewly fayreſt companye ladyes euer man eye ſene togythers place shal clepe happe eyther grace brought fortune lyen ful comune falſe traytereſſe peruerſe god wolde coulde clepe werſe nowe ſhe worcheth ful wo wol tel ſone ſo among theſe ladyes thus echone soth ſayne ſawe one lyke none route dare ſwere without doute ſōmers ſunne bryght fayrer clerer hath lyght planet heuen moone ſterres ſeuen worlde ſo ſhe surmounted hem al beautie maner comlyneſſe ſtature wel ſet gladneſſe goodlyhede ſo wel beſey shortly ſhal ſey god halowes twelue ſwete ryght ſelue ſo ſtedfaſt countenaunce noble porte mayntenaunce loue▪ wel herde bone eſpyed thus ſone ſhe full ſone thought helpe god ſo cought ſodaynly ne toke maner counſayle loke myne herte eyen gladly trowe myne hert ſeyne purely tho myne owne thought sayd better ſerue nought wele ſoth euery dele wyll anon ryght tell ſawe daunce ſo comely caroll ſynge ſo ſwetely laugh playe ſo womanly loke ſo debonayrly goodly ſpeke ſo frendly certes trowe neuermore na ſene ſo blyſful treſore euery heer heed soth ſaye reed ne neyther yelowe ne browne na thought mooſt lyke golde eyen lady debonayre good glad ſad symple good mokell wyde therto loke na nat aſyde ne ouerthwart beſet ſo wele drewe toke vp euery dele gan beholde eyen ſemed anon ſhe wolde haue mercy folly wenden ſo neuer rather na counterfeyted thynge owne pure lokyng goddeſſe dame nature made hem open meaſure cloſe ſhe neuer ſo glad lokyng folyche ſprad ne wyldly though ſhe played euer thought eyen ſayde god wrath foryeue therwith lyſt ſo wel lyue dulneſſe adrad na ſobre ne glad thynges meaſure neuer trowe creature many one loke ſhe hert ſate full lytle herte ſhe knewe nothyng thought whether ſhe knewe knewe nought algate ſhe ne rought hym ſtre get loue nere na wōned home inde formoſt alway behynde good folke ouer loued man may brother loue ſhe wondre large ſkylful place bere charge vyſage ſhe therto ala hert wondre wo ne deſcryuen lacketh englyſh wyt vndo full eke ſpyrites ben ſo dull great thyng deuyſe haue wyt ſuffyſe comprehende beauti thus moche dare ſayne ſhe whyte rodye freſh lyuely hewed euery daye beautie newed nygh face alderbeſt certes nature ſuche leſt make fayre truly ſhe chefe patron beautie chefe enſample werke monſtre neuer ſo darke thynketh ſe euermo yet moreouer though al tho euer lyued alyue ne wolde haue founde diſcryue al face wicked ſigne ſad ſymple benigne ſuche goodly ſwete ſpeche ſwete lyues leche frendly ſo well ygrounded vpon al reaſon ſo well yfounded ſo tretable good dare ſweare well rood eloquence neuer founde ſwete ſownyng facounde ne trewer tonged ne ſcorned laſſe ne bet coulde heale maſſe durſt ſweare though pope ſonge neuer yet tōg man ne woman greatly harmyd harme hyd ne laſſe flattryng worde purely ſymple recorde founde true bonde trouth man honde ne chyde ſhe coulde neuer dele knoweth worlde ful wele ſuche fayrneſſe necke ſwete bone brecke na ther none ſene myſſat whyte ſmothe ſtreyght pure flat without hole canell bone ſemyng ſhe none throte haue memoire semed rounde tour yuoire good greatneſſe grete fayre whyte ſhe hete ladyes name ryght therto fayre bryght name wronge ryght fayre ſhulders body longe armes euery lyth fattyſh fleſſhy great ther ryght whyte handes nayles red rounde breſtes good brede hyppes ſtreyght flat backe knewe none lacke lymmes nere pure ſewyng ferre knowyng therto ſhe coulde ſo wel playe lyſt dare ſaye lyke torche bryght euery man maye take lyght ynough hath neuer leſſe maner comlyneſſe ryght ſo farde lady dere euery wyght manere myght catche ynough yf wolde yf eyen beholde dare ſweare wel yf ſhe amonge ten thouſande wolde haue beſt chefe myrrour feeſt though ſtonde rowe men eyen coulde haue knowe ſo men played waked thought felowſhyp naked without ſawe one crowne without ſtones truly ſhe myne eye ſoleyn fenix arabye lyueth neuer one ne ſuche ſhe ne knowe none ſpeke goodneſſe truly ſhe moche debonayrtie euer heſter byble yf poſſyble ſoth ſayne therwithall wyt ſo generall hole enclyned good wyt ſet roode without malyce vpon gladneſſe therto ſawe neuer yet leſſe harmfull ſhe ſay ſhe ne knowyng harme el ſhe coulde good ſo thynketh truly ſpeke trouth ſhe routh therof ſhe ſo moche dele dare ſayne ſwete wele trouth hym ſelfe ouer choſe maner principall reſtyng place therto ſhe mooſt grace haue ſtedfaſt perſeueraunce eaſye attempre gouernaunce euer knewe wyſt yet pure ſuffraunt wyt reaſon gladly ſhe vnderſtode folowed well ſhe coulde good vſed gladly wele theſe maners euery dele therwith ſhe loued ſo well ryght wronge wolde wyght wyght myght ſhame loued ſo wel owne name luſt holde wyght honde ne thou ſyker ſhe wolde fonde holde wyght balaunce halfe worde ne countenaunce yf men wolde vpon lye ne ſende men walakye pruyſe tartarie aliſandrie ne turkye byd hym faſt anon go hoodleſſe drye ſee come home carrenare ſyr ryght ware may ſayne worſhyp ye come agayne ne vſed ſuche knackes ſmale therfore tell tale ryght ſame haue ſayde hooly loue layde certes ſhe ſwete wyfe ſuffyſaunce luſt lyfe myne hope myne heale bleſſe worldes welfare goodeſſe holy euerydale lorde ꝙ trowe wele hardly loue wel beſet ye myght haue bet bet ne ſo well quod trowe ſyr quod parde nay leue wel syr ſo leue well truly thought ſhe beſt beholde alderfayreſt whoſo loked eyen myne nay al ſeyen sayde ſwore ſo though ne wolde tho haue loued beſt lady fre though beautie euer alcibyades ſtrength hercules therto worthyneſſe aliſaundre rycheſſe euer babiloyne cartage macedoyne rome niniue therto alſo hardy hector ſo haue ioye achiles ſlough troye therfore ſlayne alſo temple two wer ſlayne antigelius ſo ſayth dare frigius loue polixena ben wyſe mynerua wolde euer without drede haue loued muſt nede nede▪ nay truly gabbe nowe nought nede woll tellen howe good wyll myne hert wolde eke loue holde fayreſt beſt good ſo haue reſt euer penelope grece noble wyfe lucrece beſt telleth thus romayne titus lyuius good nothyng lyke though ſtories autentyke algate ſhe true ſhe wherfore tell whan fyrſt ladye ſeye ryght yonge ſoth ſay ful great nede lerne whan myne hert wolde yerne loue great empriſe wyt wolde beſt ſuffyſe yonge chyldly wyt without drede beſet loue beſt wyſe worſhyp ſeruyſe conde tho trouth without faynyng eyther ſlouth wonder fayne wolde ſe mokell amended whan ſawe morowe waryſhed al ſorowe alday tyl eue thought nothyng myght greue ſorowes neuer ſo ſmerte yet ſhe ſyt ſo myne herte trouth nolde nought al worlde thought leaue lady truly trouth ſyr quod thynketh ye haue ſuche chaunce ſhryft without repentaunce repentaunce nay fye quod shulde nowe repent loue nay certes well werſe achitophel antenor ſo haue ioye traytour betrayed troye falſe genellon purchaſed trayſon roulande olyuere nay whyle alyue nyll foryet neuer mo good ſyr quod tho ye haue well tolde nede reherſe ye ſawe fyrſt wolde ye tel manere fyrſt ſpeche therof wolde beſeche howe ſhe knewe fyrſt thought whether ye loued nought telleth eke ye haue lore herde tel ye ſayd thou noteſt thou meneſt haue loſt thou weneſt loſſe quod tho nyl ſhe loue ſo haue ye aught done amys ſhe hath lefte goddes loue tel al god quod ſhal ſay right haue ſayde al loue layd yet ſhe niſt neuer dele long tyme leue wele right ſyker durſt nought al worlde tel thought ne wolde haue wrathed truly woſte thou ſhe lady body herte whoſo hath may aſterte kepe fro ydleneſſe truly dyd buſyneſſe make ſonges beſt coude oft tyme ſonge hem loude made ſonges great deale although coude make ſo wele songes ne knewe arte coude lamekes ſonne tuball founde fyrſt arte ſonge brother hamers ronge vpon anuelt vp downe therof toke fyrſt ſowne grekes ſayne pithagoras fyrſt fynder arte aurora telleth ſo therof noforce hem two algates ſonges made felyng myne hert glade lo alther ferſt werſt lorde maketh myne hert lyght whan thynke ſwete wyght ſo ſemely ſe wyſh god myght ſo ſhe wolde holde knyght lady ſo fayre bryght haue tolde ſoth ſay fyrſt ſonge vpon daye bethought wo ſorowe ſuffred tho yet ſhe wyſt nought ne tel durſt thought ala thought rede tell deed yf tell ſay ryght ſoth adrad ſhe woll wroth ala ſhall debate ſo wo thought myne hert braſt arwayne laſt ſoth ſayne bethought nature ne formed neuer creature moche beautie truly bountie without mercy hope tale tolde ſorowe neuer ſholde nedes maugre myne heed muſt haue tolde deed well began full euyll reherſe eke helpe god withall trowe diſmal ten woundes egypt many worde ouer ſkypt tale pure fere leſt wordes myſſe ſet ſorowfull hert woundes deed softe quakyng pure drede ſhame ſtyntyng tale ferde myne hewe pale full oft wext pale red bowyng hynge heed durſt one loke wyt maner gone ſayd mercy nomore na game ſat ſore laſt ſoth ſayne whan myne hert come agayne tell ſhortly al ſpeche hole hert gan beſeche ſhe wolde lady ſwete ſwore hertely gan hete euer ſtedfaſt trewe loue alway freſhly newe neuer lady haue worſhyp ſaue beſt coude ſwere euer euermore myne herte ſwete neuer falſe mete nyll wyſe god helpe ſo whan tale ydo god wot ſhe accompted ſtre tale ſo thought tell ſhortly ryght truly anſwer wel countrefete wordes grete anſwer ſhe ſayd nay vtterly ala daye ſorowe ſuffred wo truly caſſandra ſo bewayled deſtruction troye illion neuer ſuche ſorwe tho durſt nomore ſay thereto pure feare ſtale awaye thus lyued full many day truly nede bed heed neuer day ſeche ſorowe founde redy euery morowe loued gere befell yere thought one wolde fonde knowe vnderſtonde wo ſhe well vnderſtoode ne wylled thynge good worſhyp kepe name ouer al thynges drede ſhame ſo buſy ſerue pytie ſhulde ſterue sith willed none harme iwys whan lady knewe lady yaue holy noble yeft mercy sauyng worſhyp al wayes dredleſſe mene non wayes therwith ſhe yaue rynge trowe fyrſt thynge yf myne hert ywaxe glad nede axe helpe god blyue rayſed fro deth lyue al happes alder beſt gladdeſt mooſt reſt truly ſwete wyght whan wronge ſhe ryght wolde alway ſo goodly foryeue ſo debonayrly youth chaunce toke gouernaunce therwith ſhe alway ſo trewe ioye euery lyche newe hertes ſo euen payre neuer na one contrayre wo ſoth ilyche ſuffred tho blyſſe eke ſorowe ilych glad wroth al v one without thus lyued ful many yere well tell howe sir quod ſhe nowe quod ſtynt anon therwith woxe deed ſtone ſayde ala bore loſſe tolde lorne bethinke ſayd beforne thou woſt ful lytle thou meneſt haue loſt thou weneſt god wot ala ryght ſhe ala ſyr may deed nay yes trouth loſſe god routh ¶and worde ryght anon gan ſtrake forth done tyme hart huntyng thought kynge gan homewarde ryde vnto place beſyde v lyte longe caſtell walles whyte ſaynt iohn ryche hyll mette thus fyll ryght thus met tell caſtell bell ſmyt houres twelue therwith awoke ſelue founde lying bed boke red alcione seys kynge goddes ſlepyng founde myne honde full euen thought ſo queynt ſweuen wolde proceſſe tyme fonde put ſweuen ryme beſt anon ſweuen done ¶explicit mayſter c whan chryſt kynge aſked trouth ſothfaſtneſſe worde anſwered aſkynge ſayeth man true geſſe therfore though hyght expreſſe ſorowe wo maryage dare wryten wyckedneſſe leſt ſelfe fall efte ſuche dotage woll ſay chayne sathanas whiche gnaweth euer dare ſayne payne wyll wolde bounden neuer thylke doted foole eft hath leuer ychayned priſon crepe god let hym neuer fro wo diſceuer ne man hym bewayle though wepe yet leſt thou worſe take wyſe bet wed bren worſe wyſe yu ſhalt haue ſorow thy fleſh thy lyfe bē thy wyues thral ſayn theſe wiſe holy wrytte may ſuffyſe experience ſhall teache ſo may happe take waye leuer take fryſe efte fall weddyng trappe lytle wryt prouerbes fygures ſende take kepe rede vnwyſe wele endure yf thou ſyker put drede wyfe bathe praye yt ye rede mater haue honde god graunt lyfe frely lede fredome foule bonde ¶explicit aſſemble foules lyfe ſo ſhorte ye craft ſo longe lerne thaſſaye ſo harde ſo ſharpe cōquering dredful ioy alway flyt ſo yerne mene loue felynge aſtonyeth wondrefull werkynge ſore iwys whan thynke nought wet wel whether flete ſink al knowe loue dede ne wot quyteth folke hyre yet happeth full oft bokes rede myracles cruell yre rede well wol lorde ſyre dare ſayne ſtrokes ſore god ſaue ſuche lorde nomore vſage luſt lore bokes rede oft tolde wherfore ſpeke nought yore agone happed beholde vpon boke ywrytten wt letter olde thervpon certayne thynge lerne longe day ful faſt rad yerne olde feldes men ſayth cōmeth al newe corne fro yere yere olde bokes good fayth cōmeth newe ſcience men lere purpoſe matere rede forth gan ſo delyte al day thought lyre boke make mencyon entytled ryght thus ſhall tell tullius dreame scipion chapiter ſeuen heauen hell erth ſoules therin dwel ſhortly treate ſentence woll ſayne great fyrſt telleth whan scipion come affryke meteth maſſynyſſe hym ioye armes hath ynome telleth ſpeche blyſſe betwixe hem tyll ye day gan myſſe howe hys aunceſtre affrykan ſo dere gan ſlepe nyght tyll apere telleth ſterry place howe affrikan hath hym cartage ſhewed warned beforne al hys grace ſayd man lered eyther leude loueth comune profyte wel ytheude ſhulde blyſfull place wende ioye wythouten ende aſked yf folke bene dede haue lyfe dwellyng another place affrikan ſayd yee without drede howe preſent lyues ſpace ment maner deth way trace rightful folke ſhul gone dye heauen ſhewed hym galaxie ſhewed lytle erth ye regarde heuens quantyte ſhewed nyne ſperis melodye herde cometh thylke ſperes thriſe thre welles muſyke bene melodye thys worlde cauſe armonye ſayd ſens erth ſo lyte ful turment harde grace ne ſhulde worlde delyte tolde hym certayne yeres ſpace euery ſterre ſhuld come place ther firſt al ſhuld minde thys worlde done al mākinde prayed hym scipion tel hym al waye come heuen blyſſe ſayd fyrſt know thy ſelfe immortal loke aye beſely thou werch wiſſe comune profite thou ſhalt miſſe come ſwyftly vnto place dere full blyſſe ſoules clere brekers lawe ſothe ſayne lykerous folke ben dede shul whirle ye world alway paine tyl many worlde paſſed drede foryeuen al wycked dede ſhullen come blyſful place whych comen god ſende grace day gan faylen derke nyght reueth beeſtes beſyneſſe berafte boke lacke lyght bedde gan dreſſe fulfylled thought beſy heuyneſſe thing nolde eke ne thyng wolde fynally ſpyrite laſte wery labour al daye toke reſte made ſlepe faſte ſlepe mette laye howe affrikan ryght ſelfe araye scipion hym ſawe tyde come ſtode ryght beddes ſyde wery hunter ſlepyng hys bedde wodde ayen hys mynde goth anone iuge dremeth hys plees ſpedde carter dremeth howe carte gone rych golde ye knight fyght wt fone ſycke mette drynketh tonne louer met hath hys lady wonne ſayne yf cauſe radde affrikan beforne made mete ſtode thus ſayd thou haſt ſo wel borne lokynge myne olde boke al torne whych macrobie rought lyte ſomdele thy labour wolde quyte citherea thou blyſful lady ſwete wt thy fyre brōde daunteſt whā ye leſt madeſt thys ſweuen mete thou helpe thou maiſt beſt wyſely ſeygh north north weſt whan began ſweuen write yeue myght ryme endyte foreſayde affrikan hente anone forth gate brought ryght parke walled wyth grene ſtone ouer ye gate letter large ywroȝt verſe ywritten thought eyther halfe full great difference ſhal ſay playne ſentence men gone ye blyſful place hertes heale deedly woundes cure men gon wel grace grene luſty may ſhall euer endure thys waye good auenture glad thou reder thy ſorowe caſt al open paſſe ſpede faſt mē gon thā ſpake ye ſyde vnto mortal ſtrokes ſpeere diſdayne daunger gyde neuer tree ſhall frute ne leaues beere ſtreme ledeth ſorouful weere fyſhe priſon drye eſchewyng onely remedye theſe verſes gold aſure ywritten whych gan aſtouyed beholde one encreaſed al feare gan herte bolde one hette dyd colde wytte errour cheſe entre ſlye ſaue leſe ryght betwene adamantes two euyn weyght pece yron ſet ne hath myght moue ne fro one may hale let fared nyſt bet entre leaue tyl affrikan gyde hente ſhoue gate wyde ſayd ſtandeth writen thy face thyne errour though thou tell drede come thys place thys writtyng nothinge ment ne none loues ſeruaunte thou loue haſt loſt thy taſt geſſe ſycke man hath ſwete bytterneſſe nathleſſe although thou dul thou cauſt yet mayſt thou ſe many man may ſtande pul yet lyketh hym wreſtlyng demeth yet whether bet yf thou haddeſt connyng tendyte ſhal ſhewe matter wryte wyth yt hande hys toke anone whych comfort caught went faſt lorde ſo glad wel begon ouer al myne eyen caſt tree clad wyth leues yt aye ſhall laſt eche hys kynde wt colour freſh grene emeraude ioye ſene bylder oke eke hardy aſhe pyller elme coffer vnto carayne boxe pype tre holme whyppes laſhe ſaylynge fyrre ye cypre deth playne ſhoter ewe aſpe ſhaftes playne oliue peace eke yt dronken vine victor palme laurer dyuyne gardeyne ſaw full bloſomed bowis vpon ryuer grene mede ſwetneſſe euermore ynough wyth floures whyte blew yelow rede colde wel ſtremes nothynge dede ſwōmen ful ſmal fyſhes lyght ſynnes rede ſcales ſyluer bryght euery bough byrdes herde ſynge voyce aungel armony buſyed hem byrdes forth brynge lytle prety conyes playe gan hy al aboute gan eſpy dredeful roe ye bucke hart hynde squyrels beeſtes ſmall gentyl kynde inſtrumentes ſtrynges accorde herde ſo playe rauyſhynge ſwetneſſe god maker al lorde ne herde neuer better geſſe therwyth winde vnneth might leſſe made leaues grene noyſe ſofte accordaunt foules ſonge loſt ayre place ſo attēpre neuer greuaunce hote ne colde eke euery holſome ſpyce grace ne man may waxe ſycke ne olde yet ioy thouſande folde tell euer coude myght euer clere day neuer nyght vnder tree beſyde well ſey cupyde lorde arowes forge fyle hys fete hys bowe al redy ley wel doughter tēpred al whyle heedes wel wyle couched hem ſhuld ſerue ſlee ſome wounde carue tho ware pleaſaūce anone right aray luſt beaute curteſy crafte hath myght done beforce wyght done foly diſfygured ſhe wyl lye hym ſelfe vnder oke geſſe saw delyte ſtode wyth gentylneſſe ſawe beaute wyth nyce atyre youth ful game iolyte folehardeneſſe flatery deſyre meſſagery mede thre name ſhal tolde vpon pyllers great iaſper longe ſaw temple braſſe yfounded ſtronge aboute temple daunced alway woman ynowe whych ſome fayre hem ſelfe ſome hem gay kyrtyls al diſheueled went theyr offyce euer fro yere yere temple ſawe whyte fayre downes ſitting many thouſand payre temple dore ful ſoberly dame peace ſatte curteyne honde beſyde wonder dyſcretly dame pacience ſyttynge founde wyth face pale vpon hyl ſonde alther nexte wythin wythout beheſt arte folke rout wythin temple ſyghes hote fyre herde ſwough gan aboute ren whych ſyghes engendred wyth deſyre made euery herte bren newe flambe wel eſpyed al cauſe ſorowes yt drye come bytter goddes ialouſye god pyriapus ſawe went wythin temple ſoueraine place ſtonde ſuch arraye whan aſſe hym ſhent crye nigt ſceptre honde ful buſely men gan aſſay ſonde vpon hys heed ſette ſondry hewe garlandes ful freſhe floures newe preuy corner diſporte founde venus porter rycheſſe ful noble hauten port derke place lyghtneſſe ſawe lyte vnnethes myght leſſe bed golde ſhe lay reſt tyll hote ſunne gan weſt gylte heeres wyth golde threde ybounde vntreſſed ſhe lay naked breſt vnto hede men myght ſe ſothly ſay remenaunt couered wel pay ryght wyth lytle kerchefe valence thycker cloth defence place gaue thouſande ſauours ſote bacchus god wyne ſate beſyde cere nexte doth hunger bote ſayd myddes lay cupyde knee yonge folkes cryed theyr helpe thus let lye farther temple gan eſpys diſpyte dyane chaſte ful many bowe ybroke hynge wal maydens ſuch gon tymes waſte ſeruyce paynted ouer al many ſtorye whyche touche ſhall fewe calixte athalante many maide ye name wāt semyramus caudace hercules byblys dydo tyſbe piramus triſtram iſoude parys achilles heſeyne cleopatre troylus sylla eke mother romulus theſe paynted ſyde al loue plyte dide whan comen ayen place ſpake ſo ſote grene forth walked tho ſeluen ſolace tho ware ſate quene lyght ſōmer ſunne ſhene paſſeth ſterre ryght ſo ouer meaſure fayrer creature launde vpon hyl floures ſette noble goddeſſe nature braūches halle boures wrought crafte meſure ne na foule yt cometh engendrure ne preeſt preſence take dome yeue audience thys ſaynt valentynes daye whan euery foule cometh cheſe make euery kynde men thynke may ſo huge noyſe gan make erth ſee tree euery lake ful vnneth ſpace ſtande ſo ful al place right alayne playnt kynde deuyſeth nature ſuch aray face ſuch aray men myght fynde thys noble empreſſe ful al grace bad euery foule take owne place wonte alway fro yere yere ſaynt valentynes day ſtanden ſay foules rauyne hygheſt ſet foules ſmale eaten nature wolde enclyne worme thynge tel tale water foule ſat loweſt dale foules yt liueth ſede ſate grene ſo many wōder ſene myght men royal egle fynde wyth ſharpe loke perſeth ſon egles lower kynde clerkes wel deuyſen con tyrant fethers grene mene yt goſhauke yt doth pyne byrdes hys outragyous rauyne gētyl faucō yt fete diſtreyneth kynges hande hardy ſperhauke eke quales foe merlyon peyneth hym ſelfe ful ofte larke ſeke doue eyen meke ielous ſwan ayenſt deth yt ſyngeth oule eke deth bode bryngeth crane geant wt trompes ſowne thefe choughe chateryng pye ſcorning iaye ye eles foe herowne falſe lapwyng ful trechery ſtare counſayle bewry tame ruddocke cowarde throſtle olde froſty feldefare ſhulde ſay foules euery kynde thys worlde haue fethers ſtature men myght place aſſembled fynde noble goddes nature eche dyd hys buſy cure benignely cheſe take accorde formell make point nature helde honde formal egle ſhap gentylleſt euer ſhe amonge workes fonde mooſt benigne eke goodlyeſt euery vertue reſt farforth nature ſelf bliſſe loke ofte becke kyſſe nature vycar almyghty lorde hote colde heuy lyght moyſt drey hath knytte euen nombre accorde eaſy voyce began ſpeke ſay foules take hede ſentence pray owne eaſe fordrīg nede faſt may ſpeke wyl ſpede ye know wel ſaint valentine day ſtatute throughe gouernaunce ye cheſe make flye away hem pricke wyth pleaſaunce nathleſſe ryghtful ordinaunce may let al worlde wyn moſt worthyeſt ſhal begyn tercel egle ye knowe ful wele foule royal aboue al degre wyſe worthy ſecrete true ſtele whych haue formed ye may ſe euery parte beſt lyketh nedeth hys ſhappe deuyſe ſhal fyrſt cheſe ſpeken hys gyſe hym ordre ſhal ye cheſe kynde eueryche lyketh hap ſhal ye wynne leſe loue mooſt entrikith god ſende hym yt ſoreſt hym ſiketh withal tercel gan ſhe cal ſayd ſonne choyſe fal nathleſſe thys condicion muſt choyſe euerych ſhe agree hys election ſo ſhulde bene fere thys vſage alway fro yere yere ſo may tyme haue grace blyſful tyme came thys place wyth heed enclined ful humble chere thys royal tercell ſpake taryed nought vnto ſouerayne lady fere choſe cheſe wyl herte thought formel hande ſo well ywrouȝt whoſe al euer wyl ſerue luſt lyue ſterue beſechyng mercy grace ſhe lady ſouerayne let dye preſent thys place certes longe may lyue payne herte coruen euery vayne hauyng regarde onely trouth dere herte haue wo ſome routh yf founde vntrewe dyſobeyſaunt wylful negligent vauntour proceſſe loue newe pray thys iugement wyth theſe foules al rent ylke daye ſhe euer fynde vnto vntrue gylte vnkynde ſyth none loueth ſo wel although ſhe neuer loue behet thā ought ſhe myne mercy bonde none knet wele wo neuer ſhall let ſerue howe farre ſo ſhe wende say lyſt tale ende ryght freſhe reed roſe newe agaynſt ſommer ſunne coloured ryght ſo ſhame al waxen gan hewe thys formel whan ſhe herde al neyther ſhe anſwerde well ne ſayd amys ſore abaſhed ſhe tyl nature said doughter drede aſſure another tercel egle ſpake anone lower kynde ſayd ſhulde nat loue better ye ſaynt ihon leeſt loue wel ye lenger haue ſerued degre yf ſhe ſhulde haue loued longe louing alone guerdonyng dare eke ſay yf ſhe fynde falſe vnkynde iangler rebel wyſe iolous hange halſe beare ſeruyſe wel wyt ſuffyce fro poynt poynt honour ſaue take ſhe lyfe al good haue thyrde tercel egle anſwerde tho nowe ſyrs ye ſe lytle leyſer euery ſoule cryeth ago forth wyth hys make lady dere eke nature ſelfe ne wyl taryeng halfe wolde ſey ſpeke muſte ſorowe dey longe ſeruyce auaunt nothyng poſſible dye daye wo hath languyſhyng thys twenty wynter wel happen may man may ſerue better pay halfe yere although thā ſome man doth yt hath ſerued ful yore ne ſay nat thys ne ſeruyce may lady pleaſe dare ſay treweſt man dome fayneſt wolde pleaſe ſhorte wordes tyl deth ceaſe wyl whether wake wynke trewe al herte may bethynke al lyfe ſyth day borne gentyl plee loue thyng ne herde neuer man beforne ſo leyſer connyng reherce theyr chere theyr ſpekyng morowe gan thys ſpech laſt tyl downwarde went ſūne wōder faſt noyſe foules delyuerde loude range haue done let v wende wel wende yt wod al ſhiuerd come cryed ala ye wyl v ſhende whā ſhal curſed pledinge haue ende howe ſhulde iudge eyther partye leue yee nay without preue goſe ducke cuckowe alſo cryed keke keke cuckow authorite cōmon ſpede take charge delyuer v great charyte ye may abyde whyle yet parde quod turtel yf wyl wyght may ſpeke good ſtyl ſede foule one vnworthyeſt wote wel leeſt connyng better wyghtes tonge reſt entremete hym ſuch doynge neyther rede ſynge ſo doth ful foule ſelf acloyeth •• ice vncōmitted ofte anoyeth nature whych alway eare murmur leudneſſe behinde faconde voice ſayd holde tonges ſhall ſone hope counſayle fynde delyuer fro thys noyſe vnbinde charge euery flocke ye ſhal one cal ſay verdyte foules al aſſented thys concluſyon byrdes al foules rauyne haue choſen fyrſt playne eleccyon tercelet faucon dyffyne ſentence luſt termyne nature dyd preſent ſhe accepteth glad entent tercelet ſayd manere ful herde preue reaſon loueth beſt gentyl formel euerych hath ſuch replication ſkylles may none brought adoun ſe argumentes auayle ſemeth muſt batayle al redy quod theſe egles tarcelles tho naye ſyrs quod yf durſt ſay ye wronge tale ydo ſyrs taketh nat agrefe pray may ye wolde way ye voice yt hath charge hande iuges dome ye muſt ſtande therfore peace ſaye wyt wolde thynke howe worthyeſt knyghthode lengeſt vſed mooſt eſtate blode gentylleſt ſyttyng yf leſt theſe thre ſhe tel tale prayed god ſpede theſe water foules tho began gooſe ſpeke cakelynge ſayd peace nowe take kepe euery man herken reaſon ſhall forth bryng wytte ſharpe loue rarying ſay rede tho brother ſhe wyll loue let hym loue another lo parfyte reaſon goſe quod ſperhauke neuer mote ſhe lo ſuch thyng haue tonge loſe nowe parde foole yet better haue holde thy peace ſhewe thy nicete lyeth wyt wyl ſoth ſayd foole ſtyl laughter aroſe gentyl foules al right anone ſede foules choſen turtel trewe gan hem cal prayed ſay ſoth ſad mater aſked ſhe rad ſhe anſwered playnly entent wolde ſhewe ſothly ſhe ment nay
