death take well ybourded ꝙ ducke hat men ſhulde loue alway cauſeleſſe reaſon fynde wyt daunceth mery myrthleſſe ſhulde recke recheleſſe ye qucke yet ꝙ ducke ful wel fayre mo ſterres ſkye payre fye churle ꝙ gentyl tercelet donghyl came worde aryght thou canſt ſe whych thyng wel beſet thou fareſt loue oules lyght day hē blindeth ful wel ſe night thy kynde ſo lowe wretchedneſſe loue thou cāſt ſe geſſe tho gan ye cuckowe put forth preace foule eateth worme ſayd blyue ꝙ may haue make peace retche nought howe longe ye ſtryue let eche hem ſoleyn lyue thys rede ſens may accorde thys ſhort leſſon nedeth recorde yea haue glutton fylde hys paunche well ſayd emerlon thou murdrer ye heiſugge braūche brought forth thou rufull glotton lyue thou ſoleyn wormes corruption force lacke thy nature go leude thou whyle ye world may dure peace ꝙ nature cōmaunde haue herde opinion effecte yet neuer nere fynally thys concluſion ſhe ſelfe ſhall haue election lyſt ſo wroth blyth h • yt ſhe cheſeth ſhal haue ſwyth ſyth may dyſcuſſed loueth beſte ſayd tercelet thē wol done fauour ſhe shal haue right whō hert ſet hys herte hath knet thys iuge nature may lye none eſtate haue none eye counſayle choſe make yf reaſon wolde counſayle royall tercell take ſayd tercelet full ſkylfully gentylleſt moſte worthy whych haue wrought ſo wel pleſāce ought ben ſuffyſaunce wyth dredful voyce ye formel anſwerde ryghfull lady goddeſſe nature soth euer vnder yerde eueryche creature muſt whyle lyfe may dure therfore graunt fyrſt boone myne entēt woll ſay ryght ſoone graunt ꝙ ſhe ryght anone thys formel egle ſpake thys degre almyghty quene vnto thys yere done aſke reſpyte auyſen haue choyce fre thys ſome wolde ſpeke ſey ye get nomore al though ye dey woll ſeruen venus ne cupide forſoth yet maner way nowe ſens may none wayes betyde quod nature ſay wolde thys foules away eche wyth hys make taryeng lēger ſayd hem thus ye ſhall ſpeke ye tercelet ꝙ nature beth good herte ſerueth thre yere ſo longe endure eche payne hym hys degree well god wote quyte ſhe thys yere ſo befall thys entremes dreſſed fro whē werke brought end euery foule nature yaue hys make euen acorde way wende lorde blyſſe ioye make ech hem gan wynges take wyth neckes eche gan wynde thākyng alway ye noble goddeſſe kynde fyrſt choſen foules ſynge yere yere alway vſaunce ſynge roundell departynge nature honoure pleaſaunce note trowe maked fraunce wordes ſuch ye may fynd next vers nowe haue mynde qui bien ayme tarde oublie welcom ſōmer wt thy ſunnes ſofte haſte thys wynter wether ouerſhake saynt valentyne thou arte ful hye lofte whych dryueſt away lōge nyghtes blake thus ſyngen ſmale foules thy ſake well haue cauſe gladen ofte sen eche hem recouered hath hys make ful blyſful may ſyng whē awake wt ſhoutynge whē ſonge foules made flyght away woke bokes toke rede vpon yet rede alway hope ywys rede ſo ſome day ſhall mete ſomthynge fare bet thus rede nyll ſpare ¶explicit floure curteſy feuerier yt froſlye moone horned full phebus fyry lyght ſhe gan reyſe ſtreames ſone saynt valentyne vpon thy blyſfull nyght dutye gladis euery wyght foules cheſe voyde olde ſorowe eueryche hys make vpon next morowe ſame tyme herde lerke ſynge full luſtely agayne morowe gray awake ye louers ſlombrynge thys glad morowe haſte ye may obſeruaunce doth vnto thys day choyſe ayen herte renewe confyrmynge euer trewe ye choſynge large thys luſty day cuſtome nature take vpon blyſfull holy charge ſerue loue whyle lyfe may dure wyth herte body beſy cure euermore venus cipride dyſpoſeth god cupyde ioye owe playnly obey vnto thys lordes myghty ordinaunce mercyleſſe rather dye euer founden variaunce though lyfe medled wt greuaūce herte cloſet wounde beth alwaye one ye bounde herde lyſted longe wyth deuoute herte luſty melody thys heuenly comfortable ſonge agreable ermonye roſe anone faſte gan hye towarde groue waye take foules ſene eueryche choſe hys make yet full thurſty languyſhyng myne ague ſo feruent hys hete aurora drery complaynyng dyſtyll chryſtall teeres wete vpon ſoyle wyth ſyluer dewe ſo ſwete ſhe durſte ſhame apere vnder lyght phebus beames clere ſo anguyſhe paynes kene conſtraynte ſyghes ſore ſet downe vnder laurer grene full pytouſly alway behelde holtes hore gan cōplayne myne inward deedly ſmerte aye ſo ſore crampeth myne herte whyle drery payne sate behelde aboute euery tre foules ſytte alway twayne twayne thē thought thus ala may euery foule hath hys lyberte frely choſe hys deſyre eueryche make thus fro yere yere ſely wrenne tytemoſe alſo lytell redbreſt haue free election flyen yfere together go hem lyſt aboute enuyron kynde haue inclinacion nature empreſſe gyde euery thynge lyſt prouyde man alone ala harde ſtounde full cruelly kyndes ordynaunce conſtrayned ſtatute bounde debarred ſuche pleſaunce meneth purueyaūce god aboue agayne ryght kynde wythout cauſe ſo narow man bynde thus maye ſene playne ala wofull houre dyſauenture doulfully ſtonde ſame caas ferre behynde health cure wounde abydeth lyke ſurſanure fortune ſo felly lyſt dyſpoſe harme hyd dare dyſcloſe herte haue ſet ſuche place neuer lykely ſpede ferre hyndred grace ſaue daunger haue none mede thus ala ſhall rede ne myne helpe ſhape remedye male bouche falſe enuye whiche twayne aye ſtōdeth wey malyciouſly falſe ſuſpection cauſe alſo dey gynnyng rote diſtruction fele concluſyon traynes wol ſhende labour deth mote make ende yet dye herte wyl thought god loue auowe make beſt howe dere bought ſo ſlepe wake whyle boreas dothe leaues ſlake haue heyght plainly tyl ſterue wel wo ſhal ſerue ſake nowe holy tyme saynt valentyne ſomwhat ſhal write al though ſo ryme curyouſly crafte endyte yet leuer haue ſhe put wyte vnconnynge negligence euer ſaye excellence euer ſaye dute ſothfaſtneſſe preſumpcion thys enſure ſhall ſe vnder correction reherce cōmendacion ſhall blyue vertues dyſcryue ¶ryght example ſomer ſonne paſſeth ſterre wyth hys beames ſhene lucyfer amonge ſkyes donne morowe ſheweth voyde nyghtes tene verely wythouten wene lady paſſeth ſo taketh hede tho alyue ſpeake womanhede ruby hath ſoueraynte ryche ſtones regalye roſe ſweteneſſe beaute freſhe floures wythout lye ryght ſo ſothe wyth goodly eye paſſeth bounty fayreneſſe maner eke gentylneſſe ſhe fayreſt beſte reken ſothfaſtneſſe euery vertue reſte furthermore ſpeake ſtedfaſtneſſe rote ſemelyneſſe myrrour gouernaunce example wythouten variaunce porte benygne wonder glad chere hauynge euermore trewe aduertence alwaye reaſon ſo deſyre brydeled aye wytte prouydence wytte hye prudence welle aye deuoyde pryde vnto vertue ſeluen gyde ouer thys daliaunce lowly ſhe dyſcrete wyſe goodly gladde attemperaunce euery wyght hygh lowe degre glad herte wyth ſhortly yf ſhall lye named floure curteſye ſpeake femynyte leſte mannyſhe compariſon goodly abaſhed hauynge aye pyte hem ben tribulacion ſhe alone conſolacion arne myſchefe nede comforte hem womanhede aye vertue beſy charge sadde demure wordes fewe dredefull alſo tonges ben large eſchewynge aye hem lyſten hewe aboue heed wordes ſhewe dyſhoneſtly ſpeke wyght deedly hateth hem haue ſyght herte ſo honeſt clene entent ſo faythfull entere ſhe ne may worlde ſuſtene ſuffre eeres worde frende foe neyther ferre ne nere amyſſe reſonynge yt hinder ſhulde name yf ſhe ſhe wexeth reed ſhame trewly menynge ſhe ſette wythout chaungynge doubleneſſe bountie beautie together knette perſone vnder faythfulneſſe voyde ſhe newfangleneſſe herte aye one euer perſeuer ſhe ſette neuer dyſſeuer rude vertues euerychone connyngly dyſcryue wryte well ye wote colour haue none lyke dyſcrecion craftely endyte ſaye lyte wherfore thus excuſe aqueynted wyth muſe rethoryke ſtyle gouerne prayſe cōmendacyon blynde ſo hylye dyſcerne goodneſſe make dyſcripcion saue thus ſaye concluſion yf ſhall ſhortly commende naught nature amende good ſhe lyke polycene fayreneſſe quene helayne stedfaſt herte dorigene wyfely trouth yf ſhall fayne conſtaunce eke fayth ſhe may attayne cleopatre therto ſetrone troye whyte antygone heſter meke lyke iudith prudence kynde alceſt marcia catoun griſylde lyke pacience arladne dyſcrecioun lucrece rome toun may lykened honeſte fayth vnto penelope fayre phyllis hipſiphiles innocence womanhede ſemelyneſſe vnto canace ouer thys ſpeke goodlyhede paſſeth rede worde dede ſhe nought ne fall acorde vertue werkes though dido wyth wytte ſage tyme ſtedfaſt enee haſtyneſſe yet ſhe dyd outrage ſo iaſon dyd alſo medee lady ſo auyſee boūty beautye demeyne maketh bountye alwaye ſouerayne meane bountye goeth afore lad prudence hath ſouerainte beautye foloweth ruled lore ſhe ne ſende degre one thys goodly freſhe fre surmountynge al wythouten good fayre one perſone yfere though ignoraunce ne maye dyſcryue vertues yet thys daye remembraunce onely ſupported vnder mercy wyth quakynge honde ſhall full humbly hyneſſe rudeneſſe quyte lytell balade byneth endyte euer ſuppryſe myne herte alwaye wyth feare betwyxte drede ſhame leſte loſe worde aſterte thys metre make ſeme lame chaucer deed ſuche name fayre makynge wythout wene fayreſt tonge laurer grene maye aſſaye countrefete hys gaye ſtyle wyll welle drye wyth lycoure ſwete▪ clye caliope fyrſt woll excuſe grounde goodlyhede thus ſaye vntyll womanhede ¶balade ſymple wyth myght beſte entente wyth fayth myghtye god kynde yaue ſyth ſoule knowynge ſent cheſe thys bonde euer bynde loue beſt whyle haue lyfe mynd thus herde foules daunynge vpon daye ſaynt valentyne ſynge yet cheſe begynnyng thys entent loue though mercy fynde yf lyſte dyed wolde aſſent euer twynne quycke thys lyne suffyſeth ſene fethers ynde thus herde ſoules mornynge vpon daye ſaynt valentyne ſynge ouer thys myne hertes luſte bente honour onely wodde bynde holy yeue neuer repente ioye wo ſo wynde ſore cupide wyth hys eyen blynde foules tytan dyd ſprynge wyth deuout hert thought herd ſynge ¶lenuoye ¶prynceſſe beauty repreſent thys ſymple dyte rude makynge herte wyll faythfull myne entent lyke thys daye foules herde ſynge ¶here endeth floure curteſy foloweth howe pyte deed buryed gentle herte pyte yt haue ſought ſo yore ago wyth herte ſore full beſy payne yt world neuer wyght ſo wo wythout deth yf ſhall fayne▪ purpoſe pyte complayne vpon teh crueltye tyraunye loue trouth doth dye length certayne yeres euer one ſought tyme ſpeke pyte ran ſpreynt wyth teeres prayen cruelte awreke myght wyth worde breke tell paynes ſmerte founde deed buryed herte adowne fell ſawe herſe deed ſtone whyle yt ſowne laſte vp roſe wyth colour full dyuerſe pytouſly myne eyen caſte nerer corſe gan preaſen faſte ſoule ſhope pray lorne ſay thus ſlayne ſyth pyte deed ala daye euer ſhulde fall maner man dare hold vp heed whome ſhal nowe ſorowful hert cal nowe cruelte hath caſte ſtee v ydle hope folke redeleſſe payne syth ſhe deed ſhal cōplayne yet encreaſeth thys wonder newe wyght wote ſhe deed many men tyme knewe yet ſhe deyde ſo ſodeynly haue ſought euer full beſely syth fyrſt wytte mynde ſhe deed er coude fynde aboute herſe ſtoden luſtely wythouten mo thought bountie perfytly well armed rychely freſhe beaute luſt iolyte aſſured maner youthe honeſte wyſedome eſtate drede gouernaunce confedred bonde alyaunce complaynt wrytten honde haue put pyte byll thys company fonde rather wolde cauſe ſpyll helpe helde playnt ſtyll thoſe folke wythouten fayle wythout pyte maye byll auayle leaue vertues ſaue onely pyte kepynge corſe ye haue herde ſayne confedred bonde vnto cruelte aſſented ſhalbe ſlayne haue put complaynte vp agayne foe byll dare ſhewe effecte whych ſayeth thus wordes fewe ¶humbleſt herte hyeſt reuerence benigne ſloure crowne vertues sheweth vnto royall excellence ſeruaunt yf durſt ſo call hys mortall harme whych yfall nought onely hys wofull fare renome ſhall declare ſtōdeth thus cōtrary cruelte alyed ayenſt regalye vnder colour womanly beaute men ſhulde knowe tyrannye wyth bountie gentylleſſe curteſye hath depryued place hygh beaute apertenaunt youre grace kyndly heritage ryght ye annexed euer vnto bounte verely ye ought myght helpe trouth hys aduerſite ye alſo corowne beaute certes yf ye wante theſe twayne world lore ſayne eke auayleth maner gentylleſſe wythout benigne creature shall cruelte gouernereſſe ala herte may longe endure wherfore ye rather take cure breke peryllous alyaunce ye fleen hem ben obeyſaunce yf ye ſuffre thus renome fordo throwe ſhall man wete pyte ala euer renome fall ſo lowe ye alſo fro herytage ythrowe cruelte occupyeth place dyſpayred ſeken grace haue mercy thou herenus quene haue ſought ſo tenderly ſore let ſome ſtreme lyght ſene loue drede euer lenger ye ſothly ſayne beare ſo ſore though connyng playne goddes loue haue mercy payne payne thys ſo deſyre haue ne nothynge lyke therto euer ſetteth deſyre myne herte fyre eke ſyde go maner thyng may encreaſe wo haue redy vnſought euery lacketh dethe bete nedeth ſhewe percell payne syth euery wo herte may bethynke ſuffre yet dare playne well wote though wake wynke ye recke whether flete ſynke natheleſſe yet trouth ſhall ſuſtene vnto death ſhall well ſene thys ſayne wyll euer though ye ſlee cruelte fo algate ſpirite ſhall neuer dyſceuer fro ſeruyce payne wo syth ye yet deed ala ſo thus death may wepe playne wyth herte ſore full beſy payne ¶explicit ¶ la belle dame ſans mercy halfe dreame fully well awaked goldē ſlepe wrapped vnder hys wyng yet nat thy roſe well nygh naked ſodaynlye ſelfe remembryng mater leuynge thynge whyche muſte wythouten delay hem whiche durſt nat dyſobey charge tranſlate thynge forgyue parte penaunce boke called la belle dame ſauns mercy whiche mayſter aleyne made remēbraūce chefe ſecretarie wyth kyng fraunce vpon whyle ſtode muſynge ſelfe greatly ymagenynge wyſe ſhuld perform ye ſayd proceſſe conſyderynge good aduyſement vnconnynge great ſympleneſſe ayen warde ſtrayte cōmaundement whiche thus myne entent vexed tourned vp downe yet laſt concluſyon caſt clothes went way foreſaid charge hauyng remēbraūce tyll came luſty grene valey full floures ſe great pleaſaunce ſo boldly theyr benigne ſuffraunce whych rede boke touchyng thys matere thus began yf pleaſe nat longe ago rydynge eaſy paas fell thought ioye full deſperate gret dyſeaſe payne ſo louers moſt vnfortunate syth darte moſt cruell full hate dethe hath take lady mayſtreſſe lefte ſole thus dyſcomfyte mate sore languyſſhynge way diſtreſſe ſayd thus falleth ceſſe eyther ryme dytees make ſurely make full promeſſe laugh wepe clothesblake ioyfull tyme ala nowe doth ſlake ſelfe fele maner eaſe let wrytten ſuche fortune take neyther non doth pleaſe ſo wyll myne entent conſtrayned ioyfull thyng wryte penne coude neuer knowe ment ſpeke therof tonge hath delyte tho mouthe laugh moch lyte myne eyen ſholde make coutenaūce vntrue herte alſo wolde haue therof dyſpyte wepynge teares haue ſo large yſſue theſe ſicke louers leue hem lōges whiche lede theyr lyfe hope alegeaunce ſaye make balades ſonges euery hem fele theyr greuaunce ſhe ioye pleſaunce whoſe ſoule pray god hys mercy ſaue hath wyll myne hertes ordynaunce whiche lyeth within tombe ygraue fro tyme forth tyme hold pee weryeth mater trete let louers put hem ſelfe prees theyr ſeaſon tyme nowe forgete fortune ſtrength forcer hath vnſhete wheryn ſperde worldly rycheſſe goodes whyche haue gete beſt tyme youthe luſtyneſſe loue hath kepte vnder hys gouernaunce myſdyd god graunt forgyueneſſe yf dyd well yet felte pleaſaunce cauſed neyther ioye heuyneſſe whan ſhe dyed mayſtres welfare made ſame purchaſe dethe hath ſhette bondes wytnes nothyng myn herte ſhal neuer paſe gret thought ſore troubled minde alone thus rode morowe tyde tyll laſt happed fynde place wherin caſt abyde whan ryde went lodgynge puruey ryght ſoone herde lytell beſyde garden mynſtrels gan play wyth anone went backer ſelfe thought ynowe twayne yt frendes eſpyed yet wote nat howe came awaywarde drowe somwhat force ſomwhat requeſt wyſe coude ſelfe reſcowe nedes muſt come ſe feeſt cōmynge ladyes euerchone bad welcome god wote right gentylly made chere euery one one great dele better worthy theyr grace ſhewed grete curteſy wt good diſport bycauſe ſhuld nat mourne day bode ſtyll theyr company whyche gracyous ſoiourne bordes ſpred ryght lytell ſpace ladyes ſat eche hem ſemed beſt deedly ſeruaūtes place choſen men ryght goodlyeſt ſome parauenture moſt freſheſt ſawe theyr iuges full demure wythout ſemblaunt eyther moſt leſt natwithſtandyng hem vnder cure amonge one gan eſpy grete thought ful oftē came went one ben rauyſhed vtterly hys language nat greatly dylygent countenaunce kept wt great tourment deſyre farre paſſed hys reaſon euer hys eye went hys entent full many tyme whan ſeaſon make chere ſore himſelfe payned outwardly fayned great gladneſſe ſynge alſo byforce conſtrayned pleaſaunce ſhamfaſtneſſe complaynte hys moſte heuyneſſe came hys voyce alway without requeſt lyke ſowne byrdes dothe expreſſe whan ſynge loude frythe foreſt ſerued hall none lyke hym myne aduyſe pale ſomwhat leane withal hys ſpeche alſo trymbled fereful wyſe euer alone whan dyd ſeruyſe blacke ware deuyſe playne thouȝt hym wyt coude ſuffyſe herte nothing demeyne feeſt hem dyd dylygence well coude ryght ſemed euermore whan preſence hys chere done wolde none hys ſchole mayſter ſuche authorite whyle bode ſtyll place speke coude nat vpon beaute loked ſtyll ryght pytous face wyth hys heed tourned laſt beholde ladyes euerychone euer one ſet eye ſtedfaſt whiche thought moſt vpon hys eyen ſhot knewe anone ferefull wt right hūble requeſtes ſelfe ſayd god alone one ſawe theſe ieſtes preſe wente full eaſely make ſtable heuy countenaunce wote ye well ſyghed wonderly hys ſorowes wofull remembraunce hym ſelfe made ordynaunce forthwithall came bryng meſſe iuge hys moſt wofull penaunce god wote pytous entremeſſe dyner anone hem auaunced daunce aboue folkes euerychone forthwithal thys heuy man daunced somtyme twayne ſomtyme wt one vnto hem hys chere one nowe nowe fell auenture euer amonge drewe alone whyche moſt dred lyuynge creature myne aduyſe good purueyaūce whan chaſe hys mayſtres alone herte ſet hys pleaſaunce moche beauteous perſone ſo euer ſetteth hys truſt vpon reporte eyen wythouten might deed grauen vnder ſtone euer ſhulde hertes eaſe reſtore fayled nothynge coude geſſe one wyſe preuy perte garyſon ſhe al goodlyneſſe make frounter louers herte right yonge freſſhe woman ful couerte aſſured wele porte eke chere wele eaſe withouten wo ſmerte al vnderneth ſtanderde daungere ſe feeſt weryed ful ſore heuy ioye doth ſore herte trauayle preſe withdrawe therfore ſet downe alone behynde trayle ful leues ſe great meruayle grene wrethes ybounden wonderly leues ſo thycke withouten fayle throughout man might eſpy lady came ful curteſly whā thought tyme daūce wt trace set herber made fule pleſauntly reſted hem fro then lytel ſpace nygh hem none certayne compace onely farre coude ſe saue trayle choſe place bytwene hem two harde louer ſyghyng wonder ſore aye ſorer ſought inwarde paine coude kepe ſtore ſpeke ſo hardy nought leche nere ye gretter thouȝt muſed ſore conquere deſyre mā may penaūce brought heate bring fyre herte began ſwel within cheſte ſore ſtrayned anguiſſhe payne al peces almoſte breſt whan one ſo ſore dyd conſtrayne deſyre bold ſhame gan refrayne one large ful cloſe lytel charge layde certayne kepe ſuche werre haue ſo many foſe ful oftē tymes ſpeke ſelfe payned ſhamfaſtneſſe drede ſayd euer nay yet laſt ſo ſore conſtrayned whan full longe put delay lady ryght thus gan ſay dredeful voyce wepyng halfe rage purueyed vnhappy day whan fyrſt ſyght vyſage ſuffre payne god wote ful hote brennynge cauſe dethe true ſeruyſe ſe well ye recke therof nothyng take hede kynde wyſe whan ſpeke beſt aduyſe ye ſet nought make therof game thoughe ſewe ſo great entrepryſe yet peyreth worſhip fame ala ſhulde preiudyce man loue faythfully worſhyp eſchewynge euery vyce wyll veryly chalenge nought ryght reaſon hole ſubmyt vnto ſeruyce ryght ye lyſt ryght ſo wyll bynde ſelf fraūchiſe lamant though ſo nat deſerue haue grace alway lyue drede yet ſuffre loue ſerue withouten maugre moſt goodlyhede faith trouth gyue womāhede ſeruyce wythout callynge loue hath boūd withoute wage mede man leue thynge la dame whan thys lady herde al language gaue anſwere full ſofte demurely wythout chaungynge colour courage nothynge haſte meſurably thinketh ſyr thought great foly purpoſe ye nought labour ceſe thynketh whyles ye lyue thys mater ſet herte peaſe lamant may none make peace ye grounde cauſe al war wyth eyen letter written whyche defyed put far pleſaunt loke lode ſtar made herande thilke ſame defyaunce whiche vtterly behyght barre fayhtfull truſt myne affyaunce la dame lyue wo hath great fantaſy hys herte alſo ſlypper holde onely beholdynge eye nat abyde peace reaſon wolde yf ye lyſt ye may beholde eyē made loke whi ſhuld ſpare take kepe neyther yonge ne olde feleth ſmerte counſayle hym beware lamant ſo one hurte another ſore hys defaute feleth greuaunce ryght man may yet reaſon wolde remembraunce ſyth fortune onely chaunce hath cauſed ſuffre thys payne beaute wyth cyrcumſtaunce lyſte ye haue ſo great dyſdayne la dame perſone ne haue dyſdayne neuer trewly ne nought wyll haue ryght great loue hatred certayne counſayle know ſo god ſaue yf ſuche loue mynde ygraue lytell thynge may dyſpleaſaūce begyle make raue wyll nat cauſe ſuche encomberaunce lamant euer yt hath thus purchaſed wenynge hath nat dyſceyued certayne feruent loue ſo ſore hath ychaſed vnware caſten chayne ſyth ſo fortune lyſt ordayne welfare haundes fall eſchewynge myſcheuous payne ſoneſt dyeth hys care leeſt la dame ſyckeneſſe ryght eaſy endure fewe people cauſeth dye meane knowe ſure comforte drawe remedy suche nowe playnyng ful pytouſly fele god wote nat alther gretteſt paine yf ſo loue hurte ſo greuouſly leſſe harm one ſorowful thā twayn lamant ala madame yf myght pleaſe moche better way gentylneſſe one ſory make twayne wel eaſe hym deſtroye lyueth diſtreſſe deſyre neyther leſſe ſeruyce pleaſaunce eſchewynge maner doubleneſſe make two ioyes ſtede one greuaūce la dame loue ſeke neyther pleaſaunce eaſe haue therin great affyaunce though ye ſick doth nothing pleaſe alſo take hede pleaſaunce cheſe ſo wyll hertes auaunce fre nowe free wyll endure ruled mannes gouernaunce erthely good nay enſure lamant loue ioy ſorowe doth departe hath ſet ladyes ſeruage largely dothe graunt hem parte lordſhyp rule euery maner age poore ſeruaūt nought hath auantage may gete onely purcheſſe one loue doth hys homage full often tymes dere bought rycheſſe la dame ladyes nat ſo ſymple thus mene dull wyt ſo ſotted foly wordes whiche ſayd ye ſplene fayre langage paynted full pleſauntly whiche ye mo holde ſcholes dayly make hem great wonder ſuppoſe ſone away theyr heedes wrye fayre ſpeche lyghtly theyr eres cloſe lamant man tangleth buſyly ſetteth hys herte mynde therfore reaſon may playne ſo pytouſly hath moche heuyneſſe ſtore whoſe heed hole ſayth ſore hys fayned chere harde kepe mewe thought whyche vnfayned euermore wordes preueth workes ſhewe la dame loue ſubtell hath great awayte ſharpe working gabbing gret pleſaūce hem venge ſuche dyſceyte wolde fele knowe ſecret gouernaūce maketh hem obey hys ordynaunce cherefull wayes hem ſuppoſed whan fall repentaunce rage counſayle diſcloſed lamant syth moche god eke nature hath auaunced loue ſo hye degre moche ſharpe poynt thus ſure yet greueth faute euer hath colde heate hath deynte one aſked expreſſe pleſaunce knoweth none certeyne one thought heuyneſſe la dame pleaſaunce nat alway one think ſwete thinke bitter pain ye may nat cōſtrayne yet right none luſt loue vayn chalenge loue ryght neuer ſeyne herte aſſent bonde promyſe ſtrength force may nat attayne wyll ſtandeth enfeffed fraunchyſe lamant ryght fayre lady god mote neuer pleaſe yf ſeke ryght thys caſe ſhewe playnly dyſeaſe mercy abyde eke grace purpoſe honour deface euer dyd god fortune ſhende neuer vnrightfully purchace one onely ioy vnto lyues ende la dame ye ſwere ſuche othes faſte ſo condempne curſen fro full ſykerly ye wene othes laſte lenger wordes ben ago god eke ſayntes laughe alſo ſuche ſweryng ſtedfaſtneſſe theſe wretch haue ful truſt therto wepe waylen diſtreſſe lamant hath corage man trewly ſecheth pleſaunce worſhyp diſpyſe called forthe worthy erthe touche ye ayre kyns wyſe truſty herte mouth without feyntyſe thus ſtrength euery maner name layeth fayth lytel pryſe leſeth bothe hys worſhyp hys fame la dame curſed herte mouth curteyſe ful well ye wote accordynge yet fayned chere right ſoone may hē apeyſe malyce ſet workynge full falſe ſemblaunt bere true ſemyng name fame tonges fayned worſhyp hem put forgettynge nought repented wyſe cōplayned lamant thynketh yll good may hym befall god hys grace graunt eche man deſert hys loue amonge thoughtes thynke vpon wofull ſorowes ſmert payne wheder tender herte ſwete pyte therwyth agreued grace diſcouerte mean ſone ſhulde releued la dame lightſome herte folly pleaſaunce moche better leſſe whyle abyde make think bring atraūce ſyckneſſe wyll ſone remedyde reſpyte thought put al thys aſyde full good diſporte werieth day helpe hurte wyll aplyde troweth let hem paſſe away lamant hath byrde faucon hounde foloweth hym loue euery place cheriſheth hym kepeth hym full ſounde hys ſyght wyl hym enchace ſet wyttes cace alone wythouten chaunge put vnder moche farther grace leſſe ſet ſtraunge la dame though make chere euery man aboute worſhip myne owne fraūchyſe nyl ſo wythouten doute eſchewynge maner preiudyſe wote ye well loue ſo lytell wyſe byleue ſo lyghtly wyll brought taketh hys owne deuyſe thyng god wote yt ſerueth nought lamant yf loue true ſeruyce leſe ye good chere yt ſtraungers haue alway wherof ſhall ſerue trouth wyſe leſſe cometh goth day whiche holdeth nothynge yt nay alſo loſt ſemynge curteſy whyche reaſon wyll ſay loue loue lawfull deſyrynge la dame curteſy alyed wonder nere worſhyp whyche hym loueth tenderly wyll nat bounde prayere gyftes ſay verely hys good chere departe full largely hym lyketh conceyte wyll fall guerdon cōſtrayned gifte done thankfully theſe twayn cā neuer accorde neuer ſhal lamant guerdon ſeke none cace deſert hye wherfore aſke pardon grace sythe behoueth dethe mercy gyue good wanteth truely reaſon curtyſe manere owne moch better worthy thā ſtraungers ſhew hem louely chere la dame call ye good fayne wolde yt wyſt pleaſeth one another ſmerteth ſore hys owne large lyſt gyue moch leſe hys good name therfore one ſhulde nat make graunt lytel ne requeſt ryght well accordynge yf worſhyp kepte ſet lefte lytell thynge lamant worlde founded neuer none vnder heuen creature ybore neuer ſhall ſaue onely perſone whō worſhyp toucheth halfe ſo ſore whiche haue ſeaſon leſſe ne youthe ne age ſtyll ſeruyce haue eyen wit mouth ſtore gyuen ſame offyce la dame full great charge hath wythouten fayle hys worſhyp kepeth ſykerneſſe daunger ſetteth hys trauayle feſſeth wyth others buſyneſſe hym longeth honour nobleſſe vpon none ſhulde nat awayte hys owne ſo moche hath leſſe moche folowet hthe conceyte lamant eyen hath ſet ye prynt fele wythin herte ſo euer go yf thynge ſowneth vnto wele nedes muſt come fro mo fortune wyll thys wele wo lyfe endure mercy abydynge ryght wyll thynke alſo worſhyp aboue thynge la dame worſhyp ſe well nede ye ſpende nat ſeaſon vayne touchynge myne rede take hede folly put ſelfe payne ouercome good reſtrayne herte whyche diſceyued follyly worſe breke bowe certayne better bowe fall ſodaynly lamant nowe fayre lady thynke ſyth fyrſt began loue hath ſet myn herte vnder cure neuer myght ne truely ne none ſerue whyle ſhall endure moſt fre wyſe therof make ſure may withdrawe nay muſt abyde maner aduenture may neyther put take away la dame holde gyfte ſothfaſtneſſe one offreth forſake ſuche gyfte abandonynge expreſſe wyth worſhip ayen may take hath herte full fell lyſt make gyfte lyghtly put refuſe wyſe ſuche conceyte wyl ſlake hym nede neyther ſtudy ne muſe lamant ſhulde nat muſe yt hath hys ſeruyce ſpent whyche lady honourable yf ſpende tyme entent yet leſt reprouable fayned herte thynke vnable myſtoke whan made thys requeſt whiche loue hath entrepriſe notable many hertes gotten conqueſt la dame ye lyſte counſayle seche fayrer hygher fame whych ſeruyce loue wyll preuayle thought accordynge ſame hurteth hys worſhyp hys name follyly twayne hī ſelfe wyl trouble alſo leſeth game ſurely ſet hys poyntes double lamant counſayle ought ſe better ſayd done myne aduyſe though byleue forgyue myne herte ſuch ſo hole without feyntyſe ne may gyue credence wyſe thyng ſowning vnto truth counſayle ſe fantaſyſe saue grace ſhewe pyte ruth la dame holde hym wyſe worketh foly whan hym lyſt leue parte therfro connynge lerne truely wolde hym ſelfe conduyte ſo wyll counſayle ſute putteth dyſperaunce good ſhulde fall hym loſt deed clene remembraunce lamant yet wyl ſewe thys matter faythfully whyles lyue euer chaunce yf hap truth dye deth ſhal diſpleaſaunce whan harde ſuffraunce shall dye ſo true ſo great payne yet ſhal much leſſe greuaūce lyue falſe louer certayne la dame get ye ryght nought thys fable wyl neyther harde ſtrayte ryght wyl man cuſtomable thynke ye ſhulde ſure conceyte ſecheth ſorowe receyte counſayle fele ſe lerne caſt awayte wyll therof let hym aſſaye lamant one muſt aſſayde nay wyth ſuche reputacyon true loue ryght honour pay free hertes gotten dewe raunſome frewyl holdeth thys opinion great dureſſe diſcomforte kepe herte ſo ſtrayte priſon hath one body diſporte la dame knowe ſo many cauſes meruaylous muſt nede reaſon thynke certaine ſuch auenture wonder peryllous yet wel coming backe againe good worſhyp therof ſeldome ſene ne wyll make ſuche araye fynde pleaſaunce barayne whan ſhal coſt ſo dere fyrſt aſſaye lamant ye haue cauſe dout mater mene ſuch fantaſyſe put farre al ſtraunger goodneſſe thinke wel aduyſe haue made pryſe euery wyſe whiche truth ſheweth open euidence longe abydyng trewe ſeruyce maye well knowen playne experience la dame ryght may called trewe ſo muſt take euery place diſcerne ſet ne knewe kepe good yf may purchace yt prayeth ſwereth caſe right wel ye wote yt trouth preued hath bene getē grace leſe ſone whan haue acheued lamant truth cauſe vertue ſouerayne ſhewe good loue alway fynde cōtrary cheriſh yt ſleeth ye paine louely aduerſary whan ye pyte longe ſlepe doth tary hath ſet fyne al heuyneſſe yet comforte mooſt neceſſary shal ſet wyll ſure ſtableneſſe la dame wofull wight maye thynke ſay contrary al ioy gladneſſe ſicke bodye thought alway hem felen ſore ſickeneſſe thus hurtes bene diuers buſyneſſe loue hath put great hyndraunce truth alſo put forgetfulneſſe whan ful ſore begyn ſigh aſkaunce lamant god defende harmeleſſe al worſhip good may befall werſt tourneth lewdneſſe gyfte grace thinge ladie vouchſafe vpon call cheriſheth honorable wiſe defaute euer fall deſerueth deth ſuffre twyſe la dame iuge yſet ſuche treſpace whych right loue may recouered one curſeth faſt another doth manace yet dyeth none farre ſe kepe courſe alway one degre euermore theyr labour doth encreaſe brynge lady theyr great ſubtelte others gylte ſorowe diſeaſe lamant albeit ſo one doth ſo great offence deed put iuſtyce right well wote gayneth defence muſt ende ful miſcheuous wyſe euer ſayd god wyl diſpyſe falſhed euer ful curſedeneſſe worſhyp may neuer haue interpriſe reygneth hath wylfulneſſe la dame haue great fere daiſe wyl ſay maynteyne therto ſtedfaſt truth nothing prayſe hem kepe longe wele wo theyr buſye hertes paſſen two fro ſo wel reclaymed lure wel lerned hem wythholde alſo al chaūg whā loue ſhuld beſt endure lamant whan one hath ſet hert ſtable wyſe ſuch place good trewe ſhulde flyt forth ſeruice alway withouten chaunge newe ſone loue begynneth remewe al pleſaunce goth anone lytle ſpace partye ſhal eſchewe whyle ſoule abydeth hys place la dame loue truely ought right ye may myſtaken doutleſſe ye foule dyſceyued ſyght lyght vnderſtandyng geſſe yet may ye wel repele buſyneſſe reaſon haue ſome attendaunce moch better thā abyde foly ſimplenes feble ſocour diſperaunce lamant reaſon coūſayle wyſedome good aduiſe bene vnder loue areſted euerychone accorde euery wyſe rebel ſtyl ſtone theyr wyl myne medled al one therwyth bouden wt ſo ſtrong cheyne hem departyng ſhal none pyte breke myghty bonde atwayne la dame ye loue ſelfe euer ye loue ſtande forgete euery place wo yf ye haue pyte others pite beleue ye purchace fully aſſured thys caſe alway vnder one ordynaunce haue better truſt grace al leueth take pleſaunce lamant haue hope ſo ſure ſo ſtedfaſt ſuch lady ſhulde lacke pyte nowe ala ſhyt vp ſo faſt daunger ſheweth hys cruelte yf ſhe ſe vertue fayle true ſeruice though ſhe fayle alſo wonder thys ſurete muſt ſuffre whych way euer go la dame leue chys purpoſe rede beſt lenger ye kepe vayne leſſe ye gete hertes reſt reioyce ſhal neuer attayne whā ye abyde good hope make fayne ye ſhal founde aſotted dotage ende ye ſhal knowe cartayne hope ſhal pay wretch wage lamant ye ſay falleth mooſt pleſaunce power great al thys ſe hope ſhal neuer remēbraunce whych fele ſo great aduerſite whan nature hath ſet plente al goodneſſe vertue grace neuer aſſembled hem ſemed put pyte hys dwellynge place la dame pyte ryght ought reſonable wight great diſauauntage nede ſhulde profytable pytous ſhewynge damage lady wyl ſo great outrage ſhewe pyte cauſe owne debate ſuch pyte cometh diſpitous rage ſuch loue alſo ryght deedly hate lamant comforte hem lyue al comfortleſſe harme cōforte name ye haue herte ſuch dureſſe fayre lady muſt affirme ſame duſt ſay ye wynne thys defame cruelte whych ſytteth full yl yf pyte whych may al thys attaine hygh herte may reſt tary ſtyll la dame euer ſayth loueth perauenture leue wel ſo ought wroth ſhulde blamed though wolde haue medled wyth ſuch mo myght called pyte mercyleſſe afterwarde yf ſhulde lyue wo repent late geſſe lamant marble hert yet harde parde whych mercy may perce labour ſtrong bowe myghty tre auayleth ſhew ſo great rygour pleaſeth ſe dye thys hour eyen diſport play ſhewe ſome cōforte ſocour reſpyte death whych chaſeth alway la dame diſeaſe ye may haue allegeaunce myne let ouer ſlake alſo ye ſhal dye pleaſaunce heale ſurety make wyl hurt ſelfe others ſake wepe laugh ſynge warant mater ſo wyl vndertake none hem ſhal make therof auaunt lamant ſkyl loue god alone haue cauſe wepe preſence wel ye wote auauntour none certaynly loue better ſcilence one ſhulde loue hertes credence ſure kepe ſecretly vauntour reuerence whan tonge mooſt enemy la dame male bouch court hath great cōmaundement eche man ſtudyeth ſay worſt may theſe falſe louers time preſent ſerue beſt iangle iay mooſt ſecrete ywys yet ſome men ſay howe miſtruſted ſome partyſe wherfore ladyes whā ſo men ſpeke ſay ſhulde byleued wyſe lamant good yl ſhal alway worlde ſuch erth al plaine yt good ye profe ſheweth euerye day otherwyſe great villony certayne reaſon though one tonge diſtayne curſed ſpech hym ſelfe ſhame ſuch refuſe ſhuld wrōgfully remayne vpon good renomed theyr fame la dame suche nought whan tidynges newe eche treſpas ſhal lightly haue pardon purſuen good trewe wyl ſet none yl diſpoſition contynewe euery good condicion firſt fallen damage ful frely hertes habandon lytle fayth wyth ſoft fayre langage lamant nowe knowe wel certaynte one truely yet ſhal ſhente syth al maner iuſtice pyte baniſhed ladyes entente ſe al one ſtente good yl vice eke vertue good ſuch haue ye punyſhment treſpas hem lyue vntrue la dame haue power greuaunce punyſhe none creature eſchewe encomberaunce kepe v al holde ſure falſe ſemblaunce hath face ful demure lyghtly catche theſe ladyes wayte wherfore muſt yf wyl endure make ryght good watche lo cō ceyte lamant syth grace goodly worde one may alwaye kepte ſtore appele god may mone dureſſe whych greueth ſore pyte complayne furthermore forgate al hys ordinaunce el lyfe haue ended ſo ſone put remembraunce la dame herte haue done forfeyte ye ſhulde complayne kynd nothing hurteth owne cōceite beyng ſelfe ſo ye ſhal fynde thus alwaye let thys ſynke mynde deſyre ſhall neuer recouered ye noy ſore waſtyng al thys wynde haue ſayd ynough ſemeth lamant thys woful man roſe vp al hys payne ſo departed wyth weping countenaūce woful herte almooſt braſt twayne ful lyke dye walking forth traunce ſayd deth come forth thy ſelfe auaunce myne herte forgete properte make ſhorter al thys woful penaunce pore lyfe ful aduerſyte fro thēs went whither wiſt nouȝt parte drewe ſothfaſtneſſe hys ladyes thought daunce anone ſhe gan dreſſe afterwarde one tolde thus expreſſe rent heer anguyſhe paine ſelfe toke ſo great heuyneſſe deed wythin day twayne ¶lenuoy true louers thus beſech auentures flye hem euery wyſe people defamed ye hem call truely great preiudyſe caſtelles ſtronge ſtuffed ordinaūce haue long tyme theyr offyce hole countrey loue obeyſaunce ye ladyes eſtate ye worſhip hath choſe dwelling place goddes loue ſuch cruelte wyſe ne foule trace named ryghtwyſly reaſon ſemeth thys cace maye called la belle dame ſans mercy go lytle boke god ſende good paſſage cheſe wel thy way ſimple manere loke thy clothyng lyke thy pylgrimage ſpecially let thys thy prayere vnto hem wyll rede thou art wronge help cal correcte parte al pray hem alſo thine humble ſeruice thy boldneſſe pardon thys cace el thou arte able wyſe make thy ſelfe appere place furthermore beſeche hem grace fauour ſupportacion take gre rude tranſlation whych god wote ſtandeth ful deſtitute eloquence meter colour lyke beeſt naked without refute vpon playne abyde maner ſhowres aſke hem ſocours whoſe requeſt yu made wyſe commaundyng wyth body ſeruyſe right thus make ende thys proſſes beſechyng hym hath balaunce trewe man vexed cauſeleſſe mā remembraūce done faythful obſeruaunce trouth purpoſe hem endure pray god ſende hem better auenture ¶explicit quene annelida falſe arcite thou feyrs god armes mar rede thy froſty countre called trace wythin thy gryſlye temple ful drede honoured art patron place wyth bellona pallas full grace preſent ſong continew gye begynnyng thus crye ful depe ſonken mynde wyth pytous herte englyſhe endyte thys olde ſtory latyn whych fynde quene annelyda falſe arcyte elde whych frete byte hath freten many noble ſtory hath nygh deuoured memorye fauourable eke thou polymnia pernaſo hath thy ſuſters glade elycon farre cirſa syngeſt wyth voice memorial ſhade vnder laurer may fade ſhyp hauen wynne fyrſt folowe stace corinne iam que domos patrias cithic poſt aſpera gentis prelia laurigero ſuburente theſea curru le tifici plauſus miſſuſ que ad ſidera vulgi whan theſeus wyth warres longe great aſpre folke cithe hath ouercome laurer crowned chayre gold bete home hys countre houſes ycome whych people blyſful ſome cryden ſterres wente hym honouren dyd al entente thys duke ſigne victory trompes come baner large ymage mar token glorie men myght ſe treſour many charge many bright helme many ſpere targe many freſh knight many blyſfull rout horſe foote felde ipolyta wyfe hardy quene cithya conquered wyth emelye yong ſuſter ſhene fayre chare golde lad groūde chare ſhe ſprad brightneſſe beautie face fulfylled largeſſe grace hys triumphe laurer corowned thus al floure fortune yeuyng lete noble prince theſeus towarde athene hys way rydyng fonde wol ſhortly bryng ſlye waye gan write quene annelyda falſe arcyte mar yt furious courſe yre olde wrath iuno fulfyll hath ſette people hertes fyre thebe grece eueryche kyl blody ſpeares neuer reſted ſtyl throng amōg hem euerich ſlew ſo wroth whan amphiorax tydeus ipomedon partynope alſo deed ſlayne proude campaneus whā ye wretched theban brethrē two ſlayne kynge adraſtus home ago deſolate ſtode thebe ſo bare wyght coude remedye care whan olde creon gan eſpye yt blode royal brought adoun helde citie tyrannye dyd gentyls regyoun bene frendes dwel toun loue awe noble folke towne ydrawe amonge al theſe annelyda quene ermonye towne dwellyng fayrer ſunne ſhene throuȝout ye world ſo gan name ſpring ſe euery wyght lykyng trouth none lyche al woman thys worlde ryche yonge quene twentye yere olde myddle ſtature ſuch fayreneſſe nature ioye beholde ſpeken ſtedfaſtneſſe paſſed hath penelope lucreſſe ſhortly yf ſhe ſhal bene comprehended myght nothyng bene amended theban knyght eke ſoth ſayne yonge therto wythal luſty knyght double loue nothing plaine ſubtyl crafte ouer wyght cōnyng wan lady bright ſo ferforth gan trouth aſſure ſhe truſteth ouer creature ſhulde ſayne ſhe loueth arcyte ſo whan abſent throwe anone thought herte braſt two ſyght bare lowe ſhe wende haue al hert yknow falſe na fayned chere nedeth ſuche craft men lere neuertheleſſe ful mykel buſyneſſe er myght hys lady wynne ſwore wolde dyen diſtreſſe witte ſayd wold twynne ala whyle routh ſynne ſhe vpon ſorowes wolde rewe nothinge thinketh falſe doth trewe fredom founde arcyte ſuch manere al ſhe hath much lite ne creature made ſhe chere lyked arcyte lacke wyth myght wyte ſo ferforth yeuen hym pleaſe al lyked dyd eaſe na maner letter ſent touched loue maner wyght ſhe ne ſhewed hym brent playn ſhe dyd ful myght ſhe nyl hyde nothyng knight leſt vntrouth vpbreyde wythout bode herte ſhe obeyed eke made hym ialous ouer man ſayde anone wolde prayen ſwere ye word make yuel apayd thā wende ſhe wytte haue brayd al ſleyght flaterye wythout loue fayned ielouſy al toke ſhe ſo debonairly al wyl though ſkylful thing euer lenger ſhe loued tenderly dyd honour kyng herte wedded wyth ryng ſo ferforth vpon trouth entent goth hert wēt whā ſhe ſhall eate hym ſo thought wel vnneth meate toke ſhe kepe whan ſhe reſt brought ſhe thought alway tyl ſhe ſlepe whan abſent priuely doth ſhe wepe thus lyueth fayre annelyda quene falſe arcyte dyd al tene falſe arcyte newfangleneſſe ſhe ſo lowly trewe toke leſſe deynte ſtedfaſtneſſe ſawe another lady proude newe ryght anone clad hewe wote whether white reed grene falſed fayre annelyda quene neuertheleſſe great wōder none though falſe ye kynd mā syth lameth ſo longe agone loue falſe euer fyrſt father began louen two bigamye founde tentes fyrſt yf men lye falſe arcyte ſomwhat muſt fayne whan falſe coueren traytorye ryght horſe ye byte playne bare honde trecherye ſwore coude doubleneſſe eſpye al falſeneſſe ſhe hym ment thus ſwort thefe forthe waye went ala hert myght endure routh wo ſorowe tell man hath connyng wyt mā might within chābre dwel reherſen ſhal hell ſuffreth fayre annelyda quene falſe arcyte dyd al thys tene wepeth wayleth ſwouneth pitouſly grounde deed ſhe falleth ſtone crampyſheth lymmes crokedly ſpeaketh wytte al agone colour aſhen hath ſhe none ne none word ſpeketh ſhe moch lite mercy cruel hert myne arcyte endureth tyl ſhe ſo mate yt ſhe ne hath foote ſhe may ſuſtene forth languyſhyng euer eſtate arcyte hath neyther roth ne tene herte el newe grene wo ne deyneth nat thinke recketh neuer whether ſhe flete ſinke thys newe lady holdeth hym ſo narowe vp brydel ſtaues ende euery worde dred arowe daunger made bowe bende luſt made turne wende ſhe ne graunted lyuyng grace hath ſyng droue hym forth vnneth lyſt knowe ſeruaunt vnto ladyſhyp leſte proude ſhe helde low thus ſerueth wythout meate ſyp ſent nowe lande ſhyp ſhe yaue daunger al fyl therfore ſhe owne wyl enſample ye thrifty woman take hede annelyda falſe arcyte lyſt dere herte call ſo meke therfore loued lyte kynde mannes herte delyte thyng ſtraung alſo god ſaue may get yt wold haue nowe turne annelyda ayen pyneth day day languyſhyng whan ſhe ſaw ne gate geyn vpon day full ſoroufully wepyng caſt make complaynyng wyth owne hand ſhe gan write ſent theban knyght arcyte ¶the complaynt annelyda falſe arcyte thyrled wyth ye poynt remembraunce ſwerde ſorowe whet wt falſe pleſaūce myne hert bare blyſſe blacke hewe turned quakyng daunce ſuretie waped countenaunce syns auayleth nought ben trewe ſo true ſhal rewe ſerueth loue doth obſeruaunce alwaye one chaungeth newe wote ſelfe wel wyght loued one wt al myne hert myght ſelfe hundred ſyth called hertes lyfe knyght ferre ryght whā yt glad blyth diſeaſe deth ſwythe ayen trouth hath plyght euermore lady kythe nowe falſe ala cauſeleſſe wo ſo routhleſſe wt worde hym lyſt one dayne brynge ayen ſorowful hert pee caught vp lee ryght lyſt laugheth payn ne myne hert reſtrayne loue hym yet alway neuertheleſſe al playne ſhulde playne ala harde ſtound vnto fo yaue myne hert wound yet deſyreth myne harme certes ferther wol neuer founde none helpe ſores ſounde deſteny hath ſhaped ſo full yore woll none medicine ne lore woll ben aye one bounde haue ſayde ſayde euermore ala become gentleneſſe wordes full pleaſaunce humbleſſe obſeruaunce ſo lowe manere awaytyng beſyneſſe ye called mayſtreſſe ſouerayne lady worlde ala neyther worde ne chere ye vouchſafe vpon myne heuyneſſe ala loue bye dere certes ſwete though ye thus cauſeleſſe cauſe deedly aduerſitie manly reaſon ought reſpyte ſlee frende namely neuer yet degree offended wiſly wot wo ſoule quyte ſo playne arcyte workes moche lyte ſo beſy delyte myne honour ſaue meke kynde free therfore ye put wyte ala ye retche myte though ſwerde ſorowe byte wofull hert crueltie ſwete fo ye ſo ſhame thynke ye ye furthred name loue anewe ben vntrue aye put ſlaundre blame aduerſitie grame loue mooſt god thou woſt alway yet turne ayen yet playne ſomedaye ſhal yt mys ben game foryeue whyle lyue maye lo hert myne al ſayne whether ſhall praye el playne way done trewe eyther mote haue chayne deth ye mote depart v twayn beth none meane wayes newe god ſo wyſely ſoule rewe verely ye ſleen payne mow ye ſene vnfayned myne hew thus ferforth haue deth ſought ſelfe murdre priuy thought ſorowe routh vnkyndneſſe wepe wayle faſt al helpeth nought voyde ioye ſpeke ought voyde company flye gladneſſe may auaunt better heuyneſſe thā plyte haue ye brouȝt without gylte nedeth wytneſſe ſhulde pray weyuen womanhed nay rather deth ſo foule dede aſke mercy gyltleſſe nede yf playne lyfe lede recketh yt knowe drede yf vnto myne othes bede myne excuſe ſcorne ſhalbe mede chere floureth wyll ſede ful longe agone myght haue takē hede though morowe agayne myght well holde apryll rayne holde maken ſtedfaſt almyghty god trouth ſouerayne wher ye trouth man hath ſlayne yt hem loueth ſhal hem fynde faſt tempeſt rotten maſt tame beeſt aye fayne renne away whan leſt agaſt mercy ſwete yf miſſay haue ought ſayde way wyt away fare doth ye ſonge chaunteplure playne pley ſo maſed dey arcyte hath borne away key al worlde good auenture worlde ni creature walkyng diſcomfyture ne ſorowe endure yf ſlepe furlonge way twey thynketh fygure ſtant clad aſure efte profre newe aſſure ben true mercy prey longe nyght wondre ſyght ydrye day ſuche fraye dye al right nought twys ye retche ne neuermore myne eyen two ben drye routh trouth crye welaway ferre ben fetche thus holdeth deſtenie wretche rede drede gye ne may wyt ſo weke ſtretche ende thus ſyth maye nomore yeue vp euermore ſhall neuer efte putten balaunce ſykerneſſe ne lerne loue lore ye ſwan haue herde ſaye full yore ayenſt deth woll ſynge penaūce ſynge deſteny chaunce arcyte annelyda ſo ſore hath thrilled wt poynt remembraūce whan anneleda wofull quene hath hande wrytten wyſe face deed betwixt pale grene fell ſwoune ſythe ſhe gan ryſe vnto mar avoweth ſacrifyce within temple ſorowful chere ſhapen ye may aſked ſayd ayen fell thought walke maſe certayntie woman nothyng rought aſked ayen ſought colour ſo pale forſoth ꝙ therby lyth tale muſt wete ꝙ anon tel let ſe make taryinge abyde ꝙ ye ben haſty one wēt inward wēt gon ſtode ye mid loked ſoth ſay ſom wer full ferre behynde ryght anon ferforth beſt ſo maſed mynde alwaies wer good hem eeſt weſt thus went forth lytle reſt ſome corage dyd hem ſore withouten fayle aduyſe good counſayle thus parted ſhe left alone ſawe behelde aſyde woman come goodly one forth withall eſpyde thought anon ſhulde gyde name anon dyd enquere ful womanly ſhe yaue anſwere ꝙ ſhe ſymple creature sent frō court name diligence ſone myght come enſure taryed lycence nowe come preſence loke ſeruyce may cōmaunde ſay thanked prayed come nere bycauſe wolde ſe ſhe one ꝙ ſhe therwithal ſhe lough diligence ye knowe wel ynough opened ſhe gate go wordes fayre ſhe ſayd full gently ye welcome ywis ye mo one quod ſhe ſaue woman quod ſhe pray hertly take chambre whyle v attyred mooſt goodlyeſt v al ſhulde prayſed beſt porter came brought perſeueraunce welcomed v curtyſe manere thynke ye longe ꝙ ſhe youre attendaunce wol go ſpeke vnto harbigere ſhe puruey lodging creature furthermore ſpeke aray ſhall tell maner gowne clothe golde full ryche nay coloure blewe ryght goodly facyoū taberde wyſe ſleues hangyng adown purfyl wyſe ſhall deuyſe ſorte coller vente lyke goodly comyng vnto pace entent knowyng nothyng voyde backe preace ꝙ ſhe vp wal make large roume loke ye tary take theſe bylles ſecretarye chamberlayne dyde cōmaundement came agayne ſhe byd ſecretarye beyng preſent bylles delyuered alſo onely many mo lady wyth good aduyce agayne anone wythall called chamberlayne woll ꝙ ſhe fyrſt thyng ye ſecretarye ye make come anone wyth bylles thus wyll alſo preſent lady wyll madame ꝙ ſhe ſhall preſence ſhe wyll ye hem call wyth good wyll redy ꝙ ſhe pleaſure whan ſhe cōmaundeth vpon made ordynaunce yt came fyrſt bylles ſhulde redde full gentelly ſayd perſeueraunce rayſon wyll ſoneſt ſpedde anone wythall vpon tapet ſpredde ſecretarye layde hem downe echone bylles fyrſt ſhe redde one one fyrſt lady bearyng deuyſe sans que iamays thus wrote ſhe byl complaynyng ſore full pytous wyſe promeſſe made faythful hert wyl ſo broken ayenſt maner ſkyll wythout deſerte alwayes partye thys mater deſyryng remedy next folowing word ī wiſe vng ſanz chaūger thus ſhe dyd cōplayne though ſhe guerdoned ſeruice yet nothynge lyke ſhe toke payne wherfore ſhe coude wyſe reſtrayne thys caſe ſewe vntyll preſence reaſon wolde haue recompence furthermore ſpeke twayne one hem wrote fantaſy vncques puis leuer tel playne complaynt full pytous verely ſhe ſayd great reaſon remembre thys matere ſhall tell proceſſe fere byl made complaynyng gyſe ioy comforte gladneſſe ſurete maner wyſe ſayd therin poynt ſtableneſſe nowe yll nowe wele ſykerneſſe full humbly deſyrynge hygh grace soone ſhewe remedy thys cace felawe made byll thus ſhe ſayd playnynge wyſe ſhe
