drie thruſt thought wolde aſſa • taſte draught welle • bytter langour might alaye banke anon downe laye myn heed vnto welle ra • water dranke good drau • wherof thought refreſſhed brennyng ſate ſo nye • verily anon gan fele huge parte releaſed ſmerte therwithal anon vp ſterte thought wolde walke ſem • forthe parke holtes h • launde yed pace gan aboute faſte beholde founde anon delectable place beſet tree yonge 〈◊〉 whoſe name ſhal tol • amydde whiche ſtoode herber gre • beched colour new clene thys herber full floures gende whych beholde gan betwyxe hulfere wodbende ware ſawe lay man blacke whyte coloure pale wan wonder deedly alſo hys hewe hurtes grene freſhe woundes newe ouermore dyſtrayned wyth ſyckneſſe beſyde thys full greuouſlye vpon hym hote acceſſe daye daye hym ſhoke full pytouſly conſtraynynge hys malady hetly wo thus lyenge alone dethe hym grone wherof aſtonyed fote gan wythdrawe greatly wondrynge myght ſo laye felawe ne coude wyght wyth hym ſe wherof routh eke pyte gan anone ſo ſoftely coude amonge buſhes priuely ſhroude yf myght wyſe aſpye cauſe hys deedly wo ſo pytouſly gan crye hys fortune vre alſo wyth myght layde eere euery worde marke ſayd hys ſwough amonge abrayde fyrſt yf ſhulde make mencion hys perſon playnly hym dyſcryue ſothe wythout excepcion ſpeake manhode one beſt lyue maye man ayen trouth ſtryue hys tyme hys age alſo proued men ſhulde haue ado one beſt therto brede length well ymade good proporcion yf hys delyuer ſtrength thought ſyckneſſe occaſyon thus laye lamentacion gruffe grounde place deſolate sole hym ſelfe awhaped amate ſemeth ſyttyng hys wordes al put remembraunce herde hys complaynyng grounde hys wofull chaunce yf wythall may pleaſaunce woll ſo anone lyke ſayd reherce euerychone ſhall helpe nowe complayne ſhall nowe ſtyle gye lede niobe let nowe thy teeres rayne penne helpe eke nede thou wofull mirre yt feleſt myn hert blede pytous wo myne hande eke quake wryte thys mannes ſake vnto wo accordeth complaynynge dolefull chere vnto heuyneſſe ſorowe alſo ſyghynge wepyng pytous mournynge vnto dreryneſſe ſhall wryte dyſtreſſe party nedeth knowe felyngly cauſe roote ſuch malady ala wytte dull haue knowynge ſuche matere dyſcryue wryte full wofull cōplaynte whych yt ye ſhal euen lyke doth ſkryuenere nomore ſhall wryte hys mayſter beſyde dothe endyte ryght ſo fare ſentement saye ryght nought concluſyon herde preſent thys man complayne wyth pytous ſoun euen lyke wythout addicioun dyſencreaſe eyther leſſe reherce anone woll dreſſe yf nowe thys place fele loue brennynge feruence hyndred hys ladyes grace wyth falſe tonges wyth peſtilence slee trewe men neuer dyd offence worde dede ne entent yf ſuche nowe preſent let hym routh laye audience wyth dolefull chere ſobre countenaunce thys man full hye ſentence hys mortall wo hys perturbaunce complaynynge nowe lyenge traunce wyth lokes vpcaſte rufull chere theffecte whych ye ſhall thouȝt oppreſſed wt inward ſyghes ſore paynful lyfe body languyſhynge wofull goſte herte rent tore pytous chere pale complaynynge deedly face lyke aſhes ſhynynge ſalte teares myne eyen fall parcell declare grounde paynes whoſe herte grounde blede heuyneſſe thought reſceyte wo complaynt breſt cheſt dole dreryneſſe body eke ſo feble ſo faynte wyth hote colde myne ax ſo maynte nowe chyuer defaute heate hote glede nowe ſodaynly ſweate hote fyre nowe colde aſhes deed hote cold nowe colde hete agayne nowe colde yſe nowe cole reed hete brenne thus betwyxe twayne poſſed al forcaſt payne hete playnly fele greuous colde cauſe euery dele thys cold inward hye dyſdayne colde dyſpyte colde cruell hate thys cold yt euer doth hys beſy payne ayenſt trouth fyght debate thys colde fyre abate trewe meanynge ala harde whyle thys colde woll begyle euer better trouth mente wyth myght faythfully ſerue wyth herte diligente leſſe thanke ala deſerue thus trouth daunger doth ſterue one ſhulde deth mercy let hath made deſpyte new hys ſwerde whet agaynſt hys arowes fyle take vengeaunce wylfull cruelte tonges falſe ſleightly wyle han gonne awarre wyll ſtynted falſe enuy wrath enuyte haue conſpyred agaynſt ryght lawe malyce trouth ſhalbe ſlawe male bouche gan fyrſt tale tell ſclaundre trouth indignacion falſe reporte ſo loude range bell myſbyleue falſe ſuſpection haue trouth brought dampnacion ala wrongfully dyeth falſneſſe nowe hys place occupyeth entred trouthes londe hath therof full poſſeſſyon ryghtful god fyrſt trouth fonde howe may thou ſuffre ſuch oppreſſyon falſhode ſhulde haue iuriſdiction trouthes ryght ſlee hym gyltleſſe hys fraunchyſe maye lyue pee falſly accuſed hys fone foringed wythout anſwere whyle abſent dampned may excuſed cruelte ſate iugement haſtyneſſe wythout auyſement badde dyſdayne execute anone hys ingement preſence hys fone attourney maye none admytted bene excuſe trouth ne worde ſpeke fayth othe iuge lyſt ſene gayne wyll wreke lorde trouth call clepe howe may thou ſe thus thy preſence wythout mercy murdred innocence nowe god arte trouth ſouerayne ſeeſt howe lye trouth bounde ſore knytte loues fyrye chayne euē ye deth thrugh gyrte wt many woūd lykely neuer ſounde trouth dampned dethe abyde drawe alonge brethe conſyder ſe thyne eternall ryght howe yt myne herte profeſſed whylom trewe wyth ful myght onely one whych nowe ala volunte wythout treſpas myne accuſours hath taken vnto grace cheryſheth hem deth purchace meaneth thys wōder bre purueyaunce yf ſhall call god loue falſe hem ſo aſſure trew ala downe whele ben fall yet ſoth thys worſt falſhed wrōgfully troth hath ye name troth • ēward falſhed bereth ye blame thys blynde chaūce thys ſtormy auēture loue hath moſte hys experience yt doth wyth trouth moſte cure shall hys mede fynde moſte offence ſerueth loue wyth hys diligence fayne vnder lowlyhede ne fayleth fynde grace ſpede fol loued one full longe ſyth agone wyth myne herte body full myght deed herte gone hys heſte holde hath hyght though banyſhed ſyght mouth dampned ſhal dey vnto beheſt yet wyll euer obey euer ſyth worlde began ſo lyſt loke ſtory rede ſhall aye fynde trewe man put abacke falſhede yfurthered loue taketh none hede ſlee trew hath hem charge falſe goeth frely large take recorde palamydes trewe man noble worthy knyght euer loued hys payne relees notwithſtādyng māhode hys myght loue vnto hym dyd full great vnryght aye bet dyd chylualrye hyndred enuye aye better dyd euery place hys knyghthode buſy payne ferther hys ladyes grace mercy myght neuer attayne hys deth coude refrayne daungere aye obey ſerue beſte coude playnly tyll ſterue fyne alſo hercules hys conqueſt hys worthyneſſe ſtrength alone peerles lyke bokes hym lyſt expreſſe ſette pyllers hys hye proweſſe awaye gaddes ſygnifye mā myght hym paſſe chyualrye whych pyllers ferre beyonde inde ſet golde remembraunce ſet behynde wyth hem loue lyſt febly auaunce hym ſet laſt vpon daunce agaynſt whome helpe may ſtryfe hys trouth loſte hys lyfe phebus alſo hys perſaunt lyght wente erthe lowe vnto herte wyth venus ſyght ywounded cupides bowe yet hys lady lyſt hym knowe though loue hys herte dyd blede let hym go toke hym hede ſhall ſaye yonge piramus trewe triſtram al hys hye renowne achylles antonius arcite hym palamowne ende paſſyoune ſorowe deth graue lo guerdon theſe louers haue falſe iaſon wyth hys doubleneſſe vntrewe calkos medee theſeus rote vnkyndneſſe wyth theſe two eke falſe en • e lo thus falſe aye one degre loue luſt wyll ſaue faſhode none ſkyll thebe eke falſe arcyte demephoon eke ſlouthe luſt al myght delyte al falſhode great vntrouthe thus euer loue ala routhe falſe liege forthereth may ſleeth trewe vngoodly day day trewe adon ſlayne bore amydde foreſt grene ſhade venus loue felte al ſore vulcanus wiht mercy made foule chorle many nyghtes glade mar knyght man fynde mercy comforte none alſo yonge freſſhe vpomedes luſty fre courage ſerue al herte ches athalans ſo fayre vyſage loue ala quitte hym ſo wage cruell daungere playnly laſt wyth deth guerdonleſſe paſt lo fyne loues ſeruyſe lo loue hys ſeruauntes quyte lo howe hys faythfull men dyſpyſe ſlee trewe men falſe reſpyte lo howe doth ſwerde ſorowe byte hertes ſuch mooſt hys luſt obey ſaue falſe trewe dey fayth othe worde ne aſſuraunce trewe meanynge awayte buſyneſſe styll porte ne faythfull attendaunce manhode ne myght armes worthyneſſe purſute worſhyp hye proweſſe ſtraunge lande rydynge ne trauayle ful lytell nought loue doth auayle peryll deth ſee ne lande hunger ne thurſte ſorowe ne ſyckeneſſe ne great empryſes take hande shedynge bloode ne manfull hardyneſſe ne ofte woundynge ſautes dyſtreſſe partynge lyfe deth alſo al nought loue taketh hede therto leſynges wyth flaterye falſhed doubleneſſe wyth tale newe many fayned lye falſe ſemblaunt coūtrefete hūbleſſe vnder colour depaynte wyth ſtedfaſtneſſe wyth fraude couered vnder pytous face accepte nowe ratheſt vnto grace hym ſelfe nowe beſt magnifye wyth fayned porte preſumpcion haunte cauſe wyth falſe ſurquidre vnder meanynge double entencion thynke one opinion ſaye another ſet hym ſelfe alofte hynder trouth ſene full ofte thynge bye nowe al dere thanked venus god cupide ſene myne oppreſſed chere hys arowes ſtycken ſyde ſaue deth nothynge abyde fro daye daye ala harde whyle euer darte hym lyſt fyle wofull herte ryue two taute mercy lacke pyte cauſeth payne wo lyſt one grace ſe vnto trouth cruelte moſte al complayne ſhe hath ioye laugh payne wylfully hath deth ſworne gyltleſſe wote cauſe saue trouth aforne alone ſerue faythfully god loue vnto cry thy blende double deyte thys great wronge complayne vnto thy ſtormy wylfull variaunce yment wyth chaūge great vnſtableneſſe vp ſo rēnyng thy chaūce truſt may ſekerneſſe wyte nothynge thy doubleneſſe archer blynde marketh nothynge ſhoteth wynde hath dyſcrecion wythout aduyſe let hys arowe go lacke ſyght alſo reaſon hys ſhotynge happeth ofte ſo hurte hys frende rather hys fo doth thys god wyth hys ſharpe flone trewe ſleeth letteth falſe gone hys woundyng thys yu worſt al hurteth doth ſo cruell wreche maketh ſycke crye call vnto hys foe hys leche harde man ſeche vpon poynte dethe ieopardye vnto hys foe fynde remedye thus fareth nowe euen foe yt gaue myne herte woūde mote aſke grace mercy pyte namely none may foūde nowe ſore leche wyll confounde god kynde ſo hath ſet myne vre lyues foe haue wounde cure ala whyle borne euer ſawe bryght ſonne nowe ſe full longe aforne borne deſteny ſponne parcas ſyſterne ſlee yf conne dethe ſhopen ſherte onely trouth may aſterte myghty goddeſſe alſo nature vnder god hath gouernaunce worldly thynges cōmytted cure dyſpoſed haue throgh wyſe purueiaūce gyue lady ſo moche ſuffyſaunce vertues therwythall puruyde murdre trouth hath take daūger gyde bounte beaute ſhappe ſemelyhed prudence wyt paſſyngly fayrneſſe benygne porte glad chere wyth lowlyhed womanhede ryght plenteous largeneſſe nature dyd fully impreſſe ſhe wrought alther laſt diſdayne hinder trouth ſhe made chāberlayne myſtruſt alſo falſe ſuſpection wyth myſbyleue ſhe made chefe counſayle thys concluſyon exyle trouth eke pyte court make mercy flee yt dyſpyte nowe holdeth forth reyne haſty byleue tale yt men feyne thus trouth ala murdred ſlayne wt wordes ſharpe kene gyltleſſe god wote treſpas lye blede vpon colde grene nowe mercy ſwete mercy lyues quene grace mercy yet preye ſeruyce man maye deye yf ſo ſhall dye algate ſhall none mercy haue yet deth let thys ben date wyl brouȝt graue haſtely yf lyſt ſaue ſharpe woundes ake ſo blede mercy charme alſo womanhede charme playnly none onely mercy helpe thys caſe though woundes blede euer one lyfe deth ſtandeth grace though gylte nothynge ala aſke mercy beſt entente redy dye yf ye aſſente agaynſt ſhall neuer ſtryue worde ne werke playnly ne may leuer haue alyue dye ſothly paye yea though thys ſame daye euer lyſt deuyſe suffyſeth dye ſeruyſe god yt knoweſt ye thoght euery wyght ryght euery thynge thou mayſt ſe yet er dye wyth full myght lowly praye graunt vnto ye goodly fayre freſhe fre whych onely ſlee defaute rothe dye ye maye knowe trouth ſoth ſuffiſeth ſhe knowe euery circumſtaunce wel payde ſhe lyſt deth vengeaunce vnto vnder ligraunce ſytte dome dyſobeye luſte wylfully deye wythout grutchynge rebellyon wyll worde holy aſſent maner contradiction fully commaundement yf dye teſtament herte ſende ſpirite alſo ſo euer ſhe lyſte wyth hem alder laſte womanhede mercy recomaunde lye nowe betwyxte hope drede abydynge playnly ſhe lyſt cōmaunde vtterly thys ny demaunde welcome whyle laſteth brethe ryght choyſe lyfe dethe • er might fayne syth hande wyll bothe lyfe deth ioye al payne fynally heſte holde ſhall tyl ſpirite deſteny fatall lyſt fro body wende haue trouth thus make ende worde gan ſygh ſore lyke hys herte ryue wolde wayne helde hys peace ſpake worde ſe hys wo mortall payne teres gonne fro myne eyen rayne full pytouſly inwarde r • ſaw ſo long wiſhing trouth thys whyle ſelfe kepte cloſe amonge bowes ſelf gonne hyde tyll laſt wofull man aroſe lodge wente beſyde may hys cuſtome tabyde sole complayne hys paynes kene yere yere vnder bowes grene bycauſe drewe nyght ſonne arke diurnall ypaſſed ſo perſaunt light hys bright bemes hys ſtremes waues water fall vnder bordure occyan hys chare golde hys courſe ſo ſwyftly ran whyle twylyght rowes rede phebus lyght deaurat alyte penne toke gan faſt ſpede wofull playnte thys man wryte worde worde dyd endyte lyke herde coude hem reporte haue ſet hertes diſporte ought myſſe laye wyte worthy beare blame thynge myſſe reported make dytte ſeme lame myne vncōning ſayn ſame lyke mā complaynt dyd expreſſe aſke mercy forgyueneſſe wrote thought ſawe ferre ferre weſt luſtely appere eſperus goodly bryght ſterre glad ſo fayre ſo perſaunt eke chere meane venus wyth bemes clere heuy hertes onely releue wonte cuſtome ſhewe eue faſt fell adowne kne euen thus gan prey lady venus ſo fayre vpon ſe let man hys trouthe deye ioy thou haddeſt whan thou leye wt mar thy knight whan vulcanus fonde chayne vnuyſyble bonde togyder bothe twaye ſame whyle courte aboue celeſtyall ſhame gan laughe ſmyle ah fayre lady wylly fonde comforte carefull goddes immortall helpynge nowe thy dilygence let ſtremes thyne influence deſcende fortheryng trouth namely hem lye ſorowe bounde ſhewe thy miȝt wo haue routh er falſe daunger ſle hem confounde ſpecially let thy myght founde ſocoure ſo thou maye trewe man herber lay trewe forther hys ſake glad ſterre lady venus myne cauſe hys lady hym grace take herte ſtele mercy ſo enclyne er thy bemes go vp declyne er thou nowe go fro v adowne loue thou haddeſt adowne whan ſhe gone reſt roſe anone home bed wente wery thought beſt prayenge thus beſt entente trewe wyth daunger ſhente wyth mercy may releaſe payne recured er maye come efte agayne ne may lenger wake farewell ye louers trewe prayenge god thus leue take er ſonne morowe riſſen newe er haue ayen roſen hewe eche may haue ſuche grace hys owne lady armes embrace meane thus honeſte wythout ye may togyder ſpeke ſo ye lyſt good lyberte eche may herte breke ialouſyes onely wreke hath ſo longe malyce enuye werred trouthe hys tyranny ¶lenuoye prynceſſe pleaſeth benygnyte thys lytell dyte haue mynde womanhode alſo ſe man may mercy fynde pyte eke long hath behynde let hym agayne prouoked grace trouthe agaynſt kynde falſe daunger occupye hys place go lytell quayre vnto lyues quene hertes ſouerayne ryght glad ſhe ſhall ſene suche thy grace ala payne lefte behynde playne mercy ruthe grace eke pyte exiled may attayne recure fynde myne aduerſyte ¶explicit ¶a preyſe woman tho lyſte woman euyll ſpeke fayn hem worſe deſerue pray god neckes breke ſome euyll dethe mote tho ianglers ſterne euery man holden hem ſerue hem worſhyp honour ſeruyce euery maner beſt coude deuyſe ouȝt fyrſt thynke manere brīg v forth payn endure fyrſt byrth ſyth fro yere yere howe buſely done theyr buſy cure kepe v fro euery myſauenture youth whan haue myght ſelfe kepe neyther daye nyght ala howe may ſay hem wele foſtred ybore ben al ſuccoure euer trew ſtele ſake full ofte ſuffre ſore wythout woman ioye lore wherfore ought woman obey goodneſſe ſay well knowen hath ben thys woman ben cauſe al lyghtneſſe knighthode norture eſchewyng al mali encreaſe worſhyp al worthyneſſe therto curteys meke grounde goodneſſe glad mery trewe euery wyſe gentyl herte thynke deuyſe though wold truſt vntruth fayre wordes wold aught aſſent good fayth thinketh gret ruth woman ſhold gylt ſhēt neuer knew ne wiſt nouȝt entēt ne lyſte ye fayre wordes ye write whyche ye payne fro day day tendyte may ware tale vntrew ye ſo buſyly paynt endyte ye wyll ſwere ye neuer knewe ne ſawe woman neyther moche ne lyte saue onely ye delyte ſerue euer ye ſey loue muſte ye nedes dey thā wyl ye ſwere ye knew neuer loue ne dredfull obſeruaunce nowe ye fele wounde ſore wherfore ye put gouernaunce whō loue hath ordeyned ſerue pleſaūce wt miȝt lytel lyues ſpace whyche endeth ſone yf ſhe grace bedde wyll ye ſoone drawe ſone ſicke ye wyll fayne ſwere faſt lady hath ſlawe brouȝt ſodeynly ſo hygh payn fro deth may mā reſtrayn wyth daungerous loke eyen two dethe muſt ye nedes go thus wyl ye morne thus wyll ye ſyghe ſore though herte anon ī two wold breſt ſwere faſt ye may lyue myne owne lady myght yf ye leſt brynge myne herte ſomdele reſt yf lyſt mercy haue thus vntrouth wyll euer mercy craue thus wol ye playne tho ye nothyng ſmerte theſe innocent creature begyle ſwere hem ſo wounded herte loue ye may lyue whyle scarſly ſo longe one might go myle hyeth dethe brynge ende yf ſouerayn lady lyſt amēde yf routh ſhe cōforte wyſe pyte falſe othes ſere ye innocent weneth yt deuyſe weneth herte ſhe may thus cōfort ſomwhat chere woll theſe ianglers deme ful yl ſayne ye haue fully wyl lo howe redy tonges ben preſt ſpeke harme woman cauſeleſſe ala might ye wel ſay beſt deme hem thus gyltleſſe herte ywis gentylneſſe gylte lyſt thus womē fame trouth thynk ye blame woman cometh worldly wele wherfore ought worſhip hē euermore though miſhap one ouȝt hele falſe lore day night payne v euermore wyth many othe theſe woman begyle wyth falſe tale many wycked wyle yf falſhede ſhulde reckened tolde woman iwys full trouthe men thouſande folde fro vyces twys ſtande clere thyng euer coude yf entyſyng theſe men make hem flatteren connen neuer ſlake wold fayne wher euer ye coude without men tiſing womē dyd amys ther ye may get hē ye lye fro yere yere many gabbynge ye make hem iwys coude neuer ne knowen er thys euer ye coude fynde place euer woman beſought grace ye payne al ful might wyth herte beſyneſſe pleaſen hem bothe day nyght prayeng hem grace gentylneſſe haue pyte vpon great diſtreſſe ye wolde payne haue routh ſlee ſens ye meane trouh thus may ye ſe ben fauteleſſe innocent werkes ſlye craftes touche falſneſſe know hem ne may hem eſpye ſweare ye ye muſt nedes dye yf wolde womanheed vpon rewe er ye deed lady hertes quene ye call hem therwyth ye ſygh ſore ſay lady trowe ſene plyte haue lyued full yore nowe hope ye woll theſe paynes ſuffre dwell goodneſſe iwys ye well lo whiche paynted proceſſe ye make theſe harmleſſe creature begyle whan ſlepe ye payne wake bethink many wycked wyle ye ſhal ſe day yt ye ſhal curſe ye whyle ye ſo beſily dyd entent hem begyle falſhede neuer ment ye knowe wel though wolde lye woman trouthe ſtedfaſtneſſe good faythe neuer hem ſye moche worſhyp bounte gentilneſſe right commyng fayre ful mekeneſſe good glad lowly enſure thys goodly angelyke creature yf happe man diſeaſe dothe buſyneſſe full payne wyth might comforte pleaſe fro hys diſeaſe ſhe might hym reſtrayne worde ne dede iwys ſhe wol fayne al might ſhe doth beſineſſe brynge hym hys heuyneſſe lo gentylleſſe theſe woman haue coude knowe rudeneſſe howe beſy v kepe ſaue bothe heale alſo ſyckneſſe alway ryght ſory diſtreſſe euery maner thus ſhewe routhe hem goodneſſe trouthe ſyth fynd hem gētilneſſe trouth worſhyp bounte kyndeneſſe euermore let neuer gētileſſe ſlouth kynde trouthe aught forlore woman hath ben ful yore reuerence heuens quene ought worſhyp woman bene creature yt euer get borne wote ye well woman beſt recouered ye blyſſe yt lorn yt woman ſhal come reſt ben yſaued yf ſelfe leſt wherfore thynketh yf grace oughten honour woman euery place therfore rede lyues ende fro thys tyme forth whyle yt haue ſpace haue treſpaced purſue amende prayenge lady well grace brynge v vnto blyſfull place ſhe good womē ſhal fere heuen aboue amonge angel clere ¶explicit houſe fame god tourne v euerye dreme good wōder thyng rood wytte cauſeth ſweuenes morowe euenes effecte foloweth ſome ſome ſhall neuer come auyſion thys reuelacyon thys dreme ſweuen nat euery man lyche euen fantome oracle ſo theſe myracles cauſes knowe bette defyne certaynly ne hem nat ne neuer thynke buſy wytte ſwynke knowe ſignifycations gendres ne diſtynctions tymes hem ne cauſes yeue folkes complexion make hem dreme reflexion el thus ſayne great febleneſſe brayne abſtynence ſyckneſſe pryſon ſtryfe great diſtreſſe el dyſordynaunce naturall accuſtomaunce ſome men curyous ſtudye melancolyous thus ſo inly full drede man may hym bote rede el deuocion ſome contemplacyon cauſen ſuche dremes ofte cruell lyfe vnſofte hem loues leden ofte hopen moche dreden purely impreſſyons cauſen hem haue viſyons yf ſpyrites han myght make folke dreame nyght yf ſoule proper kynde ſo perfyte men fynde wote come warneth ſome eueryche auentures auyſyons fygures fleſſhe hath myght vnderſtande ryght warned derkely cauſe wote well worthe thys thynge clerkes treaten werkes none opynyon nyll nowe make mencyon holye rood tourne v euery dreame good neuer ſythe borne ne man el beforne mette trowe ſtedfaſtly wonderfull dreame tenthe day nowe decembre whyche remembre woll tellen euery dele begynnyng truſteth wele woll make inuocation wyth deuoute ſpecyall deuocyon vnto god ſlepe anone dwelleth caue ſtone vpon ſtreme cometh fro lete fludde hell vnſwete beſyde fulke men clepe cymery ſlepeth aye god vnmery wyth hys ſlepy thouſande ſonnis alway ſlepe thys god rede 〈☐〉 praye woll ſpede ſweuen tell ryght euery dreme ſtande hys myght mouer euer ſhall gyue hem ioye ❧ dreme yere ſtande al grace loues place hem leueſt ſtonde ſhelde hem frome pouerte ſhonde frome euery vnhappe diſeaſe ſende hem may hem pleaſe taketh well ſcorneth nought ne miſdeme thought malycious entencion ſo preſumpcion hate ſcorne enuy diſpyte • ape felony myſdeme pray ieſus good dreme barefote dreme ſhood euery harme man hath ſythe worlde began befall hym therof ſterne graunt may deſerue lo wyth ryght ſuche concluſyon hys auiſyon creſus kyng lyde hygh vpon gybet dyde prayer ſhall haue bette charyte nowe herken haue ſayde mette abrayde decembre tenthe day whan nyght ſlepe lay right wonte doone fyll ſlepe wonder ſoone wery forgo pylgrimage myles two corp ſaynt leonarde maken lythe erſt harde ſlepte mette wythin temple ymade glas whyche mo ymages golde ſtandyng ſondrie ſtages mo ryche tabernacle wyth perre mo pynnacles mo curyous portratures queynt maner fygures golde worke ſawe euer certaynly nyſt neuer well wyſt venus redely temple purtreture ſawe anone ryght fygure naked fletyng ſee alſo heed parde roſe garlande whyte rede combe kembe hede dounes dan cupido blynde ſonne vulcano hys face full browne romed vp downe founde wall thus written table bra woll nowe ſynge yf armes alſo man fyrſt came hys deſtyne fugityfe fro troye countre itayle wyth full moche pyne vnto ſtrondes lauyne tho began ſtorie anone ſhall tellen echone fyrſt ſawe diſtruction troye greke synon wyth hys falſe vntrewe forſwerynges wyth hys chere hys leſynges made horſe brought troy whyche troyans loſte ioy thys graued ala howe ilyons caſtell aſſayled wone kyng priamus ſlayne polytes hys ſonne certayne diſpytouſly dan pyrrus next ſawe howe venus whan ſhe ſawe caſtell brende downe frome heuen ſhe gan diſcende bade ſonne eneas flye howe fledde howe eſcaped frome prees toke hys father olde anchyſes bare hym hys backe away cryeng ala welaway whyche anchyſes hys hande bare tho goddes lande thylke vnbrenned ſawe next fere howe cruſa dan eneas wyfe loued hys lyfe yonge ſonne iulo eke aſkanyus alſo fledden eke wyth drery chere pyte foreſt went tournyng went howe cruſa yloſte ala rede nat howe howe ſought howe goſte bade hym ſlye grekes hoſte ſayd muſte itayle hys deſtyne ſauns fayle pyte whan ſpyrite gan appere wordes ſhe hym ſayde kepe ſonne hym prayde ſawe grauen eke howe hys father eke hys meyne wyth hys ſhyppes gan ſayle towarde countre itayle ſtreyght myghten go ſawe eke cruell iuno arte dan iupyters wyfe haſte yhated thy lyfe troyan bloode ren crye thou woode eolus god wyndes blowen kyndes loude ſhulde drenche lorde lady grome wenche troyans nacyon wythout ſauacion ſawe ſuche tempeſt aryſt euery herte myght agryſe ſe paynted wall ſawe eke grauen wyth venus howe ye lady dere wepynge wyth full wofull chere prayenge iupyter hye ſaue kepe nauye trogian eneas sythe ſonne ſawe ioues venus kyſſe graunted tempeſt lyſſe ſawe howe tempeſt ſtente howe wyth pyne wente pryuely toke ryuage countre cartage morowe howe knyght hyght achate metten wyth venus day goyng queynte aray ſhe huntereſſe wyth wynde blowyng vpon treſſe howe eneas began playne whan knewe hys payne howe hys ſhyppes dreynt el yloſt nyſt howe ſhe gan hym comforte tho bade hym cartage go ſhulde hys folke fynde ſee lefte behynde ſhortly thys thyng pace made eneas ſo grace dydo quene countre ſhortly tellen ſhe became hys loue let hym weddyng longeth ſhulde ſpeke quaynte payne wordes paynte ſpeke loue well nat nat faculte eke tellen manere howe fyrſt acquaynted longe proceſſe tell ouer longe dwell ſawe graue howe eneas tolde dydo euery caas hym tyde vpon ſee efte grauen howe ſhe made hym ſhortly worde lyfe loue luſt lorde dyd hym reuerence layde hym diſpence woman myght wenyng ſo ſwore hereby demed good ſuche ſemed ala harme dothe apparence whan falſe exiſtence traytour wherfore ſhe ſlowe ſelfe ala lo howe woman dothe amys loue hym vnknowen chriſt lo thus fareth nat golde glareth alſo brouke well myne heed may vnder goodlyheed couered many ſhreude vyce therfore wyght ſo nyce take loue onely chere ſpeche frendly manere ſhall euery woman fynde ſome man pure kynde wol ſhewen outwarde fayreſt tyl haue caught leſt woll cauſes fynde ſwere howe ſhe vnkynde falſe priuy double al thys ſaye eneas dydo nyce leſt loued al ſoone geſt wherfore wol ſaye prouerbe fully knoweth herbe maye ſafely laye hys eye wythoutyn drede thys lye let v ſpeke eneas nowe betrayed ala lefte full vnkyndely whan ſhe ſawe al vtterly wolde trouth fayle wenden itayle gan wrynge handes two ala quod ſhe wo ala euery man thus trewe euery yere wol haue newe ſo longe tyme endure el parauenture thus one woll haue fame magnifyeng hys owne name another frenſhyp ſayth yet ſhal thyrde taken delyte lo el ſynguler profyte ſuch wordes gan complayne dydo great payne mette dremyng redyly none authour allege wol ala quod ſhe ſwete herte haue pyte ſorowes ſmerte ſlee go away woful dydo welaway quod ſhe vnto ſelfe tho eneas wol ye loue ne bonde ye ſwore ryght honde ne cruel deth quod ſhe maye holde ſtyl wyth haue ye deth pite iwys myne owne dere herte ye knowe full wel neuer yet farre euer wyt agylte thought ne dede haue ye men ſuch goodlyhede ſpeche neuer dele trouth ala euer routh woman falſe man nowe ſe wel tel wretched woman arte certayne parte thus bene ſerued euerychone howe ſore ye men grone anone haue receyued certaynly bene diſceyued though loue leſt ſeaſon wayte vpon concluſyon eke howe ye determyne parte defyne welawaye borne name lorne myne actes redde ſonge ouer al thys lande euery tonge wycked fame ny nothynge ſo ſwyfte lo ſhe ſoth euery thynge wyſt though couerde myſt eke though myght duren euer haue done recouer neuer ne ſhall ſayd ala ſhamed eneas ſhal thus iuged lo ryght ſhe hath done nowe ſhe wol done efteſones hardely thus ſaye people priuely done ny done complaynt ne mone certayne auayled ſtre whan ſhe wyſt ſothly forth ſhyp agone chambre went anone called ſuſter anue gan complayne thanne ſayde ſhe cauſe ſhe fyrſt loued ala fyrſt counſayled therto whan thys ſayd rofte ſeluen herte dyed woundes ſmerte al maner howe ſhe deyde al wordes howe ſhe ſeyde ſo knowe hath purpoſe rede virgyle eneydos pyſtles ouyde ſhe wrote ſhe dyde nere longe endyte god wolde wryte welawaye harme routh hath betydde ſuch vntrouth men maye ofte bokes rede aldaye ſene yet dede thynken tene lo demophon duke athenys howe forſwore falſely trayed phyllis wyckedly kynges doughter thrace falſely gan terme pace whan ſhe wyſt falſe honge ſelfe ryght halfe done ſuche vntrouth lo thys wo routh eke loke howe falſe recheles briſeyda achilles parys oenone iaſon hipſyphile efte iaſon medea hercules dyanira lefte iolee made take deth parde howe falſe eke theſeus ſtorye telleth v howe betrayed adriane dyuel ſoules bane laughed yloured muſt haue bene al denoured adriane ne ſhe pyte made hym fro deth eſcape made full falſe iape thys wythin whyle lefte ſlepynge yle deſerte alone ryght ſee ſtale awaye let toke ſuſter phedra tho wyth gan ſhyp go yet ſworne al euer coulde ſwere ſo ſhe ſaued lyfe wolde taken wyfe ſhe deſyred nothynge elles certayne boke v telles excuſe thys eneas fullyche al greate treſpas boke ſayth ſauns fayle goddes bade go itayle leauen affriques regioun fayre dydo towne tho ſawe graue howe itayle dan eneas gan fayle howe tempeſt al began howe loſt ſtereſman whiche ſterne kepe smote ouer borde ſlepe alſo ſaugh howe sybyle eneas beſyde yle hel wente ſe father anchiſes fre howe founde palymurus alſo dido deiphebus eueryche tourment eke hel sawe whych longe tel whych paynes ſo lyſte knowe muſt rede many rowe virgyle claudian daunt tellen tho ſawe eke al aryuayle eneas made itayle wyth kinge latyn trete batayls hym ſelfe knyghtes al ywon hys ryghtes howe turnus reſte hys lyfe wan lauyna hys wyfe al merueylous ſygnals goddes celeſtials howe maugre iuno eneas al ſleyght compas atcheued hys auenture iupiter toke cure prayer venus whiche praye alwaye ſaue v v aye ſorowes lyght whan ſene al thys ſyght thys noble temple thus hey lorde thought madeſt v yet ſawe neuer ſuche nobleſſe ymages ſuche rycheſſe ſe grauen church naught wote hem worche ne ne countre nowe wyll gone ſe ryght wyket yf sene ought ſteryng man maye tellen whan dore cam faſt behelde ſawe large felde farre euer myght ſe wythout towne houſe tre buſhe graſſe eared lande felde ſande ſmall men may ſe eye deſerte lyby ne maner creature yformed nature ne ſawe rede wyſſe chriſt thought art blyſſe fanton illuſyoun ſaue deuocioun myne eyen heauen caſt tho ware lo laſt falt ſunne hye kenne myght wyth myne eye thought ſawe egle ſore ſemed muche egle yſeyne thys ſoth deth certeyne golde ſhone ſo bryght neuer ſawe men ſuche ſyght yf heuen ywonne aſ newe god another ſunne ſhone egles fethers bryght ſomwhat downwarde gan lyght ¶explicit liber primus nowe herken euerye maner man englyſhe vnderſtand lyſteth dreame erſt ſhal ye lere ſely ſo dredefull viſyon ſaye neyther scipion ne kynge nabugodonoſore pharao turnus ne alcanore ne metten ſuch dreame thys nowe fayre blyſfull cipris fauour tyme ye tendyte ryme helpeth pernaſo dwell beſyde elycon clere well thought wrote met treaſorye ſet brayne nowe ſhall men ſe vertue tell dreme ryght nowe kyth thy engyn thy myght thys egle haue tolde fethers ſhone al golde whiche ſo hye gan ſore gan beholde ſene beaute wonder neuer dynte thonder ne thynge men call foudre ſmyte ſomtyme towre poudre hys ſwyfte commyng brende ſo ſwyfte gan downwarde diſcende thys foule whan behelde rowme felde wyth grym pawes ſtronge wythin ſharpe nayles longe flyeng ſwappe hente wyth ſours agayne vp wente caryeng clawes ſtarke lyghtly bene larke howe hye tellen yowe came vp nyſt neuer howe ſo aſtonyed aſweued euery vertue heued wyth ſours dreed felynge gan deed great affray thus longe clawes lay tyl laſt ſpake mannes voyce ſayd awake agaſt ſo ſhame callen tho name ſhulde better abrayde awake thus ſayde right ſame voice ſteuyn vſeth one neuyn voice ſoth ſayne mynde came agayne goodly ſayd na neuer wonte withall gan ſtere fete bere tyl felt heate felte eke tho myne herte beate tho gan diſporte wyth gentyll wordes comforte ſayd twyſe ſaynt mary thou arte noyous thynge cary nothynge nedeth perde alſo wyſe god helpe thou harme ſhalte haue thys caſe betydde thy lore thy prowe lette se • arſt thou loke yet nowe ful enſured boldely thy frende therwith gan wonder mynde god quod madeſt al kynde shal none otherwyſe dye whether ioue wyll ſtellyfye thynge may ſignifye neyther enocke ne helye ne romulus ne ganemede bore vp men rede heuen dan iupiter made goddes boteler lo tho fantaſye bare gan eſpy ſo thought ſayde thou demeſt thy ſelfe amys ioue aboute dare put ful doute make yet ſterre er bere moche ferre wyl tel whyther thou ſhalte cam ſo thou take good herte fere quake gladly quod nowe wel quod firſt fete haue thou haſt feare wonder dwellyng wyth god thonder whych men callen iupiter doth ſtyen ful ofte fer al thys commaundement thys cauſe hathe ſent herke nowe thy trouth certayne hath routh thou haſt ſo truely longe ſerued ententyfely hys blynde neuewe cupido fayre venus alſo wythout guerdon euer yet netheles haſt ſet thy wyt although thy heed full lytle make bokes ſonges ditees ryme el cadence thou beſt canſt reuerence loue hys ſeruauntes eke haue ſeruyce ſought ſeke payneſt prayſe arte although thou haddeſt neuer parte wherfore alſo god bleſſe iouis halte great humbleſſe vertue eke thou wylt make nyght full ofte thyne heed ake thy ſtudye ſo thou wryteſt euermore loue endyteſt honour prayſynges hys folkes furtherynges matter al deuyſeſt hym ne folke diſpiſeſt although thou mayſt go daunce hem hym lyſt auaunce wherfore ſayd ywys iupiter conſydereth wel thys alſo beauſyre thynges thou haſt tydynges loues folke yf glade ne nothynge el god made onely fro farre countre tydynges comen thy neyghbours dwellen almooſt thy dores thou hereſt neyther ne thys whan thy labour al done haſt made thy rekenynges ſtede reſt newe thynges thou goeſt home thyne houſe anone alſo dombe ſtone thou ſytteſt another boke tyl fully daſed thy loke lyuyſt thus hermyte although thyne abſtinence lyte therfore iouis hys grace wyl bere place whiche hyght houſe fame ſporte game ſome recompenſatioun thy labour deuotioun thou haſt lo cauſeles god cupido recheles thus thys god hys meryte wyl wyth ſome maner thynge quyte thou wylte good chere truſt well thou ſhalt whan comen ſaye mo wonder thynges dare laye loues folke mo tydynges ſothſawes leaſynges mo loues newe begon longe ſerued tyl loue mo louers caſuelly bene betydde man wote blynde man ſtarteth hare iolyte welfare whyle fynde loue ſtele thynke men ouer wele mo diſcordes mo ialouſyes mo murmures mo nouelryes alſo mo diſſimulacions eke feyned reperations mo berdes two houres wythout raſour ſyſoures ymade graynes ſandes eke mo holdyng mo handes alſo mo renouelaunces olde forleten acqueyntaunces mo louedayes mo accordes inſtumentes bene cordes eke loue mo exchaunges euer corne graunges vnneth mayſt thou trowen thys quod ſo helpe god wy quod quod impoſſible wyt though fame pyes al realme al eſpyes howe yet ſhulde al thys eſpyen yes yes quod preue reaſon worthy leue thou gyue thyne aduertence vnderſtande ſentence fyrſt ſhal thou ſhe dwelleth ryght ſo thyne owne boke telleth palays ſtandeth ſhall ſay ryght euen amyddes way bytwene heuen erth ſee ſo euer theſe thre ſpoken pryue apperte way therto ſo ouerte ſtante eke ſo iuſte place euery ſowne mote pace ſo cometh tonge rowned redde ſonge ſpoken ſurete drede certayne mote thyther nede nowe herken wel wyl tellen proper ſkyl worthy demonſtration myne ymaginacyon geffray thou wotteſt wel thys euery kyndly thynge hath kyndly ſtede maye beſt conſerued vnto whiche place euery thynge kyndly enclynynge meueth come whan awaye therfro thus lo howe thou mayſt al day ſe take thynge heuy ſtone leed thyng weyght bere neuer ſo hye heyght let go thyne hande falleth downe ryght ſo ſay fyre ſowne ſmoke thynges lyght alwaye ſeke vpwarde heyght lyght thyngs vp downwarde charge whyle eueryche hem large thys cauſe thou mayſt well ſe euery ryuer vnto ſee enclyned go kynde theſe ſkylles fynde haue fyſhes dwellyng flode ſee tree eke erth thus euery thynge hys reaſon hath owne proper manſion whiche ſeketh repeyre ſhulde appeyre lo thys ſentence knowen couth euery philoſophers mouth ariſtotle dan platone clerkes many one confirme reaſoun thou woſt wel ſpeche ſowne el man might nowe herke wyl lere sowne eyre ybroken euery ſpeche ſpoken loude pryue foule fayre hys ſubſtaunce eyre flame lyghted ſmoke ryght ſo ſowne eyre ybroke thys maye many wyſe whych wyl deuyſe ſowne cometh pype harpe whan pype blowen ſharpe eyre twyſt wyth violence rent lo thys ſentence eke whan men harpe ſtrynges ſmyte whether muche lyte lo wyth ſtroke eyre breketh ryght ſo breketh whan men ſpeketh thus woſt thou well thing ſpeche nowe henſforth wyl teche howe euery ſpeche voyce ſowne throughe multiplycacyowne thoughe pyped mouſe mote nedes come fame houſe proue thus take hede nowe experience yf thou threwe water nowe ſtone well woſt thou wyl make anone lytle roundle cercle parauenture brode couercle ryght anone thou ſhalte ſe well whele cercle wyl cauſe another whele thyrde ſo forthe brother euery cercle cauſynge broder hym ſelfe thus fro roundel compas eche aboute goynge cauſeth others ſterynge multeplyeng euermo tyl ſo farre go bothe brynkes al thoughe thou may ſe aboue yet gothe alway vnder though thou thynke greate wonder ſo ſaythe trouthe vary bydde hym proue contrary right thus euery worde ywys loud pryue yſpoken moueth firſt eyre aboute mouynge doute another eyre anone moued haue water proued euery cercle cauſeth right ſo eyre leue brother eueryche eyre ſtereth ſpeche vp bereth voyce noyſe worde ſowne aye multiplicatiowne tyl houſe fame take erneſt game nowe haue tolde yf thou haue mynde howe ſpeche ſowne pure kynde enclyned vpwarde meue thys mayſt thou fele well preue ſome ſtede ywys euery thynge enclyned hath hys kyndlyche ſtede ſeweth wythout drede kyndly mancyoun euery ſpeche euery ſoun nowe vnneth great beeſtes nowe ryuers nowe citees nowe townes nowe great tree nowe ſhippes ſaylyng ſee thus ſoone whyle flowen fro grounde ſo hye al worlde myne eye ſemed pricke el eyre ſo thycke paradyſe ne eke wretche dedalus ne chylde nyce icharus flewe ſo hye hete wynges molte fel wete mydde ſee dreynte made great complaynte nowe tourne vpwarde quod thy face beholde large ſpace eyre loke fame great renome knowen name haue noble ieſtes acheued queſtes well loue thyng v neuer broche ne ryng ne el fro woman ſent ne one herte yment maken v onely frendly chere mought temen v bere yet let v people ſeme suche worlde may v deme woman louen v woode ſhall v moche good herte moche auayle counterpeyſe eaſe trauayle wone wyth labour dere bought honoure regarde great eaſe yet ye muſte v pleaſe let v holde eke therto worthy wyſe good alſo ryche happy vnto loue goddes loue ſytteth aboue though may nat body haue woman yet ſo god ſaue lette men glewe v name suffyſeth haue fame graunt ꝙ ſhe trouthe nowe eolus wythouten ſlouthe take thy trumpe golde ꝙ ſhe blowe haue aſked euery man wene hem eaſe though go full badde leaſe thys eolus gan ſo blowe worlde yknowe tho came ſeuenth route anone fyll knee euerychone ſayd lady graunt v ſoone ſame thyng ſame boone next folke haue done fye ꝙ ſhe euerychone ye maſty ſwyne ye ydel wretch full roten ſlowe tet ches falſe theues ye wolde ben famed good nothyng nolde deſerue ne neuer thought men rather hangen ought ye lyke ſlepy catte wolde haue fyſh woſt thou woll nothyng wete hys clawes yuell thrifte come iawes myne yf graunt fauour auaunt thou eolus thou kyng trace go blowe folke ſory grace ꝙ ſhe anone woſt thou howe ſhall tell ryght nowe say theſe ben wolde honour haue kyns labour ne good yet haue laude men wende beelle iſaude ne coude hem nat loue werne yet ſhe grynt querne al good eaſe herte eolus anon vp ſterte blacke clarion gan blaſen ſoun lounde belleth wynde hel eke therwith ſothe tel ſowne ſo ful iapes euer mowes ape went al worlde aboute euery wight gan hem ſhoute laugh wode suche game founde hode tho came another company ydone trechery harme great wickedneſſe herte couden geſſe prayed haue good fame ſhe nolde hem ſhame gyue hem loo good renoun blowe claryoun nay wy quod ſhe vyce al iuſtyce lyſt nat nowe ne nyl graunt tho came leapyng route gan clappen al aboute euery man vpon crowne al hall gan ſowne ſayd lady lete dere ben ſuche folkys ye may tel al tale ryght ben ſhrewes euery wyght haue delyte wickedneſſe good folke haue goodneſſe ioye knowen ſhrewes ful vyce wicked thewes wherfore praye rowe fame ſuche yknowe al thing ryght graunt quod ſhe ywys arte thou ſayeſt tale weareſt thy hoſe pale thy typpet ſuche bell madame ꝙ ſothe tell ylke ſhrewe ywis brent temple iſydis • henes lo cyte wherfore dyddeſt thou ſo ꝙ ſhe trouthe ꝙ madame wolde ſayne haue name folke towne although great renowne vertue thewes thought great fame haue ſhrewes though naught ſhreudneſſe good folke haue goodneſſe ſythen may nat haue one nyll nat forgone get fame temple ſette fyre nowe loo blowe ſwythe wyſly thou euer blythe gladly ꝙ ſhe thou eolus hereſt thou prayen v madame yes full well ꝙ wyll trumpen parde toke hys blacke trumpe faſt gan puffen blaſte tyll worldes ende wyth gan aboute wende one ſtode ryght bake thought full goodly ſpake ſayd frende thy name arte thou come hyder haue fame nay ſothe frende ꝙ come nat hyther grant mercy ſuche cauſe heed suffyſeth deed wyght haue name honde wote ſelfe beſt howe ſtonde drie thynke woll ſelfe drynke certayne parte ferforthe myne arte doeſt thou ꝙ ꝙ woll tell cauſe ſtande newe tydynges lere newe thyng tydinges eyther thys loue ſuche thynges glade certaynly made come hyder ſayd ſhulde bothe ſe place wonder thynges theſe ſuche tidynges ment ꝙ anſwerde parde well wote euer yet sythe fyrſt wyt ſome folke han deſyred fame diuerſly loo name certaynly nyſt howe ne fame dwelled nowe ne eke diſcripcion ne alſo condycion ne order dome knewe nat tyll hyder come lo theſe tydynges thou nowe hyther brynges thou haſte herde ꝙ nowe force well ſe thou deſyreſt lere come forthe ſtande lenger woll wythout drede ſuche another place lede thou ſhalt many one tho gan forthe wyth hym gone caſtell ſothe ſey tho ſawe ſtande valey vnder caſtell faſte houſe domus dedaly laborintus ycleped na made ſo wonderly iwys ne halfe ſo queyntly ywrought ☞ euermo ſwyfte thought thys queynt houſe aboute went neuermo ſtyll ſtent came ſo great noyſe ſtonde vpon oyſe men myght haue herde eaſely rome trowe ſikerly noyſe whyche herde worlde ryght ſo ferde dothe routyng ſtone fro thengyn letyn gone thys houſe whyche rede made twygges falowe rede grene eke ſome whyte suche men theſe cage twhyte maken theſe panyers el hutch doſſers ſwough twygges thys houſe alſo full gygges alſo full eke chyrkynges many workynges eke houſe hath entree many leues ben tree ſommer whan ben grene 〈☐〉 rofe yet men may ſene thouſande hole well mo letten ſowne go day euery tyde ben dores open wyde nyght eche one vnſhette ne porte none lette maner tidynges pace ☞ ne neuer reſt place ny fylled full tidynges eyther loude whyſperynges euer houſes angle full rownynges iangles werres peace maryages reſtes labour vyages abode dethe lyfe loue hate accorde ſtryfe loſſe lore wynnynges heale ſyckneſſe leſynges fayre wether eke tempeſtes qualme folke beeſtes dyuers tranſmutacions eſtates eke regyons truſt dred ialouſy wytte wennyng foly plentie great famyne chepe derthe ruyne good miſgouernment fyre dyuers accydent lo houſe whiche write syker ye na nat lyte ſixtie myle length al tymbre ſtrength yet founded endure whyle lyſt auenture mother tydinges ſee welles ſpringes ſhapen lyke cage certes quod al myn age ne ſawe ſuche houſe wondred ywis vpon houſe tho ware howe myne egle faſte perched hye vpon ſtone gan ſtreight hym gone ſayd thus pray thou whyle abyde goddes loue let ſene wonder place bene yet peraunter may lere good therin ſomwhat lefe went peter nowe myn entent quod therfore dwel certayne one thyng tel bringe therin ne ſhal thou neuer conne gyn come doute faſte whyrieth lo aboute ſythe ioues grace haue ſayd wyl ſolace finally theſe thynges vncouthe ſyghtes tidynges paſſe thyne heuyneſſe suche routhe hath thy diſtreſſe thou ſuffredeſt debonairly woſte thy ſeluen vtterly deſperate al blyſſe sythe fortune hath made myſſe ſwote al thyn hertes reſt languyſſhe eke poynte breſt myghtie meryte wyl eaſe al lyte • aue expreſſe conmaundement whyche obedyent forther wyth myght wyſſe teche ryght thou mayſte moſte tidynges thou ſhalte many one lere wyth thys worde ryght anone hent vp bytwene hys tone wyndowe brought thys houſe thought wythall thought ſtent nothyng aboute went ſette floore adoun ſuche great congregacioun folke ſawe rome aboute wythin ſome wythout na neuer ſene ne ſhall efte certes thys worlde ny lefte many formed nature ne deed ſo many creature well vnneth place foote brede ſpace euery wyght ſawe rowned eueryche others cere newe tydynge pryuely el tolde openly ryght thus ſayde noſt nat thou tydde lo ryght nowe ꝙ tel tolde hym thys ſwore therto ſothe thus hath ſayde thus dothe thys ſhall thus herde ſay ſhall founde dare laye folke lyue ne haue connyng diſcryue tho thynges herde loude eere wonder moſte thys whan one herde thyng ywis came ſtreyght another wyght gan hym tellen anon ryght ſame hym tolde furlonge way olde gan ſomwhat eche thys tydyng thys ſpeche euer ſpoken nat ſo ſone departed na tho fro hym ne mette wyth thyrde er lette ſtounde tolde hym alſe tydynges ſothe falſe yet wolde tell natheles euer mo wyth encrees erſt thus northe ſouthe went euery tydyng fro mouthe mouthe encreaſyng euermo fyre wonte quycken go frome ſparcle ſprongen amys tyll cyte brent vp whan full vp ſpronge waxen euerye tonge euer went anone vp wydowe gone myght paſſe gan crepe ſome creuaſſe flewe forthe faſte none ſomtyme ſawe one leaſynge ſadde ſothe ſawe gonnen auenture drawe wyndowe pace whan metten place checked bothe two neyther hem myght go eche gonne ſo croude tyll eche hem gan cryen loude let gon fyrſt nay let woll enſuren wyth none thou wolte ſo ſhall neuer fro go thyne owne ſworne brother woll meddle v eche man neuer ſo wrothe shall haue one two bothe one beſyde hys leue come amorowe eue cryde ſtyll yrowned thus ſawe falſe ſothe compowned togyder flye tydynge thus hole gonne wrynge euerye tydynge ſtreyght fame ſhe gan yeue eche hys name dyſpoſycion yeue hem eke duracion wexe wane ſoone dothe fayre whyte moone let hem gone myght ſeen wynged wonder faſte flyen twenty thouſande route eolus hem blewe aboute lorde thys houſe tymes full ſhypmen pylgrymes wyth ſcryppes brette full leaſynges entremelled wyth tidynges eke alone hem ſelue many thouſande tymes twelue sawe eke theſe pardoner currours eke meſſangers wyth box crommed full lye euer veſſell wyth lye alther faſteſt wente aboute dyd myne entent playen lere eke tydynge herde ſome countre ſhall nowe tolde nede redely folke ſynge bet mote late rathe ſheues rathe herde great noyſe wythall corner hall men loue tydynges tolde gan thyderwarde beholde ſawe rennynge euery wyght faſte hadden myght eueryche cryde thynge ſome ſayd neuer hepe tho behynde gonne vp lepe clamben vp faſte vp noyſe hyghen caſte treden faſte others heles ☞ ſtampe men done eles laſte ſawe man whych naught ne ſemed man great authorite therwythall abrayde ſlepe halfe afrayde remembrynge well ſene howe hye ferre bene gooſt great wonder ☞ god thonder let knowen began wryte lyke ye haue herde endyte wherfore ſtudye rede alwaye purpoſe daye daye thus dreamynge game endeth thys lytell boke fame ¶here foloweth teſtament loue teſtament loue many men bene wyth eeres openly ſprad ſo moche ſwalowen deliciouſneſſe ieſtes ryme queynte knyttynge coloures goodneſſe badneſſe ſentence take lytell hede el none sothelye dull wytte thoughtfull ſoule ſo ſore haue myned graſſed ſpirites ſuche crafte endytynge woll ben myne acquayntaunce rude wordes boyſtous percen herte herer inreſt poynte planten ſentence thynges ſo wyth lytell helpe able ſprynge thys boke nothynge hath greate floode wyt ne ſemelych colour doluen wyth rude wordes boyſtous ſo drawe togyther maken catcher herof ben redy hent ſentence men ben peynten wyth colour ryche ſome wyth vers wyth red ynke ſome wyth cole chalke yet good matere leude people thilke chalky purtreiture hem thinketh tyme afterwarde ſyght better colour yeuen hem ioy fyrſt leudneſſe ſothly thys leude cloudye occupacion prayſe leude comenly leude leudneſſe cōmendeth eke ſhal yeue ſight precious thinges ſhalbe reuerence latyn french hath many ſoueraine wyttes gret delyte endyte haue many noble thynges fulfylde certes ben ſome yt ſpeken theyr poyſy mater frenche whyche ſpeche frenche men haue good fantaſye haue hearyng french mennes englyſhe many termes ben englyſhe whych vnneth englyſhmen connen declare knowlegynge howe ſhulde frenche man borne ſuch termes conne iumpere hys mater iaye chatereth englyſhe ryght ſo truly vnderſtandynge englyſhmen woll ſtretche priuy termes frenche ſo euer boſten ſtraunge langage let clerkes endyten latyn haue propertye ſciēce knowynge facultye lette frenchman theyr frenche alſo endytē theyr queynt termes kyndly theyr mouthes let v ſhewe fantaſyes ſuche wordes lerneden dame tonge although thys boke lytel thanke worthy leudneſſe trauayle yet ſuch wrytynges exciten men thylke thynges yt bene neceſſarie euery mā therby maye perpetual myrrour ſene vyces vertues thynge lyghtly may cō ceyued eſchewe peryls neceſſaries catche auētures haue fallen people perſons certes ye ſoueraynſt thing deſyre moſte creature reaſonable haue el ſhulde haue ful appetyte theyr perfection vnreſonable beeſtes mowen ſyth reaſon hath hem werkynge reaſonable wol comparyſoned vnreſonable made lyke hem forſothe moſte ſouerayne fynall perfection mā knowynge ſoth wythouten entent dyſceyuable loue one god inchaungeable knowe loue hys creatour ¶nowe principally meane brynge knowlegyng louyng hys creatour conſyderacion thinges made creatour wherthrough thylke thynges bene made vnderſtādynge wyttes arne vnſene priuytees god made v ſightful knowing cō templacion vnderſtandyng theſe thinges forſoth moch bryngen v ye ful knowlegynge ſothe parfyte loue maker heauenly thynges lo dauid ſayeth thou haſte delyted makynge ſayeth haue delite ye tune god hath lent cōſyderation thy makynge wherof ariſtotle boke de animalibus ſayeth naturel philoſophers great lykynge loue knowynge theyr creatour alſo knowynge cauſes kyndelye thynges conſydred forſothe formes kyndly thynges ye ſhap great kyndly loue mē ſhulde haue werkman yt hem made crafte werkman ſhewed werke herefore truly philoſophers lyuely ſtudye many noble thynges ryghte precious worthy memory wrytten great ſwet ande trauayle v leften cauſes property nature thynges whyche therfore phyloſophers ioye lykynge herty luſt kyndly vertues mater reaſon ye perfection buſy ſtudy knowe thē haue al treaſure al rycheſſe al ye vaynglory yt paſſed emperours prynces kynges hadden therfore ye name hem ye boke perpetual memory vertue peace arne wrytten contrary ſayne ſtixe ye foule pytte helle arne thilke preſſed ſuche goodneſſe hated bycauſe thys boke ſhall loue pryme cauſes ſterynge doynge paſſyons dyſeaſes wantynge deſyre wyll boke cleped ye teſtamēt loue thou reder thylke ye wyl ſcorne laughe dwerfe el halfe man ſay wyll rende ſwerd hercules handes alſo ſhulde ſet hercules gades myle yet ferther ouer power ſtrength pul vp ſpere aliſander ye noble myght neuer wegge paſſyng al thynge ben maſter fraunce myght noble gracious edwarde thyrde hys greate prowes vyctories ne myght al yet cōquere certes wote wel ther ſhalbe made ſcorne iape ſo vnworthely clothed altogether cloudy cloude vncō nynge wyl puttē prees ſpeke loue el cauſes mater ſythen ye greateſt clerkes han ynough done ſayth gathered vp clene toforne hem wyth theyr ſharpe ſythes connynge mowen made therof great rekes noble full plentyes fede many another enuye forſothe cōmendeth nought hys reaſon yt hath hayne neuer ſo truſty although theſe noble repers good workman worthy theyr hyer haue al drawe bounde vp ye ſheues made many ſhockes yet haue enſample gather ſmale crōmes fullē walet tho fallen borde among • ſmale houndes notwythſtandynge trauayle almoygner yt hath drawe vp cloth al remyſſayles trenchours relyfe bere almeſſe yet alſo haue leue ye noble huſbonde boece although ſtraunger connynge come doctrine theſe great workmē glene handful ſhedynge theyr handes fayle ought ful encreaſe porcion ſhal drawe priuytyes ſhocke ſlye precyous margaryte wyth thy noble vertue haſte drawen loue fyrſt wenyng therof haue bliſſe galle aloe ſo moch ſpronge ſauour ſwetneſſe may attaſte ala benigne eyen whych mercy ſemeth haue al hys noriture nyll waye tourne clereneſſe mercy wardes ala youre brennande vertues ſhynynge amonges folke enlumynynge people habundaūce encreaſing ſheweth ſmok lyght theſe thynges thinke myne hert maketh euery day weping myne eyen renne theſe lyggen backe ſo ſore importable burthen ſemeth backe charged maketh backwarde meue ſteppes comune courſe euen forth pretende theſe thynges alſo ryghtſyde lyfte haue ſo enuolued wyth care wāhope helpe throughout ronne trewly leue graceleſſe fortune whych euer ſheweth mewardes cloudy dyſeaſe already make ſtormes tene blyſfull ſyde halte ſtyl awayward woll ſuffre mewardes turne force yet wol ben cōquered ala nobley ſo moch amonge creature cōmended folowynge ſtreme al maner vertues ther ben wō derful let flode come ſoule wherfore purely mated wyth ſorowe thorough ſought ſelfe crye goodneſſe haue pyte thys caytyfe inreſt degre ſorowe dyſeaſe lefte wythout goodly wyll frō helpe recouery theſe ſorowes maye ſuſtene yf ſorowe ſhulde tolde wardes ſhewed although moche ſpace bytwene v twaine yet thynketh ſuche ioleynynge wordes dyſeaſe gyuueth ebbe trewly thynketh ſowne lamentacious wepyng right flowe preſence cryeth mercy grace whyche thyng ſemeth lyſt none anſwere yeue deynous chere ye cōmaunden auoyde god forbyd worde ſhulde ſprynge haue ſo lytel routh parde pyte mercy euery margarite cloſed kynde amōges many vertues qualites comforte comfort ryght naught worth wythouten mercy pyte alone whych thynges haſtely god graūt mercye reherſynge theſe thinges many wythout tyme moment reſt ſemed anguyſhe dyſeaſe altogether rauiſhed tell howe holy paſſyons felynges loſte ſemed tyme ſodaynly maner drede lyght one nought ſuch feare folke haue enemy myghty wolde hem greue done hem dyſeaſe trowe thys wel knowe many perſones otherwhyle yf man hys ſoueraynes preſence maner ferdneſſe crepeth hys herte harme goodly ſubiection namely men reden aungels ben aferde ſauyour heuen pardy ne ne may paſſyō diſeaſe meane angel ben adrade frendes drede ſythē ben perfytly blyſſed affection wōderfulneſſe ſeruice obedience ſuch ferde alſo han theſe louers preſence theyr loues ſubiectes aforne theyr ſoueraynes ryght ſo wyth ferdeneſſe myne herte caught ſodaynly aſtonyed entred place lodged ladye ſemelyeſt mooſt goodly ſyght euer forne apered creature truly bluſtryng loke ſhe yaue gladneſſe comforte ſodaynlye wyttes ryghte ſo ſhe dothe euery wyght cometh preſence ſhe ſo goodlye thought myne herte beganne ſomdele enbolded wexte lytel hardy ſpeake yet wyth quakynge voyce durſte ſalued enquyred ſhe ſhe ſo worthy ſyghte dayned entre ſo foule doūgeon namelye pryſon wythout leaue kepers certes althoughe vertue dedes mercye ſtretchen vyſyten poore priſoners hem faculty ben comfort ſemed ſo ferre fallē myſerye wretched hyd caytyfneſſe ſhulde precious thynge nyghe alſo ſorowe euery wyght ſhulde ben heauy wyſhe recouery thys lady ſomdele aperceyued wel wordes chere thought • yed wythin wyth good womanly coū tenaunce ſhe ſayd theſe wordes nory wenyſt thou maner foryet frendes ſeruauntes naye quod ſhe full entente vyſyte comforte al frendſhyppes alyes well tyme perturbation mooſt propertye blyſſe ſhall vnkyndneſſe neuer founden alſo ſythen haue ſo fewe eſpecyal trewe nowe theſe dayes wherfore maye well leyſar come hem deſeruen yf comynge maye thynge auayle wete wel woll come often good lady quod art ſo fayre loke reynynge honny thy wordes blyſſe paradyſe arne thy lokynges ioy comforte thy mouynges thy name ſo mokel werkynge vertues enpyght ſemeth none creature euer ſawe wyth myne eyen dyſcyple ꝙ ſhe wōdreth thy wordes yt lytel diſeaſe haſte foryeten name woſte thou well loue firſt brought thy ſeruyce good lady quod thys worſhyp thyne excellence come ſo foule place parde ſomtyme tho proſperite wyth foreyne goodes enuolued mokel done drawe myne hoſtel yet many wernynges thou madeſt er thou lyſte fullye graunt thyne home make dwellyng place nowe thou comeſt goodly thyne owne vyſe comforte wyth wordes ſo thoroughe gynne remembre paſſed gladneſſe trewly ladye ne wotte whether ſhal ſay welcome none ſythen thy comyng wol moch tene ſorowe gladneſſe myrthe ſe comforteth thinke paſſed gladneſſe anoyeth efte doynge thus thy comynge bothe gladdeth teneth cauſe moche ſorowe lo ladye howe comforted commyng gan teeres dyſtylle tenderlye wepe nowe certes quod loue ſe well ouerthynketh wytte fayleth arte poynte dote trewly quod haue ye maked euer woll rue wotteſt thou nat wel quod ſhe euery ſhepeherde ought reſon ſeke hys ſperkelande ſhepe arne ronne wylderneſſe amonge buſhes peryls hem theyr paſture ayen bringe take hem priuy beſy cure kepynge tho vnconnyng ſhepe ſcattred wolde ben loſte rennyng wylderneſſe deſertes drawe el wolden put hem ſelfe ſwalowynge wolfe yet ſhal ſhepherd buſyneſſe trauayle ſo put hym forth ſhall nat let hem loſte waye good ſhepeherd putteth rather hys lyfe ben loſte hys ſhepe thou ſhalte wene beynge werſe condicyon truly euerych folke tho warde knyt condicion wil rather dye ſuffre hem erroure ben ſpylt lyſt lyketh myne ſheperdeſſe cleped▪ wotteſt thou well fayled neuer wyght refuſed wolde neglygently go vnkyndneſſe yet parde hau • manye ſuch holp releued haue oft begyled euer ende diſcendeth theyr owne neckes haſt thou radde kynde parys priamus ſon troye iaſon falſed hys falſe beheſt seſars ſonke left tene tyll troned blyſſe ſeruyce▪ ꝙ ſhe moſt maked louedaye betwene god mankynde cheſe mayde nompere put quarell ende lo haue trauayled haue thanke ſydes yet lyſt reſt myght fynde whō ſhulde werche truly myne owne dyſciple bycauſe haue founde aſſayes thy wyll ben readye mye heſtes haue folowed haſt ben true margaryte peerle one ſhewed ſhe alway ayenwarde hath made daungerous cheare come propre perſon put errours make glad wayes reaſon ſo ſorowe ne dyſeaſe ſhall nomore hereafter amayſtrye wherethrough hope thou ſhalte lyghtlye come grace thou longe haſt deſyred thilke iewel haſt thou herde many enſamples howe haue comforted releued ſcholers lore hathe worthyed kynges felde hath honoured ladyes boure perpetual myrroure theyr trouthe ſeruyce hath cauſed worthye folke voyde vyce ſhame hath holde cyties realmes proſperitie yf lyſte cleape ayen thyne olde remēbraunce thou coudeſt euery poynt declare eſpecyall ſaye thy mayſtreſſe haue cauſe cauſyng theſe thynges many mo nowe ywys madame quod al theſe thinges know well ſelfe thyne excellence paſſeth vnderſtandynge v beeſtes nomans wyt erthly may comprehende thy vertues well ꝙ ſhe ſe diſeaſe ſorow wote wel thou art one myne nories maye ſuffre ſo make ſorow thyne owne ſelfe ſhende ſelfe come thy fere thyne heauye charge make ſeme leſſe woo hym alone ſory bē moned ſorowfull wyght greate gladneſſe right ſo ſycke frendes ſycke ſorye el ſorowe make tyll whan haue hem releued ſuche wyſe gladneſſe maner countrepayſyng ſhal reſtore mokel ioy paſſed heuyneſſe beforne dyd tene alſo ꝙ ſhe whan anye ſeruauntes ben alone ſolitary place haue yet euer buſyed hem comfort theyr hertes taught hem make ſonges playnte blyſſe endyten letter rethorycke queynt vnderſtādynges bethynke hem wyſe mygt beſt theyr ladyes good ſeruice pleſe alſo lerne maner countenaunce wordes bearynge ben meke lowlye euery wyght name fame encreaſe yeue great yeftes large renome may ſpryngen therof haue excuſed thy loſſe thy great coſtages wherthrough thou art nedy arne nothynge vnknowen hope god ſomtyme ſhall ben amended thus ſayde nortuoure haue taught al myne curteſie made hem expert ladyes hertes wyn yf wolde endeynous proude enuious wretch acquayntaunce haſteliche haue ſuch voyded ſchole vyces trulye hate vertues worthyneſſe power auaunce ah worthye creature ꝙ iuſte cauſe name goddeſſe dignely ye mowe beare lyth ye grace creature worlde hath goodneſſe truly maner blyſſe precyouſneſſe vertue ſpringen wellen brokes ryuers proceden theyr ſprynges lyke water kynde drawen ſee ſo kyndly thynges threſten full appetyte deſyre draw thy ſteppes thy preſence approche theyr kyndely perfectiō dare beeſtes world ought forfayte ayenſte thy deuyne purueyaunce alſo ladye ye knowen pryuye thoughtes hertes counſayle may ben hydde knowynge wherfore wot well lady ye knowe youre ſelfe conſcyence haue ben wyllyng ſeruyce al coulde neuer ſhulde yet forſothe fayned neuer loue otherwiſe thā myne herte yf coulde haue made cheare one ythought many done daye afore myne eyen trowe wolde haue vayled certes quod ſhe haddeſt thou ſo done wold haue vyſited ye wete wel lady eke quod haue played racket nettyll docke wethercock waued truly ye ſette accorde conſcience wolde flye tyll ye reaſon aperte ſtrength made myne herte tourne good faythe quod ſhe haue knowe euer tho condicions ſythē thou woldeſt moche made pryuy thy counſayle iuge thy conſcience though forſoke tho dayes tyl ſawe better tyme wold neuer god ſhulde fayle euer wyll ready wytneſſynge thy ſoth place euer ſhall ayenſte tho wol contrary ſuſteyne moch nought vnknowen ne hydde thy pryuy hert al haſt thou tho thinges made open full hath cauſed commynge priſon voyde webbes thyne eyen make clerly ſe erroures thou haſt bene bycauſe men bene dyuers condicyons ſome adradde ſaye ſoth ſome ſothe anon readye fyght alſo maye ſelfe bene place withſaye thylke men ſpeaken otherwyſe ſothe woll charge vertue obedyence thou oweſt wryten wordes ſet hem wrytynges mowe wytneſſyng ben noted amonge people bookes wrytten neyther dreden ne ſhame ne ſtryue conne ſhewen entent writer yeue remembraunce hearer yf anye woll thy preſence ſaye anye thynge tho wryters loke boldlye truſte mar anſwer full certes ſhall hym enfourme trouthe thy loue thy conſcience ſo help thou ſhalt varye thy nede trowe ſtrongeſte beſt may founde woll tranſuers thy wordes whereof woldeſt thou drede greatlye tho gladed theſe wordes ſaith wexen ſomdele lyght hert auctoritie wytneſſe alſo ſyckerneſſe helpe forſayd heſt ſayd trulye ladye well gladded cō fort wordes lykynge vnto nobleye ſhewe whiche folke defame ſeruauntes ſyth ſeruyce ought aboue thynges bene commended yet quod ſhe ſe well thy ſoule amaſed cloude better thynge yt myght lyght thyne heuy charge knowynge thyne owne heelpe ſtyrr ſwete wordes ſuche reaſons thoughtfull ſoule namelye ſuche one thou arte woll yet ſuche thynges ſynken come therfore let ſene thyne heuye charge maye lyghtlyer thy comforte purueye certes ladye quod mooſt cō fort myght haue vtterly wete ſure herte margaryte ſerue ſo thynke done wyth myghtes whyle lyfe dureth thā quod ſhe mayeſt thou thereafter ſuche wyſe myſpleaſaunce ne entre good fayth quod ſhall myſpleaſaunce cauſed treſpaſſe ſyde wetē ꝙ ſhe ſet neuer yet perſō ſerue place yf cauſed contrary defaultes treſpaſſes ne ſpedde hys ſeruyce myne owne earthlye ladye quod tho yet remembre worthyneſſe longe ſythen many reuoluynge yeres tyme whan octobre hys leue gynneth take nouembre ſheweth ſight whā berne ben full goodes nut euery halke good lande tyllers gynne ſhape erth great trauayle bryng forth corne mannes ſuſtenaunce ayenſt nexte yeres folowynge ſuch tyme plentie hath home wyſe lyſt wander maruayles ſeche conſtrayned excited oft loth thynge done excitacyon mennes opinion wolden fayne haue myne abydynge take hert luſt trauayle ſe wynding erth tyme wynter woodes large ſtretes werne ſmal pathes ſwyne hogges haden made lane ladle theyr maſte ſeche walked thynkynge aloone wonder greate whyle greate beeſtes wood haunten adorneth maner foreſtes heerdes gone wylde er ware neyghed ſee banke ferde beeſtes ſhypcraft cryed lady trowe ye wete well ſelfe nothynge werſe beeſtes ſhulden bē tame yf catche wyldeneſſe gyn ayen waxe ramage thus forſothe aferde ſhyppe hyed ynowe latch myne handes drawe ſhyppe many knewe well name syght fyrſt luſt another thought thyrde wyll eke mayſter theſe broughten wt boorde ſhyppe trauayle whan ſayle ſprad ſhyppe gan moue wynde water gan ryſe ouerthwartly turne ye welken wawes ſemeden kyſt togyther often vnder colour kyſſyng mokell olde hate priuily cloſed kept ſtorm ſo ſtraungely deuouryng maner gan ſo faſt v aſſayle ſuppoſed date deth ſhulde haue made gynnyng vp downe nowe vnder wawe nowe abouen ſhyppe great whyle ſo mokel dureſſe wether ſtormes greate auowynge pylgremages dryuen yle vtterly wende fyrſte haue reſcowed truly fyrſt gynnynge ſemed ſo peryllous hauen catche thorowe grace hadde bene comforted lyfe full diſpayred truly ladye yf ye remembred aryght maner thynges ſelfe came haſtely ſene v ſee driuen weten fyrſte ye deynous cheare whyche ye goone better alyght euer thought ye lyued greate drede diſeaſe ſemed ſo chere whan certifyed name lenger looked goddly dradde euer myne herte opened ſo lytle tyme ſhyppe mynde ladye ye lad ware beeſtes fyſſhes great nōbre throngynge togyther among muſkell blewe ſhel encloſed margaryte perle mooſt precyous beſt euer toforne came ſyght ye tolden youre ſelfe ylke iewell kynde ſo good ſo vertuous better ſhulde neuer fynde ſought therafter worldes ende wyth helde peace greate whyle euer ſythē haue bethought man ſought precious margarytes whan founden one lykyng ſolde good bye iewell ywys thought yet ſo thynke haue founden iewelle myne hert deſyreth wherto ſhulde ſech ferther truly woll ſtynte margaryte • et euer nowe alſo ſythen wyll well wyl ſhoulde ſuche ſeruyce take ſo deſyre thynge whiche neuer haue blyſſe lyueth none hath diſeaſe myght brought ſuche ſeruyce cauſe ſorowe ioye wondre worde ye ſayne bryngen men ioye parde ye wet well defaulte ne treſpaſſe maye reaſonably bene put mewardes farre conſcience knoweth diſeaſe lyſte nowe whyle ſpeake enforme maner blyſſe ye haue thronge truly wene al gladneſſe ioye myrth beſhet vnder locke keye throwen ſuche place yt may founde brennyng wo hath altred hewe whan ſhoulde ſlepe walowe thynke diſporte thus cōbred ſeme folke maſed alſo ladye myne deſyre hath longe dured ſome ſpekynge haue el ye leeſt haue ben enmoyſed ſyght wanting theſe thinges mouth wolde durſt pleyne right ſore ſythen euyls goodneſſe arne manyfolde yolden wonder lady truly ſaue euermore reuerēce ye mowe ſhame ſuch thinges ſuffre youre ſeruaunte ſo multyplyed wherfore knelyng lowe hert praye rue caytyfe nothynge may ſerue good ladye yf ye lyſt nowe helpe ſhewe priuyeſt ſeruauntes al aſſayes tyme vnder wynges protection helpe mewardes ſhapen ſhal thā ſtraungers wyſe ſuccour loke whan ſo pryuy yet helpe fayle may thus priſon abyde bondes chaynes holden lady ye ſe wel ſelfe renyant foringed hath halfe care thus ſyghyng ſobbynge wayle alone nere cōfort preſence ryght wold ſterne yet alytle gladed yt ſo goodly ſuche grace none happe haue hent gracyouſlye fynde precyous margarete leſte menne ſhulde bye yf ſhulde therfore ſel ſubſtaunce wo ſo manye let game purpoſe brekers bene maked wayters ſuche pryſoners euermore ouerloke hyndre ſuche lettoures harde ſuche iewell wyn lady honour thy deytie thynketh ryght ſuche people ſhoulde haue mayſtry ne ben ouerlokers ouer none thy ſeruauntes truly leful vnto goddes wolde playne ye rule youre deuyne purueyaunce amonges youre ſeruauntes nothyng ye ſhulde alſo lady moeble inſu •• yſaunt countreuayle pryce iewell el make theſchaunge eke wyght worthy ſuche perles weare kynges prince elles theyr peres iewel vertue wolde adorne make fayre al realme • ley vertue ſo moche goodneſſe ouer cōmended yt wold wayle myght ſuche rycheſſe haue wyl vertue therof priſon may delyuer nought el yf throw holpen ſe ſelfe withouten recouery althoughe myght hence voyde yet wolde wold abyde day deſteny hath ordained ſuppoſe without amendement ſo ſore myne herte bounden may thynken none thus ſtrayte lady hath ſyr daunger laced ſtockes leue wyl ſe taken ſo lytle hede thynketh woll maken myght vertue mercy margaret ſtretch ſo ye mow wel caſe lyſt blyſſe myrth felde ſykneſſe ſorowe ben alway redy ye cope oftene wounde bodye ſtondyng beſt vneth may lygge pure myſeaſy ſorowe yet lytel ynough erneſt ſiluer forward bargayne treble folde ſo mockell muſt ſuffre er tyme come myne eaſe worthy welth may wo ſuffre certes heuye thynke theſe thynges ſhall yeue water ynough drynke leſt myne eyen drye rē nynge ſtreames teares ſhall waylē myne owne happy heuyneſſe▪ ſhall counſayle nowe lykyng tene goodly harſe euer brenne couete ſorowe thriſt gladnes ſhal yeue contrarious drink ſtanch thyrſt blyſful bytternes lo thus brenne drenche ſhyuer ſwet reuerſed euyl neuer yet ordeyned ſalue ſoth lyches ben vnconnyng ſaue margaryte aloone anye ſuche remedye purueye wt theſe wordes braſt wepe euery tere myne eyen greatneſſe ſemed boren oute ye ball ſyght water ben run thā thought loue gan lytle heauye miſcomfort chere gan ſobrely eaſye maner ſpeake well aduyſynge ſhe ſayde comenly wyſe ſpeaken eaſelye ſofte manye ſkylles one theyr wordes better beleued alſo eaſye ſpeakyng auyſement men maye catche put forth holden alſo auctoritie eaſye wordes eke yeuen vnderſtandyng intention mater ryght ſo lady eaſely ſofte maner gan ſaye theſe wordes ¶meruayle ꝙ ſhe great maner ſemblaunt farre eſpy thou lyſte haue anye recoure euer thou playneſt ſoroweſt wayes remedye foolyſh wylfulneſſe lyſt ſeche enquyre thy next frēdes thyne wyt haue ben thy mayſtreſſe recoure fyne thy diſeaſe diſeaſe gladneſſe ioye ful veſſel ſo helded quencheth felyng fyrſt tenes thou wonte onely theſe thinges remembre thyne herte alſo fooles thereof enfourmen adnullynge theyr errours diſtroying theyr darke opinion comforte theyr ſeare thoughtes nowe canſt thou bene comforte thyne owne ſoul thynkyng theſe thinges haſt thou ben ſo longe commenſal haſt ſo mykell eeten pottage foryetfulneſſe dronken ſo ignoraunce olde ſoukyng thou hadeſt arne mayſtred lorne fro maner knowynge worthy parſon helpe counſayle hym ſelfe theſe wordes pure ſtronge ſhame woxe reed ſhe ſeing ſo aſtonyed dyuers ſtoundes ſodaynly thyng kynd hateth gan delyciouſlye comforte wyth ſugred wordes puttyng ful hope ſhulde margarete getten yf folowed heeſtes gan fayre cloth wypen teares hyngen chekes ſayde wyſe nowe well wyſdome welth withouten may nothyng lerned thou beareſt keyes pryuye thynges vayne trauayle men catche ſtedſhyp yf ye lady fyrſt locke vnſhet ye lady learne v wayes pathes heauen ye lady maken al heuenly bodyes goodly benigly courſe gouernen v beeſtes erth ye armen youre ſeruauntes ayenſt debate impercyable harneys ye ſetten hertes inſuperable bloud hardyneſſe ye leden hem parfyte good yet thynge deſyreth ye werne man helpe wele done lore graunt lytle grace al ſorowes ceaſe myne owne ſeruaunte ꝙ ſhe truly thou ſytteſt nye myne herte thy bad chere gan ſoryly greue amonge thy playnyng wordes thought thou allegeſt thynges lettyng thyne helpyng thy grace hyndre wherthorowe thynketh wanhoope crope thyne herte god forbyd nyſe vnthryfty thought ſhulde come thy mynd thy wyttes trouble ſythen euery thing cōmyng contingente wherefore make nomore thy propoſition impoſſyble nowe praye reherſe ayen tho thynges thy miſtruſt cauſen thilke thinges thynke reaſon deſtroyen put full hope thyne hert vnderſtandeſt thou ther ꝙ ſhe thou ſaydeſt many lette game thyne ouerlokers alſo thy moeble inſuffyſaunte thou therof meaneſt truly quod fyrſte ſaye iangelers euermore arne ſpeakynge rather euyll good euerye age man rather enclyneth wyckedneſſe anye goodneſſe auaunce alſo falſe wordes ſpryngen ſo wyde ſteryng falſe lyinge tonges fame al ſwyftly flyeth eares ſayeth many wycked tale ſoone ſhall falſeneſſe ben leued truthe great ſothneſſe nowe ye quod thynketh thylke iewel ſo precious ſuche wretch wold vertue thereof extende alſo feble worldly ioyes ſuche iewell coū treuayle ſuche people worldlye ioyes han wyl ben ſet hygheſt degree mooſt reuerence bene accepted falſe wenynge maketh felicitie therein ſuppoſed ſuche caytyues euermore ben hyndred certes quod ſhe take good hede ſhall reaſon ſhewen theſe thynges mowe let thy purpoſe leeſte poynte anye wyght coude prycke remembreſt quod ſhe enſample one ſtrōgeſt maner preue man purpoſe enſample enduce propoſitiō proued ſtrength yes ſoth ꝙ wel quod ſhe raddeſt thou neuer parys troy heleyne loued togyther yet entrecomuned ſpeche alſo acriſyus ſhette dane hys doughter tour ſurete wight ſhulde haue maſtry ſeruyce yet iupiter ſygnes withoute anye ſpech purpoſe ayenſt father wyll many ſuche mo haue ben knytte trouth yet ſpake neuer togyder thynge encloſed vnder ſecretneſſe priuitie twe perſonnes entremellen hertes ſyght power knowynge ſuche thynges ſo preuen ſhall vtterlye yeuen beeſtes manye thynges ſuche precyous mater ben reſerued iudgement deuine purueyaunce amonge lyuynge people man conſyderation moune determyned wherefore ſaye enuye ianglynge welny people vpon ſeruauntes maken efte rather cauſe eſployte hyndrynge ꝙ ſuffre ye ſuche wronge moune whan ye lyſt lyghtlye ſuche euyls abate ſemyth greate vnworſhyp ꝙ ſhe holde nowe thy peace haue founden manye han bene vnkynde truly wol ſuffre euery wyght wiſe haue diſeaſe contynueth ende well truly hem woll helpen one myne blyſſe wende marcial grece ycrowned god ſtrongeſt ratheſt come longeſt abode contynued iourneye ſpared trauayle longe play leſt thylke perſon profred hym ſeruyce therin whyle anon voydeth redy ſo one thynketh water entreth anon reſpyreth ſuch one liſt parfyte blyſſe ſeruyce brynge tree ofte ſet dyuers place woll kynde endure brynge forth frutes loke praye howe myne olde ſeruauntes tyme paſſed continued ſeruyce folowe thou theyr ſteppes myght thou fayle caſe thou worch wiſe certes quod nothing lich worlde tyme paſſed eke countre hath one maner coūtrie hath another ſo may mā alway put eye ſalue healed hele ſoth betwex two thynges lyche oft dyuerſitie requyred ꝙ ſhe ſoth diuerſitie nacion diuerſitie law maked manye reaſons diuerſitie cōmeth contrarious malyce wicked people yt han enuyous hertes ayenſt trulye lawe ſeruauntes euer hath ben generall whyche maye fayle ryght man lawes yt ordeyned many determinacions may know good bad tyl aſſay people han proued end draweth ſheweth neceſſitie therof el impoſſibilitie ryght ſo ye lawe ſeruauntes ſo wel hath ben proued generall hytherto hath fayled wyſte thou well lawe kynde lawe god ordeyned ſtablyſſhed dure kynde reaſoun wherfore lawe man wyt purueyed ought vnderput lawe kynde whiche yet hath cōmune euery kyndly creature yt ſtatutes lawes ben kyndly generall people olde doinges many turnynges yeres vſed people maner proued mowen ſo lyghtly ben defaſed newe doinges contrariaunces ſuch olde often cauſen diſeaſes breaken many purpoſes yet ſaye therefore ayen newe myſchefe menne ſhulde ordaynen newe remedy alway loke contrary olde ferther malyce ſtretcheth foloweth olde doinges loue han bene vniuerſall mooſt exployte forth vſed wherfore woll yet lawes nothynge adnulled purpoſe ſuche iangelers lokers wayters game yf thynke ought mowe dere yet loue well alwaye ſet hem nought let thy porte ben lowe euery wyghtes preſence redy thyne herte mayntayne thou haſt begonne lytle fayne mekeneſſe wordes thus wyth ſleyght ſhalt thou ſurmoūt dequace euyll theyr hertes wyſdome yet ſeme flye otherwhyle man wol fight thus ſuche thynges tonges euyll ſhall ben ſtylled el fully graunt thy full meanynge ſothe euer euer ſhall myne enemyes ben aferde truſt anye fyghtynge therfore haue thou cowardes herte ſeruyce nomore ſomtyme thou haddeſt contrary yf thou drede ſuche ianglers thy viage make vnderſtād wel yt yt dredeth rayn ſow cornes ſhal haue thā thynne berne alſo yt aferde clothes let hym daūce naked nothing vndertaketh namely ſeruyce nothyng acheueth great ſtormes wether often mery ſmoth much clatering mokyll rownynge thus ianglynge wordes cometh huyſhte peace ſtyl good lady quod ſe ſeuen yere paſſed haue graffed groubed vyne wayes coude ſoughte fed grape fruite haue none founde alſo haue thys ſeuen yere ſerued laban wedded rachell doughter blereryed lya brought bedde whiche alway engendreth tene ful child tribulacion care although clepinges kyſſynges rachell ſhulde ſeme ſwete yet ſhe ſo barayn gladneſſe ne ioye way wol ſprynge ſo maye wepe rachel may ben counſayled wyth ſolace ſythen iſſue myne hertely deſyre fayled nowe praye ſone fredome grace eyght yere eyghteth mowe kinreſt maſſeday ſeuen werkedayes trauayle folowe chriſten lawe euer ye el thylke margaryte holden ſo lady priuye chābre ſhe thys caſe none perſon committed loke quod ſhe thou perſeuer ſeruice haue groūded thylke ſkorne thyne enemyes mowe thy perſon ſothed lo man beganne edefye hys foundemente badde ende maye bringe mekeneſſe coūtenaunce wyth manly hert dedes longe countynaunce conyſaunce lyuerye al retynue deliuered wenyſt thou lyſte auaunce ſuche perſonnes louen fyrſte ſyttynges feeſtes hygheſt ſtoles church hal loutinges people markettes fayres vnſtedfaſte byde one place anye whyle togyther wenynge hys owne wytte excellent ſcornynge maner deuyſe hys owne naye naye god wotte theſe ſhul nothyng pertteyne blyſſe truly maner toforne hathe ben wyrſhyppe wyth blyſſe lyon felde lambes chambre egles aſſaute maydens halle fox counſayle ſtyl theyr dedes theyr protection graūted redy ben brydge theyr baner arered like wolues felde thus theſe wayes ſhull men ben auaunced enſample dauid kepynge ſhepe drawen vp order kyngly gouernaunce iupiter frō bole bene europe fere iulius ceſar loweſt degre rome mayſter erthly prince eneas hel kinge countre rome nowe ſtondynge ſo ſaye thy grace bearynge therafter maye ſette ſuche plyghte ianglynge maye greue leſt tucke thy hēmes theyr ianghes noughte counte creſſe thy diſauauntage ever quod ſhe hath people thys worlde deſyred haue great name worthyneſſe hated foule bere anye fame one ye obiections thou alegeſt ayen thyn hertely deſyre ye forſothe quod ſo comenly people wol lye brynge ſuch enfame ꝙ ſhe yf men wyth leaſynges put enfame weneſt thy ſelfe therby ben enpeyred▪ wenyng wronge ſe aſmuch lyen thy merite encreaſeth make bene worthy hem knowen ſoth thing thou art apeyred ſo mokyl thou arte encreaſed thy beloued frendes ſothly wounde thy frend laſſe harme ye ſyr better falſe kyſſyng diſceyuable gloſynge af thyne enemye aboue wel thy frende maketh ſuch enfame ergo thou art encreaſed apeyred lady quod ſomtyme yet yf mā diſeaſe theſtymacyon enuyouſe people ne loketh nothyng deſertes men ne merites theyr doynges auēture fortune therafter yeuen theyr ſentence ſome loken voluntarye wyll herte therafter telleth hys iugement takynge hede reaſon ne qualyte doynge thus mā riche fulfylled worldly welefulneſſe ſome commenden ſaine ſo lente iuſte cauſe hath aduerſyte ſayne weaked hathe deſerued thylke anoye cōtrary
