knowen many countrees lytel london knowyng ſpeche yet among one maner people may ſuche fame goodneſſe come many prayſen comenly many lacken fye ſuche maner fame ſlepe ſuffre hym knoweth preuyte hertes dele ſuche fame thylke place nothynge ayenſt ſothe ſhal neyther ſpeake ne dare appere atturney ne maner howe many great named many greate worthyneſſe loſed han tofore thys tyme memorie ſlydden clenely forgetten defaute wrytynges yet ſcriptures great elde ſo ben defaſed yt perpetualte maye hem ben iuged yf thou wolte make compariſon euer ioy mayſt thou haue erthlye name fayre lykeneſſe pee one grayne wheate thouſand ſhyppes ful corne charged nombre betwene one thother yet mowe nombred ende rekenyng haue trewly maye nombred nothyng recken thylke maye nombred ofte thynges ended made comparyſon one lytel another great thinges haue ende another ende ſuche comparyſon maye founden wherfore heauen ben loſed wyth god hath none ende endleſſe endureth thou canſte nothynge done aryght thou deſyre rumoure therof healed euerye wyghtes eare dureth prycke reſpect ſo thou ſekeſt rewarde folkes ſmale wordes vayne prayſynges trewly therin thou leſeſt guerdon vertue leſeſt greateſt valoure conſcience vphap renome euerlaſtyng therfore boldely renome fame erthe ſhuld hated fame deth ſhulde deſyred werkes vertue aſketh guerdoning ſoule cauſeth al vertue thē ſoule delyuered priſone erthe moſt worthy ſuche guerdone amonge haue euerlaſtynge fame body cauſeth mannes yuels tweye thynges arte thou anſwered thynketh quod loue yf thynge doute thy ſoule ſhewe forth thyne ignoraūce clere leaue ſhame certes quod ne bodye thys worlde ought coude ſaye reaſon ayenſt ſkylles leue wytte nowe fele wel euell ſpekers bearer enfame may lytel greue lette purpoſe rather ſuche thynge quarell forthered yea ꝙ ſhe proued alſo ylke iewell kepynge ſhal thorowe ſteered ye leſt moment yt myght ymagined ſoth ꝙ well ꝙ ſhe leueth declare yt thy inſuffiſaūce maner letting thus ſhe ſo worthye thou ſhuldeſt clymbe ſo hygh thy moebles thyne eſtate arne voyded thou thynkeſt fallē ſuche myſerye gladneſſe thy purſute woll thy dyſcende certes quod ſothe ryghte ſuche thought myne herte cōmenly ſpoken olde prouerbe leged heweth hye wyth chyppes maye leſe ſyght wherfore haue ben al euer myghte ſtudye wayes remedye one ſyde another nowe quod ſhe god forbede ere thou ſeke doynges ſuch haue lerned yt reſtinge whyles ſuche herbes ben planted oure gardyns thou ſhalt well vnderſtande aboue man one god alone quod hau mē forne thys tyme truſted writtes chauntementes helpes ſpirites dwellē ayre therby han gettē theyr deſyres fyrſt hys manly power daunced behynde quod ſhe fye ſuch mater trewly ſacrilege ſhal haue ſort ſeruaūtes myne eyen ſhall ſuche thynge loked howe often cōmaunded theſe paſſed wyſe one god ſhal men ſerue goddes lyſt haue myne helpes ſhal aſke none helpe foule ſpirites ala man maked ſemblable god woſt thou wel al vertue lyuelych werkynge goddes purueyaunce vnderputte reſonable creature erth euery thynge thiſhalfe god made buxome mannes cō templacyon vnderſtandynge heuen erthe helle hath manne beynge ſtones ſoule wexyng tree herbes hathe ſoule felynge wyth beeſtes fyſhes foules hath ſoule reaſon vnderſtandyng aungels ſo hym knyt maner lyuynges reaſonable proporcion alſo mā made foure elementes vniuerſytee rekened alone hath vnder god princypalite aboue al thynges ſoule thouſand myle hence ferre nowe nygh nowe hye lowe ferre momente mountenaunce often wynter al thys mannes gouernaunce dyſpoſition ſheweth yt men ben lych vnto goddes chyldren moſte heyghte ſythen al thynges vnderputte ye wyll reaſonable creature god forbede man wynne lordſhyp aſke helpe thynge lower hym ſelfe thē namely foule thynges innominable nowe thē ſhuldeſt thou wene loue high ſythen nothynge aboue god alone trewly wote well yt thylke iewell maner euē lyne degre thou art thy ſelfe nought aboue ſaue thus angel vpon angell man vpon man deuell vpon deuell han maner ſoueraygnitie ſhall ceaſe daye dome ſo ſaye thoughe thou putte ſerue ylke iewel durynge thy lyfe yet ſeruage vnderputtynge maner trauaylynge pleaſaunce conquere gette thou haſte ſette nowe hardeſt ſeruyce nowe thou deideſt ſorowe wā tynge thy deſyres trewlye heauenlye bodyes wyth one voyce ſhul come make lody thy comynge ſaye welcome oure fere worthy entre iupyters ioye thou wyth myght haſte ouercome dethe thou woldeſt neuer flytte thy ſeruyce ſhul pray goddes row rowe make thilk margarite yt routh perſone vnkyndely wythout comforte let deye ſhall beſette ſelfe ſuche wyſe erthe parte vengeaunce ſhal ſhe ioye haue loues ſeruyce ſhe deed ſhal ſoule ben brought vp thy preſence whyther thou wylte cheſe thylke ſoule ſhall ben commytted el thy dethe anone foreſayd heuenly bodyes one accorde ſhall benōmen thylke perle vertues fyrſte taken ſhe hathe hem forfeyted ſeruaunte thy lyue ſhe wolde ſuffre worche vertues withdrawen myght hygh bodyes ſhuldeſt thou wene ſo yf thy lyſte loke vpon lawe kynde wyth order whyche ordayned ſothely none age none ouertournynge tyme hytherto tyme ne power chaunge weddinge ne ye knotte vnbynde two hertes thorow one aſſent preſence together accorden enduren tyll dethe hem departe troweſt thou euery ydeot w • tte menyng priuy entente theſe thynges wene forſothe ſuche accorde may roſe maydenhede plucked waye waye knowe nothyng thys conſente two hertes alone maketh faſtenynge knotte neyther law kynde ne mannes lawe determyneth neyther age ne ye qualyte perſones onely accorde betwene thylke twaye trewlye tyme ſuche accorde theyr conſent hert enſealed put treaſory amonges priuy thynges gynneth name ſponſayle althoughe breaken forwarde yet ſuche mater enſealed kept remē braunce euer ſe nowe ſpouſes haue name anone accorde thoughe roſe take aungell badde ioſeph take marye hys ſpouſe egypte wende lo ſhe cleped ſpouſe yet forne ne neyther hem bothe mente fleſhly luſte knowe wherfore wordes trouthe accorden ſeruaūtes ſhulden forſake father mother adherande hys ſpouſe two vnite one fleſhe ſhulden accorde thys wyſe two werne fyrſte lytell maner dyſacordaunt hygher one lower bene made euenlyche gree ſtonde nowe enfourme ye ben lyche goddes theſe clerkes ſayne determynacion ſhewen thre thinges hauen ye name goddes ben cleped ſaine man dyuell ymages yet one god al goodneſſe grace al vertue cometh louyng trewe euerlaſtynge pryme cauſe al beynge thynges men bene goddes louynge trewe euerlaſtyng adopcion euerlaſtynge god dyuels ben goddes ſtyrrynge maner lyuynge neyther bene trewe ne euerlaſtyng theyr name godlyheed han vſurpacion prophete ſayeth al goddes gentyles ſaye paynim dyuels ymages bene goddes nuncupacion ben neyther lyuynge ne trewe ne euerlaſtynge theſe wordes celapē goddes ymages wrought mennes handes nowe reaſonable creature adopcion alone arte greate god euerlaſtynge therby thou arte god cleaped let thy father maners ſo entre thy wyttes thou myght folowe moche longeth thy father worſhyppe ſo nothynge thy kynde hys wyll declyne ne hys nobley peruerte thys wyſe yf thou werche thou arte aboue thynges ſaue god alone ſo ſay thyne herte ſerue hye place fully haue nowe declared thyne eſtate good ſo thou folowe therafter abiection fyrſte aleged worthines thy margarite ſhal lette ſhal forther ye encreaſe nowe declare ye laſt abiection nothyng may greue yes certes ꝙ greue let muſte nedes contrary maye ben proued ſe whyle glorious worldly welfuneſſe ſuch goodes welth maken men ryche tho dra • companyes loo pryſe name yeuen tho loutēden blaſours tho curreyden gloſours tho welcomedē flatterer tho worſhypped thilke nowe deynen loke euery wight ſuch erthly wele habaūdant hold noble precious benigne wyſe ſhall degre men hym ſet al ſothe contrary tho thynges ne neuer ſo well hym behaue hath vertue haboūdaunt manyfolde maners welthed ſuche erthly goodes holde foole ſayd hys wyt ſotted lo howe falſe auer holde trewe lo howe trewe cleaped falſe wantynge goodes alſo lady dygnities offyce maken men mykel comended thus ſo good oute hys pere ſhuld men fynde truely trowe ſome ſuche ſo prayſed one another ſhulde make hym ſo knowe ſhulde wyſe ben loked onely fooles well wotte deſyren ſuche new thinges wherfore wōder thilke gouernoure whome alone cauſes proceden gouerne thynges whych hath ordeyned thys world werkes kyndely bodyes ſo gouerned vnſtedfaſt happyous thynge rule reaſon whych ſhewen courſe certayne thynges ſuffreth ſuch ſlydyng chaunges myſturnen ſuche noble thynges ben men arne fayre parſell erthe holdē vppereſt degre vnder god benigne thinges ye ſaide right nowe ſelfe ſhulde neuer man haue bene ſet ſo worthy place degre ordeyned noble ala thou knytteſt purueyaunce al thynges lokeſt thou amenden theſe defautes ſe ſhrewes han wicked maners ſytten chayres ne lambes punyſhen wolues ſhulden punyſhed lo vertue ſhynende naturallly pouertie lurketh hydde vnder cloude▪ moone falſe forſworne knowe ſelfe aue • yeftes hath vſurped ſhyne daye lyght wt peynture men prayſynges truely thylke forged lyȝt fouly ſhuld fade trouth away colour fayned thus night turned daye daye nyght wynter ſommer ſommer wynter dede myſclepyng folyſhe people quod ſhe weneſt thou theſe thynges howe feleſt thou thyne herte gouernaunce yt thys cometh aboute certes ꝙ wotte neuer yf fortune hath graunt aboue lede ende men lyketh ah nowe ſe quod ſhe thentent thy meanyng lo bycauſe thy worldly goodes ben fullych dyſpente thou berafte dygnite offyce whych thou madeſt gatheryng thylke goodes yet dyddeſt office coū ſayle wyſe thynge ended true vnto hem whoſe profyte thou ſhuldeſt loke ſeeſt nowe many thylke herueſt made mokel gloſing deineth nought forther enhaunſen falſe ſhrewes wytneſſynge trouthe theſe thynges greueth thyne herte ſene thy ſelfe thus abated fraylte mankynde ne ſetteth lytel leſers ſuche rycheſſe haue neuer ſo moche vertue ſo thou weneſt thy iewell renne dyſpyte ben accepted grace thys ſhal nothyng hynder nowe ꝙ ſhe fyrſt thou woſt wel thou loſteſt nothing euer thou myghteſt chalēge thyne owne nature brought forthe come thou naked thy mother wombe thou haddeſt rycheſſe thou ſhalt entre ende euery fleſhly body ſhalt thou haue wyth euery rycheſſe thou haſte tyme thy lyuynge ny lente thou myght therin chalenge propertie ſe euery thyng mā ne owne may therwyth hym lyketh yeue kepe ryches thou playneſt loſt yf thy myght ſtretched ſo ferforth fayne thou woldſt haue hem kept multiplied mo ſo ayenſt thy wyl ben departed frō wherfore neuer thyn thou laudeſt ioyeſt wyght ſtuffed ſuch maner rycheſſe yu arte yt beleue begyled thou weneſt thylke ioy ſelyneſſe el eaſe hath loſte ſuche happes ben vnſely yea forſoth ꝙ wel ꝙ ſhe woll proue vnſely wyſe prayſe ſo ye tother ye cōtrary lacked howe ſo ꝙ vnſely ꝙ ſhe begyleth ſheweth thentent workyng et ecōtra selyneſſe begyleth proſperite ſhe maketh iape blyndneſſe ſhe wyndeth hym make ſorowe ſhe withdraweth wolt thou ꝙ ſhe prayſe hym better ſheweth yu hys herte tho bytāde wordes diſpytous thē ye gloſeth thinketh theyr abſence many harmes certes ꝙ one cōmende lacke dyſpyce ha ꝙ ſhe ryght ſo eaſe whyle laſteth gloſeth flatereth lyghtly voydeth whē ſhe moſte pleſaūtly ſheweth euer abſence ſhe tene ſorowe herte vnſely wyth bytande chere ſheweth ſhe ſo doth wherfore vnſely dothe begyle selyneſſe dyſceyueth vnſely put awaye doute one maketh men blynde openeth theyr eyen ſhewyng wretchedneſſe one ful drede leſe owne ſobre maketh men dyſcharged mokell heuyneſſe burthen one draweth man good ye haleth hym vertue hooke thoughtes wenyſt thou thy dyſeaſe hath done mokel wynne euer yet thou loſteſt euer contrary made wynne greate good thy thynkynge knowe hertes thy ſothfaſt frēdes▪ pardy ben proued ye ful trewe haue dyſceuered falſe trewly goynge ylke brotel ioy ther yede awaye ylke thyne proper neuer lyghtly departed thyne owne good therfore leaueth ſtyl wyth nowe good quod ſhe howe moche woldeſt thou ſomtyme haue boughte thys knowyng thy frendes flatterynge flyes gloſed thou thought thy ſelf ſely thou playneſt loſſe rycheſſe haſt founden moſt dere worthy thynge thou clepeſt vnſely hath made moche thynge wynnen alſo concluſion frende nowe leaueth hys herte frō thyne helpes yf margarite denyeth nowe ſuffre vertues ſhyne wardes wyth ſpreadynge beames farre farther yf thou ſely worldly ioye trewely ſaye el ſhe ſomdele blame ah peace quod ſpeake nomore thys myne hert breaketh thou toucheſt ſuche wordes well quod ſhe let v ſyngen thou heareſt theſe thynges thys tyme ¶thus endeth fyrſte boke teſtament loue foloweth ſeconde welthe maye founden al thys world well ſene lo howe mooſt comforte wende moſte ſuppoſed haue hadde ful anſwere contrary thoughtes ſodaynly vanyſſhed workes man faren ſame wyſe folke wenen beſte entente haue wylles perfourme anone chaungynge lyft ſyde ye ryght halue tourneth ſo clene another kynde neuer ſhall come fyrſte plyte doynge thys wrongful ſterynge ſo ſoone wyſed knowynge purpoſe begynnynge ſo dureth yet yf god hys grace tyme woll graunt thynke perfourme thys worke haue begonne loue thynne wytte inſpiracion hildeth al grace woll ſuffre greuouſly god wotte haue ſuffred great throwe romayne emperour whyche vnite loue ſhulde accorde euery wyth cauſe auaunce namely ſythe thys empyre corrected ſo many ſectes hereſie faith ſeruyce rule loues religion trewlye al ſhende errontous opinion maye ſelfe occian cloſed yet ſayn many haue harberowed god wote faylen theſe thynges greuen thynke namely paſſed gladneſſe thys worlde wonte dyſporte hygh lowe nowe fayled woldē mayſtries haue thylke ſtoundes heuen hyghe aboue saturnes ſphere ſeaſonable tyme lodged nowe come queynte conſaylours houſe woll ſuffre ſoiourne wherof pyte yet ſayne ſome haue celler wyth wyne ſhede gernere corne layde couered wyth whete ſacke ſowed wolle purſe money faſt knytte amonge pannes mouled wyche preſſe amonge clothes layde wyth ryche pelure arayed ſtable among horſe beeſtes hogges ſhepe nete manye wyſe thou maker lyght wynkynge thyne eye ſonne queynt woſt ryght well trewe name neuer thus herberowed somtyme forne ſonne ſeuenth partye ſmyten bare bothe croſſe mytre yeue wolde pope went fote tho worſhypped holye churche kynges baden crownes holdē lawe ſet ſhulde tofore iuge well poore durſte ſhewe hys grefe ryche hys money defended tho taylages redy poore pay made gret feeſtes tyme noble ſōges maryed damoſelles gētyl feture withouten golde rycheſſe poore clerkes wytte ſchole ſette church made ſuch perſones preache tho ſeruyce holy churche honeſt deuoute pleaſaunce bothe god people nowe leude ſymonye auaunced ſhendeth holy churche nowe ſtewarde achates nowe courtyour hys debate nowe eſchetoure hys wronges nowe loſell hys ſonges perſoner prouendre alone wyth whych manye thriftye ſhulde encreaſe yet thys ſhrewe behynde free herte forſake loſengeour take lo accordeth ſuche ben voluntarye luſtes haunten courte rybaudye tyl midnight woll playe wake churche matyns behynde yuell diſpoſycion hys ſtomake therfore ſhulde eate beane breed ſo dyd hys ſyre eſtate therwith ſtrenghthen hys auter broke lowe lythe poynte gone erth hys horſe muſte ben eaſy hye beare hym ouer great water hys chalyce poore hath ryche cuppes towayle ſhete god ſhal ben handled meate borde ſhal ben borde clothes towelles many payre maſſe ſerued clergyon fyue ſquiers hall poore chaunſell open hole euery ſyde beddes ſylke wyth tapytes goyng aboute chambre poore maſſe boke leude chapelayne broken ſurplyce wyth manye hole good houndes many hounte harte hare fede theyr feeſtes poore men haue great care euer craue nothynge offren wolden haue hem doluen amonge legyſtres dare come doynge ſayne maken hem nedy ne wolde nothynge haue towne tort forthe nought worthe hawe aboute pleaſen men thylke greuous torcious ben myght doynge theſe thynges forne ſayde mowe well yf men lyſte ryme trewly acorde nothynge moche al thynges ſhulden ryght ben gouerned ſorye ſe gouernaunce fayleth thus ſene ſmale lowe gouerne hye bodyes aboue certes poleſye naught forbode gouernaunce treaten enformen right beeſtly wytte ſhulde ben ſubiect reaſon ſo erthly power ſelfe lower ſhulde ben ſubiect hygher worth thy bodye gouerned wyth thy ſoule ryght ſo lytell naught worthe erthely power reignatyfe prudence heedes gouerne ſmale whyche heedes ſmale owen obey ſuffre gouernaunce ſoueraynneſſe ayenwarde ſhulde thynke thys wyſe ſeruaunt theſe creature delyuered lorde defendour mayſter enfourmer poſſeſſoure poſſeſſyon hem lyche tree whiche ſparowes ſhullen ſtelen byrdes noryſhe forthe brynge vnder ſuretye ayenſt raueynous foules beeſtes tyraunt ſelfe ſmale reſte quyete heedes well diſpoſed owen ſoueraynes helth proſperyte pray doynges mayntenaunce therof performe wythouten admyniſtracion rule maner gouernaūce wyt haue hem grace come ſuch thinges yet ſhulde ceaſe tyll theyr heedes cleped although profyte pleaſaunce ſhulde folowe trewlye gouernaunce ne medlynge ought clayme ne heedes hem put trewly amonges coſynage dare come yf rycheſſe meane ſothly ſhe bodily goodes maketh nygh coſynage ther neuer propynquite ne alyaūce lyue ne ſhulde haue nere medling maners wherfore kyndly ther leged pouert kynred behynde rycheſſe ſuffreth hym paſſe truly ſaith come neuer iaphetes chyldre wherof ſory iaphetes chyldren pouert linage ben rekened caynes chyldren ryches maked iaphetes heires ala thys wonder chaunge bytwene tho two no chyldren ſythen iaphetes ofſpryng comeden knightes cayn diſcended ye lyne ſeruage brother chyldre lo howe gentylleſſe ſeruage coſyns bothe diſcended two bretherne one body wherfore ſaye ſothneſſe gentyleſſe kynrede maken gentyll lynage ſucceſſion without deſerte man ſelfe nowe lyne alyſanndre noble el hector troye diſcended ryght bloode lyne fro king artour parde ſyr perdicas kyng aliſandre made bē heire grece kynges bloode hys dame tombyſtere kynred ben gētyles dayes trow therfore good gentyleſſe ſemeth maner neceſſyte input gentylmen ſhulden varyen fro vertues aunceſtres certes al maner lynage men ben euen liche byrth one father maker al goodnes enformed hem al mortal folke one ſede arne greyned wherto auaūt men lynage coſynage elde father loke nowe gynnyng god maker man perſon clerke ne worthy gentyleſſe noryſheth hys corare wyth vyces vnreſonable luſtes leaueth kynde courſe whych ende hym brought forthe hys byrthe trewly vngentyll amonge clerkes may ben nēpned therfore woll ben gentyl mote daūten hys fleſhe fro vyces cauſen vngentylneſſe leaue alſo reignes wicked luſtes drawe hym vertue place gentylneſſe gentylmen maketh ſo ſpeke feminyne gendre generall tho perſones reuerence one euery wyght honoureth boū tie nobleſſe ymade god ſo dere hys moder ſhe became ſhe hath ſo great worſhyp nyll nothynge open declare thynge ayenſt ſecte maye ſo wene vertue al worthyneſſe pleaſaunce hem haboundeth although wold thyng ſpeke trewly may fynde yuel hem maner mater right wyth theſe wordes ſhe ſtynte lamentable melodye ganne wyth lyuely herte praye yf lykynge vnto noble grace ſhe wold deyne declare mater fyrſte begonne whiche ſhe lefte ſtynte ſpeke beforne ſhe gan ſynge ꝙ ſhe thys newe thyng ſene menne deſyren mater whyche ſelfe cauſed voyde ah good lady ꝙ victorie ſtrength proued aboue al thynge iugement eſoram whoſe lordſhyp ligne right emperour hē cōmaundeth whether thilke ben womē whoſe lykeneſſe ye aperen right man halte principalte thyng vnder beynge maſculyne gender mo gender ben maſculyne femenyne remenaunt ben gendres grace facultie grammer ryght ſo femenyne woman holden vppereſt degree thynges vnder thilke gendre conteyned bryngeth forth kynges whyche ben lordes ſee earthe al people womē ben borne noryſſhe hem graffen vynes maken men comforte gladde cheres ſorowe dethe mannes herte without woman beyng mē impoſſible conne ſwetneſſe crewel herte rauyſhe make meke buxome benigne wythout violence meuynge beautie theyr eyen el maner fetures mēs deſyres yea thā golde precious ſtones eyther rycheſſe thys degree lady ſelfe manye hertes men haue ſo bounden parfyte blyſſe womankynde ben men wenen nothynge el alſo lady goodneſſe vertue woman properte diſcrecyon ſo well knowen lytelneſſe malyce deſyre good aſker waye conne warne ye thanne woll paſſe kynde werchynge ſectes generall diſcrecyon wotte wel ye wol ſo enclyne prayere grace requeſte ſhall fully ben graunted certes ꝙ ſhe thus parte fareth al mankynde praye crye woman grace fayne manye fantaſyes make hertes enclyne deſyres whan theſe ſely womē freelte theyr kynde beleuen wordes wenen al goſpell promyſe beheſtes graunt hertes fulfyllen luſtes wherthrough theyr lyberte mayſtreſhip toforn thralled ſo maked ſouerayn prayed fyrſte ſeruaunte voyce prayer vſed anone fylled luſte manye ſo trewe lytell hede take ye ſuche kyndeneſſe wyth trayſoun anon ye thynke hem begyle let lyght thynge whyche fyrſte ye maked wonder dere ſo thyng woman loue wight er ſhe hym well knowe haue proued many halfe euery glyttryng thynge nat golde vnder colour fayre ſpeche many vice may hid conſeled therfore rede wyght truſt rath men chere ſpeche right gylefull full ofte wherfore without good aſſay nat worthe many truſte trewly right kyndely euery man thynketh woman betraye ſhewē outward al goodneſſe til haue wil performed lo byrde begyled mery voice foulers whiſtel whan woman cloſed nette wol ye cauſes fynden beare vnkyndeneſſe vnhande falſete vpon putte youre owne malycious trayſon wyth ſuche thynge excuſe lo han woman none wrech vengeaunce bloder wepe tyl hem lyſt ſtynte ſorily miſhap complayne put wenynge men ben ſo vntrewe howe often haue men chaunged loues lytell whyle el faylyng theyr wyll theyr place hem ſette frenſhyp ſhal one fame another lyſte haue thirde delyte el loſte bothe packe clothes fayre nay god wot maye nat tell thouſande partes wronges trechery ſuche falſe people make neuer ſo good bonde ſette ye myte whan hert tourneth wenen ſorow dey pyte falſe herte ſlowe towne ala therfore yt euer anye woman wolde take anye wyght grace tyll ſhe knowe full whome ſhe myght aſſayes truſt woman cone crafte queynte knowynge vnderſtande falſe diſceyuable coniectementes mannes begilynges lo howe fareth though ye men gronen cryen certes diſceyt preueth well thendes werkynge howe many woman haue ben lorne wyth ſhame foule ſhent long laſtyng tyme thorowe mēnes gyle haue ben diſceyued euer fame ſhal dure theyr dedes radde ſonge many londes han done recoueren ſhal neuer alwaye ben demed lightly ſuche plyte ayen ſhulde fall whyche ſlaunders tenes ye falſe men wicked ben verey cauſes ryght ought theſe ſhames theſe reproues holy diſcende thus arne ye nyghe vntrewe youre fayre ſpeche youre herte full fyckell cauſe han ye woman diſpyſe better fruyte ben ne ſwetter ſpyces youre behoue mowe ye fynde farre worldely bodyes ſtretchen loke theyr formynge makynge theyr perſones god ioye paradyce goodneſſe man propre bodye maked ſawes byble reherſynge goddes wordes thys wyſe good mankynde make hym helper lo paradyſe helpe tree graffed whyche lynage man diſcendeth yf man noble frute noble frute ſprongen blyſſe paradyſe mennes ſory hertes yet thys tree abydeth noble helpes ben theſe tree gentyll iewell ben worſhypped euery good creature hem anoyeth dothe hys owne ſhame comfortable perle ayenſt tenes euerye companye myrthed theyr preſent beyng trewely wyſte neuer vertue womā therof rote heauen worſe though ſarazins lyen faythe vntrewe though rennogates maken theron leaſynges fyre dothe anye wyght brenne blame hys owne wytte put ſelfe ſo farre heate fyre gentylleſt moſte element geſſe theſe thynges haue reherſed warne woman al one lyghtly without good aſſaye ye aſſenten mannes ſpeche ſonne day light knowen moone ſhyneth nyght nowe thy ſelf quod ſhe haue ofte ſayd knowe wel thyne herte thou arte none al tofore nempned people knowe wel contynaunce thy ſeruyce neuer ſythen ſet werke myght thy margaryte pleſaunce frendſhyp ne fayrehede none poynte moued frome thyne herte nowe ꝙ ſhe thou ſhalt wene woman condycyons fayre ſpeche ſuche thynge belongeth thou ſhalt ꝙ ſhe vnderſtond fyrſte amonge al thynges cure ſeruyce parfyte blyſſe doynge deſyred euery mannes herte neuer abydeth yet wote loue euery wyght weneth yt thyng coueyted moſte ſhulde come thylke loue parfyte blyſſe ſeruauntes fulle blyſſe may lacke anye thynge blyſſe anye ſyde eke foloweth muſt haue full blyſſe lacke blyſſe loue ſyde therfore ladye ꝙ tho thylke blyſſe haue deſyred ſothe toforne ſelfe wayes rich dignite power renome wenynge tho thrages ben thylke blyſſe ayenſt heere turneth whan ſuppoſed beſte thylke blyſſe haue get come ful purpoſe ſeruyce ſodaynly hyndred throwen ſo fer abacke thynketh impoſſyble come lefte woll well ꝙ ſhe therfore haſt thou fayled thou wenteſt hye way lytel miſgoyng gynnynge cauſeth mykyll erroure ende wherfore thylke blyſſe thou fayledeſt hauynge rycheſſe ne none thynges thou nempnedeſt mowen nat make ſuche parfyte blyſſe loue ſhall ſhew therfore thy ſelfe yet hye waye blyſſe ſhall ſo ſhewe thou ſhalte nat conſaye contrary good lady ꝙ altho ſuppoſe herte yet wolde thyne wordes howe ye meanen mater quod ſhe ſhall wyth good wyl thylke blyſſe firſt rich dignyte renome power ſhull thys worke cleped bodily goodes hē hath ben gret throwe mānes truſt ſelyneſſe loue rich ſuffyſance haue mayntayned begon worldly catel dignite honour reuerēce hem werne vnderput maiſtry therby obey renome glorie people prayſyng luſtes hert hede takyng qualite maner power trouth lordſhyps mayntenaunce thynk procede forth doynge whyche thynges longe tyme man coueytiſe commune hath ben greatly groū ded come blyſſe ſeruyce trewely begyled princypall muſte nedes fayle helpynge mowe nat auaile se holdeſt hym poore nedy yes parde ꝙ hym diſhonored moche folke deyne nat reuerence ſoth ꝙ hym mightes faylen mowe nat helpen certes ꝙ ſemeth al men ſhuld holden wretch weneſt nat ꝙ ſhe lytell renome rather prayſynges mo men thā fewe nat ſhame ſoth ꝙ ſhame villany hym coueyteth renome folke nat praiſe name thā preyſe sothe ꝙ ſhe thou ſayſt ſoth theſe thynges folowed ſuche maner doynge wenden ryches ſuffyſaunce power might dignyte worſhyp renome glorie wherfore diſcēded diſceyuable wening ſeruice diſceyte folowed thus general thou al ſuch ſo worchē faylen blyſſe ye longe han deſyred wherfore truly lyfe reaſon hye way thys blyſſe thynke openly declare herafter neuer later yet lytell comforte thy herte ſhewyng way thou arte entred thy ſelfe thy margaryte maye know ſet hye way wol enforme wiſe thou haſt fayled thy firſt purpoſe bycauſe thou wenteſt wronge lefteſt hye way thy ryght ſyde thus thou lokedeſt worldly lyueng thyng ye begyled lightly therfore lytel aſſay thou ſongedeſt whan turned thy purpoſe ſhewed parte hye waye tho thou abode therin dethe ne ferdneſſe none enemy miȝt ye thilke way reue euer one thyn hert come ylke blyſſe whan thou areſted fyrſt tyme enpriſoned yu loth chaunge thy way thy hert thou wendeſt haue bē thou ſhuldeſt routh ſene miſcaried wyſt wel thyne ableneſſe ſeruyce forther encreaſe come ſelfe wythout mean viſyt thy perſon comforte thy hert perdy cōming thou greatly gladed whiche tyme diſeaſe care tene myght moue thy herte yet gladde greatly enpited howe continually thou haddeſt mynde wyth good auyſement thy conſcience whan thy kyng prince huge wordes gret loked variaunce thy ſpeche euer thou redye ſake pleſaunce margarite peerle many mo thy bodye oblyge marces doynge yf anye contraryed thy ſawes ſtedfaſt way maketh ſtedfaſt herte wyth good hope ende trewely woll thou well knowe ſe ſo ſet chaungyng hert haddeſt ſeruyce made thou haddeſt grace thy kynge foryeueneſſe mykell miſdede gracious kyng arte thou mykell holden whoſe grace goodneſſe ſomtyme herafter thynke enforme whā ſhew grounde morall vertue groweth brouȝt ye werke brouȝt thys grace aboute made thy herte hardy trewly haddeſt thou fayled purpoſe neuer taken wyſe therfore ſay thou might well truſte come thy blyſſe ſythen thy gynnyng hath ben harde euer graciouſly thy hertes deſyre hath proceded syluer fyned wyth manye heates men knowen trewe ſafely men may truſt alay werkynge diſeaſes hath proued waye hence forwarde thou thynkeſt holde nowe good fayth ladye quod tho nowe ſemeth hye waye ryght yea forſoth quod ſhe nowe wol dyſproue thy fyrſte wayes whyche many men wenen gette thylke blyſſe moche euery herte hath caught full loue tyed wyth queynte knyttynges thou ſhalt vnderſtande loue thylke forſayd blyſſe toforne declared prouinges ſhal hote knot hert well ꝙ inpoſſeſſion wol wel vnderſtande nowe alſo ꝙ ſhe knotte herte muſte ben one another knowe thy deſyre woll thou vnderſtande theſe mater ben ſayd thy ſelfe dyſprouing thy fyrſt ſeruyce ſtrenghthynge thylke thou haſt vndertake thy margaryte perle goddes halfe ꝙ ryght well fele al thys caſe poſſible trewe therfore admitted al togither vnderſtāden well ꝙ ſhe theſe termes loke contradiction thou graunt god woll ꝙ theſe thynges wol fayle yf cleped cauſed yf rycheſſe cauſen knotte herte thylke rycheſſe arne cauſe thylke precious thyng beyng ſentence ariſtotle euerye cauſe dignitie hys thynge cauſed wherthrough foloweth rycheſſe bene kyndely good moſt deſyred prayſed conſequence falſe nedes antecedent mote bene ſame condition rycheſſes ben badde naughty nedy yt woll proue wherfore mowe cauſe ſuch thyng ſo glorious good rycheſſe thou haſt nede haſte thou helpe hem kepe ergo thou nedeſte rycheſſe whyche nede thou ſhuldeſt haue yf thou hem wanteſt muſt rycheſſe bene nedy theyr hauinge maken nedy helpes ſuretie thy rycheſſe kepē wherthrough foloweth rycheſſe bene nedy euery thynge cauſyng yuels badde naughty rycheſſe one cauſen miſeaſe another mowen euenly ſtretchē al wherof cometh plee debate thefte begylynges rycheſſe moſt worthy make cauſe ſo wene thylke rycheſſe better thā perſon cōmenly ſuch aſkē rather quantyte qualyte ſuch wenen well hem ſelfe coniunction hys lyfe hys ſoule precious mykel hath rich ala howe maye holden ſuch thynges precious noble neyther han lyfe ne ſoule ne ordynaunce werchynge lymmes ſuch richeſſe bene worthy whan ben gatherynge departing ginneth loue men prayſyng auerice gatheryng maketh hated nedy many helpes whan leueth poſſeſſion ſuche goodes gynne vanyſh entreth ſorow tene theyr hertes badde ſtrayte ben thylke theyr departing maketh men teneful ſory gatheryng hem make men nedy moche folke one mowen togyder moch therof haue good geſt gladdeth hoſte al hys meyny badde geſt maketh hoſt nedy aferde hys geſtes goyng certes ꝙ wondreth therfore comune opinion thus worth yt hath catell ꝙ ſhe loke thou opinion yf gold money maner richeſſe ſhinen thy ſight whoſe thyne tho haue lytle beautye thyng cōpariſon kynd therfore ye ſhulde ſet worthineſſe thyng lower thā ſelf ryches fayrenes worthines thylke goodes yf ther ſuch preciouſneſſe hem thine thou madeſt hem ſo neuer come ſhul yt wherfore enbraſeſt yu wightes goodes tho thine▪ kind hath draw hem hem ſelf ſoth goodes erth bene ordayned fode noryſhynge yf thou wolte holde apayed wyth ye ſuffyſeth thy kynde thou ſhalte daunger ſuch ryches kinde ſufficeth lytle thynge taketh hede yf thou wolte algates wyth ſuperfluite rycheſſe throted thou ſhalt haſtelych anoyed elles yuell eaſe fayrneſſe feldes ne habitation ne multytude meyne maye rekened rycheſſe thyne owne bad great ſclaunder vylany occupyer good fayre ye mater workeman hem made praiſe ſhuld otherwyſe bountie cōpted thine thilke goodneſſe fayrneſſe proper tho thynges hem ſelfe thā yf thine ſorow whā wend ne glad pōpe pryde whan thou hem haſte bountie beauty cometh owne kynde thyne owne perſon fayre bene theyr hauynge whan thou haſte hem fayre thou haſte hem thou haſt geten hem fayrneſſe ſelfe ther vaylance men demed rycheſſe outforthe wenen men haue proper good ſelfe ſeche ſtraunge thynges trewly condition good wenyng ye myſtourned wene nobleneſſe ſelfe goodes beautie thynges pardy beaſtes han felynge ſoules haue ſuffyſaunce owne ſelfe ye bene lyke god ſeken encreaſe ſuffyſaunce ſo excellent kind ſo low thynges ye great wrōge hym made lordes ouer erthly thynges ye put worthineſſe vnder nombre fete lower thynges foule whā ye iuge thylke rycheſſe worthyneſſe put ye ſelf eſtimacyon vnder thylke foule thynges leue ye knowyng yourſelfe ſo ye vyler thā dombe beeſt ye cometh ſhreude vice ryghte ſo thylke perſons yt louen none yuel dere worthyneſſe perſon ſtraunge goodes ſayth adornement knotte lyth ſuch thing hys errour perylous ſhreude wrieth muche venym moch welth knot moy good whā hath getten certes thus hath ryches wyth flyckeryng ſyght anoyed many often whan ther throw ſhrew coyneth al golde al precious ſtones mowen foundē haue bandon weneth wight worthy haue ſuch thynges alone many haſt thou knowe nowe late tyme yt rich ſuppoſed ſuffiſaunce haue folowed nowe al fayled ye lady ꝙ myſſe medlynge otherwyſe gouerned thylke rycheſſe ſhulde yee ꝙ ſhe tho floode greatlye areyſed throwe hemwarde grauel ſande made medlyng ryght ſee yeueth flood ſo draweth ſee ebbe pulleth ayen vnder wawe fyrſte throwe yf good pyle noble gouernaūce loue wel meanynge maner bene ſadly grounded holde thylke gravel ye ayen lightly mow turne yf pyle bene trewe grauell ſande wol abyde certes full warnyng loue ſhalte thou neuer thorowe hem gette ne couer yt lightly ebbe er thou ware wol ayen meue rycheſſe many mē haue tenes diſeaſes ſhuld haue therof fayled thorowe whiche nowe declared partly ſhewed rycheſſe ſhulde knotte herte neyther ben cauſed one ne trewly knott maye ben knytte trowe ſtedfaſt loue though rycheſſe fayled el rycheſſe knotte hert ſuch knotte falſe whan ſee ebbeth withdraweth grauel ſuch rycheſſe voydeth thilke knotte wol vnknytte wherfore truſt way cauſe parfyte beyng rycheſſe ſuche knotte therfore another way muſt haue honoure dignitie wened yeuen ful knot yee certes ꝙ opinion bene manye ſame dignitie wyth honour reuerence cauſen hertes encheynen ſo abled knytte togyther excellence ſoueraynte ſuch degree nowe ꝙ ſhe yf dignitie honour reuerence cauſen thilke knot herte knot good profitable euery cauſe cauſe cauſe thinge cauſed thus good thynges profitable ben dignite honour reuerence cauſed ergo accorden dignity bene good wyth reuerences honoure contraryes mowen accorden wherfore reaſon ther ſhuld dignitie reuerēce none honour accord wyth ſhrewes yt falſe haue bene cauſe ſhrewes many ſhreudneſſe wt hem accorden ergo frō begynnyng argue ayenwarde tyl come laſt concluſyon cauſe knot lo day eye arne ſhrewes reuerence honoure dignitie yes forſoth rather thā good thā foloweth ſhrewes rather thā good ſhull ben cauſe knot contrary al louers bileued ſoth openly determyned holde nowe quod fayne wolde ſuche dignity accorden wyth ſhrewes quod ſhe woll ſhewe manyfolde wiſe ye wene quod ſhe dignites office ciite ye ſūne ſhyneth bryghte wythouten cloude whiche thynge whan comen handes malycyouſe tyrauntes cometh muche harme greuaunce therof wylde fyre though brende ſtrete certes dignite office werkes occupyer ſhewen malice badnes perſonne wyth ſhrewes maken manyfolde harmes muche people ſhamen often han rancour malyce gouernoure ſhulde bene maynteyned hath ſuch dignity cauſed debate rumour yuels yes god wote ſuch thynges haue bene truſted make mennes vnderſtādyng encline many queynt thynges thou woteſte well meane ye quod therfore dignitie ſuche thyng tene ywrought ſo ayenwarde ſubſtaūce dignitie chaunged relyed brynge ayen good plyte doyng doway doway quod ſhe ſo betyde ſelde ſuch dignitie betake good mannes gouernaunce thynge recken dignity goodneſſe parde bountie goodnes vſē good gouernaūce therfore cometh honoure reuerence ſhulde bene done dignitie bicauſe encreaſynge vertue occupyer ruler bicauſe ſouerayntie dignitie sythen dignitie may vertue cauſe worthy worſhip ſuch goodneſſe • dignitie perſon yt maketh goodneſſe dignitie ſhyne thys wonder thyng quod thynketh perſon dignitie worthye honoure goodneſſe ſo tho perſon badneſſe magre hath deſerued yet dignite leneth commended let quod ſhe thou erreſt right foule dignite badnes helper perfourme felonous doynge pardy kyndly good propertie cloude lyuenges water diſtroye lady ꝙ ſuppoſed ſhined ſhulde yee quod ſhe nowe proued full beaute kyndly ſhynynge fayled wherfore dignitye hym ſeluen hath beautie fayrneſſe ne dryueth nat awaye vice encreaſeth ſo cauſe knot ſe good trouth holde ye ſuch ſonnes worthy reuerence dignity worthy worſhyp maketh men harmes quod ꝙ ſhe thou ſe wyſe good man hys goodneſſe wyſeneſſe wolte thou hym worſhip therof worthy good ſkyl quod dewe ſuche reuerence worſhyp haue quod ſhe ſhrewe hys ſhreudneſſe tho put forth forne ferd yet worthy ſhreudnes vnworſhypped reuerence part worthy haue cōtrarious doyng belongeth good ſkyl righte beſmyteth dignity thylke ſame thinge aycuwarde hym ſmyteth el ſhulde ſmite ouer thou woſt wel quod ſhe fyre euery place heateth water maketh wete kyndely werking ſo yput hem ſuch thinges euery kyndly werkynge ſheweth kynde though wight ben mayre citie manye wynter togyther come ſtraunge place ther knowen ſhuld dignite haue reuerence thā neyther worſhyppe ne reuerence kyndelye propre dignitie ſythen ſhuldē theyr kynde ſuch doyng yf yf reuerence ne worſhyppe kyndly ſet dignity therin bene ſhewed thā goodneſſe dignitie ſhewed proueth goodneſſe kyndly hem grounded wy neyther worſhyppe ne reuerence ne goodneſſe dignitie doone none offyce kynde haue none ſuch propertie nature doenge falſe opinion people lo ſomtyme thilk citie werne dignitie noble yf thou lyſt hem nempne bene nowe ouerturned bothe worſhyppe name reuerence wherfore ſuche dignity haue kyndely werchynge worſhyppe reuerence hathe worthyneſſe ſelfe ryſeth nowe vanyſheth varyaunt opynyon falſe hertes vnſtable people wherfore yf thou deſyre knotte thys iewell el yf thou woldeſt ſuppoſe ſhe ſhuld ſette knotte ſuch maner dignitie thou weneſte beautye goodneſſe thylke ſomwhat encreaſeth goodneſſe yee hertes bene rauyſhed ſuch maner thynges certes ꝙ ſhe though fooles hert thing rauiſhed yet therefore generall cauſe power ne ſyker parfyte herte loked nero mooſt ſhrewe one thylke men rede yet power make ſenatours iuſtices prince many landes great power yes certes quod wel quod ſhe yet myght help ſelfe diſeaſe whā hē gan fal many enſamples canſt thou remē bre kynges great noble huge power holden yet myghte kepe hem ſelue wretchedneſſe howe wretched kyng henry curtmantyll er deyed ſo moch couer wt hys membres yet one greateſt kinges al normandes ſprynge moſt poſſeſſion noble thinge clere power founden myghty kepe hym ſelfe nowe trewly greate fole ſuch thyng wolde ſette knotte thyne herte alſo power realmes thylk greateſt power amonges worldly power rekened yf ſuche power han wretchedneſſe hem ſelfe foloweth power febler condicion ben wretched wretchedneſſe ſhulde cauſe ſuch knotte euery wyght hath reaſon wote well wretchedneſſe waye maye bene cauſe none ſuche knotte wherfore ſuch power cauſe power haue wretchedneſſe hem ſelfe maye ryght lyghtly bene preued power lacke ſide ſide power power wretchedneſſe al ſo power emperours kynges el theyr realmes whych power prynce ſtretchen wyde brode yet beſyde ther mokell folke whyche hath cōmaundement ne lordſhyp ther lacketh power hys nonepower entreth vnder ſpryngeth maketh hem wretch power wretchedneſſe nothynge el maner hath kinges porcion wretchedneſſe thā power trewly ſuch power bene vnmighty euer ben drede howe thylke power frō leſinge may keped ſorowe ſo drede ſorily prickes euer hertes litle ye power careth ferdeth ſelfe maintayn vnmyghty ye wretchednes whych entred ferdful wenyng wretch ſelfe knotte ymaked wretchedneſſe betwene wretch wretch thyng bewaylen wherfore knotte ſhulde bewayled ther ſuch perfyte blyſſe ſuppoſed gynning ergo power nothing ſhulde cauſe ſuch knottes wretchedneſſe kyndly propertie ſuche power waye drede whiche mowe eſchewe ne way lyne ſikerneſſe thou woſt wel ꝙ ſhe nought mighty wold done yt may doone ne perfourme therfore quod theſe kynges lordes han ſuffyſaunce ful men thinges mowen well bene holden myghty cōmaūdemētes ben done neuermore denied foole ꝙ ſhe wot ſelfe mighty wotte nought myghty blynde might wote ſothe quod yf wet muſt nedes ben drad leſen wot might dout yt mote nedes leſe ſo leadeth hym drede ben vnmyghtye yf retche leſe lytle worth yt ye leſyng reſon retcheth nothing myghty power ſtrengthe leſyng ſhulde bene wythſet whan cometh leſyng may wyth • yt ergo thylke myght leude naughty mightes arne ylike poſtes pyllers vpright ſtonden greate might han beare many charge yf croke ſyde lytell thynge maketh hem ouerthrow thys good enſāple ꝙ pyllers poſtes yt haue ſeneouerthrowed ſelfe hadden bene vnderput wyth helpes ſo lyghtly fal thā holdeſte thou hym mighty hath manye men armed many ſeruauntes euer adradde hem herte gaſteth hem ſomtyme mote ye feare haue comenly agaſteth hym ayenwarde werchen ſame thus warnyſhed mote warniſh houre drede lytel myght right leude ſo taketh hede ſemethe ꝙ ſuch famulers kinges greate lordes ſhulde great myght haue although ſypher augrym haue myght ſignifycation ſelfe yet yeueth power ſignificacion theſe clepe helpes poſt kepe hym fallynge certes quod ſhe thylke ſkylles bene leude yf ye ſhorers ben wel grounded helpes ſhullen ſlyden ſuffre charge fal myght lytle auayleth ſo thynketh quod poſte alone ſtondynge vpright vpon baſſe may lenger great burthen endure croken pillers theyr helpes grounde ſyker ſoth ꝙ ſhe blynde bearynge lame gynne ſtomble ſhulde fal right ſo ſuch pyllers ſo enuyroned wyth helpes fallynge grounde fayleth altogyther ofte ſuche famulers theyr mooſt pryde proſperyte bene ſodaynly ouerthrowen thou haſte knowe many moment ſo ferre ouerthrow couer might neuer whan heuyneſſe ſuche faylynge cometh caſe fortune mowe eſchewe myghte power yf ſhulde ſtrength ſuch thynges voyde weyue ſo lo whiche thynge power tho men han bene agaſt tyme full hauyng ſyker yf wolde weyue drede mowe lytle worthyneſſe fye therfore ſo naughtye thynge knot cauſe lo aduerſitie thylke bene foe gloſed ſemed frendes welthe thus arne hys famylyers foe enemyes nothynge werſe ne myghty anoy familier enemye theſe thynges maye weyue ſo trewelye theyr myghte worth creſſe ouer thing yt maye wythdrawe bridell hys fleſhly luſtes hys wretched complayntes nowe thinke thy ſelfe trewly mighty ſe waye yu lyeth knot thylke people thā ſetten hertes vpō ſuche myghtes power often bene begyled parde myghty maye anye thing another may done ſelue mē haue great power ouer hym ouer iuſtice demeth men ayenward hath bene often demed buſerus ſlewe geſtes ſlaine hercules geſte hugeſt betrayſhed many men collo betrayed ſwerde ſmytteth ſwerde ſhall ſmitten gan ſtudyen theſe thinges made countenaunce hande maner bene huyſhte nowe lette ſene quod ſhe thynketh ſomwhat wythin thy ſoule troubleth thy vnderſtandynge ſaye quod tho thynketh although mā power haue ſuche myghte ouer haue ouer diſproueth myght perſon yet may haue power myght neuer later se nowe ꝙ ſhe thine owne leudneſſe myghty may wythout wretchednes vnmyghty may ſitte might ouer woll put wretchedneſſe thou might wythſytte ergo thou ſeeſt thy ſelfe foloweth nowe quod ſhe woldeſt thou ſkorne thou ſe flye han power done harme another flye thilk haue myght ne ayenturninge ſelfe defende yes certes quod frayler thyng quod ſhe fleſhly bodye man ouer whyche haue oftentyme flyes yet laſſe thyng flye mokel might greuaunce anoyenge withouten withſytting al thylke mannes mightes ſythen thou freſt thy fleſhlye bodye kyndely power fayle ſhulde thā accident thing ben ſurete beyng ſubſtancial wherfore thylke thinges yt clepe power accident fleſhly body ſo may haue ſuretie might wanteth ſubſtanciall body waye knot loketh aright hye way ſhulde verily proued richeſſe dignite power ben trew way knot rath ſuch thynges knotte vnbounde wherfore theſe thynges rede wight truſt gette anye good knotte ſhul ſaye renome people mouthes ſhulde yt ben cauſe ſuppoſeſt yu thine hert certes quod yes trow fly reſons dare ſac • ly ſay ꝙ ſhe wol preue yt ſhrewes rath ſhul ben ye knot good yu ayenſt kynde fayne quod wolde thynketh wondre howe renoume ſhoulde wel knyt ſhrewe good perſon renoume euery degree hathe auaunced yet wiſt neuer contrary ſhuld thā renoume accorde ſhrewe may ſynke ſtomacke tyll heare nowe quod ſhe haue ſayd alwayes ſhrewes ſhull haue knot nedeth quod reherſe anye wote well euery wyght kyndely reaſon ſhrewes knyttyng wol eſchewe ꝙ ſhe good ought thylke knotte haue howe el quod greate harme quod ſhe good weyued put eſpoire knot yf deſired ꝙ ala ſuche thynge thynke wene heuen wepeth ſe ſuche wrōges bene ſuffred erth good ought haue wyght el goodneſſe ꝙ ſhe perſon may ben general lackyng pray ſing renome ſo cōſequēce foloweth ſhrewe ben prayſed knyt good forſake vnknyt ah ꝙ tho haue ye ladye bene abouten yet wolde ſe grace argumentes better declared good bad accordē lackyng prayſyng thynketh ayēſt kynde nay ꝙ ſhe ſhalt thou ſe yerne theſe elementes han cōtrarious quality kynde whiche mowe accorde nomore good bad quality accorde ſo contraryes qualitie accorden qualitie erth drye water nexte bytwene therth wete drye ben contrary mowen accorde yet diſcordaunce boūd accorde cloudes bothe elementes ben colde ryght ſo eyre next water wete eke hote eyre hete renome way knot lo fole ꝙ ſhe howe clerkes writen ſuche glorye renome glorie glorie thou arte none thynge thouſandes folke great ſweller eares many one hath full greate renoume falſe opynion varyaunt weteleſſe folke prayſen renoume enhaunce trowe thanke people nought worth remembraunce take ne procedeth wyſe iudgement neuer ſtedfaſt perdurable veyne flying wynde waſteth encreaſeth trulye ſuch glorye ought hated yf gentylleſſe clere thyng renome glory enhaūce rekenyng thy lynage gentylleſſe thy kynne ſemeth gentyleſſe thy kynne prayſynge renoume come thyne aunceſtres deſertes yf ſo prayſynge renoume theyr deſertes make theyr clere gentyleſſe mote nedes ben gentyl theyr gentil dedes yu thy ſelfe commeth ſuche maner gentyleſſe prayſynge thy deſertes gentyleſſe thyne aunceſters forayne maketh gentyl vngētyl reproued yf thou contynueſt theyr gentylleſſe therfore wyſe man one ſayde better thy kynne bene gentyled thou glorify thy kynnes gentyleſſe haſte deſerte thereof thy ſelfe paſſyng beautie fleſhly bodyes flyttyng mouable floures ſommer yf thyne eyen good lynx may ſene thorowe many ſtone walles fayre foule theyr entrayles maner hewe ſhoulde appere thy ſyght foule ſyght fayreneſſe febleſſe eyen kynde wherfore thylke ſhoulde waye knot whan thylke went knotte wendeth lo nowe proues none theſe thinges mowe perfectlye ben vnderſtandyng ben way duryng blyſſe knot nowe concluſyon theſe matter herkeneth theſe wordes ſommer knowe wynter ſhorter cours draweth dayes decēbre moneth iune ſprynges may faden folowen october theſe thinges ben vnbounden theyr olde kynde haue loſt werke propre eſtate men volūtarious wyll withſyt ye henens gouerneth thynges ſuffren thynges pacyently werche man eſtate yet wolde bene chaunged thus queynt thynges blyſſe deſyred frute cometh theſe ſpringes ny anguyſh bytter although whyle ſwete may withholde haſtely departe thus al daye fayleth thinges fooles wende ryght thus haſte thou fayled thy fyrſte wenynge thinketh ſayle drawe courſe ſtarre de polo antartico ſhall neuer come northwarde contrary ſtarre polus articus whiche thinges yf thou take kepe thy fyrſt waye goinge pryſon exyle maye cleped grounde falſed vnderneth ſo haſte thou fayled wyght wene blameth hym ſtynteth miſgoing ſecheth redye waye hys blyſſe nowe thynketh quod ſhe ſuffyſeth ſhewynge wayes dignitie rycheſſe renoume power thou loke clerely arne wayes knotte everye argument ladye ꝙ tho ye han maked theſe fore nempned mater thynketh hem full wytte conceyued ſhall nomore yf god wil contrary begyled fayne wolde • e wyll blyſſe knotte declared myght naturally ſuff • e chaunges commeth theſe tranſitory tymes maketh reuoluing yeres thus ſtondmele euerye hath full myght worchyng tyl al ſeuen han courſe worchinges poſſeſſyon houres dayes weke haue foloweth vpon thy wordes euerye ſoule reſonable man may dye yf death endeth ſelyneſſe maketh wretch nedes fortune maketh ende ſoules deth ye body wretchedneſſe ſhuld lyuen know many han getten blyſſe maner al glad thynges ſorowful yu mayeſt naye yet namely nowe thou ſtandeſt noble plyt good gynnyng wt good forth goinge hereafter yf thou wene wretch ſuch welth paſſed thā art thou wel fortunate bad thynges anguys wretchedneſſe bē paſſed art thou come firſt hoſtrye lyfe el booth world art thou ſodayne geſt wretched exyle weneſt thing erth ſtable thy fyrſt areſt paſſed ye brouȝt mortal ſorowe ben ſtādeſt thou noble plyte lytle hede rekenynge take yf thou let fortune paſſe dyng el ſhe flye whan lyſt thy lyue pardy mā hath nothyng ſo lefe life holde doth al cure dyligent trauayle ſaye thou arte bliſfull fortunate ſelye yf thou knowe thy goodes thou haſt yet beloued whiche nothinge maye dout ne bene worthy thy lyfe ꝙ good contēplacion ꝙ ſhe well doinge vertue tyme coming pleſaunce thy margaryte perle haeſtly thyne hert ful blyſſe ſhalbe eaſed therfore diſmay fortune hate greuouſly ayēſt thy bodily perſō ne yet gret tempeſt hath ſhe ſēt ye ſithen ye holding cable ankres thy life holden knytting ſo faſt thou diſcomforte nought tyme yt nowe ne diſpayre tyme come yeuen cōfort hope well gettyng agayne double thy leſynge wt encreaſyng loue thy margarite perle therto hytherto yu ſonne verye lyght faylinge maketh derke nyght hys connynge thus derkeneſſe many doutes walketh blyndeneſſe vnderſtandynge ne wote waye forſothe ſuche one may lightly ben begyled whome came loue fayned clothed lyuery vnlefull iuſtye habyte wyth ſofte ſpech mery fayre honyed wordes heretykes myſſe menynge people ſkleren wymplen theyr errours auſten wytneſſeth heretyke hys fyrſt begynnynge man right expert reſones ſwete hys wordes werkes myſcorden thus fareth fayned loue fyrſt werchynges thou knoweſt theſe thynges trewe thou haſte hem proued experience somtyme doyng thyn owne perſon thyng thou haſt founde mater mokel dyſeaſe fayned loue redely purueyed thy wyttes catch tourne thy good thoughtes trewlye ſhe hath wounded conſcience many wyth floryſhynge mokel ianglynge wordes good worthe thanked gloſe gladde prudence thou haſte ſo manlye veyned arte thou moche holden thy kynde courſe good meanyng returne thy mynde trow ne ſhewed thy margarite thou haddeſt neuer returned fyrſte good parfyte ioye euer fayned loue impaciēt water siloe whyche euermore floweth wyth ſtylneſſe priuy noyſe tyll come nyghe brynke gynneth ſo meaſure bolne nouelleries chaūgynge ſtormes courſe euery rennynge poynte ſpyll al circuite cankes thus fayned loue priuelye fulleſt hys flowynge newe ſtormes debate arayſe mercurius often wyth hole vnderſtandynge knowen ſuche peryllous matter yet venetiens ſo luſty ben ſo leude theyr wyttes ſuche thynges ryght lytell nought done fele wryttē cryen theyr felawes blyſſe ioy thus one ſame erroure mokel folke drawen come ſayne dronken pappes ben falla lyenge gloſe whych mowe ſouke mylke helthe deedlye venym poyſon corrupcyon ſorowe mylke falla venym dyſcryte mylke lyeng gloſe venym corrupcion lo thynge cometh theſe pappes vſe coueyted collynges deſyre meddle falſe wordes wyth ſote ſote wyth falſe trewly ſoryneſſe fayned loue nedes theſe ſurfettes ſyckneſſe muſt folowe thus oxe thy langoryng deth thou drawe ſote ſmoke hath ye defaſed euer deper thou ſomtyme wadeſt ye ſoner thou founde yf kylled lytell wonder ſyde trewe ſeruaūt faynen ne dyſceyue conne ſothly theyr doynge open foundement endureth burthē neuer ſo great euer one laſteth yeueth lyfe blyſful goodneſſe laſt endes though gynnynges ben ſharpe thus two contraryes contrarye ben effectes ſo thylke margaryte thou ſerueſt ſhall ſene ſeruyce oute peryllous trybulacyon delyuered bycauſe ſeruyce newe dyſeaſe fallen hope amendement laſte ende wyth ioye gladded wherfore kynde pure mercy wyth grace good helpe ſhall ſhe graūt el ſhal ſo ſtraine pyte ſhall ſhe ben amayſtred remembre thyne herte horrybly ſomtyme thyne margaryte thou treſpaſeſt greate wyſe ayenſt thou forfeyteſt clepe aye thy mynde know thyne owne gyltes goodneſſe bountye wyth mokell folowynge pyte founde thou tyme thou goodlye accepted grace pluckynge ſhe foryeueneſſe enclyned ſtyred drawe houſe yet wendeſt thou vtterlye euer haue ben refuſed well thou woſt ſythen ſuche ſharpe dyſeaſe might ſo greatly auayle thynkeſt thy wyt howe ferre maye wytte ſtretche thou lache thy ſyde wol make knotte certes thy good beryng wol acorde pſauter haue foūde dauid ſeruice trewe holy oyle peace reſt longe hymdeſyred vtterly ſhalbe anoynted truſte well woll fayle leuynge ye fyrſt waye good hert continuaunce ſe grounded thys purpoſe perfourme draweth maner cōſtraining nedes muſt ben thyne helper although myrth whyle taryed ſhall come ſuche ſeaſon thy thought ſhall ben ioyed wolde neuer god ſythē thyne herte reaſons arne aſſented openlye haſte confeſſed thyne amyſſe goynge nowe cryeſt mercye yf mercy folowed thy bliſſe ſhal ben redy ywys thou ne woſt howe ſone nowe good chylde rede kynde vertues thy margarite reherſed ſtrength thy perſon ſhul werche comforte thou mayſt myſcary theſe wordes ſayde ſhe ſtreyght lengthe reſted whyle ¶thus endeth ſeconde booke foloweth thyrde boke nōbre ſayne theſe clerkes yt naturell ſūme diſcrete thinges tellynge one two thre ſo forth amonge nombres thre determined moſte certayne wherfore nombre certayne werke beſy leudneſſe thynke ende parfourme enſample thys world thre tymes deuyded whych fyrſt cleped demacion ſay goyng trewe way al tho deyden hel punyſhed man ſynne tyll grace mercy fette hem thence ended fyrſte tyme ſeconde tyme laſteth cō mynge merciable grace vntyll ende tranſytory tyme whyche ſhewed ye true way fordoyng badde ycleped tyme grace thynge yeuen deſerte yeldynge one benefyte another onely goodneſſe yeuer grace thilke tyme ſo cā well vnderſtande ſhapen ſaued ſouled blyſſe thyrd tyme ſhal gyn trāſytory thynges worldes han made end ſhal ben ioye glory reſt body ſoule well han deſerued tyme grace thus heuen togyther ſhul dwel perpetuelly without ymaginatyfe yuel halue theſe tymes fygured tho thre dayes oure god cloſed erthe thyrde aroſe ſhewynge reſurrection ioye blyſſe tho deſeruē merciable grace leud boke thre mater accordaūt tho tymes lyghtly good inſeer maye ben vnderſtande fyrſte erroure myſſe goynge ſhewed ſorowful pyne punyſhed cryed mercye ſecōde grace good waye proued whyche faylynge wythout deſerte thylke fyrſt myſſe amendynge correction tho erroures euen waye brynge wyth comforte welfare amendement wexynge thyrde ioye blyſſe graunted hym well canne deſerue hath ſauour vnderſtandynge tyme grace thus ioye thyrd boke ſhal mater tyl ende ſpeciall cauſe haue hert make proceſſe margarit peerle ſo precious gēme clere lytel ſtones iewel ye tōges v engliſh people turneth ye right name clepeth hem margery perles thus varieth ſpeche frō many langages trewly latyn frenche many mo langages cleapeth hem margery perles name margarites margaryte perles wherfore denominacion wol acorde mēs tonges name clepyng theſe clerkes treaten kyndes ſtudyen propertye thynges ſayne margarit lytel whyte perle throughout holowe rounde vertuous ſee ſydes britayne muſkel ſhelles ye heauenly dewe beſt ben engendred experience ben founde thre fayre vertues one yeueth comforte felyng ſpirites bodely perſones reaſon another good profytable helth ayenſt paſſyons ſorye mēs hertes thyrd nedeful noble ſtaunchyng bloode el moche wolde ren whych perle vertues lyſt lyken tyme philoſophie wyth thre ſpeces naturel moral reſonable whych thynges hereth ſayne theſe great clerkes philoſophye knowyng deuynly manly thinges ioyned wyth ſtudye good lyuyng thys ſtante two thynges connyng opinion connynge thynge certaine reſon cōceyued wretch fooles leude men many wyll conceyue thynge maynteyne forſoth though reſon contrarye wherfore connyng ſtraūger opinion whyle thynge none certayne hydde men knowlegynge parfyte reſon fully declared thus yf ſonne ſo moke • men wenen el yf erth ſothneſſe certayne quantyte planet vnknowen erthly dweller yet opinion ſome men holden mydle erthe fyrſt ſpece philoſophye naturel whych kyndely thynges treten ſheweth cauſes heuen ſtrength kyndely courſe arſmetryke geometry muſyke aſtronomye teacheth wayes courſe heuens planetes ſterres aboute heuen erthe clemetes ſeconde ſpece morall order lyuyng maners techeth reſon proueth vertues ſoule moſt worthy lyuyng whych ben prudence iuſtyce temperaunce ſtrength prudence goodlye wyſedome knowyng thinges strēgth voydeth al aduerſitees alyche euen temperaunce deſtroyeth beeſtial lyuyng wyth eaſy bearyng iuſtyce ryghtfully iugeth iugyng departeth euery wyght owne thyrde ſpece turneth reaſon vnderſtandynge al thynges ſaid ſoth dyſcuſſed two thynges deuyded one art another rethorike two al lawes man reaſon ben grounded el mayntayned thys booke loue therafter beareth hys name phyloſophie lawe muſte acorden theyr clergiall dyſcripciōs philoſophie loue wyſedome declared lawe maynteynaunce peace holden theſe loue muſt nedes acordē therfore hem place haue touched ordre homly thynges honeſt maner lyuyng vertue rightful iugemēt cauſes profitable adminiſtracion cōminaltyes realmes cite euenhed profitably raigne ſynguler auaūtage ne priue enuy ne ſoleyn purpoſe couetiſe worſhip goodes ben dyſpoſed opē rule ſhewed loue philoſophy law yet loue toforne al wherfore ſuſterne vnite acordē one ende peace reſt cauſen noryſhynge ioye maynteynen endure haue declared boke acordeth diſcripciō thre thynges margarit vertue lykned philoſophie wyth thre ſpeces whych mater euer twey ben acordaūt bodely reaſon thyrde ſoule cōcluſion boke thys margarit peerle knyttyng together lawe thre ſondry maners ſhalbe lykened yt ſaye lawe ryght cuſtome whych wold declare yt lawe cometh goddes ordynaūce kyndly worchyng thylke thynges ordayned mānes wyttes arne ycleped ryght ordained many maners conſtitucion wrytten cuſtome thynge accepted ryghte lawe lawe ryght faylen dyfferēce whether come ſcrypture reaſon wherfore ſheweth lawe kyndly gouernaunce ryght cometh mannes probable reaſon cuſtome cōmen vſage length tyme vſed cuſtome wrytte vſage yf wrytte conſtitucion ywrytten ycleped lawe kynde cōmen euery nation coniunction man womā loue ſucceſſion chyldren heritaunce reſtitucyon thynge ſtrength taken lent lawe amōge al halte ſouerayneſt gree worſhyp whych lawe began begynnynge reaſonable creature varyed yet neuer chaungyng tyme cauſe forfothe ordaynynge law conſtrayne men hardyneſſe peace wythdrawyng euell wyl turnynge malyce goodneſſe innocence ſykerly withouten tenefull anoye amōge ſhrewes ſafely myght inhabyte protection ſafeconducte ſo ye ſhrewes harme harme brydle ferdeneſſe ſhulden reſtrayne forſothe kyndely lawe nothynge cōmended ſuche goddes wil hath cōfyrmed ne nothyng denyed cōtrariouſtye goddes wyl heauen eke lawes cuſtome el cōſtitucion vſage wryting cōtraryen lawe kynde vtterly ben repugnaunt aduerſary goddes wyl heuen trewly lawe kynde goddes owne luſty wil verely mainteine vnder lawe vnworthye profeſſe reguler arne obediencer bounden margarite perle knotte loues ſtatutes ſtablyſhment kynde whyche goodlye may ben wythſetten lo vnder bonde conſtrayned abyde man vnder lyuyng lawe ruled lawe oweth deſertes rewarded payn mede yf mercy weyue payne ſo parte reaſonfully maye ſey mercy ryght lawe paſſeth thentent al theſe mater leſt clere vnderſtandynge wetē thende thyrde boke ful knowyng thorow goddes grace thinke make neuerthelater yet yf theſe thynges haue good ſleight inſeer ſouke hony harde ſtone oyle drye rocke may lightly fele nobley mater leude ymaginacion cloſed boke ſhalbe ioye ſayde ſo ferre ſet fro thylke place fro whēce gladneſſe ſhuld come corde ſhorte let boket oughte catch water fewe men ben corde eche many ful purpoſe redy ſhorter make encloſe thētre boket ioy nothing ſhuld catch empty returne careful ſorowes encreſe yf dye payne yt gladneſſe theyr hertes good lord ſende water ye cop theſe moūtaynes ſhall drynke therof thurſtes ſtāch ſey theſe cōfortable welles helth goodneſſe ſauiour holpen yet ſay houſe ioye opened dare ſorowful gooſt mater gladneſſe thynken trete euer ſobbynges complaintes redy refrete meditaciōs werbles manyfold ſtoūdes cōmyng therfore maner ioye coud • endite yet dore ſhal knocke yf key dauid wold locke vnſhyt bryng chyldrēs tōges opneth cloſeth whoſe ſpirite wyl worcheth departing goodly hī liketh goddes laude reuerēce profit reders amēdemēt maners ye herers encreſyng worſhip amōge loues ſeruaūts releuyng hert grace iewel frenſhyp pleſaūce thys peerle ſtered thys makynge nothynge el yf good thynge mēnes lykynge ſcripture founde thanketh mayſter grace whych good authour pryncypall doer yf thynge inſuffycyent el myſlykynge wt leudneſſe myne vnable connynge body dyſeaſe anoyeth vnderſtandynge ſoule dyſeaſely habitacyon letteth wyttes many thynges namely ſorowe cuſtome neuer later loue longe tyme ſeruyce termes thynke purſue whiche ben lyuely yeue vnderſtandyng thynges nowe enform thys margarites goodneſſe may nat half preyſe wherfore nat ſhe boke boke worthy comended tho boke leude ryght thynges nat place place thinges oughten deſyred prayſed ꝙ loue trewly thy wortes haue wel vnderſtād cettes thinketh hē right good wō dreth thou ſo lightlye paſſeſt lawe sothly ꝙ wyt leude right blynd mater depe ſhulde haue waded lightly myght haue drenched ſpylte ther ſelfe ye ꝙ ſhe ſhall helpe ſwym ryght lawe puniſheth brekers preceptes contrary doer written conſtitutions ryght ſo ayenward lawe rewardeth yeueth mede hem lawe ſtrengthen one lawe thys rebel puniſhed innocent meded ſhrewe enpriſoned thys ryghtfull corowned ſame lawe ioyneth wedlocke without forſaking ſame lawe yeueth lybel deperticion cauſe deuorſe demed declared ye ye ꝙ fynde lawe mede reward goodnes gyltie deſertes fole ꝙ ſhe gyltie cōuerted lawe mykell merite deſerueth alſo paulin rome crowned hym maynteyners pompeus knowē diſtroyed yet forn paulyn chefe pōpeus coū ſayle law rome hath yet name meſuryng mede ye bewrayeng cō ſpiracy ordayned tho ſenatours dethe iulius ceſar acōpted catons right witneſſe euer trouth floriſheth name among knower reaſon perdicas crowned ye heritage alexāder great tellynge preuy hate kinge porrus alexander hadde wherfore euery wyght reaſon law rightwyſeneſſe apertly mede maychalēge ſo thou maynteyneſt lawe kynde therfore diſeaſe haſt ſuffred ye law reward worthy rewarded ordayned apartly thy mede might thou chalēge certes ꝙ thys haue wel lerned euer hēſforward ſhal drawe therafter onehed wyl abyd lawe mayntene kepe ſo hope beſt entre grace wel deſeruynge worſhip wight without nedful cōpulſyon ought medfully rewarded truly ꝙ loue ſothe tho conſtitution good ſeruyce profyt auaūtage ſtretch vtterly many mē demē haue deſert mede thē good wyl cōpelled se ꝙ may men holden thys contrary good ſeruice • wold thys queſtion declared ſhall ſay ꝙ ſhe fewe wordes reaſonable workinges pleſaunce profyte thy ſouerayne ſhuld performe ꝙ riȝt wel ꝙ ſhe nowe lytel hardely ꝙ ſhe vnderſtande ye ryghte mater due ouerchaūgynges foloweth perfectiō forme ryght ſo euery mā ryghtfull werkynges ought folowe leful deſyres hys herte ſe toforne end deſerueth many tymes loketh thēdes vtterly therof vnknowen befalleth oftē many yuels wher er ware ſhamefully confounded thende therof neden loked euery deſyrer ſuche forſyght good ſeruyce thre thynges ſpecially nedeth ruler hys workes fyrſte good nexte election hys hert thyrde godlye wythouten ſurquedry thoughtes werkes ſhulden good ſeruice actes authorites many may aleged neuer later reaſon thus maye ſhewed werkes cleped ſeconde mouen vertue fyrſt wercher whych good workes wrought procede ryghte ſo werkes mouen vertue laſt ende right fyrſt workyng man ſhulde ſecōde werche right ſo ye feled ende ſene theyr goodnes cloſed ye ſhulde nomore retche ye wrought gynnynge gan wyth good ſhall ceaſe laſt ende yf well conſydred wherfore myddle yf wayes drawe accordaunt endes ſtynteth courſe good another maner courſe entreth ſo partye hym ſelue euery part accordaunt hys foule ought eſchewed wherfore euery thynge yt wrought • good accordaūt •• e hys hole foule ought withdrawe thus perſons neyther • good ne harme ſhamen foule theyr makyng wherfore wythout workynge good actes good ſeruyce may man ben accepted trewly ylke han myght good done crowne worſhyp ſhall take hem wyth ſhame ſhull anulled ſo make one werke accordaunt wyth hys endes euery good ſeruaunt reaſon cōſequēce muſte good nedes certes ſuffyſeth alone good goodly wythall folowe thanke goodneſſe el nought deſerueth ryghte al beyng come frō greateſt good goodneſſe cloſed ryght ſo endes ben directe ſame good ariſtotel determineth ye end good ben one cō uertible vnderſtandynge wyll doth away good loketh thēd loketh good doth good doth goodly draweth away dyrectiō thende goodly muſt nedes bad lo badde nothyng el abſence negatyf good derkneſſe abſence negatyue lyght doth goodly dyrecteth thylke good thende badde muſt thyng good folowe eke badneſſe ſuche folke ofte foloweth thus contrariant worker thende good ben worthy contrary thēde yt good haue ꝙ may good dede done yf goodly helpe yes ꝙ loue deuell doth many good dedes goodly leueth behynd euen badly diſceyuable wyſe worketh wherfore cōtrary thende foloweth neuer ſo many good dedes bicauſe goodly away goodnes rekened lo tho mā good goodly thende goodneſſe wol folowe thus good ſeruice good dede goodly muſten ioyne together wyth free choiſe hert el deſerueth yt merite goodneſſe ye woll proue yf thou thyng good chaūce happe thyng art thou therof worthy cō mended▪ nothynge reaſon ye turneth thy prayſyng ne lackyng lo thilke thīg done hap thy wyl cauſed therby ſhulde thanke lacke deſerue ſythen fayleth thende whych wel ſhuld rewarde muſt nedes faile clerkes ſayn mā wyllyng bleſſed good dede yt hath done done fre choyſe willyng blyſſedneſſe may folowe ergo neither thāke goodneſſe ne ſeruice yt cōtrary good ende ſo thē good ſeruice lōged good dede goodly thorow fre choice hert truely ꝙ haue wel vnderſtande wel ꝙ ſhe euery thynge thus done ſufficiētly lawe cleped iuſtice reward clayme lawe iuſtice ordained wyſe ſuche deſertes goodneſſe quantite doynge mede rewarde neceſſite ſuch iuſtice yt ſay ryghtwiſeneſſe fre choice deſeruynge wel yuel graūted reſonable creature euery man hath fre arbitremēt choſe good yuel performe ꝙ tho yf good wyl deſerue margarite perle therto cōpelled haue free choice lyketh thē holden thinketh rewarde thentēt good wyl goddes forbode el ꝙ loue wiȝt meaneth otherwyſe trowe fre wyl good hert mede deſerueth hath euerye man ꝙ free choice neceſſarye maner wyl euery doynges yt lyketh goddes proper purueyance wolde ſe ye wel declared leude vnderſtādynge neceſſary neceſſyte ben wordes mokel entencion cloſyng ſaye ſo mote nedes otherwyſe maye betyde thys ſhalt thou lerne ꝙ ſhe ſo thou take hede ſpeche yf mānes owne lyberte fre wyl good bad one tyed bonde goddes preordinaunce thē neuer ſo well nedefull cōpulcion thilke bonde fre choice wherby nothyng deſerueth neuer ſo yuel man wyte onelyche hym ſuch thynge ordayned hym done wherfore ne ought bad punyſhed ne good dede rewarded neceſſite ryghtwyſneſſe therfore free choice arbitremente put man proper diſpoſitiō truely yf otherwiſe cōtraryed goddes charite ye badnes goodneſſe rewardeth deſerte payne mede thynketh wōder ꝙ god neceſſite forwote al thynges cōmyng ſo mote nedes thylke thynges yt bene done fre choice comen nothynge neceſſite onely wyll howe maye thys ſtande togyther ſo thynketh truely fre choice fully repugneth goddes wetynge truly lady ſemeth mowe ſtande together gan loue nygh nere noble coūtenaūce vyſage lymmes dreſſed nygh ſytting place take forth ꝙ ſhe thy pen redely wryt theſe wordes god wol ſhal hem ſo enforme yt thy leudneſſe haue vnderſtād mater ſhal openly clered thy ſight ful loking therin amēded fyrſt thou thinke goddes preſcience repugne lyberte arbytrye arbitrement impoſſible yt ſhuld accorde onheed ſoth vnderſtādyng yea ꝙ forſoth ſo cōceyue well ꝙ ſhe yf thylke impoſſible away repugnāce ſemeth therin vtterlye remoued shewe ye abſence impoſſibilite ꝙ ꝙ ſhe ſhall nowe ſuppoſe yt mowe ſtāde together preſciēce god whō foloweth neceſſite thīges cōming lyberte arbitremēt thorow whych thou beleueſt many thīges without neceſſite theſe proporcions ſothe ꝙ wel mowe ſtāde together wherfore thys caſe poſſible admyt truly ꝙ ſhe caſe impoſſible howe ſo ꝙ herof ꝙ ſhe foloweth wexeth another īpoſſible proue ꝙ ſhal ꝙ ſhe ſothyng cōmyng without neceſſite god wot toforne althīg cōmyng wote beforne wot neceſſite cōming beforne wot ye caſe neceſſary maner el thorow neceſſite ſothyng without neceſſite wetherto euery wyght yt hath good vnderſtāding ſene theſe thīges repugnāt preſciēce god foloweth neceſſite lyberte arbytrement fro remoued neceſſitie trulye neceſſary yt god haue foreweting thyng withouten neceſſitie cōmynge ye ꝙ yet remeue ye away fro myne vnder ſtandyng neceſſitie folowynge god beforewetyng thus god beforne wote ſeruice loue boūden margaryte perle therfore neceſſitie thus loue bounde yf loued tho rowe neceſſitie bene kept al loue dedes certes ꝙ loue bicauſe mater good neceſſary declare thynke herein wel abyde lightly paſſe thou ſhalt ꝙ ſhe ſay al god beforne wot louer louer thus god forne wot louer without neceſſite ſo foloweth whether thou loue loue euery hem ſhalbe nowe thou ſeeſt impoſſibilitie caſe ye poſſibilitie thylke thou wendeſt ben impoſſyble wherfore repugnaunce adnulled ye ꝙ yet ye awaye ſtrengthe neceſſitie whan ſayde though neceſſitie loue abyde loue without neceſſitie god beforn wot maner neceſſitie forſothe ſemeth ſome men coaction ſayne conſtraynyng el prohibicion defendynge▪ wherfore neceſſitye loue wyll vnderſtande conſtrayned ſome priuy ſtrength wyll louynge loue defended frō wyll louyng ſo thorow neceſſitie ſemeth loue loue elles loue loue wherthrugh neither thāk ne maugre tho thynges may deſerue ꝙ ſhe thou ſhalt wel vnderſtande often ſayne thyng thorow neceſſitie ſtrength neyther coacted ne conſtrayned neceſſitie defendynge remoued ſayne thorowe neceſſite god immortall nought deedlyche neceſſitie god ryghtfull ſtrength vyolente maner conſtrayneth hym immortall defendeth vnryghtfull nothynge maye make hym deedly vnryghtful ryght ſo ſay thorowe neceſſite louer el none onelye thorowe wyll god beforne wete vnderſtande thyng defendeth forbyt thy wyll whiche ſhall el cōſtrayneth ſhalbe ſame thyng forſoth god wot beforne ſeeth thynge cōmende wyll wyl neyther cōſtrayned ne defended thorowe thynge ſo thorowe lybertie arbytrement yt done wyll trulye good chylde yf theſe thynges wel vnderſtond wene none inconuenient ſhalt thou fynde betwene god forwetyng lybertie arbytre mēt wherfore wot wel may ſtand togyder alſo ferthermore yt vnderſtandyng preſciēce proprelyche cōſydreth thorow ſame wyſe thyng afore wyſt ſayd cōmyng pronoū ced nothing forn wyſt thyng cōmyng forewetinge trouth doute may wyſt wherfore whā ſey yt god toforne wot thyng thorow neceſſitie thilke thyng cōmyng al one ſey ſhalbe neceſſitie neither cōſtrayneth ne defēdeth thing therfore ſothly yf loue put ſaid neceſſitie el put affirmed neceſſite ye neceſſite cōſtraineth defēdeth loue whā ſay loue ſhalbe neceſſitie ſhalbe foloweth neceſſitie thyng toforn put moche ſey yf thus pronoūced ye thing ſhalbe none thynge ſignifyeth neceſſitye onely thus yt ſhall maye togyder euenlyche alſo ſothe loue ſhalbe neceſſitie nede haue nedeful al cōmyng ſhalbe ſame ſaye loue paſſed loue paſſed paſſed loue preſent preſent loue preſent el loue commynge loue commynge commynge dyuerſitye ſettynge wordes maketh diuerſitie vnderſtonding altho ſame ſentēce accordē ſignificatiō ryght one loue ſweete ſwete loue ſwete moche loue bitter ſorowful er hertes ben eaſed yet gladeth thilke ſorouful hert ſuche loue thynke forſothe ꝙ otherwhyle haue mokell blys hert loue
