abyde ala yf thorowe nedefull cōpultion magre withholde lytle thanke great trauayle haue deſerued ꝙ lady ſaye ſayde lyketh mater declare full many men haue dyuers fantaſyes reaſons one ſyde thereof whiche ryght ſone trowe thou wolt vnderſtōd thou ſhalt con yeue ſentence partye probable reaſō ſoth knowyng yt haue mater maked ende certes ꝙ theſe thī ge long haue great luſt lerned yet wene god wyl preſcience accordeth ſeruyce louyng thys precious margaryte petle whō euer hert thurſtyng deſyre wete brenne vnwaſtyng langour fade yt day deſteny deth ioy vnbide yet thende comforted ſuppoſayle blyſſe ioye determyne deſyres thyng ꝙ loue haſtely neygh god graūt grace mercy ſhalbe prayer tyl thou lykende hert thyne owne wyll enfourme mater ꝙ lady thou woſte lefte loue ſwete loue ſwete ſwete one ſaye tree alway neceſſitie whyte ſometyme er whyte myght haue whyte tyme whyte maye whyte whyte tree euermore nedeful whyte neither toforne ne whyte myght togyther whyte whyte alſo loue neceſſitie preſent nowe ye er preſent myght haue ſhulde haue yet may ſhal preſente thy loue preſent margarite hath bond nedefull preſent truly ſeme action neceſſitie cōmyge ferre forne maye ſhal commyng thing forſoth comynge nedefull cōmynge may cōmynge ſhall cōmynge ryght haue ſayde preſent future tymes ye ſame ſentence ſothneſſe preterit yt ſay tyme paſſed thīg paſſed muſt nedes paſſed yet wer myght haue wherfore ſhuld haue paſſed ryght ſo whā loue cōming ſaid loue yt comnedeful yt ſayd thyng cōmyng neuer comyng ſo oft ſame thing ſayn ſame whā ſayn euery man man euerye louer louer ſo muſt nedes way may mā man togyther yf neceſſitie ſay nedeful al thyng cōmynge cōmyng ſom thyng commyng cōming impoſſible right theſe termes nedefull neceſſitie neceſſary betoken ſignify thyng nedes may otherwyſe ryght theſe termes impoſſyble ſignifyeth thynge way may thorow parfyte neceſſitie al thyng cōmyng cōmyng neceſſitie foloweth nothyng cōſtrayned lo whan commyng ſayd thyng alwaye thynge thorowe neceſſitie altho commynge ſaye tomorowe loue cōmynge margarites hert therfore thorow neceſſitie ſhal thilke loue yet maye yt may although commynge neuerthelater ſōtyme ſoth ſomethyng neceſſitie ſayde come yf ſay tomorow cōmyng riſing ſun yf therfore neceſſitie pronounce cōmynge thynge come maner loue morne cōmynge thy margaryte warde neceſſitie cōmyng el ryſyng ſunne morne commyng neceſſitie comynge loue ſothly may neceſſitie aloone folowyng thorowe neceſſitie cōmynge made certayne futur future ſayde ſayne cōmyng cōminge ſaide tomorow cōmyng thorowe neceſſite cōming aryſyng ſun thorowe ii neceſſitis cōming vnderſtād ye one forgoīg neceſſite maketh thing therfore ſhalbe nedefull another folowyng neceſſitie nothing cōſtrayneth ſo neceſſite come come whan ſayne ye god beforne wote thing cōmyng nedeful commyng yet therfore make certayne euermore thyng thorow neceſſitie cōmyng sothly thynge commynge may cōmynge waye ſame ſentence vnderſtandyng yf ſaye thus yf god beforne wot thynge nedefull commynge yet therfore foloweth preſcience god thynge thorowe neceſſitie comyng tho god toforne wote thynges comynge yet therfore beforne wote euery thynge commyng thorowe neceſſetie som thynges beforne wot commynge frewyll reſonable creature certes ꝙ theſe termes nede neceſſitie haue queynte maner vnderſtandynge wolde dullen manye men wyttes therfore ꝙ ſhe woll hem openly declare clerely thā haue toforne er departe hence mater quod ſhe thou ſhalt vnderſtande▪ ryght nedefull god wylne wyll nomore manye thynges nedeful man wylne woll euer ryght nedeful god woll ryght ſo nedefull man woll tho thynges whiche god hath put man ſubiection wyllynge yf man woll loue loue yf ne wol loue loue ſuche thynges man diſpoſitiō nowe god woll maye whā woll wyll man thorowe neceſſitie conſtrayned el defended wylne woll theffecte folowe wyll nedefull wyll man free alſo woll maner ſoth thorowe neceſſitie mā ne werke louyng wol althouȝ woll neceſſitie quod thā ſtant loue thylke wyl ſythen mē louē wyllyng free choyce inhert wherfore yf thorowe neceſſitie pray ladye anſwer queſtyon aſſoyle wil quod ſhe anſwere blyuely ryght men wyll thorowe neceſſitie ryght ſo loue wyll thorowe neceſſitie ne thorowe neceſſitie wrought thylke ſame wyll yf wold good wyl ſhuld haue ben wrought although yt doeth nedefull done yf man ſynne nothyng elles wyll ſhulde ryght ſo ſyn wyl maner neceſſary done wyll neceſſary neuerthelater ſoth yf man woll ſynne neceſſary hym ſynne though thylke neceſſitie nothyng conſtrayned ne defended wyll ryght ſo thylke thyng frewyll woll may may wylne nedefull wylne may wylne thilke wylne nedefull impoſſyble hym onethyng ſame wylne may wilne thilke wilne nedefull impoſſyble hym one thynge ſame wylne notte wylne werke forſoth wyl whome yeue hath wyll wol voluntary ſpontany ſpontany wyll ſaye good wyll conſtrayned wyl conſtrayned conſtrayned may togyther yf thys neceſſitie maketh lybertye wyll whiche ye aforne myght haue bene eſchewed ſhonned god knoweth al truthe nothyng truthe al theſe thynges ſpontany neceſſarye ſyght ſeeth ſo ben ſo theſe thynges well conſydered open full withoute maner repugnaunce god beforne wot maner thinges ben done frewyll aforen myght haue ben neuer ſhulde yet ben thorowe maner neceſſitie frewyll diſcended hereby maye quod ſhe lightly ben knowe thynges neceſſytye though god haue hem preſcience ſome thynges lybertye wyll make haue full knowynge goddes beforne wetynge heare quod ſhe ſhall ſaye blythlye ladye ꝙ lyſt mater entyrely vnderſtād thou ſhalt ꝙ ſhe vnderſtande heauen goddes although ouer al power yet abydynge deuyne perſon heuen euerlaſtynge preſence wthoutē mouable tyme ſole haue ſayd toforne tyme hurteth ryght ſo ayenwarde tyme healeth rewardeth tre oft fayled hold deyntye whan frute forth bryngeth marchaunt one leſyng ſee nomore auenture thynketh ſhal neuer auenture come rycheſſe ſo oft muſt men oke ſmyte tyll happye dente haue entred ye okes owne ſway maketh come one ofte falleth lethy water harde rocke tyll haue thorow perſed euen draught wyre drawer maketh wyre ben euen ſupple werchyng ſtynted draught wyre breaketh ſonder euery tre wel ſpringeth whā wel groū ded often remoued ſhall frute ꝙ nowe gynnethe rype grace quod ſhe parfyte ioye endure ther hou begon grace ꝙ thīketh ſhulde haue rewarde long trauayle ſhal tell quod ſhe retrybution thy good wylles haue thy margaryte perle beareth name mede good grace cometh thy deſerte thy margarytes goodneſſe vertue alone quod ſhulde al longe trauayle haue reward thorow grace ſomtyme ſeluen ſayde ryghtwiſneſſe euenlyche rewardeth quyte one benefite ſoth quod loue euer ſayd hym doeth good done neyther holdē ne yet conſtrayned ſoth quod truly quod ſhe euer thou doſt thy margaryte peerle wyll loue reaſon thou oweſt done yet nothyng el yeldynge thy det quytyng thy grace ſhe lent whā ye fyrſt met wene quod ryght lytle grace ſhe delyuered certes harde grace hath nigh aſtrangled good grace wot wel thou wylt graunt er thou depart hence yf anye man yeue wyght ought hym ſelfe nothyng maye haue garmēt cote though weare cote elles thylke clothynge put hym yt naked cauſe clothyng onely yeuer garnement wherfore ſaye thou naked loue thy ſelfe none haue myghteſt put thyne owne perſō ſythen thy loue came thorowe thy margaryte perle ergo ſhe yeuer loue although thou vſe lent ſhe grace thy ſeruyce begynne worthye thanke grace ſhe yeuer thoughtes beſy doinges pleſaūce thy might thy wordes thou canſte deuyſe ben ryght lytle quytynge thy dette ſhe ben ſuche thyng ben ſtudyed theſe mater kyndly drawen homewarde margaryte peerle thence borowed holy wyte loue thou haueſt thus quyteſt thou thy dette thou ſtedfaſtly ſerueſt kepe well loue rede thou haſt borowed vſe ſeruyce thy dette quyte art thou able right ſone haue grace wherfore mede none halue mayeſt thou loke thus thy gynnyng endyng grace alone thy good deſeruyng thy det thou aquyteſt without grace nothing worth ſo euer thou werche thanke thy margaryte great grace hytherto hath gyded praye contynuaunce forthe thy werkes hereafter myſhappe thy grace ouerthwartly tourne grace glorye ioye commynge thorowe good folkes deſertes gettynge grace therin ſhulde ende glorye ioye wyſdome loue parfite charitie god hath graunted tho well deſerue lady al one ſtart myne hert woll onbyde ꝙ ſhe euer neuer woll gone hence woll kepe medlynge whyle lyſt onbyde thyne intremetyng maners ſtedfaſtneſſe ſhullen chaunged sobrelyche tho threwe vp myne eyen hugelye tho aſtonyed thys ſodayne aduenture fayne wolde haue learned howe vertues ſhulden ben knowē whyche thynges hoope god hereafter ſhe ſhall enfourmen namelye ſythen reſtynge place nowe ſo nyghe wyll anon theſe thynges thys lady ſayde remembred ſelfe haue ryght ſo wyll wol loue loue hath partye yet deny louynge wyl wylne loue haue hath whan wolde hath ſaye maye loue wylne yf loue haue throughe whiche thylke loue ſhulde wylne haue louynge wyll may man hym ſelfe onely grace toforne going ryght ſo maye noman kepe grace folowynge conſydre nowe euery man aryght let ſene wyght hym ſelfe mowe louynge wyl get therof fyrſte nothynge haue yf ſhulde hym ſelfe ſprynge eyther muſt wyllyng wyllynge▪ wyllynge hym ſelfe maye haue ſythen fayleth mater ſhulde forth bryng mater hym fayleth why▪ may thereof haue knowyng tyll whan grace put herte thus wyllyng hym ſelfe may haue wyllynge maye haue parde euery conceyt euery reaſonable creature otherwyſe wyl graunt wyll affyrmatyfe wyllynge waye mowe accorde although louynge woll come myne hert freneſſe arbytrement boke fully ſhewed yet owe therfore moche alow free wyll grace margaryte leaned neyther myght without grace fornegoinge afterwarde folowyng thylke grace get ne kepe leſe ſhal neuer yf frewyll make wyllyng otherwyſe grace hath graunted ryght whan perſon taketh wyllynge ſobre throweth awaye wyllynge dronke el taketh wyll drynkynge oute meaſure whiche thyng anon doone maketh thorowe owne gylte free wyll leſeth hys grace thyng therfore vpon nobley grace mote truſten buſye cure ſet thylke grace kepe frewyl otherwyſe reaſon ſhulde werche cauſe grace voyde thus muſt loke frewyll grace right naturall vſage engendrynge chyldren maye bene withoute father ne alſo mother neyther father ne mother begettynge maye lacke ryght ſo grace frewyll accorden without hem maye louynge wyll partye ben getten yet frewyl gettynge thyng ſo mokell thanke worthy grace ne kepynge thereof ſo moche thanke deſerueth yet gettyng kepynge done accorde trulye oftentyme grace frewyll helpeth foredoinge contrarye thynges wyllynge loue accorden ſtrengthe wyll aduerſities withſytte wherfore togyther grace oweth bene accepted wyllynge deſerueth frewyll louynge wyſe accorded remembre well howe boke ſo hede taketh conſydreth thynges werchynges mankynde euenlye accordeth tournynge thys worde loue trouth el ryghtwiſneſſe whether lyke thynge falleth man helpynge free arbytremēt thylke ryghtwyſneſſe take el kepe thorowe whiche man ſhall ſaued whiche thyng booke mencyon hath maked euery poynt thereof grace oweth thanked wherfore ſaye euerye wyght hauynge ryghtfulnes ryghtfull yet therfore ſey concyence ryghtfull behoten blyſſe euerlaſtynge hem ben ryghtfull withouten vnryghtouſneſſe man ſom degree maye ryghtfully ben accompted chaſte men lyuynge yet ben ianglers full enuye preſſed hem ſhal blyſſe neuer bene delyuered ryght verye blyſſe withoute maner nede ryght ſo noman ſhal yeuen ryghtful voyde maner vnryghtfulneſſe founde ſo noman blyſſe ſhal ben folowed ryghtfull wyth vnryghtfulneſſe bounde degre fully knowe ryghtfulneſſe moche hym ſelfe none euyll cauſe maner goodneſſe truly mother helpeth ſpyrite withſyt leude luſtes fleſhly lykyng ſtrē gtheth mayntayneth lawe kynde yf otherwhyle weneth harme precyous thyng folowe therethorowe nothynge cauſe ſomwhat el commeth aboute ſo taketh hede rightfulneſſe forſoth werne many holy ſayntes good ſauour ſwetneſſe god almightye ſome folkes ſauour deth deedly ende come ſaynctes ryghtwyſneſſe wycked men badneſſe hath proceded truly ilke wyl whiche ladye loue lerned affectiō wyl nempne wyllyng profytable thynges euel whan fleſhly luſtes cōſenteth ayenſt reaſon ſoule thyng clerely vnderſtand know whence thylke wyll ſo vycious ſo readye euyll dedes perfourme grace gynnyng ordeyned thylke wyl ingoodneſſe euer haue endured neuer badneſſe haue aſſented men ſhoulde beleue god thylke wyll made vycious fyrſt father adam eue vycyous appetytes vycious wyll ſuch appetytes conſentyng ben one thīg kynde thyng done howe wyll fyrſt man fyrſt aſſented holde profytable ſhewe fyrſte condicyon reaſonable ceeature wol conſydred apertly loked lyghtly cauſe ſuche wyll maye ben ſhewed intention god ryghtfully blyſſed ſhulde reaſonable nature ben maked hym ſelfe kepe neyther blyſfull ne ryghtfull myght withouten wyl bothe wyll ryghtfulneſſe thylke ſame rightfulneſſe heretoforne ſhewed wyll blyſſe thylke blyſſe euery man hath thylke blyſſe whome wyll therof abydynge blyſſe euery vnderſtandyng ſuffyſaunce couenable commodityes without anye maner nede whether blyſſe aungelles el thylke grace fyrſt paradyſe ſuffered adam haue although aungelles blyſſe adam paradyſe yet may denyed adam paradyſe ne hadde ſuffyſaunce blyſſe ryght great herte without al maner coldneſſe yet maye herte heate haue ryght ſo nothyng defruded adā paradyſe bene bleſſed without al maner nede although aungels blyſſe moche forſothe foloweth laſſe haue therefore hym nedeth wante thynge whiche behoueth ben may nede ben cleped adam fyrſt gynnynge god margaryte weten meane forſothe nede wretchedneſſe good withoute cauſe fornegoinge made reſonable creature wretched hym vnderſtand loue fyrſt maked god made therfore mā blyſſed al maner indigēce togyther one toke reaſonable creature blyſſe wyll blyſſedneſſe wyl rightfulneſſe ryghtfulneſſe ſelfe lybertye arbitrement free wyl thilke ryghtfulneſſe may kepe leſe wyſe ordayned thylke two wyl inſtrument cleped forne mencyon maked ſhoulde vſe thylke ryghtfulneſſe teachynge hys ſoule good maner gouernaunce thought wordes ſhulde vſe blyſſe obedyent maner withouten incommoditie blyſſe forſothe mannes profyte ryghtwyſneſſe worſhyppe god delyuered one ryghtfulnes ſo yeuen man myght leſe whiche yf loſte hadde continuallye haue kepte ſhulde haue deſerued auauncement felowſhyp angel thinge yf loſte neuer hym ſelfe forwarde ſhuld mowe ayenward recouer well blyſſe angel blyſſe himwardes coming ſhulde nome one depriued thus fyl man vnto likeneſſe vnreaſonable beeſtes hem corrupcyon vnluſtye appetytes vnder throwen yet wyl blyſſe dwelleth indigence goodes whiche loſte great wretchedneſſe ryght ſhuld bene punyſhed thus weyued ryghtfulnes loſt hath hys blyſſe faile hys deſyre owne comoditie may comodities hys reſonable nature whych hath loſt may haue falſe luſtes ben veſtial appetite turned foly vnconning hath begyled wening thylke bene comodities owen bene deſyred affection wyll libertie arbitriment enduced wylne thys thing ſhuld ſo wyl maked yuyll vnryghtful abſence rightfulneſſe whych thing reaſon euer ſhulde haue freeneſſe arbitriment maye wylne whan haueth whyle hadde thylke halpe kepe ſo yt wythout grace may bene recouered wyll cōmoditie much vnryghtful maked wyllynge yuell luſtes wyllynge goodneſſe may wylne wyll inſtrument affection wyl thralled ſithen thyng maye wylne wyll inſtrument affection deſyreth yet bene wyl cleped ye inſtrumēt woll throuȝ affection wylneth affection deſyreth thylke thynge wherto inſtrumente hym ledeth ſo frewil vnluſty affectiō ful ſeruaunt maked vnryghtfulneſſe may releue wythout ryghtfulnes full fredō may neuer haue kyndly libertie arbytriment without veyne ydell ſothe wherfore yet ſaye often haue ſayd ſame whan inſtrument wyl loſt hath rightfulneſſe maner grace may ayen returne ryghtfulneſſe wylne ſythen nothyng ryghtfulneſſe alone ſhulde wylne yt euer wylneth wt oute ryghtfulneſſe vnryghtfullye wylneth theſe vnryghtfull appetite vnthryfty luſtes flyes deſyreth mokell bene kynde bene bad ben vnryghtful badde ben reſonable creature beyng waye ſhulde bene ſuffred vnreaſonable beaſtes neyther bene yuell ne vnryghtfull theyr kynde beyng knowen maye wel bene nowe theſe thynges forne declared man hathe alwaye thylke ryghtfulneſſe whyche dutie ryghte euermore hauen ſhulde way ſelfe may get ne kepe hath leſe recouer ſhal neuer without eſpecial grace wherfore comune ſētence people opinion yt euery thing deſtiny ruled falſe wicked bileue though predeſtinacyon wel good badde ſithen ſayde god hadneſt made whych neuer ne wrought ſuffreth hem maked hardeth whā naught miſſayth ledde temptation whan delyuereth wherfore none incōuenient yf maner ſayd god forne haue deſtenyed bothe badde badde werkes whan hem ne theyr yuel dedes neyther amē deth ne therto hem grace leueth ſpeciallyche predeſtinacion goodneſſe alone ſayde theſe great clerkes god doth bene goodneſſe werchen negatyfe herof badneſſe holdē lady loue hath lerned ſo aryght thys boke loketh vtterly weten predeſtinacyon properly god maye bene demed beforne wetinge chapiter god beforne wetynge loue reherſed al theſe mater apertly may ben foundē thinges god ben togither preſence trewly preſence predeſtinacyon nothyng diſacorden wherfore lerned god wetyng free choyce wyll mowe ſtonden togyther thinketh ſame reaſon leadeth deſtenye frewyll accorden ſo neyther hem nothing contrarieth reſonablelyche maye ben demed often thynge fayleth frewyl werchyng yf man another man wrongfully anoyeth wherfore ſleyth conſtrayned ende mokel folke cryeth ſayeth lo deſtenyed god forne knowe ſo thorowe neceſſytie fall otherwiſe myght betyde trewly neyther yt wronge wroughte ne hym ſelfe venged none thylke thynges thorowe neceſſitie wrought yf wyth freewyll wylled neyther wrought perfourmed ſo vtterly grace ye frewyll goodneſſe bryngeth kepeth fro badneſſe turneth thynge mooſt thanke deſerneth thys grace maketh ſētēce vertue abide wherfore body ſoule full plentie conyng theyr good deſeruyng euer laſtyng ioy daye dome ſhul endeleſſe dwell ſhul bene learned kyngdome wyth ſo mokel affect loue grace leſte ioy ſhall greateſt glorye reioyce bene gladded • ſame ioye wonder ſyth god greateſt loue ye ne ought loke thynges wyth reſonnynge proue ſo inſtrumēt • wyll wyll yet varyeth effecte vſynge affection wyll alſo wyll cleped varyeth f • ō inſtrument thys maner wyſe name lyche whan commeth minde anone ryght wyllyng deſyred negatyfe therof wyllyng nyl acord cloſed hart thoughe vſage inſtrument ſlepe ſlepeth whā inſtrumēt v waken ſuche maner affection trewly ſome man hath ſome man leſſe certes trew louers wenen euer therof lytle haue falſe louers lytle wenen haue ryght mokel lo inſtrument wyl falſe trewe euen liche proporcianed affection ſome place ſome bycauſe goodneſſe foloweth thinke herafter declare vſe thys inſtrument wyl taketh hys name whan wylned thyng doyng vtterly grace catche thy blyſſe deſired ben rewarded thou muſt haue affection wyl ful vſe whan tyme aſketh wiſely ben gouerned sothly diſciple wythout feruente affection wyll may man bene ſaued thys affection good ſeruyce good loue maye bene groūded without feruent deſire thing wyll coueyted neuer retcheth haue haue affection wyll yt hath reſtyng place whan thyng cometh mynde taken hede comyn come therfore place affection fayleth thylke affection ſo lytle throwe goodneſſe ſhulde come grace lytelneſſe wyl ſuffre auaile way helpes certes grace reaſon thylke affection foloweth thys affection withe reaſon knytte dureth eueryche trewe herte euermore encreaſyng ferdneſſe ſtrength maye remoue whyle truthe hert abydeth sothly whan falſhed gynneth entre truth draweth away grace ioye thilke falſheed trouth hath thus voyded hath vnknyt bonde vnderſtondyng reaſon bytwene wyl hert ſo bonde vndoth vnknytteth wyl purpoſe thā ye firſt accorde knitteth hym wyth cōtrary reaſon vnreaſon lo wyl vnreaſon bringeth man blyſſe grace whych thing pure kynde euery man ought ſhonne eſchewe knot wyll rea • confyrme thynketh ꝙ ſhe thy ſtud • ent lokes thou weneſt theſe woordes contraryen ſayenges forne place whā thou ſomtyme affection wyl thynges yt nowe han brought diſeaſe whiche haue ye counſayled voyde thyne herte diſcouer made thy wyl ben chaunged whyche nowe thou weneſt arg • e wythholde kepe shortly ſay reuers theſe wordes may ben founde thoughe dronkenneſſe forboden men ſhul alway ben drinkleſſe trowe right thou thy wil reaſō ſhuld turne thy wyll one reaſon ſhulde vnbyde ſaye thy wyll thy fyrſt purpoſe wyth vnreaſon cloſed conſtrewe forthe remenante good lyketh trewly wyll reaſon ſhulde knitte togyther fre wyl reaſō tyme thyne hert aſſentaunt thou myghte chaunge yf thou rule reaſon varye whyche varyaunce come thylke blyſſe deſyred cōtrariouſly thou wercheſt thyng may knowe wyl reaſon loue alone yf thou voyd loue weueſt bonde knytteth ſo nedes el ryght lyghtly yt gone ſondre wherfore thou ſeeſt apertly loue holdeth knot mayſtreth hem bounde theſe thynges rynge circuite wrethe ben knytte thy ſoule wythout departynge let let ꝙ nedeth reherſayle make ſoule yet parfyte blyſſe thynkynge knotte trewly lady haue groūde well vnderſtand thyng ye thylke ſpire tree ſhulde wexe expowne ye thynge ye therof meane ſhall ꝙ ſhe blithly take good hede wordes rede cōtinuaunce thy good ſeruice longe proceſſe time ful hope abiding wythout chaung wylne thyne hert ſpire whych yf wel kepte gouerned ſhall ſo hugely ſpryng tyl fruite grace plentuouſly ſprongen although thy wyl good yet may therfore thilke bliſſe deſyred haſtely diſcendē muſt abyde hys ſeſonable tyme ſo proceſſe growyng wyth thy good traueyle ſhall wexe tyll founde ſo myghty windes yuel ſpech ne ſtormes enuy make traueyle ouerthrow ne froſtes myſtruſte ne hayles ielouſy ryght lytle myght haue harmyng ſuche ſprynges euery younge ſetlynge lyghtly wyth ſmale ſtormes peyred whan woxen ſomdele gretneſſe han great blaſtes wether lytle myght diſauauntage werch mine owne ſouerayne lady ꝙ welth myne herte lykynge vnto noble grace therthrouȝ diſpleaſed ſuppoſe ye erren ye makē ielouſy enuy diſturbour hem ben ſeruauntes haue lerned ofte forne tyme euery loner hert greate plentie ielouſyes greues ben ſowe wherfore thinketh ye ne ought maner accompte thylke thyng among theſe welked wyners venomous ſerpentes enuy miſtruſt yuel ſpeche foole ꝙ ſhe miſtruſt foly yuel wyl medled engendreth welked padde trewly yf diſtroyed ielouſye vndone euer yet ſome maner ielouſy wote wel euer redy hertes trew ſeruauntes thus ielous ouer hym ſelfe leſte cauſe hys owne diſeaſe thys ielouſy full thoughte euer ſhulde kepte ferdneſſe leſe hys loue miſkeping thorow owne doyng leudeneſſe el thus leſt ſhe thou ſerueſte ſo feruently beſet better lyketh al thy good ſeruyce ſhe compteth creſſe theſe ielouſyes herte acceptable quality ben demed theſe oughten euery trew louer kindly euermore hauen minde tyll fully grace blyſſe ſeruice hym diſcended wyll ielouſy catcheth el wenyng hys owne folyſh wylfulneſſe miſtruſteth truely wyth fantaſy venyme foule begyled yuelwyll hathe grounded thylke mater ſorowe hys leude ſoule yet thā euery wight ſhulde truſte ne euery wyghte fully miſbeleue meane theſe thynges owen vſed sothly wythouten cauſe •• euidence myſtruſte ielouſye ſhulde wened wyſe perſon cōmenly ſuch leude wickednes ſhulde ſynde wyſe yuell wyll acomered abyde well hys tyme tyl grace blyſſe ſeruice folowyng haue hym ſo mokel eaſed abyding forehande hath diſeaſed certes lady ꝙ tho thyng wondreth ſythen thylke blyſſe ſo precious kyndly good wel worthy kynde whā medled lo • e reaſō ye forne haue declared anone hye one ſpronge ſpringeth anone one cometh receyueth euery thyng kyndly place full appetite euer commeth thytherwarde kyndly draw kyndly therto cōſtrayneth kindly ſtede blyſſe ſuche wyl medled vnbyde nedes ſhulde haue hys kyndly beyng wherfore thynketh anone wyll ſhewed kydde hym profreth thylke blyſſe ſhulde hye thylke wil receyue el kynde goodneſſe worchē hem ſhulde lo ſunne neuer ſo ferre euer hathe hys kynde werching erth great weyght hye onloft caryed ſtynteth neuer tyll come thys reſtyng place water ſee ward euer ben drawyng thynge lyght blythly wyl ſynke euer aſcendeth vpward draweth thus kynde euery thynge hys kyndely courſe hys beyng place ſheweth wherfore kynde thys good wyl anone ſpronge blyſſe ſhulde theron diſcend kynde wolde dwelleden togyther ſo haue ye ſayd ſelfe certes ꝙ ſhe thyne herte ſytteth wonder ſore blyſſe haue thyne hert ſore agreued taryeth ſo longe yf thou durſteſt thynketh thyne wordes blyſſe woldeſt thou blame yet ſaye thylke blyſſe kyndly good hys kyndly place wyl vnbyde neuer later cōmyng togyther kyndes ordynaunce ſodaynly may betyde muſt abide time kynde yeueth hym leaue yf man thys wyl medled gonne hym ſhew thylke blyſſe haſt folowed ſo lyghtly commyng ſhulde lyghtlye cauſe goynge longe tyme thurſtyng cauſeth drynke delycious whan ataſted howe ꝙ thā ſo many blyſſes ſe al day mine eye fyrſt moment ſyght ſuch wyl accorde yee yet whyle wyth wyll aſſenteth ſyngulerly hym ſelfe reaſon fayleth traueyle none ſeruyce tyme thys queynt maner thing howe ſuche cometh aboute ꝙ ſhe thus earth kyndely ſeaſons tymes yere bryngeth ſorth innumerable herbes tree profytable ſuch men myght leaue though naught noryſhynge mannes kynde ſeruen el ſuch turnen ſoone vnto mennes confuſion eaſe therof ataſt comen forthe earthe theyr owne kinde wythouten mannes cure buſyneſſe traueyle thylke herbes mennes lyuelode neceſſaryly ſeruen wythout whyche goodlye thys lyfe creature mowen enduren mooſte bene nouryſhen mankinde wythout great traueyle great tylth longe abydyng tyme comen earth ſeede forne ordeyned ſuch herbes make ſprīg forth growe ryght ſo perfite bliſſe haue meanyng duryng time abyde maye come ſo lyghtlye wyth great traueyle ryght beſytylth yet good feed ſowe ofte croppe fayleth bad ſeed neuer ſo wel traueyled thylke blyſſe thou ſpoke ſo lyghtly cōming truely neceſſary abiding better ſtamped venomous ieuſe wrongen likely enpoyſonen tho therof taſten certes ryght bytter bene herbes yt ſhewen fyrſte yere owne kynde well harueſt yeldeth many graynes tho longe ſore hath ben traueiled woldeſt thou demē mā wold yeue thre quarter noble gold precious gyfte▪ yee certes ꝙ ꝙ ſhe thre quarter full peerles certes ꝙ yt rych gift ꝙ ſhe mokel azure quod precious gyfte ful▪ ꝙ ſhe noble gyfte theſe one good fayth ꝙ wantynge englyſh namynge ſo noble worde preciouſneſſe yeue name ryghtfully ꝙ ſhe haſte thou demed yet loue knytte vertue paſſeth al golde thys erth good wil accordant reaſon maner properte maye countreuayled azure worlde accompt reſpecte reaſon loue wyth good wyll reaſon accordeth wyth earthly ryche ſe may ben amenden thys yefte haſt thou yeuen know ſelf thy magaryte thilke gyft hath receiued thing reward ſhe hath ſelfe bounde thy gyfte ſayd maner rycheſſe maye amended wherfore wyth thynge yt maye amended thou ſhalt thy margarytes rightwiſeneſſe rewardede right ſuffred yet neuer euery good dede ſōtime yolde al wold thy margarite rewarde quite ryght neuer dieth thy mede meryte woll puruey certes ſuch ſodaine blyſſe thou firſt nēpneſt ryȝ • wyl hem reward well worthy though thyne eye ſemeth rewarde yt deſert paſſe right ſende ſuch bytternes euēly reward ſo ye ſodayne bliſſe alwaies reaſon great goodnes may ben accompted bliſſe long long abydeth endleſſe wol laſt se thy wyl endeleſſe thou louedeſt euer thy wyll euer tabyde neuer chaunge euenhed rewarde muſt ben done ryght muſte nedes thy grace thys bliſſe endeles ioy vnbide euēlich diſeſe aſketh euēlych ioy haſtely thou ſhalt haue ꝙ ſuffiſeth thā long good wyll neuer ſo wel reaſon medled yf good ſeruice longe trauayled ſo throuȝ ſeruice ſhul men come ye ioy thynketh ſhulde wexing tree whiche ye firſt meued trouth ꝙ ſhe haſt thou cō ceyued theſe thinges thyne hert haſtely ſhalt thou able ioye parfite blyſſe receyue nowe wote wel thou deſyreſt know ye maner braū ches tree ſhulde ſpring therof lady ꝙ hertely pray thā leue woll right ſoone ſhall ataſte fruite ſo longe haue deſyred thou haſte herde quod ſhe wyſe tree forne haue declared grounde ſtocke wexinge firſte grounde ſhuld thy frewyl ful thine hert ſtocke ſaid ſhuld continuaūce good ſeruice longe time traueyle tyl greatneſſe right wel woxen whan tree ſuch greatneſſe hath caught haue reherſed braunches frute ſhulde forth bring ſpech muſt nedes voice prayer complayning wiſe vſed ala ꝙ tho ſoroufully wounded hydeth ſpeche ſpareth complayntes make ſhall ſpeke ye care payne euen lyke hell ſore hath aſſayled ſo ferforthe payne thronge leue tree ſeer neuer ſhal frute forth bringe certes greatly eaſed dare pryuy mone diſcouer trewe felowe cōninge hath myȝt wherthrough playnt thyng maye amēded mokel ioyed herte hardyneſſe dare complayne lady care yt ſuffreth hope mercy grace auaunced trewly ſaye ſyth came margaryte ſerue durſt neuer diſcouer maner diſeaſe wel later hathe myne hert hardied ſuch thinges done ye gret bounty worthy refreſhmentes ſhe grace goodly without deſerte halue ofte hath rekened nere goodneſſe wyth grace wyth mercy medled whiche paſſen al deſertes traueyls ſeruinges degree mighte endyte wolde wene ſhulde wythout recouer gettynge thys blyſſe euer thus haue ſtylled diſeaſe thus haue couered care brenne ſorowfull anoy gledes cole waſten fyre vnder deed aſhen well hoter fyre wyth aſhen ouerleyn ryght longe wo haue ſuffred lo ꝙ loue howe thou fareſt thynketh ye palaſy yuel hathe acomered thy wittes faſte thou hyeſt forwarde anone ſodaynly backwarde thou moueſt shall yet al thy leudneſſe thy braynes dull bene thy ſkylfull vnderſtādynges thy wyll hath thy wyt ſo mayſtred▪ woſte thou well ꝙ ſhe euerye tree hys ſeſonable tyme burionynge ſhewe blomes fro wtin ſygne frute ſhulde ſprynge el frute yt yere men halte delyuered ye grounde neuer ſo good thouȝ ſtock mighty full braunches ſeer burions ſhewe farwell gadiner may pipe wt yue leafe frute failed wherfore thy braunches muſt burionen preſēce thy lady yf thou deſyre fruite thy ladyes grace beware thy lyfe yt thou wodelaye vſe aſkynge thynges ſtretchen ſhame myghte thou ſpede waye eſpy vertue woll ſuffre vyllanye hym ſelfe ſprynge thy woordes maye queynt ne ſubtell maner vnderſtandynge free wytted people ſuppoſen ſuche poeſyes begyled open vnderſtandynge muſte euery worde vſed voyce wythout clere vnderſtandynge ſentence ſayeth ariſtotle ryght naught printeth herte thy wordes byde herte clene ful ſentence trew meaning plattly muſt thou ſhewe euer obedient heſtes wyls perfourme thou ſet ſuch wytte wete loke euer ſhe meaneth lyſte ſpeke ſtilly diſeaſe ſuffre wōder tho come neuer bliſſe yt traueileth vnwyſt coueyteth thing vnknowe vnwetinge ſhal quyted wyth vnknowe thynge rewarded good lady ꝙ hath oft ben ſene wether ſtormes ſo hugely haue fal burionynge tyme parte dureſſe han beaten ſprynges ſo clene wherthroughe fruite thylke yere hath fayled great grace whan burions hā good wether frutes forth brynge ala ſuch ſtormes howe harde auoyde tyll efte wedrynge yeres han maked circute cours al er fruite able taſted ſhente ſhame yt foule rebuked hys ſpeche fyre brenning ſore ſmarteth diſeaſe thynketh ful longe er water come ſhulde fyre quenche whyle men gone leche body buryed lo howe ſemely frute wexeth thinketh tho frutes maye man ataſte pure bytterneſſe ſauour thys wyſe bothe frute tree waſten away togyther though mokel beſy occupacion haue ſpent brynge ſo ferforth able ſpring lyte ſpeche hath maked al thys labour ydel ꝙ ſhe wherof ſerueth thy queſtion aſſoyle thinketh nowe duller wittes whā firſt mette although mā leude cōmenly foole demen good wol lerne ſottes fooles le • lightly mynd yt good men teacheth hem ſayde therfore thy ſtocke muſte ſtronge greatneſſe well herted tree full • eble fyrſte dente falleth although frute faileth one yere two yet ſhal ſuche ſeaſen come one tyme ſhall brynge frute nothynge preterit ne paſſed nothyng future ne cō myng thinges togyther place bene preſent euerlaſtynge wythout menyng wherfore god al thing thoughe thynge nat kyndely nature thinges yet yf ſhuld yet wherthorow hys deth henteth naye forſoth ꝙ ſhe nothynge ayenſt ſayenge god begyled ne ſeeth nothynge whether ſhal come lyberte el neceſſite yet ſaid ordeyned god immouable mā done may chaū ged thyng alſo paule apoſtel ſayth hem tofore purpoſſed ſayntes thus whych god wyſt hath predeſtined conformes ymages hys ſonne ſhulde fyrſte begotten ſay amonges many brethrē hath predeſtyned hem hath cleped whō hath cleped hem hath iuſtifyed hath iuſtified hem hath magnifyed purpoſe whiche ben cleped ſayntes holy ye euerlaſtyng preſēt wheris neither tyme paſſed ne tyme cōmynge euer preſente nowe mokel momēt ſeuen thouſande wynter ſo ayenwarde wythouten meuyng nothynge lych temporel preſence thīge yt euer preſent yet amōges mē er preſence mouable thorowe lyberte arbytremēt ryght euerlaſtyng preſent maner thing ne ſhalbe nowe tē porel tyme ſomthyng ſhalbe mouynge ſtoundes thys maner repugnaunce right ſo euerlaſtynge preſence nothynge may chaūged tē porel tyme proued mouable lyberte wil wythoutē incōuenience therof folowe tēporel tyme ſuch preſence tother preſent done paſſed come gynnē entre whych tymes amōges euerych eaſely foloweth ye preſence euerlaſtyng dureth onehed wythout ymaginable chaūgyng euer preſent nowe truely courſe planetes ouerwhelmynges ſonne dayes nightes new gynnyng circute ended ſayne one yere folow another theſe maken trāſitory tymes wyth chaūgyng lyues mutation people right tēporel preſence coueyteth euery place al thinges euery tymes cōteyned ſey wyſt goddes knowynge ꝙ wōdreth paule ſpake theſe wordes byvoice ſignificatiō tyme paſſed god ſaītes wyſt hath predeſtined hath cleped hath iuſtifyed hath magnifyed thynketh ſhulde haue ſayde tho wordes tyme preſent accordaunt euerlaſtynge preſent thē haue ſpoke preterit voice paſſed vnderſtandynge ꝙ loue theſe wordes ſe well thou haſt lytel vnderſtādyng ye euerlaſtyng preſence el ſpoken wordes neuer thing tho thou haſt nēpned fore one euenlych ye god bē al together ye euerlaſtīg preſent nowe vnderſtādyng eternal preſence ſayd hath encloſe together one al tymes cloſe one al thinges yt ben dyuers tymes dyuers place • tē porel wythout poſteriorite priorite cloſed therin perpetuel maked dwel preſent ſight thou ſayeſt yt paule ſhulde haue ſpoke thilke forſaid ſentēce tyme preſent moſt ſhulde haue ben accordaunt euerlaſtyng preſence gabbeſt thou thy wordes sothly ſay paul moued ye wordes ſignificatiō tyme paſſed ſhewe fully yt thylke wordes put tēporel ſignification al thilk tyme thilk ſentēce tēporallich borne whiche paule pronounced god haue tofore knowe haue cleped magnifyed wherthorow may wel know paule vſed tho wordes paſſed ſignificaciō nede lacke word mānes bodely ſpech betokenyng euerlaſtynge preſence therfore worde moſte ſemelyche lykeneſſe euerlaſtynge preſence toke ſentēce thynges beforne ben paſſed vtterly immouable ylyke ye euerlaſting preſēce thylke ben neuer mowe preſent ſo thinges time paſſed ne mowe wyſe bē paſſed al thinges temporal preſence paſſen lytel ſhullen ben preſent ſimilitude euerlaſtyng preſence ſygnifycacion tyme paſſed tyme temporal preſent ſo accordaunce maner thyng theſe ben thorow fre arbytremēt el neceſſary holy wrytte pronoūceth eternite ſpeketh preſence euerlaſting ſoth nothyng ſothe immouable tyme nought alway ben wylles act right nat nedeful hem ſo oft nedfull ſomtyme ſhulde ꝙ yet muſt lerned ſome enſample loue quod ſhe woll nowe enſample make ſythen know heed knotte yelke lo ſomtyme thou wryteſt arte ne arte wyll wryte ryght whyle thou wryteſt el wol write nedeful wryte ſhal reaſon defēdeth ſomthyng ne maye tyme temporall mouynge eterne immouable forſothe nomore contrary ne reuers mouable tyme temporal mouable eternite tyme alway eternite haue el come tyme temporel haue ne nought cōmyng eternite yet neuer later ſaye ſomthynge neuer tyme tēporel euer eternite al onely ſomtyme ſaye thy loue morne tyme day alone deny ne yet neuer later alwaye eternite ſo quod preſent maner quod ſhe myne diſciple gynneſt thou able haue name ſeruaunt thy wytte clered away errour cloude vnconnyng awaye blyndneſſe loue awaye thoughtfull ſtudy medlyng maners haſtly ſhalte thou tyme temporel eternite dwelleth immouable • wythout ceſſyng right nought tyme ſame euerlaſtynge tēporallyche ſomtyme ny toforne maye haue ſayd nowe ſothlye ꝙ haue wel vnderſtāde ſo nowe thynketh hence fyrſt thynge thou muſt ſet thy werke grounde ſyker good accordaunte thy ſprynges yf yu deſyre grape thou goeſt haſell ne fetchen roſes thou ſekeſt okes yf thou ſhalt haue hony ſoukles thou remembraunce may holde one thynge continually herte neuer ſo luſty deſyred nowe ſe ꝙ ſhe thy wyl ſhal folowe thy frewyl groūded cōtinuelly abyde thy fre wil thou loueſt haſt loued yet ſhal louē thys margaryte perle thy wyl thou thinkeſt holde thē thy wyl knyt loue chaūge newe luſt beſyde thys wyll teacheth thyne hert frō al maner varyeng thē although thou thretened deth el otherwyſe yet thyne arbitremēt choſe thy loue voyde el holde thylke arbytrement maner iugement bytwene deſyre thy herte yf thou deme loue thy good wyl fayleth arte thou worthy blyſſe good wyl ſhulde deſerue thou choſe contynuaunce thy good ſeruyce thy good wyll abydeth nedes blyſſe folowīg thy good wil muſt come ſtrēgth thylke iugement thy fyrſt wyl yt taught thyn hert abyde halte theſchaūge wyth reſon accorded trewly maner wyl thus ſhal abyd impoſſible turne yf thy herte trewe yf euery man dyligently menynges hys wyl cōſider ſhall wel vnderſtande good wyl knyt wyth reaſon falſe herte neuer voyded thy goodwyll thys accordaūce bytwene falſe wyl thyne herte falſyte ben lykened together yet lytel wol ſay good wyll thy goodwylles rayſe ſtrength take hede ꝙ ſhe thy wylles thou ſhalt vnderſtande right ye han body dyuers membres fyue ſondrye wyttes euerych apart hys owne doyng thinges inſtrumētes ye vſen hādes aparte handle fete go tonge ſpeke eye ſe ryght ſo ye ſoule hath hym certayne ſterynges ſtrengthes whych vſeth inſtrumētes certayne doynges reaſon ſoule vſeth thīges know proue wil vſeth wilne yet neither wyl ne reaſon al ye ſoule eueryche hem thing ſelf ye ſoule right euerich hath thus ſinguler īſtrumētes hē ſelfe han well diuers aptes dyuers maner uſynges thilke aptes mowē wyll ben cleped affectiōs affectiō inſtrumēt wyllyng apetites wherfore mokel folke ſetteth werke inſtrumēt willyng thilke ſtrēgth ſoule ye cōſtraineth wylne ryght reſon inſtrumēt reaſons ye vſen ye loken affection thys inſtrument thyng ye drawe deſyrouſlye thyng wylne coueytous maner tyme mynde yf come thought thylke thyng remē bre anone ye wylling thilke done el haue thus inſtrument wyl affection wyl alſo wylne thynge ſayd wylne helth whē wyl nothing theron thiketh anon cometh memorie wyl ſo affection wylne ſlepe whē mynde anone remembred wyl wylneth ſlepe tyme cometh yt doynge affection wyll neuer accordeth ſyckneſſe ne alway wake right ſo true louers affectiō willyng inſtrument wylne truth hys ſeruyce affection alway abydeth although ſleping thret • ed el theron thinkyng anon cometh minde anone ſtedfaſt wil abyde vſe inſtrument forſoth another thyng hym ſelfe haue ye whē ye doynge wylled thyng affect inſtrumēt wil purpoſed deſyred maner vſage ſeruice wiſely nedeth ruled frō wayters wt enuy cloſed frō ſpekers ful iāgelig wordes proude folke inſtrument maye ben although affecte vſage lefte doynge right ye haue ſyght reaſon yet alway vſe ye greateſt wyſedome hem ſhall god nowe falſe folke aſhamed wenen al beſtialte erthly thing ſwetter better body heuēly ſoule thys grace frute yt longe haue deſyred doth good ſauoure ſmel chriſt nowe crye mercy grace graunt thy goodnes euery maner reder full vnderſtādynge thys leude pamflet haue loue ended ¶thus endeth teſtament loue foloweth lamentatyon mary magdaleyne plonged wawe mortall dyſtreſſe ala wo ſhall compleyne ſhall deuoyde thys great heuyneſſe fro wofull mary wofull magdaleyne royall wherwyth hoped corp anoynted thus gone mynde dyſpoynted whyle therfore aduertyſe beholde pytous chaunce preſence ful lytel maruayle though herte colde conſydrynge lo lordes abſence ala ſo full negligence shulde founde bycauſe come ſo late men may faye infortunate cauſe ſorowe mē maye vnderſtande quia tulerunt dominum meum another ne maye fonde wotnere vbi poſuerunt eum thus muſte bewayle dolorem meum wyth herty wepyng better deſerue tyl deth approche herte kerue herte oppreſt wyth ſodeyne auenture feruent anguyſhe wrapped ſo longe thys lyfe may endure payne ſuche mortall wo neuertheleſſe partye ſhall go hope fynde myne owne turtyll true lyues ioye ſouerayne lorde ieſu syth ioye call hys preſence thus remoued nowe ful mone ala whyle made prouidence thys myſhap wherfore ſygh grone socour find place might gone fayne wolde ſome man herte breke note may complayne ſpeke alone ſtande ful ſory ful ſadde hoped haue ſene lorde kynge small cauſe haue mery gladde remembrynge thys bytterfull departynge thys worlde creature lyuynge ſo good gracious hys loue alſo golde precious ful ſore ſygh wythout comforte agayne cure ſaluation hys brēnyng loue herte ſo doth cōſtraine ſome good tiding whych ioy myght chaūge wepynge truſt grace hys mercy dere leeſt though therwyth kyll ſhal ſpare wayle wepe fyll yf dye ſuche auenture nomore welcome chaunce bone ſhall reſt thys ſepulture lyfe dethe hys ordinaunce ſhalbe tolde euerlaſtyng remembraūce thus departe ſhame alſo therof nothynge blame hope agaynſt hath courſe ytake nomore thus ſhall dye ſe ryght wel lorde hath forſake cōceyte cauſe knowe none though farre hence nothyng nye yet wofull herte hym doth ſeke cauſeth teeres ren cheke thynkyng ala haue loſt hys preſence whych worlde al ſuſtenaūce crye cal wyth herty dyligence wyght gyueth attendaunce certifye myne enquyraunce wherfore wyll al thys worlde bewraye howe lorde ſlayne borne awaye though mourne great wonder syth al ioye ſpeciall nowe thynke ſo farre ſonder hym ſe feare neuer ſhall helpeth hym call ne hym enquyre coſte ala howe thus gone loſte iewes thynke full myſery sette malyce theyr beſy cure wyth force myght gylefull trechery hath entermyned lordes ſepulture borne awaye precious fygure leuynge nothynge yf haue done ſo marred ala ſhall wyth theyr vengeaunce inſaciable nowe haue hym entreated ſo reporte lamentable bete hys body toppe neuer man borne felte ſuche wo wounded hym ala wyth al greuaūce blode downe reyled moſt habūdaūce blody rowes ſtremed downe ouer hym aſſayled ſo malycyouſly wyth theyr ſcourges ſtrokes beeſtyall ſpared ſmote inceſſauntly ſatiſfye theyr malyce full beſy ſpit face ſmote groned ful ſore ſwette many tere crowned wt thornes ſharpe kene vaynes rent blode ran downe apace wyth bloode ouercome hys eyen bolne ſtrokes bleſſed face hym entreated men without grace kneled hym made many ſcorne lyke helhoundes haue hym al corne vpon myghty croſſe length brede theſe turmētours ſhewed theyr curſydneſſe nayled hym wythout pyte brede hys precious bloode braſt largeneſſe ſtrayned alonge mē mercyleſſe ioyntes myne apparence ryued aſonder theyr great vyolence thys beholdyng wt myne eyen twayne stode beſyde wyth rufull attendaūce euer thought beyng paine loked wyth deedly councenaunce ſayd hys ſpeciall remembraūce farewell magdalen departe muſt nedes hen herte tāquā cera liqueſcens whych rufull ſyght gan beholde wytte almoſt dyſtraught tare heere handes wrange ſolde ye ſight herte drāke ſuch draught many fal ſwounyng caught bruſed body fallyng grounde wherof fele many greuous woūde thē theſe wretch full al frowardneſſe gaue drynke eyſell tempred gal ala poyſon full bytterneſſe loues chere cauſed appall yet therof might nat drinke ſpake theſe wordes thought beſt father heuen conſummatum eſt kneled downe paynes outrage clipping ye croſſe within myn armes twayn bloode diſtylled downe vyſage clothes eke droppes dyd diſtayne haue dyed wolde full fayne ſhulde auayle yf dyd ſo sythe suſpenſus patibulo thus lorde full dere diſgyſed bloode payne woundes many one veynes braſt hys ioyntes ryued partyng ſonder fleſhe fro bone ſawe hynge nat alone cum iniquis deputatus eſt nat lyke man lyke leprous beeſt blynde knyght men called longias wyth ſpeare aproched vnto ſouerayne launſyng ſyde full pytouſly ala precious herte claue twayne purple bloode eke fro hertes vayne rayled right faſt moſte ruful wyſe wyth chriſtal water brought paradyſe whan behelde thys wofull paſſyon wote nat howe ſodayne auenture herte peerſed compaſſyō remayned lyfe nature stroke dethe felte wythout meaſure dethes woūde caught wt wo oppreſt brought poynt hert ſhuld breſt woūde hert blood darlyng shall neuer ſlyde fro remoriall bytter paynes alſo tourmentyng wythin ſoule grauen principall ſpeare ala ſo ſharpe withall thrilled herte felyng body ſoule departyng ſone might releued vp agayne brethe coude nat well reſtore felyng ſelfe drowned ſo great payne body ſoul thought al tore vyolent falles greued right ſore wepte bledde ſelfe fared one lyfe nothyng cared lokyng vp rufull roode sawe firſt vyſage pale fygure ſo pytous ſyght ſpotted wyth bloode sawe neuer yet lyueng creature exceded boundes meaſure mānes mynd al wyttes fyue nothynge able payne diſeryue gan myne armes vnbrace vp lyftyng handes full mournyngly ſyghed ſore ſobbed place heuen erth might haue herde crye wepyng ſayd ala inceſſauntly ah ſwete herte goſtly paramour ala may nat thy body ſocour bleſſed lorde howe feirſe howe cruell theſe curſed wightes nowe hath ſlayne kernyng ala thy body euerydell woūde within woūd ful bytter thy payne nowe wolde might attayne nayle body faſt vnto thy tree payne thou might go free nat reporte ne make reherſayle demenyng wyth cyrcumſtaunce wel wote ſpeare euery nayle thirled ſoule inwarde reſemblaunce whiche neuer ſhall remembraunce duryng lyfe woll cauſe wayle ofte remembre batayle ah ye iewes worſe dogges rabyate moued thus cruelly aray neuer diſpleaſed cauſed debate loue true hertes coueyted aye preched teched ſhewed ye right way wherfore ye lyke tyrantes wode wayward haue thus ſlayne rewarde ye ought haue remēbred one thing ſpecial fauour grace magnifycence prince borne lorde ouer howe ye toke ſmall reuerence full meke ſuffryng offence neuertheles ye deuoured wt one aſſent hungry wolues dothe lambe innocēt pyte people mercyleſſe armyng ſelf falſheed treaſon lord ye haue ſhewed woodneſſe lyke men beeſtes without reaſon malyce ſuffred ſeaſon payne wol come thynke nat ſlacke man without mercy mercy ſhall lacke ye traytours mayntayners madneſſe vnto folly aſcribe payne ye haue depriued ioye gladneſſe dealyng lorde ſouerayne nothyng ſhulde nede thus complayne lyued peace tranquillyte ye haue ſlayne iniquite farwel nobleneſſe yt ſōtyme dyd rayne farewel worſhyp glorie fame lyue hate diſdayne maruayle ye nat treſpas blame vnto ſhame turned good name vpon nowe woll wonder euery nacion people moſt vyle reputacion theſe wycked wretch theſe hoūdes hel haue tolde playne ſentence nat content dere loue thus quell yet muſte embeſyle preſence perceyue couert vyolence haue conueyed diſpleſure lafte naked ſepulture wherfore truthe rightfull iugement malyce agayne may acquyted verdyte auyſement falſe murder ſhall endyted thefte alſo whiche ſhall nat reſpyted haſte ſhal hanged drawe woll ſelfe plede cauſe lawe ala yf true attendaunce ſtyll abydden lordes corſe kept ſtyll wyth trewe perceueraunce nat befall thys wofull deuorſe payne welcome force ſhall ſonge ſo euer go departyng grounde wo ſe right wel nowe paynes ſmerte wounde ſo greuous dolour wounde carefull herte sythe haue loſte thus paramour ſwetneſſe tourned ſour myrthe herte nothyng may conuey beareth therof bothe locke key ioye excellent blyſſed paradyſe maye ala wyſe recomforte songe angell nothyng may ſuffyſe myne herte nowe make diſporte refuſe might reſorte vnto loue well goodlyheed whoſe longyng trowe ſhalbe deed paynfull labour tourment corporall make therof none exceptioun paynes hell woll paſſe ouer loue fynde myne affectioun great dilectatioun thouſande tymes martred wolde blyſſed body one yf might ſe worlde ſo large compace ſhall nat ſpare renne lyfe duryng fete alſo ſhall nat reſt one place tyll loue may ſome tidyng whoſe abſence hādes wryng thinke ceaſe ſhal neuer mynd gentyll ieſu ſhall fynde ieruſalem wol ſertche place fro place syon vale ioſophath alſo yf fynde hym nat ſpace mount olyuet bethany woll go theſe wayes woll wander many mo nazareth bethleem mountana iude traueyle ſhall payne hym ſe blyſſed face yf might ſe fynde sertche wolde euery coſte countrey fardeſt parte egipt hote inde shulde lytell iourney howe thus gone taken away yf knewe full trouthe certente yet care releaſed might wylderneſſe thynke beſt go sith tidynges may lyfe lede fro may dwell man appere towne ne vyllage woll come nere alone woodes rockes caues depe may myne wil wayle wepe myne eyen twayne withouten varyaunce shall neuer ceaſe promyſe faithfully wepe wyth great abundaunce bytter teares rennyng inceſſauntly whiche teares medled ful pitouſly wyth blode euer ſhall renne alſo expreſſyng myne herte greuous wo worldly fode ſuſtenaunce deſyre none suche lyueng fynde ſuch woll take rote growen craggy ſtone shall ſuffyſe wyth water lake thus may ſay lordes ſake fuerunt mihi lachrime mee deſerto pane die ac nocte body clothe maketh force mournyng mantell ſhalbe ſuffycient greuous woundes hys pytous corſe shalbe full royall garnement departed thus beſt content croſſe nayles ſcourges withal shalbe thought payne ſpeciall thus woll lyue haue tolde yf may longe tyme endure feare dethe ouer ſo bolde purpoſe nat ſure paynes encreaſe wythout meaſure longe lyfe lay reaſon thyng mortall hath ſeaſon ſyghe full ſore ferre yfet myne herte fele nowe bledeth inwardly blody teares may wyſe let sythe payne fynde remedy thanke god yf nowe dye wyl perfourmed holde content ſoule let hym take hath lent lenger endure intollerable wofull herte enflamed ſo huge ſorowe myne comparable sythe mynde fynde refuge yet hym requyre ryghtfull iuge deuoyde fro inwarde ſorowe leſt lyue nat nexte morowe wythin myne herte impreſſed full ſore royall forme ſhappe ſemelyneſſe porte chere goodneſſe euermore hys noble perſone wyth gentylneſſe welle parfytneſſe redemer mankynde loue beſt hert ſoule mynde abſence paynes full bytter rightwell maye fele nowe inwardly wonder though hurte ſlee cauſe crye ſo rewefully myne herte oppreſſed ſo wonderfully onely hym whiche ſo bright blee ala trowe ſhall hym neuer ſe ioye traſlate full farre exile myrthe chaunged paynes colde lyfe thynke endureth whyle anguyſhe payne beholde wherfore handes thus wrynge folde graue loke call pray dethe remayneth lyfe borne away nowe muſt walke wander god wote partes ſhall dreſſe wyth quakyng herte wepyng many tere ſeke loue ſwetneſſe wolde wyſt mortall heuyneſſe myne herte reneweth wolde nat kepe pyte long ſtore wythout hym may nat long endure hys loue ſo ſore worketh wythin breſt euer wepe thys ſepulture sighyng ful ſore myne hert ſhulde breſt duryng lyfe ſhall optayne reſt mourne wepe euer go makyng complaynt mortall wo faſt crye audyence commyng hider pleaſe ſoule oppreſt abſence ala lyſt nat ſette myne hert eaſe wherfore payne ſelfe withall diſeaſe ſhall nat ſpare tyll take grace el ſhall ſterue place one yf myght wyth ſpeke ioye parfyte pleſaunce myght myne hert breke ſhulde anone deuoyde greuaunce blyſſe recreaunce nowe ala nothyng ſo ſtede ioye naught haue wo noble corſe within myne herfes rote depe graued whiche ſhall neuer ſlake nowe gone place ne wote mourne wepe ſake sythe paſte vowe make wyth hertely promyſe therto bynde neuer ceaſe tyll may hym fynde vnto hys mother thynke go haply ſome comforte may take one thyng yet feareth mo yf mention hym make wordes ſhe wold trymble quake coude blame ſhe hauīg one ſon borne away mother woll mone sorowes many hath ſhe ſuffred trewly syth ſhe fyrſt conceyued hym bare ſeuyn thynges moſt ſpecially drowneth hert ſorowe care yet lo wyſe may compare wyth one nowe yf ſhe knewe wolde paynes euerichone renewe great ſorowe mennes ſayeng temple symeon iuſtus shewyng theſe wordes propheſieng cuam anumam pertranſidit glaoius alſo whan herode tyrant • urious chylde purſued euery place lyfe went neyther mercy ne grace mourned whan ſhe knewe hym gone ful long ſhe ſought ſhe founde ayene whan went dethe hys croſſe vpon ſyght rewefull payne whā hong theron betwene theues twayn ſpeare vnto hert thruſt ryght ſwouned grounde pight whan deed blody lappe lay hys bleſſed body handes fete tore cryed ſayd nowe welaway thus arayde neuer man whan haſte made body bore vnto hys ſepulture remayne vnnethes wo ſhe coude ſuſtayne theſe ſorowes ſeuyn lyke ſwerds eueryone hys mother hert wounded fro ſyde ſyde yf ſhe knewe ſonne thus gone worlde ſhe ſhuld deth ryde care ſhe coude lenger abyde hauyng ioye conſolatioun ſtandyng ſtatioun wherfore ſe dare nat preſume fro preſence woll ſelfe refrayne yet leuer dye conſume thā mother ſhuld haue payne neuertheleſſe ſonne wold ſe ful fayne preſence ioye ſwetneſſe hys abſence ſorowe heuyneſſe ſyth may nat mete deſyre aboue thyng nedes muſt take ſoure ſwete hys noble corſe tydyng full ofte crye handes wryng myne herte ala relenteth payne whyche wol braſt bothe ſenewe vayne ala howe vnhappy wofull houre wherin thus myſpended ſeruyce myne entente eke trewe labour none effecte may come wyſe ala thynke yf dyſpiſe lyſt nat take ſymple obſeruaunce deth fynaunce haue called sed non reſpondit mihi wherfore myrth tourned mourning dere lorde quid mali feci tibi cōforte fynde non erthly thing ala haue compaſſyon cryeng fro faciem tuam abſcondis comſumere vi wythin myne hert grounded thy fygure worldes horryble tourment may nat aſwage ſo without meaſure ſo brennyng ſo feruent remembre lorde haue ben dilygent euer pleaſe onely mo myne herte ſoeuer go therfore dere darling trahe poſt te let nat ſtande thus deſolate quia non eſt qui conſoletur myne herte diſconſolate paynes alſo nothyng moderate nowe yf lyſte ſpeke lyue come haſt hert ſonder wyll ryue profer lo poore ſeruyce pleaſe myne owne entent offre deuout ſacrifyce boxe replete precious oyntment myne eyen twayne wepyng ſuffycient myne herte anguyſhe fulfylled ala ſoule eke redy loue pa naught el haue pleaſe pay myne hert gold precious ſtone ſhulde thyne without delay wyth hertely chere yu ſhuldeſt haue anone ſuffreſt thou ſtande alone thou haſt trowe wepyng diſdayne el thou knoweſt nat payne yf thou withdrawe thy noble dalyaunce ought euer diſpleaſed thou knoweſt ryghtwel ignoraūce knowlege certaynte haue offended lorde forgyue gladde make full repentaunce thyng hath ben thy greuaunce myne herte ala ſwelleth wythin breſt ſore oppreſt anguiſhe payne peces forſothe woll breſt yf ſe thy bleſſed corſe agayne lyfe ne dethe nat refrayne thou make delay thou mayſt ſure myne herte wol leape ſepulture ala lord fareſt thou thus tribulation yet haue mynde thy mercy thy pyte whiche euer truſted fynde sōtyme thou good kynde lette pleaſe prayer accept whiche teares haue bewept thou oughteſt haue routh syth thys mournyng ſythe aplyghted fyrſt trouth neuer varyed diſcordyng knoweſt thou beſt myne owne darling conſtrayneſt thou thus wayle wo forſoth nothyng auayle haue endured wythout variaunce right thou knoweſt thy louer iuſt trew hert thought aye thyne ordynaūce lyke ſaphire alwaye one hewe neuer chaunged newe withdraweſt thou preſence sith thought thyne abſence wyth herte entier ſwete lorde crye enclyne thyne eares petycioun come velociter exaudi remembre myne hertes diſpoſitioun maye nat endure conditioun therfore theſe paynes libera thou arte pone iuxta te lette beholde ieſu thy blyſſed face thy faire glorious angelyke viſage bowe thyne eares complaynt ala conuey rage ala lorde take fro dōmage deſyre mercy condiſcende non thou may greuaūce amende nowe yet good lorde beſeche pray thou rayſed brother lazarous frome dethe lyfe fourth day come ayen body ſoule precious great thyng mayſt thou ſhewe vnto v thy ſelfe power thy goodheed thou dyd hym lyenge graue deed myne hert wounded thy charite brenneth flameth inceſſauntly come dere lorde ad adiuuandum nowe nat longe payne mulpiply leſt meane tyme departe dye thy grace put bothe hope cōfidence pleaſeth thy hye magnifycence floodes dethe tribulatyon ſoule fele entred full depe ala conſolatioun euer wayle euer mourne wepe ſorow hath woūded myne hert ful depe dere loue marueyle though dye sagitte tue infixe ſunt mihi wandryng place wylderneſſe comforte haue ne yet aſſuraunce deſolate ioye replete fayntneſſe anſwere receyuyng myne enquiraūce myne herte alſo graued wyth diſpleſaunce wherfore may ſaye deus deus non eſt dolor ſicut dolor meus myne hert expreſſeth quod dilexi multum may nat endure though wolde fayne solum ſupereſt ſepulchrum knowe right well huge payne thus loue may nat lyfe ſuſtayne god muſe ayleth quod ſic repente precipitas ala ſe wyll none otherwyſe nowe muſt take leaue euermore bytter payne hath almoſt diſcōfyte loues corſe wyſe reſtore ala wo euer bore tombe muſte dye ſtarue dethe aboute herte carue teſtament wolde begyn make god father ſoule commende ieſu loue dyed ſake herte bothe gyue ſende whoſe loue lyfe maketh ende body alſo monument bequeth bothe boxe oyntment wylles lo nowe make laſt right place within ſepulture wol buryed whan deed paſt vpon graue woll haue ſcripture within reſteth gooſtly creature chriſtes trewe louer mary magdalayne whoſe hert loue brake peces twayne ye vertuous woman tender nature full pyte compaſſyoun reſorte pray vnto ſepulture ſynge di • ige great deuotioun shewe charyte condicioun syng pyte let hertes wepe remembring deed layde ſlepe whan ye begyn parte fro ended haue mournyng obſeruaūce remembre ſo euer ye go alway ſertche make due enqueraunce loue myne hertes ſuſtenaunce euery towne euery vyllage yf ye maye noble ymage yf happe grace laſte ye treweloue fynde coſt say magdaleyne deed paſt pure loue hath yelded vp goſt say thyng loued moſt might nat dethe eſchewe paynes ſo ſore dyde euer renewe token loue perpetuall whan buryed place preſent take myne hert rote cloſe within boxe oyntment dere loue make therof preſent knelyng downe wordes lamentable meſſage ſpeke fayre tretable say ſelfe commende thouſande tymes herte ſo free poore token ſay hym ſende pleaſeth goodneſſe take gree hys owne ryght hys ſee whyche aſked whan ſayd longe gyue thy herte deſyre due lorde loue ſo fayre face due turtel doue ſo freſhe hue due myrthe due al ſolace due ala ſauyour lorde ieſu due gentylleſt euer knewe due moſt excellent paramour fayrer roſe ſweter lylly flour due hope pleſure eternall lyfe welth proſperite myne herte golde peerle orientall myne adamant parfyte charite chefe refuge felycite comforte recreatioun farwell perpetuall ſaluatioun farewell myne emperour celeſtyall moſt beautyful prince al mankynde due lorde herte moſt lyberall farwell ſweteſt bothe ſoule mynde louyng ſpouſe ſhall neuer fynde due ſouerayne gentylman farewell dere herte hertely thy wordes eloquent flowing ſwetneſſe shall ala mynde reconforte wherfore lyfe muſt ende bytterneſſe worlde ſhall neuer reſorte whiche myne heuenly diſporte ſe ala woll none nowe farwell grounde dignite due fayreſt euer bore ala may ſe bleſſed face nowe welaway ſhal ſe thy bleſſed vyſage ſo replete wyth grace wherin printed parfyte ſolace due myne hertes roote al euer nowe farewel muſt diſceuer ſoule anguyſh nowe full thurſty faynt ryght ſore heuyneſſe lorde ſpouſe cur dereliquiſti syth ſuffre al thys diſtreſſe cauſeth ſeme thus mercyleſſe sith pleaſeth make ende manus tuas ſpirite cōmende ¶finis remedy loue seyng manyfolde inconuenience fallynge vnbridled proſperite tempred moral prudence nothyng welthy thā youthes frelte moued ryght equyte youthes wele ſomwhat write wherby may hym ſelfe ſafecondyte fyrſt note thyng mooſt noyous vnto youth greuous malady amonge v called loue encombrous veryng yonge people ſtraungely ofte force cauſeth hem dye age eke turmented loue byneth gyrdle aboue wherfore thys werke ryght laborous age nede hande take youth oweth obſequious nowe begyn thus worke hys ſake whych may feruence loue ſlake louer mitigatyue hym none preſeruatyue myghty lorde whych gouerneth youth meane meaſure yf pace euery mater whiche hym concerneth fyrſt behoueful woll aſke grace forth wythal thys ſame place er begyn wol knele ſaye theſe fewe wordes hym helpe pray flourynge youth whych haſt auauntage ſtrength body luſt beaute alſo precellyng haſte aboue age many ſinguler commodite howe one thyng hath beyonde thy mooſt profyte greateſt auayle ſhlud ye cōduit meane ſad coūſayle yet good lorde preſumption nyl depraue thy myght deite lyue vnder thy protection thy ſubiecte weare thy lyuerie thou arte grounde proſperite freſheſt floure al garlonde ſinguler ayde wel vnderſtonde oweth hys lorde beſte ſeruice entyre fayth honour ſupporte ryght ſo ſpeke none wyſe knowlege ſelfe one leſte ſorte thy ſeruauntes elder comforte drawe ſadde counſayle yf thou lyſt thy power may reſyſt fye age vnder wordes fewe erconyous opinyon mote cauſe wherfore yt mē playne men may deme playneth folyly cauſeles ala wherfore ye grounde cauſe al payne troubled wyt may attayne wol reherſe haue redreſſe declare grounde heuyneſſe fyrſt tyme ala wrought certayne effectes hyder brought hym lordeth eche intelligence yaue true ſeruyce thought euermo dere haue bought ſo great excellence wight yt ſheweth firſt offēce whan ſhe wroth taketh cure may longe ioye loue endure fayned mater tell lady ſours well beautie luſt fredome gentylleſſe ryche araye dere men ſell diſport men frely dwel loue play benigne hūbleſſe ſowne inſtrumentes al ſwetneſſe therto ſo well fortuned thewed yt ye worlde goodnes ſhewed wonder though beſet ſeruyce ſuch one may k • et wele wo ſith lyth myght therfore myne hert euer vnto het ne truly deth ſhal let ben trueſt ſeruaunt knyght flatter may wete euery wyght day ſeruyce ſhall dye grace ſe neuer eye ſhal playne diſtreſſe may help may hert redres shall complayne vnto lady free nay certes ſhe hath ſuche heuyneſſe feare eke wo geſſe lytle tyme wolde bane ſhe ſafe force ala euer louers mote endure loue ſo many perylous auenture though ſo louers trewe metall forged newe many caſe hem tydeth oft ſorowe somtyme ladyes wol hem rew somtyme yf ielouſye knewe myght lyghtly lay heed borow somtyme enuyous folke wt tange horow deprauen hem ala may pleſe falſe louer hath eaſe auayleth ſuche longe ſermoun auentures loue vp downe woll retourne ſpeken payne poynt deſtructioun ryght lady ſaluacioun fray playne hert ſwete lady ſouerayne diſeſe ought wel ſwoun ſwelt though none harme ne drede felt fyne made god ſyt ſo hye beneth hym loue company ſtrayneth folke loue maugre heed ioye ought eſpye ne laſteth twynklyng eye ſome haue neuer ioye tyll deed meaneth myſtihed wherto conſtrayneth folke ſo faſt thynge deſyre ſhulde laſt though made louer loue thyng maketh ſeme ſtedfaſt duryng yet putteth ſuche miſauenture reſt ny yeuyng wondre ſo iuſt kynge doth ſuche hardneſſe creature thus whether loue breke el dure algates hath loue done hath ofter wo chaunged mone ſemeth hath louers enmitie lyke fyſſher men maye daye ſe bayteth angle hoke ſome pleſaūce tyl many fyſh wode c • aſed therwith erſt hath al deſyre therwith al miſchaunce though ylyne breke hath penaunce hoke wounded ſo ſore wage hath euermore broche thebe ſuche kynde full ruby ſtones inde euery wyght ſet eye wende anon worth mynde ſore beautie wolde hert bynde tyl thought muſt dye whan ſhulde dry wo dred ay yt welnygh feare ſhuld mad whan fro poſſeſſyon double wo paſſyon ſo fayre iewel hath forgo yet broche concluſyon cauſe confuſyon wrought enfortuned ſo euery wyght yt ſhulde haue wo therfore worcher vyce coueyture ſo nyce fareth louers though lady haue ſo great beautie made get grace cauſe myne aduerſitye wrought mote put ſuche beautye face made coueyten purchace myne owne deth hym wyte dye myne vnwyt yt euer clambe ſo hye hardy knyghtes renowne syth ye deuyſyoun al nat worthy ſo great name yet ſayne theſe clerkes patrone therfore ye ought haue ſome compaſſioun diſeaſe take nat game proudeſt may made full tame wherfore pray youre gentyleſſe ye complayne myne heuyneſſe ye ladyes ben true ſtable way kynde ye ought ben able haue pytye folke ben payne haue ye cauſe cloth ſable syth empres honorable deſolate wel ought ye playne ſhulde holy teares fal rayne ala honour emprice nygh deed drede ne cheuyce complayneth eke ye louers al fere vnfayned humble chere euer redy ſocour cōplayneth euer hath dere cōplayneth beautye fredome manere cōplayneth endeth labour cōplayneth thylke enſample al honour neuer dyd gentleneſſe kytheth therfore ſome kyndneſſe ¶the complaynt venus ny ſo hygh comfort pleaſaunce whan anye heuyneſſe haue layſer remembraunce vpon manhode worthyneſſe vpon trouth ſtedfaſtneſſe hym whoſe whyle may dure ought blame creature euery wight prayſeth gentyleſſe hym bountie wyſdome gouernaūce wel man wyt geſſe grace hath wolde ſo farforth auaū ce knyghthode parfyt ryches honour honoureth hym nobleſſe therto ſo wel hath fourmed nature euer hym enſure euery wyght prayſeth gentyleſſe notwithſtandyng ſuffyſaunce gentle hert ſo great humbleſſe worde werke countenaūce ſerue beſyneſſe ſet ſykerneſſe thus ought blyſſe wel myne auenture syth hym lyſt ſeruen honoure euery wyght prayſeth gentyleſſe certes loue ryght couenable men full dere abye thy noble thynges wake bed faſten table weping laugh ſyng complayninges downe caſt viſage lokynges often chaunge vyſage countenaunce playe ſlepyng dremen daunce reuers glad felynge ielouſye hanged cable wolde al knowe eſpyinge doth wyght nothyng ſo reſonable ny harme ymaginyng thus dere abought loue yenyng oft yeueth without ordinaunce ſorowe ynough lytle pleſaunce reuers glad felynge lytle tyme yefte agreable full accombrouſe vſyng ſubtel ielouſye diſceyuable ful often tyme cauſeth diſtourbyng thus ben euer drede ſuffryng certayne languyſhen penaunce haue wel oft many harde miſchaūce reuers glad felyng certes loue ſaye ſuche wyſe ſcape lace ment ſo longe haue ben ſeruyce lete wyll neuer aſſent force though ielouſye tourment suffyſeth ſe hym whan may therfore certes myne endyng day loue hym beſt ſhal neuer repent certes loue whan wel auyſe eſtate men may repreſent haue ye made fraū chyſe cheſe beſt euer erth went loue wel hert loke thou neuer ſtēt let ielous put aſſaye payne woll ſay nay loue hym beſt ſhal neuer repent herte ought ynough ſuffyſe loue ſo hye grace ſent choſe worthyeſt wyſe mooſt agreable vnto myne entent seke ferther neyther way ne went syth ye haue ſuffiſaunce vnto paye thus wol ende cōplayninge laye loue hym beſt ſhal neuer repent ¶lenuoye prynces receyueth complaynyng gree vnto excellēt benignite dyrecte lytle ſuſtyſaunce elde ſpirit dulleth hath indytyng al ſubtiltie welnygh beraft remēbraunce eke great penaunce sith ryme englyſh hath ſuche ſcarcitie folowe worde worde curioſitie granſonſtoure hem make fraunce ¶explicit ¶hereafter foloweth letter cupyde cupyde vnto whoſe commaundement gentyl kynred goddes hye people infernall bene obeddyent al mortall folke ſeruē buſylye goddeſſe ſone cythera onely tho deitie ben ſubiectes hertely gretyng ſende generall wolde ye knowe ladyes honour reuerence gentylwomen hauen ſowe suche ſeed cōplaynt audyence men hem outrage offence eares greueth pytous theffect matere paſſyng al londes lytle yle cleped albyon moſt cōplayne ſay crop rote gyle con tho men diſſymule fayne ſtandyng dropes eyen twayne whan hertes feleth diſtreſſe blynden woman doubleneſſe wordes ſpoken ſo ſyghingly ſo pytous chere countenaunce euery wyght meneth truly demeth hert haue ſuche greuaunce ſay ſo importable penaunce lady luſt ſhewe hem grace ryght anon muſt ſteruen place ah lady myne ſaye enſure doth grace ſhall euer whyle lyfe may laſt endure humble lowe eche degree poſſyble kepe al thinges ſecre ryght ſelfe lyſt el myne hert mote braſt two ful harde knowe man hert outwarde may mā trouth deme whan worde mouth may none ſterte reſō ſemed euery wyght queme ſayde hert wolde ſeme faythful woman ful innocence thou art diſceued falſe apparence proces moueth oft woman pytie wenyng thyng theſe men ſay graunt hem grace benignitie men ſhulde ſake dey good hert ſet hem wey blyſful loue kepe yf con thus otherwhyle woman beth ywon whan man ye pan hath ſtele fully poſſeſſyoun woman kepeth nomore dele yf may fynde toun woman blynde affectioun vnto beſtowe euyl mote preue man al othes harde beleue euery falſeman hath make vnto euery wight lyght knowe whā traitour womā hath forſake faſte ſpedeth vnto felowe tyl herte lowe falſe deſerte may nat ſuſfyſe trayſon telleth al wyſe afayre auaunt honour man hym ſelfe accuſe thus diffame good confeſſe hym ſelfe traytour brynge woman ſclaundros name tell howe body hath ſhame worſhyp may thus hym conquer great diſclaundre vnto hym nay yet reprefe al vertue ſhe wrought brewed hath al myſchefe yt ſpake ſo fayre falſly inward thought ſclaundre reaſon ought vnto thanke perpetuel ſuche nede helpe ſo well although men fleyght ſubteltie ſely ſymple innocent woman betrayde wondre ſyth cytie troye ſtory tell betrayde diſceyte man ſet fyre al downe ouerthrowe finally deſtroyed men knowe betray nat men cytes great kynges wight ſhape remedy ayenſt theſe falſely purpoſed thynges crafte ſuche craftes teſpy man whoſe wytte euer redy taply thyng ſownyng falſehede woman bethe ware falſe men rede furthermore haue theſe men vſage nat lykely ben ſpede suche ben double viſage procuren purſewe nede prayeth cauſe procede largely guerdoneth trauayle lytell wote woman howe men hem aſſayle another wretche vnto felowe ſayth thou fyſſheſt faire ſhe hath fyred falſe inconſtaunt hath fayth rode folke ſo deſyred horſe fro day day ſhe hyred whan thou twynneſt fro company cometh another blered thyne eye nowe pricke faſt ryde thy iourney thou art ſhe behynd thy backe lyberall ſhe woll nothyng withſey ſmartly another take ſmacke thus fare theſe woman packe ſo hem truſteth hanged mote euer deſyre chaunge nouelte wherof procedeth enuy hun ſelfe ne wynne may ſpeketh reprefe vyllany maunes blabbyng tong wont alway thus dyuers men full ofte make aſſay diſtourbe folke ſondrye wyſe may nat eſchewe empryſe many one eke wolde good hath loue hys tyme ſpent vſed men wyſt yt lady hys aſkyng withſtode er playnly refuſed waſte vayne muſed wherfore none remedy lady ſhapeth hym lye euery woman ſaythe lyght gete none ſay nay yf ſhe well yſought ſo may leyſer haue wyth trete hys purpoſe ſhall fayle nought madneſſe ſo depe brought ſhende wyth open homlyneſſe louen woman doten geſſe ſclaūder woman thus may profyte gentylleſſe namely hem arme ſhulde defence woman hem delyte ordre gentylleſſe wolde man lyſt gentyll holde muſte eſchewe therto contrary ſclaundrous tonge hys great aduerſary foule vyce tonge lyght ſo moche clappeth gabbeth ofte tonge man ſo ſwyfte ſo wight whan reyſed vp lofte reaſon ſhewed ſo ſlowly ſofte hym neuer ouertake may lorde ſo theſe men ben truſty aſſay men fynde one woman nyce inconſtaunt recheleſſe varyable deignous proude fulfylled malyce wythout faythe loue diſceyuable slye queynt falſe vntruſt coulpable wycked feirſe full cruelte yet foloweth ſuche woman whan hyghe god aungels fourmed amonge hem none founden malicious bad yes men wote many one pryde fyll fro heuen anone shuld thy yeue al angel proude name nay ye ſuſteyneth blame twelue apoſtels one traytour remenante yet good trewe yf happe men fynde perca woman falſe ſuche good eſchewe deme yt al therfore vntrewe ſe well mennes owne falſeneſſe hem cauſeth woman truſt leſſe euery man ought haue herte tendre vnto woman deme honourable hys ſhape thycke ſlendre good badde fable euery wight wote yt wytte hath reſonable woman diſcended ſhame ſpeke amyſſe wicked tre good frute may non forthbring ſuche frute tre take hede whō thou toke thy begynning let thy mother myrrour vnto honour yf thou wolte honoured diſpyſe manere leſt therby thy wyckedneſſe apere olde prouerbe ſayd englyſhe byrde foule full diſhoneſt holde full churlyſhe vſeth defoule hys owne neſt men ſay well woman beſt naught diſpyſe hem ne depraue woll honour kepe ſaue ladyes euer complayne hem clerkes haue made bokes diffame diſpyſe woman werkes ſpeke hem great reprofe ſhame cauſeleſſe yeue hem wicked name thus diſpyſed euery ſyde diſclaundred blowen full wyde tho ſory bokes maken mencion howe woman betrayde eſpeciall adam dauid sampſon salomon many one mo may reherce hem al treyſon haue ſhall worlde malyce may cōprehende clerkes ſayne hath none ende ouyde hys boke called remedye loue great reprofe woman writeth wherin trowe dyd great folye euery wight yt ſuch caſe delyteth clerkes cuſtome whan endyteth woman proſe ryme vers say wycked know reuers ye boke ſcholers lerned chyldhede woman beware ſhulde age loue hem euer drede sythe diſceyue ſet corage ſay perel mē ſhuld caſt thauaūtage namely ſuche men haue bewrapped many man woman hath miſhapped charge ſo theſe clerkes ſayne writyng cure labour trauayle vayne bytwene lady nature ſhall ſuffred ye world may dure thus theſe clerkes cruell tyrannye ſely woman kythen mayſtrye whylom many hē cheyne tyed nowe vnweldy age vnluſt may loue atteyne ſayne loue dotage thus hem ſelfe lacken corage folke excyce wicked ſawes rebell ayenſt lawes maugre hem blame woman moſte suche force myne couden full well preche betrapped aught yt coude tech truſteth well meruayle woman knowen playnly entent wyſte howe ſoftly coude aſſayle hem falſheed herte mente thus clerkes daunger hente wyth venym diſtroyed thus theſe clerkes ofte anoyed theſe ladyes ne theſe gentyls neuertheleſſe none tho wrought wyſe ſuche vertuleſſe quytten thus theſe olde clerkes wyſe clerkes leſſe ought ſuffyſe diſpraue woman generally worſhyp ſhull none get therby theſe men louers hem pretende woman faythfull good trewe dredde hem diſceyue offende woman loue hem wolde eſchewe euery day hath man herte newe one abyde ſerpent made go diſceyue eue thus man welthe byrafte hym fende ſtelthe woman knowyng diſceyte god wote ful ferre conceyte wherfore ſay good woman eue father adam diſceyued nought may man diſceyte preue properly ſhe herte thought compaſſed fyrſt ſhe wrought ſuche impreſſyon men may call diſceyte reaſon ne wight diſceyueth purpoſe fende diſceyte caſte nothynge ſhe wronge deme ſuppoſe hys harme virgyne ſuffred dethe hym delyuer pyne god whō may nothyng hyd woman knowen ſuche malyce men recorde hem generalte lady lyfe reperatryce nolde haue borne ſhe vyce voyde full vertue well wyſte endawed borne hym lyſte heaped vertue hath ſuche excellence leane mannes faculte declare therfore ſuſpence dewe prayſyng put nedes muſt thus ſay verely ſhe next god beſt frende man longeth key mercy gyrdle hongeth mercy hath euery man ſuche nede reſyng farwell ioy man power taketh riȝt good hede mercy may wel purchace diſpleſeth honoureth woman woman ſake ye ſorowe ſhall awake boke alſo ye fynde werkes dethe lyfe ieſu ſpelleth maketh mynde woman hym forſoke wo ſtryfe wight ſo ententyfe aboute hym woman proued none apoſtels hym forſoken euerychone woman forſoke hym faythe holy churche woman lefte onely lee thus holy writte ſaythe loke ye ſhall ſo fynde hardely therfore may well preue therby woman reigneth ſtable conſtaunce men chaunge varyaunce thou precious gēme martyr margarete thy bloode dredeſt none effuſyon thou louer trewe thou mayden manſuete thou conſtante woman thy paſſyon ouercame fendes temptacion many wight conuerted thy doctryne vnto faythe holy god thou vyrgyne vnderſtādeth onely cōmende nought encheſon virgynyte truſteth came neuer thought euer werre ayenſt chaſtyte euer ſhall lo meueth louyng herte conſtante lay driue remembraunce ne may nowe holdeth ferme lye trewe iuſte commendation woman tell flatterye ne bycauſe pryde elation onely lo entention yeue hem corage perſeueraunce vertue honour auaunce vertue laſſe pride vertue ſo digne ſo noble kynde vyce woll infere abyde putteth vyces clene hys mynde flyeth fro hem leaueth hem behynde woman vertue arte hoſtreſſe great thy honour thy worthyneſſe woll thus conclude defyne commaunde myniſtres echone redy ye heſtes enclyne theſe falſe men rebel fone ye puniſhment anone voyde hem court banyſh hem euer therin come neuer fulfylled ceaſyng delaye loke none excuſacion wrytten luſty monthe maye tho none hath highe god beleued wōder though thilk world greued though tyrāt purpoſe miȝt wyn vengeaunce fortune ſyn nowe faith chriſt come place among prince erthe ſytte hem well pyte grace yet muſt tempred manere fynden cauſe matere vpon poynt afterwarde betyde lawe right ſhall nat layde ſyde may kynge warre voyage ordayne take therto holde clayme aſke hys ryghtfull heritage place wyth warre awaye liege lorde take hede ſaye yf warre may lefte take peace hande whych may wythout goddes ſande wyth peace ſtante euery creature reſt wythout peace may lyfe gladde aboue good peace beſt mēnes ſpeche deedly warre tourneth nought yf theſe olde bokes wel yſought myght yu ſe thing ye war hath conqueſt conquerour alſo vayne honoure worldes good whylom ſtrōge warres made wher bethinke myght nyghtyngale yet none herde al yere tho thyrde nyght may anone day aſpyde lenger wolde bedde abyde vnto woode faſt went forth alone boldely helde way downe broke ſyde tyl came launde whyte grene fayre one neuer bene groūd grene ypoudred wt dayfye floures greues lyke hye al grene whyte nothyng el ſene ſate downe among ye fayre floures ſaw ye byrdes trippe bowres reſted hem al nyght ſo ioyful dayes lyght began maye done houres coude ſeruice al rote many louely note ſonge loude playned ſome maner voice yfayned ſome al wyth ful throte proyned hem made hem ryght gay daunſeden lepten ſpray ne chere founde thou fauour thou knewe diſceyte colour mooſt worſhyp lye knowe eke falſe diſſimulour finally fortune defye ¶the anſwere fortune man wretched hym ſelfe wene hath hym ſelfe hath ſuffiſaunce ſayſt thou ſo kene haſt thy ſelfe gouernaunce ſay thus graūt mercy thyne abundaunce thou haſt lent yu ſhalt ſtriue woſt yu yet howe wyl auaunce eke thou haſt thy beſt frende lyue haue taught diuiſyon betwene frende effecte frende coūtenaunce nedeth nat galle hyne cureth eyen derke penaunce nowe ſeeſt thou clere yt ignoraunce yet holt thyne anker yet thou maiſt ariue bounte bereth key ſubſtaūce eke thou haſt thy beſt frende alyue howe many haue refuſed ſuſtene syth haue foſtred thy pleaſaunce wolt thou make ſtatute thy quene ſhalbe aye thyne ordynaunce thou borne arte reigne
