forgoten ſolatary wylderneſſe yet skogan thinke tullius kindeneſſe mynde thy frende may fructify farewel loke thou neuer efte loue defye ¶explicit go forthe kynge rule ſapience byſhoppe able miniſtre doctrine lorde trewe counſayle yeue audience womanheade chaſtyte euer enclyne knyght let thy dedes worſhyp determyne ryghtous iuge ſauyng thy name rych almeſſe leſt thou leſe blyſſe wt ſhame people obey kyng lawe age thou ruled good reugion trew ſeruaūt dredeful kepe ye vnder awe thou poor fye preſumption inobedience youth vtter deſtruction remembre howe god hath ſet lo parte ye ordayned ¶chaucer vnto hys empty purſe purſe none wight complayne ye lady dere ſory nowe ye lyght certes ye nowe make heuy chere lefe layde vpon bere vnto mercy thus crye heuy agayne el mote dye nowe vouchſafe thys daye nygt blyſful ſowne may ſe colour lyke ſunne bryght yelowneſſe neuer pere ye lyfe ye hertes ſtere quene comforte good company heuy agayne el mote dye nowe purſe arte lyues lyght ſauiour downe thys worlde thys towne helpe myght syth ye wol treaſourere ſhaue nygh frere pray vnto curteſye heuy agayne el mote dye ¶explicit ¶chaucer vnto kynge conquerour brute albyon whych lyne free election bene kynge thys ſende ye maye al harmes amende haue mynde vpon ſupplycation ¶explicit conſyder wel euery circūſtaunce eſtate ſo euer thou rych ſtronge myghtye puiſſaunce prudent wyſe diſcrete beſy dome folke ſoth thou maye flye euer thou doſt truſt wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys thy porte thyne apparayle thou cladde honeſtly ſeyne anone people malice wol fayle wythout aduyce reaſon ſayne thyn array made wrouȝt vaine ſuffre hem ſpeke truſt wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys thou wolde kynges equiuolent wyth great lordes euyn peregal yf thou torne al rent wol ſay iangle ouer al thou art ſlogarde yt neuer thriue ſhal yet ſuffre hem ſpeke truſt wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys befal thou take wyfe wol falſly ſay theyr entent thou art lykely euer lyue ſtryfe voyde al reſt wythout alegement wyues hem mayſtren thys iugemēt yet ſuffren theyr ſpeche truſt well thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys thou fayre excellent beaute yet wol ſay thou arte amerous thou foule vglye ſe woll affirme thou art vicious people langage ſo diſpytous suffre al theyr ſpeche truſt wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys ſo thou parfyreneſſe haue auowed lyue chaſtite wol folke thy perſon expreſſe thou art impotēt tengēdre thy degre thus whether thou chaſt delauie suffre hem ſpeke truſte wel thys wycked tonge wol alwaye ſay amys thou fatte corpulent woll ſay thou art gloton denouret el vynolent thou megre leane faſhyon cal nygarde theyr opinyon yet ſuffre ſpeke truſte wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys thou ryche ſome wol yeue laude ſaye cometh prudent gouernaunce ſome wol ſay cometh fraude ſleyght falſe cheuyſaunce ſay worſt folke haue ſo gret pleſaūce ſuffre hem ſay truſt wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys thou ſadde ſobre countenaunce men wol ſay thou thynkeſt ſome treaſon yf thou glad dalyaunce men wol deme diſſolution callyng fayre ſpeche adulation yet let hem ſpeke truſt wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys holy perfection men malyce wol cal hym ypocrite mery clene entencion mē ſay ryot doth delyte ſome mourne black ſome lauȝe clothes white ſuffre hem ſay truſt wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys ſpeketh much holden prudent debateth mē ſaye hardy yt ſayth lytle wyth great ſentemēt men yet wol wyte hym foly trouth put downe nowe goth flattery yt lyſt playnly know ye trouth thys wycked tong yt alway ſayth amys though man pacient dauid thorowe humilitie salomon wiſdome prudent knyghthode egal ioſue manly proued iudas machabe yet al truſt ryght wel thys wycked tonge wol alway ſay amys though mā hygh proweſſe worthy hector troyes champion loue troylus kyndneſſe ceſar famous hygh renoun wyth al alyſaunders domination yet al truſt ryght wel thys wycked tonge hym wol ſay amys though man hyghe lowe degre tullius ſugred eloquence seneca great moralite caton • oreſyght prouidence cōqueſt charles artures magnificēce yet al truſt ryght well thys wycked tonge wol ſay hym amys wyſely trouth penelope though poſſeſſion holyneſſe beautie kyndeneſſe medee lyfe vnfeyned mertia caton alceſt trewe affection yet dare ſay truſt ryght well thys wycked tonge wol ſay amys ſythen ſo man may eſchewe ſwerde tonge kerue byte ful harde man remewe theyr daunger aquyte wo tonges hem ſo delyte hynder ſclaunder ſet theyr ſtudye thys theyr pleaſaunce ſay amys mooſt noble prince cheryſhers vertue remembreth hygh diſcrecyon fyrſt vertue moſt pleaſyng ieſu wrytyng ſentence caton good tonge hys opinyon chaſtyſe reuerſe wyſdome thys withdraw hering frō al ye ſame amys ¶et ſic eſt finis ¶thus endeth workes geffray chaucer prynted
